review_content: Beautiful room and view. Such a special place to have a holiday lunch. Impeccable food and service.
Such a good experience. Never liked italian food but this totally changed my perspective.

Absolutely the best Italian food I've had in Italy, with service and a fantastic table to go with it.  Having just spent 10 days in 3 cities across Italy, I really appreciated everything, and the hospitality that went with it.  Great pate, lasagna and daily fish.  Super wine list as well.  Looking forward to returning next trip to SEA.
Jeannie, our server, was amazing. From start to finish she was very attentive and friendly. The food was amazing. Highly recommend going there to enjoy the food, performance and atmosphere.
Love this place so much!  We try to come here every year for my birthday, and never am I disappointed.  Every dish from the bread and oil to dessert, is exceptional.  Make reservations ahead of time.
Soooooo delightful, amazing food, incredible atmosphere
Really great dinner!  I would highly recommend  all of our food, including appetizers, dinners and desserts were very tasty. Warm and inviting atmosphere.
Food was amazing! Cioppino was amazing, arancini was delicious, the steak was 10/10! Great service and atmosphere. Would recommend!

My mother and I accidentally stumbled into the pink door about a year or so ago. We smelled it and followed our noses.  Now we are hooked.. We try to go to The Pink door whenever we see a show in Seattle. It's not easy to get in unless you have a reservation but the food is amazing. Their Bolognese is perfection. From the pasta to the sauce it is what all other Bolognese strives to be.

We also got the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce and pomegranate. It is rich but the tangy pomegranate cuts it just right. And the gnocchi is pillowy and light.

Service is friendly as always. Atmosphere has some strange elements when it comes to decor but even with some of the strangeness, it's still cozy overall.

I already have a reminder set to book our next reservation.

A true Seattle treasure. Impeccably service, the most gorgeous food presentation and a lively but classy ambiance. The food was delicious & interesting (in the best way). Everything I hoped for and more!
Delicious food, so pretty looking out the window in the back part of the restaurant. Our server was delightful. Really lovely experience. Definitely will be back.
Eric was excellent and full of energy.  We both had the steak, which was delicious.  Overall, an A+ meal and setting.

The lasagna was amazing, but the Tuscan fries were disappointing … basically regular frozen fries with some large leaves on top and whole cloves of garlic sitting on the side (not presented in a way that you would eat it with the fries). The service was horrible. The hostess was extremely rude, and the rest of the staff seemed unhappy to be there and annoyed with having to help customers. The restaurant was cute inside but overall, I would not go there again. I would order the lasagna to-go if I could avoid the staff.
Great lunch. Beautiful table with a view.
Fabulous food, service and atmosphere. Would highly recommend.

What a festive evening with friends from out of town. Magic behind the pink door. Delicious arancini to start and sticky toffee pudding.

The best part was being accommodated so graciously after a last minute schedule change!
Another absolutely wonderful night at TPD. We were given a great table and received great service. Our meals and drinks were great. Can’t wait to go back this summer.
We had a fabulous table with a great view for our anniversary. The service was great and the food was fantastic. We highly recommend Pink Door!

Our party of three had a wonderful late lunch at The Pink Door. Our waiter was absolutely outstanding and very attentive to our requests. Two of enjoyed the market fish of the day: seared scallops with lentils, cauliflower puree and frisee. One ordered the gogonzola gnocchi with toasted walnuts and pomegranate. Our view table was perfect. Bravo to one of Seattle's classic restaurants.
There is a great vibe throughout the restaurant. Everyone is happy to be at the Pink Door?
Fantastic meal. The linguini and clams was divine!
Food was a bit overrated. Famous lasagna had little flavor. Great views and ambience though!

This is my second visit to The Pink Door, and I am very happy to say it was just as lovely as the first. Beautiful food, ambience, and service. They do not rush you. We were given a great wine recommendation, and the food is delicious. Highly recommend!

What a pleasant experience! We had the pappardelle bolognese, cioppino, and the Caesar. They were all delicious. We especially loved the cioppino which had a mild tomatoey taste not fishy perfect to our taste. I rarely order cioppino at seafood restaurants but was pleasantly surprised. Definitely will be back.

The Pink Door has always been special but in recent years it has risen to perfection.  Every time I am in town, I make a point to stop in and it is always a flavor sensation.  Every dish they prepare is a treat to your taste buds.  The staff are great and the ambience is just right with the old world feel and new world spin.
Great food, Great service, highly recommend this restaurant.
Another great experience and amazing food!  Chefs kiss on the dessert as well!  Thanks for always offering great options and a true experience!

Absolutely love this place. The atmosphere is very relaxed, the food and drinks are superb, so is the view and so is service (for the most part). I almost always order from the special or seasonal menu, and this time was no exception. Winter salad, scallops, special drink and espresso. The ingredients are simple but masterfully prepared. Sometimes difficult to get a reservation, so worth planning ahead. Highly recommend.
Quintessential Seattle experience and the service was perfection.

The Pink Door is our favorite place to go for a great meal.  The food and service are spot on without being ostentatious.  My personal favorite is the Caesar Salad with Dungeness Crab!  If you're considering whether to go or not, you won't be disappointed.  Just do it ;)

We finally made it here after years of walking by the door!  The restaurant is much larger than it looks from the outside.  Beautiful decor, great service, live music, and fantastic menu.  We got lucky and were seated in the back room with a view!
A must try in Seattle!  We had a wonderful family lunch here.
Such a special place in Seattle. Professional staff, welcoming maitre d, and top quality dishes.
Great food with phenomenal service. Thank you Jeanie, you were exceptional. And to the chefs, the halibut was amazing.

Great experience! Definitely will go back. Food was very flavorful and just what we expected from previous reviews. We had the lasagna and clam linguini. Only reservation open was at 9 but we sat at the Irish place across the street and had a few drinks while we waited. Will go back!

This was our first time at the Pink Door, one night I will never forget. From the moment we arrived the ambience made the experience feel classy. The decorations and lighting throughout fit the mood. Customer service and special request were  accommodated positively and without hesitation. The menu was simple but not lacking, wasn’t an overwhelming amount to decide nor was it too small to not have options. The food was made at a high level with attention to detail and exquisite taste. It is where I proposed to my now fiancé and provided a night I can’t forget and will be somewhere we come for our special days. Go to the pink door, you will not be disappointed.

We eat at The Pink Door at least once a month, and service is normally great. Last night, we had a server with no personality and would disappear and leave us frustrated. He never asked us if we wanted drinks or dessert. We had to flag him down to order, get our check. He never gave us his name when greeting us as if he lacked basic personal skills. The food was fabulous, so it was a bummer to have such a poor server especially since we had these reservations for a month to celebrate our daughter's return from college and my birthday.

Great experience. I got a last minute reservation and I was glad that me & my friends could find one just in time for the dinner. Loved the fish of the day. My friend lived her vegan pasta too. Drinks were amazing as well. Totally worth the hype :)
will come back again:) brussel sprouts was the best best
Cozy restaurant close to Pike's Market with delicious food and excellent service.
Exquisite dining experience. Love the atmosphere and the food!

Service and atmosphere were great as usual.

Kale salad fantastic.

The meatballs quite terrible. Gummy quality. Over mixed. Not hit. A total disappointment.

The eggplant parmigiana sandwich was also worth a miss. It’s like ground up eggplant covered in cheese. The simple “teeny salad” was the saving grace, dressed simply in olive oil and vinegar.

Overall I wouldn’t rush back.
Some of the best Italian food that I've enjoyed in the greater Seattle area.  Service is excellent, and prices are reasonable.
Fantastic service, amazing table, beautiful ambiance  and great food made for an unforgettable birthday dinner, can't thank the wait and kitchen staff enough for such an awesome night.

This is one legendary restaurant that lives up to its legend.  The food is out of this world.  The service is brilliant.  The room with a view is spectacular and the room in the lounge is cozy.
This is a go-to place for special occasions.  Thank you to Jackie, Jeannie and the whole staff who greeted us and our special guest so warmly.
Our server, Jeannie was delightful. We thoroughly enjoyed our anniversary lunch. Bread and infused oil were so delicious. We’ll go back soon.
Very good food, great service, but a little bit challenging to find  -no visible name or number of restaurant so we had to inquire elsewhere.

We've never been disappointed. Had the halibut and it was excellent, as was the rest of the meal. James, out server was spot on. Came for my birthday lunch and enjoyed it so much. This is one of our favorite places.

Marta

Overall very good food, service and reasonably priced.  I gave it 4 stars because I don't give 5 stars unless it's outstanding.  The antipasto was good, but nothing special.  The bread was not particularly fresh.  I had the clam linguini which was heavy on the pancetta and too salty for me. 

 Had a butterscotch pudding dessert that was outstanding.

I would come again and try different dishes.

We had a great view of the Ferris wheel but could not see the show. We were able to stop on our way out to watch the quick 5 minute aerobatic show. The lasagna was great and so was the La Fettunta bread!

First time dining here, wish I’d gone sooner! The staff were so friendly. Definitely make a reservation! We were seated right away at a table overlooking the market and Elliot Bay. We had the arancini to start, amazing! I had the lasagna and it definitely lived up to the hype. Looking forward to going back soon.
We had an outstanding server. She was spot on for her recommendations for food and wine. Highly impressed by the food and service. Definitely a must dine in Seattle!

Absolutely lives up to its stellar reputation. Lots of menu options and specials. Food was superb, really delicious. It’s hard to impress my mother, but she just went on and on about how good it was. I thought it was reasonably priced given the quality. Great drink menu too. The service was impeccable. We’ve already made our next reservation for a special occasion.
Lasagne and cocktails were amazing. Such a gem of a place
Soooo nice!!! Awesome food and atmosphere! Awesome service
Maybe add some more to the servings of pasta. Felt like little servings for large price.
Service was attentive and thoughtful. Food was outstanding. Look forward to returning.
Second time dining at Pink door. Food was delicious with a memorable experience.

Although the ambience was fun, the the food was delicious, and the service outstanding, the $33 (very small, 2 tbsp) addition of crab to my Caesar salad was NOT worth it.   In total it was a $51 salad. 

Now my son's $64 ribeye steak with wine reduction was memorable.  

However the crab addition is an unfortunate memory.
Dined with 4, including 2 teenagers - all found food to be fantastic (The Pink Door Lasagna was my personal favorite). Wonderful night views of Elliot Bay and great ambience.

Last night in Seattle   We literally had the best seat in the house   Our server was on target in every way   Food came to us in courses   I think they have the best lasagne I have ever had   Delicious   We left extremely satisfied   We loved the atmosphere and live music

Great for the most part, but bit down on a stale hazelnut (as in oxidized) in the kale salad (which was otherwise superb) and it put a damper on my whole meal. Drinks were great, halibut was excellent. Service was outstanding.
Someof the best service I have had in a long time.

My partner and I had the best time celebrating our anniversary at The Pink Door! The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and given the quality and location it was so reasonably priced. We will definitely be back!
Excellent food and service - view of waterfront from dining room was a plus. We really enjoyed the pappardelle and endive/fennel/apple salad. This restaurant is always stellar!
Our experience at the Pink Door was absolutely spectacular by every measure. And our server, Patrick was delightful and so helpful. Now my favorite Seattle restaurant.

The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful.  The food is very good and the price is not out of line with most Seattle restaurants.  The service was a little lacking - the host was very engaging but our server was ok.  
I would definitely recommend!
It was the absolute perfect place to celebrate, we loved it all!
Great experience. We were seated in the far back with a great view over the sound.
We look forward to going to the pink door when ever we are In seattle.  was only able to get a lunch reservation, I take what I can get to have such a wonderful experience!

The experience was  good. The service was not proper based on the experience. You should be allowed to enjoy some appetizers and drinks while waiting for you dinner to be brought out accordingly. BAD FORM!!  from serve staff. I felt like I was in a Macdonald’s drive through lane being timed  on how fast you can get served and leave so they can move on, sometimes it’s not about the dollar it’s about the customer and what vibe you create for your customers and business.

Loved it!  Food and service were amazing. Super accommodating and friendly server, great recommendations, service flow was great so we could enjoy our delicious meals without being rushed through. A special occasion made even more special with wonderful food and service.

The Pink Door has outstanding food and service!  The grilled garlic bread is a definitely delicious. The salads are crisply chilled, presentation is lovely. My favorite entree is PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE. The pasta is prepared perfectly, the sauce has a wonderful flavor, and again the presentation is perfect!
Amazing experience start to finish. The food is delicious and of good value and the service impeccable. No wonder it is a staple in Seattle.

We had to wait 15 minutes for a reservation we had made two months in advance. Other places have offered us a drink while we waited or suggested we got one from the bar. We were just told to sit and wait.

Food was great! But getting out of there took awhile. Asked for boxes and waited about 10minutes for the server to come back for us to ask for the check.
Ambiance is nice and I’m sure we will go back.
This was a highlight of our trip.  The food, the service, the entire experience is just wonderful!
Always a pleasure to eat at the Pink Door. Been going there with family and friends for many years.

Delicious hot food , good portions. Quick, friendly and attentive service. Ambience is a nice Pike Place market feeling. It is romantic and European feeling. Was just a little loud for us but we are old and hard of hearing. Lovely experience.
Food and service was amazing definitely a go to must when visiting Seattle
Erik was awesome.  Food was great.  Drinks good. Entertainment was cool!

Amazing delicious food. We scraped our plates clean from the starter bread and their inhouse oil.
Great service and ambience! Always enjoy my meal at pink door!

We’ve been going to Pink Door for years when visiting Seattle and loved it every time. This visit it was a disappointment and won’t go out of our way to return as we did in the past.

We were not impressed by the food or drink menu, normally there are great seasonal options and this time it was just a basic menu with a sprinkle of seafood specials.

We got the rigatoni and meatballs, the noodles were overcooked and the dish itself was bland. We also got the eggplant parmesan which was garlic noodle pasta with 2 slices of eggplant heavily breaded with a lot of cheese. You could not really taste the eggplant and was disappointing.

We left without dessert after being disappointed and waiting for our server to return numerous times for prolonged periods.

Overall, we were sad to have this experience as we always looked forward to Pink Door when visiting. The food used to be exciting and delicious and the service was always on point.

Another excellent dining experience at The Pink Door.   Simple menu with tons of flavor.
-Arancini
-Crostini Costani
-Hailbut Special
-Cioppino
Fresh local ingredients done right with great service!
Been coming for decades and a must whenever I am in Seattle. Consistent and great service.
As always, a solid experience when we are in Seattle.  Our server (Patrick) was phenomenal and the cuisine was creative and delicious.  Never skip desert here - it’s all made in house.
Food and atmosphere was amazing! Thanks for a great evening.
Everything was wonderful. Loved the atmosphere, food & service.

The Pink Door has a reputation as a classic Seattle spot, but the hype did not match the experience. The food was nothing special and several of the dishes lacked flavor. On top of that, our server could not have been less interested in us. He had to be asked to do basic things like clear our table and order more drinks, and seemed bothered by our simple requests. A total let down and not worth the money. Apparently it has lost its luster.

I have eaten at many different establishments on both ends of the spectrum. Frankly pink door was a slight let down,my partner and I ordered 1 appetiser, 2 entrées and 2 drinks ( Did not get a dessert because nothing really caught our attention). Right off the bat the table layout in this restaurant was haphazard with tables anywhere they could stuff a table into. Service was not great either for example  our waitress waited for our table to be filled up with plates and bowls to the point we had to stack dish before clearing it.

The food was good but truthfully not worth the price (lasagna, fall special pumpkin ravioli,clam and mussels soup). And the the fall cocktails were most definitely not worth the price. All we tasted in our drinks was vodka and that’s it. 

Unfortunate let down.

Would we go back again? Probably not. Would we recommend folks to try it out for themselves? Probably.
Wonderful!! Great service.. great food. Nice booth with a view!!
Food was great, atmosphere was top notch. Live music was fantastic. It was Halloween so the costume contest made for an extra level of fun. Highly recommend
Great food, quick service, a little speedy but the pasta was worth the price. Nice atmosphere

This iconic restaurant lives up to its reputation! The food was delicious, ( don’t miss the spinach lasagna), and the service was outstanding! Not to be missed when you visit Seattle. Such a fun, unique atmosphere!

After finding the unmarked pink door, which was interesting and had to ask a local, the host staff were so welcoming. Our anniversary meal started out great. The drinks and garlic bread were amazing. Entrees were okay, the clam pasta dish was more flavorful than the steak dish. Our server, started out engaged then after we received entrees she was NOT attentive at all. Very disappointing experience for first timers.

Great experience for speak easy+ vintage theme lovers! You spot a pink door down an alley and then a world of cozy, old space, dim lights opens down the stair w amazing Italian food and drinks and wine list. The bar got stained glass and live jazz band is playing. Super cozy, romantic and tasty experience!

As always the food was outstanding. The ingredients in every dish were well thought out and paired superbly.
The ambience was wonderful--great view and good vibe without being too loud. Our server was gracious and very knowledgeable about the food. Can't wait to return!

When friends come into town, I love to wow them and meet them at The Pink Door. Sitting near the windows and looking out over the Sound makes for an impressive experience. The service is great, the ambiance is "just right" and the food is consistently good.
Great seat overlooking Puget sound. Great food and service. Interesting the place did not have a sign at the door but very popular place

Excellent lunch and experience at the Pink Door. Krista was our server and she was great! Food was excellent and beautifully presented. A great place to celebrate a special event with a loved one. Thank you!!!
Great food superb service excellent menu variety that changes seasonally so even regulars get a new experience

Everything was on point, from opening service, drink selection, bread service with infused olive oil, appetizers and entrees.  Atmosphere strikes a balance between casual and uniquely Seattle.  Perfect for a date night, dinner with friends and family.  Started with salads and seasonal soup, wife had pasta w/ marinara, a bright tomatoe and herb sauce with meatballs on the side, while I had the bolognaise, a decadently rich sauce.  Suggest getting a reservation from 6PM on so you can enjoy the entertainment.
Pink door was fabulous!   Food was thoughtful and so flavorful!  Service was great and restaurant was beautiful!   If you’re in the back room or has beautiful view of Elliott Bay!
The food excellent as always. The service excellent too, from the young man with the water, to the very attentive lady in charge of our table

I put the wrong date on our reservation! When our party of six arrived the restaurant was packed and had a long line of people waiting to be seated. The manager overheard the receptionist telling us and intervened, saying he would find a place for us. We were seated within five minutes.  The waiter was very good.  The food, as always, was the best!  We highly recommend the Pink Door.
Great restaurant. Had amazing service alongside beautiful food. We had the Caesar salads as well as the ragu and the lasagna. Would highly recommend all dishes. Will be going back!
What a beautiful atmosphere! The cuisine was equally good. Glad to have the unique experience.
Amazing everything. Service and food were impeccable.

Great view, amazing variety on the menu for a large ‘foody’ family, excellent meals all around. To top it off, clearly they have a dedicated pastry/dessert chef, phenomenal dessert (in attendance, my sister, who recommended and has a lifelong career in the baking/ingredient industry…highly recommended from her work related prior visit)…her recommendation did not disappoint!
Great food, service and experience, highly recommend.
Food was good but was expecting more.   Was an enjoyable night but honestly can’t say I’d recommend people go here.
We all had their lasagna…excellent! Great service  and fabulous food!!

Warm friendly excellent food and service
Great music and ambiance
This place exceeded our already high expectations!  This is a great place!
Food was amazing.  Would absolutely recommend it.  Had the special fish and linguini and clams.
Amazing place! Been here many times and the food and service is impeccable!

I came slightly late for my 10 pm reservation expecting them to turn me away but they immediately showed me to my table. The waitress was warm and friendly and I received my food at a great time. The ambiance here really is special and was great for my trip to Seattle!
Lounge was beautiful. Ariel show very cool. Food exceptional. Service fantastic. Thank you for the perfect evening Pink Door
By far my favorite restaurant in Seattle! Incredible ambiance, food, and service!
Great food and great service. The atmosphere was outstanding.
Fantastic! Our waitress, Elyse, was attentive and knowledgeable. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious! Highly recommend to everyone!
The Pink Door is such a wonderful dining experience. The food and service is consistently great.
Always a fabulous experience

Everything was perfect, except the restaurant and open table messed up our reservation time. The only con, was the host reacted and spoke to us as if there was potentially nothing they could do and as if the incorrect booking they had was my fault, and not a system error. Baby talking to a customer on if we can be helped or not is not cute, should speak to adults like an adult. other than that they got us seated immediately
Second time at the restaurant.  It was truly amazing.
The service was great. The food was amazing. Highly recommend this restaurant

Love coming g to this place. Ambiance is warm and charming. Food is always amazing. I was underwhelmed this time due to our service. It took a long time for our server to come to our table and overall service was lackluster. What a difference your overall experience is when your server is a bit off. Oh well, we all have those days. I still highly recommend coming here.
It was worthwhile to find the pink door. Incredible experience. The food and service was excellent. All the food was so good! Def worth dining at in Seattle! 10/10!
Service could have been better.

The Pink Door surpassed my expectations! Such a quaint gem with decadent and authentic Italian food. The staff was friendly and provided phenomenal service.  Will have to make a return trip in the future. Highly recommend!!
I’ve been to Seattle multiple times and found this gem on a whim! It’s an absolute must! But make reservations, so worth it!
We thoroughly enjoyed our evening. We had the perfect seats near a window overlooking the Bay. Food was tasty, drinks were delightful and service was perfect.
Love this place. Food always excellent. View from backroom and balcony in summer) are incredible.

I was disappointed with the red wine that they served. It was Italian. The noise level was horrible. They really should not play music because nobody hears it and it increases the noise volume in the restaurant because everybody has to speak louder. I complained to This Server about the noise level. I've been there customer since they open 1981 I was there the first week they opened. My friends and I could not carry on a conversation because of the noise level. The food was good. I had Cioppino and it was perfect.
Great evening with delicious food and excellent service. Make your reservation today!

We had a fantastic meal. From the cocktails to the Caesar salad, mains and dessert, everything was delicious (and we are picky eaters). Love the atmosphere. This was my second visit and my boyfriend’s first visit. We’ll be back. Highly recommend!
This was absolutely the best lasagna I have ever had in my life.

This is a must for any visitor to Seattle and if you’re a resident of Seattle and you haven’t been, you must go! From a non-descript entrance in the alley you enter a gorgeous unique space that has a spectacular view of the water. The food is beyond excellent… Truly delicious Italian recipes and sauces. The staff is all friendly and full of energy. It really is a perfect dining experience. ￼
Delightful meal, ambience and service. Incredible views.
It's always fun to go to the Pink Door.  Great energy, wonderful view, good food and charming service.
Love the Branzino and the signature lasagna!  Friendly service and great location.
The Pink Door never disappoints. They have wonderful seasonal cocktails, specials, and desserts. We come here every opportunity we have when we are in town.

Me and my girl friends had dinner here again last night, and it was so amazing. The food was immaculate and our server Patrick was so attentive and so nice. He has served us before and he always does a great job. Since we come here every few months, we have our order down and always get the clams to start, then get the lasagna or bolognese. These are the best dishes in our opinion, they are always so delicious.
Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. An excellent value, also
Always a treat. The Pink Door is a local favorite and a must when visiting Seattle. Try the Pistachio Pasta!

Loved it. Almost cancelled when travel issues arose, but pushed back reservations and had an amazing meal. Start to finish. Great service, fantastic cocktails(and I'm picky). Caesar salad was delicious, bolognese was special and the pumpkin cheesecake was crazy good. Had a blast. Don't miss. Enjoy
Exceptional, I always feel special at the Pink Door!
Excellent all around: Food, service, and ambiance.

It’s was our first time here. It’s a hidden gem because it’s actually HIDDEN but it’s worth the search. Reservation is highly encouraged since they can get busy really quick. They have a seasonal menu so the pics you may see on social media may not match the current menu. We ordered the special catch of the day: salmon with cherry tomatoes and broccolini, and the pappardelle with bolognese sauce. Both were delicious and savory. They were paired with the apple salad   Which complemented  and enhanced all the flavors. The o fly down side was the ciabatta bread was a little bit chewy and cold but we didn’t let that little issue ruin our evening. The decor is phenomenal and very entertaining with eclectic elements making Terence to different parts and times of Italy including the music. Service was very professional but can be perfectioned. We ended our evening with coffee and carrot-ginger torta which flavor was spectacular. It doesn’t have parking lot and it’s not ADA accesible. Overall it’s was an amazing evening with delicious meal so definitely coming back next time I visit Seattle! Well done!
calm ambience , delicious simple Italian - take your time and enjoy...the Pink Door Way...

Very classy fun place. I can't believe we didn't know about this before.
Delightful for lunch. We will be back!
The food and vibe were amazing!  Patrick made the experience even better with his great service and conversation!!
A must dining spot if in Seattle.  Food was outstanding as well as the service.

We visited The Pink Door for dinner with friends, absolutely delicious - we had the ARANCINI  and ANTIPASTO OF THE HOUSE for appetizers, both were great, followed by PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE and my husband had the ROASTED HALF CHICKEN SCARPARIELLO.  Both were delicious!!  Great atmosphere and service.  The Pink Door is a special place and we will be back to enjoy another fabulous dinner.
Everyone we interacted with was friendly and helpful!! The food was excellent and the ambiance was beautiful and comfortable! Highly recommend:)
We had a lovely lunch at The Pink Door. Make a reservation, many walk in’s were turned away!
Lovely waiter, Spencer. Amazing food and d ambience!

We went for our anniversary and they did not disappoint!!!   Put us at a window table looking out over the water.  The food we ordered was was excellent along with the ambiance.  They even put a candle in our desert for our anniversary!  We will go back and recommend to everyone!

We had dinner: orderves, soup, two entree. I had one appetizer that was considered good. The rest of the food was fair. It should be great! Other than my appetizer nothing had much flavor. I couldn't tell what the stuffing for the raviolis was. The special drink was sour and no one asked if I wanted more even after my glass was empty. Service was cursory and by the numbers.
Such a special night…thank you!! Food was amazing and the environment was so unique, friendly and just overall amazing.
Wonderful experience, ambience and service definitely a place to book 30 days in advance!
Dinner was excellent. Pasha was a terrific waitress. All around lovely experience. Our party had the ribeye, agnolotti (superb), meatballs and rigatoni, and the fettuccine.
Amazing! Worth the wait and the hype! Thank you and looking forward to dining here again.
We have had a condo near them for 25 years—along with a couple of others, it is a top go-to. Always excellent.
Fab! Every pasta had a unique and delicious sauce; had the bolognese, meatballs, and lasagna. Have the chochocolate dome cake four-ways, at the end. Perfecto!
Amazing food and service. People were very friendly

Amazing lunch experience we had. Vegetarian options are delicious as well including Risotto, Lasagna was great, Chef’s special featured dessert was also pretty delicious. Aracini was great too. Would definitely visit again.

From the moment we got there everyone was extremely helpful and nice. The atmosphere amazing, the food excellent, and the bread and olive oil so good I bought 3 bottles of their olive. If ever back in Seattle will definitely be back. Only request would be to have more vegan options.
Such a fun experience with wonderful service and incredible food. We can’t wait to go back!

We always wanted to visit but our days off are the days they are closed. We decided to get a reservation finally after seeing all the good reviews and TikTok’s. We had to wait 45 days to get the spot we wanted and patiently waited in anticipation. The anticipation was the only good thing we had about this visit. While we had a 5pm reservation we showed up at 440 and was told to wait at the bar as the dinning room was not ready yet and they would come get us. Bar tender was nice and drinks were good. As we waited we seen people behind us getting seated and finally at 520 we were seated in the middle of empty seating against a down stairway. Window seats open and other better seating was open but were stuck there and felt like an outcast. Server came and was nice but clearly didn’t know the menu was she kept looking at a note pad. Drink order placed and she left, came back with drinks 30 min later and asked if we made a decision. We ordered the salmon chefs special and pork chop. Waited another 30 min for food never checked on again and had empty glasses. Food came and was less then acceptable as we began tasting the food, pork chop was very good, greens were mushy and little baby potatoes were undercooked. Salmon was over cooked, what we thought were mashed potatoes were grainy and tasted like instant, the vegetable was unknown half burnt and soggy as well. Served came back 30’ish minutes later and asked if we were done. Took the 3/4 full plates as we said yes and she left, not asking if it was okay. First clue to ask was $80 in plates 1/4 eaten. Came back with a menu and said here are our deserts and quickly turned to the next table and started talking to them. Left and came back 15 minutes later asking if we wanted anything. We asked for check and was promptly brought to us. We paid and left not being asked anything or thanked for coming. Need less to say we will never be coming back and lots of friends have thought about going here but after our visit not sure.
Great meal! Food was absolutely delicious, atmosphere incredible, performance amazing, and prices are great!

This was the highlight of my trip to Seattle for the first time. They are very accommodating after we have to change the number of our party due to family emergency. Drinks 9 out of 10, main dish ( we had pork chop and steak) 10 out of 10. Patrick was great as our server! We will definitely come back again!

Absolutely wonderful!  Food was excellent, service was fantastic.  Drinks were great.

Spectacular view of puget sound.

Had an amazing experience for a birthday celebration. The view of the Wheel from the back room was just gorgeous. An a very elegant performance from the aerial artist was a very elegant show in the beginning of our dinner. ￼
Food and service were good. Ambiance was perfect. Will absolutely go back.
Great food. Nice interior. A bit on the noisy side though.
I was able to walk right in and get a table outside. The food was really good and my water cup never went empty. It was just the meal I needed.

Love this restaurant.  Brought a friend for a Friday lunch and we were able to sit on the patio in the most perfect fall weather.  The server was really weird though.  He completely forgot our drink order and we had to remind him when he asked us 15 minutes later if we wanted drinks.  He also seemed to forget one of our apps until we asked about it.  And we had to ask if we could place our main lunch order.  He wasn’t rude, just didn’t seem like he was present.  The food and atmosphere are so amazing that it won’t dampen my perception and I’ll definitely be back.
From top to bottom! Amazing dinner and experience
We had a lovely meal and we had to change our reservation last minute and they were so helpful.
Exceptional lunch with a beautiful view on a beautiful day in Seattle. The service was exceptional as well. One of our “Must Do” dining spots anytime we visit Seattle.

We were a party of four with reservations. We were seated promptly. The server was friendly and informed. The atmosphere was upbeat and the decor was eclectic. All four of us enjoyed our meal thoroughly.

This place is well-oiled machine. Service is efficient but that makes it a little impersonal. I sensed a vague annoyance that we weren't ready to order in a sequence that pleased our wait-person.
I had the audacity to ask if they needed to turn our table for the next round of patrons as we were feeling a little rushed.  And as I looked around probably about a third of the tables were cleared. So was this so folks without a reservation could be seated?  I booked months in advance and could only get a super early time slot, so maybe if I go again I'll just take a chance on a little later hour? Overall the food was generous and amazing , the combo of fresh crab with sweet corn seemed a little odd, but hands down was the almost the hit of the evening. tops for me was tied between the whole fish and my desert which was amazing, lemon peel with a marzipan was other-worldly. But no offer of a second cup of coffee we didn't feel encouraged to linger even as the room was clearing out. Another recommendation?  Ask for a table in the larger room with windows.  the first room is LOUD! And when the band started up I was grateful to be a room away. Will I go again?  Maybe, Le Pichet has better food, and Cafe Campagna has a quieter more relaxed ambience but the food needs  an update.
I love this restaurant and the food there.  The staff is always incredibly accommodating as well.

Absolutely enjoyed every aspect of this dining experience. The service was knowledgeable and friendly. The food was excellent. The ambience was perfect. We can’t wait for our next trip to Seattle so we can visit again.
Every trip to Seattle requires a visit to the Pink Door!  Food is always great!  Great use of delicious and local ingredients!  We always love it!
Pink Door is always a fav. Will never bore from dining here!
Great food and service. The rigatoni was good. My husband enjoyed the white fish. We will be back.

The Pink Door was recommended to us by a friend and it did not disappoint.  We enjoyed lunch on the patio on a beautiful Seattle afternoon.  The Caprese Salad was a perfect starter with juicy and colorful tomatoes and a generous amount of mozzarella.  Our entrees included the Rigatoni with meatballs and the Pink Door Lasagna - both were flavorful and portioned appropriately. Our server was friendly and attentive throughout our meal.  My favorite part was the drink specials named Hello Madame President and We're Not Going Back, with a portion of each sale donated to the Harris campaign and matched by The Pink Door.
Grossly overpriced, average food. $19 for 5 small pieces of dry, cold bruschetta.  Plastic table cloths and a view of a roof.  Save your money and get some fresh food at another restaurant.
Seated on the deck on those beautiful fall day was extra special. Service from beginning to end was first class. The food is always delicious and it could not have been better. ❤️
A Seattle gem. Always amazing. The lasagna is out of this world.
Went here on the recommendation of a friend and was not disappointed. Exceptional service, drinks and food! Reservations are a must.
The food was amazing! Great vegetarian options! Can’t wait to go back.
The best Italian with phenomenal view in Seattle. Delicious food and beautiful Pike Place/Puget Sound view.

Elegantly charming restaurant with classic and well executed menu.  They were very able to accommodate my celiac and dairy intolerance. The bar puts out some inventive cocktails!  Will definitely be back for dinner next time!
A wonderful day on the deck.  Food was fantastic as usual and we had exceptional service.  One of very best places in Seattle especially on a nice sunny day.
Great service, great food, great ambiance! The only thing I wasn’t clear on is why they lined the people who didn’t reserve and the people who did in the same line.

We had a wonderful server and the food was delicious. They were accomodating to seat us by the water so we could enjoy the beautiful sunset. The only thing that could have added was some chili flakes with the bolognese.

We had a wonderful experience at Pink Door! The service was fantastic and the food delicious! There was jazz entertainment in the front room that was at the perfect decibel. My boyfriend usually hates live music in restaurants because it’s loud and you’re unable to talk with your partner but this was not the case here. I highly recommend if you’re in Seattle to give it a try!

Our server was an absolute gem. A busy Friday night seating and he allowed two 46yr besties celebrating our birthdays to stay through 2 seatings for delicious pre dinner cocktails all the way to two candle lit desserts.  He went above and beyond. Thank you for having us. We can't wait to come back soon.

The Pink Door was an awesome experience.  From the moment we entered the non-descript pink door, we felt transported to a special experience.  The food was excellent!  The service was exceptional!  Next time we will try to go when the aerial show is occuring.

Ordered the ahi tuna appetizer. Scrumptious. The Coho salmon special. Another delicious entree and the seafood cioppino was amazing too. We were served plenty of crusty bread and olive oil to accompany the meal and the make some fabulous old fashions too.

The Pink Door was lovely! They accommodated our request for a table with a view, and boy that view was gorgeous. The food was incredibly fresh and bright, and so delicious. The lasagna is a must order and we tried a limited time salmon dish that was cooked to perfection - definitely try to get some fresh seafood while you’re there. Finally, it has such a cozy and warm aesthetic, such a great atmosphere to eat in. This place made our trip to Seattle so special!

Food and views were incredible. Live music was great, but would have been too loud to converse if seated close. Service was fine but not super engaging, checked on us a few times without clearing empty plates.
Fabulous. Service was a little slow and awkward. Lovely food.
We had a beautiful table on the window. Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive. The food was fabulous and don't forget to have dessert!

I got together with 2 good friends for lunch. We sat outside on the deck with a lovely view of the sound and Ferris wheel. We shared a number of dishes and wine. The service was great, attentive but allowing us to chat and catch up! It was a fabulous afternoon!
Food was really good, particularly the white fish. Table service was very good - although the host who seated did not seem like she enjoyed her job!

It was good as its reviews.

A stunning menu with fun decor and friendly, attentive staff.
The Pink Door is my favorite place to take friends. It's funky but clean. Service is always good and the food is exceptional.
Excellence spattered with ambiance, fun, ad comfort.
Love Pink Door! Excellent service and great food. The grilled fish is so so delicious!! All other dishes are very yummy!

In one word, amazing. The restaurant was recommended to us by friends who had recently visited Seattle. I booked over a month in advance and was able to get a weekend lunch reservation. Every bite was delicious, cocktails devine, wine pairing suggestions perfect, and service was attentive and warm. We will definitely return on our next visit to Seattle.

Fabulous food. Had the heirloom tomato bruschetta (always best and most fresh here), the ahi tuna with capers and mandarin, bouillabaisse and halibut special. We were seated at a lovely table with a beautiful view. Service was top notch. 
It’s my favorite restaurant in Seattle! Has always been and it did not disappoint this visit!
Carefully prepared and presented, both creative and solid. It may be difficult to get in sometimes, but worth the effort.
Great atmosphere, food quality seemed inferior to my previous visit.
Love pink door! I met friends I hadn’t seen in years and even with some food restrictions, we had a wonderful time!
The food was good and nicely presented. I ate the fish special. The broth was not balanced as far as my tastes were concerned, but good. The lasagna that my friend was eating was a little cold.
Wonderful experience! Service, ambiance & food were excellent. I can’t wait to go back!

Service, food worth the money spend.
Definitely recommend this spot.
Nice romantic dinner with a nice view.
Best dining experience ever.  Only issue is sound level a bit high.
Average food. Had a great waiter. Wasn’t worth the $300 for 4 people.

Hugely overrated. My tomato and olive oil European partner could not believe how much we paid for the quality of food we got. The “very good” olive oil we were served wouldn’t cut it to be on Mercadona shelves (maybe barely? but either way not restaurant quality). Bathrooms were cheaply decorated. Please go somewhere else; nice restaurants in Seattle do exist but just not this one.
pink door不是太容易找到。但是菜做的非常好吃，量也非常足，我们俩个人点了一个意式的米饭，萨拉和海鲜。吃的非常饱。

I have lived about 1.5 hours away from seattle for 30 years. I have never tried this restaurant before but have always wanted to try it and now I have. I thought it was located elsewhere in post alley But we found it very easily. This is a wonderful restaurant. It is very pretty inside as you walk through.  We went for lunch. We each had a drink, one with alcohol, one without. The Dicky and Hello Madame President (I can only hope). They were very good. My husband had the papparedelle bolognese which he enjoyed. I had a tiny taste, I have had better elsewhere but these n.w. seafood was just plain delicious. That halibut was beautiful. I wished I had more, even though the serving was not small. The sauce was great and the peppers were not spicy as I thought they would be. I would order that again any day. I really didn’t know what to have, several good looking things on the menu. Glad I had this.
Great visit with foreign guests. Will return soon.

We dined at Pink Door  for our anniversary 

Ordered the Pork Chop and Lasagna , and a few cocktails.

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great.
Thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.  Great service, cocktails and dinner!

One of my all time favorite restaurants. Once again outstanding food and service as we celebrated two
Birthdays.

We were fortunate to get a reservation.  Food and service were outstanding.   View was spectacular.   Good value for a fun place on the water. 

I was a little disappointed in the political endorsement on the specials list.  I prefer to keep politics out of my dinning establishments.   That was the only turn off.

Didn't live up to the website hype of quirky and unique. No performers of any kind. Dinner entrées were good, although we booked brunch.  No signage on entry door had us hunting for an entrance,  making the elderly parents wander around unnecessarily.

The Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants, period. The quality of the food, the ambiance, the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff and the overall experience are reliable top notch. This latest visit was no exception.

It's difficult to choose a favorite dish at The Pink Door because I've literally never had anything I didn't absolutely love. This time, we did the arancini as an appetizer and they were pure heaven. Crispy on the outside, filled with gooey cheese on the inside and topped with a Calabrian chili read sauce that was just the right kick to complement the creamy goodness. I opted for the pistachio cream trenne pasta which was an excellent balance of nuttiness and light creaminess. My partner did the lasagna, which is a Pink Door favorite for a reason. It's layers and layers of goodness. We skipped dessert this time but we saw a lot of people enjoying the grilled nectarine option, which looked amazing.

The Pink Door is simply one of Seattle's true dining gems. If you've never been there, go. If you have been, keep going. It's a great date night spot, fun for groups, and excellent when hosting out of town guests. You simply can't ever go wrong with this restaurant.

A++! 100% recommend to locals and visitors! We were greeted by one of the restaurant managers (Jeanne!) right at the door! Waited a very minimal amount of time for our reservation and had a lovely ambience of candles, the waterfront, the live jazz band. Food was to die for. Consider ordering a number of dishes and sharing with your date or family! Awesome, awesome. Will be back! - a Capitol Hill resident ;)

LOVED the Pink Door!  First time visiting Seattle and landed a day-of reservation!  The vibe was quirky cool and the food was amazing!  The sourdough bread and house-infused olive oil was soooooo good. Wish they sold the olive oil… it was drinkable delicious!  We ordered the rigatoni with mama’s meatballs and the lemon risotto with prawns. Both dishes were amazing!  Sat on the patio, our server was great, and we just loved the entire experience!  Hoping we can score another reservation for our next visit… will be craving this food until then!

The Pink Door can be a pass on your Seattle trip. The food, vibe and energy isn’t special and I would argue overpriced. While the food was fine, there isn’t anything unique about it, so I would recommend going somewhere else- especially if you’re only in Seattle a short time.
We had a great meal with the rice balls, lasagna and rigatoni with meatballs. We had tiramisu for dessert, it was ok, could've passed on that.

Fantastic location, service and food. Nothing else like it! Live music weekly and just a fun place. Menu outstanding. Get the whole fried fish. Desert not to miss. Two pastry chefs! Cannot wait to go back. Take reservations 30 days out.
Cioppino appeared to have canned veggies. Calamari overcooked and rubbery.tomato broth bland. Not worth it.
We sat outside on the patio able to enjoy the sun and food. Late lunch made for an easy reservation due to it being less busy.
An outstanding experience as usual in our 26 years enjoying The Pink Door!
Everything was fantastic!!! I was very impressed with the quality of the ciopino! And those arancinis!!!!!!! Oh lord!!!
A must visit if you have a couple nights in Seattle. Food is wonderful and cocktails are delicious. Chic stop amongst the hustle and bustle of Pike Place.
Hidden gem - amazing!  I highly recommend this experience.  Take the time to relax and enjoy it!
Wow.  This was our best lunch in Seattle.  Amazing space and ambiance.  Friendly staff and fantastic food.   Could not ask for more.  Do yourself a favor and go!
Our 2nd time here and just as fantastic as the 1st! Definitely will recommend to anyone.

We had a terrific lunch on a nice sunny fall afternoon at Pink Door.  Ordered and shared a variety of appetizers, salad, entrees, dessert, and drinks and left very pleased with quality of the service and food.  Highly recommend this restaurant if you are visiting Seattle.  Literally look for the pink door in Post Alley above the Pike's Market Starbucks.

My recent dining experience at The Pink Door was delightful! The ambience was truly unique, with a vibrant and eclectic vibe that made the evening feel special. We tried the lasagna and pappardelle bolognese, both of which were excellent. The lasagna was rich and comforting, while the pappardelle bolognese had a perfect balance of flavors.

The atmosphere, combined with the delicious food, made for a memorable night. I highly recommend The Pink Door for anyone looking for a cozy yet lively dining experience!

We came to Seattle on vacation and before arriving asked around and did some research for the best places in town to eat. The Pink Door was recommended multiple times. Service was great, polite and fun. We started with the arancini and fig/goat cheese/prosciutto both were delicious. Entrees skirt steak, fantastic flavor, catch of the day, pan seared halibut was wonderful and the veggies cooked perfectly. Meatballs and rigatoni were a miss but we read good reviews previously, meatballs seemed tough and texture off for our liking. We had 7pm reservations on a Tuesday and we were seated around 725pm. 3 of us, bottle of prosecco, 1 beer, 2 apps, 3 entrees came close to $200. I would recommend to try at least once and definitely make reservations.
This was our first time to the Pink Door and it was AWesome! It had been recommended by close friends and it met all of the accolades! Thank you very much!
The ragu is so delicious!   Also loved my Sicilian almond cake dessert.
A late lunch on a sunny afternoon. Great ambience, and delicious food. Everyone was in a great mood - like a big party!

The Pink Door NEVER disappoints. I have been going there since it opened, and before it was constantly full, every day of the week. I am glad for the success of the business, but I miss my "secret" favorite.
I’ve been going to the Pink Door for years and it never disappoints! Food, ambience, view incredible!
It was fantastic.
Delicious as always! The ambiance is also my absolute favorite and exceptional servers and support staff.

Excellent service average food.
Served warm water with no ice
Small portions for large price.
Been but won’t be back.
Very busy for a late lunch. Such an enjoyable and delicious dining experience. No wonder this is a place i return to whenever in Seattle

Great food ambience a nice way to welcome out of towners to Seattle. Portions are right, fresh and came out piping hot. Our server was excellent and very knowledgeable about the menu and had great tips of areas to visit in Seattle. Would definitely recommend! Look for the pink door as there is no signage for the address.
This place is amazing. The food, the ambiance and the service all exceeded expectations. I can’t wait to dine here again and hopefully catch some live entertainment next time.
Love this place ALWAYS! Best food, amazing staff and beautiful space!

This is not my first time at this restaurant, and it will not be my last. It is such a wonderful landmark of the Seattle scene, and it never disappoints. Great cocktails, wine, service, and Italian food. This trip was all about the meatball appetizer and the lasagna. So good. 

I wish they still offered takeout, but alas, it went away with the pandemic. The decor is fun, and the location is wonderful. I referred someone I met at the market to come here prior to flying back to Colorado. Hopefully, he did. 

Anyway, I encourage you to go, I will be back often.
Went for lunch and not political views as expressed on menu and contributions.
Super lindo lugar!  La comida Deli!!!! El ambiente super Padre!!!! Todo Increíble!

Great location
Great service
Food not so great
Entertainment was inside so could not hear
Overall ok, but not as good as the price suggested
Consistently good, which is likely why it’s harder to score a reservation. Great food and view!
Excellent service and food.  Recommended by my cousin who lives here.

Amazing food and beautiful restaurant. Glad we were able to snag a reservation. Just wish our server was more attentive and provided suggestions on appetizers, entrees, etc. she seemed very rushed and not very genuine.

Always a marvelous dining experience. The server checks in on a regular basis. Everything we desired was quickly brought to our table. The food is always delicious. The two tables next to us were commenting on how much they were enjoying their meal. I always recommend the Pink Door.  Those two tables agreed that dining at the Pink Door is exceptional and they will be recommending.
Our dining experience did not disappoint. The service was excellent, and the food was second to none. For myself, I found the linguine a dish to die for!
Perfect cute table in the corner outside on a sunny day
My favorite restaurant in Seattle. Awesome place, spectacular food and great service. It is a must.
Food was excellent service was very good. Overall great experience
We dined outside on a lovely day. No real view but enjoyable ambience. Wait staff were personable. Although busy we were able to visit easily at our table. We will be back!

The staff was lovely esp since our guests were sooo late— they were elderly and not in great shape but the staff was kind and patient and very helpful.  I’ve always liked dining at the Pink Door and will continue to do so!  Thank you.

The reviews of this place don’t lie, the food is incredible! I’d go back tonight and get more to try if I could. Drinks, appetizer and entree were all phenomenal. Service started a little slow but picked up and was overall very pleasant. I liked our waiter’s personality and felt very welcome. The view is also fantastic! It is a little tricky to find but that kind of made it more fun. I will absolutely be back.
Great dining experience! Quirky spot with great service and great food. A perfect place to celebrate a fun night out!

We have been to the Pink Door once 20 years ago. We live local so we are spoiled by being frequent visitors to the market. We came to celebrate my husband's 71st birthday. I requested a birthday dessert for him. They did not bring it. So disappointed. We were staying at the Inn at the Market and went to the Electric Light Orchestra concert after dinner. We purchased a dessert to go. As for dinner- the arancini was delicious. The Caesar salad needed a touch of horseradish and anchovy. The bread was dry, needed balsamic vinegar with the olive oil. The lemon risotto with prawns needed salt. It fell flat. Prawns were a bit undercooked. My husband had the halibut- it was overcooked and dry on a bed of lentils with some yellow grape tomatoes and sauce. Mediocre. Probably will never return. Not recognizing a 71st birthday is just not right. This restaurant could improve.
Service was excellent and everything we ordered was delicious.

The Pink Door is beloved for good reasons.
Service is professional, food is exceptional, setting is lovingly eclectic. A fabulous place with a welcoming, joyful vibe. Manager Kiara was generous and gracious as our party celebrated a special occasion. There is no better place to savor a lunch or dinner with friends.
Food was great. The patio is awesome! Tyler was a wonderful server. Highly recommend the meatball sub!
Overall experience and seating were excellent.  Little disappointed in the service. We’ve had much better in the past.

Ambience and service were exceptional! Food also very good!!!

My second Time and I will be back!
Fantastic as always. I come to Seattle once a year and The Pink Door is always on the list of musts. Never disappoints.
Awesome food and atmosphere! Service was amazing. Would deff come back
Great meal, waiter was fantastic. Bruschetta as a start with amazing tomatoes kicked it off. Cioppino and Halibut for mains and a grilled nectarine and ice cream to finish..kudos

I flew my family in to celebrate our dear mothers 60th birthday.  The jazz duo we saw upon entering was a wonderful first impression. The ambiance was eclectic, inviting and the view of the ferris wheel was spectacular. Our server, Eric, was very attentive and knowledgeable. The wine, shared plates and dinner was outstanding with fresh ingredients from the olive oil served with the bruschetta down to the signature tiramisu. looking forward to our next dining experience at the Pink Door
We thought the food we ordered tasted generic for the price the restaurant asks. Atmosphere was the highlight. If we travel back to the area we would look elsewhere for a nice night out.

Great choice.  Made reservations 30 days out and was very satisfied with our experience.  Service was professional and our waiter was informative and helpful with the menu.  Made our dinner enjoyable.  Food was really good.  Shishito peppers for appetizers was a hit at our table.  Everyone enjoyed their main dish and wine list has some really good items on it.  Recommend going for dinner.  Live music started at 7pm and added to the good vibes of the place.
Food and service were incredible.  Great atmosphere and experience!

This was Our Family Bucket List Restaurant and it  lived up to the 5 Star reviews. The Greeting was Gracious, the Atmosphere Serene looking over the Bay, the Food was Delicious from our Appetizers to Dessert. Our Server Olga was Wonderful, friendly and gave our Family caring , kind Hospitality. If You want Exceptional Italian  Cuisine with a twist this is the Place.

Great recommend from a friend. We managed to snag a late lunch reservation, and it was so great.  Fresh pasta, great bread and great service.  We also appreciated that they had good NA Beer if that is important to you!
Would definitely go back if we come back to the Seattle area!
I can see why this is one of Seattle’s best. Superb food  and  service.  Highly recommend if you are visiting the city.

The server was fantastic! The food was delicious! The halibut was the BEST we have ever had! Would go back every night of our stay in Seattle if it was possible! So glad we chose to dine at Pink Door!

What a Seattle gem. Great food, the energy of the Pike Market, perfect service.

We love dinner at the Pink Door, but the lunch setting is even more special!!
Food was delicious! Need reservations. Lovely ambiance. Great service!!!!
Great dinner, great server, great atmosphere and great view!! Would def recommend to anyone visiting Seattle.
As usual, we had another superior dining experience today. The food, the cocktails, the service, everything was on point!
Can’t say enough about this place.  The atmosphere. The food. The service.  All fantastic
A truly beautiful space , and fantastic food. You can't ask for more. Thanks

It took us a 45 minutes to get our food. 
The salad was terrible. The pasta was good.

We love eating at the Pink Door.  We've celebrated two anniversaries here.  The food is fresh, creative, and tasty.  The menu is expansive enough without being overwhelming.  We had the Alaska cod and Rigatoni with Meatballs.  Very flavorful and filling, without being heavy. So fresh!  The dessert of berry cobbler with gelato was buttery crisp and full of fruit.  My husband had the Lillet wine and I had the watermelon and rosewater lemonade.  Our waiter was just the right amount of helpful.  We live in the Napa Valley and when we travel to Seattle we make sure the Pink Door is on our agenda.  The only negative is that sometimes they are totally booked - they are that good!

We had a great time! Had out of town guest (Arizona) and they all liked their meals. Our server was great. She was familiar with the menu and answered all guests questions. The one issue was the weather(not your fault 😊) couldn’t be on patio. But our table had great view! Its one of our favorite places in downtown Seattle. Never been disappointed.
Excellent food & staff. Staff walked us through the menu and specials.
Lovely place in Post Alley to enjoy some good Italian food!
Even when busy, the staff was on task, wonderfully friendly, helpful and attentive.  The menu is great, the food well done and I only wish we'd had room for dessert.  Next time.
Loved the atmosphere & views from the patio.  Would absolutely return.  Definitely recommend to locals & vacationers.
Fantastic meal and great service. The view was beautiful.
Amazing food and service!  A must when visiting Seattle!

We sat on the deck and enjoyed the view and wall painting s.  We were delighted to find your “Hello Madam President cocktail would donate two collared to the Harris campaign, for every purchase .  
Every dish we ordered was delivered timely and tasted freshly made with the best ingredients.
We will go again the next time we visit Seattle.
One of the best tiramisus i’ve ever had. Drinks, apps, lasagna were all excellent

Ate there on a Saturday afternoon.  The food was fair, nothing to drool over. We got the fries as an appetizer and they were good, warm, crispy and aromatic since they were friend with herbs. The eggplant Parmesan sandwich was solid. Meatball sub was very large and two adults shared it and were full afterwards. The service was terrible!!! Took forever to get our food, had to ask multiple times for refills on our drinks. We sat outside which made more a little more pleasant experience.  I think it’s overrated and the restaurant needs a rest to not be such a tourist attraction.

An absolutely amazing meal and experience!  The cocktails were phenomenal and the bruschetta was perfect. Main courses of lasagna and pappardelle were absolutely delicious.  Service was excellent, too.

Amazing dinner! We had the antipasti platter, Caesar salad, bolognese, and torching pasta with tomatoes, mint, and basil. We ended the meal with the cherries and the berry cobbler. The food was delicious! I highly recommend eating here—and, you’ll need reservations. One of the best meals I’ve had in a long time.
Great meal and great experience - thanks again for hosting our dinner.

What a wonderful experience, so glad we managed to get a reservation. Interesting menus for both food and cocktails and no disappointment when they arrived. Our server Cecile was delightful and helped make this a truly wonderful evening.
Every course was delicious and the service was amazing
We had a great lunch, start to finish. We even ordered meatballs to take home and continued the party thru dinner.

Made reservations for our wedding anniversary. The food and service was amazing, we were seated right by the windows overlooking the market and the water, truly a great dinner. Will come again, will recommend to others, just a truly great experience.

Everything was absolutely amazing!!!  No waiting (we had a resy, but still), amazing service from hostess, to busser to waiter!  Great table. Acrobatics were mesmerizing and the food!  Omg. Absolutely delicious. Can’t wait to come back

We love the Pink Door, for it's fun ambiance and vibe, excellent service and great food.  It is always such as treat to go there.  This time we were on the patio, where the tables are very close together.  At one point, my chair leg was inadvertently kicked hard by a server, which was very unpleasant, so I'd recommend revising the table spacing.  But otherwise, it's a great place!
Great food, great show, great service! Will definitely be back!
Lovely lunch at the bar. Caprese salad and an Italian rose. Beautiful day at The Pink Door!
Was running late due to a delayed flight and the staff pushed my reservation back. Food was excellent, as was the service. Thanks again for a great meal .

We recently had lunch at The Pink Door and were thoroughly impressed. The food was excellent, with each dish offering a unique and flavorful experience.

However, what truly stood out was the exceptional service from Amber. She was attentive and went above and beyond to cater to our group’s various concerns and food allergies. Amber made thoughtful accommodations and even suggested creative solutions that ensured everyone had a great meal.

Her professionalism and dedication made a noticeable difference in our dining experience. If you’re looking for a place that combines great food with top-tier service, The Pink Door is a fantastic choice.

Whenever I am in Seattle, I try to arrange a meal at The Pink Door.  The drinks, food, ambiance, and service is always top flight in a casual and convivial setting. The special entree of the day is always outstanding.  I enjoyed the fresh Alaskan Halibut with Carrot Ginger puree - really wonderful.

Excellent food. Tender, fresh salads dressed expertly with herbs and best quality olive oil. Also, these people know their tomatoes. Superb. Pasta is handmade, delicious, although could do with a larger portion. Halibut special was solid. A bit overcooked for my taste but my dining partner thought it ideal. The carrot puree and basil puree that came with the dish were lick-worthy. Berry crisp was excellent, good balance of sweet and tart and crisp. Not too much ice cream on top, and the ice cream was good quality. Wine list had good selection with varied price points. Would go again for special meal, but it was expensive. For two people, two apps, two entrees, a bottle of wine ($65) and dessert, the meal came to $260.

Went for our anniversary and they were so lovely about it. Had cioppino and the torchio pasta. Both delicious, the calamari was just barely on the other side of overcooked, not enough to mar the dish. Torchio pasta was wonderful. Both drinks had visual appeal as well as good balance of flavors. Very well worth it.

Food is on point!
Tuna crudo
Rockfish
Branzino
Berries/cream
Cappuccino
Value is the best in city.
What a wonderful place. Great history. Incredible good and outstanding service! Will be back - will be back
Great service, amazing food!  Highly recommend visiting when in town!
Excellent service, amazing food, great ambiance.  Can’t wait to go back!
Great food from the apps to the entrees thru dessert, everything was excellent, a must go to in Seattle but get a reservation early
Had a great time there for my wife’s birthday!  We really enjoyed it!

Was amazed to see the length of the lineup but it moved quickly. Giant space and loved the patio area service was attentive. The bruschetta was great 4 servings of a slice of tomato on crusty bread with a delicious olive oil. The paradise was outstanding. The Congolese could have used a little more seasoning. The non-alcoholic Dicky was bitter and wouldn’t recommend. The berry crumble was a fantastic finish to lunch. Highly recommend even without a reservation as people in the walk up didn’t have to wait long.
Fabulous! absolutely lived up to the hype! like we stepped into Italy for the afternoon our lunch was gorgeous! From start to finish, truly delicious and the service was very welcoming! Loved it!!
Was seated outside, no atmosphere there!  Much better dining inside

Excellent experience! Food was phenomenal and service was top notch. We shared a Caesar salad and then my husband had the lasagna and I had the Pistachio pasta!  To end the meal, we shared a tiramisu. We throughly enjoyed everything, however, the portions are on the smaller side (which we enjoyed because we are traveling so we didn’t want leftovers) One of our favorite meals we had in Seattle!
Great restaurant. We go here annually for my wife's birthday. Been doing it for 20+ years now and never have been disappointed.

Food was fantastic.  Service was a little iffy.  Appetizer plates and empty drinks not cleared until after the main course was finished.  Wrong roll came out for main course, so I had to wait for a new one to be made.  The food runner was more attentive than the waitress.  Food was fantastic though!  I would come back again for the food.
Always enjoy the excellent food, service, and wine on the best deck in Seattle
It’s always such a lovely experience every time. I love this restaurant.
Food was spectacular as was ambiance. Great service from our server as well. Inside was so quaint and pretty. Totally not what you expect walking up outside.
This was an excellent recommendation the setting was great, food fantastic, service lovely and would thoroughly recommend.
The Pink Door continues to be one of my favorites in Seattle.  Great food, friendly, knowledgeable service, amazing setting, and nice ambiance.  What more can you ask?
Incredible anniversary dinner! Would highly recommend if you can get in!
We live very nearby and consider this our favorite downtown restaurant.   Consistently good food and excellent service.  Two thumbs up!
Our server was wonderful!   The lasagna was terrific!!!!
Excellent services and good food, i really recommend to visit this restaurant and if i have chance i will come back again.

We had a wonderful lunch. I asked Elyse (sp?) To chose my lunch and wine and both were fabulous. 
Next time I'm in Seattle, I'll definitely be back.
Well done to your entire staff!! 🩷❤️💜
Never a disappointment, one of the best meals you can have in Seattle. Service, food, and ambiance is always on point.
Beautiful restaurant and amazing food/service. I dined solo inside so I could have a window view.
Food was great. The service was meh, not worth the 20% of gratuities that was included on the bill.
Mediocre and not worth the hype. Food was good but nothing spectacular.
Greta ambiance and service and the pasta was amazing! Don’t sleep on the branzino!
The food was great as well as the service. I really enjoyed the ambiance and decor. I would highly recommend and I will definitely come back once I am in Seattle again!

Went here based on a lot of recommendations and it did not disappoint! There was an aerial dancer during dinner which was amazing, great views over looking the sound. The pistachio pasta was absolutely delicious and not something you see on many menus!
Our server was excellent, and the food and wine were perfect too.

Great experience!   Staff and food amazing!
Will definitely go back!

Loved it!  What a phenomenal meal with impeccable
service.

Over the past decade, Pink Door has gone down year after year.  From food quality to the ambience! This evening with a 5p reservation (opening hour for dinner) sitting at the bar. Service was absolutely horrible. Food was mediocre at best, their special was something out of a can with random cuts (chunks) of onion. Music was that of an 90s night club and loud.  This has truly become a tourist experience, one to simply say you’ve been. Pink Door is a complete miss!
We sat on the patio and the food, service, ambiance was incredible!!
Food and service were amazing.  Drinks were delicious.  Cute place.
Amazing. Ive been here so many times. Its the best Italian in Seattle.

We heard a lot of great reviews about the Pink door so we were looking forward to the lunch. However, we left disappointed. While the food was delicious especially salmon and tranne, the service was lacking. When we showed our waitress the rock in the clam linguini, she did NOT apologize or do anything about it. It seemed this was not a surprise to her. Also, we were there to celebrate birthdays which was noted in the reservation but except the host wished us happy birthday the waitress did not acknowledge that at all. Overall, pink door is overrated, not worth revisiting.

I have been to the Pink Door several times and have ALWAYS enjoyed what I ordered and had a great experience.  
Yesterday, my experience was not so great.  We ordered the antipasto for an appetizer, which was good.  For lunch, my husband and I both ordered the lemon prawn risotto.  The risotto was watery and undercooked.  The prawns were a rubbery because they were also undercooked.  I only at a portion of my meal. I was so disappointed.
Some of the dishes were amazing, while other were less...
The food was outstanding, we had a beautiful table facing the market.  It was a wonderful experience!
Excellent service and the food was delicious. Outside host and our waitress were wonderful. Thank you
Incredible meal and service.  Amazing wine list and cocktail selections. Perfection.
Everything is exceptional about this restaurant and a favorite of ours to visit every time we come to Seattle.  The food is incredible, the service is outstanding, the atmosphere is a 10.

Always good food. Fun to visit when in Seattle.
Would highly recommend .

Good food but bit more on the expensive side.
Good for fine dining
Little bit less options for vegetarians

Our experience was amazing! All service was friendly and fast, and the food definitely lived up to our expectations. The view and decor created a wonderful atmosphere. Thanks for a great meal on my dad’s birthday!
What a great dining experience! Great food (we had pasta dishes, including the trenne), well-timed professional service, and a lovely room. The Caesar salad was excellent.
One of my favorite places in Seattle.  Always excellent.
Wonderful lunch outside. Fantastic service. Calm ambience.
We had a wonderful time, we’re lucky enough to get notified of an opening reservation while we were there. The food was amazing. The staff was wonderful, and the ambience was spectacular.
This is a magical place. You absolutely need a reservation but watch open table closely! We were able to snag a cancellation. Food was delicious but the atmosphere was even better. Service was solid.

The staff here were very kind and patient with us. The entire atmosphere of the restaurant was very welcoming yet beautiful, not to mention how our dinner was of the best quality, especially the pistachio trenne pasta. The options were unique and delicious. I don’t think that any restaurant can have the same distinctive and signature flavors that the Pink Door has.

I've been going to the Pink Door for more than 30 years and it never fails to impress. Well-trained, professional, and charming servers, fabulous food, and four different but equally wonderful environments - the new(ish) front room, the bar, the old main room, and the patio  —easily the best place for a summer meal in Seattle.
Seasonally fresh, farm to fork deliciousness. Creative presentation without being pretentious. Great cocktails. Can't wait to return.
The fish of day Salmon was incredible !  Very fresh !  Meatballs excellent and  bolognese pasta.
Good food with ample portions. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. We also had a fantastic bottle of wine at a reasonable price. If we get back to Seattle we’ll definitely go back.
Our server was adorable—food was delicious —just too much of it !!!
Spectacular food and wonderful service. Patio was good albeit a little noisy, inside seemed much quieter but also not as crowded. Overall wonderful expand can’t wait to go back.

Portion petite (demi poulet de la taille d’une petite poitrine et lasagne très ordinaire de la taille d’une entrée) 
Restaurant sur évalué. Expérience générale très moyenne.
a great place and and a must if you are visiting Seattle!

When looking up places to eat in Seattle, this always comes up as highly recommended and sought after, so I knew we had to book it for during our Honeymoon!
