The food and service were really great, but I was a little disappointed by the space itself. The indoor space was ok, but the terrace felt sandwiched between buildings with not much of a view, which I was really surprised about because people RAVE about the ambiance. 
Generally we liked it, but the outdoor space just felt a bit industrial for us.
Wonderful and friendly service and outstanding food.

Ordered the lasagna and my husband ordered the salmon/fish of the day
It was such a unique ambiance but in the best way!
We loved every minute

Absolutely fabulous dining experience at The Pink Door.  Great server Max!  The fig and goat cheese app and bruschetta were great starters and my guests all very much enjoyed their meals.  Ambiance on the patio was a great Puget Sound experience and loved the interior spaces.  Very happy that Kimberly at The Scout Guide Seattle  (@tsgseattle) recommended this restaurant to me.  Now I know just how lucky we were to score a reservation!  Awesome!

Food items were all good. Pasta was not overcooked and skirt steak was properly seasoned and mostly cooked to temperature ordered. Service was good but not great. However, restaurant was very crowded so it’s understandable. Good ambiance and decent value for the money. Will go again.

As always the food at the Pink Door is amazing.  My wife ordered a glass of champagne and I had a glass of Syrah, portions were generous and price was fair.  We split the Tuna Curd which was very high quality, but I could do without the micro greens, but that is the big thing these days.  We both had our favorite Pink Door Lasagna and it was amazing as always.  The only issues we had was there was a hole in the floor board and my chair leg fell through it and I almost hit the deck, and we were too close to the table next door and the waiter could not serve that table without constantly bumping into me.  He did apologize, but they need to think about the layout.  We will be going back as the food is so Good!!
Outdoor sitting is amazing. Love the squid ink seafood pasta that is not on the menu.
Wonderful food and great service! Would highly recommend.
Wonderful dinner for our party of 5. Every morsel was delicious. Superb service. Lovely and lively atmosphere.
Beautiful ambience, patio and indoors. Delicious handmade pasta. Wonderful experience!
I had a lovely meal overlooking the water.  Food was great.

Came here on the recommendation of a local residence. It did not disappoint! Sat out on the patio. Cocktails were spot on. Entrees (Rigatoni, Pappardelle, and Branzino) were amazing. The icing on the cake was our Server, Jeanie. Very engaging, great recommendations. Definitely a gem!
Food was excellent. Prices are in-line for that part of Seattle, but out-of-towners may find it pricey. Cute outdoor space
A beautiful lunch, a beautiful View and an overall outstanding experience!!

The food at this restaurant was delicious, though the portions were on the smaller side. The views from the dining area were absolutely stunning, adding to the overall experience. They have an impressive wine collection that pairs perfectly with the meals. The tiramisu, in particular, was a standout hit, leaving a lasting impression. Overall, it's a great spot for a fine dining experience with exceptional scenery and a carefully curated wine list.
Very nice and romantic place.  Food was great and entertainment very nice

Loved the beautiful romantic atmosphere ! Loved the soft jazz music in the background ! Loved the service ! Food was very good too . Only recommendation would be to kick it up a level or two on the bread ( warm it up ? Something other than no taste oil ?)
Overall an extremely good experience ! Highly recommend !
Food was amazing. Our server was very helpful and kind. She was knowledgeable about the menu and as able to give amazing advice. Loved this restaurant!
Great experience! Highly recommend. Food and ambiance was amazing

Sadly, I waited too late to book dinner reservations, so we settled for lunch. We started with the GRILLED FIGS, PROSCIUTTO, GOAT CHEESE, it was simply amazing. My partner ordered the PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE and I thought he was crazy for getting something so ordinary, but I'm glad he didn't listen. It was the best bolognese we've had in ages. I had the fish of the day, which was Salmon and it was seasoned and cooked to perfection. 

The daytime ambiance was nice and breezy, but I hope to experience a dinner at The Pink Door on my next trip to WA.  The cocktails were a bit on the pricey side but very yummy!

My new favorite restaurant to suggest when in the Pike Place area. The bolognese was the best I've ever had, the watermelon lemonade was amazing, and the Casata Siciliana for dessert will be a dessert I have to get any time I am in the area. Thank you for a perfect meal!
This is such a great place to dine at.  The ambiance, service, and food are wonderful.

My husband and I come every year for our anniversary when we are able. I always mark that this is for that event in the reservation, but it was not acknowledged on this visit. Why bother to ask on the reservation if it doesn’t mean anything?

The food was good as usual, but maybe not as good as it has been in past visits. They are top tier about refilling your water here though! 

I don’t know, it’s just our special place, and it’s sad that they don’t acknowledge the event. In years past we’ve gotten a glass of Prosecco, or even a simple “happy anniversary.” Sorry if I’m just sounding like a complainer. 

I also felt a little rushed out at the end by our waiter, but I understand that they’re busy.
Got on the waitlist for reservations and was lucky to get one. The line for walk-ins was quite long. As usual, food was amazing and loved the seasonal drinks. Service was great!

We arrived a little early for our reservation and were seated near the windows overlooking the water.  The food was delicious!  We needed water refills for a time and were not served bread with our meal but we would definitely go back!
Great service at the door and wonderful food. This is a yearly tradition for our summer celebrations!

The Pink Door is an iconic, lovely, special Seattle gem.  The service is always delightful and the food consistently delicious and fresh.  The I side offers cozy interesting seating and the patio is nestled just right to afford some shade and peek a boo views of the sound and ferries.  They had a new special pasta I had never before had with a pistachio sauce that was amazing.  A favorite gem!

From start to finish, this was an incredible experience with friends. The food was so fresh and left a lasting memory on your palate. A true staple restaurant that needs to be around for decades to come.
Out party of four really enjoyed the food. Inside they were playing very loud music, but they sat us on the patio which was very nice. Service was good, and the view from the patio was quite nice.
It was a very wonderful experience. Food is a little pricey as compared to the portions.

Food and service were top notch. Service was so nice it felt like eating at a fun friend’s house - a really nice house with great food made with fresh ingredients. The lasagna was SO good.  We had specialty iced coffees that hit the spot on a hot day. Will definitely be back.
Beautiful sunny day on the pergola’d patio with the view of. Puget Sound. A lovely lunch in a convivial atmosphere, knowledgeable and charming staff, and food that outdid our expectations.
The entire experience was excellent and our service was fantastic!
Best food in the world, but small portions for the price
One of my favorite restaurants.   Always excellent food, ambiance and service!
Always an amazing experience from the moment you walk in till the last bite. I love this restaurant.
Amazing great mussels fantastic people and I am hitting 50 chars
Great experience and amazing food . Our server was outstanding.

We usually don't go out for Italian food, as it can sometimes be just cheese and red sauce.  We knew this would be better, but I'm always cautious.
We were thoroughly impressed.  Delicate, balanced flavors.  Fresh ingredients. Fun/classy/unique environment.  The service was attentive without being in the way.
While not an inexpensive meal, I felt it was reasonable for what you get.  We will be back.
Wonderful atmosphere, excellent services and the food was superb!
If you're planning to visit Seattle, book your reservation in advance. This is a must visit restaurant in Seattle.

Our favorite place for lunch in Seattle!

Always fabulous

Delicious food. We got a coveted outside table for lunch. Our waiter was having a tough day. Not     A smile out of him. There was a huge hair in my lasagna which they replaced immediately and comped my meal. A long wait for the check.
Probably the best lasagna I’ve ever had. Great meal!
Best modern Italian cuisine in the city.  Best ambiance, too.
My favorite restaurant ever! The lasagna is a perfect appetizer to share!
Always excellent food, service and ambiance, love rooftop

A go to for locals and tourists alike. In this.warm summer day we asked to be seated outside under the gazebo/lattice. A 1 pm rez.amd.we.were.able to be seated at 12:50. We have been numerous times and the food and service never disappoints. We had the Antiipasto  of the House for 2 - generous portions of olive tapinade, Salumi, prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, etc. Fantastic. We had the Ciopinno Pink Door and the Lasagne Pink. Both fantastic. We enjoyed the craft cocktails as well! Thank you for a wonderful lunch.
Server was great and very nice to chat with. From California and always go to Pink Door when  in Seattle. Highly recommend but make reservations 30 days in advance.
The  service, menu, and dining room were exceptional.

What a fun experience. The vibe and music was awesome. We sat outside with a view of the water. Our server was super knowledgeable. We shared most of our meal so we could taste as much as possible. The toccino pasta dish was yummy!
Fantastic evening; the combination of the ambience, food, and service was beyond expectation.

Great food and service.
Carter and Alyssa met our every need.
Made for an excellent birthday celebration.
Beautiful indoor restaurant. We ate outside but loud neighbors sitting next to us.
Wonderful food and service! My fish was impeccable! Must have to visit in Seattle!

I came here on my birthday when I was visiting Seattle. One of the best meals I have had here for sure. We got the bruschetta, Cesar salad, bruschetta, lasagna, and bolognese. The lasagna has a touch of pesto which added to the dish and made it pretty unique. The bolognese was my personal favorite and I haven't stopped thinking about it since. The service was really nice and we were able to get seated right next tot the window since had a beautiful view. I will definitely be coming back.
I had a lovely lunch at Pink Door on their patio, enjoying a beautiful summer view of Seattle, with delicious food and great service.
Server was really really slow. Food was amazing as always.

My husband and I had an amazing time last night celebrating our 3 year wedding anniversary! Was so thankful I was able to snag a reservation, and they went above and beyond to seat us at a beautiful window table with a view 🥹 Food was amazing and our server Eric was so nice. Not to mention the great jazz trio we got to listen to throughout dinner! Definitely would recommend for a splurge occasion dinner!
Food 10/10, service 10/10, drinks 10/10, it’s a vibe!
The aerial show on Tuesday nights is fun, and the food was delicious as always!
So amazing I get why the place is famous!! Can’t wait to go back
I can’t believe it took me 20 years of Seattle living to finally experience this decadence!
Lasagna is awesome!!!  Very unique restaurant. Service is excellent
One of our favorite restaurants. Great ambience and amazing food!

We absolutely adore the Pink Door. We come here every year for a small family reunion over the July 4th weekend. We always find it very special and delicious.  We usually stay at the Thompson and just walk over from our hotel. Love the food and the vibe. The best!
Everything was outstanding! Food, service and ambiance is excellent!!
We had not been back here for a while (2014) and never disappoints. loved the food and the restaurant as always fantastic service.
Great food, service, and atmosphere! Our waitress, Cecile, took great care of us. Thank you!

Pink door has always been a treat since I discovered it seven years ago. Every July I've come here solo to have lunch to treat myself for my birthday. A glass of wine, a special of some sort, a main dish to my craving, and to wrap it up with a limoncello. 

The staff is wonderful, always an air of class, attentive, and making you feel at home. The food is to die for, making you want to come back for more, but enough to know, you need to wait, because it's that special. It's a treat. You don't indulge in treats. 

I moved to the other side of the country, and have been talking about Pink Door non stop for the last five years. She leaves you with a lasting impression.
Excellent food and service. Great place to celebrate our anniversary! The highlight was the pappardelle bolognese. Delicious!

We arrived just in time to see a few minutes of the aerialist’s act which was beautiful.  We were hoping to be seated outdoors but were led to a table near the window/view which was lovely.  Food was delicious, l loved my pappardelle!  Kudos to the chef and staff.
Perfect way to complete our Seattle vacation.  Food, service, and setting are all amazing.  Highly recommend!!
The Pink Door is a special experience unlike anything else in Seattle. The ambiance is great and the food and prices are superb. I love to take people that haven't been before. Everyone loves it.
We had a wonderful time. It had been a few years since we visited seattle and allot has changed but the food at pink door still the best!!!

Great food great service and atmosphere 
Had lunch on a Monday…good idea to make a reservation ahead of time
Amazing. Patrick was everything. The food was everything.

Excellent as always!
Service was spot on.
Ahi Crudo
Caesar Salad
Branzino
Prawn Risotto
Lemon Tart
Cappuccino
Delicious food and beautiful view!  Perfect place to celebrate a birthday or other fun occasion!
Superb service and food. Seated quickly and when we explained about a tight schedule the wait staff provided all items quickly.
Good and service were fantastic. A great experience overall!
My absolute favorite restaurant! Food is scrumptious and service superb!
Food was delicious, service was prompt, energetic atmosphere. We had an enjoyable experience.

It was a lovely sunny day and we were seated in our favorite server's (Elyse Eng) section right by a window. We got the benefit of the sun without the heat. The food, as always, was delicious. Service was excellent. We had a concert to attend so couldn't stay for dessert, but I'm sure there'll be a next time in the near future.

One thing, there's gotta be a better way for you to handle your reservations. Had we not had to wait in line outside we would've had time for dessert. We waited at least 10 minutes before being allowed in to check in with the front desk. As it was, we weren't seated until 11:45 vs. our 11:30 reservation time.
The lemon risotto and the papardelle ragu were really good. Impeccable service. Pink door never disappoints
It was very fun nostalgic restaurant & happy we could experience it.
Great food and service. A little pricey but otherwise great experience.
Our server was outstanding, the food amazing and the view spectacular.  This was my second time dining at The Pink Door - I will look forward to the third visit.

really great service as usual. we got the arancini and shrimp caesar salad to start (both are faves for us). we split the eggplant parm panini (first time trying) and it was okay. bread was a lil soggy and it just felt like it needed something more, maybe acidity? i got the cold brew cardamom cocktail and that was pretty good. all in all we had a good time and will be back again

Another amazing meal at the Pink Door. Our 35th anniversary lunch before heading to Bainbridge Island for a wedding weekend. Food and wine on point as usual and our server was the best. Cheers Seattle.
We dined at The Pink Door to celebrate our daughter’s 21st birthday, while visiting from Australia. Great food, service and ambiance. Highly recommend.
The dood was incredible, staff was wonderful and the vibes were amazing!
We had a great meal with good service! The ambiance is really cool and is a neat spot. Glad we found it and were able to get reservations!
Great food, service, and location.  Lasagna the best!
My favorite place to dine in Seattle.  It is all lovely and the location can’t be beat.
We had a great time at the pink door, great food and service!

The quality of food drops significantly during Summer. I’m a frequent diner at the Pink Door but I regularly experience the significant quality drop in food every Summer/busy season. Still great, but I’ll only go when there are less tourists.

We were a party of 6 having dinner with a very old friend and his family, who we hadn’t seen in 18 years. He forewarned us that he now had significant health issues. In fact he had overwhelming limitations. The restaurant did an amazing job of accommodating him up and down the stairs, and seating us at a great table. The food, the view, the service, and the ambience could not have been better. A truly memorable evening, made even better by a great restaurant.
We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch at the Pink Door. The linguine alla vongole was amazing! The lemon tart was to die for. Waitress was very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely visit again!

We had an amazing lunch!! The lasagna was incredible! A normally heavy dish was super light! They must roll the pasta super thin. It was so so good!

Very eclectic and beautiful dining room. We had a great view of the water.

We loved every minute of it!
Great food. Good service. Wonderful lunch option if you’re in the Pike Place Market area and want a respite from the crowds.
Had another great lunch at Pink Door.  The food is always excellent and the ambience and service the best.

Some of the best risotto we have ever had.  Impeccable service.  Light, airy room (though we have eaten in their darker room and like that too.). Terrific crab Caesar.  I forgot to ask them to not put too much dressing on it, and they did that anyway.  Ample, fresh crab

We enjoyed our dinner at the Pink Door- the decor was funky, and the service was friendly and efficient.  We had a great view of the Sound from our indoor table. The salad was wonderful, and we loved our entrees. We would return it in the area.
My second time in. Each time the food has been outstanding. Great service by happy employees!

Early summer offerings can’t be beat! The best of seafood, vegetables, and fruity dessert options. 
The classics hold up, too. Clam linguine is always a good go to choice 
Lovely setting, fantastic food, excellent service.
Met and exceeded expectations.  A nice wedding anniversary dinner

The Grilled Rock Fish, was outstanding,
Our party of six all devoured the Lasagna &
Pasta dishes, with the only survivors being fish bones, head & skin.
Superb meal, service, everything. Love this place. Food was absolutely delicious. Great cocktails and wine. Yummy desserts. And the acrobatics were a lot of fun. Big thumbs up 👍
Such a cute place located just off pike place market. A must if visiting Seattle. The olive oil was the best I’ve ever had that I ordered a bottle and shipped it home.

I was able to check in early and was given a table by the window with a nice view of the Seattle Great Wheel. Our server was very knowledgeable and kind. I absolutely loved their Bloody Mary. We ordered the special appetizer and NW catch of the day. Both were amazing! The shigoku oysters were the best we’ve had in Seattle so far.
Excellent service, all the way around! The Pink Door is our #1 Choice for celebrating special occasions or simply enjoying a meal. Just being there is a celebration of absolutely delicious food.
Always fun. A rack of lamb should be a rack of lamb not lamb 3 lamb chops. But they were great.

Cute place, awesome food and the server was very attentive and friendly. 
We had a reservation but came in earlier. Hostess was very nice and was able to seat us by the window. We had a very enjoyable dinner with really good food.
Food was delicious, but our server was outstanding, and truly made our dining experience fantastic and worthwhile
Always a great experience can't wait to go back to Pink door

Very good comp bread and olive oil. Food is delicious. Portion is not big, but perfect for us. Everything green salad, oysters, lasagna, clam pasta, and limoncello all great choices. Our server is very warm and welcoming.
Very good food. Burratta and arancini were amazing. Server was great. Finished my whole plate of paparadelle!

We loved it and our wonderful waiter Dana!
Fabulous venue!
Great food and service and live singing was also very nice, would recommend for family to on a nice date. :)
We ate on the patio and had wonderful food, service, and wine. Highly recommend The Pink Door even though it might make it harder to get in.
What can I say, always delightful. The oysters were marvelous!
Was excited to try but disappointed by service and food quality.
Food is delicious—especially the lasagna and the green salad. Service was great also.  Served was very personable.
If you can’t get seated inside I don’t think it’s worth it.
Pink Door is a must in a sunny day. Get the Bolognese, no matter what!

The Pink Door never disappoints!
Always delicious!
We ate on the outdoor deck and the weather was beautiful!  The hanging baskets and colorful tablecloths kept it cheery.  The ambiance indoors looked great as well.
Great food. Great view. Wonderful atmosphere. Delicious bread; would be nice to be offered the bread to start.

Ambience was everything! We missed the entertainment due to 9pm reservation. Waitress was ok, but you could tell she was probably tired and ready to go. Food was good. Views were amazing from the dining room.  I will return!
Our food was delicious, our service was great, and overall, we were pleased. It is a little pricey, but nice for an occasion.

The service and food were excellent, but we were disappointed because we believed that there would be entertainment during dinner. However, our table was in the large back dining room, pretty far away from the small stage, and we could barely hear anything. We were with friends to celebrate their wedding anniversary and specifically selected The Pink Door for the entertainment factor and came away disappointed.

We were excited to finally be able to get a reservation and our dining experience was everything we hoped for! The food was delicious with generous portions, service by Erik was excellent, and the restaurant was beautiful with a great vibe!

Great Food, Awesome Service and nice atmosphere.  We are so glad we had the opportunity to eat here.   The service was exceptional. We had the prosciutto with grilled bread. Super yummy. Oysters were fresh and lovely. Perfectly brined and yummy. We had the famous lasagna and it didn’t disappoint. Every bite was balanced with the cheese, basil pesto and sauce.  I had the beet and cheese ravioli they were the prettiest plate ever. They were super light and the lemon sauce complimented the sweetness of the beet and cheese.
Bucket list dining complete. I can’t wait to go again.
Excellent food and service!  Our server was extremely friendly and quite helpful with food and wine selection.

The Pink Door was hard to find.  It’s on a small backstreet with no signage, just a pink door that opens to a narrow staircase.  The entrance was crowded with people trying to get walk-in seating.  Fortunately we had reservations and were taken to a great table overlooking the water.  Service was excellent as was the food.  The Pink Door should be high on your list of restaurants in Seattle, but book well in advance.
Very lively restaurant which has been around for 40+ years. The service and food were top notch.

Greatest restaurant in Seattle!! Go here every time we come to Seattle and it is consistently excellent. It's not cheap, but it's definitely you get what you pay for there. The Bolongnese is the best I've ever had and they had a spring risotto that was amazing!! Desserts and appetizers are always exceptional!
Fabulous food and surroundings. Great team of staff : Gretta was a delight. Certainly will be back next time we’re in town.

Mostly very tasty Italian food.  Outstanding patio location.  Would love to come back some time on a Tuesday night and see the aerialists perform!  Surprised we were not offered grated cheese for our pastas...
It was great!  Food was amazingly delicious.  It was everything we hoped for.
Very unique Italian restaurant hidden in Post Alley at Pike Place market. Probably the best lasagna I’ve ever eaten.

We had the best time at the Pink Door!  Made reservations about a month in advance to ensure a spot at dinnertime since it is super popular.  Very cool spot that felt authentic with live jazz playing when we got there.
Great food, great service. Would definitely recommend.
Great restaurant. Food was delicious. The vibe was awesome. Would come back.
We have never had a bad meal/experience at The Pink Door. Best in Seattle. Much try!

What a great find…once you find it!!!  Entrance on a small alley - if you can’t find it don’t give up.  Reservations a must.  Food all around was excellent and the cioppino (my go to) was the best I’ve had anywhere!
We loved our special birthday lunch in the dining room. Everything was perfect, everything was delicious, and Stephanie provided exceptional service.
My favorite restaurant! The lasagna is a must have
Server was great, I forgot his name. The food was ok.

What a wonderful eating experience! We sat out on the deck on the water. The temp was perfect! Our server Stefano was awesome! His recommendations were spot on! We enjoyed our drinks From my rosehips to my lips was refreshing and delish. Apps were amazing Arancini, followed by lasagna (not the typical heavy dish with meat), mussels and clams.  Lemon tart for dessert because it sounded so good. There’s always a wait list but put yourself on it. We did and we’re not disappointed. The Pink Door was a culinary delight. Wonderful staff, service and food.
Our server was first class professional and class. She made the dining experience a joy!

Fun day out. We had late lunch. Would love to do dinner but hard to get a table at a decent hour. We had prosciutto and burratta appetizer. Bread was great. Spring salad was good too. We had lasagna, pappadarelle, and meatball entrees. We liked it all. Half chicken was so so. We ate on patio as sun was out. Good service.

Non-alcohol choices were limited.  Bread that was given before the meal was room temperature. It would've been nice if it was warm. The linguine alle vongole 
had a lot of clams, which was great. The pappardelle al ragu bolognese seemed to lacked meat and it's supposed to be a meat sauce on the pasta. It was all noodles. We ordered the antipasto. It would've been nice to have crusty bread to put the tapanada on and the other antipasto.
It was our first visit, everything from when we walked in until we left was phenomenal, from the staff to the food to the ambience. Can’t wait to come back!
The restaurant was very nice and the service was excellent
Food was very very average but very expensive all at the same time. Great views of the water though and some fun live entertainment. Would recommend a drink but eat somewhere else.
Great service and food.  Would definitely recommend
Excellent place. Consistently good food quality, always friendly staff. Highly recommend if you’re able to get in!

Later for lunch on a beautiful Seattle day — great timing as tables began to clear and serving staff weren’t so rushed. Delicious salad and arancini filling, accompanied by delicious bread. Oh, it was a happy meal.
Food and service were both outstanding. Sat outside which was great
The food and ambiance are always wonderful.  If I could give more stars for the service I would - we had such a fantastic server yesterday.  Absolutely impeccable service!
Great restaurant. No sign outside but the place was packed. Bryan was an excellent waiter. Food was really good. Go see them.
Very unique experience. Fantastic food. Great service. Highly recommended. Ten stars!!!
Very upscale restaurant. Food was great, services great. The trapeze act was fantastic. Difficult place to get a reservation because it’s so popular. ￼
The Pink Door is a wonderful place to eat! The food was outstanding and the surroundings were beautiful! We had a fantastic server! I highly recommend this restaurant!
Excellent all the way around!!  Spaghetti with artichokes was great. Always get the grilled bread and the Bloody Mary was just right!!

An amazing visit to the Pink Door as always, and shout out to Eric the best waiter we've ever had! Food was all delicious and it was the perfect place to celebrate my friend's birthday. Every staff wished him a happy birthday and it was truly the best visit I've had yet! (Been over 15 times)
Excellent food. We had half the antipasto plate which was huge and fresh, followed by pasta with meatballs and pappradella. Both excellent along with great service and views

The Pink Door is a recommended place and hidden gem to search for whenever to are in the heart of downtown Seattle!  We loved the choice/selection of food on their menu. I especially loved the Cioppino. Im always looking for the best ciopinno wherever I travel to. And, I have to say The Pink Door measures up to that!  The view of Pike’s Market and water is amazing and the service was great!  Like I said, this is a must restaurant.

Went to the Pink Door for an early dinner.  Should have gone when they have the entertainment. I think that is what it is known for. Food was good but nothing special. Had a good table with a view and a great waitress!!  I made reservations 29 days ahead of time. Could only get a 3:15 reservation and at 3:15 the restaurant was pretty empty…..
Best bolognese. Ever. We’ll come back again just for that dish.
Ryan was great, food and ambience is always on point
Incredible food, amazing service and a perfect view!
Wonderful experience!!! Amazing  service and ambience 👍

We had the best time! Our niece gave us a gift certificate and we used it for our birthdays. We loved the musicians when we walked in. Then our table was overlooking the pier and the water. Our server was fun and efficient. And our food/dessert were Delicious!! We will definitely be back to Pink Door!!
Absolutely delicious and friendly. Have been coming for years, but this time around, it was extra special. Will continue coming for the food and ambience.
Great food and acrobatic show. Loved the ambience in the lounge.

Great value for money with beautiful food.  Unfortunately, it wasn't a clear day otherwise it would have been even better.  Went there to celebrate my husband's birthday and was everything we could have asked for. Exceptional wait staff and fantastic ambience.
Me and my friends do a dinner every few months to get together and catch up. We LOVE pink door. The food, the service and atmosphere is always amazing. Cannot recommend enough.
Best meal Iv had in a long time! Very impressed!!
Exceptional meal, wonderful service and a fun atmosphere. Their branzino-style white fish was delicious and my cocktail was creative and refreshing. Overall a lovely dining experience.
Fantastic food and view. Will be back the next time we are in Seattle

The Pink Door is my favorite place to dine. I'm glad I was able to find a reservation for my friends and I. They were visiting from out of town and have always wanted to dine here so I'm glad we could!  They were impressed.  I love the "new" space. It's been a while since I've been to the back of the restaurant and I was impressed with the atmosphere and decor! Can't wait to come again!
Loved this place! You cannot go wrong with the cocktails or food.
Always great. Never miss it when we are in Seattle.
Amazing food and service! We had appetizers, Entrees and dessert and all were excellent. We never felt rushed but waiter was super attentive.
We brought friends from Hawaii here and had an awesome experience and meal!
Food and drinks were incredible. Highly recommend.
It was an absolutely wonderful dining experience! Will definitely go again.
Beautiful atmosphere. Lovely service. Amazing food.
the service was very good. the food was delicious, but the size of the dishes was small.
Over 40 years of enjoying outstanding meals! The lasagna is to die for, the sauce is divine. Our server Carolyn was excellent in her service and personality. I love the Pjnk Door!👏❤️
A fun restaurant with delicious food, wonderful atmosphere, and amazing value! Highly recommend experiencing this unique Seattle gem!
Great place for date night, nice ambiance, great food
We had a great lunch! Food was yummy! Highly recommend the lasagna and bib lettuce salad.

This place is very cool. Unassuming from the Pink door entrance, the ambience hits you from the moment you open the door and step into the landing at the top of the stairs. We wound though the restaurant and sat at a table with a beautiful view of the water. Our waitress was spunky and well informed. She helped lead us to some fantastic dishes which we shared. The Pink Door Lasagna was amazing and pair well with an order of meatballs. The Linguini Alle Vongole was excelent. We also ordered the Oysters on the half shell, and for dessert the Rhubarb and Donut holes (they both had better names but I don't recall them). Everything was just fantastic! We booked a month in advance and had to settle for 9pm, but with the view and ambience as the sun went down the timing was perfect.
The team, the food, and the ambience are the best, as always.
Great place and location. Food was meh. Server just messed up the order a couple of times
Great food and service. We will go back again. So many gluten free options

Lunch or dinner at The Pink Door is always a treat, and my experience yesterday for a late lunch out on their patio was no exception.

The food - linguini vongole, arancini, spring risotto, and a glass of sauvignon blanc was excellent.

The service was friendly, knowledgable, and energetic.

This restaurant has long been one of my favorites, and I cannot recommend it more highly.

Dominik was awesome! He created  a great experience for us!
The food was amazing, highly recommend!

What a great experience! We listened to live music and enjoyed the ambience. Food was great and the wine was reasonably priced. Definitely suggest making a reservation. We showed up a little early but they sat us right away. We heard people talking the following day how they were trying to burn time in the hopes the restaurant would slow down and an opening would become available.

We've been experiencing The Pink Door for more than 30 years and it remains our very favorite Seattle restaurant. Ever. From atmosphere to food to service, all of it. May its door never close. Long live The Pink!

Food choices were varied. I tried the Pink Door Lasagna , Phenomenal !!  the Spring risotto, the linguine were some of our favorites  Our party of 8 tried several appetizers all were terrific. Drinks were spot on. Beautiful restaurant and perfect place to start our Seattle vacation. Hardest part was finding it! You simply can not go wrong with this restaurant . every dish was delicious and the staff are the best
Great experience the risotto and fish of the day was to die for! Amazing, extraordinary, fresh local flavors! The  views and ambiance were also unique!

This place is everything.  And it all starts with a mysterious pink door with no name.  We got there right before 1130 and the place was already garnering a line.  I thought all of us were going to rush the insides when the door opened.  And when it opened. What a delight.  Like opening a jewel box lid and seeing all the sun sparkled gilt and oil paintings and friendly staff.  The view in the back of the giant ferris wheel and the water is to die for.  And then to eat ... in those rooms .. with that view.. and the attentive, laid back staff.  The sweet/crisp/bright green/tender butterbean lettuce salad was so vibrant with flavor and greenness.  Butterbeans remind me of my grandmother.  And these were clearly from a nearby farm. The fish - grilled to perfection over a bed of crisped potatoes and greens.  The rhubarb pavlova - a tangy pink delight draped over a giant cloud of meringue.  A true slice of heaven.  Cant recommend enough!!  A favorite meal of a lifetime!

Fantastic experience!  Our server Ryan was the best.  If you dine there, must sit in the back with a view of the water.  All entre’s are very reasonably priced.  Will be back in June.
Thank you Pink Door.
Mark

This was my first time at he the Pink Door.  Not sure why I waited so long, it is a wonderful place with amazing food and outstanding service.  Had a table for two at the window, the view was spectacular at sunset.  We tried a little bit of everything on the dinner menu and it was all fantastic.  the tuna crudo melts in your mouth, the pasta course was cooked perfectly, the lamb chops were served rare and were crave worthy.  Also tried three of the deserts and they were all delicious.  Best dining experience in the Market area that I had had in a while, Well done Pink Door, keep it up, we will be back soon
Favorite place to eat in Seattle. Love the lasagna. Favorite lasagna I have found in the US.
Would live to have been seated outside but a very good experience overall.
Perfect sunny afternoon lunch on the deck. Heaven!
Great food.  Wonderful flavors. Super service. One of our favorite places.
One of the two entrees was badly oversalted. Even my salt-loving daughter agreed. I could have sent it back, but that would have ruined the timing of the lunch.
It’s always an amazing time when we come. The risotto has been on my mind for weeks and did not disappoint.  The staff is so sweet and accommodating.

I love the Pink Door. Celebrating Mother's Day with my daughter and her friend that just lost her Mother. Everything was great except our waiter. I had a gift card and also paid with my credit card. I made the mistake of my tipping on the credit card not the entire  amount because I was busy talking to the girls.  I am a very good tipper, he kept coming over asking about the service and when we left stared at me in a rude way. After we left I realized what I did, that still was did not a good reason for his rudeness.
Expérience exceptionnelle. Repas délicieux dans un environnement sympathique.

Thank you for another wonderful dining experience on your deck. The service was very professional and highly competent. Every dish was enjoyed. The burrata and prosciutto appetizer is not to be missed. The halibut was cooked to perfection. The cioppino looked amazing. But save room for rhubarb pavlova. A perfect ending.
We ate on the patio on a beautiful day!  It was perfect. Service is exceptional (thank you Dan). Food is delicious. A wonderful lunch with family!

Wonderful meal. Make reservations long in advance of coming to Seattle. Eclectic interior. Beautiful view of the sea. Our waiter was excellent. Good wax too. 4 in our party. All 4 different tastes. Lots of menu items to choose from. Will be back! Don’t miss this gem!
I’ve been trying to get a reservation here for years (out of towner) I finally came for my birthday weekend with my husband and it did not disappoint.

For all you go through to get a reservation, the food actually should’ve been better… The advertisers were great, but the entrées seem to be pedestrian… The linguine clam sauce was very dry and didn’t have much in the way of interest… The meatballs were excellent but we’re not served with enough sauce. They gave us maybe a tablespoon of sauce. I understand the Italians don’t use a lot of sauce, but this wasn’t enough sauce, the majority of the pasta was dry.
￼ the space is lovely and the service was excellent, but at the end of the day you go out to dinner for the food and I don’t think it added up
Service was amazing 🤩. I enjoyed the eclectic atmosphere. Food was top notch! Very good value for such an exclusive restaurant.

The Pink Door never disappoints.  Great food, great service, great location.  If it your first time, I recommend starting with the Tuna Crudo appetizer, and then the Lasagna entree.  But even if these don't appeal to you, you can't go wrong with the other selections either.
Excellent service and great food options as well as a view while you eat.
Very lovely vibes. The interior design is fabulous and feels like you get transported to France. Staff was great and live music was awesome.

It is very hard to get a reservation.  I don't think I would go without a reservation simply because we are older and not up to the wait.  I did get up at midnight to get a reasonable reservation time for 5.  I could only get 5:30.  It was worth it though.
Lasagna was perfect, as expected. Stellar service.
Fantastic food, service and the best patio ever on a sunny day. Loved our meal.
We have been coming to the Pink Door for decades and it is always a treat.  Reliably great food and an amazing place to go on a beautiful sunny day.

I’ve been wanting to go to the Pink Door for years.  Finally, all the stars aligned.  It was a beautiful late spring day, and this restaurant”s outdoor space was the perfect place to be.  Abuzz with people, yet never felt put upon by a crowd.  Service was fantastic. The food was very good. The bill was high.  It made for a wonderful occasion that I look forward to doing again, tho not likely to be often (sigh).  Beautiful, unique and welcoming space on interesting Post Alley. Highly recommend for a splurge.

The Pink Door is incredibly charming. The restaurant overlooks a gorgeous view of the water and the ambience is vibrant. The drinks and food were excellent, and the service was lovely. If I ever make my way back to Seattle, this is a spot I'd love to return to.
Rude hostess wouldn’t allow us to sit our reserved table. We wait over 20 mins for our reserved table. Luckily, our server was sweet. Small portions..

We save the Pink Door for the big moments of our year and it never disappoints. This time the spring risotto, green pea bruschetta, antipasto, Caesar and green salads were delicious as always. The light- filled dining room was beautiful even when we didn’t happen to be facing the view. Our server was gracious and attentive without being invasive, and the two birthday desserts were beautiful as well as scrumptious. Our only problem was remembering to plan far enough ahead to get reservation at this deservedly popular, charming place.
My favorite restaurant in the market!  Always top notch.  Can’t wait to come back.

We ordered the Arancini, Oysters, Branzino, Pappardelle Bolognese and the Vongole.  All were excellent.  Service was great for the most part, but was a little hard to hear/understand our server.  Most everything came out in a timely order, however towards the end our server forgot a couple of things so we were waiting around for those items and the check for a little longer than usual.  Overall, the experience was good.
Fantastic food, fantastic staff, literally a hidden gem. The homemade pasta is second to none, the ragu bolognese was the hit of the table. Can’t say enough about the awesome deserts.
Had great service are server was very attentive. Seating had a good view. The bolognese was absolutely delicious!!!!! Me and my girlfriend loved the experience would definitely go again!!
Worth the trip. The food was excellent and the views of the bay were amazing. Everyone was friendly and professional.
The food excellent as always. The rhubarb pavlova delicious. Frederick our server excellent too

Highly recommend.  If you can’t get reservations they do take walk ins but on Fri night the waitlist was closed by 7pm so arrive early. Service and food were excellent. We left before the entertainment started at 7pm. Arrive after 7 if you want that experience.  On Tu &Sat they have aerial acrobats.

Great service, scrumptious food with really nice ambience in a beautiful dining room with a glorious view of Elliot bay and the market..
Top notch!

From beginning to end, it was a meal to remember! We had a large family gathering on the terrace, and the view, food, and service was impeccable.  Fresh oysters, anti-pasta, prosecco, clams, mussels, fish, meatballs....we felt as if we were dining in Italy! We had children with us and they thoroughly enjoyed the experience as well.  I cannot recommend The Pink Door highly enough. Much praise to Jackie for creating such an amazing restaurant, and to her daughter Angelica now at the helm.  Brava!

My husband & I had an early dinner at the pink Door and felt it was worth the hype. We sat in the back dining room with the windows overlooking the water. The noise level was significantly lower than the front room. The ambience is eclectic which unique wall art & a mix of textiles. Our table was fabulous- we were in the corner by the windows.
Our waitress was excellent. Very friendly, professional & knowledgeable. We had Caesar salad, PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE & fish of the day. The bolognese was excellent. The Caesar salad was just ok - nothing special. The fish was cooked beautifully but it was served on lentils which were just ok.   WeI would definitely come back.

Pink Door has been a Seattle favorite for decades; over the last few years, getting a reservation has been like getting an audience with the Pope. I understand that they have cut their reservations in order to ensure that they have room for walk-ins. I appreciate that. Just getting in is the biggest issue; otherwise, the food is terrific, the vibe has always been awesome, the service friendly...just great food in a casual, fun setting. Highly recommend if you can score a reservation, and probably worth the wait if you don't (they'll take your number, have you walk around Pike Place Market, and let you know when a table is opening up).
Super cute place. Food was very good, but honestly, I think it’s so popular because of the ambience.

The best Italian dining we’ve experienced outside of Italy!  Excellent and professional service, creative menu and healthy options make this a must visit in Seattle.  Topped off with a great wine selection, some at reasonable prices.  We had a really fantastic experience and would definitely return.
I could be more pleased with my meal, the service, and the overall experience.
The food was amazing and our waitress Steph P was so nice. We had a blast celebrating a birthday and definitely plan to visit again soon.
The fish of the day was amazing! The oysters were fabulous and the view was great!

Service was quick and the server checked in to see how we were doing several times, as well as provided some insight on the menu which is always appreciated. The ambience was beautiful and the food was delicious!
Fantastic evening! Great cocktails, wine and food plus excellent service!  Love the space too!

The linguine was very good but the Halibut was not well seasoned.  The almond cake was just okay. They also don’t seem to have a sommelier to recommend wine but I suppose that’s not a big deal. The service was good and the the view is great.
Well the stake wasn't that great (medium rear was well done). Next time I will order their specialty... Just pasta. The lasagna was great. Their dessert was average.

Eric was our server and he was lovely. The food was simply amazing. Atmosphere incredible. Half litter of wine for $20. When the bill came we were very pleasantly surprised!! 


First time in Seattle and an absolutely pleasure to be able to eat dinner here.

Second time here and had a great time! Live band playing for about half the meal and although we were right next to the stage, it was really quite enjoyable! I would recommend walking in and trying for space if you don’t have a reservation, but I waitlisted on OpenTable and that worked!
Food was amazing!  Fun atmosphere,  great service,  and so so yummy.
Great  food and service. Great ambiance. We will come back
Amazing Lasagna and Arancini. Pavlova had subtle sweet but was complemented well with the rhubarb compote. Great experience 😀
Great for special occasions and friendly wait staff

We had a wonderful time!  We were welcomed in and escorted to our table with a view by friendly, professional staff.  The staff was very attentive and helpful when asked for recommendations.  The food was delicious and plentiful.  The entertainment that evening was a jazz trio (I believe) but we were in another room so we did not enjoy them only seeing them when we were leaving.  We would recommend this fabulous restaurant for the ambience, professional staff and of course the food!
Be sure to make a reservation!
Service was amazing on point food was good I had great experience
Beautiful environment, excellent service and delicious food!

We had such an amazing experience from the moment we stepped into the Alley. The service was exceptional. There was never a moment that our needs were not met before we knew we needed it. I love this! Food was beautifully plated and the taste to match. Absolutely delicious on all the senses. Thank you!
It is always an epic experience.  I highly recommend the Pink Door.

This Seattle gem deserves its popularity, and luckily is available for lunch. There is so much flavor and elegance in the offerings and so much understated class and gentility in the delivery, that you’ll want to stay long after your meal is done. And the only things more inviting than the windows of the great room are the soft fresh breezes and garden party feel of the deck in springtime. You will want to return again and again.

We have lived in Seattle for 30 years and have been here only a few times...not sure why other than it is tucked away in an alley in Pike's Place Market so you kind of forget about it...but the Pink Door has excellent food, a great location and ambiance.  Highly recommend it if you are a local, or coming from out of town.
Everything was amazing! We are from Lafayette, LA  have a few people recommend the Pink Door. Amazing food & wonderful service.

We had a fabulous experience at the Pink Door. Loved the food, the wait staff was friendly and attentive, and the ambiance was romantic funky. The only comment is the live music was a bit loud so had to talk loudly in order to have a conversation with my dinner partner. I think it might be difficult for tables of 4 or larger. But GO, you will love it.

We visited the Seattle area for our anniversary to experience the sites and National Parks. The Pink Door has great ambiance and delicious food. We got a half dozen oysters, the prosciutto and burrata, cioppino pink door, and a squid ink pasta with seafood. This was perfect for an anniversary week lunch to end our week long trip.

Our waiter Stephano gave great suggestions! Food was delicious and homemade. I really loved the “rose hips to my lips” drink. The man with the water pitcher was so on it my glass was never half empty. Props to him.
Hard to get in place but well worth it if you can find it.  Pink door on building in an alley is hard to find.  Open the door, and it’s a cavernous lively atmosphere, with good food and service.

I visited earlier this week few a late lunch surprise. The team at the restaurant was fabulous!  They helped me to make it an incredibly special event. The service was impeccable, the setting was magical, and the food stupendous. We would highly recommend!

We have been coming to the restaurant for year and it never disappoints.  We had a table by the window and the view was awesome.  Our server appeared right when we needed him.  The food was sooo good.  Highly recommend reservations to this very popular spot.

Our server acted like he wanted to be anywhere but there. We told him about a birthday in our group and his comment was “ I don’t sing and dance” - we never asked him to do either. We observed other servers taking a small dessert with a candle to other guests and wishing them a happy birthday.  We were asking questions about the menu and he was obviously annoyed by that.  Sadly, the birthday girl in our group was so excited to eat here for her birthday dinner and we felt bad because while the food was amazing the service made us feel unwelcome and like we were inconveniencing our server by our mere presence.
Our server was great & the food and drinks were delicious.
Wonderful place to take friends from out of town. Great menu, welcoming service, nice vibes, and good drinks.  This place is Seattle in a microcosm.

Reallly enjoyed our experience here! The food was great! We really liked the fresh oysters and cioppino! The vibe of the place was cool too and there was a nice view of the water in the back room where we were seated!
Great spot and amazing food! The pasta and wine is my favorite but also great seafood.
Simply amazing!! Food, service, atmosphere and value were incredible. Can’t wait to go back.
This maybe the best restaurant in Seattle.   The food and service are outstanding.

I really enjoyed the quality of the restaurant! Behind a seemingly innocuous pink door with no signage lies a beautiful and relaxing Italian restaurant with high-quality pasta and wonderful service. I'd come back with a date next time!
Meal was excellent — our waitress was amazing, she did a fantastic job. We travelled from Arizona today and went straight from the airport to Pink Door, thanks again for making the trip worthwhile.

We keeping coming back! Such a lovely restaurant and the menu is spot-on. Fine wines, a variety of appetizers, salads and entrees. Plus great service by all the staff. Thanks for making lunchtime so tasty!
Service, food, and ambience were all great. I love the quirky decor too.
The food was delicious, the service was excellent! Highly recommend the lasagna and the risotto!
We came for lunch as part of a work trip. It was Delish! Can’t wait to go back. 10/10!

Rarely does a restaurant experience go so far above and beyond my expectations that I feel I have so much to write about every single part of the experience. We made a reservation for the pink door because we had heard it was a can’t miss Seattle experience. The novelty of seeing an aerial performance during dinner was the initial draw and it did not disappoint, but the service, food, and ambiance were also excellent. Our server Elyse took excellent care of us and took special care to find a wine that fit our taste. The roasted beet ravioli and artichoke pasta were both amazing and so different from anything we had eaten before. The ambiance was perfect for a romantic dinner. It was packed but we could still hear each other perfectly. We managed to see 3 of the 4 aerial performances for the evening and they were all stunning and unique. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!
Great dining experience and amazing food. Be sure to make a reservation weeks in advance. Had to make a reservation a month in advance even for a Tuesday evening!
Good was really good, service was amazing, felt very taken care of. Would’ve liked to sit near the window, but wasn’t too upset about that. Would definitely go again!

Such a wonderful experience with amazing views and just a great vibe.  The food was delicious … the menu is small but well thought out.
Service is excellent and attentive without being smarmy.
The almond cake with cherries is worth the trip.

We had a fabulous dinner. This place is not overrated at all! The Ahi tuna crudo is a MUST. The everything green salad was great. The spring risotto and halibut special were both delicious. Expresso martinis were dark & rich. The decor and ambiance is great. Love it!
Excellent food, beautiful views, and great customer service.

Had the chance to celebrate my birthday on the first trip to Seattle at the Pink Door with my boyfriend. The ambiance was perfect with the live jazz performance and the food matched the vibe. The restaurant has a speakeasy feel, would highly recommend coming during the performance times during dinner.

After 15 years, I returned to an old favorite. The lasagna was just as good as it used to be, yet the service was even better. We had oysters, gnocchi, lasagna Pink Door, and red wine. We had a great table and so much fun. They called me right away when I accidentally left my purse, and everything was still in it. I am so grateful! Worth every penny!
The decor is great! Our food was excellent! Great service!
Wonderful as always - excellent, attentive service, great recommendations, everything prepared perfectly.
This was such a highlight of our trip! Excellent service, wonderful views, absolutely amazing food - will definitely be back!

Always a wonderful experience here when I’m in Seattle. The food is amazing, staff is super professional and nice. Make a reservation if you want to go it’s literally sometimes impossible. Walk in maybe a wait but it’s worth it.

We ate in the main dining room overlooking Puget Sound, so the excellent jazz trio playing in the bar provided background music. The staff is engaging, sophisticated and professional. The food was excellent, the wine list carefully selected.

Just above the tourist destination this gem is unassuming until you make your way past the host stand through the restaurant to the main dining room. We were seated I. The middle of the room with a stellar view of the sunset and ferry boats going to and from. The service was outstanding. Very attentive but not intrusive. Perfect recommendations and handled our allergies with respect and care. Even the chef triple checked before sending our order to our table! Highly recommend this place. Bolognese, cioppino, mama’s meatballs, oysters, bottle of bubbles and lemon tart for dessert.

The Pink Door was a wonderful experience on every level. From the Hostess who greeted us, to the person who escorted us to our table, to our waiter, all staff were friendly, engaged and knowledgeable. Our food was delicious.  Noteworthy was the wonderfully fruity olive oil presented with the bread and the sauce that accompanied the Arancini. Main courses (cioppino, eggplant parmigiana, and halibut special) were very enjoyable. This experience was a birthday celebration (89th!) for a mobility-challenged friend and everyone—including fellow diners—were kind and accommodating.  We had a lovely booth with a great view of the Puget Sound and all the maritime activity. The restaurant has a very warm and welcoming ambiance. Looking forward to returning.

I haven't been to The Pink Door since before the COVID shutdown. I was pleasantly surprised at the wonderful service, drinks, meal and dessert. Everything was A+++++
We went to celebrate my wife's birthday and it has instantly become our favorite restaurant. Thank you for keeping a Seattle classic wonderful.

My favorite restaurant ❤️🥂

This is our special place for celebrations.

Don’t miss the lasagna, the best I ever had.
The restaurant is so pretty and we loved all the decor.  The menu was very average and lacking. Everything tasted good, not amazing or bad. It was just an overall “ok” eating experience.
Great place! I would go again. The food was delicious and the service was great compared to other Seattle restaurants.
Terrific food and friendly lively service. Always a great meal.

The Pink Door never disappoints!  One of my favorite Seattle restaurants.  The lasagne is the best in the city, which is why it's been on the menu for 42 years! (that's what our waitress said anyway).  Great wine list too.  Service is excellent.  However, it's not an inexpensive restaurant.,.
Fabulous food and service. Great atmosphere very busy but enjoyable!!!

Came right at sunset into the main dining area and it was absolutely stunning. The food was incredible and the staff was amazing. Ladies just be mindful of cobblestone on the street leading to the restaurant when wearing heels
Phenomenal food. Literally every dish was delicious and presented well.

I have been wanting to dine here for quite some time and was a bit disappointed in the food and service. The aerial performance was worth it but they only did 3 songs and half the dining room couldnt see the performance as they were seated in the other room. We asked to move and luckily they had an open table near the performance for us. The food was just OK, would likely not go back unfortunately.
Food was amazing. Fun night to celebrate my birthday. Aerial show was beautiful.

Was visiting Seattle and went on a date night with my husband. We had a wonderful evening and meal. He had the steak and I had a Cesar salad with the pink door lasagna. It was all delicious! Pricier, but great quality and worth it. Would definitely recommend.

I brought two oot friends to join us for my partner’s birthday.
We all loved our meals!

Sannie

Fabulous wait staff and great table to celebrate 3 birthdays! We were part of the last seating, and I appreciated that we didn’t feel rushed at this late hour. As always, wonderful food. Thank you for a lovely evening!

The Pink Door does not disappoint. As a new Seattle resident I waited awhile to get the perfect reservation slot. It was worth the wait. Everyone from the front hosts, to the wait staff and support staff went  above and beyond to make for a great evening. Portions are not large but everything was delicious. We shared the Caesar salad and pasta Bolognese to start, delicious! The halibut was melt in your mouth delicious. The lamb chop was also delicious and perfectly prepared. The dining room was a beautiful backdrop for all the magic. The lounge looked like a warm and fun place to eat as well. We will be back.
Incredible unique experience in Pjkes that we will not forget. The food and aerial performances were amazing. Quick seating with reservations that can be booked up to 30 days prior.
Hidden spot with FANTASTIC food and impeccable service.

Celebrated my birthday with a friend. We had dinner in the lounge so we could see the show, and the aerial performance was a delight! Our server, Ryan, was wonderful, and the food was delicious. My friend and I shared the fig bruschetta over cocktails, then had some yummy pasta before our entrées. The chicken was delicious, and while I had hoped to have a salad before dessert, I was too full to indulge in both! It was my friend's first time at the Pink Door, but will certainly not be her last. Love this place.
Loved the live performance, wish it was longer. Food was good too - a little expensive but good quality. Overall a fun place to visit.

We waited 2 years to get in, well, actually we were in Seattle 2 years ago and they were booked the whole week we were there and couldn’t get in. We loved it. The food, the ambience, the decor, the view. All of it was lovely. Lee tried the rigatoni and meatballs, the risotto, the chicken saltimboca and the cioppino. We enjoyed it very much and look forward to coming back next visit. Thanks for the greatness.

We absolutely love this restaurant!  It is the perfect place for a date night, or getting friends and family together.    Wait staff are attentive and friendly - food is delicious - ambience is lively but allows for conversation.  Two thumbs up!!

I really appreciate the Pink Door honoring my request to get a comfortable table for my dad who is navigating health issues. They had Eric tending to us and he was so polite, kind, and let us take our time. It was a special evening.
One of my favorite restaurants. I delight for all the senses!
Fun and elegant atmosphere, wonderful food. The risotto was really tasty and the salads so fresh. Attentive and personable server. Special evening.
Dynamite. Food was great. Staff was super friendly.
This was the best meal we had in the Seattle area during our 4 day stay. Fantastic! Made reservations well in advance and still got a late table but it was worth it.
Great place to take your date, the food is delicious, the music and ambience is top tier.
Wow. WOW. WOW. Unfortunately, we could only attend the lunch menu, but this place has everything. We will be back.

Just a lovely lunch. Again.

A nice table. A nice, friendly, attentive server. Management present and caring about the experience of the clientele. A beautiful view. Great food off an interesting menu. And at prices that are so much more reasonable than you'd see in many other loci, _especially_ in an area with high tourist traffic. 

And the whole thing managing to feel individualized, not cookie cutter. Well done!

I can't wait for our next visit.
The Pink Door truly has it all: Amazing food, amazing service, & amazing ambiance. Highly highly recommend.
My cousins were  visiting from Korea, they loved the experience at pink door!  Good food and service and cozy atmosphere!!

Had called a few weeks in advance for a window seat   Got there at 11:30 when you open for my reservation  was offered 2 tables  both NOT at window   Had deal attitude about not getting window seater a bday celebration    Then my guest asked for butter instead of garlic olive oil for her bread   She was denied butter   Said they have it but not allowed to serve it with bread   This was a request   I get it if not put on table with bread but when requested it would be nice to please a customer    So we skipped a second course and had no dessert  just to leave asap    Shame on Pink  Door which I  frequent

We had an amazing dinner out and Stephanie took great care of us! The lasagna, linguine vongole, endive, fennel, & apple salad were all delicious as was the garlic bread. The Stevens XY reserve cab was so velvety! We love the hidden gem ambience, live music and consistent cuisine!

Great food but very busy and loud.
Salad portions could be bigger or have a larger option
Fantastic experience! The Lasagna was the best I've ever had. Will be coming back and recommend eating here.
The dining area near the bar is exceptionally noisy !  Not conducive to good conversations
Great place and atmosphere. Great service and amazing food!
Server was good, but stars knocked off for unfriendly hosts.

Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and it far exceeded my expectations. The Pink Door is the definition of 5 star dining. The food was amazing and we cherished eveey bite. My girlfriend is Italian and I wanted her to enjoy something authentic and every dish we ordered blew us away. I couldn't leave that place without also getting a bottle of their house olive oil. 

I would say that I can't recommend this place enough. But the fact you have to reserve your table a month in advance means everyone already knows how amazing this place is. 

5 stars!
Good food and the service was excellent.  Risotto was cook perfectly and the beef check was tender and flavorful

The music was great and so was the atmosphere! The food was absolutely delicious! The service was also very quick! Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu as well. That was very helpful. The view we had was also quite incredible!
I had a great time. I would definitely go back here if I'm ever in Seattle again.
Great food, service and table. Best overall spot in Seattle🥊🥊🥊

Our second time dining here, we made it up to the PNW yo celebrate my birthday second  year in a row.  I had the pink door lasagna, It is delicious- chefs kiss!!  Antipasto was delish!! Try everything, it won’t disappoint!!
The ambiance is quaint, beautiful inside!  Great view of pike place market and waterfront from dining room.  Looking forward to next year’s celebration here!!

Overall excellent meal! Had the grilled garlic bread, the parpadelle with bolognese, and the zeppoles for dessert. All cooked perfect! Service was attentive and the view was ideal. Definitely will be back!
Food was excellent! Always great food. Anytime we come to Seattle it is a must.
Great food, atmosphere and service!  We will definitely be back.
We had an excellent lunch with our out-of-town friends.  Great server; great food.  It was fabulous all the way around!

This is one of the best restaurants that I've been to. The service was impeccable, the decor was fun and quirky and the views of the water in the back dining area were incredible. The food was outstanding, everything we ate had great flavors and textures, oysters were fresh. I would return in a heartbeat.

Our expectations were high. Food was not good we wanted to send back both dishes we ordered. (The fried cheese ball dish and lasagna) Caesar salad was fine though. I don’t know if we are just spoiled because we have great restaurants in Southern California but this place was a huge letdown.

Our dinner was absolutely fabulous. Orange salad was light, fresh and unique. Cioppino was loaded with seafood. Meatballs were good. The cassata cake was outstanding. Thank you also for a nice table for our celebration. We found the service to be attentive, friendly and efficient. Looking forward visiting again!
The lasagna was amazing! Also the desert was yummy.  Chefs kiss
We celebrated my girlfriend’s 56th birthday and she spent her 16th birthday there with friends and family 40 years ago. So fun! We ate every bite. It was so delicious.
Great time lovely meal! Enjoyed the entertainment as well

As described, a pink door opened to reveal an eclectic setting with fun energy . Once again , our server was top notch and welcomed us. From the table bread to the gourmet menu  offerings .
The view of the harbor was a bonus

Fourth time to dine in this restaurant. Service is always top-notch, and the food is always very tasty, never too salty.

Not really a cocktail person, but this is the one restaurant I always get a specialty cocktail and I’m never disappointed
Food & staff are great as always.
Portion sizes were much smaller than expected. Especially for the salads. Could see the bottom of the plate when the salad came out. Server was great.
We love the Pink Door! Always amazing food and accommodating of group reservations.
What a wonderful meal.  I highly recommend trying The Pink Door.

The food and ambience was great.
Wished some music was playing in the background. It started when we were about to leave.
I asked warm water but never got it.

It was delicious and perfect.  I had made a reservation for 11:30 a.m. which was opening time. We waited outside with a dozen other people.  I mentioned my reservation anyway and I think it got us better seating. It was every bit as good as reviewed and I look forward to going back.

Another lovely dinner at Pink Door. It was my first time bringing my parents from out of town and their delight was evident. Ryan, our waiter, was the perfect balance of attentive, funny, and gracious. And lest we forget the bus boy, seamlessly making sure water was never less than half full while also flipping tables at warp speed. As for the food and ambience, no notes. Perfect as always.
Might be my favorite restaurant.  Never disappoints.  Seasonal menu and year round classics are all wonderful.

We enjoyed the nice atmosphere, food was wonderful, tasty cocktails. I just did not care for our server. He was attentive, but not friendly, forgot our appetizer and charged us double for the entries. Glad we checked the bill. Now still dealing with double charge on the credit card. Hopefully it will get resolved.
Outstanding all around. The food, the service, and the atmosphere. An excellent place to eat at

I was in Seattle for the weekend and had to eat here twice for dinner! Food was delicious, ambiance was great and service was on point! This place did not disappoint and I’m definitely returning when I come back to Seattle.
The Pink Door is ALWAYS the best! The food is phenomenal, the staff is so friendly and helpful, and the show was just awesome. Love coming here!

Our pasta dishes were excellent, as was our dessert (orange marmalade olive oil cake).
The server we had was great.
My only complaint was the oysters we ordered as a first course. They tasted, and smelled, fishy. Oysters I have had in the past were sweet and tasted slightly of the sea. My husband ate them but I couldn’t choke them down.
10/10. Chef was extremely accommodating with allergies and food was amazing as always.

The lasagna was incredible! I’m vegetarian so it’s rare I can have a lasagna and this one did not disappoint. My server was also very attentive and made great recommendations. Would absolutely go again
Overall, fantastic experience. The ambiance is very cool and it was awesome to have some live music in the background. The food was absolutely delicious and service was great!
I had an amazing experience. Good food and ambience
Great place - food is fantastic and our waiter Dominic was awesome.
always consistently great.  I love the seasonal cocktails and the food is always delicious.
Lovely experience as always. Wonderful food, service, and ambiance without pretension.
Exceeded expectations!! Incredible food and ambiance. Lasagna and oysters are a must.
Do the Tarot reading on Thursday nights with Kince!
Very cool place.  The food and service were excellent.  Good wine selection and fairly priced.

Cannot recommend enough! Everything was wonderful. Took my partner out for a date night and to celebrate his birthday. The waitress greeted us in a timely fashion, provided the specials, offered great recommendations, and checked in with us throughout the meal. The ambience is stunning, what a great space and the food was phenomenal. Totally worth it! Can’t wait to go back again.
Fabulous restaurant, food, and setting! Love this restaurant.
Lovely view.  Good food.  Service was excellent. Five stars
We really loved our server, She was delightful and very upbeat!
Excellent service, exceptional food and great atmosphere.
Thank you! We have so much fun when we go to Pink Door. The menu never disappoints and we always come back to try the option that we missed. Next time, swordfish!
Another great experience . The food and service were spectacular. Can't wait to go back!
Always a wonderful experience and the service and food are both amazing.

This place is quintessential old school beautiful. A pure Seattle Gem. I recommend it for anyone seeking a lovely experience that feels special and  off the  beaten path~ The Pink Door is one of the only restaurants in Seattle that has a pure Italian vibe. Well done to the chefs, servers, hostesses.
A must do on your list when in Seattle.  The lasagna is to die for and the endive, apple and fennel salad is one of the best salads I have ever had.  5 stars all the way.
Overrated and overpriced. The food was good but nothing that you couldn’t get at Olive Garden
What a wonderful dining experience. We enjoyed our food, staff and ambience.
Great food and fast/attentive service. Got to go in earlier than originally planned which was sweet.

My friend and I were visiting for the weekend and we loved our visit to the Pink Door! Unfortunately, we had some complications with our reservation time/date and the staff were so kind and accommodating to help us find a solution! They were very busy and managing a lot, and still made sure we got to enjoy dinner with them. THANK YOU! It was our last night in town and you made it lovely.

The ambiance is very enjoyable - good lighting, detail in the decor, and there is live music. We had a beautifully positioned table in the back room near the windows. I had the caesar salad as a started, Bolognese for my meal (the sauce and portion were perfect), and then we split the olive oil cake. Our server was fun and bubbly. We had a terrific time. The location is also fun, tucked in a cute alley near other bars and restaurants and not far from the iconic market.
Great food and environment definitely worth checking it out

Outstanding.
Food, staff, service always amazing.
My go-to at Pink Door:  Caesar with fresh Dungeness crab, and the best darn meatball sandwich in Seattle.  Don't forget a couple tasty oysters for an app.
In our opinion, the best value and service of any restaurant in Seattle.
Skip the rest, and book here every month.
You won't be disappointed!
We had a great time and the food and service was fantastic.
A great historical experience. Fantastic food and service.
Excellent restaurant, great experience every time we go!
Absolutely lovely ambience, perfect for a date night.

N times is in the pink door, even Valentine's Day is too busy, but the food still good , and it has music band start at 7pm.
The special main menu fish is so so, but the special dessert is very good.
The food was really good and the service was very attentive and friendly.

Great menu options
Reasonable pricing,  attentive service
Main dish was a bit salty compared to before but good otherwise

Had reservations for the lounge, we were not seated in there but we were assured that we could get up and go watch the trapeze show and when it happened, we were stopped abruptly by staff member that didn’t want us to walk any further yet we could not actually visualize the show and since we came from across the country, really wanted the entertainment option, which was not appreciated.

All the food we have tried were outstanding, any plate you choose you will enjoy it.
The important thing, pink door needs to be pink 🩷
Would be more pleasant to see waiters wear more modest clothes not sweat pants. ￼
Worth visiting! Will recommend to my friends and family.
The food, service and setting are fantastic.  They are always consistent in their service and food.

Great food and nice atmosphere. Getting a reservation can be difficult but it’s worth it. I chose a classic and wasn’t disappointed. The service from the waiter was great the hostess’s assistant wasn’t having a good day and it showed. Overall a great dining experience
Excellent food, great performance in the lounge are ea. Incredibly romantic down to the dripping wax candle on the table. Excellent service.

The Pink Door is a favorite of ours in Seattle! We’ve celebrated special events, entertained colleagues, and enjoyed long, leisurely lunches with our of town friends - it’s the best. Great menu, atmosphere, views, service. Yesterday’s experience was sadly not the best as our server consistently and persistently tried to rush us through our meal and out the door.  One crabby server having a tough day - it happens! Hopefully the next experience will be back to the high standards and fantastic experience we’ve always had here.

Food, drinks, and ambience was perfect. Our server was noticeably annoyed with us for almost our entire stay. We’re not really sure why, but it was definitely a negative cloud over our lunch. The food was so good though so we’d definitely go back for that.

From start to finish, Dominic had us in the palm of his hands and we were very appreciative of his professionalism and congeniality. We will be back and often if we can have Dominic as our server thank you for getting us a wonderful window seat and for the very good recommendations from Dominic and the staff to not over order as everything on your menu is extraordinary

The service was impeccable, with our waitress going above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. Her recommendations were spot on, guiding us through a menu teeming with tantalizing options. We started with the La Fettunta, a simple yet divine grilled bread that perfectly complemented every dish by soaking up the rich, flavorful sauces.
