But it wasn’t just the food that made our lunch great ; it was the overall experience. The blend of delicious cuisine, warm service, and unique entertainment in such a magical setting made our dinner at The Pink Door an outstanding adventure in dining. It’s a must-visit for anyone in Seattle looking for a meal that’s not just eaten but experienced
Lovely place, romantic, the service was prompt, food arrived in a promptly as well, beautiful decor and views

This place is amazing. We made reservations on a Friday night, only time left was 5:45. Had a great seat 2nd table back from the window overlooking a glorious February sunset over the Puget sound. We both had a cocktail and seafood dishes. Everything was excellent! Fun place! No sign in the alley, just look for the pink door!

I went in with high expectations and they were all exceeded.  Exceptionally worm, friendly and attentive service.  All the food was flawless, as were the cocktails. The back room with windows facing the sound is a really bright and elegant space during the day.
The entire menu is very thought out and offers a variety of great options.
The food, atmosphere, and service were amazing. Love this place!!!
Everything was great! Servers were attentive and the food was amazing.

Reserved table through open table and requested window seats. We were sat in the inside room as there were no window seats available at that time. Before we could order, one table opened up. I requested the server, she asked the manager and the manager clearly didn’t even consider. We were told that we reserved a table for 2 and those are tables for 4. Fair. Then after 10 minutes I see 2 women seated there. WTF? Why were we rejected that table then?  Just felt wrong. Anyway, the food came. I ordered medium well lamb chops. Apparently if you want medium well chops, they will be burnt. The server tried her best. She changed and got my 2nd order. But I had to wait longer for food. Whenever I am here, I order their lamb chops and it was never this bad.  And the table thing felt like just mistreatment. Not worth the wait and the hype anymore it seems.
Excellent last minute reservation choice. The service, food, cocktails and ambiance were all impeccable. Can’t wait to go back
It’s very cool, and weird. We ordered a fish and a cocktail we weren’t feeling, but that’s on us. It’s very cool in there. Great service.
We enjoyed our lunch at The Pink Door celebrating my brother’s birthday. Our wait person was terrific and patient with our slowness to order.  We all enjoyed our food.

Comfortable seating with picturesque views of Elliott Bay. Complimentary bread was a plus. We had the usual pastas...pappadelli, rigatoni and meat balls with marinara sauce, which were all tasty, flavorful and delicious. Pici con sugo di coniglio was their special rabbit dish offered that day...happens to be my favorite of the evening. Order if you see it or ask the waiter for it. So Good! Short rib with soft polenta was well seasoned. Vegetable sides of string beans and brussel sprouts cooked just right.
Service was stellar...top notched! Dishes came at a good pace. Will be back when visiting Seattle.
Always amazing and yesterday was the best in terms of food, service etc. Can’t miss!!

Service was excellent!! Waiter very knowledgeable. We had lasagna, was wonderful, spaghetti and meatballs delicious, lamb chops were out of this world
The salmon disappointing, a bit mushy .. we will definitely be back!!
The Pink Door is amazing. The food is Authentic to Lazio and we moved here from Italy so it’s like home. It is the perfect secret spot with the most amazing wine selection.
The food was super delicious, services was great. Definitely a MUST go in Seattle!
The Pink Door had great food and service. Was pretty busy and this the moderate noise level.
Great experience. Service was great and ambiance was super cool
Highly  recommended for a date night! Upscale but still affordable (for nice food) with amazing food! I highly recommend the lasagna - I get it every time!
My favorite restaurant in Seattle! Another great evening here with excellent service and food. We’ll be back!
This place never disappoints. My favorite place in Seattle Washington. The food is top notch, the atmosphere is amazing and the staff is so welcoming. The best bathroom for selfies too. 🪞🪞🪞🪞

Had an amazing time.  Such a cool space.  Super service and food.

Loved!
This is our go to place for celebrations I just wish it wasn’t so hard to get in to. Thanks it was a great meal with great service and atmosphere.
Pink Door has the hype for a reason! It's worth the wait for the reservation, I promise. So yummy, excellent service, good atmosphere. Just overall lovely time!
Testing testing testing testing testing testing testing
One of the most pleasurable and delicious meals ever! A place well worth the wait to enter! Don’t miss The Pink Door, ever!

A Seattle classic, with staff as accommodating, friendly and professional as ever.  The food and beverages were spot on.  Not to miss is the tapenade - the best you will ever have.  So good with the crusty French bread as a pre-dinner warm up!!!

We weren’t able to make our reservation for a Tuesday evening and the hostess was able to fit us in at the same time the following night, which was much appreciated for us to celebrate family birthdays. Waiter was attentive and friendly, table in the dining room was nice and food excellent. Will definitely be back.
Amazing food we had the lasagna which was excellent and the scallops. Service was excellent, we had a great time!
What a fabulous place…3 unique seatings areas and all are interesting. The food is excellent and our server attentive and friendly.
Great place to have a date night! Love the lasagna

What a stellar experience!  I always love the Pink Door, but this was beyond fantastic.  From the minute  we were seated everything exceeded our (already high ) expectations!  It’s tough to get a reservation, but worth persevering for this really special place.  It’s a true Seattle Treasure.
First time after being recommended by friends. Absolutely loved up to the expectations. Our server Eric was great and the food was outstanding!
Outstanding in every way! The service, environment and quality of food were all incredible.
We had a wonderful time and experience celebrating our girlfriend's special birthday! Our server Steph was terrific and the food was wonderful as always.
Our server was amazing. Food was good. Ambience was great
Really cool place! The food was awesome and the live music rocked
The server, Greta, was wonderful and answered all my questions I had, food came out fast, and tasted amazing. I will definitely come back if I am ever in Seattle. Amazing spot!
Great in every way.  Always the best of everything.  Returning real soon.
Lovely experience with excellent food and service. Will definitely be back

We showed up right on time for our reservation, but had to wait for 20 minutes. Pink Door is also a bit spendy, so be warned. This was where the negatives end though, since the food was delicious, portions were generous, and the staff was pretty good. We were treated with a live smooth Jazz performance on stage in the dining room too. We will definitely return.
My only complaint as an older patron is I wish I didn't have to walk up that steep hill to get to the restaurant.

Every occasion at the Pink Door became a moment to remember. Fabulous food ,outstanding food.
Our favorite restaurant in Seattle♥️
I took my girlfriend here for our anniversary, and had such a wonderful time. It was recommended to me by my sister as her favorite restaurant, for which was not misleading. Overall 11/10.
Visit after visit excellent food and staff wonderful!  When you walk in this restaurant you feel special!  The decor unbelievable 😁
Fabulous lunch with a view. What a treat! Perfect special occasion.

We had a wonderful experience for my birthday. The service was exceptional. The food was amazing and the ambience is 2nd to none definitely will be going there again would recommend to anyone who’s looking for a curated dining experience.

The Pink Door went beyond expectations. The wait staff was helpful, attentive and professional. I had the lasagna was fantastic boldly flavorful masterpiece. I felt like the staff truly enjoyed their jobs and took pride in good service. This made for a very memorable night.

We always have a great experience dining at the Pink Door. Olga, our server did a wonderful job, the food was delicious, as always and I recommend the lasagna if you haven't had it. 

Marta

Ate here with my friend who was visiting Seattle for the first time, and my boyfriend. Amazing experience, amazing service every time. This trip around we had Gretta and she was absolutely wonderful and made my day! We were treated with great kindness and attention to detail. And don't get me started on the atmosphere of this restaurant, always - absolutely stunning. It's the service, though, and the genuine heart and soul of all staff that makes me want to come back again and again and again (and again). Thank you, Gretta! (Also I had lamb chops, HIGHLY RECOMMEND.) I could not have asked for a better place to show my friend Seattle.
Had a fantastic time and meal with my friends here, service was amazing and the place is very romantic. We loved coming and we will be back
The food was delicious! We mad reservations but ended up arriving early and they were able to accommodate us.

We had a great time at The Pink Door. Check in was a breeze, and were seated at the table by the window with a very nice street and Puget Sounds view.
Food and drinks were tasty and priced right.
Not to mention the great service.
Would definitely come back again!

I was hosting a dear friend for a birthday lunch at a table of 4, the dining room is so pretty and the service was impeccable. We all enjoyed our food, the lasagna was great as usual and we had a decent squid ink pasta. One small disappointment was the endive and apple salad which was so very small that it seemed almost to be a joke for $14. It was a lovely lunch and I appreciate having such a beautiful place downtown where I can count on having a nice experience.

The Pink Door is a perennial favorite. No matter the time of year, time of day, it never disappoints. Service was great and the food even better. It was a good thing we made reservations! The place was packed in minutes once the door was opened.
Amazing food. Great service.  Just wish they were open the first week of Jan for my birthday.  But I realize everyone is exhausted from Christmas.
A great spot all around.  Delicious food and friendly attentive service.  A unique and fun vibe.

Excellent food, location, and ambience. The squid ink pasta and rabbit pasta were incredible. The live jazz music was great, but only the front seating area is able to see the performers. Highly recommend!
A Seattle gem. Try the seafood in particular. Fresh fish and clams.
Fabulous restaurant with delicious food and great vibes.
Pleased and surprised - this restaurant has weathered COVID and it just as wonderful as it has always been.

This restaurant is ranked #1 in Seattle - and it didn't disappoint! The decor is eclectic and cool, the service was super friendly and welcoming, the cocktails and wine were great and the food was delicious! We would definitely go back and highly recommend!
The Pink Door never disappoints. Always looks great as go down the stairs and room to room, food always outstanding and delicious, and service friendly and warm. I return again and again.
Really good food, reservation was necessary otherwise it’s a long wait
Wonderful food and service as always. One dish didn't agree with my son's tummy, but all ended up OK. We love the lasagna, which originally brought us here. Still amazing!!

Great service, food and ambience. Booked a party of 8 6 weeks prior to date and was smooth process all the way to the date of event. Staff was on top of contacting me to ensure we were still attending with a large party.

Atmosphere, food, and service was great! Enjoyed my sister’s birthday dinner. Although the waiter did wish my sister a happy birthday, we did not receive any birthday dessert or offering. Not that we would expect anything for free, but the table next to us received a birthday dessert and was sung happy birthday. Overall a good experience though!

Delicious food as always. Our server was so lovely and round the answers to our wine questions. Friends had pasta, but my meal, the long bone, was DELECTABLE. Infused olive oil cannot be beat… drool all over the table.
The pink door is my go to whenever family or friends fly into town. Food and drinks never disappoint. I’m huge on customer service and every worker there gives the best. Love this place!!

Always wonderful! 
Service: top notch (call out -elyse is amazing), menu spectacular as always and such a beautiful space to enjoy a leisurely lunch with a bestie!

Thank you, please don't stop doing what y'all do!

I was able to book a lunch reservation at The Pink Door and loved every minute of it. My server was fantastic. She was super friendly and attentive and shared a lot of items on the menu that were her favorites. I ended up ordering fresh oysters that came with a tasty red peppercorn mignonette shaved ice. I then had the clams/mussels. The serving was very generous and the broth was out of this world. It came with a large piece of toasted bread for dipping and my server also brought me some additional bread as a back up. :)  It was a fantastic experience and I could have eaten there 3 to 4 times and still not have tried all of the dishes that I wanted to order. There is a reason The Pink Door is so popular!
Love the Pink Door! Great restaurant run by wonderful staff. Always a special experience. Thanks!
Everything was fantastic! It's a little pricey but the service, and atmosphere is so fun! The chocolate truffles were amazing!

I came here on a date night with my husband and loved our dinner here! The hostesses were very friendly and seated us right away at a table by the window with a gorgeous view. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive without being overbearing and the food was incredible! Oysters, charcuterie, arancini, lasagna, seafood and dessert! All were incredible! Make your reservation early and you’ll love it here!
Server was prompt friendly and kind. No complaints of any part of it.
Great ambience, good food, prompt service and   beautiful view
I go to the Pink Door a few times a year. The setting, food and service never disappoint.

I was disappointed that my guest's 80th birthday didn't warrant a cupcake with a candle.  Plus, I asked for a quiet spot because it's difficult for me to hear in a noisy restaurant. Yes, we were seated by a window but next to a very loud party of four. We should have asked for the table in a corner and skipped the view. But we were delighted with the ambience, the attentive service, and the food. Also loved that we were allowed to stay and talk as long as we wished.

All the staff were friendly and helpful during our lunch at the Pink Door.  Our server was particularly accommodating, sensing that we wanted more time before ordering. Food offerings were plentiful; both my friend and I were delighted with our choices. Everything was so lovely, from the table service to the food presentation! I expect I'll be visiting the Pink Door again very soon.

We had an amazing New Years Eve at The Pink Door!
The food was delicious, and the service and live music were outstanding!
What a fun way to ring in 2024! Definitely one to remember and hope to come back again soon.

My girlfriend and I have wanted to come to The Pink Door for a dinner night for some time now. Finally were able to make reservations for New Year's Eve to hear the live music and try the special 4-course meal. Simply put, the night was amazing and everything from the service as soon as we walked in to the mushroom risotto, it was all perfect. Thank you for making our start to 2024 the best possible!

Amazing atmosphere to drop down in to this cozy restaurant and enjoy the wonderful flavors. Very relaxed atmosphere. I understand they have acrobatics  on the weekend. We did not get to see. Service was right on! The rice cheese balls were fantastic and the mushroom pasta was delicious!!
Lunch at the Pink Door was absolutely delicious. 💕  The restaurant is beautiful and the food is excellent.  We had a wonderful time and will definitely be back again soon!
Great service, knowledgeable waiter, accommodating chef, all around great time

It was perfect from start to finish! The service, ambience, food, experience exceeded all expectations. I knew it would be good based on reviews and recommendations but WOW! This was the best meal/dining experience.
Wonderful food and music. Amazing service. Thank you.

Brought my lady in for her bday. We'd been trying to get into this place for quite some time. Was worth it. The wait staff was great! The ambience is perfectly romantic, but not mushy. Grown and sexy, without a doubt. Smooth jazz playing on that night. Both the front area, bar and back room, all offer thwir unique views and vibe. Ryan, our server, was exceptional! In a city filled with blah, nonchalant, dead eyed service, this place stands out. THANK YOU for making us feel like you wanted and appreciated us being there!

Had a great table at the window with a terrific view.
The food and service were wonderful.
A great evening!

I ordered the Paglia e fieno and it was delicious. Also the portion size was perfect, not too big, not too small, perfect amount of food. Our waitress was very attentive, helpful, and quick. The snowglobe spritz was also very tasty and refreshing. Can’t wait to come back here again!
Perfect dining experience. Highly recommend to anyone.

Loved dining at the place
Great ambience
Great server
Food is amazing
Fun environment. Food was good, but wasn't worth the hype. If anything, the cocktails and mocktails were the best part of the lunch.
Excellent food and superior service!  A wonderful place to enjoy the best Seattle has to offer.

Overall my party of four was underwhelmed by our experience. The place is beautiful for sure. We were seated close to a window view of the water which is impressive as is the rest of the decor of the restaurant. However we felt our service was sporadic and less than expected. I had to go find our waitress 3 times for forgotten items and our check. It felt as if we were forgotten by the end of the dinner. Maybe our waitress had too many tables but our area was almost empty when we left. The food quality varied from good to so-so. We were informed the fish of the day was nixed due to the fisherman not being able to fish due to rough seas. I worked in the fishing industry and this seems like a made up excuse. Besides, your restaurant is next door to a major fish market! Also your website does not emphasize the need to be in the lounge to enjoy the entertainment when booking the reservation. This was not an issue for our visit since we had to dine early to make a different performance but I would have been disappointed if I had expected to experience this and been placed in the wrong area. Improve your website to inform your guests better ahead of time otherwise it seems deceptive. I will probably not dine here again due to all of these issues. Overall, disappointed.
Got crostini, crudo and lasagna.  All were just okay.  The space is pretty.  I guess that's why it's hyped.  But flavor-wise, truly nothing special.

Noise level was fine.
Excellent service.
Excellent food.
We had a wonderful time!
Nice staff. Good food good. Good ambiance. Overall good experience that met our expectstions.

The food is quite delicious, the staff very attentive, and the ambience is fab. I also really liked their online place-saving offering. Super helpful!!! It helped us get a seat when they were fully booked!
I just wish they had the allergies listed on their menu though, as I felt like we were putting their staff on the spot with gluten and lactose questions. They seemed a bit lax with their answers, and I feel it would be much better for EVERYONE if the restaurant spelt out clearly what was what ON the menu!!! Please!!!
We couldn't enjoy the dinner we wanted because we ran out of fish at only 8:00 PM, unbelievable.

I absolutely love this place. We had a beautiful view out the window over the market and at the beautifully lit wheel.
The food was incredible the tuna for appetizer, the beef cheek, risotto, and Dungeness crab Caesar for dinner… Truly remarkable as usual. This is one of my favorite restaurants in the world.
Great food and ambiance as always. Garlic bread with olive oil was wonderful as were the meatballs.
Delicious! Amazing meal, so accommodating to our 4 kids. I just wish we dined during a performance. Next time!

It was our first time visiting Pink Door as it can be hard to get reservations but the food was amazing! Service was great as well. We came on time for our reservation and had to wait ~10mins to sit at our table which is fine. We got our food pretty fast after ordering, and they did acknowledge my request of having a table with a view. Just FYI the tables they have by the windows are 2 seaters. Overall we enjoyed our visit and will definitely come back with some friends if we are able to get another reservation
Phenomenal food, superb service, delightful destination. An experience that must not be missed when visiting Seattle.

We enjoyed the clam and mussels in white wine sauce. Dipping the toasted garlic bread in that sauce is heavenly. The risotto with beef could be a bit more favor. It's not bland, but lacking the punch you expect from the dish. Overall, the food is good but not exceptional. The service was excellent and the ambience was great.
Provide more vegan options or provide flexible menu that can be cooked without meat. Very disappointed with the lack of vegan options.
Fabulous food, outstanding atmosphere, excellent service, one of the greatest restaurants in Seattle!
Excellent meal. Excellent service. No where else I wanted to be for my birthday.
Great experience for a holiday lunch. My husband and I enjoyed the food and great service.
It’s really nice. They allow us to change seating from coach to dining room, and assign a really great seat for us. Besides, the food is amazing. Really like its chipino and lasagna
It was great. Good food but service was mediocre.
Lovely lunch celebrating the holidays! Mentioned this to many after a great experience!

Not sure if it was the guests next to me or the server that bumped the table next to me, but I had hot candle wax spilled all over my pants and shirt. This was my first time dining here and I am not pleased with my experience. This incident ruined the rest of the time I was here. The servers just offered how to get the wax off my clothing, but never asked if I was okay or if I needed anything. Still paid full price for my meal which I’m thinking now if wax had gotten into my food. Not motivated to come back.

The Pink Door has been one of the best restaurants in Seattle for many years and it hasn't slipped a bit.  Special thanks to the hostess, Belle for the help with our reservation.  She really went above and beyond for us during this Holiday season!

Happy Holiday's!

I have to start by saying that the overall experience was great. And has been great coming back to this beautiful gem in Seattle.

The place ambiance is unique. The food and the staff are amazing. My only feedback is to the host/hostess team, every time I have been to the Pink Door, I have never been treated well. Not even a reply to a “hello” or “good afternoon”.

I have to say that this is only specific to that area of the restaurant. The rest of the team is amazing, helpful, polite.

Our family always gathers at the Pink Door for special occasions. We love the Pink door lasagna and a few people always order that. We have enjoyed their lamb entree and many of us also love the  Prawns and anchovy squid noodles. Their oysters are also delicious.

We made our visit to The Pink Door part of our annual Christmas dinner out - we’ve loved the food every time we’ve eaten there. The interior is very nice and we had a comfortable table in the back that wasn’t crowded. My only comment would be that the individual opening and initially serving our wine was so serious that he came across as unfriendly. Our waitress was nimble and took good care of us but I felt her friendliness was forced but get it - she’s extremely busy and the holidays must be tough in the restaurant business.
Our server was terrific and all the support staff friendly and on point! Thank you and happy holidays!
Food and service were spectacular. Loved the music, but it was a bit loud.
Food had too much salt but they had a good variety of dishes. For the portion and quality, it seemed slightly overpriced.
Great show!  Great food!  Great drinks!  Great server!  Great table!  Great temperature of the restaurant!  Such an enjoyable time - thanks again!

My boyfriend and I fortunately got a last min reservation our last night in Seattle and we can easily say it was the perfect way to end our Seattle trip. The Pink Door excelled in service and the food & drinks were both outstanding. Service was very attentive and the restaurant ambiance was intimate and even had a live performance to enjoy. Really recommend coming here if you get a chance.
We had such a wonderful experience at the Pink Door! We weee seated by the windows so you can see the water and the food was delicious.
Fabulous as always.  Only complaint is that it is not easy to get reservations because it is so popular!

I love this place. It's tough to get a reservation but well-worth the effort. It's literally the main reason I come to visit Seattle. My only comment would be that service is spotty - especially if you are a party of 1. This has been consistent over a number of visits or I wouldn't mention it here. Nonetheless, the excellent food and ambiance always make up for being somewhat ignored.

A night out for my hubby's birthday. The ambiance was perfect, the food delicious, our server was friendly.  Not only did he recommended entrees to try but offered a list of nightlife places for two out-of-towners.
Always love eating at the Pink Door!  Favorite restaurant in Seattle!0
Good food. In general a good experience. Highly recommend to come.
Amazing ambience, service, and food! Highly recommend
Great food - great service - looking forward to going there again sometime soon.

Amazing food. Enjoyed our antipasta start with crostini and aperol spritz. 

Main course was amazing with pappardelle and risotto and a bottle of Chianti. 

Loved the eggnog with brandy to finish the night off and keep things festive for the holidays.
Four girfriends enjoyed an excellent meal and service.  Hats off to the busy front and back of the house.  We'll come again.
Lovely live music and delicious foood! waiting time worth it!!!
The food was phenomenal and we had a wonderful time!!
As always, just perfect and lovely. Tasty food, fun atmosphere and great service.
Always love going to the pink door What a treat for a special occasion or just any ole occasion

Our team holiday lunch was an excellent experience! The beautiful room facing Pike Place felt warm and inviting, with lots of natural light. The food was excellent, especially the bread and pastas. Everyone was very satisfied with their meal – thank you for a great experience!

I always find my experience at The Pink Door to be outstanding.  Courteous, attentive service; fresh, quality seafood dishes are well executed; salads beautiful composed with excellent seasonal offerings; and a very good but limited pasta offerings.  Appreciate the excellent daily fish specials.  A vibrant energy fills the dining rooms, the atmosphere relaxed and most tables spaced to enjoy conversation and privacy.  Portions seemed on the smaller side this visit but you can’t beat the value of this establishment.

Such a great Seattle spot for lunch/dinner. Whether it's outside on the deck in summer or inside, where the dining areas are all beautiful (and many with a view of the water). But where The Pink Door excels is its top notch staff -- have never been disappointed, they are the best! Enjoyed a fun gathering of five for an annual holiday lunch. Bravo to The Pink Door on keeping it real!
Always an enjoyable experience.  Quality of food and service excellent and consistent.
The magic of the Pink Door for all special occasions!
Our first time, and we read reviews on line and we wanted to try a good restaurant. It didn’t disappoint and our server Krista was very nice and knowledgeable of what the Restaurant have to offer.
Excellent experience here, the food was wonderful, the atmosphere was amazing and the service was wonderful. Not disappointed at all and we will be going there again.
We love the Pink Door.  Always amazing people and amazing food!  Thank you for always delivering a fantastic experience.
The pink door was such a nice experience. We went here for our anniversary & it didn’t disappoint. The ambiance is one of a kind. Loved it!
Never disappointed, always delicious!  Every Seattle visit includes a meal at the Pink Door. This time I had a carmelized onion risotto that was incredible.
We loved it. It’s always so special dining at Pink Door. Our server was amazing!
Beautiful, iconic restaurant with excellent service and amazing food.
Great experience. First time here and will definitely be back. Food was amazing and the restaurant is beautiful.
Service was fantastic. The lasagna is the best. Will definitely come back
Excellent food! Great drink menu! It’s a must for a pike place visit
so so good the risotto was so amazing and the servers was really sweet too
Had a lovely early afternoon lunch. If anything the food was even better than I’d remembered including one of the best Caesar salads I have ever had.

Greta has been a server there for 17 years. I went in there once for the first time a year ago and I was lucky enough to have her again on my most recent second visit. She suggested the very best highlights of the menu and was even able to have them recreate an amazing off-menu squid ink pasta and prawn Calabrian chili dish that I got my very first time in. It was delightful because I had been thinking about that dish ever since that first time I had it a year ago.

If you’re ever in Seattle, make sure you get a reservation for The Pink Door. It’s beyond excellent in every way. Every bite of everything we ordered was exquisite. From the scallops, to the affogato dessert, and every appetizer we had in between. This place is fabulous.
This is the best place from Seattle. I just love it love the lasagna, the service, the vibe. The wine! Everything!!!!!
Everything was awesome! Thank you so much! ❤️❤️❤️❤️

Service and food quality sadly disappointing and surprisingly lacking. Caesar salad was soggy, barely any crab despite adding to salad, and no lemon wedges provided for oysters. Had to wait 10 minutes before our server would attend to us despite attempts to get his attention. Table service and food quality not what I have been able to count on for many years.
The food was delicious. The staff was so nice and friendly. Highly recommend this place.
The food was excellent as well as the server.  It was a very positive experience overall.
We all ordered different dishes and all 4 were fabulous. The view was beautiful and we had a great meal. Will definitely return when we come back to Seattle.
We love Pink Door and make it our first stop when we’re in Seattle. The food is great, service is fantastic and the setting is beautiful.
Sometimes popular tourist spots are a letdown but this one was NOT! The ambiance, view, service and food were impeccable. I will come back  again for sure and would highly recommend
We visit the Pink Door every time  we visit Seattle.  Delicious food, great service,  wonderful wine list, A+ location and ambiance.

The dessert was the best part of the meal.  We also had drinks, antipasto and lunch entrees.  I did like that I didn’t feel too full after indulging but the food was okay and overpriced.  The service and ambiance were great.  We didn’t feel rushed to leave even though we spent 3 hrs for lunch while catching up with old friends.  I would recommend but keep expectations low for the flavor and cost.

We loved the food.  We really appreciated being seated near the window for our anniversary.  The service was excellent and our server explained the items on the menu very well.  I could tell that the guests at the other tables were being treated well too.  I originally tipped about 30% but when the time came for me to sign the check, I added some cash.  Everything was that good!
Fantastic service and great food thank you! Will come back again

We were a group of girlfriends taking a day to enjoy our city and celebrate the holiday together. Capping off the day at The Pink Door was the perfect way to end our celebration - the ambiance, our server, the food, perfection!!
Always lovely, and especially so during the holidays!
Great birthday lunch stepping out of the rain . Food, service and view were top notch. Great experience, all the way around .
The food was delicious, the service mediocre. Risotto and grilled cheese/soup on point
this food was so great! The server was alright, but the food made up for everything. I would definitely go back.

We enjoyed our time. Our server was nice - I asked about the calm cool and collected cocktail which was on the menu on the website and was told no that’s not available. I would have liked her to check with the bartender or offer something similar but I was directed back to the seasonal cocktail menu. Understood why but it was strange to be told no without checking. The hostess was having an off night  - I know it’s high volume but she was a bit snippy with us and other guests and we saw her rolling her eyes walking back from seating someone. We had a reservation but got the table right in the walkway. We asked if there were other options but there were none. It’s high volume so it makes sense but it drew from the experience a little being in the entrance walkway. Chicken and mustard dish was stunning!!!!
Really great! Scallops in sun dried tomato sauce were delicious!

Been waiting to try this place every time visited Seattle, but we finally booked the table and we were enjoyed all the food we ordered. The seafood are fresh daily and our server was amazing friendly.

third time here. requested a booth when making our reservation, and we were seated in a nice corner booth near the window. server was great, the best we’ve had here, unfortunately didn’t get her name. arancini was fantastic as usual, along with our caesar with prawns. i got the chicken dish (cant remember name) with potatoes and green beans and it was really good, but nothing special. partner got the scallops (fish of the day) and they were amazing. i had the mistletoe cocktail and it was a nice sipper. partner got the pomegranate martini and luna rossa(?), both great but the second was def the winner. also got a half bottle of wine. total came out to 198 before tip. all in all great time can’t wait to come back
The Pink Door never disappoint ! The good is always delicious ,the service always on point and the vibes  in the space are simply magical.
This was our first time visiting The Pink Door - and we were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and energy level in the restaurant. Highly recommended
Fabulous meal, excellent service and wonderful table right by the window. Our expectations were definitely exceeded!!!

Embark on a culinary journey at The Pink Door in Seattle, where the dining experience reaches new heights. The Bolognese dish, a true masterpiece, captivates the senses with its rich, slow-cooked meat sauce that flawlessly intertwines with al dente pasta. This dish is a symphony of flavors, a testament to the restaurant's unwavering dedication to delivering an authentic and unforgettable Italian dining experience.
Absolutely amazing experience. The food was delicious and the ambiance was amazing.

Utensils and cups were dirty with lipstick stain on cup and cheese on fork. When we requested new ones the waitress took offence and had a bad attitude the rest of the meal. Unsanitary and poor service.
Excellent dining experience. Great views, attentive staff and delicious food. A bit pricey but worth it!

The food was absolutely amazing I got a swordfish special and I was worried it would be dry but was the opposite it was very flavorful and moist. They also had great drinks including a pomegranate martini and a pink door mocktail both were superb, I highly recommend the grilled garlic bread. The vibes and service were immaculate!
We had a great experience at this restaurant and will be back! The food was great and the service was excellent!
Enjoyable dinner to celebrate a couple of birthdays. Pleasant and enjoyable service. Appreciated not being aggressively upsold on drinks and beverages.

We were very early for our reservation (almost an hour!) and asked if we could be seated anyway, expecting to be turned away. The staff went above and beyond to set up a table for 5 in the dining area with a view. It turned out to be a lovely lunch!
The food and service was excellent but it was very noisy.

Our renewed favorite:  we hadn't been since before COVID and happily The Pink Door survived and is thriving and has maintained their excellence and professionalism.  Real menus, outstanding service, and incredible food -- all for a better value than many fine dining establishments.  If only it were easier to get in especially for the entertainment!
So fun to be back at the Pink Door. Food was wonderful but the service was Superb. Such a beautiful space and everything so lovely and comforting.
Phenomenal. Exceeded expectations. Great food and service. Good vibe and night. 👍
The perfect service and Seattle old world ambiance combined with absolutely delicious Italian dishes made for the best night to celebrate!  Such a Seattle treasure!
We love visiting the Pink Door. It's lively, so cozy in the winter and love the patio in the warmer months, and the food is always delicious.
Always a must for any special occasion! The BEST in the city

I go to this restaurant once a month and used to love it. The lasagna portion is getting smaller each time, which is disappointing for a $24 protein free lasagna. I had lunch a week ago and the tables didn’t even have a paper or table cloth anymore. Food and service are good but I wish the ambience would match the prices.

Excellent overall service was personal and attentive and food delicious! 
Our waitress was very helpful pleasant and the service was great! 
The ambience interesting and the overall effect was charming ! 
We have been there several times always a treat!

What a delightful lunch! Great service, excellent food. First the antipasto plate was perfectly executed, superb blanched green beans especially, and the Prosecco by the glass was fine. My Hawaiian fish was good but nothing like black cod which the waitress said, more like halibut. My wife had a hamburger, I think, very good.  Had not been in many years but will return soon!

The squid ink pasta and cioppino was excellent.  The bagno caldo with raw vegetables was not good, but we told the waiter who graciously comped it.  The atmosphere was great and service was impeccable.  Love this place.
Took my girlfriend here for our anniversary. The server immediately congratulated us. They were very educated on the food and provided excellent service and recommendations

Having stood the test of time for over four decades, this restaurant boasts an impressive 42-year history, ensuring a rich dining experience steeped in tradition. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance of elegance and comfort, complementing its prime location. An intriguing aspect is their selection of off-menu items, which adds an exclusive touch to the dining experience. Overall, it's a remarkable establishment that consistently delivers quality and sophistication.
The food was incredible the bread on the appetizer menu was so good. Everyone was very kind and helpful. The ambience was lovely. Get the lasagna :D

I took my husband out for a late lunch for his birthday, and our server was Krista. We had the best experience, and Krista was a fantastic server and host of the pink door! I cannot recommend this place enough and it is always so fun to be a tourist in your own city. Five stars, no notes!
The food was amazing and our waitress was outstanding. I'd definitely eat here again.
Excellent experience. Great for business meetings
Love the food and the quality is amazing. Love the service as well. Everything was perfect

Truly a blessing that we got a reservation on a Saturday night! I've been coming here for 30++ years, it is consistently magical & delicious, but harder to get a reservation these days, since the word is out!  Eric our server was excellent, on top of everything. The Caesar salad is perfection and I used to make them at tableside, I know a good ceaser, definitely one of the best I've had in Seattle!  Missed out on the dessert, we ran out of time...  Hopefully next time!  Love you Pink Door, thank you!

Was such a cool experience. A must eat in Seattle. We went to some of the Pike Place restaurants and this is by far the best. Cool secret entrance type place with a vibey but classy amibience and critically, incredible food.
Trendy place, yet they continue to live up to their reputation... Excellent food and service...

My partner’s parents who are visiting from Chicago for Thanksgiving’s always wanted to dine at Pink Door, so I made a reservation for six people a month ahead to secure our spots.  We had a lovely lunch.  Foods, ambience, service were all excellent.  They really liked the way the restaurant was tucked in the alley, and they felt they were going into a rabbit hole.  The whole experience was lovely.
This was such an amazing date night experience. The food was absolutely fantastic. We will come back the next time we visit Seattle!

The Pink Door has unique & charming ambiance, excellent food, and Cecile, our server, was helpful with questions and there when we needed her. We had the  broccolini- charred deliciousness, Caesar salad-crip, not overdressed; & oysters- surprisingly bright & tasty, for the table. Our mains were grilled lamb, juicy, perfectly done; cioppino, packed with seafood, slightly spicy; and pasta with meatballs, loved the sauce & pasta, but meatballs were kind of bland. Bread was comped and an excellent bottle of wine, made it a perfect occasion with 4 satisfied guests.
Alway a favorite, delicious food, professional staff. We come every time we're in Seattle.

First time going there. We went for my birthday and we loved it! Our waitress was very knowledgeable and seemed to really love her job. She took care of us very well. The food was amazing, the desert, the ambiance, everything was better than I had hoped. Super cool to see a whole restaurant behind a small pink door!

The Pink Door lived up to their reputation as the best restaurant in Seattle. The service was fabulous and the food exceeded expectations.
We loved everything!

Our highly anticipated visit to The Pink Door exceeded expectations. The venue is fabulous, the food was delicious and the service very welcoming and wonderful. An incredible and memorable dining experience. We can't wait to return!

Wonderful hosts and ambiance. Interesting restaurant - very fun.  The halibut and linguine and clams were excellent.  Weakest link was the appetizers. Oysters tasted like sea water - not in a good way. Ahi crudo unfortunately had some white muscly pieces - ahi should melt in your mouth and not be chewy; other ingredients saved the dish. Server was nice. We would eat here again.
5 star service! Great food and an old but charming building.

Cute overall.
Menu covers the basics. 
If you are booking a table and hope to watch the live show, make sure to let them know. Front room is where the sows are. The back room has a nice view of the sound.
Our server Stephanie was fantastic. She was nice, very professional and informative. Thank you, Stephanie for taking good care of us and making our experience at The Pink Door a pleasant one.
Amazing food! Amazing ambiance! Amazing service! The best place to enjoy!
We enjoyed the food and the Saturday night event!
Delicious!! Great service! Wonderful drinks!! Bolognese was amazing!!

The Pink Door is my favorite restaurant in Seattle so far. Granted, I live in the East Side and don’t get into the city nearly enough, but it’s a treat to go to this restaurant for special occasions. The food is phenomenal, service genuinely friendly and impeccable, and the ambience/locale is as quirky, tasteful, and fun as Seattle gets in my book. Much love for this restaurant!
This has always been a favorite.  awesome restaurant
Delicious food, excellent service, cozy waterfront atmosphere. Definitely make a reservation.

Good atmosphere and service. More veggie options always appreciated.

Mushroom pasta was a bit too salty.

I’ve been to the Pink Door several times and this was not my favorite visit. I have been times when the food was amazing - this time it was okay. I should probably have stuck to Pink Door specialities, like the lasagna, but I ordered the special (braised beef cheeks with risotto) and it was underwhelming. The server was delightful, the restaurant was busy and noisy, and our 4 top was out in the middle of the room which lead to a less than perfect experience for conversation, etc.

Great atmosphere, wonderful food, and beautiful sea views! Service was fine … Wait staff could learn a few tips on how to be more personable, genuine, and friendly. I almost felt, at times, as if we were imposing.
Everything was exquisite - from the front door, the service staff and the food. Everyone should experience this cuisine. It was all crafted to perfection.
Love everything about this restaurant! The food and atmosphere was amazing. The restaurant was so cute and service was great! It was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend. ❤️
Loved it. Always have the best experience. Hope to go back on our next visit.
As always, everything was excellent!  It will not disappoint!  We had a fun evening with great food & service!
Great atmosphere, beautiful view, excellent service and exceptional food!

I am the fifth time to go to the pink door, I like the food and feel here. Only the first time the serviced is too rudely and no any help for me to order food, the other four times is very good. Of course, I haven’t see the first services lady again.
The food was delicious (caesar and pappardelle). Service was professional and friendly. It’s such a unique place. Highly recommended.

A wonderful dining experience. The staff are very attentive. This is fine dining in a more casual atmosphere. The food is exceptional. It's easy to understand why this is one of the top-rated restaurants in Seattle.
Best place ever!!! Food, service and ambiance top notch.
It was a fairytale as I got to know my friend better. Also we got the best spot to sit because the sunshine on her face was making it glow so y’all clutched up
Hadn’t been to the Pink Door in years… it was as lovely as I remembered and looking forward to a return. Great food, excellent service, and a beautiful setting.

When they led me to my table,  it rocked. I was looking for my server, maybe 5 seconds when a someone came over,read my mind, opened a drawer and put a stabilizer under the leg. I had said nothing.  Service only got better from there. I never waited or wanted for anything. My dinner was perfection
The place is extremely over hyped and over rated. The food was not good, the hostess didn’t greet anyone, only asked how many in the party. Also, very small menu. Never again, would not recommend.

We thoroughly enjoyed every bite of the four dishes we ordered: antipasti plate; cioppino; lasagna; and broccolini. Received great service from Greta. Try to get a table in the back dining room for wonderful views.
Fabulous every time.  Good food,  good atmosphere.
Always excellent and we get our favorite table most of the time!
Great venue, service and food for a birthday dinner as a couple.
Great spot for a date or to take someone from out of town! We try to go a few times a year, I love their bolognese.
Pink Door never disappoints 🌺 Our go to spot for celebrations.
Good birthday dates. Make sure you book reservations for a night with live entertainment.
The lasagna is not to be missed.  Great service and atmosphere whether you are in the dining room or the lounge with the live band.  Always on our Seattle itinerary.
Great experience! Quality everywhere through the roof, appreciated the attentive but none overbearing service on a special occasion. Loved the food, will be back!
As always, just the best!  And that room is magical as the sun goes down!
We stopped in for drinks & an antipasto plate to share. Great hospitality & setting. The food was good & drinks were too. Overall a great experience.
Food and service is always stellar. Elyse is our absolute favorite waitress. We always look forward to seeing her.

Always an amazing culinary experience at the Pink Door when visiting Seattle.  There is always a line to get in before it even opens which is a clue to how wonderful this restaurant is in every way.  Food, service, ambience spectacular
We’ve been coming to the Pink Door since ‘81, and have never had a bad experience.  This time was no exception.  All aspects were absolutely amazing!
We had an attentive waiter who didn’t hover, delicious dinner, and good friends-could not have been better. It was a little loud, but we probably contributed to the noise level ourselves.
Fantastic food - phenomenal service!  Can’t say enough positive comments about Pink Door.
Worth coming back a second time with a reservation.
Another incredible experience at The Pink Door.  The food is still top notch and always seasonally fresh!  Great service, too.
Went for my grandsons 10 year old birthday and had a fabulous experience! Excellent food, fabulous service, lovely ambience!

Our server really rushed us the entire time. We only were there for an hour and we both felt like she wanted us to pay the check and leave. I’ve been to this restaurant many times before and never felt this sort of pressure.
Great food, service & view!  Highly recommend to all but plan ahead and make reservations well in advance as its super popular.

My entree selection, autumn risotto, seemed to be a mashed vegetable with diced pumpkin and, I was told, roasted radicchio which looked like burned mushrooms and tasted so bitter that I had that bitter taste lingering in my mouth for the rest of the evening. I am Italian and my expectation was a dish of rice with autumn vegetables. I saw no rice. The server was kind and subtracted the entree from the total bill.

When we went to check in for our reservation for my birthday dinner somehow I had put in the wrong date and the staff still seated us with a smile on their faces it made me cry. I thought we would be out of luck but they made our night more than special. We will be back on our next visit to Seattle. Thumbs up to The Pink Door .
Great food and awesome service! I would come back again!

An excellent restaurant. The meal was perfect from start to finish. The server and other staff were very attentive and had wonderful sense of the next need as a diner. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone and be prepared to make a reservation as soon as possible!
Room with a view of Elliott Bay!  Service was outstanding!   Drinks awesome!  Food fab!
Classic Italian food in a great atmosphere.  Service is professional and friendly.
Great food and wonderful service.  Definitely would go back.
A popular luncheon spot in the Market. Efficient and cordial service. Seasonal food was terrific.
Nice restaurant with nice views of the water. Food was ok and expensive.

Me and my Wife went here for our honeymoon and it was amazing. The restaurant is beautiful and all the staff was very nice and did great. It may be a tad bit more expensive than your average restaurant but their food is amazing for not a giant price tag. I recommend the Pink door for anyone looking for a special occasion or even just to treat yourself and maybe some friends!
Our waitress Christine was wonderful! I love the staff in costumes 😊🎃🎉for my Halloween birthday!
I believe the owner wears ‘pink’ pants. He manages the place perfectly, waiters/waitresses are friendly, and the food is just SUPERB!!!!

Server was inattentive and disinterested - didn’t check on us, never asked how our food was. The food is usually amazing, but this time the garlic bread was unusually dry and the BUCATINI ALL’ AMATRICIANA was really terrible. If the server had come back to check in and offered I would have gladly sent it back for a different tried and true dish. In the end she must have sensed I didn’t like it because when it came time to box up our food she said “do you even want this?” when she picked up my barely touched dish. Was also my friend’s birthday which we put in the reservation and that wasn’t even acknowledged until a passing remark as we were getting up to leave.

The food was very good, and the restaurant itself is really cute. The service was okay, I feel like everything just took a very, very long time. Worth a visit, but I don’t know if I would come back. I feel like the food is pretty expensive for the quality of service you’re getting.

We were fortunate enough to arrive in time to see the performer on the silks…what an incredible introduction to the restaurant!
The food was outstanding and the ambiance is warm and eclectic.
Our waiter was excellent.
Highly recommended.
We had the BEST TIME once again! The food and service is amazing. Can’t wait to return
The Pink Door never disappoints and has the best ambiance in Seattle.  Great food, decor, views, service, the whole package.
Absolutely incredible. Enjoyed this amazing restaurant, the ambiance and great service.
As always the service and food excellent! It’s an official visit when come from Puerto Rico to Washington.
A little overpriced and somewhat loud but enjoyed the food and the ambiance, service was terrific, would definitely eat here again.

Loved our visit. I was going to get a spot next to the entertainment but alas I must have booked the wrong seating area.
Nevertheless the entire place has a great ambience.
A little loud since there is nowhere for the sound to go, but tolerable for my sensitive ears.

Food is really good, I did need to add some salt.

My partner has celiac disease (can't have gluten at all, not even something that touched gluten).
The server was knowledgeable both about celiac (didn't need to be explained) as well as extremely familiar with the menu items and what they contain.

I've been to other restaurants in Seattle in the same price range and the whole experience at Pink Door was much better.
The service and ambience was phenomena! Probably some of the best lasagna I've ever had.
Service was excellent. Food delicious!  We were seated at the bottom section where the view is great and airy lighted space!
It was a feast for all the senses!  Lasagna and clam linguini were wonderful, bagna cauda was amazing.  Had a reading after dinner with Kince that was a perfect end to the evening.  Highly recommend
First time I've eaten at The Pink Door in over 30 years and it was even better than I remember.
The food was amazingggggg! The service is impeccable. Will definitely come back before going back home
Pink Door is always a good choice. Have eaten here multiple times. Everyone I bring loves it. The food and service is always on point.
Truly enjoyable time. Great view and food. Wonderful service.

My girlfriend and I LOVE The Pink Door! We always come here every time we visit Seattle. This occasion happened to be for our 5-year anniversary. The hosts were so great, and they seated us at a nicely elevated table with a romantic candelabra. We were also lucky enough to see the aerialist performances during our meal, which made it even more exciting!

I cannot forget to mention the food. We had a nice Caesar salad, with the fish of the day (halibut filet and butternut squash purée on a bed of vegetables), the vegetable lasagna (to die for), and a side of grilled broccolini (extra charred but still soft enough to perfection). We cleaned our plates with great satisfaction and did not feel overly stuffed at the end.

Everything was absolutely perfect, and our date night was one that we will remember for the rest of our lives!

The pink door is a historic restaurant with gorgeous views of Elliot Bay which surrounds you with a classically decorated restaurant fit for a nice cozy meal of delicious food!!! I strongly suggest ordering the pumpkin bread pudding…OMG 🤯one of the best  desserts I’ve had this year!!!

It was our first time in a long time to have dinner at Pink Door. Love the new space-and Eric our server was the best. The food is very good- not over seasoned- salad dressed just right. We had oysters, the burrata, cioppino, a pasta and the green salad. Too full for dessert, my husband had a cappuccino that was excellent.

Overall, the food was good- the service and atmosphere were excellent.

Great evening at Pink Door! We were seated immediately & our server was exceptional. He checked on us regularly & made sure we knew when the show was happening in back dining area so we could go watch. Super fun atmosphere.
Food was all really good too. Our groups shared Caesar salads, bucatini, rigatoni, clams & mussels and the spicy sausage with polenta. Our favorite was the bucatini! Very reasonable pricing.
Fun, iconic Seattle dinner spot!
This experience was awesome. Food was delicious and Quick!

The Pink Door never disappoints.  There is a reason reservations get booked immediately!  We came in for a late lunch/dinner and has great food from beginning to end.  Our server was fantastic! I’ve probably been coming here for over 15 years at least. And I don’t even live in Seattle but whenever I come up, I always come to The pink Door.  There’s something about the ambience of the restaurant, with a little bit quirkiness.

The Pink Door is amazing.  I was in town for a large conference and talked it up to my friends.  We were able to get a last minute lunch reservation, and it did not disappoint.  We got appetizers, entrees, and dessert.  No one rushed us, and it was a 2 hour lunch!  The lasagna is their classic must order.  Someone got halibut that was PNW fresh.  Ciopppino was excellent.  Seasonal dessert of pumpkin bread pudding was also outstanding.  Even the guy who doesn’t like pumpkin said it was good.  If you’re heading to Seattle, this is a can’t miss, make a reservation 4 weeks in advance spot!
Great time with out of towners. Lovely place close to pike with a great view.

If you know you're coming to Pike Place Market and you want amazing food, BOOK NOW! Definitely worth it. We were sat by the window that had gorgeous view of the water, boats, and the sun setting. The pastas and cioppino were delicious. You can taste the quality and freshness of the ingredients. 100% worth it for any occassion.
Our server, Elise, was truly exceptional! The ambiance was superb! We had such a great time! I’m so glad we finally got reservations! Worth the wait! We’ll be back!
Absolutely delicious! Loved the atmosphere and food even more. Would definitely go every time I am in town.
Great service/friendly staff, good food, good natural light and view. Cool location and concept overall.
The autumn risotto was incredible, and the desserts absolutely divine.
My husband and I enjoyed our pasta and halibut. Both delicious and not over priced. No dessert but they sounded incredible. May go back today just to try the dessert! Wonderful service as well.

Wow and wow again.

Fun atmosphere, delicious food, and my server Carter really made the meal.

Her recommendations were perfect and despite how busy things were, she did a great job making sure I had everything I needed.

I’m looking forward to coming back.
Amazing view food and service. Couldn’t ask for more! Definitely a must in Seattle.

Fantastic experience start to finish. The meatballs are wonderful, Caesar salad was divine, and that autumn risotto with butternut squash was to live for. Their pumpkin bread pudding (and I don’t even like bread pudding) was killer. Such a beautiful establishment, service was on point (thanks Greta!) and food was absolutely worth the hype.
Amazing food , best service we had  all trip ryan m. Was our server super knowledgeable  and friendly
Halibut hazelnut special was one of the most tasteful, flavorful dishes I’ve had. And had to travel all the way from Boston to discover this not so hidden gem.

Excellent restaurant near Pike Place Market. The food was delicious and was high quality. Someone was always nearby to refill our water glasses. The waitress was extremely friendly and was always nearby to ask if we needed anything. Highly recommend to anyone who is looking for something unique.
Amazing food and atmosphere. The aerial show was amazing, would have liked to get a short video but I understand why they don’t want everyone’s phones out. Very glad we went
Phenomenal meal from start to finish ! Highly recommend the arancini and lasagna

Busy venue, excellent food. Was seated next to ocean view windows which was a plus. Everything was very reasonably priced and delicious. Would recommend and return next time we are in SEA. Perfect evening ❤️
Always outstanding! An exceptional dining experience every time!
Great ambiance, very good food and excellent service.  PD has lots of energy and as always a wonderful place to have a meal
Terrific location, lovely service and fantastic food

Our sever & food was awesome! The only complaint I have is I booked for standard seating assuming it wouldn’t have been front row seats of a dancer with her legs coming near our head & bright lights facing our table. She was a good dancer, but I would of preferred if the hostess asked if that table would have been okay.
Lasagna was great. The whole experience was wonderful. For a wonderful evening we highly recommend it.
Great place - must visit meal if you are in Seattle !

The quality, presentation and taste of the food was better than most places we’ve tried. We had the halibut, vegetarian lasagna and pappardelle pasta. Portions are small but definitely delicious and full of flavor. You must have the herbed fries, they’re sinfully good. A hidden gem inside an alley. Look for a peach door and enter the staircase to the check in area.
Wonderful birthday lunch! Surprised by our view of the water and the wheel. Food was delicious.. we were even 15 minutes late for our reservation and they were very accommodating.
The food and service is wonderful.  Definitely recommend the lasagna and the branzino.  Right near the market.  Great Seattle experience.
Absolutely fabulous! We were in Seattle for few days and could only get 11:30 am reservations. It was soo great. Food was amazing..wine delicious service great.

Amazing food
Amazing service 
Amazing place
Amazing
Everything was amazing at this restaurant! From the apps (rice balls and antipasto plate), meals (Bolognese, chicken, seafood bowl, and halibut) were superb!

the food was wonderful. Beet salad, fab, big serving, sharable. 
Wild mushroom pasta and lasagna were very nice and the roasted butternut risotto was wonderful as well.
Pink door pin was a bit on the pricy side for a souvenir ($20 PLUS tax). Our server Pasha was lovely, the food was nice and the view was enjoyable.
Great Italian food! Server very friendly and attentive
Fantastic food and service. Excellent cocktails.  Do not skip dessert!
Lovely food, lovely setting! A fun Seattle experience

I've lived in Seattle for 9 years and have never before visited this iconic restaurant. I'm so happy I finally did. The service, food, and ambiance were great. We sat in the dining room next to the window so it was lovely and great view. By the time we left at about 7:30 the bar area was packed and there was a live "torch singer" type french cabaret happening. Next time I'll sit and the bar for that experience. It was very cool.

Yummy fresh halibut!! Creative presentation and good mix of flavors.
Wine list a little pricey.

Not at all what I expected. Ordered the lasagna, lemonade, and caramel pumpkin bread pudding. It came extremely fast. Almost as if everything is already prepared. The flavor was very dull, and bland. Dont waste your money
Amazing food as usual, the views spectacular, and the service top notch!
We had an amazing experience at The Pink Door. We had 9pm reservations on a Wednesday, so lovely live  jazz music was playing by a trio. The food was all absolutely delicious.
Waitress was great and overall experience was very enjoyable.

I brought my out of town boyfriend here for his birthday, it was an amazing experience. I was so happy that we were able to get a table by the window, the view was so beautiful. The food was delicious, a meal together is our favorite thing. Thank you pink door for making it special. <3
Wonderful food and service. Lasagna was to die for.
One of my very favorite restaurants in Seattle. Beautiful room with fabulous view!

Food and ambiance were fantastic. Didn’t care for the waitress tbh. She clearly treated me different as a solo diner than the other tables around me, barely speaking to me while carrying on whole conversations with other tables which sucks when you’re spending as much if not more as everyone else. everyone should be treated the same. She also tossed my pasta leftovers then acted like I was crazy for asking why she threw away 1/2 my food. Mgr replaced the pasta which I appreciate but found it odd when he said it’s policy to toss food rather than ask the customer if they want it to go. If there were 2 bites that would make sense but literally 1/2 of my $25 pasta was left lol the foods too good to be throwing it away imo would definitely go back but would make sure to specify at the beginning I want my leftovers
Best rib eye I have had! The meatballs were amazing highly recommend this restaurant.

AMAZING!!! Everything about tonight was fantastic! We missed the day reservations opened, and we checked every day but couldn’t get one… so we showed up right when they opened to get on the waitlist. We had to wait a couple hours, but we were prepared and it was worth it!!!
The atmosphere was delightful, and the service was excellent. The lasagna was excellent. The warm pumpkin bread was one of the best desserts I have ever had… And I eat a lot of desserts!

This was my second time eating at The Pink Door. The tuna crudo was excellent, as was the risotto. I had the rolled fish in a butter cream sauce with potatoes and garlic green beans. There was almost no flavor at all in the fish or the sauce. It needed salt and pepper so badly. I was pretty disappointed especially because it was the "special". The pumpkin bread pudding was delicious, though! I'll definitely go back, but will probably stick to the pasta/risotto dishes.
Ashley was a lovely server & all our food was excellent. We had success coming on a Saturday afternoon with a reservation, by the time we walked out there were huge lines.
Best restaurant in seattle, and when the weather is nice, the patio is just like heaven. The best!

Vibe: 4/5
Drinks: 4/5
Appetizer: 4/5
Pasta: 3/5

It didn't really lift up to the hype. Will pass.
Fabulous as always! And our waiter Ryan was  excellent!

Everything about the Pink Door was incredible. The ambiance, the service, the food, and the location. We had early reservations and they were completely booked for the evening. Despite that we never felt rushed or that they were in a hurry to get us to leave. Their marinara sauce is the best thing I have ever put in my mouth. Our waiter told us it was an old recipe and something made in house. I wish we could have seen or heard the entertainment, but our reservations were too early. It was an amazing experience and I’m so glad we went.
The food and scenery was outstanding! The server who served our table seemed disinterested and not very welcoming, but other staff members were great. Overall very enjoyable experience
Delicious, fun and vibrant! Only got a lunch reservation but can imagine how fun dinner would be. Definitely will be back 🤩
Food quality ok. Portions average. Service was poor too many tables for one waiter. Very disappointed with this restaurant I heard great things about it but not good my pasta was cold and no good.
By far the best Italian food we have ever had in Seattle. Amazing ambience and great service. Highly recommend.
Such a great atmosphere. All 4 of us enjoyed our entrees

It was great. The view was good, ambiance was nice, but there was no live performance on Thursday.
Also, limited vegetarian/vegan options.
The Pink Door is always great, favorite place to visit when in Seattle!
It was a wonderful time with my date. The service was exceptional and so was the food. There were a few very loud people for some reason but couldn’t ruin the great view and wonderful food.
The best dining experience our family has ever had! Seriously great food, service and ambiance!
Fabulous food, view and service. Will go back soon.
one of the loveliest places in seattle. will be coming back :)
Loved the food, the ambience, the views and everything about the pink door lasagna.
It was worth the hype. The lasagna was delicious and they make a great martini

Pink door is one of my friend’s favorites so once we knew she was coming to town, we made a reservation to celebrate two birthdays.  The receptionist was less than welcoming and didn’t smile or act like she gave a rip.   
We told our waitress it was a special occasion (two birthdays) when we were seated.  The two appetizers we got were yummy - fancy rice balls and 1/2 of an antipasto.  The main courses were good but nothing to rave about - we ordered the clams, the pasta with meatballs and the autumn risotto.  
The autumn risotto just tasted like Parmesan cheese.  I was hoping for more butternut squash flavor and nice chunks of squash.  Pretty much puréed.  We had to ask for a dessert menu and the waitress acted like we needed to finish up so the table could be cleared.  No lingering over a nice meal and visiting.   I was disappointed that there wasn’t any recognition of the birthdays other than a half hearted ‘Happy Birthday’.    We decided to skip dessert and leave.  
On our other visits to pink door we have had good service.

What a wonderful dining experience. Another reminder of why we travel from Kansas City to enjoy the Inn At The Market and The Pink Door, which is just a few steps away.  So many fine restaurants in a very close proximity.

A very delightful dining experience. The food and service were outstanding. You have to know how to find the restaurant. There is no marking on the restaurant on the street. It took us fifteen minutes to find it. I suspect this arrangement is done intentionally to give a speakeasy ambience.
The best food I think I have ever had! The clams and mussels were amazing and they somehow made the bread that came with it taste like a really good steak. 10/10

Went for lunch on a weekday. Quickly filled up. Great location and cool interior … much larger than it looks from the outside. I had the cioppino, which was excellent though not the best I ever had (Alioto’s in SF). Good wine selection, teas, coffees. I had a dessert wine I never had before. Waitress was very helpful. Need to go back for the live entertainment in the evening … and definitely will.
Fantastic food, fantastic service!  We will be back.

I came here during my birthday weekend and I loved every moment of dining here. The food and our server was amazing. Additionally, they had a beautiful aerial show, which happened to be right next to our table and we were able to talk to the performer afterwards. Every time I come to Seattle, I will eat here. 10/10 🩷

The experience is good. The food is just about average. I ordered their house antipasto and specifically asked for vegetarian, but it came with Tapanada that had anchovies. Their Arancini is good.
Main course was ok. I ordered their sausages and it was cooked nicely, but nothing to wow. Like I said go there for the experience, the live music, the aerial show, etc.

Every single food that we ordered taste so good. Our server was very knowledgeable and always on top on all of our requests and orders. I forgot his name but thank you so much for your excellent service last night. This is our first time here and Im glad I brought the whole family to celebrate with us. We ordered these foods/drinks:

2 Italian sodas (cherry/almond and almond)
Lemonade (this was so refreshing!)

Antipasto of the house-full (4 people shared this and 🤌🏼)

PINK DOOR CAESAR
The grilled chicken was so soft  🤤
LINGUINE ALLE  VONGOLE
 (baby clams w/ shell and pasta. I didnt try this because Im allergic to shellfish but my husband said this is 🤌🏼 too)
LASAGNA PINK DOOR
 ( I wanted to order 5 or this thats how good it is 🤌🏼🤌🏼🤌🏼🤌🏼🤌🏼)
PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE
My least favorite but still taste good. I think my taste buds are so overwhelmed by the time Ive tried this that why. 
CIOPPINO PINK DOOR
If you love seafood and shellfish, this is the best as per my husband and in-laws.

My 3-year-old son also had linguine and red sauce with meatball and their TUSCAN FRIES & FRIED HERBS 🤌🏼

🤤THE BEST DESSERT EVER🤤
TOASTED ALMOND FLAVORED MOCHA AFFOGATO!

We will for sure come back and will try other food on their menu. I wanted to try them all last night 😅🤤

Great place.  Super food.  Lovely service.
Looking forward to returning.
The Lasagna and cioppino were fantastic!! Oysters were so fresh and delicious! Loved the Ambience and great views of the sound.
Very cool venue with delicious food. The Cesar salad and lasagna were great.

Honestly, for the effort it took to get a table here, we expected a little bit more, but overall it was a good experience. The only issue we had, was a very spicy mixed drink, and our waitress did not let me know the drink would be spicy when I ordered it. I was more disappointed in missing the live entertainment that they are known for. The dishes were great. The drinks were okay.. but it felt more like any other nice restaurant we had been to. I wouldn't bother with the effort of staying up late and planning ahead to make another reservation. I think expectation just beat out reality on this one, but the food was delicious, so you can't ever be too upset with that 😁

Food and services fantastic. 
#1 place to eat in Seattle Washington .

I really appreciate the thoughtfulness that this restaurant has in giving a great experience. I scheduled a business meal here and it went exceptionally well all the was around in part because of the excellence service and delicious meals we received.
Staff couldn’t have been kinder or more accommodating!

Food was amazing! We had a booth in the back dining room facing the water - great location.
Our server was good but one of the busboys had a bit of a condescending attitude. The  busboy that served the water was amazing! Such a hard worker!
The decor is eclectic and interesting!
Food portions are small but it’s a nice place to visit

The Pink Door is outstanding! Alicia was incredible .

Thank you
It was my first time at the restaurant and I’ve been hearing about how amazing this place is. It did not disappoint! Everything was amazing from food to service. I highly recommend to anyone!
We were treated like royalty.  It was a perfect evening.

We had a fantastic time at the Pink Door for our 3rd year anniversary. Food was delicious, and possibly the best affogato that we’ve had in all of Seattle. The only nit with food was that there was quite a bit of sand in my linguine con vongole, which can certainly be improved. I was unable to try the cocktails due to having a cold, but I will definitely be back to try them out!
Excellent experience at The Pink Door last night.  Our server was fun and knowledgeable.  The cocktails, food, and wine were great.  We will make this a regular on future Seattle trips.
Great atmosphere and delicious food. I ended up seated next to a local at the bar and had the best conversation!

Lovely restaurant, from the lively energy and decor.
We shared the meatballs for apertures and they were delicious!
A little bit on the expensive side for the food but overall great place to visit!
Absolutely loved my dinner and the whole experience of Pink Door! Be sure to make a reservation!
Nice dinner and great service.  A bit pricey but the view and decor is lovely.

Amazing experience! Great quality food, stuff was super friendly and kind. Took my wife for or wedding anniversary. Requested a window seat on the spot, they promptly provided during even busy time. Recommend and will return again!
It was a good experience and great service but wait time to book the table can be reduced.
Loved the atmosphere and the drinks and food! We were visiting from Cincy!! Also, loved the view!!
Best meal and service in Seattle. Perfect atmosphere. Cannot recommend enough!
Had a delightful lunch, and were lucky enough to be seated outside on the patio on a gloriously sunny fall day (because today is le equinox)!
Awesome restaurant with wonderful ambiance, food and service. Truly an enjoyable evening!
Maybe people come for the entertainment because the food was just ok. Great outdoor patio but make sure you come for the show. The food isn’t anything to write home about.
Bright fresh menu, great views, wonderful atmosphere. 10/10 would come again.
I always try to walk a fine lunch here when I’m in town￼
Such a great experience every time. I always feel fortunate to get a table!
Friendly staff and very delicious food. You can taste how fresh the ingredients is

It’s not really worth the hype. The space is really beautiful! Get a drink and call it a night… the food was meh.
Service was excellent.

Our brunch experience was perfect from start to finish. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and very positive energy.  The crudo and the Caesar salad with crab was as good as any of the 4 have ever had.  The bottles of wine were priced fairly and the entrees were diverse but wonderful across the board, lasagna, papradelle with bolognese, ciopino were all fantastic.  We finished with a shared butterscotch desert and Spanish coffee which were great.  The meal, the atmosphere and the service were 5 star from start to finish.  
I have no trouble leaving a poor review if merited but this place is one that you must visit if in Seattle.

Reservation at 9 pm. We were early by 20 minutes but were seated immediately.  The ambiance perfect. Our food was delicious. Started with bruschetta with delicious tomato flavors, cioppino (seafood) and steak for husband which were well made. We finished with butterscotch desert and wine.  Our evening was perfect
Great experience for our anniversary! Service and ambiance were fantastic and the food was great as always. Definitely recomen for special occasions
A must place to go when in Seattle. Very cool experience. Food was good. Request a seat in the lounge.

The food was delicious but the portions were on the small side for the price. I loved the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant. We sat outside on the patio and it was nice to have a pleasant breeze during our lunch.
