A real treat!  Favorite place to bring out of town guests!
Food was absolutely fantastic. Best Italian food in Seattle! Make a reservation!

We actually made the trip specifically to go to this restaurant as we were celebrating a special occasion ￼and made the reservation over a month in advance. The majority of our food was good. The raspberry basil cake is amazing! The trapeze artist was wonderful! ￼We were a little disappointed in the service we received. But perhaps our server was not having a good night. If we’re in Seattle again, will definitely give it another try!
The best dining experience in its class. Highly recommend

I strongly suggest you reserve in advance because it is a very popular place although there is a “walk in” line the waiting line is long and you might end disappointed because there are limited spaces. I used Open Table App.

When looking for the place, beware that it might a bit challenging to find because there are no outside signs or any kind of identification… just a Pink Door.

Food is amazing!
I had the Pink Door Lasagna… strongly recommended also the Basil Cake was really good!

Weather was nice so sat outside. Great experience!

Service was excellent! Staff is very kind and attentive.
Food came out at reasonable time.

If you want to have a wonderful experience in Seattle… this is the place!
The food was great. The only place in Seattle that serves squid ink pasta with 5 star rating.🥰

The venue and location was very very nice our waitress, her name was olga, started out the evening super Pleasant and extremely inviting but as the evening continued for whatever reason that turned a little South. It took a long time for our food to finally come out it was okay but nothing over the top to get excited about
One of the best dinners we have had in a long time. The food was amazing, our server Ryan was superb and the atmosphere was warm and cozy.

We were disappointed that there was no burlesque show after trying to get reservations for two months. It was a special anniversary dinner evening, and then the food was just fair, nothing special. The ambiance is great but not worth the hassle of waiting for a reservation. We may try again, it seems impossible to get a Saturday night reservation to see the entertainment.
Beautiful dinner at the Pink Door! Exceptional waitstaff and delicious food.
Loved this restaurant for years it never fails to amaze me!
WOW just amazing all around. Definitely a gem. So happy to have come across it during my travel planning
Our Waiter was nice, funny, and attentive. Kince was awesome and funny. Food was amazing. It's a vibe!

Absolutely 
My all time favorite place
Went in March for my 80th bday
& eat inside 
& Sept for our 60th anniversary & sat on the deck for an awesome day! 
I’ve taken my girls friends every August for lunch (before covid)
I always recommend PD

Difficult to find the front door, pink door with no sign in an alley, not amenable for the handicapped or Thais having difficulty going up/down stairs, eclectic ambiance, decent service but excellent, high quality Italian fare
Got seats near the window. Beautiful view and great food! Definitely worth visiting.

We arrived 20 minutes early for our reservation and got seated right away in the area we wanted! The service was incredible - our server was Alissa - we LOVED her. she was super helpful with the drink menu and answering any questions we had. The food was delicious, and any time out water ran out it was refilled immediately. We had a group behind us that was so loud it made it hard for us to hear each other, but once they left the place mellowed out and was a lot more enjoyable.

Highly recommend getting a reservation as it is a busy restaurant. Only take reservations though 30 days ahead… worth the effort! Food is so good. We had the signature lasagna and Cesar salad and both commented was some of the best we have ever eaten.  Prices consistent with similar Seattle restaurants
The best service food and atmosphere. If only it was easier to get a table.
The food was just ok, but the setting, view and ambiance are awesome.
Restaurant interior is very eclectic!  Dinner was good and server was excellent!
Lunch for 5 took 2.5 hrs.. and wasn’t due to drinks…. Food was good but incredibly slow… waitress likely had too many tables and wasn’t anticipating.
I love this restaurant! However it was the first time I had to ask for salt to season the risotto 😢
Front desk had a hard time finding my reservation. Showed them the confirmation message, but still could not find it.
Amazing Italian!!!  Beautiful view of the sound. Staff were fantastic.  Make a reservation.  Well worth it
Dan was his usual competent and enjoyable self.  The linguine vogole was to die for.
Absolutely delicious food with amazing service. Our waitress was able to recommend options from appetizer to dessert.

Very popular place, had to book exactly 30 days in advance to get our reservation.  We were there for our anniversary with friends and we couldn’t have been more pleased.  Drinks, appetizers and entrees were all outstanding.  Service was impeccable, his timing was perfect, we were not rushed but he was there when we needed him.  

We ate in the main dining room, so did not catch the show which takes place in the lounge area.  That looks entertaining, but from the main dining room you have the amazing water view and sunset.  Different types of awesome!

The only thing that we were only very slightly disappointed with, were the dessert choices.  What we chose, to share as a table four (so full) was the basil cake which was good.  We’re all chocolate lovers, and so no options.

Highly recommend, but getting there can be difficult right now due to all of the surrounding construction.  Enjoy!!!

Everything was so on point. The food was excellent. The service was excellent. The atmosphere was fun and professional. 

People who own or manage restaurants should try to inspire to be this good. 

Make your reservations and experience this wonderful restaurant.
Request a table outside if it’s nice. And order the fries as an appetizer
Salmon was the fish of the day, very good but slightly over salted. Pink door Lasagna was delicious.

Amazing setting. Unique. Great service and overall customer care. My wife’s fig and cheese dish was very good. My Caesar salad with crab was only so so. The crab had a very strong smell. I would recommend the Pink Door. Just not the Caesar with crab.
It was so delicious! Came…not wearing tourist sneakers and we did just great!
Staff was friendly and amazing. Hard to get a reservation but glad we got a lunch reservation on the patio on a nice summer day

the food was divine!! i loved the presentation and timing of all the courses. i only wish the ambience of the outdoor area felt the same as the indoor part of the restaurant. the tablecloths felt a little kitchy and didn’t seem to match the vibe
Delicious food in a cute atmosphere!  Service was fun and attentive.

THANK YOU for a wonderful night!!  EVERYTHING was perfect water views skyline I got the Chicken Parm we asked the hostess what was good she said the lasagna was Devine that's what my husband got I LOVED IT   I smiled from ear to ear the entire night  In the beginning they bring out bread and oil. The oil is AWESOME they make it there they infuse it with many things  We brought some home with.  We will definitely be back when we come back to Seattle to try other items on the menu
The food was delicious.  Best bruschetta I ever had.  Surprisingly Delicious rum drink yummy. Only downside was a strong odor in hallway where bathrooms are.
Great Food! Great Service! Great Atmosphere! Best meal we had on our trip. The lasagna was incredible.
I loved the experience. I’m sad we missed the show, but that’s no fault of them. Food was excellent. Drinks were fun and delicious. Great place!

Our lunch with out of state friends was a celebration of their visit and the best of Seattle:  beautiful, taste-perfect food served so very professionally by a friendly waiter, accompanied by the perfect wine pairing.  We sat near the windows so our friends could take in Elliott Bay and fully enjoy the beautiful dining space as well.
Great service and delicious food. Servers are very attentive and friendly

We really enjoyed our meal here and the view from our table on the patio. The food was excellent - recommend the pink lasagna as well as the figs appetizer. They provide blankets in the evening if needed but it would be nice if they could have overhead heaters as well. Service was wonderful, we really enjoyed our dinner experience at Pink Door.
I now know what all the hype is about - the service and the food were outstanding!  The olive oil was the best I have ever tasted.  I hope to be back one day to have another amazing experience!
PD was perfect for a light lunch outside with visitors from Norway!
All around excellent lunch experience. I highly recommend.
The Pink Door never disappoints! We were thrilled that heirloom tomatoes were still available and spectacular for the caprese salad and bruschetta.  The patio was delightful for our early fall lunch.

The Pink Door remains our favorite Seattle restaurant, especially when it’s tomato season and their fresh tomato bruschetta is on the menu. We tried the steak, chicken parmesan, and risotto, along with the antipasto plate. All were wonderful as usual.
Always delicious food and service!  Love the outdoor dining experience.
Our server was exceptional and food preparation fabulous! Look for the salmon colored door. No sign, but this the entrance  the “Pink Door”! Worth the hide n seek !
The food is amazing, simple fresh ingredients. Dessert is too good. If you dont like fish then the place can feel smelly. As they have a lot of sea food dishes option available.

We caught the tail end of the performance which was very fun. The service was much faster than we thought, the staff was very friendly, and the food was amazing. The best food we’ve had in a long time, definitely worth the hype. 12/10 would recommend!
I had my 30th birthday here and it was the best experience I ever had. The food was amazing and the trapeze show was gorgeous!

Had a really nice time taking my parents here, the food was good, the service was great. The hostess let me push the reservation back by half an hr when my parents were delayed with no problems at all.

We loved our server Broc. He was so friendly and made sure our toddler was entertained and happy. We rarely go out, and we were stressed about our toddler not being cooperative, but Broc really made everything easy for us.

I always order a vongole pasta every time I dine at The Pink Door, but the dish was not so amazing on my most recent visit. It was salty and the clams were not fresh. Other dishes we ordered were good, the lasagna and cioppino. Service was great.
We had a lite meal. A salad each and 3 meatballs. The meatballs are a MUST! Great experience all around.
Amazing food and wonderful service, as usual!

Whenever we visit Seattle, we always try to eat at the Pink Door.  My wife loves the lasagna.  I like the cioppino and the linguini with clams.  I'm not a big dessert person,   but tried the budino and it was delicious.  It's hard to get reservations, but we got lucky this last time and were able to make same-day reservations.

Ask for everything at the same time. By the time we ate our two starters we could not finish our steak. We ordered thinking tapas style.  Next time we will request that.  And, there will be a next time. We dream about the Caesar salad.
Just amazing! It is such a lovely restaurant and the food is superb.

Classic Italian fare done particularly well, in a - hmm, perhaps whimsical is the word I’m looking for to describe the setting. The Pink Door dishes are the most evocative of the taste and aroma of Italy of any place we’ve eaten recently, from the tasty meatballs and long-simmered sauce to the well-seasoned tagliata, preceded by a caprese and bruschetta - excellent, perfectly salted tomato on very slightly charred herbed/garlic toast, mmmm. The simple dishes are often the hardest to get right in a memorable way - and they do.  Excellent, friendly service with just enough attentiveness.
Patio is very crowded, need to have a little more space between tables
The Pink Door is such a staple! It will never get old!
Lasagna deserves its accolades   Place is hard to find but oh so worth it.  Great service too
just ok - they seriously need a wireless order & payment system or teach servers table management
The outside patio was beautiful. The field and service was great. Wonderful time
Definitely a cool place to visit and the food was amazing

Lasagna was not as large as I hoped for the amount it cost. It was good, just pretty small. Drinks were pretty pricey for not large amounts either, but still tasted great. Seems more like a place for the ambience and music instead of the food.

Terrible waitress - kept rushing us
Food was mediocre for the price
Feel like we were paying for the view and ambience
The ambience was as perfect as it can get. Best place to get Authentic italian.
Really cool place with great people and excellent food!  Try the risotto, it’s awesome!

Great find!!   A friend recommended this restaurant and we are so happy he did!  Reservations open at midnight 30 days in advance, so try to grab one early as they book up fast.  The food was very good and the ambiance was even better.   Staff was very professional.   We will include this restaurant on future visits to the area.
Excellent for both business and casual lunches. Great food, solid service, calming views and both indoor and outdoor seating.
Quick service but very very loud in there. Felt myself shouting across the table.
Amazing food, ideal location, fantastic service.  We went for our anniversary and I could not recommend it more, especially the fig and goat cheese plate.

We ate 2 times on Tuesday, our waiter at our 2:45 lunch was ok, not too much into us, as I noticed his service to others around us, like asking if we'd like more bread, and our water was never refilled.

 Our food was delicious! Our second time that day our waitress was wonderful . . . 
think it was Carolyn S
But I do love Pink Door! Entertainment was super and I bought a couple of the lapel pins, so cute. Shared that info with a worker at Seattle made store, said she was going to get one!
So yup, great place

We had heard so much about The Pink Door. The service was good and the decor was quite sweet. Unfortunately our lunch did not meet the hype. Our caprese salad was pretty good.  That's pretty straightforward. My linguine alle vongole was tasteless (salty at best), and the pasta was overdone.  My dining partner's dish (fish) was equally tasteless. Maybe the chef had an off day or something.
Food was fabulous and so was staff. It is a must when visiting Seattle.
Delicious food (ordered fries, arancini, and the lasagna) with a great view of the market during lunch service. The wait staff are friendly and attentive. Reservation recommended!

The food, the service, entertainment, beverages were all amazing! Definitely coming back whenever we visit Seattle! Special shout-out to our server Stephanie, you were great! Thanks for making our anniversary trip one to remember 🫶🏼

Even though it was a very busy summer Saturday afternoon they were able to reserve a table out on the patio like I requested in my reservation. It was amazing and very easy, food was delicious service was superb. Made a great impression only my visiting father! Thank you
Excellent restaurant. Highly recommend! Even the house wine was great.
Wonderful meal and fantastic service! I highly recommend .
Atmosphere was terrific, Food was outstanding ! A spot you should not miss when In Seattle

Great spot where we enjoyed delicious food and wonderful service.
With yummy gluten-free bread, which made me very happy. 
You shouldn’t skip it!
Loved the beautiful views and ambiance. The salmon was delicious and figs/goat cheese/spinach appetizer was to die for.
Incredible spot to enjoy a tasty yet fairly economic meal, the live entertainment was great and if you’re ever wondering how good lasagna can get, try this place!

This was a near perfect experience.  The ambience was so wonderful with gorgeous views.  The wait staff was incredibly hospitable and attentive.  The food was tremendous (pork chop, risotto, cioppino, chicken and steak were all amazing).  It was a fantastic evening.  The only challenge was in getting a reservation.  Reservations open up at 12:01 am 1 month in advance.  There are not many tables for 6.  The only time available was 5pm which was a bit early.  And I was on at midnight to do this.  I’m not sure there is anything the restaurant can do about it, but that was disappointing.  Just know that to get a reservation you need to be trying literally at midnight!
Love this place! It isn't cheap but oh so good! This is my second visit, and I look forward to returning again soon!

Our experience on this visit was superb!! Our food was great, the atmosphere on the outside patio spectacular and our server, Erick the best!  Even as we were leaving a manager  remembered it was my birthday and wished me a happy birthday and was so engaging!  As a local, would certainly go to the Pink Door more often if it wasn’t so hard to get a reservation!
Our waiter was moody and broody but got our orders right. We got to sit outside, which was heavenly.
Great food and service!! I treated my son and his girlfriend to dinner. Always packed!
Never disappoints!  The best place in Seattle for an early dinner on the patio.  Food was fantastic, service was great!
The food and the service was outstanding! If you get to to restaurant and they say the wait is an hour, say ok! This restaurant is worth the wait!!! Favorite restaurant in Seattle!!!
Excellent food,  ambience, service.  Have been to The Pink Door many times during visits to Seattle over the past 14 years!
I forgot our waitress' name but she was very personable.   She said she was from New Jersey but have moved to Seattle! : )

We were greeted warmly and promptly. Our server was friendly and professional and took care of any questions we had about the menu. The salmon I had was absolutely delicious and in fact everything we ate was cooked and flavoured to perfection. We are definitely coming again.

I have been dining at the Pink Door for 28years  I love it and so do my friends.
I usually like Dan to serve us.  He does an excellent job.  I love the pasta.

Everyone is very friendly   I am always greeted in a lovely manor.  It is my favorite
restaurant in Seattle.  Thank you

We managed to get a last minute lunch table here and it was a real find . 
It’s so friendly and welcoming . Service and food was excellent . Can’t fault it at all and would recommend The Pink Door if you are in Seattle
Amazing food, unique and tasty cocktail, very nice waitress, food worth the price
They took such good care of me, even though I was solo. Thank you, thank you!  Great service, great food and a wonderful view.
Don't hesitate.  Everything we had was amazing.  So fresh.  Make a reservation and run to The Pink Door.!

We wanted to like this place more, but it unfortunately did not meet our expectations.  The view was nice from being seated in the back, however part of the reason we wanted to come to this restaurant was to see the acrobatic show, but there was no way to tell if it was happening or not. Disappointing. However, the food was good, but not great except for the bolognese- I would highly recommend the bolognese. So delicious! The service was okay - we weren't huge fans of our waitress, so it made the meal a little less enjoyable. I'd still recommend the restaurant to a friend, as I feel like it deserves a second chance.
We always have a great time whenever we go to Pink Door.
Amazing food, great service, great views, appetizers and drinks were delicious as well. Great weekend dinner.
Food is tasty but size has been decreased. Aurora is still good as usual.

It’s the first time we’ve been back to Seattle in 25 years. I was so hoping to get a reservation, and we did due to a cancellation. Our meal was perfection. Every bite was delicious, and the service was terrific. Just as I had remembered. Our best meal so far in Seattle!
Great place to eat. Meatballs and lasagna are delicious. Don’t miss the French Fries
Easy walk from Westlake. Food was good and not overpriced
Best value for the quality of food in pikes place! We're never disappointed when we eat at the pink door!
Everything was lovely 10/10 experience. The service, food, and ambiance were incredible. They gave me and my girlfriend the window table too. Love this place!

We were shown to a very nice table in a corner by a window. Our server was very sweet and accommodating. We had been wandering and exploring around Pike Place so we were thirsty and hungry and excited to eat. The bread and olive oil … yum. Super hard to save room but we paced ourselves. Our antipasti was perfect. Gorgeous figs and surprising arancini. They make it with black rice! The caprese was perfect and the Caesar salad was well dressed if a tiny bit ruined by the need to use a fork and knife to eat it. I don’t know when restaurants decided not to tear lettuces into bite sized pieces anymore. Entrees next… my husband had the chicken parm which he said was delicious. My son went silent with appreciation as he ate the lasagna and only commented once to say he was glad we still had bread so he could sop up all the sauce. My risotto was tasty but very loose. Almost soupy. And some of the prawns were quite over. Our server gave us a complimentary dessert to make up for it and oh… those cherries poached in red wine and bay were so lovely. All in all we had a beautiful dinner. A very nice end to our vacation. Thank you Pink Door ☺️

The food and atmosphere were excellent. The ambient noise was low, and you could easily have a dinner conversation. The service appeared to be a bit rushed, but I suspect that is because of the restaurant's popularity. Highly recommend!
We loved our waitress! She was so fun and attentive. And a good sense of humor and explained things very well!

Simply lovely. Couldn’t ask for a better dinner my first. Igor in Seattle! I dined solo and was seated at a lovely table with nice views. Could ask for more. Service was fast!! I hadn’t enough finish glaring throughly my photos before I knew it my food was ready to eat!!!
a MUST every time we are in seattle! cannot skip the vongole and bolognese. and the BREAD/OLIVE OIL! we love you, pink door!

The decor, the food, and the view were all fantastic. If only our server could have tried harder to be less grumpy, it would have been 5 star experience. We sat right by the window which was nice. If I ever visit again, I would try to sit where I could see the band on the stage.
The Punk Door is  beautiful and service was excellent! I had the Caesar Salad with Dungeness Crab, very average but the Summer Sangria was amazing!
Always good. Great use of the food available in the PNW.
Disappointed with lack of sea food options and no dinner specials, just a dinner salad special
Fabulous experience...Ryan who helped with our table orders was excellent. Food was above expectations.
Our favorite meal in Seattle! Food and service were top notch. The lasagna is to die for!

a little hard to spot the door. great drinks! waited at the bar for a table, ended up getting a table outside. it was a warm night and it felt just right out. we had a reservation for 9 pm in august and the sun was just setting, so we had a nice view that turned into a romantic nighttime dinner. the food was very good! service was friendly and attentive. i would definitely go back!
ask to sit in the lounge area if you are a bar person. tuesdays is trapeze show! food is amazing
Been coming to the Pink Door since 1986 with my boyfriend, now husband and friends who are now husband and wife as well. It is OUR romantic place to celebrate all our special occasions. Love it here.
Great time! I we would go back again. Awesome food and service.
Quintessential Seattle!  Love this place. Food, service and ambiance is a 10!

I’ve been to the pink door 4 times in the prior few months — I live in Arizona and travel 1200 miles to come here. The service is HORRIBLE. Never get refills; the servers are so rude; I feel like I’m ordering from a soup kitchen every time I explain an allergy. If you bring in a coffee from pike, you literally get screamed ay. You’re lucky the food is good because everything else is horrible.
Delicious food, great service and uniquely beautiful setting!
I requested a good seat but was smashed in with other people the food was ok that hostess really set the mood and didn’t get to enjoy it as much
This was a great experience the food was excellent, the service was outstanding, and the atmosphere was romantic.  We had dinner on a Friday and we were lucky to see the AERIAL PERFORMANCE.

Would highly recommend pre booking for this hidden basement restaurant. It can be hard to get in, but it’s well worth it. Service was excellent, as was the ambience and the view over the water adds to the experience if you get seated at the back dining room. 
Definitely get their famous Lasagna (spinach pasta, so much flavour too), Clams & Mussels, and the side dish grilled corn off the cob. 
Dessert was also standout - simple, done well.
Great vibe, great food and people that care about what they are doing.  I will definitely come back when I am in Seattle.

The food blew my socks off. The service was highly attentive. The atmosphere: a mostly shaded outdoor table on a gorgeous, sunny August afternoon. My reservation was for 3:15 and the last one available for a single. Deserving of its “must go” reputation, The Pink Door will be an unthinkable omission on my next trip to Seattle! Good LUCK getting a RESERVATION. You’ll NEED BOTH, or a lot of patience. I had the 1/2 Antipasto plate, the grilled corn OFF the cob, and the Caesar salad w grilled prawns. All 10/10! Next time: dessert!

Most beautiful day dinner
Food is delicious and the service is wonderful. Definitely more casual beachy vibes
Beautiful ambiance, reservation on time, timing of drinks and food was excellent. Friendly and efficient servers.
Very fun, different feel and awesome food. Must do in Seattle.
It was amazing as always!  The food, ambiance and service, were perfect.  Favorite restaurant of all time; I have been going there for 33 years, thank you for all of the great experiences!
it is so hard to get a reservation here and I was getting a little frustrated thinking it might not be worth it . . . IT WAS DEFINITELY WORTH THE WAIT!
￼Great ambiance and service - food was amazing!  Seattle vibe- not touristy.
The food and ambiance were great! The linguini and clams were definitely the highlight for me.
Wonderful food, service and greeting! Woukd definitely go back again next time in Seattle:)
Server was absolutely amazing, knew exactly what he was doing and gave great recommendations. Portion was perfect, the baby clams that came with our dish had so many! We weren’t expecting it.

I really enjoyed my dinner at The Pink Door. Our server was fabulous, the food was delicious and not nearly as pricey as I had expected. The only thing I would change is that I wish we had chosen to dine inside instead of out on the deck. It was a beautiful evening so we chose the deck. It was very comfortable but didn’t feel special in any way. The inside restaurant is so incredibly beautiful and cozy that I wish we’d sat there to enjoy the wonderful ambience. Next time, I will choose inside! And there will definitely be a next time!!!
We enjoyed another very good meal at The Pink Door.
Wonderful dinner with colleagues on a short visit to Seattle.  Very cool vibe! Arancini was divine and lasagne was silky and luxurious! Nice wine list too!
Wonderful can’t wait to go back when we visit Seattle !
Fantastic food, service, ambience - everything! Ahi Tuna appetizer was my favorite!

Pink Door was a bucket list restaurant, and when we finally got a reservation we were not disappointed! I went with my partner to celebrate an anniversary. I put that note in our reservation details and was a bit sad they didn't congratulate or mention it, even though they were wishing others a happy birthday (this is not a negative, I'm just sensitive:) ) The food was amazing, the tomatoes for the bruschetta and caprese salad were the stand out. I got the Summer Risotto which was so so so good. My partner got the lasagna, which we were so happy to learn it was vegetarian.  5 star experience, food, atmosphere! Will return (if we can ever get another reservation!)
Everything was delicious, our waiter (Ryan) was fantastic and we had a great night!

The food was terrific! We brought a very, very good bottle of wine with us, paid the $35 corkage fee, and the waiter offered to decant it for us which was a nice surprise. I think he needs a little training on how to open a bottle however. Didn’t cut the foil and broke the cork off midway. I would highly recommend seating in the lounge. Best view of the show. It’s almost impossible to call and get someone on the phone. Hostess staff was super nice. We’d go back, knowing what to expect now.

The Pink Door is our favorite restaurant in Seattle. The food is always good, service is excellent, ambiance is welcoming and friendly. The prices are within reason for the quality of the experience. We always feel like special guests and are never rushed to leave the table for others to take our seats. It’s a special place with no pretentiousness, just an enjoyable time.
Fabulous wait staff and excellent food. The lasagna and cioppino were both perfect!

The drinks and ambience were lovely. The Bolognese was delicious. We found, though they had good flavor, the meatballs were dry. Despite putting a tree nut allergy warning on the reservation and reminding the waiter that I had a tree nut allergy upon my arrival, I was still served a desert that had tree nuts in the sauce. I could tell the moment I took a bite. He was extremely apologetic and said the recipe has changed since they printed the menu, which did not reflect tree nuts. Given the hype of the restaurant, I would’ve expected better allergy practices. The price of the desert was removed from the bill, but I would’ve expected a larger compensation.
Our server was great.  Helped with meal selection
Pink Door is one of the most iconic restaurants in Seattle. Not only is it an amazing beautiful venue and food is outstanding with a staff to match. Great for tourists and locals!
Fresh, flavorful and delicious, great ambience and views, and very friendly staff.  Highly recommend.
Beautiful room overlooking the water at the back. Impeccable service and fabulous food.
Fantastic, would highly recommend to any1 visiting Seattle such as me and my date did. Came from Los Angeles, California.
Great experience. Highly recommend.....if you can find it. 😉
A must do when in Seattle! Food was incredible and our server was funny and attentive.

Besides food excellent I was so grateful for my waitress and even the manager so helpful to look for my rings that I thought I lost !! But I didn’t! It was in my pocket 😀. Thank you Nora for getting on your knees to look under cabinets for me 🙏🙏🙏
Great Euro-vibe / Great Food.  Charming without pretense.

This is such a lovely restaurant. Everything about it is wonderful, especially the people who work there and then the food, ambiance, music. We lucked out and had a table in the back with views of the water and it’s much quieter! Our food was incredible. My husband had salmon and starter salad. I had the vegetarian dish that was amazing! So many fresh vegetables and deep rich flavors. We love The Pink Door and will keep coming back again and again.

The food was amazing! Best meal we’ve had in Seattle. We loved the Pink Door Lasagna, the gelato sundae, the tuna appetizer, and the chicken parmigiana. Can’t wait to go back next time we’re in Seattle!
Service was lovely, especially as I was there on my own, and food/drink was incredible.
Best Vongole — clams and linguini  ever. Service is fun and excellent. Food is gorgeous— wish I’d been able to try everything!
Great space. Great food.  Awesome service.  Love the literal pink door entrance!
Excellent food and an amazing atmosphere! Loved it!

A delightful evening.  Our server, Eric, was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  We both enjoyed our meals which were served at a reasonable pace.  Price was also reasonable considering the location and quality of food/service.
Our server Ashley was amazing. Cudos to her for making our celebration so special.

This as good as I remembered from 8 years ago. I brought a friend for her birthday, also her fist time in Seattle. We had a late lunch because I left dinner reservations until the last minute but it was delightful nonetheless. Our server Adam was great-engaging, personable, friendly and attentive. He was on his A-game.
Amazing place, food is incredible and atmosphere is just great
The food is very delicious and the server was professional.

Was underwhelmed by our experience at the Pink Door seeing as you need to make reservations quite a bit in advance. Food seemed a little pricey, had to ask the server for our complimentary bread 20+ minutes into being seated, and had someone else’s dessert brought to our table. They did try to make up for the mistake with sample size ice cream. Overall I would say it is fine, but not anything I’d recommend someone to out or their way to try.
Food was great.  Service was good.  Entertainment was a nice plus.

Authentic Italian cuisine with the tastiest most flavoursome tomatoes we have ever had anywhere in the world. Sadly we were there at lunchtime so missed out on the legendary live entertainment! An interesting cocktail menu completed our great experience
Cath and Mike from England

This place was perfect for my birthday. Everything we had from the drinks to the meal was great. The server was really friendly and recommended so many good options.  I definitely will be coming here again and recommending it to others. The food was so good!
Tasty food and great ambiance right by Pike Place overlooking the water.
Been there multiple times and it's normally a great experience. This last time was hopefully an off day. Service was eh, food just ok.
Good and service are great. The location is also a plus, as it overlooks the Pike Market and Puget Sound. The only downside is they were playing some annoying background music.
We got the Caesar salad, the chicken parmigiana, and the halibut special.  It was all delicious!  We topped off this amazing meal with the gelato sundae.  Perfection!!
We were lucky to get a table outside. The noise level out there was great. Very easy to hear each other. Food was all delicious.
Ryan our server was superb. Food was perfect. Views are lovely
Food was good! Lasagna and chicken parm, Nora was an excellent server. Neat place!

Such a great meal, it’s ridiculous! The Lasagna Pink Door was fantastic! We were celebrating our anniversary and we were sat right next to the window with a great view. We ordered fries which we never got but we also were not charged for it so it’s almost like it never happened.

Really yummy food! We ordered arancini for an appetizer. Pesto pasta added chicken & the fish special, which was halibut. Really good dishes. For dessert tried the gelato & it was probs my fave part of our meal. Had hazelnut chocolates toppings around the vanilla ice cream. The drinks were also really delicious as well! They provided complimentary bread & olive oil.
The Pink Door knocks it out if the park! Great ambience, great food, great service. Make a reservation to score the dining room, but each room has its charm. A market gem!
Considering the prices the food was not worth it. There was hardly a view and you’re really just paying for the ambiance. The service was horrible too.
Our server Dominic was terrific. The food was delicious, beautiful atmosphere. Everyone was very pleasant.

Second time coming here, does not disappoint. The pink door lasagna is just amazing, I can’t eat any other anymore because of how good it is. This time we got the chicken Parmesan as well and it was also delicious the pasta on this dish was a little spicy but still excellent! Service was fantastic! We will be back!

We sat on the deck and I was pretty warm by the end of the meal. We noticed the that you have an extra layer of lattice above head. Maybe do the whole deck?

We had the fish special, which was delicious! But, if I am picky, the potatoes tasted like they were cooked the night before. The caponata was fab and the basil cake, really good!

Definitely coming back!
One of the best restaurants in Seattle! Highly recommend.

This is a must visit restaurant! Don't let the hard-to-get reservation put you off, for it is well worth the month out wait. My sister and I came because I had such a great time the last time I went, and it did not disappoint! Coming here always feels like a special occasion, even if it's not. Everything was incredibly delicious from the meatballs to the caprese salad to the lasagna. The eggplant that comes with the chicken parmesan is so good! I can't recommend this place enough.

We had later reservations and were accommodated early which was great.  Staff and waiter very nice and efficient.  We did not have any Italian food.  A sandwich and 2 salads which I have to say were lackluster!
Our fave restaurant in Seattle.  A family tradition for us.

Loved lunch yesterday with two of my best friends.  We ate on the deck and were so happy to kick back with the beautiful view for an unhurried elegant lunch. The halibut was perfect as were the sides.  It's one of my favorite places to take people for an outdoor lunch with a view.

We ate on the patio so it was quiet and we were able to easily carry on a conversation. All four of us ordered different items from the menu and we all thought our food was outstanding. The only disappointment was that their online wine list is out of date so the wine we really wanted wasn't available. Service was excellent with well trained staff. The fresh tomatoes were beyond wonderful. This is one of our most favorite restaurants. We had a reservation for 5pm that was made 30 days in advance. Restaurant is very popular so reservations are a must if you want to be sure you'll get seated.
There's nothing better than a lovely summer meal on the deck at the Pink Door!
Amazing experience and the food were delicious. Friendly staff and it’s a must if you will visit Seattle
Wonderful as always!!  We will return soon. Thank you!

The Pink Door never ceases to impress.  What a perfect way to spend a summer day having lunch on the deck with my daughter and her friend.  They were able to accommodate us adding 1 person without any fuss.  Food was terrific, the service was all around great.  We ordered too much food because everything looked good.  Too bad there is construction nearby but not the restaurant's fault and it appeared they stop at noon for their lunch break.  I've already made future reservations since the place i so popular.

An interesting restaurant.  Appears to be a must-go when in Seattle.  Not sure I agree.  Service could be improved and being from New York - dishes may be a little different in Seattle.  Everything was fresh and I would highly recommend the Bruschetta - delish!!  Chicken Parm not so much.  Didn't enjoy the coating.
Everything was delicious! Best Italian restaurant I’ve ever been to. We loved the vibe and received great service. We got the bruschetta, lasagna, and pappardelle pasta. I can’t wait to go back!

Every time I visit Seattle, I bring friends to The Pink Door. We were there for lunch on  Friday, 7/21 and it was wonderful! The food ambience, and service were spot on! We sat outside and had a lovely view and lunch. We will be back!
Awesome vibe and the food was bomb. Thanks for having us
Celebrate my birthday there every year, and I am never disappointed.  The food and service is excellent and the staff is so efficient and nice.
Very enjoyable dinner!  We particularly enjoyed the arancini and the Limoncello ricotta dessert.  The atmosphere is nice and relaxed, and we did not feel rushed.  There is also a great wine menu.
Excellent food, charming ambiance, solid service. We enjoyed this visit greatly.
Great food and fun to find the “peach” door. Service was lackluster and made the experience less than expected.
Wonderful service and delicious food!  Can’t wait to return!

It’s been too long since my last trip to the Pink Door.  I was reminded yesterday of why it has always been one of my favorite restaurants- the food above all (Caesar salad with Dungeness crab), but the staff, the setting combine to make it an excellent experience.  It used to be a special go to place but given what restaurant prices have climbed to the value of the Pink Door stands out and I’ll be back frequently.

This place is really good. We tried 3 different dishes and an appetizer and all were excellent. Our waitress was also very good, very personable.
I would highly recommend this place. I can see why there is a line out front waiting for it to open.
This restaurant was not worth the hype.   The food was bland and ordinary.

Outstanding as usual! The food, the atmosphere, and the view cannot be beat. The service is always impeccable. The staff here is very kind and attentive. We come here for our anniversary as often as we can! I was only mildly bummed they didn’t offer us a glass of Prosecco for our anniversary like they have in the past, but it’s no big deal honestly. 

Thank you for always providing a memorable occasion and a satisfied stomach!
Always a fabulous experience with both food and ambiance.
Still and always our favorite Seattle restaurant. We've been eating and drinking and being inventively entertained here for more than 30 years!
We sat up at the bar and Mikey served us and was fantastic.

The service was exceptional and a diverse menu. Appetizers were the best part of the meal and the wine and dessert sent me over the top. Entree was very good but not the best I've ever had, however, I would return and try something else.

Food was delicious especially the heirloom tomatoes. Patio was perfect when we ate at 2:45. This is one of our favorite restaurants and we will continue to bring friends and family members there to eat with us.

Found the Pink Door on Yelp as I was browsing through Pike Place area- surprise me! Timing is everything so I arrived for lunch when the doors opened and able to get a table promptly!

Ambiance- 5 stars! Seated on the outdoor patio and had a partial view of the Sound. Server was attentive and recommended the Pink Door favorites.

The Caesar salad was delicious- lightly dressed and the croutons were really outstanding. The lasagna was divine and I highly recommend this! The portions are large. I'm looking forward to my next visit to try the rest of the menu!

Our trio had lunch mid week. The service was prompt and skilled. We had lovely food the halibut I had was very fresh (accommodating my gluten free needs too with a side of GF toast) .Also, the appetizer , figs, cheese plate w prosciutto as well liked by friends. The muscles and clams were cleaned well, fresh, and full of flavor. The Cioppino seafood stew was fabulous for my sister she loved it.
We are repeat customers and had a memorable meal together once again with a nice view.

Went for a night out with friends and had an amazing dinner at Pink door. Food was delicious and since our reservation was late at night it was nice and quiet. We loved the ambience of the restaurant, would recommend.

We had a lovely time at the Pink Door for an early afternoon seating at 3:15. Our server was delightful and the food was great. The stars of the show were the summer risotto for me, cool calm and collected cucumber cocktail, and the cherries with mascarpone dessert. My friend had the halibut special with burrata salad. I had a Caesar to start and we split the arancini.

We thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon spent on Pink Door’s deck with a nice view over the Pike Place Market and Elliot Bay. The atmosphere was casual and welcoming. Our server was a delightful and helpful woman. Pink Door is my idea of old Seattle: classy and unique.
A Seattle classic that does not disappoint- gets better every year and we have been enjoying Pink Door for decades.
Great food and great service, perfect spot for a date night!
Very good food with a great atmospher and ambşance
Such a great spot for lunch with friends. We did have trouble finding it as the "pink door" is more "beige". But lovely spot to enjoy the summer sun and some tasty food!
The meatball sub is amazing and views are beautiful! Must eat if you are in Seattle!
Outstanding cioppino. Mad extra spicy per my request. Garlic bread is a must

Great atmosphere and view of the city from the backroom. Service could have been better. Knowledgeable and have good recommendations. However, a bit of a chip on his shoulder. He poured our bottle of white wine before we were even half way through our cocktails even though we asked him not to.

Ultimately, a good experience and really cool spot.
Loved the place and the food!

Our server forgot our table multiple times and didn’t get our order correct. We went as a group of 4 for desserts and cocktails, and our server forgot our table for 20-25 minutes at a time including getting our dessert order incorrect and forgetting our cocktails in general. We’ve been to the Pink Door before and enjoyed it and our service was excellent, but this time the ball was dropped. Very disappointed.
Unique dining experience with lots of people watching opportunities. Good assortment of food choices. Pricey but not overpriced. A fun place to dine.
A delightful, enchanting evening. Such a great experience!

I have heard such great things about this place that I had to try it. I must say it did not disappoint. The food was delicious and I will be back for more.

I was under the impression it was family dining only but too are able to order individually. If you go here you will delighted with anything on the menu. One suggestion I have is to order the Basil cake. If you are a Basil person you should give it a go. 10/10 recommend.

The Pink Door was a top notch dining experience from start to finish.  The staff was very understanding of our drive to Seattle and held our reservation.  They were great upon arrival when I was seated with our daughter and my wife parked the car (not easy in the Pike Place Market area).  Our waiter, Eric, was fantastic and provided the right amount of service.  The food was excellent as was the decor and ambiance of the restaurant.  The prices of our menu selections were more than fair. We've paid a lot more in Southern California for a lot less.  I would put the Pink Door on the top of my list for dining if visiting Seattle.

We were able to get seated immediately outside on the patio to enjoy the summer warmth and cool air of the night. I had a ribeye with morels that was absolutely fantastic and rich with flavor. Service was good and even though we were outside could still hear a bit of the live music in the dining room.
My favorite place. Haven’t been for 15 years and it did not disappoint. Perfect martinis. Lovely view. Amazing vibes. Food was delightful. All the good adjectives come out at The Pink Door.
Very fun looking place.  Staff was very nice. Good meal.
Truly memorable experience! Everything we had - drinks, appetizer, salad and entrees- were all made with fresh high quality ingredients and were delicious. Ryan was an awesome server!
I thought I was in Italy after my first bite. Don’t miss this restaurant if you’re in Seattle!
Exceptional experience! Food was great! Ambieance, trapeze artists stellar!

Good: Best lasagna I’ve ever had, delicious food, constant refill on water and soda without asking, enchanting atmosphere
Bad: Never offered free bread, had to ask. Never offered spoon, had to ask.
Not a lot of selection and the food was plain and

We arrived early for our reservation and were seated quickly, we asked for outside which worked out beautifully.  Service was excellent, prices were a little higher so we shared 2 entrees between 4, and with the delicious bread it was a great meal.Great hidden gem in Seattle!

We came to the pink door because it was highly recommended by several friends. I’m not sure why, but our experience was nothing like theirs. Inside was beautiful, but we did have to wait a while to be seated (despite reservations) and there was no where to sit while we waited. 

While my salad was good, my husband’s noodles were very undercooked and the meatballs were just ok. We needed to ask after our meals were brought to us if we could have bread too like all the other tables…. We also were not checked on often enough for us to bother with more drinks or dessert as we knew it’d be a long time before we got those too. 

Overall, I won’t go back. Glad we tried it! But it wasn’t anything special.
Lovely evening on the patio!!  Shout out to Alana who makes the best summer drinks especially the Negroni. Highlights of our meal were the arancini and lasagna.

We had a fabulous evening - the food was delicious, the service - impeccable and the ambiance was warm and friendly. We were able to enjoy our meal without feeling rushed or hounded by wait staff. We all ordered different meals - tuna and arancini to start, with fish of the day, risotto, chicken and cioppino mains. All fantastic. 
The menu is so varied, it offers something for all palettes. And Dominic made the evening perfect - he was attentive, friendly and informative. 
the Pink door never disappoints!
Everything was amazing! So glad we came in and so sad we don't live close enough for it to be a regular thing.

Our reservation was made a month in advance, and it was not worth all the hype. We hoped to be seated near the live entertainment but instead we were seated in their back room where the vibe was completely different. The food was good but our server barely checked on us and was very quiet spoken, making it hard to hear in the already loud room (from other tables). Disappointed and would not go back!

Was curious to see how it changed after not having been for over 10 years. The food was good but not great. The clam linguine was rather disappointing but the antipasto and the risotto were good. The service was attentive. The noise level was too loud and the scheduled band never played. All in all it was fine but would rather spend a little more money to get a much higher quality of meal and ambience at other Seattle Italian spots.
BEST lasagna ever!  Excellent wait staff. Will return every trip to Seattle.

This place only operates outdoor during lunch time, you will expect to be really hot under no shade outdoor. The food was normal, nothing special. My husband’s risotto had no taste, maybe chef forgot to put salt. Also, the restaurant is not stroller friendly. If you have a baby, you can’t carry stroller with you. You may park outside. If you bring stroller, the restaurant manager or host, who owns that place will annoy you.
As this place was known to many people, we decided to visit, but food has no taste, we were super hot under the hot weather with no shade. Server and host were not kind at all. We had unpleasant visit.

The cheese Board is a must.  Every restaurant I go to, which is often, I choose the cheese board.  This was the best ever.  Then choose the Risotto.  We had the Summer Risotto because of the season.  I closed my eyes with the first bite......
Top tier date spot, on the water. Jazz band is a plus.
Great food, didn’t have what I wanted but was delicious

Out of town visiting and picked after some research. Get a reservation for the Pink Door. Food was amazing-especially the oysters and salmon! We got there too early for the entertainment but ambiance was fun and lively anyway. Great staff who made it very easy to add a member to our group. Definitely recommend and would eat here when in Seattle again.

The Pink Door delivered on its commitment to providing an exceptional experience
to their guests. With a reservation secured, we were sat at a beautiful table right away. Our server was friendly and excellent at welcoming us and guiding us through the menu, wine list and specials. Our meals were delicious, accompanied by a nice selection of interesting Italian white wines.  We loved Pink Door and look forward to visiting again soon.

The Pink Door was definitely a highlight of our visit to Seattle. I was in Seattle with my daughter and her boyfriend celebrating her 21st birthday and literally, The Pink Door was amazing!  Not only was the food impeccable, but the ambience, atmosphere and service was top notch. Truly something that cannot be missed if you’re visiting Seattle. But be warned, you must make reservations several weeks in advance. It’s well worth the effort to get the reservation.   Note that it’s not cheap, but it’s an experience you’ll never forget!
It was a great anniversary spot. Walkable from our hotel. It was great
Our server was so knowledgeable about the menu, was very helpful and lovely overall. Food came out right away and was so delicious. Would definitely go back again to try other things on the menu
Something for everyone, including gluten free selections. The server was very knowledgeable, friendly and patient. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Too much hype. There are way better places to eat around Pike Market than this place.
Perfect Seattle day on their patio. Excellent food and service, lovely Sicilian wine. Highly recommend. A Seattle institution still fantastic!
Wonderful as always. I enjoyed the trofie Al Pesto. Lovely on the patio.
The pink door is so fun! The atmosphere, the food, the staff. My boyfriend and I loved it the food was amazing we ate everything. Definitely recommend coming here for any occasion.
Wonderful service, fine food, excellent meal on the deck with beautiful weather
Services was excellent and flexible. The ambience  was perfect. It’s very value for money. It’s my favorite restaurant in Seattle. Must go and experience.
The view and the ambiance were incredible but the food here was way over-hyped.

We sat by the window and it was a nice view. The place is bigger than I thought it would be. Very busy but our server was really great, water cup was always full, and we didn’t feel rushed but never felt like we had to wait too long for anything. We had the Asparagus, Bolognese, and the Cioppino and both were well-seasoned and yummy. Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time!
We ate indoors with a great view! Good food and service. We had the lasagne and the pasta bolognese.
The ambiance was OK but the food cost was way too high because the portion sizes are way too small. Honestly not really worth it to go. Unfortunately….

Everything was delicious. It can be hard to get a reservation during weekends, but we scored an early afternoon time slot on a weekday and had a beautiful meal outside. The setting was beautiful, the staff was terrific and we had a wonderful, slow visit and meal. Can’t wait to go again. The Pink Door is worth its reputation.
We love having lunch on the patio! The food and atmosphere are perfect on a sunny day. Reservations strongly recomended!!!
I love this place! Absolute favorite place to eat outside in the summer! Food is consistently delicious!

This is one of my favorite lunch spots in Seattle -- especially when their beautiful deck is open! From the colorful oil-cloth tablecloths to views out to Elliott Bay, it's Seattle at its finest. Throw in an inviting menu, tasty appetizers/entrees/desserts and no shortage of libations. And the wait staff is the best! BRAVO! to this locally owned restaurant hidden behind -- a pink door!

Service was very disappointing. 3 out of the 5 meals we ordered were wrong. No offer was made to resolve the issues.

It took a very long time to get a reservation and we were really excited to celebrate a special day.  Unfortunately the experience was not great :(

This was one the best restaurants I’ve ever been to. Food and service was amazing and the ambiance as well. Definitely check out if coming to visit Seattle. 100% would come back. Would be great to celebrate a birthday or special event!

We had made a reservation for our anniversary. It was so loud inside we could’ve hear each other talk. They told us there wasn’t anything else available. They finally offered us a table outside which we ended up taking because we could have a conversation but it lost all the ambiance of the restaurant. Our service was not great - waitress was not helpful and made our experience more difficult. Food was pretty good but not amazing.
Service is good, honestly thought the food was just okay. Sorry.

I had a wonderful lunch here. Lasagna is as good as everyone says it is. I don't normally eat bread - but both it and the olive oil were worth the extra carbs.  Wait staff was great! Nice seating on the patio on a beautiful summer day - who could ask for more!
Service was bare minimum, food was not hot, did not feel welcomed for birthday celebration even though we indicated it’s for birthday on the reservation.
The Pink Door was amazing!  Food was excellent, staff was great, ambiance was eclectic!
Best place we ate at the week we were in Seattle and the week we were on a cruise 👀👀👀
Amazing food and wine selection. We were seated at the Patio and the views of the water are great!
Our first time dining there and it was amazing. Our server was friendly and really helpful! Reservations are definitely recommended!

Our waiter was amazing!!!  Food was incredible! Thank you for making us feel like we were valued  customers. I had the lasagna and my mom had the rigatoni. Both were flavorful and scrumptious and don’t even get me started on the ARANCINI… mouthwatering!!! We will definitely be back on our next trip to the Pacific Northwest!!!!
Amazing experience. Awesome food and service. An absolute must dine here kind of place.
Wonderful everything! Totally enjoyable! Loved it!
food was incredible- the lasagna is a must-try! The ambience is the cherry on top. Definitely recommend!
Saw lots of amazing reviews and hype about Pink Door but the food was just average so it was a little disappointing, service and staff were lovely though.
Excellent Bolognese!  Beer was cold and service was fabulous. I’ll be back!

The rice balls appetizer is an absolute must. Was so good. Also Pink Door lasagna was a hit. We sat next to window looking out over the area of Pikes Market and waterfront. Was great day for that seat. Service was good.

The views are ridiculous and amazing. The service pace was a touch on the slow side. Pasta tasted fresh and cooked perfectly. The dishes we ordered tasted good. Nothing amazing about the food we had or the service. Views 10/10 food 7/10 value 6/10

This was our first visit to the Pink Door for our 37th wedding anniversary and it was a win! Fortunately the weather was nice so we got to eat on the outdoor deck which had fabulous ambiance and nicely shaded with a trellis 'roof'. The server was very helpful and provided excellent service. The menu was great and difficult to make a decision so we'll have to return to try more entrees. We had the crostini  and 'Mamas' meatballs for appetizers. Both were awesome! My wife had the Bolognese and I had the Cioppino and they were also excellent. My wife had been wanting to try this restaurant for years (we don't live in the city) so it was perfect for our special occasion. We'll be back!
The food is mediocre, but the price is reasonable for its reputation and location.
Delightful atmosphere, great food, and attentive service!
Great food and ambience as well. The staff were very friendly and attentive.

Our standards for good service are the bare minimum: refill drinks as needed, ask us if we're doing okay, and don't rush us.
All 3 were lacking this time around. From the reviews, I was hoping for great service and an amazing experience, and we were honestly quite disappointed. Our server, (I won't say her name for her sake), was just not polite nor doing anything the right way. From spilling water everywhere, to grating cheese all over my friend's lap. The food was subpar, with the Lasagna Pink Door being a star. Unfortunately, I had no idea that Rigatoni and Meatballs meant having meatballs that couldnt even be cut. They were tough as rubber. Bread and olive oil was offered, but felt rather cheap and tacky. Overall, I hope that this place's service gets a revamp, as I felt that it was quite disappointing, since we had hoped for it to be a good experience. Probably not coming back.
Great ambiance! We will definitely recommend this restaurant to friends.
Great meal, location and ambiance and the decor was retro funk
30 years later and still amazing food and fantastic service.

One of our favorite dining experiences during our visit to Seattle! The food was amazing and the service was excellent. The arancini was delicious, chicken parm was some of the best we’ve ever had, and the lasagna is just… I have no words. The lasagna is their staple dish for a reason… fantastic! Excellent experience and look forward to a return trip so we can eat there again!
The food was fantastic. The ambiance is really great. They had an aerial performance and it was just such a cool place. The green salad was a favourite.
The food was nice, and the restaurant was beautiful. Our server was super nice too.
Hostess was very rude. She did not seem happy we had kids.  Food was good but not great.  Served was good.

The Pink Door is definitely a vibe! The entry is obscure which lends to the nostalgia of this classic Seattle eatery. We enjoyed the atmosphere, which included a great selection of live music performed by a visiting New Orleans musician. Our server was lackluster to say the least. It was obvious she wasn’t loving her job and should have been addressed by management for her borderline rude demeanor. Our food was as described, hot, presented well, and portions were large. Unfortunately, taste and quality fell slightly short. Our selections felt like an elevated approach to tourist attraction fare. Overall, it’s a great environment. Manage your expectations for subpar service/mediocre food and you’ll be fine.
First time going and it was amazing. The food was great and they have live music. Overall a beautiful experience.

We went for our anniversary. Our server Ryan was excellent. Great knowledge of menu. Had a table little close to people next to us so not very private but ok. Food was all very good. Boobie cake dessert was outstanding.
Overall, experience was amazing and will definitely be coming back! Love the food and the atmosphere.
Great food and service. We love coming hear for date night. Also very knowledgeable and able to accommodate gluten free.
Loved the ambiance. The food was excellent and loved the view from dining room window seats. It was an overall great experience!

The food was absolutely delicious .. definetly worth the hype .. My server was very dry. It was our first time and had. questions just seemed very  uninterested.. besides that the vibe and the ambiance was really nice
Delicious - as always! The Pink Door lasagna never disappoints.
Amazing food and service. Sat on the outdoor patio which was lovely!
Love this place! This is the second time we've been and I definitely recommend!

Had a wonderful birthday lunch outdoors on their deck. I realized inside in the back dining room would have also been really nice as there was good sunshine coming through the windows, and a fabulous view! They created a custom Mocktail for me that was quite delicious. Pasta & Ahi fabulous. Service terrifi!
The food was fantastic! The price is high but the ambiance and food quality makes it more than worth it. I recommend looking up their performances on the website to better choose your night!
It's a very popular and busy place, so got very loud. If you're looking for quiet ambience it's not for you. But the food and service was AMAZING. Will return :)

Started with Grilled Romaine salad and antipasto, perfectly cooked and presented for a table of 4.
Entrees of Pappardelle Bolognese/Spring Risotto and Chicken Parm, so good!!! Dessert Boobie cake was the best dessert of the vacation!
Servers and staff were attentive and engaging! Love the ambiance and quirkiness!!

Great food, great view, love the kind of under-the-radar feel. I moved from Chicago and sometimes feel the smallness of Seattle's food scene by comparison. This place is my fave and yet also a quintessential Seattle eatery. Love, love, love.
We had the most amazing experience! The service was exceptional, and the food was outstanding!

The food was ok.  It was my husbands and my 33rd anniversary.  The restaurant knew that and didn’t acknowledge it.  I ate the cioppino which was Luke warm but tasty.  My husband ate linguine with clams.  There was no sauce on the clams and linguine.  The clams were dry.  Irregardless of it being rated so high we did not enjoy our meal. Also the server didn’t come to check on us during our meal.

This was our first time at the restaurant. The food was incredible and did not disappoint. The lasagna was heavenly and the desserts were to die for. But our server Emily was what made our experience there absolutely perfect. She was so warm and friendly and made our evening there unforgettable.
Fantastic as always, an absolutely favorite in Seattle. Thank you!
Amazing service with a great ambiance. Lasagne was next level!
Such a delightful lunch and restaurant. The food was excellent and all the staff very pleasant. Highly recommend.
Mike the bartender and the entire team were outstanding.. He even made me fresh whipped cream at the bar for my fresh strawberries! Amazing!

This was another incredible meal for us at The Pink Door. Perfect for our celebratory lunch and will be a part of our cherished memory of the day. The food is beyond amazing. The entire experience… Phenomenal!
Gosh I love this place. Such a treat!

The vibe was super cool. you walk through a very inconspicuous door and you enter an eccentrically beautiful dining area. The live entertainment was very fun. I had the clam pasta and they offer the most clams I have ever received in a clam pasta. I Highly recommend!

My husband and I enjoyed a lovely meal here on the outside deck.  We were happy to be seating outside, because the band inside was rather loud.  It was a beautiful evening in Seattle and we had the most charming dinner.  The food was fantastic, and  the service was terrific.
Phenomenal.  Quite possibly the best Italian food I’ve ever ate.

The chicken parm was excellent. The lasagna is also very good. The service was slow and not forthcoming with information regarding drinks. I was served  a beer with a citrus flavor which was not described. I told the server I didn’t like it and received a stare. I had to ask for a different drink.
Good food. Bring me back to Europe. Hidden entrance.

Once again, the Pink Door was absolutely fabulous. I had the Everything Green salad that had the perfect ingredients and was lightly dressed to enhance the FRESH greens.
The bread is soooo good. 
The wine was reasonably priced and full bodied.
Everything was fabulous. I let them know we were celebrating and they treated us like queens.  The food and service were fantastic!
A small complimentary bday treat would have been a nice addition (70th bday).
Great food, great service. Would definitely go back.
Perfect all things, fantastic taste!! I really love it!! I wanna go again!!!

The Pink Door was fabulous. I hadn't been there since pre-pandemic days and it is a Seattle restaurant that remains on top of its game. We celebrated a milestone graduation and dined in the back room which was the perfect elegant, yet festive and comfortable setting. Our service was outstanding and adept and the each course was perfectly prepared and delicious. So happy this traditional dining experience continues to be such an important part of the downtown Seattle experience.

Fabulous meal! Arrived early for our reservation and got seated quickly. Great service. Penne ala  vodka , pasta bolognese both delicious. Crusty bread and olive oil yummm. Also I mistakenly left my credit card after paying and went back the next day and they got it back to me . Thank you so so much for that !!!!
The food is really amazing, it was our second visit in 2 months, the service always kind, happy and effective
Great evening all round, lovely decor and a good menu
Great ambience and service.  Something for everyone with focus on Italian and seafood.
The waiter was not very attentive and didn’t even bring bread basket.

We were there for lunch. We started with the Ahi Crudo, which was very tasty, The Bolognese was excellent (always the first thing we try at an Italian restaurant we haven’t visited before). ￼The manzo brasato sandwich was large, and the beef was wonderfully tender.  It had some peppers on it, but needed a little bit more salt or flavor.  This lemon hibiscus tart was excellent. Great experience, bartender, willing to try out something different. We will be back.
Very friendly staff. The food was amazing. We will definitely come back again.
Amazing! Dan was amazing and a kind server that made the experience at The Pink Door worth our while!
Our server was so knowledgeable and made great suggestions!  Would go back again.
Everyone was very pleasant, and the food was delicious!
Food was amazing!!! Absolutely loved it. The views were great as well.
The service was very slow. The food quality was poor. I will not be returning.

The food the ambiance the whimsical decor, it was an experience we won’t forget. It’s a classy restaurant but more than that it’s a creation of hard work and an imaginative mind. We were treated like royalty and yet as though we were at home with friends. Fine dining with a electric luxurious vibe. I don’t want the world to know, and yet I do, of this glorious evening we had. Wine & oysters, lamb & pasta. Let’s go together.

This restaurant was very good. The prices were fair, the portions were generous, the service was good, and the food was delicious! My new favorite food is their rice balls. Well worth the wait for booking the reservation so far ahead of time. We got to sit outside, and the patio was very cute. The live music indoors was good, but pretty loud.
The food was wonderful! The decor is interesting, different and the atmosphere was positive.  I highly recommend this neat place.
Amazing food! We loved everything we ordered. Our server was great too! Would definitely come back on our next trip!
Food was great and the service was excellent! We sat outside on the patio, which is a very different (but very enjoyable!) experience than sitting inside.
Remains our favorite dining experience in Seattle🤙🏼

Awesome experience ! Book early as place fills up !
Pasta dishes are amazing. Atmosphere was awesome and has a speak easy vibe. Great views of water in back room and great entertainment / live music  was going on in the front room by the bar. A must see !!!!
It was a fun experience. The food was great, the service was phenomenal, and they had live music.
Not good food that day.  I’m sure from the reviews, the food is really good, but that wasn’t my experience.  Location and decor was off the charts amazing, but food was not good.
Always great food in a beautiful outdoor setting (weather permitting) and indoor as well. Greta was a wonderful server.
Had a wonderful time celebrating our anniversary at this restaurant. Wonderful, ambience, and music. Had great seating by the window. The food was delicious and the service was excellent.
My overall experience with the pink door was great. The pink door in front of the restaurant was very cute. It had a very nice ambience to the vibe of the restaurant and the food was really yummy
Fantastic food and experience! The live entertainment was a lovely treat, and I appreciated the birthday candle with the cake. Will be coming back to try the lasagna.
Such a great restaurant. Amazing views and even better food! Highly recommend!
The food and service was great.  The lasagna is a must have!
This is such a unique Seattle experience. The food was delicious and the vibes were perfection. Would highly recommend and would definitely visit again.
Their location looking out on Elliott Bay makes this such a great spot for dinner.  Thr food was excellent at a reasonable cost, and service was first class.

Hyped up too much 
Nothing too special on menu, staff was ok not the best bunch. Tables little too close together
Very friendly staff our waitress was very helpful and kind. Food was delicious . It was a fun place to be and we had a wonderful relaxing dinner.
Got a squid ink tonnarelli a chicken parmigiana nn ahi tuna crudo. The chicken parm was cool, although i really liked the tonnarelli n tuna crudo
Food, drinks & service were all excellent! Definitely would return!

Great food! Great Service: Great view!...we had a wonderful experience at the Pink Door. It is one of our favorite stops when we visit Seattle! The pace of the meal was excellent...each course arrived hot, appropriately timed and tasted great! We really appreciate when  the kitchen and staff can make this work! a great sign that the restaurant is functioning as a team. Highly recommend!
Bonnie, our “bar goddess” was exceptional. Along with her enduring personality and exceptional food this, our first stop in Seattle, set the stage for a wonderful experience.

We've been trying a lot of things when we come here, but what I've learned: just get the lasagna. Definitely their signature dish for good reason. It is so delicious! We also had the blistered asparagus appetizer and added the poached egg to start out, which was also phenomenal. Service was friendly and great quality. Always going to continue recommending to anyone in Seattle.
Amazing food and service!  Would absolutely recommend and visit again.

The lasagna was the best dish, truly best lasagna I’ve had so far, we also had the clam linguine and it was so flavorful, we went all out so we also tried the crab Caesar salad absolutely delicious 10/10 would recommended, dessert was great, service was pleasant and spot on, will definitely be coming back when I’m in Seattle again.

We had such a great time with friends.   Ryan was a wonderful attentive server with great recommendations.   The patio was perfect on a beautiful sunny Seattle evening.  Our meals were incredible.  Could not have been better!  Thank you so much!

The Pink Door was a must go on our trip to Seattle because everyone recommended it. They certainly did not disappoint! We were very impressed with all our dishes, and our server was very attentive and friendly. Can’t wait to return!

A surprising find after a recommendation from friends.  
We made reservations 3 months in advance, and walk-in is that evening we’re shut down after and hour due to the long wait, so if able, plan ahead!
More of a Tuscan food experience and some authentic choices along with interesting additions! 
Overall very good experience…. We had the pasta with Ragu. The pasta was super delicate and cooked perfectly, the mean Ragu was very good, and in the true Italian way, they did not totally French the pasta in the sauce - Bravo!!
We also got the mixed seafood dish, all fresh  and cooked perfectly as well!!!
the food was great, indoor seating is a nice environment and outdoor seemed very fun
Great place for a dinner party or date, unique and elegant atmosphere, attentive wait staff and incredible food! highly recommend giving them a try next time you're in the city

The Pink Door is my favorite restaurant in Seattle.  Great Food, new cocktails to try, consistently excellent all around!  This visit was no exception.  The Lasagna, Squid-Ink Pasta, and Tuna appetizer were all amazing.

you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. Seriously. I have been dining at the Pink Door for years and it is consistent and creative . This last visit I had the spinach lasagna, oh my it was divine. Moist and flavorful.  The ambiance is always perfect. The weather also cooperated and allowed us to dine al fresco.
We had a wonderful experience at the Pink Door. Friendly staff, excellent food and ambiance. One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle.

We reserved a table next to the window two months ago. We were seated at a table next to the window with a lovely view and happy as could be. We all ordered different seafood and all was delicious. Good place to go for a romantic dinner, a happy visit with friends, music and fun deco. 5 stars.

Very nice restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. We were seated at one of the best tables with a lovely view of the Puget Sound without our request, probably because they noted that we were celebrating our anniversary.  Great service, attentive wait staff, delicious food, and the nice view all made this a memorable experience. The only negative was the noise level. Because the restaurant was completely booked, the noise level of all the happy patrons talking prevented us from hearing the nice live jazz music well. However, we much preferred sitting by the window rather than in view of the stage.

Wonderful anniversary dinner at the Pink Door! We had the arancini, lasagna and cioppino. All were stellar. For dessert we shared the lemon tart and the rhubarb crisp. Fantastic! Highly recommend visiting The Pink Door when you're in Seattle!

The Pink Door food always astounds. Tons of flavor, presentation is impeccable, and the selection is great. The Pink Door staff were very accommodating to us bringing our own dessert, and I couldn't ask for a lovelier experience with the staff. Amazing experience, would definitely recommend. Make sure to book a reservation!

Love the location of this restaurant. Friendly hostess. I stopped by each time I'm visiting Seattle. I started with their simple Caesar salad and ordered my favorite pasta which was the Pappardelle al ragu Bolognese...comes saucy, cheesy and very flavorful. My husband had the linguine alle vongole with a side of corn off the cob. To his delight, the linguine was loaded with lots of tasty baby clams. Delicious meal and very attentive wait staff. Will be back!

Our first time in Seattle and a friend recommended The Pink Door and wow it was incredible! The location, the choices to sit in or out on the deck and the food divine! Couldn’t help but look around at the eclectic decorating, sip on my gorgeous specialty drink and once the food came it did not disappoint! Flavour, presentation and portion was spot on. The staff was lovely, helpful and very accommodating. We will definitely be returning to enjoy this gem 💎

Very nice and fun. Taking one star off for ravioli (not
so great) & espresso martinis (not so great). All the other food & drinks were really good.
Dinner was amazing. We had a beautiful view, the ambiance was unparalleled and the food was delicious.
Excellent tasting food. Not sure why it is so hard to get in.. Doesn't seem like a place that is 100% full all the time. However the food is tasty.

Gorgeous patio day. I’ve been once before when in town for work, but being back and taking my family was an even better experience. Accommodating to us having two littles. Excellent wine list and cocktails. Halibut and bolognese dishes were extremely tasty.
