Absolutely amazing food! The atmosphere and views are stellar. So thankful we were able to get a last minute reservation but totally worth waiting if they are taking walk ins for the day!
Our waitress was excellent and was very attentive. The food was delicious. I highly recommend it!!
The Pink Door lasagna was delicious! Highly Recommend
We love the pink door. We eat here whenever we’re in Seattle. We’ve never had a bad experience.
We’ve been coming here for many years. Always excellent in every way!

We ate here on our last night in Seattle and what a fantastic choice - the host and team provided fantastic service. The food was fabulous - the pea ravioli wow! Would highly recommend a visit to The Pink Door!
Great atmosphere, fantastic food!  Service was outstanding.
The Pink Door is always a hit! Delicious and beautifully presented dishes, friendly service, and a quirky cool atmosphere. Always a wonderful experience to share with friends. 🙂

The Pink Door has a well deserved word-of-mouth reputation for superb dining in Seattle.  To that should be added extraordinary service.   Never intrusive and always helpful, our waiter was a paragon of his service.   Thanks for that and the wonderful food.
The antipasto platter, mussels & clams, and artichoke spaghetti offerings were outstanding--all solid 5-stars.
Fantastic ambience, back dining room has a spectacular view of the Sound, and service was impeccable. Food was delicious, if rich.  Would definitely recommend.

If you are looking for good Italian based food in Seattle, go here!  I would recommend the Pappardelle Bolognese and the Lasagna Pink Door.  They are both great options.  I had the Chicken Parmigiana for lunch the other day and it was amazing as well.  You will not be disappointed.  As usual the staff is great and accommodating.   Would recommend!
Great outdoor dining experience! The wait staff were quick, informed, and warm. The food was excellent to outstanding.

Amazing service + delicious Italian food with a view. Definitely request the outdoor patio on a nice sunny day! Favorites: Spaghetti Con Carciofi, Lasagna Pink Door, Cabaret Cake aka Boobie Cake and A Trip To The Garden (raspberry cake with rose scented panna cotta), YUM!

Lived up to its reputation!  The fava bean crostini was a revelation.   The Penn Cove clams and mussels were pitch perfect.  The risotto was a tad overcooked - the rice had lost it's 'bite'. The lemon hibiscus tart was excellent as was the 'A trip to the garden' desert with raspberry almond cake and rose scented panna cotta. Would definitely go again.

We had the most beautiful anniversary dinner here. Sarah was our server and she was fantastic. Very personable, stopped to talk when we asked questions,  and had perfect wine recommendations. The food was 10/10. Perfect night!
Delicious food and a wonderful, perfectly paced dinner.

We came here for a Mothers Day lunch and we’re not let down! We just loved the ambience, the decor, the service and the food! The drinks were amazing as well! Can’t wait to visit again! You can tell they use quality ingredients in everything!
We celebrated my neice's wedding at the Pink Door and it was perfect.  Beautiful views, flowers by Pink Door on our table, delicious food and excellent service.  What a perect place to celebrate!

Love this place! The food was outstanding, this place  was amazing. Got to sit on the patio with a view to the water which was amazing. The drinks and the food was great. Mamas meatballs as an appetizer was so good and the lasagna was beyond delicious. The atmosphere I can’t speak enough about. Elise was a wonderful waitress and whenever I’m back in Seattle I’ll visit.  It’s like a Speakeasy turned restaurant, best hole in the wall. 🫶🏽

Food is very good and the deck is lovely. 

Only sticking point -- the staff (especially the hostess) acts like she's doing you a favor  by working with you.
Great experience. Music was excellent. The food was very good and HOT which is a plus. Will definitely return. I had the Pasta Carciofe, the carpaccio was no longer on the menu.
My favorite restaurant in Seattle! It can be hard to get a reservation, but it is always the best experience and great prices.
This place is amazing. Great service, great food, and good value. We had the Arancini and meatballs as appetizers. Highly recommend both. The lasagna is divine. Best in the city. Go here!
As a longtime customer of Pink Door, this visit was a bit disappointing. The food was great. The service was sufficient, but really rushed.
We all loved our food and it was a beautiful day on the patio with great service.
Amazing food, the lasagna in particular was so good!!

We were greeted cheerfully and given update on our table after a short wait.  Table was perfect for us in a corner where we had a view and not too loud.  The server was excellent and the food was delicious.  The lasagna really is terrific!  Pappardelle ragu was delicious. We will definitely return.

Nice cozy restaurant. Caesar salad was refreshing and came with garlic bread. Our only complaint was the meatballs appetizer in marinara sauce was overcooked and dry.  Chicken parmigiana was crispy and cheesy goodness. Clam linguine had lots of clams. Rigatoni with mama's meatballs was awesome. A plate of grilled lamb chops was expensive. Cabaret cake was very good. Restaurant was very busy. We were entertained with live music as we ate that evening. Restaurant provided great service. Hostess greeted us right away. Wait staff was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. Will certainly dine here again!
Great food and service as usual - a Seattle must and mainstay
This place is awesome. Highly recommend. Better have a reservation
A girls get away vacation would not be complete without a dinner at the Pink Door!  Food was fantastic and the trapeze artist was amazing!
Loved the unique setting. The food was great. Service was good. The view at sunset was amazing. We would return.
The dessert was amazing and I got a cocktail specially made and it was not overpriced. Service was great. Ambiance beautiful.
Amazing experience and great service. Very nice and chic environment
The Pink Door was wonderful. The service and the food were amazing. My favorite dining experience in Seattle!
Granted we were in the lounge and not the dining room with a view and possibly quieter atmosphere, but I assume the menu was the same, and the food was...meh. Nothing special I'm afraid.
A hidden gem worth finding. Lovely ambience, delicious food. Book well in advance if possible.
The garlic bread, blistered asparagus, and lasagne are all unreal.
We celebrated birthdays and had an amazing time. Food was so wonderful
Wasn’t what I was expecting by all the other reviews. The meatballs were a little dry in my opinion. However my wife’s salmon she said was amazing. Can’t win em all!
Fantastic place!  Be sure and ask for Sara!  She was our server and was a wealth of information not only about menu considerations but about what to see all around Seattle!  A great place.
Amazing!  The staff was attentive, food was great, and the view from the back room was nice!  Thank you!

I am a longtime fan of the Pink Door!  Had the greatest waitress, always adore the ambience and my all Green Salad was even better than I expected from the description.  Of course, I will be back as soon as possible.
My favorite restaurant in Seattle by a landslide!
Awesome service - amazing food. Especially mussels and clams
Amazing place! Fantastic atmosphere, great food, nice services!!
Amazing, must try restaurant in Seattle. Excellent food, music and vibes. Enjoy!
Phenomenal.
Best lasagne I’ve ever had. Loved the atmosphere and all the food was amazing.
Been eating here for over 40 years and it only gets better!
Workmate in town from Australia. Food & service was excellent. Risotto was done well & delicious!

We are from out of town and we were able to make a late reservation. Our table was up against the stage. The Jazz trio was fabulous. I had the Cioppino. It was cook to perfection. The broth was slightly spicy and was worth drinking at the end. My wife had clams and mussels in a taragon infused cream sauce. Loved every bite. Highly recommend.
As a very picky, Italian foodie, this place is a 10/10
I had high expectations. It was ok for the price.  Expected some sort of “show”.
Food was delicious! Definitely would come back here for a special occasions.

Wonderful
Excellent service.
Amazing food.
Elise is the best !
Amazing food, amazing view, and amazing service! Best lasagna I've ever had, hands down!
Portion is meh. Taste is okay. Atmosphere is great. My server is good but the three hostesses at the door were super awkward. I wouldn’t say they are friendly.

It was my friends birthday celebration. The food was fabulous and the ambience was perfect! We sat by the window so we watched the sun go down. The waiter was kind enough to let us know when the lounge act was happening so we could go watch the show! Such a great place!! I would highly recommend it!!
Always a delight. Incredible food and service. This is our go to for friends and special occasions.

The food is absolutely some of the best around Seattle! The view is lovely on the deck, the service is fantastic, and they have an outstanding selection of wine. This is a must visit for the Seattle area!
Excellent food. Great service. Love this place. Can't wait to go back!
A seattle staple that as a local took me a very long time to try. But a place definitely worth the hype, delicious food, wonderful patio for lunch (when sunny), and just overall a joy to experience.

I hate reviewing things poorly but this was one of my worst dining experiences :( We were sat at a table that was in direct sun and squished. Our legs could not fit under the table. We were facing a rooftop with a loud humming AC to look at. It felt like a forgotten table you’d put an unexpected guest at. Definitely felt like oh maybe these two young people wouldn’t mind being here… but it was extremely uncomfortable. The food was not stand out. The lemonade did not state it would be pink, and the added sugar/flavor was overwhelming instead of refreshing. The bread was nice. Our waitress was nice. When you make a reservation a month in advance, I think you expect more, but this did not deliver.
Enjoyed a Very nice view at window side table, squid ink pasta was a bit spicy and I liked it!
The service was excellent.  We got there early and sat at the bar until our table was ready.  The food was excellent and would definitely go there again if I am in Seattle.
We had a super fun time and enjoyed the food and atmosphere.
Incredible meal. Best clams and linguine I have ever had!

Not cheap but delicious! Pasta bolognese was incredible. Surprisingly light and ever so flavorful. My rock fish was good, but a lot of work to get the flesh from the bones. Definitely a scene - very fun atmosphere.

Absolutely phenomenal! Started with the Tickled Pink cocktail and ended the evening with the Lemon Hibiscus Tart, and everything from start to finish was perfection. I enjoyed a half dozen of the Fresh Northwest Oysters for an app, followed by Ravioli AI Piselli — each bite was more addicting than the last. So happy we were able to dine here on our adventure to Seattle, and look forward to returning in the future. Keep up the amazing work!
Service was excellent, lunch was a limited menu, I would recommend dinner. We had the whole bronzino.

We celebrated a birthday with family over a late lunch. The food and service were excellent. It was a little noisy at first but got quieter after many diners left. We had not eaten at the Pink Door during the pandemic and were delighted to return and have such a nice meal.
I brought first time diners and everything was perfect, as usual.
Beautiful spring afternoon lunch on the deck overlooking the Market and the Sound.  Great food, great wine.  Service was attentive and helpful.
Service was exceptional.  Food was delicious and well prepared.
Amazing experience and amazing food. The lasagna was my absolute favorite
Unbelievable experience! Delicious food out to be able to get in in the middle of the afternoon. The place speaks for itself and the food melts in your mouth!
The service, food, and wine list at The Pink Door are all exceptional.  I had a fantastic table to view the water as well as the dining room.  Highly recommend!
Excellent food. Prompt service. Great environment.
Delicious food. Wonderful service. Lovely ambience. Great view.

The ambiance was incredible and the food was truly the best I’ve ever had! 10/10 recommend the bolognese. Our waitress Kristy went above and beyond to make our experience the absolute best. Her recommendations were spot on. I will be back if I’m even back in Seattle.

I celebrated my birthday in the legacy dining room to enjoy the aerial performance. We were ushered to a table on the bandstand, where we were treated to outstanding service by Eric. 

The evening could not have been more perfect—thanks to everyone at The Pink Door for making my birthday celebration one for the books!
The view was lovely of the water.  The salmon dinner was delicious and the service was excellent.
Seating, service and ambiente very nice, check in somewhat chaotic, no line for reservations, but people kind of falling over each other, food a little disappointing/average, wine very good
It was amazing as always! Thank you to everyone who was involved in our experience. From the server, bartender, busser and of course the Chefs!
Everything was good from the service to food! Will come back!
Was super excited to go and it did not disappoint. Food was wonderful.
It is my favorite place to go whenever I am in Seattle
Always love Pink Door!  Our server was exceptional!!!
This place lived up to all the hype. It was amazing! Every single thing about it was great from start to finish. Our server Pasha was great.
This place has Amazing lasagna!!! I Highly recommend going here. We were able to get a reservation for lunch on open table!!
Atmosphere is great. Awesome chef and the sous. Waiter checks at the right time.
If visiting Seattle and like good dining this is the place not to miss.

Had a wonderful dinner celebrating our wedding anniversary. Everything was perfect. We enjoyed our Caesar salads, the bread and olive oil, our pasta dishes and desserts. Kristy was professional yet friendly and helpful in making our selections. She had a nifty way of attaching the cork to the wine bottle and taught my husband how to do so. We truly enjoyed ourselves and will return!
Everytime the food is great. The standards are always awesome, especially the lasagna! The people that work there are professional and friendly.
Great food and ambience, Great spot for friends or a date

Amazing place! Friendly staff!
Storngly recommend!
We enjoyed!!
The Pink Door is great. It never disappoints. Will return whenever in Seattle

The atmosphere service and food were fabulous.  They served delicious bread for no extra charge.  I recommend sitting in the back room with a view of the water.
It is open for lunch.  It is hard to find good sit down elegant lunch places.
Worth the time spent getting a reservation. Great experience with amazing food and ambience.
The closset I have been to the set  of a Fellini  movie set- we loved the trio
The menu was creative and the food itself was delicious. The service was excellent. Our only regret is that we waited so long to dine at The Pink Door.
Took my wife for her birthday, the food and ambiance were amazing.

Good food that were worth it with the price tag. The ambience is great for a nice date or to catch up with your old friends.  The servers were amazing but perhaps too amazing to a point that sometimes it seems like they won’t leave you alone haha.
Delicious food, great service! My only complaint is it took awhile to be seated even with a reservation.

We came to Seattle for a journey to drive the pacific coast highway. This restaurant was recommended and it did not disappoint. Absolutely amazing. The food and service was out of this world. We had the Ceasar salad, which was crisp and the dressing was phenomenal….not to heavy. We had the bolognese and lamp chips. Wow!! Highly recommend.
It was fantastic and the atmosphere was great.  We had a wonderful view.  The food was excellent.

Had never eaten in the back room and was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was our waitress was awesome. Friendly. Accommodating and great with my adopted grandson making my reunion of colleagues great fun and overall successful. I’ve spent 15 years in seattle and since moving miss it very much and couldn’t think of a better place to rendevoux and celebrate with old friends. Thanks to your whole team. Max

Six of us enjoyed a lunchtime birthday  ~ what a delicious, delightful time! The ambient noise is perfect so that we could talk and giggle and open gifts without disturbing others. Our waitor was very kind and the food was amazing! delivered hot and in a timely manner! I highly recommend the pinkdoor!
Wonderful as always. Very good Cioppino and Spring Risotto & service & ambiance.

We love this restaurant, never disappoints.
Beautiful, Elegant, Magical.
Thank you for another beautiful birthday evening.
Love, Love, Love.
The lasagna is so delicious. It melts in your mouth.  I highly recommend it.
We were having lunch and the occasion was a birthday celebration. It’s a beautiful restaurant with amazing service and equally amazing food.
The Pink Door is my favorite Seattle restaurant over many years. I want to go back again soon and experience the music and a cabaret show!

Wonderful food and wonderful staff! They treated us great and helped us with their recommendations. The food came out timely and the drinks as well. Maybe forgot one thing here or there but they were kind and accommodating. We had a great dinner!
CUTE expos omg. Incredible ambience and food. Wonderful live music from Hopscotch

The food was fantastic and the vibe of the whole place was great. The service was decent, but a few of the servers that kept coming to check in on our table were slightly rude and almost seemed annoyed that we were there.

This was our first time at The Pink Door. We were celebrating our anniversary. They did not disappoint. Our waiter did an impeccable job. He was training a new employee and doing a wonderful job. We were so impressed that management was right in the thick of things lending a hand where needed. The food was outstanding. We are looking forward to dining there again.
We had a great time here. Loved the view of the water from our table. Everyone was friendly and the service was prompt. We really enjoyed everything we had, the food was really great!!!

Beautifully Amazing food with great friends!
Great service….will def be back!

Server pour water on top of my food and didn’t say anything. 
Beautiful place and nice food, but plates were a bit too small for the price.

Food was good nothing extra special. Service was not what I expected didn’t really check in on us. I was done with my drink and never asked if I wanted another one. Luckily there was a person filling water glasses constantly.
Great overall experience. Good wine list Great views. Unique location in the heart of Pike Place.

This was my second time for lunch. The lasagna was our choice, again. It’s just too good to pass up. We also ordered the garlic bread, which was also delicious. The service was top notch. Everyone was professional and courteous. we highly recommend a meal there.
Wonderful experience! Too noisy, though. We laughed about how we were shouting at each other the whole time.

Saturday night 9:45pm. With reservations only one month in advance I made reservations within that first 12 hours of opening, was booked out already 2:45-9:30pm. Lasagna Pink Door was the best Lasagna I’ve had in my life. Perfect atmosphere for anniversary. Some people were dressed nicely. Some were in hoodies. Very satisfied with the experience.

Our meal and wait staff were beyond wonderful!!
What a delicious entertaining evening!!
Such a welcoming staff!!
This iconic Seattle gem NEVER disappoints. The food and service is super great but the dining vibe is simply perfect.
Food was amazing. Great quality and great service. We will be back!
I wish it wasn't so hard to make a reservation at this restaurant.
Food was absolutely delicious and we really loved the atmosphere and the show
They gave us a nice table for our Anniversary. Server was very nice. Food was a little expensive, but good.
The place is really cute. The service was great and the food was super yummy. It gives speakeasy vibes. I loved the concept
Highly recommend! Very authentic taste of seafood pasta

We sat in the new part of the dining room. Our table by the window was magical. Service was outstanding. Food incredible. We haven’t eaten in the indoor portion of the restaurant for years. In every ear, it exceeded our expectations.
The food was spectacular, as was the service however we felt slightly rushed otherwise it would have been 5/5!

When we were looking for a dinner spot for our first night in town, this was one of the most recommended spots. From the moment we walked in, the vibe was very chill and it set the tone for the entire night. The service was great and the food was even better. It definitely lived up to all the great reviews we read.

We're already looking forward to the next time we get to come into The Pink Door. To say the food was delicious would be an understatement. That lasagna is what dreams are made of; absolutely phenomenal. The drinks were strong, but tasty, so mostly just a great value I suppose. The mocktail was also super tasty! The service was nothing special, no reason to come back but also not a deterrent; luckily they convinced us to return on account of everything else.
Your restaurant came highly recommended and it exceeded all our expectations.  We will be back on our next visit to Seattle.
Our server, Dominic was terrific! Food and atmosphere is top notch.
Great meal, great service, well worth it for my visit to Seattle.
The ribeye was amazing, lasagna too! Drinks were decent, waitress did not come by often enough. Would have ordered more drinks.
Always dependable - great food and fantastic service.
You should absolutely go to the Pink Door, nightlight of the trip!
Ok service, terrible food. Food didn't taste fresh.

Love coming here, the food is amazing. Usually have amazing service but the waitress serving us was not very inviting or friendly. Looked at the waitresses at other tables and they were very friendly like what were use to. She also did not read the specials to us. After we ordered is when we heard the specials from another table.

Food is just awsome however the smell of the place can be improved.
Ambience is rustic and decent and would give 5 stars for the good food and great service but 0 stars for smell

Amazing! Third time visiting Seattle. Third time dining at the pink door. We had an amazing time . The hostess was extremely accommodating. Our server was outstanding! Cecile was bubbly, sweet, helpful and had a wonderful sense of humor . Thankyou for a great time .
The best I love it here. Food is amazing and fairly priced. Service is top notch. Views are great.
One of the best lunches I have had reviews don’t lie amazing

I lost a kid blue winter knit hats it has a bear logo on it. Please let me know if you found it.

Thank you,

Gina
The food and service was great! I’d definitely recommend for anyone visiting Seattle

Our daughter is in college in Seattle and we live in Oregon. We’ve had such a hard time getting a reservation whenever we are in town and finally got one! Now I know why it’s so popular. All 4 of us ordered something different and everything was fantastic! The crab Caesar had very generous amounts of crab and was a large enough salad for 2 of us to share. We can’t wait to come back!
First time in the restaurant since before the pandemic and it didn’t skip a beat. Food was fantastic as ever, service was great, vibes immaculate. Always feels like a special treat to stop in here.
Love this place! The food, service and ambiance were all incredible! Hope to make it back soon!
The entire meal was perfect. The service, the view, the jazz band. Would absolutely return!
It was great.  I recommend the fried cheese as an appetizer and the entree as chicken scallopini.  You’ll enjoy it. Hard to find so use your phone to find it.

We are frequent guests at the Pink Door and this visit didn’t disappoint.  I had the Bucatini Amatriciana  something I’ve been wanting to try since seeing it featured on a Stanley Tucci episode.  I knew the Pink Door would be the right place to do that-it was pretty fantastic.
Went here to celebrate a birthday and happen to walk in on a day they had an aerial show.  Make reservations!!  This place will not disappoint.

Very elegant and classical atmosphere, unfortunately reservations for seeing live performances were booked up the butt a month in advance so lunch was all we had. Selection on menu wasn't exactly varied. Crostini ai funghi was cooked like taco meat and tasted like it too, with little to no mushroom flavor. My halibut was quite tasty however the bed on which it rested was lacking in volume, it only consisted of green beans and two large and bland potatoes. My dinner guest ordered the clam pasta and while the clam was flavorful it was simmered in far too much butter, an unfortunate trend that has spread across restaurants. It removes the flavor of the ocean from which it came, a quality that is supposed to be inherent in all seafood. Also our bread got delivered quite late, practically during our antipasti. Also it was cold. The fact that the food safety level in its window was just "good" was also very telling, in retrospect. Oh and that totally funny trend where places don't have signs out front? Totally helpful and chic. Not only was it in post alley but also it had a door that wasn't exactly pink pink, more of a very light salmon. That's just nitpicking tho. Overall, it was alright.

My wife and I stopped by, a little under dressed, for an afternoon bite to fill out our last day traveling in Seattle for the week. As a couple who have both previously served tables and bartended, this location hits all the marks. We tried the Crostini al funghi and Northwest fish to keep it light. Do your self a favor and try some of the wines. The Greco Di Tuffo hit all the right notes to pair with the halibut. Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive. The food outstanding, the service impeccable. Thanks to all the staff
Worth the wait! Super exclusive and beautiful. Our server was amazing and pasta was delicious.
Amazing service, personable and extremely helpful. Food is extraordinary. I don't know how i'll eat halibut the same anymore
Great food, outstanding service and a really fun show.
Great service, incredibly relaxing and fun experience. Food was amazing and the value at lunch is awesome.
Great experience with staff taking care of all the needs

Very nice restaurant for our adult family get together in Seattle.  Food is not foodie creative, but well prepared and tasty.  The back room facing the water was beautiful, had a warm glow to it befitting special occasion. Not too loud so we could have a good conversation.  Live jazz music was a nice touch.  A little on the pricey side but we’re visitors to Seattle and the cost was worth the experience.
One word: Amazing! Everything we ate was delicious.
The ink pasta was tasty, and the fish was really fresh, though a bit underwhelmed because of high expectations.
The whole experience was amazing and the food was fantastic
Great restaurant and even better server- Dominick!
Lovely view, good food, pleasant, efficient service.
We loved it.  Food was delicious and the atmosphere so lovely.
Everything was perfect.  Our server, Domenick (sp?) was incredible, attentive, kind, educational, and mellow.  The food surpassed expectations.  We can’t wait to come back again.

The Pink Door is more than just a restaurant – it's an experience. From the moment you walk in, you'll be transported to a whimsical and romantic world filled with delicious food, fantastic drinks, and live entertainment. Located in Seattle's Pike Place Market, The Pink Door has been a local favorite for over 35 years, and it's not hard to see why.

The restaurant itself is a charming space filled with twinkling lights, colorful decor, and vintage photos adorning the walls. But the real draw is the food - the menu features a mix of classic Italian dishes and Pacific Northwest seafood, all made with fresh, local ingredients. The handmade pasta dishes are a standout, as are the wood-fired pizzas.

But it's not just the food that makes The Pink Door special - it's the atmosphere. The restaurant is known for its live entertainment, including aerial performances, cabaret shows, and live music. The performers often move throughout the restaurant, adding to the already immersive experience.

The drinks are also top-notch, with an impressive selection of Italian wines, creative cocktails, and local craft beers. And the service is always friendly and attentive, making you feel like a welcomed guest in someone's home.

My husband and I were able to have a late lunch at this wonderful restaurant in Seattle. From the moment you enter   And greeted warmly to being seated by a window with a fabulous view we knew what a delight this experience was going to be. Our server Dan just could not have been more helpful as I have quite a food allergy. Our meals were well presented and delicious. Cudos to the Pink Door. We definitely return.
Vancouver Island BC

Had a wonderful table in the old section.  The service was  very good as usual but a bit slow as the staff are all attending to so many tables.  Enjoyed my meal and it was a fantastic experience as expected.
I love this restaurant! I had out of town guests and they loved it too! Food is delicious for a reasonable price, beautiful venue and our server was great. Thank you!

What a fun and quirky spot at Pike Place to enjoy a birthday meal! Our server Elyse had great energy and remained attentive to our needs despite a busy lunch crowd. The food was yummy. We will be back!

we were so pleasantly surprised with our table at the Pink Door.  None of us had been there for years! well, we walked into the renovated larger dining room and the views were spectacular! the staff were super friendly and helpful and the food was so delicious...we had the cheese plate ...the lasagna, parpadelle pasta with rags and the pork panini all of them excellent....you will not be disappointed

I went early because my friends could not make it. They were busy, but the hostess found me a bar seat from which I could see the circus performer who was doing a ribbon-trapeze type act. I can't remember what the apparatus is called. Very talented, strong, and elegant!

The Pink Door ambiance is one thing I have always found classy and charming. The hostess, servers, were very helpful and attentive.

The ciopino was terrific, and the barman brought extra bread to sop up the broth. I have had similar dishes - this was very good - but it was not in my top 3 for a ciopino so I gave it 4 stars.

There a lot of other nice choices on the menu too, at a good value for the venue and quality of the food.

I highly recommend The Pink Door if you in Seattle - just expect that a place this good will be busy. It is in a really touristy area, so walk in service is touch and go.
Good food and service. Nice views. Look forward to returning often
This was our first time eating here. We came because our daughter gave us a gift certificate....but now that we have been, we will be back. Thanks for the delicious meal!
The Cioppino is outstanding!  I could drink the broth.
It’s always a Seattle Icon.  Even better now days.
The food and drinks were delicious. Recommend the Rosemary Vodka Gimlet and the Ribeye.
Never disappoints. Food, service, professionalism always top rate,
Wonderful as always. Lovely setting & service. The Special scallops over polenta was delicious as was pasta ragu.
What an unbelievable experience we had. The food was unreal and on point. The tuna was SPECTACULAR!! I would highly recommend.

This was my first time dining at Pink Door.  It's a challenge to even get a reservation.  But if you do, it's well worth it.  The atmosphere is charming, service is excellent, and the food is amazing.  It was a memorable night.
Incredible atmosphere, service and delectable dishes!

I was very impressed with the Pink Door! It's so hard to get a reservation there, I was worried that it wouldn't live up to the hype! I shouldn't have been worried because everything we had there was fantastic! We had antipasti (half order), kale salad, lamb shank & chicken scallopine and to top it off the strawberry rhubarb crisp! Everything was so good. I can't wait to return! We often go to Carmines, Cantinetta and San Fermo - this was just as good or better! Thank you Pink Door!
Absolutely wonderful, as usual.  The lasagna is amazing.

I have been trying to get a reservation at The Pink Door for months and I FINALLY succeeded!

It did not disappoint! The entire experience was fantastic starting with the hostesses being so welcoming.  Emily, our server, was just fabulous.  She was not only fun and kind but gave us all the recommendations for our menu selections that were perfect!

The food was delicious.  The Rice Balls, Lasagna, Bolognese, and the Almond Cake.  Every single item was outstanding!

The atmosphere was gorgeous and romantic.  Loved it!  Can't wait to go back.
Thank you!
Highly recommend - loved everything we ate! The lasagna is a must and a great vegetarian choice.

Great Service, Amazing Atmosphere, and food was very good (: 

Took my girlfriend here for our Anniversary and she loved it.
Excellent food!! Great view! We would definitely go back.
loved loved loved. made less than 24 hours in Seattle feel very worthwhile

Service is outstanding. Food is always wonderful. Friendly people and good location.
Always enjoy dining at the Pink Door.
Everything was excellent, from the wait time to the view. My server Emily was a real pro who made excellent recommendations. Will return for sure.

What an amazing dinner we had at the Pink Door!! We walked in to the sound of live jazz and were seated, Ryan took great care of us! We enjoyed the velvety Stevens Reserve Cabernet with mushroom crostini-so earthy, crunchy, and delicious! Then the citrus shaved fennel salad with blood orange and olives was bright and fresh. The pastas were sublime-the spinach lasagna and linguine with clams divine! Our only regret is we had no room for dessert! Oh, what a night!

Where do I begin?! Such an amazing ambience for our 25 year anniversary celebration! The small table setting kept things intimate. Our server Ryan was FANTASTIC and the food was flavorful and delicious. We can't wait to return!

I've been here a few times and I really love coming here and I always bring someone with me. I was slightly disappointed because in Dungeness crab Caesar salad, I felt something very hard in my mouth and it was a crab shell. Then after that I felt another very sharp hard thing and it was an eggshell. Not ideal for a $30 salad, but they were kind and offered dessert even though not necessarily something I want to eat personally, but I accepted. I've never really had an issue before.

excellent service from maitre d' when we had to shift our reservation time at last minute plus from our server when we arrived.
food excellent
ambience a little noisy (even at lunch) but we were fortunate to be seated in the waterfront view room which is spacious room

We were running 10 minutes late so we called ahead to inform them, and as soon as we got there, we were seated right away. The food we ordered were all excellent. Our least favorite items we ate was the cold bread and hard butter they serve. The rest of the menu items we ordered, we had no complaints. Reservations are essential because this location is extremely busy! The next time we visit Seattle, we will dine here again.
I’ve been here twice now and I must say their lasagna is the show stopper I love it!

It had been several years since my last visit and I was very pleased to find that the ambiance was still recognizably wonderful. The expanded space is a real plus, and the food and service terrific.  Roll on Pink Door, roll on.

I booked reservations expecting to be able to see the aerial hoop shows during dinner. I was surprised that the majority of the diners (including us) weren't in view of the performances. That was a bit of a disappointment.

All of our dishes were amazing though! We absolutely loved the food and all the servers were lovely.
Lovely ambiance, view, and service.  Great kale salad!  The duck confit risotto was richly flavorful and satisfying, if a little salty.  Wine and espresso were great - we had a wonderful evening!
Great experience - cocktails, food service, atmosphere and ambiance.  Highly recommend - definitely will be a repeat customer.
Enjoyed the arincini and caesar salad. Best bolognese I’ve ever had, will be back!!
The clam linguine alle vongole and cioppino Pink Door were mediocre. I was rather disappointed as I had high hopes for this place.
Great dinner experience at the Pink Door to celebrate our 4 year anniversary. Food was good and ambiance was romantic. They even had a show before we left. Can’t wait to go back.
Wonderful! Excellent—excellent food and service!
Everything was good
Wonderful experience with my mom. Any time I am in Seattle this is a must visit restaurant.
Great all around. Location was incredible, food delicous, and service fantastic. A MUST when visiting Seattle. Cannot wait to return.

Friends were in town for a convention and we were fortunate to get a reservation at The Pink Door. My husband and I both ordered the cioppino and it was amazing - fresh seafood, light tomato broth, with just a touch of spiciness. Others ordered pasta dishes, and the scallops - everyone was very happy with the entrees. Appetizers were a dozen oysters - fresh and delicious - and the antipasto plate, which was large, varied, and yummy. The House Red was OK, but single glasses of other wines, showed some excellent choices. Our server, Emily was great and other service staff were there when we needed them and did everything right. This is not a quiet restaurant, but in the back dining room the noise level was such that we could chat and hear each other. The atmosphere with soft lighting and windows overlooking the water was exceptional.
The evening was a treat for sure- such a beautiful sunset and ambiance.
Had a great time at Pink Door. Can’t wait to come back for the bar!
Loved the food, ambiance and view at our lunchtime experience!
Again… great food, great service! Will continue to dine here….
Great meal with a wonderful atmosphere

Absolutely amazing! We went for my wife’s birthday and The Pink Door did not disappoint. The food was absolutely amazing. I had the scallops and polenta and my wife had the lasagna. Both exceeded our expectations and both were absolutely amazing. It was very evident that the chef was NOT playing and it was greatly appreciated. The lasagna was great and the portions were perfect.

Delicious Italian food that manages to feel both comforting & classic and bright & fresh. Entertainment was great. Service was spot-on. Ambiance was both quiet and bustling — lively but easy conversation-level. Fine dining but comfortably casual (not sloppy, but relaxed) and unpretentious. Obviously a real treat, but also a great value, which is a rare combination. Basically, this place manages to be everything all at once, without overstretching in any direction. There’s a reason the Pink Door has been beloved for decades. It’s a delight!
We loved it. Food was amazing and the atmosphere was fun. Looking forward to coming back again soon
Amazing service, food, and ambiance!! The view was beautiful too!! We couldn’t say enough about The Pink Door! Only that getting a reservation is tough…I know why now!!
Delicious food. Great service, low key ambience,and yummy drinks.
Impresionante! Deliciosa la comida, encantador el lugar, excelente el servicio… volveremos pronto!
The lasagna is great and the ambience!
Fantastic brunch - definitely try the lasagna!
Amazing dinner as always!
It was great! Awesome service and food. Would go back! :)
Always Amazing. I’ve NEVER had a bad meal or experience at The Pink Door. A lot of Tourist. But, my Husband and I love coming for a date night.
The food was amazing! The people were nice and fun. We will definitely go back if we have the chance.

Absolute jaw-dropping aerial performance. Girlfriend and I loved the lighting and ambience throughout our experience. Food was very delicious and filling. Definitely a must if you’re visiting Seattle!
Special meal with my visiting family. Sat in the back dining room with a view of the sound. Service was excellent, food was surprisingly great.

As always the pink door is grest but this time our waiter sucked.  We had a girl tht it was her birthday I caught the waiter and before I could open my mouth he syas.. Let me guess its someone birthday.. I said yes and then he didnt even wish her a happy birthday! The table next to our got that courtesy.  He was the SLOWEST waiter id ever seen there. He was clearly not happy to be there. I wont be going anymore
the server was very friendly and the atmosphere was antique and special. my bf really enjoyed his lasagna. My seafood linguini was good as well.
The service was excellent. The ambiance was so romantic. The food was fabulous. And the restaurant is beautiful. We love The Pink Door.
The live band was awesome. Food had a good variety and cooked to perfection. We had a gluten and egg allergy within our group and there was still plenty to choose from. Will come again.
Pink door is always amazing. Amazing food, amazing service, amazing experience. 10/10 recommend! And of coarse lasagna and clams are a must every time!
My wife and I have to the Pink Door before, but it had been quite a while due to COVID and all.  This was one of the best meals we've had in a long time.  Everything was spot on.
Service was great. Food was delicious. Decor was fab. Drink was really good and strong.

Visiting from New Zealand we booked well in advance of our arrival to Seattle and it did not disappoint.  Food was devine, venue gorgeous. 
Food highlight of our trip.  10/10
Our server was wonderful and the staff was just lovely. The food was exceptional! Highly recommend
Always an amazing atmosphere, and ALWAYS an amazing Bolognese!
Pink Door never disappoints! Excellent service, delicious food, and lovely ambiance.
Best Lasana!! So good

So it's been a while since we were here and since then they have expanded into a larger, less cozy restaurant.  It used to be quiet, kind of dark and a nice place for a special dinner.  Now it's a lot bigger and noisier.  The food is still good and my wife's scallops were excellent.  My meatballs were good but nothing exceptional.  Dessert was a disaster with a burned gingerbread pudding served that was not edible.  We also felt that we were being rushed by our server as she initially came by every couple of minutes just as we were trying to get settled and go through the menu.  I think it will be a while before we go back.
This place just gained a place in our favorite’s Seattle restaurants list. The ambience was great, quiet, great view and food was a classic Italian dish, we will definitely be back soon.
The food was wonderful, and it has the best mood in the city.
To go place for date night. For vegetarians too a lot of good options. Spinach Lasagne was fabulous!

We had a perfect Valentine’s Day! Our server, Alissa was outstanding, warm, professional and checked with us often to ensure everything was going well. Our meal was delicious from salads on down!  Cant wait to to return.
It was perfect
The best restaurant in Seattle! Great food, great ambiance and great service!

Everything from the food, to the staff to the decor was absolutely perfect and I am so happy we finally got a chance to try this location. There’s a reason why their reservations are two weeks out and always booked out.
Waiter with the tattoos and piercings was the best help and gave excellent recommendations. Will definitely be returning !
Great atmosphere, wonderful service, and amazing food!
Ver y good food with great selection of dishes and extensive wine list. Portions were just right.

The food was really good, service was perfect. The waiter was amicable and shared with us the special plates for the day. The drinks were delicious, I ordered the rosemary gimlet cocktail.

Definitively I would recommend this place for a special occasion.
Absolutely amazing! The ambience, service, and food was incredible! Kristy, our server was truly amazing!
Awesome Seattle experience from finding the place to the live music to the food.  All was first rate fun and well worth the adventure.  Will return for sure.

My husband and I LOVE dining at The Pink Door but this experience was above and beyond. We took our time and truly enjoyed the environment, the beautiful water view, the delicious food, and our amazing server, Kristy!

Kristy was delightful, adorable, and completely perfect. She was personable and made sure to honor our desire to dine slowly so we could enjoy the food and each other.
Great table, food and service.  However, the noise level progressively increased as the restaurant filled up.
Fabulous table and I so appreciate it, it is nice to make a request and feel like it was actually noted.   Great server and my guest very much enjoyed the evening.
First time are The Pink Door and it did not disappoint.
The waitress was amazing. Allergies were handled wonderfully. And the food was great
The entire staff was very polite and professional.  Food, drinks, and atmosphere were amazing.

Our serve was first class! Emily was delightful to work with, considering that the four of us had a wide variety of tastes and appetites on that Saturday evening. She helped us pick out the best variety of antipasti, pasta, entrees, and salad that we munched merrily. This was the first time for my friends and I’m sure that they’ll return many times more.
Great food! Incredible people and service. Lives up to the reputation and I’ll be back again soon.
We always love a special occasion at the pink door! Best food in Seattle!
A Seattle classic for a reason.

The atmosphere is amazing and food is very good. Smaller portions but great wine and cocktail selection. Great service. Our waitress had good recommendations and was funny and friendly. Enjoyed our time here and the view. Make sure to book your reservation a few days in advance to get guaranteed a spot. Luckily it was not too busy of a Thursday night and we were able too wait about 30 mins for a table, with 3 guests. Lots of little bars and wine tasting with in walking distance. So it’s easy to stay occupied while waiting for a table.

Call on vacation in Seattle we found this fun place to eat at. Has a cool vibe to it with live music. We had the lasagna and risotto with gingerbread toffee pudding for dessert. Everything was excellent. Would definitely go back in the area.
It's an OK spot to try once based on the location  history, and atmosphere but I likely won't be going back based on food quality and value.
Great food and ambiance!!!!

Showed up 45 mins late to my reservation and they still saved the best seat in the house

Loyal customer for life after one meal!!

What can I say, it was an absolutely wonderful experience from the minute we walked in. The service was personalized and well crafted to our specific ocassion being celebrated. We're looking forward to visiting again and probably get a chance to enjoy the entertainment offered on Tuesday ls and Saturdays. Major shout out to all at the Pink Door!  Food was AMAAAAAZING!
Amazing food, atmosphere, service and quality of food. Great for get togethers and also surprising for kids.

Another lovely evening at Pink Door. Made a reservation a couple weeks back for only time available at 10pm. Came at 8pm and they were able to accommodate immediately and sat us right along the window. Beautiful views of Elliot Bay. Service was perfect. Food was on point and inventive without being pretentious. Just a wonderful night.

This is an exceptional restaurant run by exceptional people. I can't say enough how much I appreciated the care with which we were treated. We came here for a 60th surprise birthday party. The food was fantastic, our servers were thoughtful and helpful and quick despite the busy afternoon. The staff insured that this was the special occasion that we hoped for. Exceeded all expectations. My only regret is I didn't get my server's name because I would love to call her out here. She was spectacular: warm and friendly and clearly invested in meeting our needs.
Amazon service, amazing food. Ambiance great but does get very loud after 6pm. Get a table by the window for Great view of Puget Sound

The Pink Door didn't disappoint. I booked a reservation there during my visit to Seattle and I am so happy I did. The food was spectacular, the vibe was comfortable and the service was great. Our server was very attentive. I would highly recommend.

I was recently attending a conference in Seattle.  I am a huge fan of Italian Food so prior to my trip I started my search for the most promising Italian restaurant.  The Pink Door consistently appeared in every search.  Because of the amazing reviews, I was not surprised with the challenges I faced trying to get a reservation.  I was determined and it paid off as I finally got a reservation online (it may be easier to call in).  My determination sure paid off because WOW, this place is amazing from walking up to this quirky building, the staff greeting my party, wait staff, ambiance and OMG...THE FOOD!  If overeating is a crime, then LOCK ME UP because I could not stop.  Every single entrée my party had was outstanding.  The ambiance was so on point that we just sat there after our meal was done because it was just that amazing.  GO HERE.

My wife and I had a very nice lunch at the Pink Door.  The food was quite good but it was not anything spectacular.  The place was beautiful and clean and our Waitress was beyond amazing.  It was very loud, almost too loud for us to have a conversation.  We are very glad we went but we won’t need to return as there are so many amazing places in Seattle.
Great place and a great view. Food is pretty decent
Phenomenal food, atmosphere and service! Our waiter (I think his name was Ryan) was fabulous! Definitely the best meal we had while visiting Seattle!
Good lasagna, good service will return again in the future.
Went to celebrate a birthday and received poor service. Was made to feel

Oh my, what a marvelous experience. From the near-hidden pink door entry to the classy decor, to the just-right attentiveness, and the no-rush pacing of our meal, I was smitten. And the food! I can’t imagine that any dish served here would be less than perfect, but here’s what we enjoyed: 

I started with the rosemary vodka gimlet and loved it. The tuna crudo was a complex and tasty combination of sweet and salty, and the portion size was ideal for two. The bread was crusty, lovely soaked in the olive oil, one of the best I’ve had in ages. At the suggestion of our server, I had the signature lasagna. Yummy! And not too heavy, and again, just the right portion size. 

We husband gushed over his linguine and clams. I begged for a taste and they were superb. We topped it off with the cranberry tart, not too sweet, and cappuccinos. 

Highly recommend and can’t wait to return.
It was great experience
Place is beautiful and elegant, lasagna and duck risotto are awesome
Food was delicious and the ambience was great!
Incredible food, we ate everything we ordered. Service is incredible as well, and the ambiance and view are breathtaking!
Overall excellent experience! Food was fresh and delicious.
The food was amazing! Service could have been a little bit better

Came here for my bday dinner. My friends hadn’t been here before but Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle! We sat in the front area where they have live music (
I’ve been probably 5 times before and always got sat in the back so I count this as a win!). It was a little bit loud but the music was great! The server was kind of rushing us a bit with our orders, maybe to get our table turned, but other than that he was very nice. We got the Arancini and Garlic Bread to start (both MUSTA), the Paparadelle Bolognese, Linguine w/ Clams, and Squid Ink Tonarelli (Squid Ink was AMAZING) for our entrees, and the Cookies, Bread Pudding, and Coffee/Donut for dessert (the bread pudding was the most delicious think I’ve ever eaten). Their menu is always changing so not sure they’ll always have these items, but just in case! Always planning my next trip to Pink Door!
The Pink Door is unmatched for quality food at great prices and it has a super cool vibe.
The staff was great and my girlfriend had an amazing time on her birthday thanks to that. Love this place!
Absolutely fantastic from the moment we walked in. Great live music, fabulous service, even better food. Everything was well balanced in flavor and high in technique. 10/10 would recommend

Not our first time, worth returning. As usual, we had impeccable service, this time provided by Emily C. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive, without being snooty or overbearing. Every morsel we’ve ever put between our lips, or sip we’ve swallowed, has been expertly crafted. We generally let the server lead us to their favorites, and they haven’t missed yet. (You must have the charred bread with whatever you order.) Tonight, there was a fantastic jazz trio performing, that topped of the experience. Don’t miss an opportunity to open the door when you’re visiting downtown Seattle.
Always a wonderful time at the pink door! I can’t wait to go back!!

This was our first visit in the establishment, was impressed with their food and service. Bonnie made great lemon drops and Emily was attentive and wonderful to be our server. Thank you both. We’re glad we came, in town for the weekend, we came from California, in the LA area.
Our annual holiday lunch at the Pink Door did not disappoint. Our server was relatively new and not as engaging as our past lunches but he was professional.
Delicious black cod, excellent wine, and wonderful service. Thank you for a great birthday dinner for my Dad!
Great experience. We had a table of screamers next to us. They left finally. Food was yummy. I’ll go back again.
The Pink Door is one of our favorite restaurants in Seattle. Our visit on 1/11/23 was as expected, excellent service and food. I highly recommend it. We will be back.
Love this restaurant, especially the main dining room ... lovely! Great service and thoughtful menu. Fine wine selection, too.

Our server did not listen to our order. She forgot to order 2 Chicken entrees and to split the pasta dish into 2 orders and no serving utensil to share it AND we asked for the salad for my wife be server as the first course with our shared pasta for my friend and I.
Chicken and pasta were awesome, but the salad was mostly onions, not good.
Great service, great food!
Great food, great service and the NYE menu was excellent.
Outstanding service The Best waitresses ever Emily !!! Delicious food and beautiful atmosphere!
Food & service was amazing! Live music was not the best
Wonderful New Years dinner!
Excellent Italian food plus they accommodate special diets very well. I have celiac disease and It’s the only Italian restaurant that I eat without any fear of cross contamination.
The ambiance of the restaurant was super unique. Elegant, but in a more relaxed manner.

Anytime you visit The Pink Door, the occasion immediately transforms into a special experience! Our recent visit (Friday, Dec. 30 for lunch) was certainly no exception. We spent a leisurely 2 hours, overlooking the Puget Sound and Pike Place Market. We wined, we dined, we laughed and savored every moment! Staff is attentive, professional and never distracting. Food is consistently as delicious as it is innovative and fresh.
Always a classic choice.
Everything was great - from the service to the food quality.
I returned after a 40 year hiatus, hoping it was still good. It exceeded my expectations!

Another excellent meal at The Pink Door!

We missed the summer menu… wanted to order the vine ripened tomato bruschetta on crostini… but they didn’t have it on the menu so we opted for the porcini mushroom on crostini tonight!  Super yummy!  We took the champagne pink peppercorn vinaigrette that came with our PNW Oyster on the half shell and drizzled it on the porcini mushroom and it gave the app a nice zingy tang!  Jon ordered his favorite Pink Door Lasagna as his main and I ordered the fish special which was three good sized scallops on top of polenta and a frisée salad. Dessert was a super yummy espresso jello like dessert with an ok maple bar. The Christmas cookies were also a delight!  Wonderful meal!
FANTASTIC experience at The Pink Door with a dear friend. Food was incredible, setting was so fun. Already making plans to go back for a romantic dinner with my husband. The vibe is perfect.
We went for lunch while on vacation in Seattle.  The food was really good and it was a cute place right by the market.

I had been been going here for over 20 years (I’m a Seattle original ;)) and it was always been amazing. I hadn’t been since before covid and the quality of food isn’t what it once was (or maybe we hit an off day). The papardelle noodles were cooked a little too long but the sauce was still amazing. The lasagna portion was smaller and barely had any bechamel sauce so the flavors weren’t the same. It was still good but definitely not the pink door I frequented for many years… the setting is great for the location and ambiance but I wouldn’t recommend to out of towners as a must visit place any longer.
First time dining here. Absolutely beautiful restaurant,  so full of character.  The oysters were delicious. Their lasagna was soooo good! Had a great time and will definitely come back for more!

Love this restaurant.  Excellent service and delicious food.  We had scallops as a special and gnocchi with their wonderful garlic toast.  Each bite took time to appreciate the flavors.

We've been coming here for many years, each time we fly into Seattle.  As soon as we book our flight, we make a reservation for dinner at the Pink Door.

Only suggestion I can make is not to order a Manhattan.  They make other drinks that are really good.
Very romantic and cozy atmosphere. Wonderful service. Loved the food. Just a wonderful night.

It’s been years since I’ve had the opportunity to stop in to visit. The Pink Door was one of the first restaurants I dined at when I first visited Seattle 12 years ago. Now that I’ve lived in Seattle almost two years, I’ve been chomping at the bit to go back and since my partner (hopefully soon-to-be fiancé) is visiting Seattle for the first time, I wanted to pull out all the stops to make it an unforgettable trip. Needless to say, it was a success. The Pink Door staff, food, atmosphere, performances, and drinks were nothing short of perfection. A huge thank you to all of you for knocking it out of the park every day.
Service was excellent. Food was perfect.
Wonderful experience, we’re so lucky to get a reservation for our first night in town, everything we ordered was better than the next- the ragù especially is unforgettable.
Wonderful experience. My favorite restaurant in Seattle.

Lunch at Christmas at this beloved Seattle eclectic gastronomic icon.  The ambiance complements the able staff whose personalities welcome and ably curate what’s ahead.  Which is great food simply prepared, with subtle twists that give us amateurs clever ideas.  Oh yeah, love the array of candles ready to join your table.  A treat!
The food was excellent as always and the service was outstanding! The Pink Door is our favorite restaurant to dine in prior to shows in downtown Seattle.
Nice and cozy. Great views and food.
Ryan was our server and we ordered shareable most of which he recommended. Lasagne was fantastic and enjoyed a new wine (a red blend but I can’t recall the label or region).

No signage, really is just a pink door. Great place to visit, especially if ur already spending a day at pikes place. Great drinks and good food, a bit pricey but definitely a fun one to hit while ur in Seattle

Even if you book the dining room, you can indicate on your reservation that you'd like to be seated in the lounge.  Bar seating was wide open the night we were there (Tues).  The aerial dancer cannot be seen at all from the dining room and it's tough to determine when she will be performing.  I booked exactly 30 days ahead of time. On the night we dined, there were many open tables around us...maybe some tables are saved for walk in's.

Food was very good...small portions, a bit pricey, but very good.  Lasagna was the best meal among all of our choices.

Great dining room ambience.

It was magical! This is the third time dining at the Pink Door and each time it’s amazing. We really enjoy our experience. The waitress was great and the ambiance was amazing. It was an awesome anniversary dinner!
Great food kinda noisy views of the sounds are amazing.
Loved pretty much everything. Amazing server and thank you for the view of the sound.

Love the remodeled back room. We had a great table looking out at Pike Place Market and the Sound. The carrots with cardamom cream is excellent as are the carpaccio, duck confit risotto, cioppino and cookie plate. Server was very helpful and gave perfect level of attention.  Overall it was a wonderful celebration for us.

Dined in for lunch. I had the Cioppino and Arancini balls. Both were amazing. We had a window side seat with a very nice view of the market and the sound.  Its a truly special place, a hidden gem. I would like to come back in the evening to enjoy the entertainment.

Outstanding food and excellent service- could not have asked for better! Just wished they would open up more tables for reservations- I got on line exactly 30 days before our desired date (earliest ability to schedule) and there were only 2 dinner options- 5pm and 9:30. The 5 reservation was a little early for a special occasion ( anniversary and a birthday) but that was it.

Absolutely fabulous. Fresh delicious oysters. The bread is fantastic and complimentary!  A Seattle first. Awesome staff. The Pink Door is consistently one of my favorite restaurants. Go and try everything. Brussels are the best. 🎉
Excellent food quality and skilled preparation.  Uneven service which I found uncharacteristic at this visit.
Great service and great server. Food was delicious. Beef carpaccio wasn’t my personal fave but still okay. Really enjoyed our time and definitely would go back / recommend
Atmosphere, food and service were incredible!! Definitely recommend ordering the arancini and gnocchi they are to die for. Will definitely be back soon!
Always a delight. Food, ambiance, service.. everything was a 10/10!  Thank you for doing it again!
Amazing amazing food. Desserts included. Lasagna is so so good. Pudding is to die for
so amazing!! i definitely will be back again soon !
Food was very delicious and great atmosphere. I shall definitely recommend to others

This was our first time at Pink Door and we LOVED it. We went for lunch as it is always so hard to get reservations. It was my wife’s birthday and the food was amazing. We were so happy with the quality of food, the service was amazing too. We will certainly be back again!
A favorite place to eat in Pike Place market area. Delicious food, wonderful service & spectacular ambiance.

We had reservation at 9:15pm. They seated is about 30 mins late. Its a pact restaurant so we expected a wait. They did give is a free app for the delay. Our waitress was very friendly. I got the lamb. It was very tasty. The polenta was eh. I felt  arancini were made with a white rice so they tasted a bit off. Charcuterie board is always amazing. The stars dishes of the night though were the duck confit risotto and steak. The risotto was cooked perfect and duck had so much flavor. The steak was cooked perfectly and also had a nice crust. We ordered the branzino. It was cooked well our only qualms with it was the side dish was a sort of caper/ spinach sauce and it was a placed in a side dish? It was very salty and just a bit awkward. Overall, well worth the wait. Ambiance A+, customer service A+, food B +.
fantastic place.  as always. food is amazing. atmosphere is amazing.
Limited vegetarian & gluten free options. Good ambience and service.

We came in to have desserts and drinks (we got 2 bottles of wine and a few whiskeys) to toast two of our birthdays and somehow the desserts (we had a 3 of them) were not as great as we’d hoped. We also felt a bit rushed as the restaurant was closing (our reservation was at 10pm on Saturday) We’ve had a great time always in the past but this time it felt average overall. Hope for a better experience in the future!
Awesome atmosphere, incredible food and excellent service ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Most incredible food I've had in a while, service was amazing, and the place is decorated so beautifully.
Very nice!
Literally the best pasta I have ever had.
Always a favorite, great food, drinks and atmosphere.
Birthday. They asked whose birthday it was at the front desk but then did not acknowledge it at all. A little disappointing compared to what we have experienced at other restaurants.
Great food and our server, Emily, was awesome. Overall, fantastic experience.

Love, love, love The Pink Door! If you make a reservation, all runs as planned. The food is amazing….never leaving disappointed. This is our second visit and will be coming back! It’s a bucket list dining experience, for sure!
Outstanding. I love the Pink Door!
Went here for a birthday dinner and was so impressed!  Probably one of the best restaurants we've been to in Seattle.  Will definitely be back soon!

Amazing food, service and ambiance! Fun jazz music was playing and the restaurant was nicely decorated for the holidays. Got to try the Arancini’s! Pink Door is worth the hype.

Nearly impossible to get a reservation unless you setup alerts on Glassdoor to notify of cancellations.
Love the place! Just wish it wasn’t so hard to get a reservation.
Great place for a celebration or to gather with friends and family!

Our server Kristy was the best!  She answered all of our questions, was so personable, and really made our night feel special.  The Ribeye was cooked to perfection!  The oysters were the best oysters we've ever had.  Portions were the perfect size.  It was really an amazing experience eating at The Pink Door.

Overall, the experience was amazing. I gave the food a 4 because the lamb shank was very bland but the rest of our dishes were full of flavor. 
Regardless, I will always come back.

So thrilled to hear that the hostess allowed our group to move from the lounge area to the dining room and we ended up having dinner there. Very interesting and healthy portions. However, it was loud in a small compact area.
It was cute
Lasagna was very good but the gingerbread dessert was really incredible. Fun environment too
Best lasagna I’ve ever had. Hands down. So good!!
a very good option for dinnner in Seattle. I would recommend to ask for a table in the dining room that has music live. And I definetly recommend the pink door lasagna!

The hostesses were rude and very bratty. There was construction going on in the main lobby, which probably contributed to them acting the way they did. (Hopefully)

Cool spot, speak-easy style restaurant. Ambiance was fun, and our waitress was great! Food was good and eclectic.

I can’t give it a 5 star rating because of the treatment and first impression upon arriving. That just set the tone and was hard to come back from.
Such a fun environment! They got us in earlier then our reservation time and the food was quick and tasty!
Amazing food and service! Best food that I had in Seattle all week!
Kicked off a birthday weekend in classic Seattle style
Dan was very helpful in wine selection and food.  We had the duck confit, a fine Italian wine and cocktails.  Dan deserved his big tip!
40TH ANNIVERSARY
My date and I have always had a vert pleasant experience at the Pink Door. It’s my friend’s favorite restaurant and always asks to go for her birthday.
We had a wonderful time! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone, anytime of year!
Everything was divine.   I can see why this place has been around for years and years.   The view is terrific too.  Must go again!

We enjoyed our meal at the Pink Door. The younger staff seemed irritated to be there, but out older server redeemed the day. We ordered the mushroom bruschetta. We didn’t find it very good. It had an odd taste and texture. We both ordered the lasagna. It was absolutely delicious. The portions were rather small and we definitely could have eaten more. That would have been my only complaint.

Fabulous dinner!
Such a beautiful restaurant.
Lovely warm ambience, delicious food and superb service!
5 stars!!
The food was amazing. We had the arancini and it was great. We loved the sauce it came with. Also loved the bolognese and lasagna. Heavy dishes but delightful in the winter.
The food was really good. Friendly staff and an aerial artist to boot. How could you ask for more!!

The Pink door is definitely a top-tier restaurant in Seattle near the Pike Place Market. We had three different dishes and dessert, it was all extraordinary. We will definitely be returning to this wonderful restaurant.
We always enjoy going to the Pink Door.  It’s a toss up between Boca and the Pink Door.  Very nice atmosphere and the food is always great.
Really great restaurant in a really great location.  We liked the lasagna so much we ordered another to share.
Amazing food, service, and ambiance! My absolute favorite restaurant in Seattle!
Amazing! Been a few times now and will continue to come back!
Went for my birthday. We got an awesome window seat! This was the best Italian food we’ve ever had! I think our waiter was Dominic and he was awesome!!
Always an amazing experience!

We had a table of 4 to celebrate my Bday and it was the perfect spot for it. The interior has a romantic design that sealed it off with a nice view on the dinning side. They were playing old school R&B which I wasn't expecting it but was fun to listen to while we sipped on the new fall drinks. The cider hot drink and old fashion were the winners! We all had pasta, entrees and free desserts (compliments by the chef) so we left SUuuuuper happy! Will def be coming back for the show this time!

Performance was spectacular. The hostess made sure we had seats with a great view since we were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. Food was great - and they even had some vegan options for us! They were able to accommodate. Wine selection was pretty big and decent prices - a couple bottles were well priced if you are on a budget. Overall great ambience and experience.
A cool little lunch spot on a rainy day. Great authentic Italian food. Great service.
Excellent service and ambience. Loved the antipasto plate, mushroom crostini and vongole pasta. Meatballs were just ok. Will go back to try more seafood dishes!
Always a favorite… never disappoints
Amazing performance, spectacular service, and they can accommodate vegans!
We had a lovely time! The food and drinks were delicious, the service was quick, friendly, and not over-bearing, and the ambience was warm and welcoming. Would gladly go back!
If this was my final meal, I’d be 100% satisfied.
Excellence all around.

From the hostess to our server, they were all very nice. Very good communication and gave us the best quality service. The food is to die for! I ate the lasagna, it literally melts in your mouth. Let’s talk about the aesthetic inside. Super cute! Very cozy and warm.
Great spot for parents in town! Loved it!

Had my 5th Anniversary dinner at The Pink Door. My husband ordered the ribeye as his main course, which was cooked to perfection. I had the autumn risotto. We ordered the pumpkin cheesecake to go. EVERYTHING WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. My first time here, but will not be my last!

The Pink Door has always been on my list, now the opportunity. It was to be the wife, daughter, and myself, but daughter became ill. Tested negative.  The two of us took the BI ferry over for wife’s birthday. Took a cab to Pikes Market ($15+5) and then walked Post Alley so we would be sure to know where it was. Finally found it so we decided to wait there (45 min. early). She had a spiced apple cider (10.00). We got seated and ordered Arancini and a Ceaser salad. The Arancini was divine with the thick tomato based sauce with the warm Calabrio peppers (menu said spicy - no worries). She thought the salad was slightly underdressed but fresh and good. For dinner she had the Bolognese and I the Lasagna. Both were outstanding. I usually order the Bolognese as my benchmark meal for all restaurants, but fortunately for me I got the best of all worlds because I got to finish hers. Both were outstanding but if I had to choose I would order the Lasagna. Let’s not forget the bread. If it were bread and water and they served that bread I'd become a bank robber. Amaretto cheese cake for the birthday girl and the apple cinnamon caramel with vanilla gelato for me. Both exquisite. Our server KG was wonderful. Professional, friendly, gave perfect recommendations. We had reservation for 3:15. Seated 3:20. Left 5:23. Walked back to the ferry. Perfect for us as we got home at 8:05. The only thing we missed was the entertainment. Total bill under 150.00. Right around 200.00 with parking at ferry terminal, ferry tickets, cab, dinner. Well worth the wonderful experience. We will be back.

I would highly recommend the pink door for any special occasion or dinner to treat yourself. Incredibly atmosphere, great views, helpful staff and of course delicious food that is well prepared. We will definitely come back for another special occasion.
Amazing food, amazing atmosphere, amazing experience… expensive though! Overall worth it & I’d definitely recommend if your in town visiting Seattle.
Great service and great food - recommend adding the truffle fries even though you will be full. Bolognese was the best I have had.
You are very good ❤️
Dominic was awesome and the food was great! Ahi tuna was crazy good and the lasagna is my new favorite. Not too noisy at all and the atmosphere is really nice. Love the decor and the warm setting.

I’ve had the pink door lasagna which was my fave, perfectly balanced red/ pesto sauce amongst green spinach layers & cheese, the meatballs are absolutely amazing..heavy seasoned with a slightly chunky marinara. The arancini balls are perfectly fried filled with a seasoned mozzarella sitting in an arrabiatta type sauce..The mashed potatoes! Omg the mascarpone greatest addition ever texturally and taste wise if you like a nutty sweet cheese hint. The squid ink tarttalle very good pasta Al denote, a seasoned breadcrumb mix atop a few huge prawns and cauliflower tossed in there..they’re bread and oil, legit sour doughy a bit but the oil with a tinge of lemon rounds everything out

Beautiful view and ambiance, with excellent service and good food. It is not compliant with regulations for access for disabled people however, so I would advise them to be transparent on their website and advertising that the only way in and out of the restaurant is a staircase. My friend with a walker struggled, and a wheelchair would have been impossible.
The Pink Door is one of my favorite!  Superb, creative, innovative food, gracious service, high energy, fun ambiance.
Pink door never disappoints!  Another great meal in the beautiful new dining room!!
Need more vegetarian options.  The only reason I gave the food a 4 star rating is because the clams I had were gritty.  I did let my server know and they compt’d a desert which was very good.
First date, 20th anniversary. Now an annual dinner. And yet it is always so good. Thank you for another amazing experience. Next year for our 25th. See you next November.
They were amazing. Food was fabulous!
Our server, Dominic, had great recommendations for appetizers, entre, and dessert. Very friendly. Great vibes. Hope to come back on a night where they have trapeze.

Bolognese pasta was cooked to perfection. Caesar was uncut romaine which we personally aren’t a fan of. Gluten free bread was just slices of toast with olive oil, for $4 — definite pass. Drinks were so so. Ambiance was there but to us it just isn’t anything special. The fact that reservations are booked up a month in advance, good for the restaurant. They’re truly doing something right and people do love it. Just personally wasn’t worth the hype in our opinion.

The Pink Door is my daughter's favorite restaurant and we went there to celebrate her birthday.  I have Celiac and must eat gluten free.  They do not have a gluten free menu, but our server was very knowledgeable about which items I could eat safely.  
I ordered their gluten free pasta with bolognese sauce.  It was delicious!  The live music in the bar added to the fun atmosphere.
Loved our time there.  Great place. Great food. Great service.
Love this place!!!  Amazing ambiance, great food, super service!
Our late lunch at the Pink Door was a wonderful experience and we look forward to coming back again in the near future.  The food, service and over feel was amazing!

Food was fantastic. Atmosphere is brilliant. Wish we would have had a different server. Pappardelle bolognese was amazing! Also loved the butterscotch budino dessert. Arancini were great but should be served with marinara instead of the weird spicy sauce it came with.

Food was fantastic but portions and accompaniments vary. The portion of lasogna was small with no accompaniments. While the ribeye steak was huge and served with mashed potatoes and sautéed mushrooms. Server, took a while we to get to the table but was very attentive once she arrived. Overall, a great dinning experience.
The Pink Door never disappoints!  Their Caesar salad might be the best in Seattle.
A great place. Good food, experienced and professional staff, outstanding location, fun
Always a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience. The Pink Door lasagna is our favorite!

Booked a table a month prior - got up at midnight to do so - hopefully to be close to the live jazz session, however I suspect this is a marketing gimmick. The live music was in their front dining area. Our table was as far back into the rear dining area as possible out of sight of the jazz trio. Hard to hear any of the music - although piped - over the background babble. Tables were also quite close together. 

Food was mediocre, arrived fast. We were in and out in less than 1-1/2hrs. Great if you like to be hurried. The special scallop dish was a root dish, with caramelized onions and small bay scallops ‘mixed’ through. Not what we were expecting.
This was my first visit to The Pink Door - loved it! Our waitress, Sara, was amazing and the food was delicious. I'll definitely be back.

Fav! Fav!!
Mamas meatballs
Branzino
Eggplant penne
Clams
Garlic bread
So so so so good!
