Waitress was fantastic.  One of the most charming spots in Seattle and a great value too.  This restaurant deserves the high accolades it receives year after year!

Everywhere we read before making this reservation said that the shows run from 7-10 so made only reservation available at 9pm later than I ever want to eat. Then to show up and find that on certain nights the show ends at 8:45. Very disappointed. Also beware the Arancini have vinegar in them which was NOT a nice surprise.
Great experience and amazing lasagna. Pumpkin cheesecake was super sweet but tasty.
Waitress what somewhat friendly. Asked her a few questions about dinner options and she was very vague with the answers.
Loved this place from top to bottom the entire experience was amazing.
The food and service here was amazing.
My favorite place to eat in Seattle. They have the best Bolognese I've ever had! I've been dining here for years and they're only getting better and better!

Waited for a reservation for a month but so worth it. Amazing food and drinks! My husband said it was the best lasagna in his life and he is hard to impress. Hard to find at first, small door in the alley with no sign. Our reservation was at 9pm on a Saturday and they had an aerial show that just ended when we walked in. Sad we missed it. Wish we knew about performances beforehand. But either way, we will be back for sure. This is my new favorite place!
So good! Loved everything about it. The service was amazing. The food was outstanding.  Such a great night out
Amazing food, service and experience!
My Bearbies Birthday:)

Great dining atmosphere, delicious food, great drinks, the best wait staff and a jazz band playing live while dining. Couldn’t have been a better night. The lasagna was our favorite of the three dishes we ordered but all were delicious. Highly recommend The Pink Door.
Excellent all around
The service and the food were excellent.  Perfect mid-day lunch.
Food was delicious. The lasagna was amazing and so were the old fashioneds!
What an amazing dinner experience! The lasagna was fabulous and it’s still the place that makes the best espresso martini!
The Pink Door never disappoints!  Food is excellent, service is too.

We always make a reservation here when we are in Seattle.   Great service and food.

Ceasars salad had a little too much dressing but overall everything else was fantastic!

Such a treat of an evening! Delightful ambiance, the server had personality for days, so much fun, helpful, sincere.  The food was so so good, we joked about coming back the next day for lunch during our short stay as we really just wanted to try it all!  Could not have had a better night!
Goodness gracious, the Pink Door is AMAZING!  The food was fantastic, our server Kristy was PHENOMENAL, the location and the ambiance are out of this world.  Five Gold Stars!!  I highly recommend!!
Amazing food, ambiance, service and experience. A wonderful night so spend a special ‘date night’ out in Seattle.
The Pink Door is a very special place that transports you back in time to when dining out was an experience and not just the means to a meal.

We always visit while in Seattle and this trip was the best yet! Excellent food, service and entertainment! My husband and son had the squid ink tonnarelli which was amazing! We shared the cheese board supreme and I had the celery, mushroom, fennel and parmigiana salad. Perfect!
Amazing as always. Best lasagna. Delicious cheese plate. My favorite in Seattle.
Always great food & a great server made the experience even better.
Delicious food and great service!
Anniversary - wanted dinner but could only get lunch reservation.  Turned out so great.  We will try dinner next time!

I always love The Pink Door year round, but especially on Halloween which is my birthday.  It's so great that the wait staff dresses in costumes.  This year was very fun to afterwards go into the Pike Place Market and see all the pigs.  You are a Seattle landmark!
Amazing.  Great food, great service.  Really interesting atmosphere.  Will be back repeatedly
The Pink Door never disappoints. The atmosphere is pure bohemian awesomeness. Service is outstanding, food is heavenly, and the price is surprisingly affordable.
Excellent service and excellent food

We had a very nice time. It was a combination business/pleasure lunch.

The food was fabulous and the atmosphere was very nice. It was a little loud when the restaurant was full so it was a little hard to hear each other at times.

Thanks!
Great restaurant experience, with fantastic food and an awesome view. If you get lost, just look for the light pink door!
Our waitress was cheerful and friendly! She made our visit one of our best! The food was delicious, as always!
I am obsessed. Our server was wonderful. The food, the drinks, and the ambiance was everything I had hoped for. I would go back 100 times and still not be satisfied.
Worth every penny. Lasagna is amazing. Best thing on the menu. Oysters could be better but not a deal breaker.

The lemon vodka cocktail was perfection, the view of the Pike Place market was lovely, service was exceptional, and my pasta dish was perfect. I had the pumpkin pie with meringue on top and I loved it. I will absolutely be back!
Great food and good service
Great overall… as a local I was worried this would be a tourist trap, but this was simply good food, great service and a wonderful view !

Pink Door was a very nice dinner experience. We celebrated my friends birthday. We got the Arancini as an appetizer and was so good. My friend got the oysters and they were decent. We both ordered the lasagna. I was a bit skeptical since it didn’t have any meat but it was delicious so completely recommend. We both ordered drinks. I got the pink door mock tail and was too sweet for me could have done without it. My friend got pear vodka drink and was decent she could have done without it. We both tried their cheesecake but it was decent as well. Overall good experience.
Excellent food in fun atmosphere. Highly recommended.
Wonderful.  Our table looked out to the water and along the pier.  The food and service were amazing.

Three pm reservation, we were tabled next to the window within minutes of arriving. Great view, quiet area even though most  tables were full.   
 The food was great - I had the bolognese… my favorite - it’s perfect every time.  We were all happy with the quality and freshness of the food.
Dominic our server was always there, not hovering but  there when we had a question or request.   Wicked smart and funny.  Great staff and service  from entrance to exit.   
I love this place!
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Love the new dessert items! The pound cake with house made marshmallow was delicious. We always love the ever changing menu and trying something new. Such a great place for our special occasions.
Everything was excellent, as always, but the pumpkin pie “extraordinaire” was aptly named, it was extraordinary.  Not to be missed if it’s on the menu.
The most wonderfully pleasant experience! We made a reservation and got a lunch with wonderful views.
Completely lived up to expectations.
Wonderful experience! Loved every moment💜

We had a lovely late lunch  with a foggy view of Elliott Bay. The service was excellent, the food delicious. We had beet salad, crostini ai funghi, meat balls and linguini alle vongole. The food was ample and reasonably priced. 
Can't wait to come back.
The Pink Door never disappoints.  The service is outstanding and everything on the menu is as good as the next
Excellent overall!

I booked my reservation 30 days in advance (the furthest out you can book a reservation) to ensure my husband and I got a table for our anniversary. We got sat right away, but at a table in the middle of the restaurant, on a walking path and next to a booth with a noisy group. The server wished us a happy anniversary, so they knew it was a special and romantic occasion, thus the disappointment in the table choice. There was an available 2-top next to a window that would have been so much better and I should have asked to move, but didn't. 

The service was really wonderful and I could tell there were managers walking around to make sure everything was running smoothly. 

The appetizer was fantastic, but I was disappointed in my main dish. It was the squid ink pasta with shrimp and the pasta was good, but the shrimp was coated in some really salty, basic seasoning that didn't pair well with the pasta at all. Overall, just too salty and not fresh tasting. The house red wine was good. 

I was especially excited about the Jazz music, but it was playing in a different room than we were sat, so I didn't get to hear it.  We tried to sit at the bar after our dinner to enjoy the music, but there was a wait to be seated at the bar. 

Most of these issues could have been resolved with me specifically asking to be sat at a different table, one that could hear the jazz music, but I still think they should have chosen a better table for us. Also, the hostess was not very friendly. 

Loved the decor, ambiance, and service!  Shrimp and table choice could have been improved. Hope this is helpful to future diners!
Great spot for a nice dinner, a bit too loud for a special occasion.

The food was phenomenal - we had oysters, meatballs, arincini, lasagna, clams, and the apple dessert. Recommend every single dish. Our server anticipated our every need, he made solid recommendations, and was present without being overbearing. The ambiance is perfection and felt like we had been transformed as soon as we walked through the unsuspecting pink door.

We stumbled upon The Pink Door while exploring Seattle. We were lucky to book a table online. The food was amazing and the view wonderful. What a wonderful last dinner we had before heading back home to Australia.
Great food, great service & everyone was friendly!
I have been a faithful customer for over 40 years. Consistent quality in a unique and special setting.
Belle at the hostess stand is lovely and an asset to the restaurant!
Fantastic dining experience. I can’t wait to go back.

Even though I was only a party of 1, I received a requested window table with a lovely view. Maria was wonderful and made great suggestions for food and beverage. Had a half dozen oysters on the half shell with the balsamic ice (which were tiny, but the best I've ever had), and the almost requisite house spinach lasagna. The lasagna truly lived up to the hype. For dessert, my Whiskey Budino arrived with a birthday candle. It was just perfect, light and decadently rich at the same time. Glad I stayed up very late one night to make sure I got a reservation as soon as they opened up for that date.
My favorite restaurant when in Seattle! Amazing experience overall!
It has taken us many years to get a reservation at The Pink Door because it is so popular. It was a treat to finally go there. When we left it was packed with people waiting to check in.
Amazing experience. Food, drink, and service are all top notch. Savannah the server was incredible!
A favorite place when we are in Seattle

Our dishes ranged from outstanding (penne fumo), but served lukewarm to good (canary rockfish) so I am at a loss to explain why it is so difficult to get a reservation here. The food quality is variable and the noise is close to deafening so why book 30 days in advance? There are many other places with equally good kitchens but requiring far less effort to land a reservation.

The Pink Door is nothing special. We got the Ahi Tuna appetizer which was good but didn’t have a lot of flavor. There aren’t just a ton of options as far as food. My husband had the lasagna which was just okay. We like meat sauce and it had none. I couldn’t decide on an entree so I had the three meatballs. They were good but definitely dry. I’m surprised that this is considered one of Seattle’s best restaurants!
Great food and service! Nice outside tables
High quality food, deliciously prepared.  Service was warm, professional, perfectly attentive.    This was celebratory meal and the Pink Door made it memorable.

I would say it's a hype!!  I am not sure why people ranting and raving about this place, but I can truly say it is overrated and a tourist trap!  We heard and read reviews from Vlogers, TripAdvisor's, local eateries, etc., so we made reservation to be sure we get a table without waiting on a weekday.  It's only 5:30pm and there is a crowd with RSVP and walk-in.

Menu selection is mediocre at best.  I have dined at quite a few Italian restaurants in the major states throughout US on west coast and east coast and this is not even closed.  We ordered 3 dishes to try.  The linguine w/baby clams (in the shell) was too salty and not even served hot when the dish was placed on the table.  The risotto was very bland and not worthy of risotto.  The 3rd dish was the spinach lasagna and this was the only dish I would say it's good.  The pasta melt in your mouth with the right balance of sauce, cheese and pasta.   

Desert - Tiramisu is not on the list!! What kind of Italian does not serve Tiramisu?  

Wine list - We all know restaurant charges 3 to 4x the cost of a bottle but even that, the selection was not that great.  One would think in the Pacific Northwest, especially Washington, there would be many great options, but nope!  A $68 bottle tasted like table wine that is less than $15 from Costco.  They also have some of these gimmicky drinks that look nice, but I doubt it's worth it.  Which is why we settle for a bottom of red.

In short, I would recommend folks go to other Italian restaurants such as Blu Sardinia (Redmond) or Spinasse in the Capital Hills district.

The service was excellent and the food was delicious. They found us a table even though I had the wrong night for our reservation. We enjoyed the wine list and thought the flavors were wonderful in our meals. We hope to go back.
Great atmosphere, great service and great food.  The Beet salad is not to be missed. I will definitely eat there again!
One of our favorite stops when in Seattle.  Solid.  The Porketta sandwich was off the charts
Savannah was brilliant!
Fantastic!  It got a little chilly out in the patio, but it was still lovely!
Great food, service and atmosphere.  Perfect date night.
Wonderful food and very fast service. Would go again.

We love the Pink Door. It's our go to for special occasions. The food can be a little inconsistent at times, but the overall experience is always first rate.
We look forward to returning.

Our only complaint is making a reservation at a reasonable hour is extremely difficult. I'm sure you've heard this before.
The waitress was superb! She understood her customers.

Great service. Perfect way to celebrate my son’s 
21st birthday.
We had a great experience at The Pink Door! All of the food we got was amazing. Definitely reccommend the Lasanga or the Linguinie Alle Vongole.
So so so good! The lasagna and risotto were the absolute best we’ve ever had.
Just a beautiful restaurant with great service and great food.  ❤️
Fun restaurant with amazing food!
It was planned for a birthday and they forgot about it.
Wonderful lunch experience.  Service was noteworthy with prompt attention yet never feeling rushed.

We had made reservations a month in advance. We were looking forward to our visit, especially for the live entertainment as we’d heard amazing things. We arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation. Our reso time came and went, and we were told we’d be seated shortly. No problem, it happens. When it was finally our turn to be seated, the hostess very quickly began leading us to our table. I tried to catch her attention by calling out to her once I realized she was taking us really far back into the restaurant. She either couldn’t hear us (most likely, as it was fairly noisy) or didn’t care to listen. I asked her if we could sit in what we now knew to the the ‘lounge’ as we had seen two 2 person tables cleaned and open when we walked by. She said that would be fine, lead us back to a table in the lounge. As she was about to offer one to us, another hostess was bringing a couple to the same table. The other hostess was quite rude and said no, I’ve already offered it to this couple (a couple who walked in mere minutes before we were to be seated; and online their lounge access states first come first serve). We asked about the second table, only to be told it was reserved for a large party coming in (website says they do not seat large parties between tables or groups over 6). It didn’t make any sense. We were offered another table near the back of the bar, which would give limited viewing of the entertainment. We wanted to see the entertainment, so we chose this over the back dining room, but then had to wait an additional 15 minutes to be seated. This was our biggest gripe - lack of communication between staff, and the fact that we had arrived early, been waiting a long time with no complaint, and felt brushed aside for others coming in after us. Our service from then on was just ok. Food was really good. When performances started, other patrons would move around, often standing directly in front of us. Staff seemed to encourage this. Overall experience ruined.
Excellent 👌👌👌👌👌
The rabbit was delicious, and the entertainment was spectacular!
Great ambiance, good value and excellent food. The Pappardelle Al Ragù Bolognese and the Ahi are amazing!

It was the final night of our honeymoon.  Everything was great!  I did make the reservations 30 days in advance and I’m so happy we did.  We had the best seats in the house on the stage.  The performances are short, but very cool and entertaining!  We were able to see 2 performances and I would go again.
Our server Cristina made a fabulous r ending even better!
Great food and drinks with Nice views.
Dinner with friends
Very delicious
Weekend trip to Seattle
Eating outside on a sunny day is a great experience! My halibut and my friend's pork sandwich were delicious, and the service was outstanding. The Pink Door never fails to live up to expectations.

I love the eclectic look of the restaurant. The Cioppino was flavorful and cooked perfectly. They served just the right amount of bread, which was excellent. I plan to return to try more dishes. Service was well-timed and friendly. A very pleasant experience all around.
The place is nice and cozy but doesn't live up to the hype when it comes to food.
Best lasagne ever! Every dish had such well developed flavor. We loved it.

Outdoor dining space was very nice.
Food was good.
Service was friendly and knowledgeable.
Would return.

The ambiance and service were excellent! We had the most enjoyable experience with our college son and friends. I enjoyed the spaghetti with bolognese and my son had the risotto, which was also delicious. My favorite thing we ordered was the bruschetta. The tomatoes were super fresh and flavorful. We will definitely be back!
Food was delicious and service was attentive, friendly and informative.

Excellent service by Nora in a new dining room for us. We appreciated the quiet corner. Enjoyed the wine, lasagna without sauce, pumpkin ravioli in brown butter sage sauce. A very nice birthday celebratory evening. We return again & again from Texas.
20th anniversary
AS GOOD AS ALL THE REVIEWS SAY! Did not disappoint. Order the lasagne. Get there early if you’re trying to walk-in.
Excellent as always!  Great food, service and views.

Excellent service, incredible food, eclectic ambiance that still brought the element of class and fine dining I was looking for. Pink Door was an overall incredible experience. Only wish I had arrived earlier to sit in the lounge and watch the performer!
Unique experience with a show and outstanding food. Reserve ahead.
Food was so good and the service was excellent. Was happy to be able to see one of the shows for the aerial. Great time!

Restaurant was difficult to locate for a first timer with no external signage. My bloody mary was served with rim of sugar rather than salt, but was replaced when i mentioned it to my server. Overall service was fine and food was excellent, but noise level was high in the area we were seated in. Tables appeared to be very close together so that definitely contributed to overall effect.
Norah was the best! Food was great as always 🎉 sunny relaxing lunch before heading to the airport 💐
Great spot, delicious food, loved our server. Would certainly return.
Anniversary
Incredible! The ambiance was perfect, the food was perfect, the service perfect. I am sad that we live out of town & cannot come here every week! Thank you!

Even though the outdoor patio was closed, they kindly sat us outside. Given that my partner is currently undergoing treatment for cancer (and has a compromised immune system), we were greatly appreciative. Also, the food and drinks were excellent as always. Thank you!
Amazing food and ambiance.  Not over rated- it’s fantastic!
We love the Pink Door so much! It’s an amazing restaurant. Every time I have gone, I have gotten the lasagna. The lasagna is literally melt in your mouth good. The other dishes are great too.
We have been going to Pink Door for years. Always excellent service and food!
Loved it. Took my daughter and her boyfriend for a special occasion and they had such a lovely time. Now one of their favorite date night places in Seattle.

The food was fabulous. I have celiac, but had a safe pasta meal, GF bread and an antipasto that was amazing and did not get sick. The server was really nice, attentive and helpful with my allergy. I can't remember her name unfortunately, but she was great!

Overall great experience!
I would for sure go back.
Delicious food and jaw dropping entertainment. I’d recommend this spot to anyone visiting Seattle!
I had the linguini with clam sauce and it was fantastic. We were able to also see the aerial ring show and that was really excellent as well.
Favorite summer place in the city. Wonderful food, attentive, engaging service, and fabulous owner.
The food are excellent. They are super good. Usually I don’t like Italian food much but this place has been impressed me.
It was beautiful day so we were able to enjoy the deck and view! The food was superb as was the service. Have never had a bad expreince and would highly recommend to anyone!
Always look forward to this when in Seattle and nice to see Bell at the front!
The food was great and our server made it better!!
We loved the restaurant. We had a great seat by the window & my daughter & I enjoyed our dinner, & the show.
We went for lunch and everything was fresh and yummy!
The food was absolutely delicious and the service was wonderful, will definitely be going back next time I’m in Seattle.
What an Ace venue. Food was amazing. Staff are attentive and service was impeccable. Lovely bougee vibe.
Phenomenal table service and great food!  The main dining provided an excellent setting for our dinner!!!
The Pink Door has amazing vibes and the ambiance is beautiful. Our waitress Sarah was very knowledgeable and attentive. We would definitely go back!

I’m Italian and not a a fussy one when it comes to food. Eclectic atmosphere, very, very crowded, uncomfortable to make your way through, seated on top of one another and food that for the most part was just acceptably good,  nothing special, felt too busy, the waiter was wonderful but then forgot to give us silverware after our food was served. Skip this place unless you’re into hip restaurants that don’t have a sign out front, just the pink door, look out, there’s a lot of stairs.

Went to pink door for our anniversary and everything from the food to the service was outstanding. We love the patio space and our server (Ryan I believe) was personable and offered many great suggestions! We’ll definitely be back pink door never disappoints!

Excellent food and service. A bit noisy but very fun atmosphere. Good antipasta plate and caprese salad. Lasagne was so good and my husband loved his mussels and clams. Definitely a great find. Made reservations 30 days in advance.

We had an amazing time and will be visiting again in the future. I really can't say enough about how wonderful the food, service, and atmosphere is. Unforgettable and made celebrating our youngest going off to college extra special. The staff is incredible! Make a reservation, you won't be disappointed!
Fantastic experience. It was our anniversary and we sat at a table by the window. Great ambiance, service and food!! Recommend !!
Always an enjoyable meal and an iconic setting. Warm service and classic cuisine.
Above and beyond service! Everyone was nice, orders were accurate,  food timed perfectly. Wonderful experience on a Tuesday evening!
Perfect night
The service was fantastic. The food and drinks were fancy but not fussy exactly what we hoped for . Lots of fresh local ingredients.

The deck outside was the perfect place for an end of summer dinner.   The food was amazing, the servers wine recommendation very good, and the eclectic wonderful atmosphere inside was so delightful.  One of my favorite Seattle spots

Overall just lovely. The ambience was white tablecloth/paper topper upscale, warm and inviting. The view was nice and the server charming and welcoming. 
I’ve been going to the pink door for three decades and happy to see they’re still thriving.
Very pretty.  Spaghetti and meatballs were delicious. The wine could be better
I’ve been dining here for over 30+ years and it never disappoints and has always been consistent on every level. The food is creative, delicious and beautifully prepared.
Travel to Seattle
Fabulous service,  inspired food, and a lovely environment.
So good and we got free dessert! The acrobat was fantastic.
The Pink Door never disappoints! Every dish is made with the best seafood and with the best ingredients. I love the Pink Door!
Great service with knowledgeable wait staff. Ambiance was great as was the Ariel performance. Food was delicious!

Great experience! The service was fantastic and the ambiance was everything you can hope for. We were able to see one set of the arial performance and she was incredible. 
We tried a few different cocktails, all of which were amazing. Specially I had a watermelon beverage and it was so good. For meals we had the risotto and the fish special (seared tuna)- literally melts in your mouth.
We hope to return again!

Changed our flight after securing a reservation and so glad we did! The food was fantastic….the antipasto, bolognese, and saltimbocca chicken were palate pleasing. Loved the tapenade, the mozzarella and haricot vert on the antipasto plate.
Everything was phenomenal

The best seared ahi tuna special ever! Simply prepared and finely presented. One of the most delicious seafood meals we have ever had! Love the space, love the vibe, loved overlooking Pike Place Public Market while we ate.

I've waited a lot to explore the food here. Must say that everything tasted amazing. We were here to celebrate an occasion. Their patio is a perfect place for a sunny day. Loved the food and the ambience.

Lasagna and Tuna were amazing and so we're our cocktails. The only catch is to make sure that you get the reservation in advance. Totally worth the money.
Food, service and ambience was fantastic. Would definitely go back
One of the best restaurants in Seattle. The food was amazing! I highly recommend
Great menu. Loved the appetizers. Excellent service too!
Excellent service from Dillon our waiter. Specific recommendations that were accurate and made for a delicious meal! Ambiance was excellent, and overall we had a great time at the Pink Door.
Cute place. Food was delicious! Need a reservation! Service awesome!

We went to the pink door twice within a week. Both experiences were very good especially the second one where in the evening we sat in the dining room with lovely water views. The bruschetta, lasagna and bolognaise were all excellent.

Have always loved TPD. It’s still amazing, but I think our orders were off tonight. The fig starter is A+. But the mains were good not great tonight. 

The risotto was 8/10. Nice, I was happy, but it wasn’t as robust as TPD usually is. Not overpowering, but flavorful. Same for the fish special—salmon. 

We will be back, and it certainly wasn’t bad. It was a good experience, just not amazing as We come to expect. 

With that said, Dylan, our server, ambiance, and experience were fantastic. 

We were outside, loved it and the weather was wonderful!

Still highly recommend!
Food was amazing, had the pink door lasagna and it was perfect. All the employees were nice, but our waiter was a bit curt which was disappointing but other then that was great.
Excellent food, salmon special and the lasagna were standouts. Excellent staff as well
Delicious!!

In heart of Market district - great location - inside is quite nice atmosphere, funky vibe - with live music - but also features a large outdoor, covered deck - with a nice view - for those seeking an outdoor dining alternative.  Friendly service.  Food is good - not NY/NJ metro Italian food good - but good.
Absolutely amazing experience. 10/10 would recommend.

Arrived a few minutes before reservation and they took us back and gave us a choice of table. I had requested a window table, but had only got the reservation a few hours before, so felt lucky to get in. As we walked through restaurant to our table, we could see the patio ( would have been a perfect spot, could hear the music), the area by the stage would definitely be my choice next visit. Would have loved to see the entertainment. Food was incredible,  service was top notch. Will definitely go another time. Only thing... that door ain't pink, it's peach.
The appetizers were average but the main course items were excellent.
Excellent food, wonderful service, knowledgeable about the excellent wine selection, and an overall great dinner experience. The entertainment begins around 7-7:30
Terrible experience!!! Food was terrible!! We left hungry bc our food was burnt!

This is among the best restaurants my wife and I have ever been to.  The food and service were outstanding. The atmosphere was charming and flat out fun. Be advised the place is hard to find. There was no sign or address numbers on the building. Google maps got us there.
Loved everything about it. The patio terrace was beautiful quiet. Sever a delight. Lasagna best I ever had.
Very interesting
outstanding food and great service. Always a joy to go there.

Fantastic helpful waiter who stopped to chat to us and let us eat our meal at our own pace. We were seated out on the deck which was nice but having seen the inside restaurant I would have preferred to be in there - the ambiance seemed to be better inside. The food was all delicious.
This is a go-to whenever I have family or friends in town and it NEVER disappoints!
I live here and this is one of our very.favorite restaurant. We've eaten lunch here many mzny times and everything we've  ordered has been perfectly prepared. Wonderful anbiance and superb service

This is an extraordinary restaurant at medium affordable prices. The service was spectacular, extremely friendly in a casual to formal atmosphere. Great place for a meal with a very good friend! Their secluded patio is especially nice on a warm day. We shared a generous roasted figs and prosciutto appetizer, and had wonderful main dishes (a crab, prawns and corn risotto that was original and superb), and a great basil/raspberry layer cake, plus coffee and two glasses of wine for under $180 (including gratuity).
Birthday for husband
Amazing dinner accompanied by outstanding service by our waiter.  Can’t wait to return to try the rest of the menu !
Dominick was a great server! He was attentive and polite. Our food was delicious!
Amazing! Our server was so sweet and knowledgeable
Had a fantastic time! Food was fantastic and the ambiance was even better!
The patio atmosphere was great.  The service was prompt, very friendly and on point.  The food was exceptional.  We would highly recommend The Pink Door to any and all.

On my recent trip to Seattle, I ate at 6 very nice restaurants…..but this was the best. Best lasagna I’ve ever had. But please put up a sign. I must have walked around the block 3-4 times before I had to ask someone where The Pink Door was. And the door doesn’t look all that pink. Nevertheless, the restaurant was fabulous. Wonderful ambiance, great service and really good food!
Wonderful as always
Some of the best Italian food I’ve ever had. The lasagna alone is worth a repeat visit.
Excellent service. Food was good.

The Pink Door is a diamond in the rough.  The staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean and the meal started out quiet but we had a table of four sit next to us so it was a little louder.  The wine recommendation was wonderful and was the meal....lasagna and my husband's pasta was outstanding.  We highly suggest if you are in the Pike Farmer's Market area to give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.

Me and my friends have been coming here for years, and the food I always amazing. Last night our service was incredible, and the food was as amazing as always. The lasagna and bolognese never disappoint.
Everyone at the Pink Door, from the hostess to the server, made our anniversary extra special :)
Great, creative Italian food.  Our meal started with bruschetta topped with a farm fresh heirloom tomato and each dish was better than the last.  We will be going back!
This place was spectacular. The service was great and the food was amazing. We tried the bruschetta, pappardelle and summer in the NW rissoto. We would most definitely come back.
Sat outside, great service, delicious food.
Had a great time! Love the view food was amazing!

We’ve been wanting to go to The Pink Door for quite some time now but they were always booked up and now we understand why. The servers were amazing the ambiance was great and food was so fresh and delicious, that olive oil was to die for! Everything about this place impressed us and we cannot wait to make another visit. It was the perfect way to end our summer.
Consistently great, and this visit was no exception!
Very unique location.  The food was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely recommend it.
Beautiful jazz music playing, amazing appetizers and entrées. Overall ambience was very romantic. Server was very nice and helpful with choices. Always love getting in when we can!

A shout out to our server, Stefanie, for the excellent service. Location is really great - nice views. Lots of menu choices.  The ONLY complaint was that our food was not served HOT. There is something not great about eating steamed clams when they're not steaming, as well as chicken and pastas, etc.  Otherwise, a wonderful dining experience.

Nice location, ambiance and food.   Everything was well presented and tasty.
The restaurant had a bit of a raunchy smell throughout.
Amazing food outstanding service. We love dining here :-) great referral from our kids lol.
Love this place! Had a party of 7 including 3 out of state guests. We all had something different and everything was excellent! Staff has been fabulous on the occasions that I have dined here!
Patio is perfect seating for a summer day and food and service were excellent
Amazing experience. Food was great, service was good and the ambience was lovely. Will definitely be back!
The Pink Door deck is the perfect spot to be on a summer's night, everything delicious and beyond lovely service. It's a gem!
Havent been in awhile and service and food was amazing!!!

We were excited and hopeful for our meal with The Pink Door but we're disappointed. 

Upon being seated in their outdoor patio section we were immediately uncomfortable because of the heat, the patio is located between two buildings so there is no breeze and the restaurant does not have any fans. The lattice roof does not do enough to provide shade and the patio was full so the crowd didn't help either. The cutlery and water glasses were dirty at our table as well which was disappointing.

The food was fair but the heat made the meal difficult to enjoy and it wasn't as good as we had expected based on the reviews. 

Highly recommend making adjustments to the patio for hotter days, IE, fans or limited seating. That was the real issue with our experience.

We enjoyed a lovely 3 course meal here and a bottle of wine.  The staff were all very attentive and friendly.  Unfortunately, we didn't get to see any of the alternative entertainment but it did not spoil anything.  We would recommend this place to anyone - a superb Italian restaurant with a twist.

Very nice ambience and a must visit restaurant in Seattle for the whole experience. The shows they organize are incredible. We got to see the trapeze show and it was so much fun. Food is delicious and meatballs are a must try.

We loved the atmosphere, service and food!  A very eclectic restaurant with outstanding views. We had the caprese salad with the sea salt added a great touch.  My wife had the chicken sambuca and I had the pappardelle bolognese which both were some of the best.  We ended the meal with the tiramisu which was a great way to end the meal.  On our way out there was a performer did a napkin ribbon routine.

We were a little disappointed.  Based on everything we read we thought we were going to a romantic dinner with a show.  The show was in the other room which really was not a show.  The restaurant was bright and filled with kids.  The food and service were good.  It was just not what we were expecting.

I was lucky to get a reservation during our short trip to Seattle!  We were seated after a few minutes  when we arrived and got a table outside!  The weather was great late August and we got the view of the water too!
Our waitress was so nice and she answered any questions we had.  We got a salad to share, my hubby got the salmon special and I got the seafood cioppino.  They gave us a bread basket too.  We shared a tiramisu for dessert!  There were lots of people around but we still managed to carry on a conversation.  Overall it was a great experience!  We didn't order pasta dishes so we were not too stuffed which we like!
I highly recommend it for the experience, customer service and ambiance!
Beautiful ambiance and great food
Great server and great food!
Excellent Northwest seafood and Italian dishes served in a charming setting overlooking Elliott Bay and the Pike Place Market.  It never fails to delight us when we dine there.
Great food, great service, an incredible view and ambiance
Our first time sitting in the front room with water view …  It was so charming and we loved it! Staff was sweet, attentive and efficient - food was amazing!

Pink Door is fantastic! Unpretentious and welcoming service combined with beautiful food and a comfortable but tasteful venue made our experience more than we could have hoped for. We plan on revisiting again and again. Thank you for such an amazing experience!
Our favorite place!

Overrated food .. we’re vegetarian .. the lasagna was the best .. but ordered other dishes which were average .. the cocktails were limited in variety , but good .. wouldn’t say excellent .. the service was excellent and location wonderful .. we had booked for 3pm meal as that was the only time available..desserts were good ..

Loved the menu!  The salmon special was FABULOUS!  and the salmon was cooked to perfection.  (That never happens at most restaurants.)  It was such a fun and lively atmosphere.  The service was wonderful!

The tomato with mozzarella , salt, olive oil and some feta was excellent.   Tomato was firm, sweet, and meaty. Really great. The cioppino was just ok. It was not exceptional and the seafood was a touch over cooked. The risotto was pretty good but probably not worth the price. All in all mains were a bit disappointing and tables were too close and you could hear next door tables conversation very clearly.
Excellent experience on this return trip to our Seattle favorite.   Celebrating 40 years and they clearly know what works.  Get a reservation if you can!
A return visit after 10 years confirms this classy restaurant is still a wonderful place to dine!
Amazing experience! View, cocktails, food and service!
One f the best dining experiences I’ve ever had. Will definitely come back for more!
Went here to celebrate a birthday and oh my gosh, the food was incredible, the ambiance was great! I will 100% be coming back. One of the best restaurants in Seattle I’ve ever been to!
Awesome. Amazing. Wonderful. Fabulous. Yes. Vibey.
Good dining spot in Pike Place area but reserve early. Lasagna & their olive oil infused with lemon served with bread are superb.  We bought a bottle to go.
Great ambience, very creative space and lovely service. Food was delicious.

The ambience was cool, the view was nice, but the food was just ok for the price. Ordered the pasta special and the lasagne. It was ok. Not bad but not amazing. Portion sizes were on the smaller size. The mocktail was very good.

Very enjoyable meal with fantastic service.  There were many menu options. Our server was timely and informed us of a delay immediately.
If you have not visited the Pink Door 
This summer do so before the patio closes.  It’s a beautiful setting and the food and service match.
Best outdoor seating downtown Seattle. Festive, fun, pergola so it's not too hot too. Enjoy a cold drink, interesting appies, or great pasta.
Fantastic service!
Yummy food. Good people watching. My husband and I played a little guessing game called “who here was born into money, and who came into it later in life.”
We were only in town and able

Brought friends here for a Birthday lunch. Their first time. Food was outstanding !!! The bruschetta is Killer Good ! Sliced perfectly ripe tomato on an olive oil soaked grilled bread !!! YUM ! I had the grilled salmon special. Excellent dish ! Dan was the perfect server ! Good wine list, Kiara picked the right wine to compliment the fish dish. We will go back soon !!! Cheers, Ed

The Pink Door is always a delight, especially on the patio in summertime.  Our friends’ lunch yesterday was spectacular!  Service was relaxed,  and all the food was wonderful.  My all-time favorite in the summer is the heirloom Caprese salad. So delicious!  Bread and excellent olive oil started our meal.  We extended our stay with a cup of excellent coffee.  A delightful afternoon with women friends.

This is the 5th or 6th time I have dined at the Pink Door and am happy to report that the place is still "fine dining" in downtown Seattle. This is 1 of my favorite restaurants in Seattle and we shall return. The only 2 issues that arose were: 1) the owner will not let staff serve butter - you get olive oil (like it or not). I love olive oil with my bread but my wife prefers butter; no big deal; that's the prerogative of the owner but I feel that if a patron wants something (i.e. ketchup with his / her filet mignon) - they should get it - no questions asked or faces made. 

2) the cioppino my wife had was very good but was a bit lite on the fish and shell fish (at least 3 mussels were shells only and the small piece of Rock Fish was - well........small!). But to give credit where credit is due, they simply took that off our bill (but with no apology). We would have gladly settled for a very small additional serving and would have been happy to pay. 

The ambience is very pleasant and the service was very good. The restaurant was full by the time we left (mostly tourists I suspect) so they are nit hurting for business. Book in advance!

I have been frequenting The Pink Door since the mid 1980s and was delighted to return for the first time in a long while to find that the quality of food, service and overall experience remain top-notch.  Really among the top restaurants in Seattle. They have a lovely outdoor area which is a must-do on sunny days.  During the evenings there is usually some interesting performance happening on a small stage.

Pink door is a Seattle classic and does not disappoint when it comes to food!!! Cheese board was the bomb!! The best lasagna I’ve ever eaten. Also the meatballs were so good. We were also lucky to get a reservation when the performance was happening so loved watching the trapeze artist!
We were really hoping to get the tiramisu but it was not on the menu for the summer.

The food and atmosphere were outstanding.  We sat in the bar area next to the outdoor seating exit door(not the best table).  I would not recommend this table because there was a lot of traffic and also people coming in from outside to see the show. The people coming in stood in front of you and blocked your view of the show.  I will have to say a staff member tried her best to keep this area clear during the show but it got a little crowded.  So if I had to do it over again I would  try and get a good table outside or in the main dining room and walk up to see the show like everyone else. The food was OUTSTANDING!  I would highly recommend putting The Pink Door on your list to eat at if your are in Seattle.

I was really excited for this restaurant, but I think it fell a little short of what I was expecting.  The basil lemonade drink I had tasted weirdly super salty and the risotto was also pretty salty.  The saving grace was the Amaretto cheesecake.  I think for how hard it was to get a reservation to the prices, I just expected more.
always, Pink door is my best Italian restaurant! especially, Pasta is amazing and really delcious!
Cumpleaños

Our second visit in 2 weeks and both were times everything was as good as it gets!  Both times we had Lexi as our sever and she is fantastic!
The Linguine Con Vongole, soooo good and the Lasagna with spinach pasta is a must.
Wonderful good and service
Fantastic food - not one dish disappointed - and a beautiful room!
Fantastic! Great for any occasion. All of the food was incredible and the views were stunning.
Great place for date night or with fanily and friends. Staff were friendly. Food was fantastic.

The online menu needs to be updated. 
I was really looking forward to trying the tiramisu.

Food was amazing as always. Appetizer was forgotten and our server barely paid attention to us. Expected the service to be great but it was a bit poor. Disappointed knowing this place is always held to a high standard.
Terrific as ever.
Iconic restaurant, don’t miss the food and the view!
Great ambiance, delicious food (don't miss out on the lasagna) and drinks, kind and attentive service. It's a lovely spot all around and I'd love to revisit.
Food was fabulous and service was very good. The band and atmosphere was great. We really enjoyed ourselves.

Best restaurant in Seattle and it’s not even close. I’ve been eating at this place for years, yet they constantly tweak the menu to keep it lively and the food is remarkably fresh. Seafood Risotto is some of best ever. Service is impeccable.
Amazing meal. If I ever find myself back in Seattle I will go again.

Terrible service.
No draft beer despite menu.
Food was mediocre, didn’t stand up to East coast Italian.

With the pretentious vibe this establishment puts out, they do not deliver an experience deserving of their overall attitude.
Disappointed for sure.

As always Pink Door exceeded my expectations.  Thank you for the lovely table on the deck.  Our wait person was cordial & personable.  She was wearing the perfect orange dress with flowers - so PINK DOOR! Sadly I had to hear her deal with the idiot at the adjoining table who was sooo put out because he couldn’t order a beer “on tap” - apparently, the system was down, but he just couldn’t bring himself to order one of  your bottled beers.  Meanwhile, the table to my right, brought their sweet guide dog … after giving their 4 top waters she made sure the big lab (who tucked in seamlessly under the table) was accommodated with a bowl of water.  Thankfully, the beer deprived diner was in & out in just 45 minutes.  Our lunch was delicious & everyone on your staff is ever so patient - from the front of the house - to the wait staff - as  the hoards descend on the terrace on a sunny day.  Jackie, if you’re still at the helm congratulations! I’ve been coming to your place for over 25 years & it’s the best! Sorry, for going long. Ciao!
One of the best restaurants by the market!  We love eating in their deck.  Food is always great and service is excellent!  Punk Door us the best!

Everything was top notch! We went to celebrate my partner's 30th birthday and what a way to celebrate. Our server was personable and took great care of us. The food was incredible, we powered through being full just so we could finish the last few bites. The wine selection is quite impressive, and we got an amazing view of Elliot Bay from our table. Would highly recommend an evening at the Pink Door, it's fine dining while being welcoming and unpretentious.
Really amazing food and hospitality!
My favorite restaurant for over 25 years. Consistently a wonderful experience.
Souper tête à tête

As always, we thoroughly enjoyed our outdoor patio dinner at the Pink Door.  Delicious food (love the lasagna), wonderful service with just the right amount of attention, and the additional factor of a perfect Seattle summer evening.

Absolutely incredible!  If you are in Seattle, this has to be on your bucket list!  We were visiting there and looking for a nice restaurant to celebrate a birthday at.  I'm so glad we went!  Be sure to get a reservation if possible!

Loved this place! So charming, friendly staff and fabulous food! I had an awesome linguini with clams and my guy had   Seafood Risotto…. We both said next time we visit we’re gonna have each other‘s dish 😜😂 The grilled gig antipasto was amazing! No room for dessert but next time ….
Simply amazing. This restaurant was highly recommended for a reason!

Was in Seattle for a night for a girls weekend. This restaurant had great reviews. Food was fine but nothing special. There are only two vegetarian options and we tried both. The burrata pasta with tomatoes was good but simple (i.e. can make at home) and the portion was small. The service wasn't great, we had to pour our own wine (which is fine but speaks to the caliber of the service). I had to ask a few times for more dipping oil - wasn't sure if the waitress couldn't hear me or wasn't listening. We were intrigued by the live entertainment but the trapeze artist performed once every 30 minutes or so for a few minutes, so hard to catch it as were sitting outside. Was yelled at by a bartender for taking a photo, though no one said when we arrived not to take photos!  The dessert was awful - we had the basil raspberry cake and it was dense, small, and not that tasty. Wondering if it was a bad batch because the cake itself didn't have great texture. The alley where the restaurant is located is beautiful and was cool to discover it but wouldn't go back to this spot.
Delicious pasta dishes and drinks! The outdoor patio was lovely.
It was a very pleasant night at the pink door. The place was fantastic and the food was amazing!
Terrific place with friendly staff and a great outdoor seating atmosphere

This has been my favorite spot for any special occasion for the past 14 years I’ve lived in Seattle! Gorgeous decor, amazing food and Bolognese to write home about, and the live music nights make for a perfect evening.
Have been going to the Pink Door forever! Still love it

First time in Seattle and had gotten a recommendation from a friend that had to visit The Pink Door.  It did not disappoint.   Atmosphere was romantic overlooking the waterfront.   Our waiter was fantastic.   Food was delicious 
You can’t go wrong
Anniversary

Always a showcase of NW food located in the heart of Seattle’s best place: Pike Place Market.  Food is expertly prepared and presented in a fun way.
Don’t pass up a cocktail if you are one to imbibe in creatively crafted drinks.

Cheers Pink Door…here’s to another 50 years!
Fabulous meal, excellent service, beautiful ambiance. It’s our favorite restaurant!
Always the best quick seating - best in house. As single guy they didn’t sit me in far away table . Great service !

You need reservations or the wait can be long for walk-ins. The average lunch meal is $23. They have a beautiful outdoor patio and an indoor room that looks out over the water Staff is awesome an dthe food is very good.
Incredible! Such a memorable meal

Food, service and value were all outstanding. Have eaten here many times over the years and consistently excellent experience. Ask for an outside table to enjoy the view of the Bay and the Olympic Mountains
Excellent fig, goat cheese, and arugula appetizer. The flavors complemented each other perfectly. The pappardelle with bolognese was also very good, as was the peach cobbler with vanilla gelato.

Pescatore was excellent!! Al dente linguine with the freshest mix of seafood. The cherub cocktail and watermelon mocktail was also very refreshing. We came to celebrate a friend’s bday on a weekday, weather was perfect for outdoor seating. Our server was also very friendly and efficient.
Food came out cold. Clams & mussels we ordered did not taste  fresh at all. A ghost of its past.
Perfect outdoor dining, perfect service and food! Fresh and delicious! I will always return when I’m in Seattle and will recommend The Pink Door to everyone I know!
Came here on my birthday for a date and our waiter took such good care of us and the food was obviously amazing, as always
Perfect, waitress was excellent. The weather was perfect. Food was perfectly prepared.
Always a great pleasure to dine on the deck in the summer.
A charming place with great service and delicious food. What more could you want??!

Fun decor. Very good food. Great olive oil. 

Appreciated open window seating. 

But - Somewhat too noisy for easy conversation.
It has been around forever and continues to get better with age.
Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle! It’s always fantastic and the service is top notch.

The food was amazing! The arial show was fun and unique, the atmosphere was high end without being pretentious, we walked in off the street hoping to catch the show and the hostess made room for us even though they were booked. We can back for dinner and our meal was to die for! Can’t wait to go back again and try the different menu next time!

This is my 1st time having dinner at The Pink Door and our experience was SUPERB from the vibe, to the service and to the food. I love everything we ordered ( Lasagna , seafood and their special pepper) and for sure we will come back once we visit Seattle again. Great Job The Pink Door!
Amazing performer and amazing drinks! The ambiance was so cool and I would definitely recommend to anyone!
Great location, service and food
Great atmosphere and ambiance, however very expensive for the quality of the food. I would avoid the bruschetta at all costs.

The food was amazing- we got  the antipasto starter, lasagna and spaghetti with  meatballs for main courses, and the gelato assortment to finish.  There is entertainment, we came for the aerial show. The acrobatic woman was graceful and beautiful. Our server was attentive, friendly, and efficient, just like the old days it was wonderful. Great experience!
I enjoyed everything except for my actual meal and wine, crab salad was too dressing heavy and crab was mulch with no flavor, would definitely come again but just order something different.
Best food and customer experience!

Come to the pink door for the food.  I came looking for the arancini and the spaghetti carbonara.  Little did I know it's only available in the fall / winter.  However, I was not disappointed in the summer menu.  I ordered the bruschetta and the Flank Steak Tagliata.  Both were excellent.  Love this place.
always happy with the pink door! lovely time, lovely food, my partner and i had a great anniversary lunch :)
Wonderful staff and very nice wine selection
Amazing food and drinks overall. Everything we tried was Amazing. Spectacular service will definitely come back when we visit Seattle again.

We had a wonderful evening. Our food, waiter and servers  were great. When checking in I realized I made a mistake when booking and somehow booked In September by mistake. The host graciously fixed the error and let us be seated anyway and it was much appreciated.

I haven’t been to the Pink Door for years time doesn’t skip a beat. It was a beautiful day, we sat on the patio enjoyed the fig appetizer, delicious cocktails, the chicken saltimbucco, and the gelato for dessert. Service was excellent. Can’t wait to go back.
Great food, great service and lovely setting.  Would very very highly recommend.
This was a special belated birthday lunch! I loved the antipasto and look forward to coming back! If the weather permits, the deck is a wonderful place to dine.
This is one of the very best restaurants in Seattle.  The service, ambience, food and care are remarkable.

Was an awesome experience. 
Definitely will  be back
Excellent service and food. Great ambiance too

We were in Seattle boarding a cruise and decided the PINK DOOR sounded interesting. Amazing experience! Finding a Pink door in an alley was quite the adventure. The lasagne was recommend as a favorite and it definitely was something special! The ambience is eclectic old world Italian and we loved every martini and every bite!!

Our first visit to the Pink Door was worth the search.  We walked past the entrance 3 times before we walked in.   Didn't see a sign, and the door color is a faded salmon.  But never mind.  The ambiance was a kicky eclectic, food very good and view even better.    We'll visit again.
Good food but portions are too small for the price.
Love love love
Perfect evening in every way!
Great Italian food, great atmosphere!
The lasagna was just ok. The Bolognese has a long way to go. I have eaten way better at Il Terraco Carmine.  Service was good but not excellent.
We had a wonderful dinner at The Pink Door. We started with fun cocktails, the bruschetta & tuna crudo. All were great.  The table then had a variety of entrees & all were amazing!
Amazing service and the food was so good!  We’ll be back!!

Great restaurant with beautiful outdoor seating , had the lasagna and was good but nothing to write more about￼. Would eat here again in future maybe order a special next time or server recommendation.
This is one of the most enjoyable and cool dining experiences we’ve ever had. Thanks so much.
We ate on the patio which was beautiful but if you’re looking for ambiance, I would definitely recommend eating inside!
Our waiter was so friendly and the food was incredible!

Visited to celebrate my parents coming into town. Made a reservation the day of (a Tuesday night) and was able to get a table in the main dining room (the lounge was fully booked and goes quickly and early). Waitress was attentive and kind. The noise was bustling, but not overwhelming and good for conversations. Completely passed the clean plate test and will be finding a reason to go again.
Favorite meal in Seattle!
First experience and it was great. Great drinks and great food!

Italian dishes good but not excellent. 
Prices slightly on high side
Service good
I would recommend making a reservation. If you like beer, there aren't many options, but plenty of wine and liquor options! Food was fantastic and well portioned.
Fabulous food!!!! The bruschetta with great tomatoes, seafood risotto and lasagna were outstanding!,

Beautiful restaurant. Comfortable yet elegant decor just a half block up from Pike’s Place Market. Food was excellent. I highly recommend The Pink Door lasagna. It’s vegetarian and oh so delicious with thinner lasagna noodles and three different sauces that blend so well together. It’s amazing. I went with a girlfriend and her two daughters. They ordered chicken saltimboca, shrimp Caesar salad, and spaghetti and meatballs, with a side of corn with Calabrian chiles. Only little thing was the shrimp were a bit dry because they were overcooked. Definitely go and try this Italian restaurant if you get a chance.
The Pink Table is excellent. The deck is great for summer dining. The Seafood Riscotto was delicious. Very attentive service and extensive wine list.
Please put a sign ourside the "no longer pink" door? 🤪😉

The food here is incredible. The pappardelle bolognese is rivaled only by that we had in Rome. Absolutely delicious. The ambience is wonderful— one step through the door and you’re overlooking a magical wonderland.
Love love love this restaurant. Food is outstanding and the service is impeccable. Would highly recommend this restaurant!!

The cutest little restaurant with great staff that went above and beyond. Our sever was great. Food was so good and the prices are fair. There was a live performance right front of our table which was so amazing!!  Would love to come back if back in Seattle.
Fantastic choice of vegetarian food. Both starters and mains were delicious.
Lovely server, delicious food & magical mixed drinks!
Great fun lunch
Beautiful outdoor patio to match the delicious and beautiful food.
Beautiful cool restaurant with a great view and wonderful food!
It was perfect. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and had the best time. She was from out of town and loved it so much, she came back a second time later that day with her husband.
Special place.  Great ambience, food and service.
Food was amazing!
We had a great meal, and good drinks.
A little pricey for lunch, but delicious!

Reservation for Thursday lunch was necessary for this popular Pike Place Market spot, especially to sit outside as we desired. With outdoor dining being weather-dependent, we didn’t realize the hot weather would limit outdoor seating. We had to wait to be allowed to sit outside, but the quieter sound level and Covid-safety was worthwhile.  The food was tasty as expected for our day prior to our wedding anniversary celebration.  Clams and mussels were served in a tasty broth, enjoyed with the crusty bread to soak up the extra.  Fusilloni Gigante was a great summer option with ripe tomatoes, fresh herbs, and burrata on top to mix in.  Great decision to order the basil cake with raspberry jam filling for take out to enjoy later!

They stayed live music but didn’t tell you it doesn’t start til 7 and when we left at 730 it still hadn’t started. We felt very rushed they were more interested in turning tables than service. Disappointed since I choose this place for my daughters 30 th birthday and was not thrilled.
Good experience but reservations appear to be mandatory.

Great food 
Great customer service!

fantastic aerialist, delicious food, top notch cocktails, glorious decor & ambiance, host & server were outstanding 

cannot say enough positive things about Pink Door, wish we lived closer to enjoy more often

Decent food in an iconic Seattle location. I do highly recommend. Food is good, not great. Service may hv been an off night but wasn’t impressed. Appetizer plates weren’t cleared before our main course. Server wasn’t in a good mood.
The lasagna was the best I’ve ever had. We got a table in the dining room with views of the market and water.
Was very nice setting I do wish they gave you the option to ask to be inside instead of automatically putting you outside!
Fantastic date night!  …food, drinks, ambiance, trapeze performances, service!    Thank you Pink Door - keep up the excellence.
Loved it going to this place. Great ambiance and food.
Highly recommend making an intentional effort to check it out. All around great experience..

Huge fan of Pink Door. Always celebrate my anniversary there and will continue the tradition due to the amazing food, perfect location and great service. The location is great but definitely better if you are seated in the patio on a nice summer day. The staff is always fun and attentive, you won’t feel forgotten. The staff always makes time to try and fulfill my seating request which I appreciate tremendously. Will always return!
Love pinkdoors patio seating. Always enjoy it during seattle summers!
Ambiance was great, but the pasta was blan and the meat was undercooked even though we asked for well done.

Great dinner
Fast, accurate service
Will go back many times
The Pink Door is a Seattle fave for Italian cuisine in the heart of the Pike Place Market!!
Amazing venue, fabulous food, friendly staff!   Everyone must find this place and experience.  Thank you for being The highlight of our Seattle trip.
The Pink Door was amazing!!  Food, service and ambience was definitely worth the wait!!  Would highly recommend!

We had a lovely lunch the Erin Cheney rice balls where’s the curb I had the note the bouillabaisse but like a seafood stew it was delicious it was a signature dish my daughter had the Bolognese she loved it and the waitresses so friendly and the people who aren’t great the Parmesan cheese would just go on and on and on and tell you said stop and put a smile on their face it was just a great experience

The Pink Door remains my favorite restaurant in Seattle. Granted, it brings back fond memories of my Seattle upbringing and going regularly back in the 80s in its early days of being quirky and fabulous. It’s still that and so much more. The food remains the star with ambiance, great service and fab views to match. Now it’s not easy to get a reservation when I’m in the area, but I try every time and celebrate the times I can get in and savor this wonderful place.
Candle lit dinners with live music stage tucked into the lounge and the outdoor patio is romantic
Amazing pasta, pork chop, wine, and view!!
Wonderful food and service on the deck. Would be tough to beet anywhere.
The food, the service , the ambiance was excellent . Reservations highly recommended since it can get pretty busy. Hostess and staff are really friendly and helpful.
Love this place and have loved it for the 30+ years I have been coming here

There was a line to get in but it moved fast.  Lovely atmosphere on their patio.  Felt like we were in a secret garden as it was below street level but with water views.  I am Celiac and have dairy allergies. The waitress and chef were very accommodating.  The chef even made me some GF garlic bread.  Over the moon!   The meals were super fresh and delicious.  I would highly recommend.

Amazing service, better food!  Bartender Mikey was a wealth of knowledge not only regarding cocktails but on the menu as well. 

The Ahi Tuna Crudo appetizer as AMAZING!  I’m not a raw fish guy but tried this at Mikey’s recommendation.  The unique combination of flavors popped. So good we ordered a second one. The Linguini Vongole and Northwest Risotto were also amazing!  

Then the ambiance…. Chic yet classy. 3 piece jazz band playing and amazing views of the harbor. 

An absolute MUST if you’re in Seattle.
Pink Door was a great experience.  Food and drinks were perfectly prepared.
Love the atmosphere.  The service was great.   I thought the lasagna noddles were over cooked.
Great food, next time would eat indoors if warmer than 80 degrees outside.

It was delicious! The bread was a great starter. Highly recommend the arancini. The Lasagna Pink Door was unique and tasty. The pappardelle alla bolognese was good but not the best we’ve had. The linguine with clams was a classic, exactly as expected. The ambiance on the patio was great although it was a bit hot out. Friendly staff.
Great service !! Elyse E was amazing . Great view and excellent food
Absolutely loved the Pink Door! Seattle's best kept secret!
It doesn't get much better than The Pink Door. It is just an incredible place to dine, always.

Excellent service, excellent food. Our hostest got us a table right in front of the aerial show. Our waitress Emily was kind and sweet, drinks were flowing, and the food was top notch. 

The Aerial show was beautiful. Love the quirky vibe of this place. Recommend highly to check it out if you are visiting Seattle. Perfect date night spot
If you like seafood, the Linguine Alle Vongole is a must. My husband is a picky eater but he really enjoyed the Pappardelle Al Ragu Bolognese.
Great place great view great food fun ambiance
It was a good date place but need to book far in advance
3 year anniversary dinner celebrated here. Sat outdoors on the patio, delicious wine and charcuterie appetizer. Great feel and food overall
I highly recommend The Pink Door. It has an eclectic and fun design, the live music was great, and the food was sublime. Also a great view of the waterfront in the Dining Room.
Whenever we are in Seattle staying at the Inn at the Market, we dine at the Pink Door. It is always an outstanding evening.

We sat out on a the patio. It was the sunniest day of the weekend and also very warm. My husband and I shared a cold bottle of Chardonnay. Had the best waitress. Made for a fabulous experience. The food was fantastic and so delicious. Thank you 🙏 we will be back. Also posted our pictures.
The food was amazing! Great quality and portion. And the servers were very kind and helpful. Definitely made the experience enjoyable!
Great spot for a beautiful summer lunch on a patio.
Beautiful place with a great view and delicious food! Service was amazing!

Perfect spot for outdoor lunch — one of the loveliest decks in Seattle.  Service was flawless, friendly and professional.  We were able to take our time and enjoy the occasion.  I do wish there were more light and simple vegetarian lunch options on the menu.  I miss the beet salad that used to be offered.  But lunch at the Pink Door was a treat.
Great experience!  The lasagna was delicious and entertainment at night was cool.
Nice upscale dining spot with patio and live music in the lounge. A hidden gem.
Difficult to find. Food was good. Would recommend it.
Food was exceptional,…. All of it, great wine options also
Entry smelled like a bathroom.. food was okay. Reasonable.
One of the best meals I’ve had in a great setting
Fantastic place. Gorgeous decor. Great service. Delicious food. Lovely views. Live music playing but not overpowering just really nice. If we’re ever back in Seattle we will be back.
This is one of the most fantastic venues in z Seattle.  Great food, great service and fantastic value

Really wonderful food!  Hours later and I am still very full and satisfied.  Nothing ordinary about this meal! Meatball sandwich was top notch as a meatball sandwich could possibly be. Hesitated about the lasagna because pesto is not my favorite. Don’t skip it.  Dessert was great and dessert drinks fun!

We went for a birthday celebration..they have modified the menu recently and it wasn’t updated anywhere online and disappointed with our fav items are not there anymore. Worst bruschetta I have ever .. Other items tasted ok !

Even though they have multiple seats available inside they are wantedly making people who made reservations to stand in a line .

This was our second time visiting The Pink Door. Both experiences have been fabulous! The food and entertainment (a band for visit one and the aerial show for visit 2) were wonderful. The food is always fresh as delicious and service superb!

The venue was a little mysterious. No signage outside the "Pink Door", just a little sign with a barcode to get to their reservations page. Once there, the ambiance was delightful. The food was delicious. They do have a gluten free pasta that can be substituted in some of their dishes. The antipasto was really good. They offer gluten free bread, which is basically sliced sandwich bread that is cut on the diagonal and buttered. You get 8 of these half slices. Not the best option, but I wanted bread to eat with my Italian food and wine. Everything else we ate was so good, I will definitely make reservations again for our next visit to Seattle.
Celebrating the birthday of my wife in there. It’s our first time there, services and food are nice.

the pink door never fails with food & ambience.     it's the unique environment & amazing views that really make this place special.    
i always feel that the staff/employees seem to really enjoy their jobs & it's casual, unpretentious.
Fabulous food!

Ludicrous that you have to stand in line (10 couples deep) waiting for the door to open at 11:30 for a 11:30 reservation! 

Door swings open at 11:33 - young lady yells out “reservations to the left of the door, all walk ups to the right…”

REAL Classy…NOT

What happened to being 15 minutes early for your CUSTOMERS!!!
Excellent service, beautiful place and food delicious.
Absolutely fantastic a great way to celebrate 12 years of marriage!
Very good food and service. Lasagna was excellent.
Lasagna was best ever. Our server was so friendly and just nice.
We had an awesome dinner here with cool and funky Jazz music. Next time we are in town we will for sure go back. Service was great also!
Love the pink door.
The food and service was perfect. Would go weekly if I could :)
Good place for a date night. I would definitely go back.
Great experience as usual.
Really lovely place with awesome food and beautiful views if you sit in the front room.
Ahi tuna crudo was the best!
The Pink Door has been in our Top Five most favorite places to dine for many, many years.  Love the decor and absolutely love the food.

A delightful lunch on the deck with a treasured friend. Excellent service that didn't intrude but was always ready with a smile and pertinent information about the menu. It's hard to beat prosecco, pappardelle, a delightful Bing cherry dessert and one of the best doppio espressos I've had anywhere in a long time. Ah, yes. Summer on the deck at the Pink Door. Nothing beats it!

We were disappointed with our service. We came for lunch to spend our 14th Anniversary here. Waiter was friendly but didn’t check up on us as much. We never got our bread as others were getting theirs. Would’ve been nice to go along with the clams and mussels we ordered. Then as we asked for the check and it took another 30 min as we sat there waiting. Food was excellent but service could’ve been a lot better. We had high hopes especially for being a special day.
Wonderful view.  Great food.  Excellent service.   Really enjoyed.
Great place to eat! We had reservations and were able to be seated early. Both food and staff were outstanding! We will do this again on another trip.
The restaurant is gorgeous and has a bit of a speakeasy feel to it. They make amazing cocktails. The food was delicious! I'll definitely be back.

We expected the level of loud, so that was ok. The view was exceptional and service, too!! The food was amazing, though not the best I have had (but literally amazing!). One improvement I can see is to offer more bread. Overall wonderful experience and we'll be back!
Great restaraunt.   They could use a sign as it is very hard to locate
Great views, eclectic design.  Just all around cool place.  There is a reason it’s so hard to get a reservation
Great service and deeelicious food, would highly recommend and will definitely come back!
Fabulous food and service….my absolute favorite restaurant in Seattle!
What a gem of a find , be sure to get your reservation exactly 30 days in advance. Great food impeccable service a very fun experience, just steps away from the famous Pikes market

Dylan was our sever and they were amazing! We loved every course. The crudo, the lasagna, seafood pasta, to the dessert was everything we expected and more. We sat in the room with the view of the water.

What a gem! We went here for a special occasion and The Pink Door did not disappoint - everything we ate and drank was incredible - from the cocktails, to our house appetizer (and delicious bread + olive oil, hints of rosemary? YES PLEASE) , to pasta & pork chops, to tiramisu and a tart. Our server was super bubbly and attentive - I wish I caught their name, they were fabulous. We sat at a corner table overlooking Pike Place and the water, lovely spot and the music was perfect. Go!
Wonderful as always!

My friend is visiting from Australia. Our server really was not interested in interacting with us. He seldom checked on us, would slide items to us when brought out or when giving us the check. He seemed rather bothered to be helping us.
The ambience was spectacular, and warm and welcoming. The staff showed great hospitality and were responsive. The service was quick, the food was excellent and I look forward to my next visit.
Great meal! Server was so accommodating and let me order half dishes since I was not overly hungry! Got to try several pastas which were both great.

Very accommodating. Another couple wanted to join us & they were able to add 2 more to my reservation that I had made 30 days in advance. We didn’t see the show but the antipasto appetizer was great. The small order was enough for 4. Three of us had the risotto special with Dungeness crab & shrimp. The Ciopino  was also good. Excellent service & the view is great!
First time at The Pink Door.  Service, food and aerial performance were all incredible!  Thank you for accommodating us and making our experience so memorable!
Amazing food reasonable price great service.  Would go back for sure

We celebrated our 27th anniversary with family and friends at the place where I proposed 28 years earlier. 

We try to make it back every year and keep bringing new additions to our group. The food is always AMAZING as is the staff and ambiance.
Fantastic pasta, cocktails, and tiramisu. Nice view of the water if you are near a window.

They were able to accommodate us when we wanted to sit outside and then again when it was too hot. Excellent service and helpfulness from every staff member we crossed paths with! It was a great experience for my out of town friends!
The food  was fantastico! The staff and the service were fabulous. Highly recommended.
Amazing experience as always love stopping here when in town- love the ambiance and food!
So wonderful.  The room was beautiful, food delivered cloud and service impeccable.  We will return and highly recommend to all we know.

My friends and I arrived 30 minutes before our reservations, yet the hostess and manager were unprofessional and seated other guests ahead even though I checked in 30 minutes prior.  The managers we’re unapologetic and unfriendly.
I’ve been coming here every time we visited Seattle for the past 10 years and will never return again.

Awesome service- delicious food- great atmosphere!!
A great experience!!!
Absolutely worth the hype especially if the outdoor deck is open on a sunny day, service was impeccable and the food was delicious
Everything about our experience at the Pink Door was fantastic! Fun, cool vibe, outstanding service and exceptional food. Can't wait to return!
Fantastic food! Love the place. Great wine recommendation. Groovy staff.
Totally outstanding - Excellent food and menu selections.  We always love The Pink Door!

We had a long over due friend reunion dinner and it was so delightful! Cocktails and food were all awesome but what really made our visit was the flawless service from Dominic! His kind sincerity along with his perfect recommendations really made our night! Thank you :)
Birthday celebration for visiting friends

Great Italian food with a view and very reasonable prices!  A must when in Seattle.
The food was amazing....the tuna crudo, lasagna, cioppino, and clams linguine.  The portion sizes was good (not huge portions) but enough to satisfy and leaving you fairly full.  Their complimentary bread and homemade infused olive oil were also delicious!   We were full so we did not have the opportunity to try their desserts. They also had some signature cocktails....so delish!
