I would have to admit that this is the best Italian meal that I have anywhere in the U.S.  I wished they have an Italian restaurant as good where I live.  A very enjoyable meal with great service and a great view but with reasonable prices!  I will definitely be back when in Seattle.
Anything with “Pink Door” in the menu item title is great
Make sure you ask directions.  There is no sign, and the door isn't very pink anymore.  But once you find it, wow!  Great food, great band (we were there on jazz night).
Consistently 5 out of 5 stars. The halibut was amazing!!!

If you’re looking for a delicious meal or a place to celebrate someone special, take them to the Pink Door. The food was perfect, the wine recommendations were on point, and dessert was scrumptious. 10/10 will go again.
Lovely corner table with a view of the Market - perfect for our birthday celebration.  Waitstaff was exceptional.  Food & drink service was well paced.  Thanks for a great meal in the Market!
The food is always great.  It was a touch noisy the night we went and it may be because we were sitting directly under a speaker in the large dining room.  It is a fantastic dining experience.
Great shaded outdoor patio with best lasagna around, martinis, and excellent service. Our go to place for lunch!
great ambiance - cool vibe and great Italian food - really good service -
I celebrated my birthday at The Pink Door.  Everything was amazing!
Fantastic ambiance, service and delicious food!  Loved everything about it.   Wish I lived here so I could go again!
Wonderful food and great atmosphere
Fantastic as always
Food was amazing!!

Had reservations for lunch but arrived early.  My wife and I were able to get seated early without any problems.  Greeted almost immediately by our waitress.  Slight wait for our cocktails but we’ll worth the wait.  Shared the antipasto appetizer.  It was absolutely delicious with plenty to share.  Our meals were just as wonderful and delicious.  We had a really great dining experience.  Loved the service, food and ambiance.  Would definitely recommend The Pink Door anyone coming to Seattle.

Thank you for making my mom’s first visit to The Pink Door such a great experience! I went here last year with my husband for his birthday and we weren’t disappointed. Such a wonderful place! We will be back! Thank you for being so awesome!
Delicious! The menu was fantastic, the ambiance was everything and the view was incredible!

Visited while on vacation. Our friends recommended Pink Door to us and it was fantastic. The service was excellent and the food and drinks were delicious. We dined Al fresco on their beautiful patio and the ambiance was fantastic.

My family of 5 had an amazing birthday dinner. The waiter and water team were so great. They went above and beyond to make my family feel special especially my 7 year old. The food was beyond amazing. We had the rice balls and bruschetta. All other bruschetta will pale in comparison.

This place was amazing!! We were delayed 3 hours out of Denver and they changed our reservation with no fuss and empathy for our travel situation. The food was incredible and the staff extremely friendly and just overall chill and cool. We will definitely come back to this restaurant the next time we are in Seattle!!!
Visiting Seattle for the first time. Everything was great. The “make me something fruity” drink is delicious as well as the all of the salads, the mussels and Tuscan fries.
Lunch on the patio to celebrate a friend’s birthday. Absolutely wonderful: food, service, ambience. We’re making plans to return soon. Will make a happy habit of The Pink Door.

Pink Door was very good. We came for dinner in June 2022. For starters, we got the arancini which was very rich, but very good. The fry was perfect and it didn't eat greasy at all. The parmesan sauce was also very good. Next we split the Caesar salad which was really good, particularly the fennel croutons. For entrees, we had the bolognese and the lamb chops, which we both really liked. The lamb chops were well seasoned and the accompaniments (olives, artichokes, ricotta gnocchi) were perfect. Surprised this isn't a more popular menu item. Overall, a great experience.
It was hands down the best meal we had in Seattle. They did NOT skimp on the clams and the tiramisu was the best I’ve ever eaten. We licked the plate clean!!
We had lunch at the Pink Door during our honeymoon. I’m a big fan of Halibut, and the special was delicious and soft as butter. The cheeses were also very good.
Beautiful setting on the patio, great food & wonderful service :)
Great to be back at The Pink door!  Great people and service!
Amazing food-service and atmosphere! Fabulous time with bestie!!! Thank you!!!
The Pink Door is always special. Especially when Seattle weather permits outdoor dining. Spectacular views, charming ambiance, great professional service and the food is always wonderful.
Average food with great location. Most items here are decent but not great. Mostly for the tourist. I would suggest people skip the dessert and go for something else around the area.
Best Italian in Seattle. Reservations fill up fast but worth the wait.
The Pink Door is a darling place with fun ambiance.  Our server was excellent and attentive throughout our meal.
The best food in Seattle. You can’t beat the experience!

Cane for our wedding anniversary - lunch was the only available reservation.  We booked 4 weeks ahead & limited avability- so plan ahead! 
Started with arancini, then shared Pink Door lasagne & Alaskan halibut with smashed fingerling potatoes tossed with fresh tomatoes & vinaigrette!  It was delightful.  Too full from the meal for dessert.
A must see place for sure!
Great service and food like always but this time sat on the patio and had an incredible view

Service and ambiance were outstanding. My son ordered the honey lavender pudding with lemon cake and said it was the best dessert he has ever had. His friend ordered the tiramisu and that was amazing, as well. The lasagna had a lot of pesto, which I liked, but others may not, so heads up on that. And my son had the flank steak, which the thought was great, but the sides had a chili-sauce on them that made them too spicy for his taste. His friend ordered pasta with meatballs. He liked the pasta, but said he thought the meatballs had mint in them, which he didn’t love. Aran I I was very good, and we enjoyed the Caesar salad also.
Excellent service and fabulous food. Loved the ambiance!
This place never fails! It is always a treat to dine here. The service was fabulous and so was our meal.
Shjsjjdndheinsnsisjbsisndbdisnksnsjsjsnsidjdbnsjsisus
Love the pink door. Every time we are in Seattle, we go.
I absolutely love this place! A must when in Seattle.....
Loved everything about it. Amazing food and service. Fun, buzzy atmosphere.
Food was superb and Dylan was amazing! Highly recommend
It was great! The ambience was perfect and the staff was amazing. I would come back 😍
Sailing out of Seattle for 47 anniversary!
Staff was incredible and food was excellent!! I had the lamb chops, wife had the beet ravioli and daughter had the papardelle with bolognese. All were delicious. Great wine too.
Except for being hard to find we had a very good experience. The front desk was accommodating in changing our reservation and everything went well.
Well done dish, service and ambiance.  We’ve eaten all over the world and will consider this on our list of places to try but sit in the back dinning room.

Very much worth setting a reminder to get a reservation. The hosts were wonderfully accommodating for a party of 9 so we could all sit together. Everything from the appetizers to dessert was a hit. A dining experience all can appreciate.
The Pink Door is an outstanding restaurant. The food is inspired and consistently perfect and the ambience is distinctive, whimsical and beautiful. My absolute favorite restaurant in Seattle!
Best lasagna ever! We had best bartender recommend great wine. Loved the bread and Cesar salad. We look forward to going back!
Great food, lively environment, and friendly service.
My wife birthday . And pink door didn’t disappoint . Awesome staff awesome food . We are vegetarian and the dishes were out of the world,  best in class .

Honestly, Pink Door was a bit of a disappointment. The expectations were very high, considering this is considered one of the best restaurants in Seattle. The very first problem is the smell of the place when entering, I don’t know if it is always like this, but there was a not pleasant strong smell. The place is nice overall and the service was good. Regarding the food, the arancini were good, but the risotto and the lamb were really heavy. I personally got the lamb and my wife the risotto. I think I finished digesting the lamb only after 10 hours.

Excellent, exciting dining. 
What a surprise. The drinks, service, food, entertainment and dessert! All of it was too notch and fun!
Our experience was amazing. From our waiter to the food and entertainment, we will be back next time in Seattle.
We really enjoyed our dinner and the view
Great experience
Worth the hype. The staff is amazing, food was great and the ambiance memorable.
The food was bland and mediocre for the price. My pasta was stuck to each other and under cooked. Just unimpressed given the service and ambiance was perfect.
Girlfriend’s birthday

Accommodated our late arrival and gave us a great table overlooking the water. 
Our server was excellent, providing knowledge suggestions as we navigated the menu. 
The food was delicious from the appies through to dessert. Definitely we will return next time we visit Seattle.

My wife and I ordered two of the specials from the menu, a salmon dish and a pork chop dish. The salmon was way overcooked and dry as a bone. The accompanying vegetables, green peas, asparagus and morel mushrooms, were very good. The pork chop was slightly overcooked, but the fennel seeds on the chop dominated the flavor profile. The fennel seeds were not mentioned as being part of the dish. Cocktails were decent. My drink had a kiwi puree that was tasty, but the black seeds were not strained from the puree, leaving an ugly black sediment at the bottom of the glass. All in all, we very disappointed in the meal - especially after reading such great reviews of the place. My 2 out of 5 rating is generous.
Excellent service and excellent restaurant

My friends had the lamb chops and said that every bite was perfect. I had the lasagna and peas and they were amazing. Our server was friendly and attentive. The aerialist performance had a burlesque feel and was so cool to watch while eating dinner.
Great view of the bay.  The salmon and tiramisu were outstanding.  Definitely will come back again.
Great place, the food is so good. Highly recommended.
We came here because of it's high rating, well deserved! We loved our meal out on the deck, so worth a trip
One of a kind charming restaurant near Pike Place Market that provides consistently great food and unparalleled service with a view of Elliott Bay.  Their outdoor deck is a must for summertime.
Excellent food and service. Love the ambiance as well.
I went there with my girlfriend for my birthday, it was awesome. The food is a reasonable price, we only spent $50 combined. It’s bar far the best atmosphere I’ve experienced at a restaurant before.
A must visit when in Seattle.  Went at 11:30 when it first open. Food was delicious. Wish we could have gone at night with entertainment
Spectacular. Love the ambiance of the restaurant and the iconic feeling of entering through the pink door. If your looking for any sign the door is it!  Advanced reservations needed.
Great ambiance, food reminds me of our trip to Italy. Fun place would highly recommend to anyone visiting Seattle. FYI the door is Salmon colored than pink.

Fun Italian restaurant in Post Alley but difficult to find entrance. Signage? Service was excellent and some of the best I've received in Seattle. Food was hit and miss. The house meatballs a miss. Too dense and sauce tasred like jar of Bertolis. The Ceasars a miss as croutons were tasteless. Fennel dusted?  Hits were the bread and VOO. The linguine and clams a hit and the seafood on the cioppino. Too bad the broth was so salty as everything else fresh and tasty.

It’s so nice to have the outdoor seating open again. The tables and flowers were gorgeous, and the service was excellent. My salad and antipasto plate were perfect, and it sure helped that the sun came out!!
Amazing ambiance, service and food. Loved the vibe at this place.

Read about it on Pinterest and had to go. We were seated immediately, even though our party wasn’t completely there. They were friendly and attentive. The food was INCREDIBLE. Even though we had a late reservation, it was 💯 worth the wait. Will go every time we’re in Seattle!
Great ambiance and impeccable service. Enjoyed the live musicians and the diverse menu options. Both the wine and the food was delicious.
Beautiful venue for our first night in Seattle!
Delicious food, beautiful view, casual ambience.
Atmosphere is warm, unique, and fun.  Cool indoor atmosphere and outdoor dining is great too.
Great experience, will be back!
Seattle Native. Just great everytime!
Loved it!  There was a medical incident and the staff was extremely careful and conscientious of the person in crisis and the rest of the customers.  Very impressed with their response.
The restaurant has an amazing outdoor view. Best for sunny days in Seattle. My favorite was the Pink Lasagna.
Really perfect. Romantic and interesting. Food was exceptional.
A must if you are going to Seattle!  Ambiance is awesome and the food and service was excellent!
It didnt feel special, it was like a casual restaurant. Maybe there must be a attire rule so that you wont feel like you are eating at a Pike Place street place..
Our favorite restaurant in Seattle. The wait staff here is as good as it gets.
Wonderful place to take my wife for her birthday dinner, thank you!

I live in Puerto Rico and every time I come to visit my son we love to go to PINK DOOR. The food is excellent and for every taste. Love the desserts! The staff always looking for give an excellent service.Cant wait to go again.
Been to a lot of places and this place was ok, don't really understand the hype of it.

Great service, great views and great food!!!
This is a must try!!!
Lasagna was unbelievable!!! Do not miss this restaurant!!
Sadly Arancini appetizers not on the menu but the special pork entree was a hit with my husband.  I was also happy to see Albariño wine on the menu and enjoyed that.
A must go to when In Seattle. You won’t be disappointed
.Visited for lunch with friends and were sat in the new-ish dining room overlooking Victor Steinbreuck Park and it was lovely. Service was knowledgeable and friendly. Food was delicious as always.
It was a great place! Great good - I would recommend the cheese ball appetizer!!
Great experience - food, location, and service were all fantastic! Couldn’t have asked for a better dinner out in Seattle. The lasagna was probably my favorite dish of the night!
Our party of 4 enjoyed their meals.  Would definitely go back again.

Really great meal every time
I go! My server was fantastic and quick. The Arancini was amazing in a thick cheese sauce.

Seriously, the greatest restaurant. Food was marvelous, ambiance coolest ever, staff was fabulous. Wonderful to see an employer that embraces the individuality of its staff. No uniforms anywhere. Kudos to the owner. Staff is smiling and experienced. If you have not been to this restaurant, then run, don't walk, just get there. We went for lunch and can't wait to get back for dinner, and some entertainment.  I wish we lived in Seattle, just so we could get to the Pink Door regularly. Thank you for the fantastic experience. We will be back, for sure.
Great food, great menu, definitely a Seattle must.

stoked that they now offer gf bread as an option on the side. It's a little bland and plain, but a great step forward in being more inclusive with food allergies. They also have a great gf penne you can sub out for any of their pasta dishes :)
Beautiful place!!! We are from Chicago and this was simply amazing!!
We had the best time!  Christy was our server and she was absolutely fantastic!  No one rushed us and the food was wonderful!  Definitely will return. Oh and drinks were fabulous !
Seattle classic. Great restaurant with wonderful staff, food and ambience.
One of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had a chance to enjoy. From ambience, to decor, to service, to the food and drink, dinner at The Pink Door was a truly outstanding experience.
Ambience was amazing and food was delicious. Wish exterior had better signage, but maybe that adds to the allure?
Great view and friendly staff. Menu was diverse

The six of us enjoyed eating and conversing at the outdoor seating. I was disappointed with the cioppino. For my taste the dish needed a variety of fish and and a thicker more robust stock. Great location and service.
Great experience as usual. Interesting and unique menu items. Absolutely delicious!

All great - came for the show remembering the burlesque show of years past. The trapeze show was cool but shorter than what we hoped - and would love to see a return to the former. Food was excellent, portions were not as generous as we remembered, but it had been a while and we didn’t leave hungry. Still a wonderfully special treat when in Seattle!
Such an adorable restaurant!  I’ve lived in Seattle almost 6 years and this was my first time to visit.  So fun and can’t wait to go back and bring some friends to visit!  :)
Anniversary dinner was great
As always, The Pink Door was amazing! Excellent food and service with excellent entertainment!
Great food and great atmosphere. Reasonably priced.

It was my first trip to Seattle.  I recommend reservations in advance.  I had the lasagna. It was delicious.  Service was amazing.  I was a few feet from the trapeze artist.  She was cool.  It is loud,pricey and expensive but worth it for a special occasion.
The service here is lovely, and the food is PHENOMENAL.
The food was excellent, the service top notch! It was a beautiful day & the ambiance for lunch on a sunny day can’t be beat! Can’t recommend the lasagna enough 👍
Delicious food & great service at this intimate, spacious location in downtown Seattle! Would recommend to a friend every time they’re in town.
We got the Bolognese and lasagna . Excellent choices . Also got the recommended wine and was not disappointed.

My mom and I went to dinner at The Pink Door prior to boarding our cruise out of Seattle. We got a reservation 30 days out and the place was very busy. I highly recommend booking early. We shared the bruschetta and risotto. Both were flavorful and delicious! If we are ever staying in Seattle again, we will definitely come back!

Very busy spot but it is a tourist trap. Overly priced average at best Italian dishes. The wait staff where attentive.  Had the lasagna, small portion and not very flavorful.  Ordered the meatballs,  they where tough and dry. Cesar salad was the best part of the meal.
This was my first time at The Pink Door and I was so impressed. Great service, reasonable prices, and beautiful ambiance!
Everything was great…next time we will plan a reservation during a show.

I attended the Pink Door with 5 friends - none of us lived in the area . We experienced a wonderful evening from the ambience , service and tastefully prepared fresh meals . Next time I'm in town I will definitely make that my first option .
Always a classic! Delicious!

Even though we live in Olympia the Pink Door is still our go to restaurant for
special occasions.

I had a lovely lunch with my son. It was his first time at the Pink Door.
He enjoyed the food.
Thank you for a memorable experience with my son.
The best halibut entree I have ever had, and I'm in the fish business!  I'm hoping they'll share the recipe.
The Pink Door is an awesome place to eat, I highly recommend it!
Absolutely amazing..no other word can describe! If in Seattle a must do!

Everything was wonderful at the restaurant. My husband and I dined here three years ago while in Seattle and just had to return.

Our dining experience was better than perfect. Our server, Lexie, was AMAZING and should be commended for the superior service we received. The decor was unique and our food was so delicious. Both my husband and I ordered their specialty, the bolognese, which was the BEST we have ever had, anywhere. The dish, which had the most luscious meat sauce and wide homemade noodles, melted in our mouths. 

When in Seattle, this is a restaurant you should not miss. You will LOVE it! You have to go up a street across from Pike's Market (Post Alley?) and look for a metal pink door. There isn't a sign outside with the restaurant's name on it; you just have to know where it is. If you can't find it, ask a resident. Also, make your reservation at least a few weeks in advance. The place is always packed to the hilt. The prices are somewhat high, but believe me, what you pay is worth every penny.
Incredible food and service. Great room. Will be back!
The food was fantastic, and the show was short, but a truly unique and cool experience. Server was timely and attentive! Great overall experience!
Fabulous experience… definitely go. Unique and delicious!
Great place!  Good food and ambiance

I found this restaurant as a place not to miss in a book about Seattle. I've lived here all my life and somehow not known about it. I booked a reservation for my husband's birthday and we both thought it was amazing. The performance was amazing, the food and drinks were great, and the service was attentive without feeling intrusive. We would love to be back.
The Pink Door never disappoints! From the drinks to the food to the kind and interesting staff.

We were so thrilled to finally experience The Pink Door, and they did not disappoint. The food was transcendant, service flawless, and the ambiance fantastic. If the lunch alone was this good, I can't wait to return for the show!
Elegant in every way. Deliciousness defined in food, ambiance, and service. It is a special place for friends, lovers, and family. I savor each time I go.
Amazing! Highly recommend. Wonderful lunch experience and ambiance.

Food was amazing! Rockfish was absolutely delicious and the clam linguine was the best we've had since being in Italy. Food portions were good and we were stuffed. Ahi Tuna Crudo and everything green salad were both refreshing. Olive oil served with bread was a good quality oil. Highly recommend this place! Pride in food and service evident.
Great place
Excellent food!! risotto, lasagna and clams linguini were all delicious. Definitely best food in town.
Awesome!!!

Very nice sitting at the bar and the service there was wonderful.
I made a reservation over a month in advance but upon arriving they could only seat us in the lounge or bar area.
Very disappointing.
The ahi crudo was fantastic and well as the green salad.
Unfortunately the fish of the day, Halibut, was a bit on the dry side. The flavors were lovely.
We will return and hope to have better seating next time.
Love everything about this restaurant, the ambiance, the food and the service. Lasagna was amazing and the grilled whole fish was cooked to perfection.
Excellent good, great ambience and views. Service was good but could have been more attentive & prompt. Am guessing the surge in guests post-COVID might have slowed them down.
A group of five friends celebrated birthdays here at lunch! We wouldn’t suggest any changes as all loved this experience! Thank you!

We had Roasted Beet Ravioli and the famous Pink Door Lasagna. They were both delicious. Must have. Followed by tiramisu. Yummmm!!! All the dishes were light and sooo flavourful. Usually Italian food just gets too heavy very soon but we scraped our plates to completion this time :D my pink door mocktail was also interesting. Thank you!
The live band is awesome! First amazing also only one thing for the night. Worth it to drink for couples but not worth for food

Such an amazing ambience nothing you would be expecting. The food is very expensive and just alright!! The value was a little over rated for the price!! Add a little herbs to the olive oil for the bread even that would make a huge difference!!
Everything was great as usual. The food was wonderful and the service was great!

We had a reservation but didn’t get seated until 25 minutes later. We specifically went there for the ambiance and entertainment but never got to hear any music or see a performance. The food was amazing and so were the drinks. Our server was fantastic. By far one of the best I’ve ever had. Just a little disappointed in bringing people from out of town to see this unique Seattle place but not getting the full experience. Other then that, it was great.
Great food - one of my Seattle favorites. My business partner said his selection melted in his mouth.

Best restaurant experience in quite a while. Stephanie was a great server- quick to bring us a drink and very attentive during the meal.

Can’t wait to return to Seattle and to the Pink Door.

Business dinner for 4

We have eaten at Pink Door many times.  While it is still good it wasn't great- We had a very nice table at the window that I had requested which was very nice.  Our waitress was training someone, she was friendly however we had to ask for water several times, we ordered a drink and entree.  The tables are very close to one another and our glasses were at the end of the table empty- pretty obvious.. The portions have definitely gotten smaller.  The service just wasn't at par nor the food as in the past.  It was enjoyable however we will try some other restaurants, but will return one day.
The food is really good, will come back again.

I brought my wife, mother in law and my daughter over for a morther's day dinner. They absolutely loved the food and atmosphere. The lady who served us was very friendly and more than accommodating to some of our requests. Pink door is an old institution of Seattle and knowing that it has been around the 80's warms my heart. I wholeheartedly recommend this place.
UHHHmazing!!!
Never disappoints (although no patio dining due to PNW weather).  Aracini was marvelous, halibut perfect and a fun cocktail.  Great way to start off Mother’s Day weekend.
Love this restaurant!!!

Overall great experience. Food was great, drinks could be better. Kind of loud to us but it is in a very touristy area. We’ll be definitely going back. For the best views reservations are highly recommended.

I had not been for 14 years, but had the food on a pedestal and it exceeded my memory and expectations. The service was excellent and the ambiance is so lovely and unique. I certainly will not wait 14 years to visit again.
The host who seated us and our wait staff person, Greta, made this visit very pleasant.
Tries too hard to be “trendy”.   Would have preferred plain old iced tea rather than something that tasted like I swallowed a florist.

The Pink Door was a great Seattle surprise which we had never been to before. This was our 4th trip to Seattle, and we are glad that we decided to give it a try. The service was very good- polite , friendly and attentive server. Our dinners were delicious. On our 1st visit, I enjoyed the linguine w/ clams. So much so that I ordered it again on our 2nd visit. Loved it again! My husband had the bolognese the 1st night and the lasagne plus an order of meatballs the 2nd night. They were all wonderful. Even the garlic bread we ordered was exceptional! The live music was an added bonus! We will definitely return if we ever visit Seattle in the future.
Love the ambiance, food is fantastic, can’t really go wrong. Drinks are delicious! The dining room has a ton of windows overlooking the market & sound.
Amazing food and service!! Go here if you are in Seattle
Food as delicious as always!
A delightful lunch with wonderful service and food! Make a reservation. :)

Everything was delicious! We ordered the rice & cheese balls for appetizer with a cheese sauce and they were full of flavor. I had the Pink Door Lasagna and it was so good just melted in my mouth. Our friends had the halibut, rigatoni. & chicken saltimbocca. All were devoured! Our waitress was excellent not just in the service she provided but answering our questions to help us choose. We ordered the chocolate brownie with ice cream for dessert and it was warm, rich and delicious. The restaurant is very unique and reservations must be made well in advance. We took a walk through it and will try the main dining area next. We were in the lounge area and was able to enjoy the live music  so many times music is so loud you can’t even hear each other but this was just perfect and gave us another reason to return. This place is a must on your visit!

We had an amazing evening!  Our server Emily was just wonderful. She was such a pleasant person and very attentive and knowledgeable about the restaurant. We were fortunate to have a window table.  The food was so good and timed perfectly… we never felt rushed. We’ll definitely be back (advice to book reservations a month in advance but this time wait list on Open Table worked really well!)

Good wine and food was so, so delicious. I came here for a special occasion after a recommendation from an Italian food buff that travels extensively told me that Pink Door serves hands-down some of the best Italian food in the United States. I’ll stand by that!

My boyfriend and I went out to dinner here last night and we had an amazing experience. We came with a reservation and were seated promptly. Although we were right next to the stage, the noise levels were not too loud and we loved the ambiance as well as the band. 
Our server was very friendly and accommodating- we had no complaints! 
The food was delicious and came out very quickly. You definitely get a great value out of the menu items. We had two kinds of pasta, salad, bread and dessert and all of it was amazing, especially for the price. 
If you live in Seattle or are coming to visit, we would definitely recommend the Pink Door and we will be back ourselves Im sure.
Overhyped. Beautiful food and ambience but food was underwhelming

Great ambience, it's a beautiful place. But very crowded, hostess was very busy not very friendly. Even with reservation it took a while to grab a table. Food is good and skip the cocktails. Dessert was delicious.
Place to see and be seeing. Little bit too crowded and busy for me. I went on a Wednesday night.
This was a bucket list item for our trip to Seattle (from Ohio) & it definitely didn’t disappoint! Dinner was incredible, and the live jazz was an exciting surprise.
Some of the best Italian food my husband and I have had outside of Italy! We also enjoyed the live jazz music, it was truly a perfect and memorable dinner!
Loved the jazz band and our seat in direct line of sigh and sound of the band.  I booked the same day so was pretty amazed at our luck to get in on the same night.
What can I say if your in Seattle don’t miss the the Pink door. We go every time and it’s is always unbelievably great.
Food was fantastic, our waitress was so nice. 11/10 pastas & arancini
The Pink Door is always a reliable pick for great food, attentive service, and a Seattle vibe ambiance.

The Pink Door has been a favorite over the years. I love the ambience, view, and “vibe”. My server was very knowledgeable, helpful and upbeat
My food, unfortunately, was not up to Pink Door standards. Very disappointing!
Love it every time!
Outstanding food, fine atmosphere, great menu.

This is a beautiful restaurant with wonderful food. I refrained from a five star rating because my beet ravioli entree was a very small and had no accompanying side whatsoever.  The size of the entrées of my guests were much more appropriate.  
The waiter was great and gave me a refill of coffee which was a pleasant surprise!
Amazing ambiance, really good food, amazing music
Fabulous food, great service, a 10!
I have been coming here for over 30 years. Always delicious! I brought out of town guests on this visit and they all loved it too.
I love the Pink Door and so do my out of town guests!
Excellent service!  Great ambiance! Delicious food and cocktails! Pink Door never disappoints.
Very average. Disappointed . Garlic bread was the best thing.
Loved it. Food and drinks were great as always. The jazz trio was tremendous as was the entire staff!
Great Views. Great Food. Great music. One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle.
Excellent food, ambience and service. Would very happily book again
Loved my birthday meal at the Pink Door. Really enjoyed my whole meal and ambiance of the Pink Door and would highly recommend. Attentive and friendly service.
Their staff is extremely friendly and portion sizes are also adequate
It was a good and quick Meal. Lasagna was good but not exceptional. I like the Rose and Pistacchio dessert

Very delicious main meal, dessert, and drinks. Very nice atmosphere for a late lunch (3:00pm). We missed out on the daily events that happen but we were lucky enough to get a view of the harbour which made up for that. When they say this place is a “hole in the wall” they definitely mean it! It’s located in an alley (safe and easy to get to) and it has no sign out side… just the pink door! Definitely would recommend this restaurant.
We were pleasantly surprised by the experience and will retrun again with frinds.

I have a personal pet peeve: no plates should ever be removed from the table until ALL guests have finished their meal; especially in a highly rated restaurant such as The Pink Door.  Otherwise we had a wonderful meal.

Took my boss there for a work meeting. He was impressed. Every detail thought out and what a way to kick-off being able to have face to face work meetings again.

A local treasure that I almost don't want anyone else to know about :)
Great service and super yummy food!

Everyone and everything was amazing. We requested a special table to celebrate a birthday and they were very accommodating. Every staff member went above and beyond to make sure our night was perfect.
The Pink Door is right on the waterfront so has a fabulous view. But more importantly, the food and drinks are to die for.
Wonderful dinner. Great service and fantastic food
There is a good reason they are so busy.  This place is the best in every regard.
Overall very lovely experience, our server could have been a little more attentive and friendly, but still good service.
Dominic was a great server. Food was excellent. Beautiful comfortable setting. Really enjoyed our time. Reservations a must.

Appetizers were ok but the main course was terrible for both myself and my wife. We left our entrees as is after a couple of bites. This was absolutely not the pink door I have experienced in the past. Service was great as usual. Very warm and courteous.

birthday… we like to go on birthdays as it always seems
so special.  Food was fantastic as was the service!
Food was great and so was the service. The table we got was great. The food came out fast as well.
This was my daughters first trip to Seattle and this was a highlight.  We enjoyed the view, delicious lunch and great ambience . Can’t wait to come back.
The service, food, and drinks were impeccable. We love this place and will definitely be back.
Good food, good service, but too noisy  and busy for a Thursday night.

The Pink Door is gorgeous! We had a lovely view and the service was fantastic. The only drawbacks are that it is quite loud. The food was wonderful, but not the absolute best we had on our trip. Overall, I highly recommend going. The noise may have been due to a very large party behind us. Worth the trip overall, for sure!
The Pink Door never disappoints. Outstanding food, service, and ambiance. An otherworldly atmosphere and creative flourishes to the food. IMO, Seattle's best dining experience!
Amazing food!! Excellent experience.

The ambiance was warm and welcoming. The table was exceptional and the staff was super friendly and attentive. All the dishes we ordered were excellent. The arancini was scrumptious with a rich cheese sauce, the lasagna was very fresh with a melt in the mouth pasta, the deserts- tiramisu and sea salt chocolate brownie with coffee ice cream were one of the best deserts we've ever had.

Beyond all expectation. Met by a darling server “Elise” who made the experience over the top. There were 7 of us. Got our cocktails, appetizers and entrees came out in a timely manner but we were t rushed. Great food. Only suggestion- Bring back the Bagna Cruada!

I was visiting from out of town and wanted to take my friend who lives here out for his birthday. Safe to say neither of us have had a meal in our lives that was as carefully crafted, detailed, or made with love as much as the food at the Pink Door. After each bite we were looking at each other in disbelief… this little hidden gem was bursting with exquisite flavor! Not only was the food amazing, but the aerial artist performed shortly after we were seated and everyone was blown away. Our waiter Ryan took the time to explain the menu and make the perfect suggestions for us throughout our night. Everything from the cocktails and appetizers all the way to the last bite of the dessert had complexities that he explained to us and they made the meal even more special. We tried to guess how much our bill was before it came and both of us actually guessed too high! The value is outstanding for the quality of food, service, and ambiance. You are getting this experience for a steal in our opinion. Will 100% be returning the next time I’m in Seattle!
You can walk right past and miss, look for the pastel pink door.
Amazing food, staff, and entertainment. Highly recommended!

The Pink Door never disappoints!  I hadn’t been in quite a while as I live in Portland.  I love the ambiance and overall feel. The service was impeccable and the food was fantastic and impressed my friend who had never been.

First time going there, went with my wife for our third year anniversary. Waiter was very polite and considerate. He wished us a happy anniversary.
 Only thing that I didn’t like was when I made the reservation the open table website said dress smart casual and when I called that’s how they explained it and when we showed up, we  were a little overdressed while everybody was wearing T-shirt and jeans. Not a big deal but next time I go I know it’s very casual.

Great service amazing food. Have not been blown away in awhile...Gretha, or server, took amazing care of us...thank you so much Gretha! Now every time we visit Seattle, we will be looking for that Pink Door.

I don't know what they r doing with that menu but it was scary!! Beet ravioloi?? Ok that and a big bowl 8f purreed green glop that was supposed to be rice and shrimp?? Where was the shrimp?? 5 ravioli made with purple sweet beets!!??? Ok that was the absolute worst display of I don't know what kind of food - inedible.
Great service on top of great food. Our favorite place to visit when in Seattle
It was perfect anniversary dinner with great seating for Saturday night entertainment.  Everything we had was amazing. Our waitress was not super friendly though.  The hostess was wonderful as well.
We always enjoy the Pink Door for birthday celebrations. The food and atmosphere are great and so is the service.
The lasagna was delicious!
Met the boyfriend on our daughter’s birthday!

Disappointed in the quality of the food… the food was a bit flavorless and just okay. Not terrible just okay. The “shows” are only like 3 minutes long and only visible from the lounge area. Certainly disappointed. The tiramisu was the best part and even that we were informed is being removed from the menu. I don’t foresee myself going back ever again.
The food was absolutely amazing. The service was fabulous! I will definitely return the next time I am in Seattle.
My wife and I went here for our 20th anniversary and the food and service was outstanding. Great place to eat and enjoy the scenery
What a hidden treasure! Everything was perfect, and can't wait to go again!

We love it here! Everything is always great - the staff are so friendly, knowledgeable and courteous. The food delicious and very generous portions. It's a great place to celebrate a special occasion, or to be in lovely surroundings. The tuna starter is to die for. Our main dishes were very tasty - fish of the day - halibut - fantastic, prawns - equally as good and Chicken that was very tender and flavorful. 
Would I recommend it - in a heartbeat!

The food was really good and so was the service.  We had a couple
of cocktails and they were really good as well.  Our waitress was extremely attentive (I think her name was Maria? She said she was originally from San Diego).  The entertainment was also a neat touch!  We will definitely come back when we visit Seattle

Never disappointed in my decision to dine here. We had a window table looking out at the waterfront. 
The appetizer of spring pea/pickled onion & mint bruschetta was absolutely delicious. Had fresh halibut for main which was scrumptious and the desert…amazing lemon cake with honey lavender custard. Somehow the lavender was a little crispy and sweet so the essence was like a little hint vs tasting medicinal. 
We vowed to come back soon!
Birthday Lunch
WOW! WOW! The service was excellent! Server made great recommendations! The halibut special and ahi starter were perfection. Halibut was tender and flaky. We already made reservations to come back!
excellent dinner specials

The dining experience was excellent. We both had the fresh catch of the day (Halibut) and it was the best I have ever had.  The waiter assisted in pairing a perfect wine to go with the meal and was very attentive.  He came around when you needed him, and he left you alone when he was not needed.  Excellent service and food.
We had a lovely evening and spent so much time wondering why we don't come here more often.
What a lovely surprise! After an exhausting day of travel, we headed to The Pink Door. Warm and friendly service, expert recommendations, and a delicious dinner. Perfect evening!
Will definitely be returning
The food, service and ambiance were amazing! Love this place!

10/10, would recommend! Made reservations for a birthday lunch on a Wednesday right at opening. They sat us at the best table in the house overlooking the market! Our waitress was incredible and friendly!

We made a reservation via open door. I was looking forward to see the aerodynamic show but unfortunately, the show is only at the lounge. We got seated in the back of the restaurant, and the view compensated not been able to watch the show. 

We ordered a few anti pastas and entres. I would say the food is ok but I’ve had better pasta. The carbonara was very salty :( The only pasta we liked was the linguine. 

This place definitely has a great atmosphere for drinks and an amazing view to the fairs wheel and ocean. However, I don’t think the entres were to excellence compared to other restaurants in town. 

Costumer service was great! And the whole experience was good over all.
Thank you to the wonderful server who told us before each show was about to start so we could go stand somewhere with a better view!
Delicious food, excellent service (thank you Zachary!), and wonderful ambiance.  Book a table early in your trip, this gem of a restaurant fills up quickly.  Highly recommended.
It was so nice. They gave performances each night. The servers are kind and sweet. Food was good. Would definitely go again.
It’s a beautiful restaurant with friendly service and some of the best pappardelle pasta I’ve ever had.
We followed several recommendations to eat here. We had a lovely dinner and our server was delightful! I would highly recommend!
Absolutely lovely place to spend an intimate evening, incredibly happy with our server. Food was fantastic. Highly recommend making a reservation!
Cannot recommend enough!! The lasagna was unreal!

Great evening, buzzy atmosphere and beautiful views. Fantastic friendly service. Food was delicious, best arancini I think I've ever had.
We all loved our food and great selection of cocktails and wine.

Would highly recommend!
Fun atmosphere and great food! Service was great. Will be back again soon!

Good 👍🏻 I like to try something new every time I go. I got the sandwich with mamas meatballs. It was Ight. A lot of bread. But the Tuscan truffle fries takes #2 of my all time favorite fries. Loved the herbs and garlic.
I think we had the one waitress who wasn’t very bubbly and didn’t check back in as often.  Everyone else was great.  And my time prior service was excellent.
Top 5 meals I’ve had in my lifetime!  Amazing food, drinks, service, ambiance!  Going to be the go to every time I’m in Seattle!
Celebration of our research presentation!

We were lucky to have made our reservation for the perfect day - first opening of the deck, first 70+ degree day of the year last Thursday, April 7.   The salads and beet ravioli were delicious, the service delightful and super to be outside on the deck.
Everything was delicious and service was great !
Staffs were friendly. Food was great !
Amazing lunch on the deck!  The pea bruschetta was almost as good as the heirloom tomato bruschetta!
Incredible. What a fantastic place. The food, service, attention to details. Incredible service at the bar. Can’t wait until next time!
Food was good, waiter was cool, ambiance was just up my alley
Pink Door is always fabulous and a great choice for any occasion, never disappoints!
Awesome every time I go.  Meatballs are a must
Had a great table at the window, beautiful view!  Amazing food!  Will definitely return!
30th birthday. Dylan was the best server I’ve ever had I adored him and we really enjoyed the whole experience!

Bartenders were super friendly! Food was tasty. I like to get creative and try to mix two meals and make my own to enhance one so I put the Aji tuna on top of a traditional Caesar salad. They blended perfectly.
Food was amazing. Get the lasagna!! Vibes and service was perfect.
Another wonderful meal and overall experience.
The food and service were amazing!
The food was fine, the waitress we had wasn't the best. The other workers there were great. The vibe was nice but there's other great places in seattle to go to too.
Wonderful spot, food, service and view
We were visiting from LA and had the best experience here! Amazing service, food was even better! Will be back 😊
Still one of the best spots in the city for dinner.
Best in town with the best view. Try to find table in back side for amazing views!!
What a fun and good restaurant with amazing views of the Puget Sound...  A Seattle institution!

Liked the overall feel of the place. Portions are not large so recommend an appetizer not just an entree, but the food was good. The view is great- however, if you want a window seat for 2 you should request one specifically when you make your reservation, otherwise they keep them “for their regulars who are in the know”. I made my reservation 6 weeks in advance for 5pm - there were several open tables when we were being seated. I asked if we could get one and that’s what I was told by the manager. Nice guy but still kind of a frustrating response. 
Biggest issue of the night, by far, was the service. Our waitress was SO bad. We had to ask 2 servers who were NOT ours for things because she was nowhere to be found for large stretches of time. I think she was at our table for drink orders and food orders, 1 time after we got our food and to finally bring the check over (which we had to ask another waiter to get for us because we were just sitting there waiting.) Someone else dropped off our meals, she never checked to see if everything was correct or if we needed anything else until we were almost finished. We needed more bread for a dish that specifically needed bread… had to find another server. Even after someone else had brought our check, my husband had to go find her to tell her the card needed to be run because we had an event to get to soon. I watched her walk over to a table near ours and stand and chat with the people for quite awhile before she finally came over. 
All in all, I really liked the overall setup of the place and vibe and the food was good. Just the seating and the service kind of put a dampening on our first impression.

Lovely experience! We ate in the dining room and loved the atmosphere in the restaurant. The lounge was neat looking as well. The food portions were perfect and the food tasted wonderful! We would definitely go back - we would recommend the Pink Door Lasagna with spinach pasta and pesto and the Pappardelle Ragu Bolognese!
Great food great waitress!
A must have experience! Beautiful meals that taste even better than they look. Literally got goosebumps after my first bite of the springtime risotto.  Perfect!

Ambiance was awesome. We were in the dining hall right by the windows with beautiful view of the water. Arancini was delicious and sauce was great. Lasagna was good. Meatballs were hearty and moist. Overall really great experience.

The tables at the front of the restaurant have fabulous views.  Staff are very pleasant.  Wouldn't choose a table near the bar.  Food was okay.  As a tourist I wouldn't go back as there are numerous of restaurants to try.
Dinner was lovely! The restaurants is beautiful, there was live jazz music playing and the food was incredible. Our waitress Ashley was a delight! Great experience and definitely will come back!
We had a wonderful time - food was great and the Ukraine drink was thoughtful
This restaurant came highly recommended; the ambiance is great but the overall experience was so- so definitely overrated. Food was average; seafood over cooked.

This was the second time going to restaurant and was awesome both times.  My son lives in Seattle area and plans to come back to the restaurant now that he knows where it is.  I love the fact that the door is kind of hidden down an alley and not in the main stream of traffic flow.  My daughter is the one that turned us on to your special restaurant.  Glad you survived the COVID.  Keep up the great work.

Excellent from start to finish! The vaccine card check is easy and done right at the top of the steps. The server was attentive, helpful and fun. The food was amazing! We had the lamb shank, pasta special, cioppino and clams with pasta. The dessert special was also very good as was the house red. Really nice birthday celebration!
first time in Seattle from Singapore !
Hostess staff was aloof and pretentious. Food and wait staff were great.
Lunch was amazing. Try the Ahi Tuna appetizer! Amazing food, service. Definitely coming back for dinner. Ask for tables by the window~

This is a lovely restaurant - and we particularly liked being seated in the section that overlooks Puget Sound.  Service is professional without being stuffy.  Food is nicely done - although not overly memorable.  In our party of 4, we had the Caesar salad with prawns, the mussels and clams and the chaucurterie plate.  All were beautiful presented.  Flavors were good.  We would return and would consider this a nice restaurant for special  occasions.

Food was amazing. Served in a timely manner. Bread was a bit chewy, if it was warmed a bit that would’ve been great.

Server we had tonight was really kind and personable. The host, up front, wearing a green turtle neck and was a young AA female, was very very cold/rude upon arrival. 

We were told we would be seated by the live music, as I called ahead of time, but we were not seated in the lounge. Not enough to raise a complaint but we thought that was odd.
This was a great find for us during our Seattle trip. Enjoyed the overall experience...
Servers were excellent. View was great. Foods amazing!
Cute restaurant. Part of the old Seattle history. Must go to. Food was good. A little on the high end but we enjoyed.
Will be back. Food was high quality lovely dishes. Beautiful ambience no matter where you sit but definitely get a window table if possible
Bday dinner. Delish
Fantastic ambience, service and food. Want to go back!
I loved every part: drinks, appetizer, pasta with clams, more drinks. Everything was delicious and our server was so kind and helpful.
Outstanding service and food. Relaxed pace, though noise level was a bit high. Make sure you get a reservation!
Everything about The Pink Door is worth having a meal there
My nieces birthday trip to Seattle,  pink door is such a fun unique spot, amazing view, good food, sad we didn’t see an Ariel act.
Nothing but an Amazing experience.  Was great from start to finish.  Recommend the Pappardelle Ragu and the Pink Door Lasagna.  Will be going back!
Excellent food and atmosphere, excited to go again someday 🙌
Friend-Anniversary
Lounge seat. Didn’t realize there would be a show but we were front row to acrobat.
Been my favorite restaurant in town for years, a must for locals and tourists alike. Unique, delicious, wonderful ambiance. Always happy to be back when I make it in.
I’ve gone so many times and I will continue to go there till the end of time. The service and the food are both phenomenal!!
The ribeye was so delicious with the risotto. Definely a must try.
Loved the relax feeling of this place, food and drinks were great.

A true gem. The wait staff is on par with canlis. The food is amazing and the prices are quite reasonable. We started with a small house antipasto,(two of us). Top shelf and bountiful. We shared mixed greens, a mushroom pasta dish and the semi freddo for dessert. Each dish was perfectly executed. Cocktails were great too.  We’ve been a few times and always perfect and I’m really picky. A Seattle must.
A fun restaurant with delicious eats! Service was very good. Would recommend.
Magical place! LOVE The Pink Door. Arty, funky, romantic, authentic. Wonderful for couples, small groups & special occasions.

This was just a lovely restaurant with an awesome back alley, vintage feel to it. The food was absolutely delicious. We had ordered twice the amount we normally do with the intent to bring some home but we devoured everything that came out. Can’t wait to come back!
Great food, ambiance, and service.

Ryan provided absolutely delightful, above and beyond service and the food was divine! Perfect atmosphere for a cozy date night and we can’t wait to return! Would absolutely recommend to anyone we know.
Great service, food,  & ambience. I’m a returning customer that will continue to go back again & again & again.

environment cant be beat. disappointing they still want to show your vax card after protocol has been dropped in Seattle. Lasagna is oh so very wonderful. Wine glass is disappointing - would expect finer glassware. Ahi crudo, a must!

Food was excellent. It is neat, trying to find is an adventure as it an unmarked door hidden away in a back alley. Once you enter down big stairs is much bigger than expected and hidden away from the chaos of the main street. The food was delicious and good sized portions. I loved my oysters. served with spicy ice which was fun and new for me. My mom who is not very adventurous loved her meal.
Eight women of a certain age celebrating an upcoming wedding.
Best ambiance, food, & service in all of Seattle. A walk into wonderland you won’t soon forget!
Had a wonderful experience. Fantastic server. Would highly recommend.
Wonderful atmosphere and attentive staff. Great food and drinks. We were celebrating our anniversary and loved it!

Excellent food. Great staff. Took my 5 yo for a “special night out”. She loved the aerialist in the lounge. The wait staff was kind in letting us take a brief break between dinner and dessert to watch her perform. Will be back on our next visit to Seattle.
Fabulous good, attentive service and great ambience.
Pink Door never disappoints. Delicious to the last bite.
Thank you Breezy for making our 7 year anniversary dinner a great experience!
Great service overall: from the host to our server,Ryan. Nice varied menu, good cocktails, and spectacular waterfront view.
Outstanding service, outstanding ambiance, and food was incredible. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to visitors and will come again next time I’m in town.
Great service, delicious!
Our favorite place to wine and dine in Seattle. The food is always good, wide range of wine and excellent service.
The pappardelle is the best I’ve ever had! I order two plates.
Arancini was great! Everything else was just good. Customer service was ok.

Great atmosphere and wonderful food. Apps came out quickly but there was a huge lag in getting our mains which resulted in not having enough time for dessert (we had tickets to an event). We were there 2 hrs.
Always a great experience when sitting in the dining room.

My husband and I celebrated our 6 year anniversary at The Pink Door.  The staff was Amazing, the ambiance was great and we got to experience an acrobatic show.  E enjoy our time. Would recommend and will defiantly go again.
Beautiful restaurant with great helpful staff.  Food was amazing and drinks did not dissapoint!
Dylan C was the best server! Atmosphere was great with live music and amazing food! Highly recommend dining here!
We always love it. It is  A favorite destination for special events. Also Enjoy taking visiting friends there if they like Italian and seafood.
Split a pasta with a dining companion so you can try more of the menu!  Non-alcoholic bartender creations also recommended.

This was by far one of the best dining experiences that I have had. Everything about the restaurant was amazing. Can’t wait to visit Seattle again and I’ll be sure to come to The Pink Door. Thank you!
Always impressive never disappoints
We were celebrating our anniversary and we were seated right by the window. We enjoyed the beautiful view while dining on delicious food.
Loved every part of this dining experience! 10/10!
We had a nice time and great food at the Pink Door. A varied menu and excellent service. Appreciate being Covid safe.
Beautiful place and delicious food with excellent customer service. This place is always a favorite.

Lunch was on-point!  My guest had the fish-of-the day (pan-crusted cod), and I had the Bolognese, which has the softest wide egg noodles, and delicious spicy sausage sauce.  It was perfect.  And, as an appetizer, we share the rice-filled cheese balls.  They were incredible.  We were using our bread to sop up the sauce from the plate after we devoured them.  I had forgotten just how good the food is here.  Will be back for dinner!
Birthday celebration

First time in Seattle and heard about this place so had to try it. We enjoyed the ambience, but did not enjoy where we were seated. We were placed on a stage above the rest of the restaurant felt like others could see us eating which is not comfortable. Also the table was so small it barely could hold the bread basket and the dipping plates and water. Felt like if I moved I might knock something over and it fall on the ppl sitting below us. The food was good, but nothing amazing. The rib eye we ordered was very charred, and the pasta bowl was mostly just shells not very much pasta. The cocktails were tasty and we loved the live performance. Nice touch to a Saturday night date.

AMAZING EVERYTHING! The ambiance in the bar (best place to sit), the incredibly nice waitstaff, delicious cuisine, and spectacular entertainment made our entire weekend trip to Seattle the best experience! LOVED The Pink Door and we will be back again & again!!!
The food and service was outstanding!  The Arancini was fabulous!
Service, food, dinging room, all were just excellent...
Delivered our starter to a different table then finally got it to us in the middle of our entree. Was expecting a comp.
The food and service was amazing
The staff is friendly,efficient,welcoming and not stuffy. Knowledgeable about food and beverage. Ambiance is warm and elegant. Food was top notch. Wine list had many reasonably priced selections.

There was really loud table next to us.  I feel the staff should have asked them to quiet down.  Otherwise, as usual, 5 star.  Have been goinng to the pink door since i worked on 4th and blanchard in the 80's.  It always feels like i am coming home.....
Lasagna was the best and very creamy. Beautiful decor and presentation. Window seating at sunset, nothing beats it.
One of the best meals we’ve ever had! The lasagna was outstanding. Loved everything.

While mother nature added to the ambiance--a beautiful sunset. The food and service and setting always delights. Oysters with frozen mignonette were delicious followed by crab caesar salad, cioppino, and mushroom pasta---amazing!!! Company was fabulous too!

The pink door was definitely one of a kind. From the exterior pink door to their seasonal menu. The noise level was pretty loud inside making it difficult to hear the person across from me and our server. We started with mushroom crostini and we felt the dish was overall very oily and messy to eat. Flavors were great and very delish. We had the risotto and fish of the day for our entree. Fish dish - overall great dish but very acidic from the vinaigrette. Risotto - overall also great, but radicchio made the dish bitter and sausage pieces were too big - inconsistent with rice. For dessert we had ricotta donuts and an affogato (off menu) which were both AMAZING. The grapefruit jelly with the donuts was to die for, I wish we could have take some home with us. The affogato was a nice touch at the end of the meal. Thanks for having us!
The food was incredible and the atmosphere was dazzling. It's a nice place for a special occasion but it's not pretentious. The servers were helpful and friendly. The waterfront view was lovely.
The Pink Door has such a beautiful ambiance, wonderful staff, and delicious food. Definitely a must-eat in Seattle.
Everything was perfect. There’s a reason this establishment has been around for decades. They never disappoint.

Visiting from out of town, this was our first time at Pink Door. The food was excellent! Some factors driving my lower rating included a very long wait to get our food. We had a 7:45 pm reservation on a Tuesday, so at the time we got there, the rush was dissipating. There were three of us, and we were seated at a table for two, so it was very cramped. Also, although our waitress was very friendly and professional, she only checked on our table a few times after initially getting our drinks and order. It would have been nice if she would have stopped by to reassure us that our order was on the way, and perhaps offer a comp for the extremely long delay. I'll definitely go back at some point to give it another try, simply because the food was so good. I don't want to negate giving it a second chance due to the possibility it was an off-night for the staff with service and timeliness.

We came for my daughter’s 17 birthday dinner which was a surprise to her. I chose the Pink Door because they have the aerial show on Tuesdays. When I made the reservation, I could only choose a table in the dining room which is not close to the performer. The lounge area is where the show is and it’s on a first-come, first-serve basis. I called to get an idea of how it all works and I was fine with a table in the dining room. But when we showed up, we were surprised with a table in the lounge! Not sure if they reserved it for us or if we just lucked out, but it made us feel special. My daughter LOVED the place, decor, ambiance and of course the show! Our server was very attentive and engaging. The food was good. We highly recommend the Pink Door especially if you’re looking for an evening with an extra oomph!
Fantastic restaurant.  The food is delicious, and the service is excellent.  Very comfortable and appealing interior.  The entertainment is also a nice touch.
Wonderful food and exceptional service! Pink Door is our favorite spot to dine when visiting Seattle.

I really have no complaints with the food, service or ambiance. All were very good. My only problem was that I much prefer to have dinner there at the Pink Door, but all the evening times were already booked which I found to be odd. I even tried to reserve a table a week or so beyond the desired date, but nothing was available, even in the months of February or early March !  I explained this to my waitress, but she didn’t really have a decent explanation.
What a great place! Staff was fun, wecoming, accomodating. Music was fantastic. We had a wonderful time. Highly recommend it!

We traveled to Seattle for a weekend away and I came across some blogs that said The Pink Door was a must-try place while visiting. The food was delicious - the Pappardelle Al Ragu Bolognese was one of the best pasta dishes I think I've ever had! The noodles were delicious - as was the sauce!  It was a great date night location for my husband and I while visiting. The other food items we had were delicious as well.  I would certainly recommend this location for others going to the area!

The ambience of this place is amazing! But unfortunately that’s the only positive thing I have to say about this place. The food was disappointing and almost inedible. The entree I received tasted as if a bucket had been dropped into the ocean and dumped on to the plate. With so many positive reviews we had high expectations and were extremely disappointed. Save your money, time, and your taste buds. Your stomach will thank you.
Great food. Never felt rushed.
Great place and great food! Service was very expedient, food was delivered warm, and the staff are more then accommodating. Five stars all around!
A group of us went in Feb for a birthday. The service was excellent and the food was outstanding! 😊

Amazing food, friendly service, great ambiance and views of the water. 

Would highly recommend for a nice dinner out or special occasion in Seattle.
Plan ahead and get your reservations for this place. The atmosphere is fun, our server was very attentive and personable and the food is delicious.
It was decent.
Great atmosphere, superb service and excellent food. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for authentic Italian cuisine

Your service, from water, to wine, to the food that was prepared and brought to our table, was exceptional. Thank you for being part of our evening prior to the show at the Moore Theatre.
I was at your restaurant back in High School, 30+ years ago, and the ambiance is still as excellent and classical as it was back then.
The food is amazing!
Excellent food, service, music, and overall vibe. Highly recommend.
This is the best restaurant in the Seattle area hands down and it was my last night in town so there was no better place I’d rather be. Will be making reservations for every visit back!
I had an amazing experience at The Pink Door! Everyone was so friendly, and my server gave me some good suggestions on my meal. 10/10 would go back again!
Great visit.  Great friendly service.  Solid squid ink pasta. Would recommend.
We stopped in for a late lunch, and it was delicious. Bar service was friendly and fast. We shared the whole fish, and it was amazing. Oh and get the oysters with the pink balsamic shaved ice.

We have never been disappointed in the Pink Door, and last night was no exception. The food, the service, the ambiance is spectacular and this is why this restaurant is our go-to for all of our special occasions. Last night was my son's 18th birthday and the server and the hostess both were aware and wished him a happy birthday. 
5 of us ate and drank and enjoyed appetizers and the bill was well below 250.00, which is pretty outstanding for food this delicious.
If you've not tried their lasagne, you are missing out. By far, the most delicious lasagne I've ever had. Oh, and don't forget the garlic bread. Excellent wine list as well.
Didn’t enjoy the service.
It was windy and 32 degrees outside the night we ate had your wonderfully prepared King Salmon with a blessed sauce. I would walk thru a blinding snowstorm to have that meal again.
Absolutely amazing food and service!!
Absolutely loved our experience at the Pink Door. The staff was kind, engaging, and attentive, and the food and drinks were delicious. We hope to come back next time we are in town!
Excellent from beginning to end.  Vibe was perfect for a family of 4.  The service was exactly where it needed to be, the food was excellent(!), and the view was an added bonus.

It has been six years since we last went for a date night at the Pink Door. We enjoyed sitting in the new addition in the back with the view of the water and pike place. The food was delicious as always and the atmosphere was wonderful. Just. Slight complaint. We felt our server was lacking in friendliness but they did answer our questions when we asked. The other thing is we had ordered the garlic bread and would have loved more and did not realized that we could have gotten free bread with olive oil dipping but was never offered this and witness all the tables around us get this. So I had no bread with my main entry.
My new favorite restaurant in Seattle! The deserts were amazing!
Our favorite Seattle restaurant!
Fabulous! Beautiful food! Perfect ambience. Well worth the late reservation
The reservation was difficult to get a month in advance. If possible try 6 weeks or more before. The food is well worth it. The ambience is great and the view of Pugent Sound is lovely.
Great vibe and wonderful staff. Wish the chairs were a little more comfy.
A must if in Seattle! The food, drinks, service and ambiance exceeded our expectations!!
Italian soda was amazing food very good but a bit on the pricy side overall very good

Our all-time favorite is the crispy bread appetizer (perfectly crisped, perfectly dripping with delicious olive oil), although the mushroom-slathered bread tranches are also divine.  Hubby swears by the pappardelle al ragu bolognese.  Dad and I recently split the caesar salad and the rigatoni with mama's meatballs; both were perfection, avoiding the pitfalls of gloppy sauce, overdone (soft) pasta, and ordinary-flavored meatballs.  I always wish there were more vegetable sides, as straight pasta is, well, straight pasta.  A gracious three carrot slices, or two sprigs of perfect broccolini would take these plates to perfection, not to mention nutritive sanity.  

While the food is excellent, we always regret the cafeteria feel of the dining room: hard, noise-bouncing surfaces, detached wait staff (competent but not warm or relaxed), and a service style oriented more to moving tourists rather than developing long-term loyalty and relationships.   For example, once our waitress delivered the bottle of wine to the table and poured the initial glass, she never again poured or checked wine status.  It's a touch of graciousness entirely missing.
Great place in pike place excellent food and service
Romantic ambience. Exceptionally fresh seafood. Views of the sound. Artfully crafted cocktails. 10/10
Great staff, excellent food and wine, lovely view, it was a remarkable evening!
Always an outstanding experience. Food was flawless and service was excellent.
Just great overall!  First time dining there and will definitely be back.
Great food, great service!

It's not the Old Pink door. The restaurant is twice as big as it used to be with water view dining on the west side of the expanded restaurant. Gorgeous space, delicious food and lots of characters eating and working there. Not just a meal out but a real experience. Reminiscent of "Theatro Zin Zanni"

Very nice place and reasonably priced. Nice view of the waterfront if you’re able to get a table in the back. We did almost miss the door because it’s in an alley and there’s no sign. The door is actually pink though.
extremely nice place, good food, excellent service, highly recommend
Food and atmosphere were incredible! Absolutely will be coming back.

It had been more than 20 years since our last visit to the Pink Door, that's definitely too long to wait, this is one of Seattle's finest! The food is outstanding, the service excellent, and the entertainment really tops off a terrific evening! This is a must visit establishment, for the food, atmosphere and entertainment, a triple whammy!
Great ambience, food, drinks and service. Would definitely go back

Unique and beautifull decor, both inside and outside; service is always excellent; the menu offers a nice range of delicious items; the overall vibe of clientele, art, water and garden views and fun helpful servers creates a perfect experience.  You will want to return!

The restaurant had a lot of tasteful food that it leaves a memorable impression, everything from the food to the atmosphere was fantastic. The customer service was phenomenal and my partner and I enjoyed our time there! I highly recommend eating here at least once in your life

Amazing! As soon as you step inside it’s a completely different vibe. Jazz music playing and everyone dressed up. The food was so good I forgot to take pictures. They give you complementary bread and the slices are freaking huge! The portions aren’t huge but they are filling. They even took our picture with a Polaroid on the way out.  We had an amazing valentines night and will be back.
This is our favorite restaurant and they never disappoint. You simply cannot beat the quality of the food and the ambience. Pink Door should be on everyone’s list.

Amazing experience for Valentine’s Day! Server was super nice and helpful, we asked to go through the menu with reco’s and they did a great job patiently explaining. We ended up with a few selections and they even gave the great suggestion of bringing it out gradually as different courses. Food was absolutely amazing especially for the value. Ambience was so soft and romantic, live jazz was great. Worth booking 30 days in advance for sure!
One of the best Italian places, great place, would highly recommend
Always perfect, the best!
Had a wonderful time, very experienced waiter, no pressure, good time.
After reading great reviews, we made reservations way ahead, but were greatly disappointed! The place was loud, the quality of food is good, but not to charge what they do. Try something else…
So much fun and food was delish! We loved the cured meat and cheese plate. Ribeye was also fabulous. Can’t wait to visit again.

Everything was perfect! I think they upgraded us to a low top in the dining room which was perfect, right at the windows looking out on to the water. The food was delicious and brought a fresh twist to traditional dishes! Can’t wait to come back here every time I come to Seattle!
Best lasagna on earth- beautiful atmosphere, great views, service was amazing.

I've wanted to come here for years and it did not disappoint. I had no idea there was a gorgeous view of the water and live music. Not to mention the food and drinks were delicious, the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the place is beautifully decorated. I will be coming back very soon!
Sat at the bar. Our bartender/waiter was friendly and helpful. Very tasty food and drinks. But it really is all about the atmosphere. You feel like you are in on the secret. Must come!
Such great service, wonderful food and options and great cocktails. Would always recommend!
Such a great vibe and amazing food! Will be coming back here vey soon

The hostess was not very welcoming at all. This is my 2nd time in 2 months visiting and she still had the same attitude as the 1st time I visited. Sadly, that was the only reason my experience was not a 5 star

One of the best establishments to entertain. Professional service, beautiful setting, and ambiance. Can be a bit loud, but wonderful energy. 
Most of my guests find it to be world class.

Great table in their expanded area that was light but still cozy and overlooked the water. The wild king salmon with the tapenade, broccolini and roasted fingerling potatoes was delish as well as my partner's hearty sausage risotto.

Restaurant was full for the lunch hour but our server was attentive. Loved the fact that staff was diligent in checking vac status.

We'll be back again for another special lunch!
Quirky, out of the way, great Italian restaurant!  When your near Pike’s Place, Go! (If you can find it). Overall: 4.5stars.
We sat in room overlooking Elliott bay. It was beautiful. The food was excellent as was the service.

We ordered the clams and mussels for appetizer and had the salmon special and Caesar salad with Dungeness crab. The clams were really small and I’m guessing it’s out of season. But the wine sauce was really tasty. The salmon was a bit over cooked. The waiter did not ask how we wanted the salmon cooked. The Dungeness crab was a bit disappointing. The meat was too shredded and not whole crab meat. Other than that the meal was good and price is right.
Unparalleled ambience. Excellent food and service. One of our favorite spots in Seattle!!

The food was really good and the service was outstanding.
Our Server, Kristi, was personable, efficient, prompt and gave us some excellent recommendations.  We will be back.

Off the bat, I should say that I love The Pink Door.  It has long been one of my favorite Seattle locales.  I do not know what has befallen the place & hope it's a transient effect of the pandemic.  My most recent visit greeted me with rude & uninformed staff, including our server, & a hostility unlike any I had ever witnessed in this setting.  I have a soft spot for the restaurant, or I would be reluctant to return after that experience.
Amazing. Came here twice during my time in Seattle and wish it could’ve been more.

Just amazing! This is the ultimate date night spot in Seattle. We requested a table by the window and we got it! We got to enjoy the sunset over some really good food. Every employee there was so nice too.

I have had some truly wonderful meals at The Pink Door; always with a dining companion. (Thus the 3 star review) This time around I was dining solo before the ballet and I can only assume, because it was just moi,  I got the reject table. You know the one, it’s right next to the bar with the rambunctious drunk guys and so close to the front door that you have a steady stream of people walking past you hitting you with their coats and bags as if you’re invisible.  Solo diners deserve some ambiance too. This afterthought of a table really dampened the experience. The soggy mushroom bruschetta didn’t exactly help either. I’ll be back with friends, but I won’t dine solo here again.

Fresh Italian. Unique and well-loved entrees. Pricy wine list, but reasonably priced dinner (for downtown Seattle). Quaint settling. Loved the increase space between tables - makes for a more intimate dining  experience. The only truly downside is trying to get a reservation.
everything was wonderful from being greeted at the front all the way through the dinner and upon leaving.
Absolutely wonderful food and service! Please get the lasagna you won't regret it! Would recommend again and again

Everything was amazing from the moment we stepped in to the restaurant!! The food is some of the best I’ve had since I was in Italy! Amazing and attentive service beyond compare! Alexis was a fantastic server!! Cannot wait to come back!

We were able to get a reservation here while we were in town for our first ever visit. I LOVED my experience here! Food, views, service - it was all amazing! Will recommend to folks coming to Seattle in the future
The food was delicious!
