Last time I was in Seattle I remember the food at The Pink Door being amazing so I went back on my trip this year and the food was still just as good as I remember it being!
Food is sooooooooo good. I’m Italian and very picky. Oysters, cioppino, bolognese, lamb shank with polenta.
We love the experience of being so well cared for during our quarterly luncheon. Service is absolutely the best! And the food, always sublime!
Ahi appetizer is fantastic and not what you’d expect. Nice touch with the fried capers. The whole mean was wonderful
Amazing as always! The bolognese and salmon special were incredible!
Really nice place. I had dinner with my husband. Everything was perfect, service was good and food was amazing. Highly recommended
Maria was a great waitress, and the food was incredible

What a great date spot. Beautiful and fine dining inside, there is few other places I've been that can match the ambiance that you will find here at the Pink Door. Sometimes I think a dish could use a small tweak here or there, but overall the food is very good and high quality. You can't go wrong putting this in your special date rotation.
service, food, entertainment, vibe, view - all amazing! Thank you for a great night!
Delicious and wonderful all around! The arancini was the best part!
My favorite Italian in Seattle! Always top notch!

Amazing food and drinks. Seated in the lounge area where an instrumental jazz band was playing. They played quiet enough to have a conversation. Service was spectacular. Will definitely be back again.

There really should be a 6th star ⭐️ Pink Door meets and exceeds expectations - every. single. time.
From the human-centric staff to the artisan cocktails and cuisine… Special shout out to Lola, who sparkles from the inside out and makes every Pink Door visit and dining experience that much brighter.

First time sitting in overflow dining area. Always love pink door, this time the food felt rushed. My noodles were not cooked all the way. Tables were very close together. I prefer the main dining room, the low light and ambiance just makes for a better dining experience.

Been dining here since they opened their iconic pink door in the early 80s. I expressed our concern about healthy airflow during this precarious time. They  promptly responded and placed us at a scenic window table and opened the window. The food was delicious (love the pink lasagne) and the service was on point. It’s always such a wonderful experience and the ambiance is unmatched. Thank you!
Thank you for the amazing service for my moms birthday! Food was incredible :)
The mushroom crostini was our favorite!! Great ambiance, fantastic Seattle resturant.
Fabulous evening with love entertainment. Delicious food and wonderful attentive staff.
It was my son’s 16th birthday. We’ve been to Pink Door a few times now and as a family we agree the entire experience has been wonderful. Brings us back to our time living in Italy ❤️
Delicious food. Wonderful atmosphere and service.  View of Pike’s market and Elliott Bay.  Reserve ahead of time to be guaranteed seating as it is quite popular.
Honestly such an incredible experience! It is the cutest spot. Loved the food, our server was phenomenal and I love the jazz band!!
Was a very good experience. Food was great, service was great, and we had a fantastic time.
Great food, the server was helpful and kind, the ambiance was enjoyable!
Love the Pink Door for its ambience, food and service.  Carter did an excellent job serving us and meeting our dinning needs!

Wonderful experience dining at the Pink Door! This was not my first time there. All my times dining here have been great. This is the first time I’ve gone for lunch. Food was exceptional as always, but our server really was remarkable. She was attentive, helpful and pleasant , not pushy or overbearing and made you feel welcomed.
Took our out of state son and he loved it

Such a special spot! Gorgeous and unique atmosphere, live entertainment, and Italian food noteworthy enough to write home about. Always a favorite for date nights or to show off Seattle when friends visit!
Great food and atmosphere!

Awesome food. Nice ambiance. We were lucky to have the view of the sunset and that made up for the early reservation we had. We have been trying to get a reservation at The Pink Door for a while and eventually decided to go one a weekday as that's what was available. The fish (market order) was very well cooked and they were happy to accommodate a slight modification to the order without hesitation. We could only try one dessert. The panacotta with orange flavor is quite good. I highly recommend this restaurant and we ourselves will go again in a few months.
The room we sat in was beautiful and the food was delicious! Definitely coming back!
My favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle! It has such a intimate environment and it's perfect for date nights. The service is great too.

Emily our server was great, food was amazing, beautiful view! Had a lovely time. 
Great place for a birthday dinner
Friend’s birthday celebration. Delicious food, requested a table near the live music but was sat way in the back…waitress was not very attentive, bartender was great!
No complaints from my last visit. The food came out quickly and was absolutely delicious. Our server was very nice and helpful.
Absolutely amazing staff, so so sweet. Food was very good and reasonably priced for a somewhat fine dining restaurant. Get the lasagna pink door!

I love this place… one of my favorites.
Ribeye is incredible. Excellent service.
Love their food!! Little salty for Asian palette but overall my family loved the food!!

Arrived 30 minutes early for reservation and seated immediately at a great window table with a view. Server’s recommendations were excellent. We shared the lasagna and the scallops special. Lasagna was lovely, not the traditional preparation, but very creamy and delicious. Scallops were prepared perfectly. Also enjoyed some NW oysters on the half shell. Very fresh and clean tasting. Looking forward to a return visit.
Food is fantastic.  Great view if the bay. Welcoming and knowledgeable staff.
fantastic setting and greatly priced food
Amazing food and ambiance! Service was amazing as well! Oysters were so fresh!

The ambiance was awesome. We arrived prior to our reservation, and the hostess was able to seat us immediately. Our food and our drinks were both spectacular. I highly recommend this spot for a date night.
Great environment, nice people and outstanding food

The Pink Door is our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  We often drive from Olympia
for special occasions at the Pink Door.
The Pink Door never disappoints!  All three of us enjoyed our entrees and shared the mushroom crostini - delicious!!

Excellent as always.   Used to go there quite often when we both worked downtown.  Took the bus from West Seattle and walked over from 3rd Ave.  Highly recommend for a downtown treat with a great view.
Classic and iconic Seattle restaurant. Great food and exceptional service.
A truly memorable experience in every way possible! I cannot recommend this restaurant enough, everything from the food to the atmosphere was unforgettable.
Wonderful as always, thank you. Consistent, lovely.
No sign at the front door. The food was okay but only seafood option was trout
The food, service and ambiance were exceptional from start to finish!  Quite possibly my favorite dining experience ever!
A beautiful experience, great food an great service
The food and service were great.  The place was hard to find. No sign, just a door that was pink.  The tables were very close together and it was noisy

This was the first time for my wife and myself. We read the reviews, decided to check in out and it exceeded out expectations! The food, atmosphere and service was outstanding! Beautifully impressed!  You definitely need to go!
Pink Door never disappoints. The food is delicious and I love the elegant, romantic vibe of the restaurant. Perfect for a romantic dinner or a special celebration.

Gorgeous and quirky inside, the atmosphere was great, it wasn’t super busy for a Wednesday in January but I’d love to see it full as I’m sure it’s a fantastic atmosphere. Food was delicious, we had the blue cheese gnocchi and it was so full of flavour along with a seafood dish which kept it light. Definitely recommend!
What a lovely birthday lunch! The dining room is beautiful, our server was perfect, and the food was delicious.

The best New Year Eve Celebration ever . The food was fantastic . Our wonderful server, Emily , made the difference. Thanks Emily.
We had a wonderful time .
Grazie

Very cool spot. Located close to the water, I could see a patio that is probably open during the summer. Vintage building but   dressed up nice on the inside. Clean dining areas, back bar, clean restrooms. Service was great - waiters & waitresses were dressed up nice, the trapeze performances were awesome. We dined for 3 hrs and & saw one performance per hour. Since we attended on NYE there was a pre-fixe menu and it was very good. Fresh oysters, fennel salad, squid ink pasta w/ crab, short rib & pasta. They offered wine pairing but we declined and ordered a bottle of champagne. The dessert course was some of the best we have ever had. Chocolate coffee cheesecake & ricotta donut holes. Topped the night off with cocktails - Oh my word, a bourbon based cocktail with amaro & green chartreuse. And a twist on the Negroni cocktail with an egg white shake. 5 stars, would recommend, and we plan on returning.
Wonderful atmosphere and decor, excellent New Year's Even prix fixe menu, and very attentive service.  The trapeze artist was an extra bonus and I look forward to coming back again, many times!

NYE dinner and this was the perfect place to enjoy the evening. The service was the best! Food amazing and the entertainment was excellent. We started off with drinks at the bar and at the end of our evening, we both agree that this was one of the best experiences in a long time.
This is the best italian restaurant I ever had in Seattle. Very auhtentic. The only downside is there is not a lot of dessert selection.

Be on the look out for this gem as there is not a sign to designate the location of this restaurant but rather well... a pink door!

A truly great restaurant to visit if you're in the area as the decor, service, and food were welcoming and provided a relaxing atmosphere to enjoy our lunch experience. The gnocchi with Gorgonzola, walnut, and pomegranate seeds was delicious and did not need the accompaniment of a protein as the components were flavorful and the gnocchi was very well made. The bread with truffle crema and mushrooms was a great start to the meal and our cocktails were just the right amount of sweetness.
Love it here! Impeccable service and delicious food!
Amazing service, unique food choices, outstanding flavor, gluten free garlic bread(YES!!), and friendly/knowledgeable staff.
First time attending for my fiancé and I and we’ll certainly be back. Food amazing and the service to match.
Few slots to reserve. Able to get in earlier than our scheduled appointment since not busy.

Another great meal at Pink Door! I had a 1/2 order of the antipasto della casa, and even that was enough for a full meal (loved the beans, salami, prosciutto, sautéed bell peppers, zucchini, etc.). Then the pappardelle Bolognese, which is as good as I've had in multiple trips to Bologna. Ending with a pear poached in red wine--a satisfying ending without being loaded with sugar--you could even say "healthy" :-). Finally topped off with an espresso that's for real (most restaurant espresso is bad stuff, here it's very good).

I opted for wines by the glass, starting with their Franicacorta (a sparkling wine from just east of Milan--better than most Prosecco's) and moving on to an Etna Rosso for the meal. Both were quite nice.

This is one of the best Italian restaurants in Seattle. Highly recommended. Just be sure to get a reservation!
We had the most amazing time after being stranded in Seattle for a few days. A must see restaurant.
This is our favorite restaurant and once again was absolutely outstanding.
The food is excellent.
We loved it. Arancini and meatballs were big winners. Any thoughts about adding Tiramisu to the dessert menu??
Excellent！ The best restaurant I had during this Seattle’s trip
The Pink Door will always be my go-to, all-time favorite of the entire Seattle food scene, & I am particular.
Good service and the food was good
Amazing everything for a special occasion!
Christmas Eve Eve
The antipasta was excellent.  Was full before finishing the main course.
Risotto was very good. The Ahi Crudo and the view of the Puget Sound were superb.
Continues to be one of my favorite spots in Seattle. Ambiance, delicious food and location… has it all.

We loved our waitress! She was personable, attentive, but not overly so. She helped make our celebration of my husband's birthday dinner feel special. We had a small, but nice table with a lovely view of the water. The ambience was lively, but not too loud.  The oysters were fresh and good. The lasagna was rather bland. It needed something for texture. Maybe mushrooms? The caesar salad with grilled prawns was very good. The scallops special was very nice.

Beautiful view of Pike Place and waterfront. Elegant holiday  decor and setting. Excellent food with quality ingredients. 
You have to get the poached pear!

Amazing experience 
our Server Ashley was super! 
The food is always spot on and the craft cocktails bliss! 
The best Armagnac served proper!
Great service and good food
An overall great dining experience.
The food is great and the ambiance is fantastic.  Will return sometime soon.
The antipasto plate is delicious! I also recommend the gnocchi.
As always, The Pink Door was amazing! Took friends who are new to town and they loved it, as we knew they would.
Lovely time!
It was a lovely location for our daughters birthday

Location is exceptional.  Atmosphere is warm and unique and tasteful.  Service is tuned to perfection.  Food is delicious-often items that you would not typically do at home.  Wine list is very nice.  Price is reasonable.  I typically pursue different restaurant experiences whenever I go out or travle.  The Pink Door is a place I would like to visit everytime I am in Seattle.

This was our recommendation from a friend and I must say it is better than it was mentioned. The service was very prompt and friendly. We had the arancini, cioppino and clam & linguini pasta as well as panna cotta and red wine poached pear. Food is amazing and highly recommendable.
Most of the food was good, service was lacking after main dishes were delivered.

Our semi-annual trip to the Pink Door did not disappoint. The only slight knock was our server wasn’t as experienced as they historically have been. She wasn’t able to recommend beverages to accompany our meal. Otherwise the service was great as usual.
Lives up to its reputation. Food is outstanding and service is excellent.
Absolutely exceeded expectations from the food (Halibut) to the service. Recommending this to others and looking forward to returning! Thank you
Food was great, service was very professional and ambience was lively

Last visit for us was 35 years ago (moved out of state). Still great food and a fun location by Pike Place Market. Their facility has been expanded and now includes a dining section with views toward the water. Definitely recommended for celebration meals or visitors, if you’re able to get a reservation. Book ahead.
Amazing food, view and ambience! Their vegetarian lasagna is to die for!

It was a fantastic meal. We live in La Conner and come into Seattle about once a month. We will continue to come to the Pink Door each time we are in town.
My brother, Dennis Conte, says hello to Jackie.
Ron Conte
Love sitting near the West windows. Food was excellent.
Awesome waitress.
Went in for our ten year anniversary and everything was perfect. I highly recommend the seasonal winter drinks. Thank you to Dominic who was an excellent server!
Fabulous food and service!! The Pink Door is always a wonderful experience, especially so during the holidays.

Love the ambiance of this place. My server was knowledgeable and made great recommendations for us to eat and drink. Drinks and food were great. 
The acrobat performance was beautiful. Would definitely visit again.
Our 40th anniversary dinner at Pink Door was as fantastic as the first time we went there. Very glad the Cioppino is still on the menu!

Beautiful food, beautiful ambiance, a view of the water, great waiters and waitresses. What’s not to love? Perfect for that special day/night out when you want to treat yourself. Every dish I’ve tried here is simply amazing, explore with it and dare to try something you normally wouldn’t, I’m sure it will pleasantly surprise your taste buds.
Pink Door never disappoints. The lasagna is next level.

First came here more than 10 years ago, then moved away. It was remarkable then and even better now. They've added a huge room with views of Elliott Bay (ask for it) and an already gorgeous restaurant has taken it to a new level of beauty. But let's talk about a staff that is warm, friendly and attentive. Walking to the rest room, a half dozen say hello. And the food? Well, it is exceptional, as well. Some great Italian dishes and lots of seafood. You will want to return, over and over again, as I have. It is memorable and inspiring.
Finally got to go here and it was spectacular! Food, wine, service, all was a 10/10.

We came here to celebrate our one year anniversary. I had requested a table with a nice view but unfortunately we were sat in the only area of the restaurant with no view of outside or even the live band that was playing. Also, I had noted on our reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary but that was not acknowledged. The service was sub-par, we waited about 10 minutes just to be seen or given water. The food was good. I loved the lasagna but my husband found the lamb shank a little too fatty and gristly.
Wonderful per usual!
Wonderful experience in an established Seattle restaurant. It was a very festive evening in the Pike Place Market. The food and service were perfect!
This place is fantastic. Great food, great atmosphere. Love it
Lovely holiday lunch with friends, yummy  food, great service and festive location for any season.

Love the environment and the food.  The staff is stressed but handling it well; probably better than I ever would, and the experience is still stellar. 

People love the lasagna and the meatballs but I think the bolognese is the unknown star — extremely, extremely good with homemade pappardelle.   Panna cotta; amazing.   The bread they get from the local baker is so well made it is actually delicate.  Homemade infused olive oil.  Wow.  Very nice meal.
Love this place, the views, food and service are always top notch!
Great place. We took a group of out of town friends here. Food is spectacular, we ordered bruschetta and oysters appetizers, cioppiono, seasonal dishes, lasagna, and it was all wonderful.
Husbands 30th bday

We were there for hub’s bday and it didn’t feel particularly special; if anything, we felt rushed.  Otherwise, the food, drinks & atmosphere were quite nice.  Would recommend for most any occasion, but not a special one.
Fabulous food, amazing ambiance, great value, incredible service!!
The Pink Door never disappoints. Ashly was our server. She was perfect in every way. And the food? Also perfect.
From the moment we sat down, everything was fabulous!

The Pink Door does it all well! Leisurely lunch in it’s beautifully appointed holiday dining room. The wait staff was attentive without being obtrusive, very knowledgeable with excellent suggestions and each course was delectable! A perfect holiday dining experience.
Always a favorite. Very festive and a little loud.
Beautiful interiors but the food was a disappointment. Our french fries and meatballs were not cooked all the way through. Our waiter was unfriendly and put forth the minimum.
love the classic Seattle Style, the views overlooking the market, great service and great food!
Just Amazing
Absolutely amazing!!! I entertained clients and had an early dinner, it was perfect ad the service is wonderful!

The Pink Door is always our restaurant of choice when in Seattle.  For the first time
the noise level was a concern.  Perhaps it is that it is that I am 80 or we were at a table was surrounded by a large crowd.  Have not noticed this to be a problem in the past.

Thank you,

Jim and Kay Eisenhardt
Delicious lunch with friends. Nice place for celebrating or just having a nice lunch/dinner.
Food was delicious. Service the best that we received in Seattle on our visit. Wonderful dining experience with my daughter. Thank you!

Arrived early sat at the bar till we were seated.  Relaxed atmosphere and casual dining in a humble unassuming place.  Passed the entrance several times lol.  But good was good and service was nice.  Bartender was cool too!
Like the foods! The drinks , the ambience , like the dining room ! Wish there were more cocktails option too and some birthday special cake 🍰
Mother & Daughter weekend!
The best place to spend our anniversary dinner. Our server (Emily) was kind, fun, and timely. She gave us great recommendations. The food and drinks and view was amazing.
Fantastic food, great service, and a super cool atmosphere.
Pink Door is always a yes. The food is always amazing, and the service is great!

The food, service and atmosphere at The Pink Door were outstanding. I would not typically order lasagna but after reading other reviews we ordered it and were not disappointed. It was truly delicious. We also ordered the gnocchi with rabbit and it was amazing!

Everything was outstanding; from the wine recommendation, appetizer, Caesar salad, entree and the Butterscotch Budino was out of this world!!! Service was excellent! Finding the Pink Door was certainly part of the adventure!
Always fabulous!!
Our waitress Elyse E was the best. We have been coming to the Pink Door for years and we always have a good time but Elyse made this time really fun.

The Pink Door NEVER disappoints, my only issue is I wish my stomach were bigger so I could order more things! Making the choices is hard! The Pappardelle Ragu Bolognaise is about the most delicious thing on the planet. The Arancini balls are to die for. The bread & delicious olive oil they serve with meals can't be beat. I will come back here again and again.
Best of Seattle.  Fab. lunch with Elliot Bay view!
Amazing food! Definitely a unique Seattle experience.

Everything was wonderful. Ashley, our Waitress was "The best waitress ever, as I told her. The young man who dilivered and uncorked our wine was pleasant and knowledgeble. Atmosphere was excellent as it always is. Busy, busy night. It was there 40th Anniversary night, and my 78th Birthday celebration as well. Ashley took good care of me as well as the other four at the table. The wine and food was superb. Good time! John

It was an amazing experience. However, thinking about the price you pay and the waitlist to get a reservation, it was a little bit disappointing. There was no privacy for us to talk because it was very loud, our table was extremely tiny, and right next to the other tables, we were almost touching the other customers on both sides. They didn’t have another table available to switch us. The food was amazing. The best steak ever, the appetizer was incredibly delicious, the drinks were made with great quality and flavor. The trapeze performance was BEAUTIFUL!
Underwhelming food. Restaurants is hardly an Italian restaurant.

Wow, we really enjoyed our dining experience here! There's a lot of hype around The Pink Door, and reservation availability is scarce, and for good reason. Here are a few:

The food: We asked our server about her favorite dishes, and everything hit the spot. We *cleaned our plates* (sauce and all!) of the arancini, garlic bread, parpadelle, and lasagna dishes. We indulged and got two desserts, the bourbon boudin (a sort of pudding) and ricotta doughnuts -- my favorite! 

The entertainment & ambiance: We were originally sat in the back of the restaurant with a view of the Ferris wheel, it was lovely but we wanted a livelier vibe. We're grateful that the hostess was so accommodating of our request to sit in the main room. Luckily there was a table for 2 right in front of the live jazz band. We caught the last hour of their 3-hour set, and they were amazing. There's really nothing better than eating delicious food while listening to live music. 

Service: From the hostess, to our server and the supporting staff, everyone was attentive and knowledgeable. 

Scoring a reservation here is difficult, but so worth it! Highly recommend coming on a night when there's entertainment.
Excellent service and sumptuous food. Need to reserve 2 months ahead.

We came back within a week for the rive eye that’s perfectly delicious and better than anywhere I’ve had before. It’s 16 oz and big enough to share or take half home . I loved their Caesar salad as well as gnocchi and the lemon merengue pie was recommended as the top dessert choice so I enjoyed that as well as a hot cider whisky drink called caldo-caldo. We remembered our server from last week in a different section even though we weren’t seated to see the sunset over the bay this time we wanted to hear the band in the back lounge and we got great seats again! Thank you so much for getting us in with our ferry boat schedule challenges on a busy thanksgiving weekend!
Great food.  Recommend to reserve a table in the room and on the days where they do acrobatics.

Went with my boyfriend for lunch. Neither of us were especially into Italian food. I think we just never specifically sought out good Italian food before. Every item was delicious. We were very pleasantly surprised. There's a reason why this is a Seattle classic. If you're looking for fanciness this might not be the best choice. It's not the high-class feeling place like Canlis, but the restaurant is nicely decorated. We got the waterfront view and looked directly at people bustling about at Pike Place. For me, food is more important than fanciness, so this place is now one of my favourites.
Always amazing here. Classic Seattle staple. I don’t come to Seattle and not come here.
Great food and atmosphere. Good was perfectly portioned to leave comfortably full

Absolutely wonderful experience! Found this place several years ago while on visit to Seattle.  When coming out to visit our son and daughter-in-law, we knew we had to bring them here. Did not disappoint! Wonderful!!
A Seattle institution with great food

For vegetarians the eggplant pasta was delicious and they Aldo make Perfect ribeye with parsnip yummy mash& veggies. The half portion antipasto plate was big for two of us! Will definitely come again as the view is amazing too! So lively to see the furry parade on the street below and the amazing pink sunset over the vast bay VIEW!
Amazing food!  Great wine!  Excellent service!  The chicken breast was phenomenal.
Great Service! Ordered an on menu drink with a personal twist and they loved it so much it's being considered for a future seasonal drink. Food is superb.

First time here .
Came on recommendation.
Absolutely fantastic food , atmosphere and service 
It feels like you are transported back in time to an old European circus themed restaurant.
It’s a MUST DO while in Seattle 
Make reservation ASAP
Food was okay, it was nothing to write home about. Prices were expensive for the value of the food. Place was a little too chaotic probably because everyone in town was in the restaurant.
Food and service was amazing as usual! Server was knowledgeable about menu items and gave great suggestions. We will return!

We shared the arancini to start. They pack a spicy punch! The rigatoni and lasagna are al dente perfection with bright acid red sauces. The desserts are deceptively light tasting but I’m sure calorie laden. Try the apple cake or the luxurious busing. A great lively vibe.

Oysters were great and the ice/pepper shaving topping was top notch.

Local beer was very enjoyable.

Overall good but clam prep during our visit was done wrong which hurt food quality.

Went for my partners birthday and they gave us a table by the window with a beautiful view. The service was incredible, my water was never empty for more than a few minutes, and the server was very attentive. They even ensured that I was able to get meals that satisfied my rare dietary restrictions. Would highly recommend and I plan to go back!
The waitstaff are tremendous, attentive, engaging, knowledgeable. Love the painting of the owner’s former dog with the halo.

Delicious, ambient, fabulous! Just note that the entrance is unmarked and a light pink door in an alley that is easy to miss if you’re not sure what you’re looking for. Almost felt like a speakeasy entrance. But back to the point—yummmm, go!
Everything was perfect!
always the best of the best!!!  we love the Pink Door
Beautiful, stylish and delicious in every way.  One of my favorite spots in Seattle.

Loved the nice front dining room.
Great service and food. Clams and bread were our favorite.
What a lovely evening! Great food, great service and such a lovely restaurant. Cannot wait to go back!
Tried Pink Door for the first time and the Lasagna is a must order. Highly recommend and will come back just for that.
This restaurant was the highlight of our visit to Seattle!
we got there 30mn earlier to our reservation. Luckily we can sit at the bar getting a few drinks while waiting for our table to get ready. Love the vibe and the jazz! Totally gonna visit there again.

A wonderful dining experience right on the water. Plenty of great seating and the ambiance is casual and fun. Food is high quality and the price is understandable, if equally high. Would definitely return. Music is also great!

Incredible.  They not only never disappoint, they ALWAYS deliver an exceptional experience.  Very happy to see them back to full capacity.  Every dish was so good...and the live music was perfect.  Great mood, yet definitely in the background as it should be.  They nailed it!
Food, ambiance, view, service were perfect.
Dining before Paramount Performance. Waitress attentive but not too much so, relaxed and tasty meal. A bit noisy but not that much of an issue
Superb food, great service and wonderful views! Our new favorite restaurant.

The ambiance was very nice. Would recommend for a date night. Noise level is as moderate conversational. My friend ordered the chicken Caesar salad. It was extremely tangy and not as creamy as other Caesars I’ve had. The lasagna was amazing. Highly recommend it. Will return for the lasagna.
Excellent! Highly recommend

Food was great, good atmosphere, don’t order wine - the wine comes in cheap glasses.

The waitor was rude and made me feel uncomfortable- not worth the restaurant if the staff makes you feel uncomfortable. I would rather eat elsewhere just because of this.

We loved our dinner and experience! The trapeze artist was talented and entertaining. The ahi tuna was amazing! The beats appetizer was ok if anything wasn’t to our liking. Overall highly recommend to anybody and everybody!!
I think it is a joyful atmosphere with pleasant tasting food.

Consider yourself lucky if you get to eat here. I only knew if this place from a rec from a friend and I had no expectations. From the minute we opened the door, I was so entranced by the ambience and old World feel of the place. We ordered the salumi appetizer and the goat cheese/tomato spread was so delicious. We ordered the lasagna from the waiter’s recommendation and went with the whole fish (Brandini). The fish was beautifully presented but the pasta was so delicious that if we had to do it again, we would have ordered 2 other pasta dishes instead of the fish. 

We had a window table, by luck, and it was neat to hear other languages at adjacent tables such as Korean and Russian and Hindi. It made the experience seem even more special. Such a treasure. Waiter was also attentive in refilling the bread bowl for my eight year old and accommodating a side of salami for her picky palate. Loved the whole experience. Best part of our quick Seattle weekend getaway.
Every time it’s always so good.  Glad to be back
Great good and services

Our friends that were visiting wanted to try this restaurant because I always raved about it. They weren’t able to go to dinner anytime before 8pm so I checked for reservations and the only one was for 10pm. That is pretty late for dinner, but in my opinion would’ve been worth it because it was the Pink Door after all. 

My friends arrived a few minutes before the reservation and my boyfriend and I arrived at 1002pm (we were driving in from 30 miles North). When we saw our friends at the table the first thing they said “our waitress is rude she told us last call for food is 10pm and was asking how late you were going to be”… hearing this I was a bit confused as to why they would allow a 10pm reservation and close the kitchen at 10pm. 

Either way my boyfriend and I knew what we were going to order within the first couple of minutes after being seated. We kept seeing our waitress stop by every single table around us but never came to ask us what we wanted to order. She didn’t take our food order until about 10 minutes after we sat, no urgency on her part after her remarks to our friends. 

When she would come to our table there was an air around her (very negative). When she grabbed a plate off our table she just pushed her way between myself and the window without even saying “Excuse Me” or anything (I didn’t even know she was there). I wanted more iced tea for my refill and she said “I don’t think we have anymore, I have to check”.. I understand it was the ending of the night but if I knew there was going to be a shortage I would’ve gladly ordered something else. 

I thought that was the rudest service I’ve ever had at Pink Door. I don’t live close to there and try celebrate many special occasions with my friends there. I probably will not be back. I was very disappointed and embarrassed that I recommended a place with such rude, lacking service.

I mean... so good. I had the bolognese and my vegetarian wife had the lasagna(her go to) my buddie had the ribeye mp=$55 and his wife had the linguine vongole.  We shared a couple bottles of red! Food is top notch, really the best Italian in Seattle. Waitstaff excellant and ambiance perfect. We had live jazz playing and incredible views of the water front! Great night out!
We were sat at what I would consider the best table in the house! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great!!
Delicious food, great service and awesome venue! The decor is beautiful
Dominic was great!! All of the food was excellent (especially the Arancini), the atmosphere was nice, and Dominic was the most helpful and friendly waiter.
Best server we've ever had! Wonderful food and atmosphere!

This may have been the best dinner of my life. The potato gnocchi with braised rabbit was phenomenal. We had the blondie brownie and pudding which was tasty. I ended my night with the espresso martini and it was delightful. The booth we sat in had a beautiful scenic view. The service at Pink Door was amazing, we had the kindest waitress whom was knowledgeable about the food and wine list and gave great recommendations. If you are in Seattle this is a MUST. Book early so you get a chance to taste all the yummy foods!
It was wonderful from the check for a vaccine to the service and outstanding food!

Cannot say enough good things- everything was delicious, and the ambiance was prime. We splurged and went big:
-Fresh oysters
-Caesar salad with crab
-Bread with olive oil 
-Bolognese  
-Cioppino

Everything was amazing, and I can honestly say best bolognese I’ve ever had; the pasta is light but packed with flavor.

Terrific restaurant.  The food was excellent, the service very professional and friendly.  Terrific atmosphere and vibe. AND entertainment! Cannot wait to go back (if I ever have the time to search and search for a reservation)
I went for my birthday. It was the first time going, and it was lovely. The atmosphere was great, the food was AMAZING, and our waiter was lovely. I think its my family's new favorite place!
delicious!  wonderful energy.  the seasonal drinks and desserts were decadent.
The meal was quite enjoyable.

This has always been one of the best dining experiences in Seattle. I have been several times, sat in different places inside and out, and it never fails. Always great food, great service, and great ambience. This is one of the places I was most looking forward to returning to once I felt comfortable dining inside again and it did not disappoint! I am appreciating more than ever these Seattle classics now that they have survived the difficult times over the last two years and so grateful this institution is thriving as ever!
Always a wonderful place to eat. Enjoyed our dinner and dessert last night.
Food is always excellent and service was great
Excellent food and service. Nice view of Puget Sound. Reservations are a must, and the restaurant is tricky to find. A memorable dining experience.
A little busy for lunch creating longer wait times for drinks and apps. Food and service was excellent.
Food was excellent and service was great. And the view was quite nice in the back
Amazing food and exceptional customer service!

One of my all time favorite Italian restaurants. Their service is fantastic, our server was attentive and friendly. Our food was delicious with all the fresh made ingredients. The fall cocktails had complex flavors, the desserts were decadent and the cappuccino had beautiful foam and the espresso was smooth. If you are looking for a beautiful place to have dinner, this is it.
The staff was simply amazing!  The food was so good!
Atmosphere, food and service was exceptional!

What an amazing place!  We went for a belated anniversary dinner and we’re seated at a table overlooking the sound!  A French euro meets Seattle burlesque scene greets you when you enter and it’s a wonderful journey throughout the meal.  So happy we went!
the food and atmosphere were great but most of all our server was OUTSTANDING.  We are from Philadelphia and have never been in Seattle-- truly enjoying the experience.

Very nice atmosphere, not presumptuous nor too casual .  We were in for lunch and everything was delicious.  We split some apps and entrees and everything was flavorful and delicious.  Especially enjoyed the Oregon oysters, Dungeness crab Caesar salad and spinach lasagna.

Food was very good, but our server didn’t really care or she didn’t know we were celebrating birthday even though the host knew.  I hoped she brought the dessert with a little candle or something.  Well, we had a good lunch though.

We had family guests in town and our immediate reaction was to take them to the Pink Door for lunch.  We’ve trusted the food for years and you can’t beat the double punch of Pikes Place Market and the view of Elliot Bay.  As we expected lunch was fantastic and we look forward to our next “excuse” to visit.  Bravo to the chef and staff at the Pink Door.
Birthday lunch for a colleague.  This place never disappoints. Lovely views, food and waitstaff
The Pink Door is the best. Eat here now, not later.

This was an amazing experience especially on Halloween! All the staff was dressed up and were so welcoming and excited for any customers dressed up or not. 

The service was fantastic, our waiter was knowledgeable and when he didn’t have an answer immediately found someone to field our inquiry.
I love having my Halloween Birthday lunch at The Pink Door every year so we can dress in costumes and enjoy the wait staff’s outfits as well 😊♥️🎃🍁🎉

Been a Seattle visitor the Pink Door is a must.  Learned my lesson and made reservation weeks before and was looking forward to it.  
Brought my whole family this time and everyone loved it.
AMAZING! Worth the wait.
Celebrating our 21 year anniversary, thank you!
Amazing food, incredible venue and the entertainment was top notch. We will be back!

We had a lovely lunch experience at The Pink Door. Our entrees were so good, we all sprung for dessert - which was also delicious! Attentive service and a nice view out over the Sound. The Pink Door is a Seattle favorite for good reason.
I can't say that food was great, but I loved the atmosphere.
Beautiful hidden gem. If you like good food and good ambiance this is the place to go
Fantastic experience for my food and cocktail forward trip to Seattle!  Awesome service.
The Pink Door is a tradition in our family. We go there as often as we can.
We had lunch here and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! The food was wonderful and so tasty. The ambiance and view was perfect. The dessert was the best!
Incredible atmosphere, the live music was such an amazing & personal experience, the food was a great value, friendly & knowledgeable server. Loved our experience at the pink door!!
Lovely sparkly fall decor. Skillful servers. Outstanding food and a great wine list. Rabbit gnocchi was fabulous!
I really have no complaints.  I love it at The Pink Door EVERY time.  It's all beautiful, comfortable, delicious, and addicting !
Food was excellent and very filling. The waitress was very informative.
Great lunch. Loved the penne al fumo and burrata and beet salad.
Our server Elise was great. The Italian wines were great. The acrobatic scarf show was amazing. I would go back

It was our first time and i have wanted to go for years !! I am now vegan so i was a bit concerned i wouldn’t enjoy but it was amazing still and the waiter was so wonderful ! trying to go back today! GET THE BREAD!!!
Best table in the place!  Lasagna disappointing. Prices good. Seafood good. Ambiance outstanding.
5 Stars on all levels! Even if they didn’t recognize our anniversary after asking occasion. Truly a Dining must In Seattle

We enjoyed our Anniversary/Birthday celebration brunch at the Pink Door. The food was outstanding and the drinks even more so. I had the Caldo Caldo drink which tasted like a hot boozy apple pie. It was a warm hug to my core. The toasted garlic bread, to die for! Also, order the Brussels sprouts. You won’t be disappointed. Not only is the food and drink amazing, but the decor, ambiance, and scenery outside is like a fairy tale. Can’t wait to visit again!
Ambience was great and our server, Kristy, a CA transplant was awesome!
Amazing food and exceptional quality.  Highly recommended.
The drinks, food, and service were great.
Wonderful late lunch. This is one of our favorites in our neighborhood.
Amazing as always!  The Pink Door is a gem and always on our “to-do” list when we are in Seattle.  Excellent seafood, wine selection and service.
Lovely setting.  Cant wait to come back when live entertainment is in place.
You need to book atleast a month before. However, wait was worth it.
Loved everything about it
Great experience. Wonderful staff. Best meal we had while visiting Seattle.
Overpriced good food. Nothing great definitely not worth the price nor the difficulty to get a reservation

We were in Seattle to celebrate my daughter’s wedding and based on reviews decided to try The Pink Door.    We are so glad we did.   Our entire party enjoyed their food tremendously.   The entire experience was one we will remember.
I had an amazing time eating here! I got a braised rabbit gnocchi and it was delicious! The staff was super nice this was the first restaurant I ate at for my solo trip and would definitely come back
The hostess was rude and arrogant. The food was nice.
Fabulous food. Super service
Loved the environment and food!! Such a great spot in seattle

El servicio fue genial, algo que no me gusto es que hay algunos platillos principales las porciones son muy pequeñas, me quede con hambre pero el sabor es muy rico. Nos ofrecieron pan (como el que nos dieron al llegar) para acompañar nuestro risotto pensamos que era parte del servicio pero no, nos lo cobraron en 8 dólares. Disfrute mucho el ambiente es muy romántico. En general estuvo bien. 

The service was great, something I didn’t like is that there are some main dishes the portions are very small, I was hungry after 2 dishes but the flavor is very good.  They offered us bread (like the one they gave us when we arrived) to accompany our risotto, we thought it was part of the service but no, they charged us at 8 dollars.  Enjoy a lot the atmosphere is very romantic.  Overall it was okay.

The quality of our dining experience at The Pink Door over many years has remained the same: excellent food served in a cozy, comfortable atmosphere by courteous, efficient wait staff.   Thank you, TPD, for a great evening!
A fantastic hideaway in the middle of the best part of Seattle. Food is delicious and properly priced.

This was my first visit to Pink Door. The food absolutely exceeded my expectations. Tried their garlic bread and loved it. They have the best Lasagna in the town. The catch of the day Halibut was appetizing.  Loved their appealing Vanilla gelato and hazelnut cake.
Wonderful restaurant/great service
Service was great and food was good.  I’m from Boston and in the North End back home there’s some the best Italian and seafood I ’ve had.

The food, wine, and cocktails were divine. The atmosphere and vibe was very chic. All views (window or otherwise) were amazing both day and night. The staff were an added bonus with delightful personalities and impeccable service.

Always appreciative and grateful for this place. The meal was delicious, the service exceptional, and ambiance delightful. This is a well-loved, iconic restaurant who continually and consistently delivers. A true and beloved staple in the Seattle restaurant scene. Love!!!!
Food was brought to us cold. Not as good as it used to be and much more expensive
Nicely situated with a great view. Good food and drinks.

Cute restaurant in an alley just above the marketplace.  Beautiful ambiance.  Wonderful service.  We really liked our waitress.  The owner and a manager touched the table.  Everyone was great.  I'm glad we tried the garlic bread. I had the steak, but in hindsight should have ordered a fish entree as it's more a seafood restaurant and not a steak house.
Service was as amazing as the food! Highly recommend the butterscotch pudding with toffee!

Seriously some of the best food in Seattle. Very attentive staff, food came out quick, hot, and tasty. Free live music with show and an incredible view of Seattle. Makes a great night for special occasions

Will be coming back!

The space was very charming, the server was knowledgeable and transparent and the food was spectacular! We were lucky enough to get a table by the window and had a solid view of pike place market and Elliott bay at sunset. A truly fantastic experience!
I didn't realize when I made a reservation for the bar that it would actually be a table, just in the bar area. It was great! Food was excellent!
We always love the pink door! Our table was by the window and wonderful!

Great Food!
Great Service!
Great Caesar salad split with friend.  Pasta was enjoyed by all and half carafe of house white wine was a good value.
Yum yum yum.   Maybe a soft scrim over the windows would be nice. If you are seated facing toward the windows your dining companions are in silhouette.   Counteract so much brightness at one source.

Don’t be discouraged by the location in a touristy area, The Pink Door had great food tucked behind a non-descript door and downstairs in a beautiful cozy space overlooking the water with low key live entertainment when we went at 9:45pm but apparently also has trapeze, burlesque, and other artists at other times.

Cioppino was excellent. The garlic bread is a must have, as is the butterscotch budino. So good!

This restaurant was so fun! The food was delicious and there was a great wine selection. I would recommend for a date night, the tables overlooking the sound was a beautiful setting. The music performer added the perfect back ground.
Absolutely stunning view and delicious food! The service was outstanding.
The service, good and atmosphere was great as always! Keep up the good work!
Amazing food.  Some of the best mussels we’ve ever had.

Visiting from Hawaii and wanted to finally have some good Italian Cuisine. I came alone, sat at the bar, and absolutely loved everything I ordered. The bar tender who took care of me was lovely and knowledgeable.
Highlight of the meal was the Arancini, Linguine, and Grilled Bread. Caesar salad was another hit and if I had a bigger stomach or others to share my meal with, I would’ve definitely ordered more.
Arancini was the best I’ve ever had, super crispy and the sauce was perfect amount of heat to compliment the lush tomatoe. Linguine was like 80% clams 20% noodles which isn’t a bad thing AT ALL. I was so excited because I was already getting full by the time it came out.
Another unique/cute highlight was the wine bucket that my bottle of Verdicchio came in. 
I would definitely come back but with some friends to share with.

As out of town visitor, we wanted a great meal and a view. The Pink Door absolutely delivered. The food, the ambiance, the servers are all impeccable. Highly recommend this restaurant to all who want to experience the best Seattle has to offer.
Fantastic food and the restaurant piped the live music throughout the whole restaurant! Would highly recommend.
Great service, delicious food, vigilante about filling water cups, but overall such a great place to go for a special occasion
Loved dinner at the Pink Door.  Reserve early to get a table at 7pm or after for the entertainment.  The food was amazing.  I had the pasta (gluten free) with Bolognaise sauce.  Yum!!
The food was very good and the service was of a high standard.
We celebrated our 1-year anniversary here and everything was perfect! Romantic setting, delicious food, and the service was top notch. The Pink Door gave us such a memorable experience!

Came to enjoy dinner with some friends for our last night in Seattle and couldn't have asked for a better way to end our trip! Great food, service and ambiance - they even had an aerial hoop performer which was amazing! Would highly recommend!
Probably one of the most proficient waitstaffs I’ve ever experienced. It was incredible watching them work together like a finely tuned machine. Well done!
Great service and food
Excellent time at the Pink Door! Everything was top notch and memorable. I’d recommend the experience to anyone especially if they have a special occasion.
Outstanding food, outstanding view, nice atmosphere, and our Server ((Kristy) made the evening all the more enjoyable!
Delightful atmosphere.  Friendly professional staff.  Excellent food!  Can't wait for my next visit!
Window table on a moody Pacific Northwest day. Great service, delicious food. Was happy to have an out of town guest to bring through. A fun way to experience Seattle & the Market.

The ambience cant be beat. Its a beautiful space.  Lovely room. We really enjoyed our meal.  And service is very good.  The food is good but I wasnt super impressed.  Its good but not outstanding.  All in all a very enjoyable spot.
Amazing, beautiful location and delicious food.
Amazing food/drinks, gorgeous space, Wonderful service.
We celebrated our anniversary! Best views of the Seattle wheel!

My daughter & I had a lovely meal at The Pink Door.  I got the squid linguine with seafood in a spicy marinara sauce.  Delicious! We had gelato & apple cake.  Both were very good. I would recommend this restaurant for a fun night out!

This is my favorite spot in Seattle! Beautiful ambience and view with high quality food. I especially loved the house-made Burrata & Bolognese! The wine list could use some attention, a few more natural wines on the list would go a long way, especially a Col Fondo! 

Our server was pleasant and attentive, though she needs to learn proper wine service. Our Barolo was done a bit of a disservice by her unfortunately. I'd recommend getting the sommelier or general manager to do wine service for you. 

Overall, a wonderful dining experience! I will definitely be back again and again.

Wonderful food. Especially enjoyed the squid ink pasta and the arancini. The waitress was lovely.
Also love that they require proof of vaccine.

It's been many years since I've eaten at The Pink Door. The space is beautiful and interesting and the room that my group was seated in had a beautiful view of the water. Very lovely and the food was delicious!
Great food and great service. Views were absolutely stunning!
The bruschetta and Cesar salad were terrific, the vongole and clams with mussels merely very good.  Service was outstanding and we will definitely go there again.
Fantastic food, service, and atmosphere!
The service was quick and polite. The food was great. Had a great time.

Such an incredible experience. We were lucky to go on Sunday and therefore got more than a delicious dinner with  wonderful service by Carter R… we got to see a one-of-a-kind aerial acrobatics show. Love how unique and special this made our evening and we will definitely be back!
Delicious food, beautiful place, great service and a nice view. Will definitely come back!
Obsessed! My water was always full and the food was unreal. The basil cake  was wild, but I’m glad I tried it!
Delicious food- great service from hostess and waitress.
The Pink Door is amazing. My favorite place in Seattle. Get the food: it's delicious.
Good but not special
Amable el servicio, cálido. La comida muy rica, los tiempos bien cuidados y el pan, extraordinario (una elasticidad del pan blanco, perfecta!) Muy razonables los precios para la calidad de la comida.
I love the pink door.  We went for my birthday.  The view of Elliott Bay from our table was incredible!  And the food matched ththe view!  Service awesome as well

We love the Pink Door it is a wonderful legendary Seattle dining institution. Sarah was our service and like all of the staff from the owner Jackie to Chris the manager to all of the support staff they all have a wonderful attitude, disposition and attention to detail. What a pleasure it is to support such a wonderful restaurant.

We visited the Pink Door after getting engaged on the Waterfront earlier in the day.  The staff was amazing.  We had beautiful waterfront table adorned with a candle.  We shared an amazing Caprese salad, meatballs, lasagne, ribeye, and mushrooms….the waitstaff, chefs, and management were friendly and attentive.  The food had so many wonderful flavors that we will definitely return on our next trip to Seattle

We were really excited to try this place out. It's a fun environment and you don't expect it to be as large as it is on the inside. Unfortunately the entertainment that we had heard so much about was nonexistent, the caprese salad was so salty that it was inedible, the meatballs were decent, the Bolognese was actually good but it was so loud in there that you could not even have a conversation. 

No need to go back......

Absolutely fabulous experience at the Pink Door. The atmosphere is so cozy, romantic, and eclectically charming. I couldn’t get over how cute it was. The food was phenomenal, and perfect serving size for one. A little pricey, but not terrible for a special treat dinner. Service was wonderful. I’d been trying to get a reservation for weeks, and when I finally went, it did not disappoint!
worth the hype to visit while in seattle - great location in pike place, great food & fun aesthetic.
We are always pleased with our dining experience at The Pink Door and appreciate the consistency of the excellent food, service and ambiance.
Amazing food, good portions for the price, and very friendly service. The space was beautiful. Would highly recommend.
Family visiting- we go every time they are in town
Great service and food.  Would highly recommend their bread and oil appetizer.  Thanks for upholding the vaccine card mandate
Everything about The Pink Door is perfect.  The food, the location, the decor, and the staff are all amazing!
Dinner is always a treat at the Pink Door. I finally got to bring my daughter to this magical place.

We ate there on a beautiful PNW day on the patio.  Unfortunately they sat us at a table where the sun beat down on us.  My husband was sweating to the point it wasn't enjoyable after a while.  Other than that, it was a fabulous meal.
The place as food are amazing

As always, the evening at the Pink Door was just perfect. The service was timed just right.  The menu is one of the most consistent in the city and produces super food. We sat outside and the evening was lovely. Pink Door is old school and trendy...a tough thing to achieve.
Perfect anniversary spot! A secret little entrance adds to all the charm! Top notch service, food & drinks made this a perfect 10 year anniversary spot! Thank you!!
Amazing food!  The tomato bruschetta was the best!  I will dream about the farmers cheese and tomato jam!  Can’t wait to come back!
The food was amazing and so was our server.  We were seated at a table outdoors that got a little hot in the afternoon sun, but didn't affect us too much.
Excellent lunch and service

Worth the hype. Food and service were both exceptional. We started with Tuna Tuna Crudo...so good and flavorful. I had the squid ink pasta, which was amazingly lemony and delightful (REALLY AMAZING) and the lasagna (no photo) but the VERY best lasagna we've ever had. Do not pass the opportunity to go if you can get a table.
Excellent food & our server was terrific!
Visiting friends in Seattle. Everything was amazing.

Wonderful atmosphere, Mamas Meatballs, delicious wine and Seattle soaked in a September sunset. What's not to love? Really like that it is vaccine-only. I felt very safe. Shame the singer had to wear a mask - could barely hear him, but entertaining nonetheless.
Dinner with friends from out of state
Service was excellent, as was the food. Outdoor patio was charming and cosy. Just what we needed after a long day of travel!
This was a lunch, albeit a late, 2.00pm lunch. The service was friendly and efficient, food marvelous and I will give  it a full 5 stars!
Wonderful restaurant! Was very lucky to have gotten a reservation for our vacation.
Had a great experience. Our server was delightful and extremely helpful with ordering selections. The Mikey melons signature cocktail was delicious
Service was outstanding. The food was fabulous. The dining room is beautiful.

The squid ink pasta was absolutely delicious. They rotate out desserts to the season so I had the nectarine in rose with lavender honey whipped cream. Overall the restaurant has great ambiance and views. Food was well prepared and the staff was very accommodating. Highly recommend.

FABULOUS EXPERIENCE! Went with five girlfriends for a birthday luncheon and the food was absolutely fantastic. Our table wasn't ready when we arrived but we were welcomed into the lovely bar seating where we had some wine while we waited for our table to be ready. We ordered Bruchetta to start that was amazing...the most perfectly grilled bread topped with the sweetest, freshest tomato slice, and topped with basil, salt pepper...subtle and not overdone. Between us we had the chicken caesar, the steamed mussels/clams, cioppino, and pasta, and each dish was so delicious. Our server was a bit disinterested or perhaps just having a bad day but he was practically humorless and lacked warmth. But in today's climate, we have to give everyone grace, we don't know what might be going on in their personal lives behind the scenes. Service was good, don't get me wrong, just wished for more engaging server.
Loved it! Amazing food, amazing service! Loved the wine selection, zero facets of disappointment.

Great place, beautiful restaurant, amazing food. We were seated nearby the windows for a spectacular view of the water. We ordered lasagna, rigatoni, and gnocchi. All dishes were delicious. Our waiter was nice but didn’t going out of their way to engage.

We literally stumbled upon the Pink Door during a trip to Seattle. It intrigued us when we saw people going in so we made reservations for that weekend. It has become our tradition every trip back to the Downtown. Always a fun place to take guests, lively fun atmosphere and delicious food.
Incredible! Only regret is not making reservations sooner so I could have gotten in for dinner.

What a wonderful place to celebrate our anniversary!  Started off with some champagne and the Ahi Tuna Crudo that was flavorful.  Our server was delightful and our view just lovely.  We then moved into our lunch entrees of Rigatoni & Mama's Meatball and the Sturgeon fish special which had a yummy pesto concoction on top of it.  We finished off the meal with the Peanut Butter Brownie Sundae and left completely satiated.  I will totally recommend this experience to others.  Thank you to the Pink Door for making our return to dining memorable.
Great view, great food and great service!
Birthday for a friend

We don't remember much because we were really drunk from visiting the Doctor's Office before, but we do remember the food being extremely good, and that should speak mounds about the quality of their food, because if you can recal something being satisfying even when you're completely inebriated, then that is all the evidence you need!

Also the live music is always an added bonus and really helped to enhance the experience!
The best ambience, service, and great food!! Loved it

Went with my gf for our anniversary on a vacation  to Seattle. Everything was amazing. Our server was super helpful and attentive. Thanks for the recommendation of the basil cake (aka pesto cake lol) The view was amazing, watching the sunset over the sound. The food was so good. I would go back in a heartbeat.
Pasta us basic for the price but it's not to bad. More the experience and views.
Delicous lasagne and bread. Outside dinning a real plus.

The food was terrific ! Our server was beyond expectations!
Pink Door is the best restaurant in town !
Fantastic.  Best meal ever.
Went there to celebrate the twins birthday!   It was a great night, amazing service and food as always.
Great experience overall. Delicious food and an awesome ambiance. We sat in the lounge which I think I prefer as we could see the band! Definitely my new favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle

We live in Las Vegas. This place is worth the flight, hotel and rental car alone. This is truly a top destination restaurant that everyone should eat at in Seattle. Make sure you get your reservations a month in advance. Lovely night out with some of our very best friends who flew in from Vermont.
We had a great time celebrating a birthday on the patio!

We love The Pink Door. Food is delicious, great service. One of our go to places when we visit Seattle.

We always love to eat there when you have the bruschetta with those heirloom tomatoes, so delicious.

We were so glad you had to have proof that you had Covid vaccine. Good for you!
Amazing service. Great wine and appetizers. Shared an entire. Great view. Not from Seattle but felt like a great spot in the heart of downtown. Would come again on another trip.
Mediocre pasta. Great service. Good ambience. Had nice weekend lunch with friends/ out door dining on a beautiful day.
Great seating, friendly staff and great food.

This old Seattle favorite in the Pike Place Market expanded it's size 4+ years ago and this was my first visit since that time. The new space is elegantly done and continues the Pink Doors quirky, artsy, comfortable take on Italian style. A wall of windows along the far end gives views out across the market to nearby Puget Sound. Try the Squid Ink pasta, so well done.

Our first time at The Pink Door, for a special occasion..we live a ferry ride and almost 2 hours drive away, so Im going to say this WAS WORTH IT! Food, absolutely fantastic. Service, the best we have experienced in ages.  Beautiful restaurant.  We didn't get to be outside, due to rain, but we absolutely will return!
Service and food were excellent I would highly recommend this restaurant.
My date 4 the evening gush gush

The bill for 6 of us was $164 and they added $54 for tips and taxes which seemed like it was a lot. I certainly don't mind paying 20%tip but no one could explain what percentage the taxes were supposed to be. Food good except bolognese...not much meat.
The spinach lasagna was heavenly - the best I’ve ever eaten. The grilled broccoli was great as was the poached nectarine. Great place!  I shall return!
Our server, ( Isla ?) Provided the wonderful service ☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️
It was just meh
Our food was excellent and there was plenty of it. The wait staff and everyone we came in contact with were quite lovely. Overall it was a great experience. Thank you.
Dining at the Pink Door is always a pleasure because of the superb food and service.  One of of our all-time favorites!

Two friends and I lunched at the Pink Door on a weekday.  We sat on the large, covered deck with a good-sized table -- roomy even if we'd had four.  Food was outstanding -- especially the mussels.  The wait staff was helpful and attentive without being obtrusive.  This is not an inexpensive restaurant, but it's definitely a good value.
Incredible food. Great vibes. Vaccination proof is great for us. Loved it.

Our anniversary, daughter strongly recommended this restaurant. We tried to make reservations but online always showed 2-3 weird available slots. We didn’t make reservations. But our anniversary day showed 5:30 pm available but only outside Seay. We found there were plenty of seats inside and outside. We chose inside seating. The food was okay…. Garlic lams as appetizer, mine was Ciopinni, anothe main dish was Pappadelle Al rago Bolognese. No unique taste on either one. Kinda disappointed.

The Pink Door NEVER disappoints. Lunch with a client for the first time in 2 years yesterday and it was perfect. Thank you to our lovely server in the bright window dining room. My Linguine Vongole was superb.
Phenomenal ambiance. Excellent food and service. Top notch - highly recommend!
We love the Pink Door! It’s always a treat to dine at this Seattle gem.
Great food even better service - covid safe a perfect restaurant experience!

The absolute sweetest staff !!! Really made
My anniversary wonderful.
The food was amazing! A bit pricey but worth it! The arancini is a must-get appetizer!
Excellent, friendly service.  The mocktail, salad, and dessert were really good.
Best meal and more importantly best service we’ve had in a very long time.  Reminded us how much we missed Pink Door.

went for my boyfriend’s birthday and was not disappointed! the back dining area is wonderful and better for noise control so you can talk over your meal. overall a wonderful atmosphere with even better food!
Our first visit to Seattle and
Food was AMAZING. Great location and ambiance inside and out was so beautiful. Love it. I will definitely be coming back soon!!
Delicious!!!
Excellent food and service. The appetizers were the best.

It is my absolute favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle! It never disappoints. We introduced friends to the Pink Door this last time we were there and they wholeheartedly agreed! Just remember to make reservations early!

We came to celebrate a birthday. Walking into the restaurant felt as if we were walking into an experience - and we did. The food was AMAZING. The ambiance was generally soothing. At times, the service felt a bit hurried, likely because we came into a  late lunch service (which was the only reservation available), and they were preparing to transition to dinner. Otherwise, this was a superb dining event.

Stopped in for a quick lunch stop. Sat at the bar. Joe was our server. His old fashioned was amazing. Conversation was great. Recommend 10/10. The truffle fries were fire. Finished with the baby mussel dish was out-of-this world.
The pink door never disappoints!!!
Celebrate for birthday
Loved the food and the service! The drinks were great - but there was a bit of a wait.
Outdoor furniture needs an upgrade. It’s uncomfortable seating

Went here to celebrate our elopement! Absolutely incredible! Can’t recommend this place enough. It’s a must visit if you’re here. Just book it with 3+ weeks before getting there. They book up real quick! Service was incredible!
It was our anniversary and they saved a seat by the window for us and wished us a Happy Anniversary as we came in. We were very happy also with them checking our vaccination cards to get in!
This was the best lunches I’ve ever experience, we were celebrating 19yrs of marriage and this was the best way. You have to get the lasagna!!!
Great food, drinks and service. Will definitely return.
Great experience! From the location to the food and the service - all of it was top notch.
Almost perfect!  Loved it and will recommend and return when in Seattle.
Another wonderful experience on the deck at Pink Door. If you haven’t tried it, do so and soon

Loved, loved, loved this place. The decorations were unique and fun. The entertainment was top notch and our waitress Breezy was the best. We were celebrating a birthday and they brought dessert with candles.  Definitely will visit again on my next trip to Seattle.
Loved Pink Door. Food and wine were amazing along with the show and environment. Will return!
Very pleasant experience. Great food and service. Zach was really nice and super knowledgeable about both the food and the wine options.
Friend visiting from out of town
Open table reservation was specifically for an outdoor table, but the hostess thought we wanted an indoor table. Food is great as usual.
Convivial and unpretentious! Care and intention in aesthetic and service. The food tastes like it is made with love.
Fresh food. Great ambience with overlook of Elliot Bay. Exceptional service.
Delicious food, great service, a beautiful day. Appreciated their policy requiring full vaccination
The food, ambiance, service, entertainment and value were all 10/10. Love this place!
The best patio for summer. Such yummy food. Great wine list. We had a stellar night.

We had a wonderful meal. The service was amazing. There was a health problem at an adjacent table - staff handled the situation well and then covered dessert for those nearby.  We go here each time we visit - we will continue to do so.

Courteous and attentive staff. It was our first time there so our waitress gave us great recommendations. We had bruschetta which was fresh and delicious, clams and mussels were excellent. My husband had the chef’s special salmon and beets and I had their lasagna. And for dessert nectarine with lavender rose honey and whipped cream. We shared everything so we could try it all and where not disappointed.

It's a weird time trying to eat out and live life during a pandemic so I was so amazing being able to relax in a safe environment. I love that they require proof of vaccine!!! 

The food will transport you to a beachfront villa in Italy, and the service is perfect.

20/10 would recommend!
Our favorite date restaurant. We loved the extra assurance given by the new vaccination card check at the door. The food as-always was amazing. Will always be back for more.
Excellent view and interior design .. unique quaint and elegant!
Amazing - favorite is the lasagna!
Service was amazing. Food was just as good. Will definitely return.
Service was excellent.  The food was delicious and met expectations based on reviews.
It's a MUST try when in Seattle! Food was delicious, staff was courteous and attentive and the atmosphere was perfect. Hard to get a reservation but now we know why.
We heard this was one of the best restaurants in Seattle and it did not disappoint! Would recommend to anyone visiting the city.
Delicious lunch And Nora was a great server
Beautiful restaurant with good service, fresh food, and a nice wine list.
Such a fun place, great energy, terrific ambience, lots of smiling faces, great for special occasions or just home style dinner with the fam. Will definitely be back

The visit to the Pink Door was everything I'd hoped for.  The food was fabulous, the service excellent and the ambience was memorable.  We'll have to go again before too long. I didn't realize how much I missed the place.

The food, service and setting were superb! We loved every course and our server was friendly, helpful, enthusiastic and efficient. The only thing missing for a perfect experience was the sun, beyond the control of us or the restaurant😉
An absolute can’t miss! Everything was prepared and served perfectly and tasted even better. The flavors and quality is unlike any place I’ve ever been and I’m and old school east coast Italian snob.
I have never had a bad meal or experience at The Pink Door. Everything is always outstanding!!! It is my favorite restaurant!
Great food & location!

I had a great time at this restaurant. It was my 2nd time here. The lasagna was really good but a little too oily. I brought my friend who is new to town. He absolutely loved the food and really wanted to speak to the chef but I think everybody was busy. I wish there was a happy hour menu. That would be amazing! 

Best,
Auric K.
Patio setting is adorable but the food didn't live up to taste bud’s expectations.  Don't get me wrong, the food was fine but was looking for more than just fine.

Excellent food and service.

Will definitely be back.

Regards Ian.
Absolutely amazing! Jackie and her team are super hosts and the food is divine! Will return every chance I get.
Unbelievable food and service! Neither my husband or myself drinks and the mocktail we had was a nice surprise on the menu. New favorite restaurant, hands down!

Honestly I was surprised at how plain the food was. I had the linguine with clams and it tasted like salty pasta, no flavor at all. Service was great! The waiter was very nice and attentive to our every needs.
The bread portion is now right before entree .. would have preferred it was served with drinks right away..

The second time came to here, I want to say this time is perfect. I can try the ink pasta with seafood, it only had summer. Finally, the server is better that last one, she was very helpful. The last server when I had dinner in April , she was too bad too too bad.

Once again everything at the Pink Door was amazing. The Fig and goat cheese was to die for as was the lasagna. Hit the spot! One of our favorite places in Seattle on the patio in the summer. Spacing of tables outside was good so it felt safe outside.
Amazing service and the food was delicious, as always!
Had a delicious dinner and the best service! Can’t wait to go back!

It was ok dining there.  It was my daughter’s birthday so I wanted to make it special for her.

Seating:
I requested not near the bar/entrance area but by the window.  We were seated exactly I wanted but the problem was that the window was very dirty.  There were some large seagulls’s droppings on our window and not pleasant to look at when dining. Then, my side of the table cloth/paper and my napkin had fresh spaghetti stains on it thinking they did not fully cleaned/replaced my side of the table. I did not want to make a fuss so I just fold the stained area and did not say anything.

Service: Our server did not check in with us like she did with other table.  We would have ordered more drinks if she did.  Also, she did not bring new sets of silverware even foods came in. So, we had to wait for her to come around but never did so we had to ask the server who is assigned to the next table. I felt bad but what can we do, wait until the foods get cold?Also, we were not served the bread with entrees so I had to ask for that. She probably thought we do not need it because we ordered garlic bread but that is not right.  The appetizer dishes were still in the table until we finished our entree. I can praise the person who refilled water quite often.

Food: Lasagna is good as always.  The clam and mussels were overly cooked with butter and did not taste clams/mussels
Garlic bread was half burned and not even taste garlic. Could not have chance to ask for new one cause the server doesn’t come around. Squid ink spaghetti was already cold and the shrimp were tasteless. Only ate few bites and was expecting the server to question me but she failed.  Other dish like fries, egg plants, spaghetti were mediocre.
I was kind of expecting some special desert for my daughter but none of the came. I was surprised the server asked if we want to see desert menus. She probably forgot it was the special dinner, oh well. We did not order any desert so cannot rate.

My husband and I were visiting Seattle on a stop over from our cruise. The Pink Door was recommended and it did not disappoint.  Luckily I was able to snag a reservation.  Tip if you see one don’t hesitate as it will be gone. Walk ins are accepted but there did seem to be a line and a wait.  The food was fabulous and very flavorful and the service was great. Was the perfect last meal before we headed home.  We will for sure return on our next trip.
We always enjoy the Pink Door for nearly 40 years. Thanks for always being amazing.
Just love this place.  Beautiful, great food, nice atmosphere!!
Excellent place and cool vibe. Great food and great value of wines
Beautiful view and great service, the food is fresh and delicious

Nice ambiance, the decor is cute 
Serving sizes seem small but it was very filling (if you're starving don't come here)
Pasta is as good as everyone says, very delicious 
Server wasn't that nice/patient but there were bigger parties who were drinking so I think they had his attention

We had a lovely leisurely lunch, and were not rushed in the slightest - What a salve to our Covid-weary souls! 
We especially appreciated the proof of vaccination requirement, which helped with the relaxation factor…We’ll be back!
We had a lunch reservation and were seating at a window right by the water overlooking park of the market. The service was great, the food was great, the wine was great!
Fantastic food and service

All I can say is WOW! The food was top notch and live music was incredible. Ben Hunter was performing the night we were there and he really made the night perfect. Would definitely come
back!
We had an amazing meal and the service was impeccable.
Nice outdoor patio
The service was outstanding.  We enjoyed an outdoor meal on a cute patio.  Was one of the best meals we enjoyed while visiting Seattle!

I had a really lovely solo dining experience. The restaurant was beautiful, the jazz was perfect, the food was exceptional, and the service was fantastic. Emily was so welcoming and made me feel at home. Her recommendations were perfect for setting a festive vibe and fun mood on my visit to Seattle. The covid protocols were also incredibly well done. I hope to come back again and would recommend to any friends visiting Seattle.
Worth the effort to get a reservation and really, really good. The gnocchi with wild mushrooms was my favorite.

Overall: Food is mediocre. View is pretty, but plenty of other restaurants have a similar view and better food/service. 

Customer service was pretty bad. The waitress wasn’t that helpful with menu suggestions or checking in on us. Bus person weirdly wouldn’t fill out water glasses all the way up, so he had to keep coming back every 8-10 minutes.
