The music that was supposed to start at 7 didn’t start until 8, so it was just a noisy restaurant for the duration of our meal. 

Sunset over the water is nice but multiple tables had to ask the staff to lower the blinds because they were being blinded by the sun. Sunset happens every day - there should be a process where someone comes and pulls down the blinds so patrons don’t have to squint or literally wear sunglasses at their indoor tables. Disappointed that this is a date-night/special occasion place but dress code is very casual (workout shorts and flip flops) for many patrons. 

The clam linguine was bland and uninspired but the seafood was fresh. The rigatoni and meatballs were good, but nothing out of this world. The amaretto semifreddo was the best part of the meal. 

The building is cute and tucked away down a quaint alley. They require (on Aug 18th 2021) proof of vaccination but allow people to congregate at the front door with no social distancing. One of the elderly musicians was coming and going through the crowd at the door, bringing in his instrument and equipment and wasn’t wearing a mask at any time that I saw, inside or out.
Amazing! Love this special place. Great service! The drinks were amazing.
Always my favorite place to eat. Everyone there is amazing especially working under these Covid circumstances.
The setting, food, service is as great as always - it's a classic for a reason. Thank you!
Loved this place!!

The food was great and the view was amazing. The service was a little bit disappointing. It seemed as if my waiter was annoyed or maybe he was just tired, not sure. Location was fun and made it part of the experience.

While we shared when making our reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary, it seemed a bit disappointing that we did not get seated inside the restaurant where all the activities were going on. The service was amazing, and the lasagna is the best dish on the menu.
Dessert was ok, we we’re surprised that given the menu is Italian , we were surprised there was not a tiramisu or coffee based dessert on the menu.

We are on the fence to possibly return. The hype that others shared about having gone here was disappointing in the end for us.
It was great, excellent service ,food and environment!  Will be back for sure!
We love it !
The gnocchi with wild mushrooms was so delicious. The gnocchi was the perfect texture...not mushy and the fresh herbs added great flavor. My husband had the salmon which was also amazing.
Defines the term “outstanding”. Absolutely incredible food and mix of flavors. Cannot wait to be back.
We sat outside on a lovely summer day- the Chioppino was excellent. Seattle classic restaurant that is still great after all these years.
Delicious- great meal and excellent service.

Really loved the booking experience on opentable. The ambience and staff was perfect! Its the most lovely place for a date night - both the seating and setting inside and outdoors.
Enjoyed most of the items we were recommended- the Pinot Noir went perfectly with the Lasagna Pink Door. Unfortunately the garlic bread was not the freshest and was chewier than we like it. The infused oils in it were nice though! From alot of reviews and recommendations which said it was not too sweet, we ordered the basil cake for dessert but it was extremely sweet for our taste even without the butter cream frosting. And i dont think my palate enjoyed the basil flavoured cake. All in all it was a 4/5 night.

We hosted out of town guests to our favorite patio in Seattle and it did not disappoint!  When many restaurants are rushing you out ...limiting time, PD let us take our time and did not ask for our table.  Wonderful evening!
Very popular! Book early. I support their proof of being vaccinated and ID!!

The restaurant was really pretty, I loved the set up where we were outside. I felt like the service was a little bit on the dry side by our waitress. I observed the interaction with other tables and the enthusiasm was definitely noticeable. I believe there is a strong difference between professionalism and being fake. My advice, hide it better.
best restaurant in seattle
Food was amazing!!
Wonderful food, exceptional service and the trio was fantastic!
An experience for me. It was a bit upsetting to wait as long as I did for a waiter to see at my table. But other than that food was amazing. Ambiance as well.

Make reservations 2-4 weeks ahead if you can.  Food, wine and service were outstanding.  Indoor dining room was elegant and cool on a day that was a little too warm for us on the patio.  Proof of covid vaccination were required the day we had lunch (August '21).
Loved this place. We were in visiting from Dallas and we’re told this was a must do for dinner. It did not disappoint! Would highly recommend!

I have eaten here before, and rated it much higher, so to be fair - they were just coming back from a COVID scare and a bunch of rearranging reservations as well as staffing shifts.
Food was excellent, and our server was a very nice young man.  The lower rating was given due to the fact that there was a table of 6 people in the center of the room, and one of the women was yelling loudly - to the point that my daughter and I thought that there was going to be a fight breaking out - turns out she was "just conversing" with her friends at her table.  I got the sense that everyone around them was very uncomfortable.  Once that party left, the atmosphere changed and people just seemed a lot more relaxed.  Too bad a manager didn't talk take her aside and let her know how loud she was being.  
The other thing that contributed to a lower rating this time - I asked for non-alcoholic beverage - perhaps a mocktail, and the waiter didn't have any suggestions, so I ordered a ginger ale.  I received what seemed tobe a club soda with some kind of gingery syrup that tasted like it had aspartame in it (yes - I can tell!).  I couldn't drink it, and never got the opportunity to tell the extremely busy waitstaff why - and nobody asked.
I would definitely go back, but not until things are a little more "normal" - this place is too expensive to waste on anything but excellence.
Great food! Better atmosphere! Was a treat to eat outside, enjoying a great meal with friends.

Fantastic, quality food. Thoughtful pallets. Artfully played. Perfectly cooked.
Service was attentive and professional. Typically I get rushed when I dine solo, but they were respectful with timing and I was taken care of without it being overdone.
The atmosphere strikes a beautiful balance between elegance and fun.
Thank you!
Beautiful restaurant! Live music was really nice. Overall great experience!
The food was so amazing, our waitress was fantastic and I absolutely loved it
Visited the Pink Door during a recent trip to Seattle. Enjoyed a lovely view from the windows. Fabulous service. Great option for a vegetarian meal - excellent Caprese salad, risotto and gnocchi.

Pink Door required a vaccination card to be seated and I loved it!  I haven't felt as comfortable outside my home since before the pandemic.  The food and service were AMAZING.  Best french fries in town.  The Cioppino was SO fresh and delicious.  They have a knowledgeable staff- (I've forgotten our server's name-oops). I have a gluten intolerance and she knew exactly what I could order or what needed to be subbed out.  Everything was timed beautifully.  ALL the stars!

I got sat in a corner with no light. I had to use my phone and the candle they had at the table to see the menu. They had one page for a food menu. The water they served was room temperature. The girl refused to accommodate my drink order. The lasagna I ordered came on a small plate (with nothing else). I had to practically force the staff to offer me the complimentary bread. The only good thing there was the guy who walked around and kept my water glass full (and eventually gave me ice)

Bravo to The Pink Door!  First for providing us a safe dining experience with your new “Proof of Vaccination” policy which immediately put us at ease and made us feel safe in your warm and inviting space.  Our server, and really our personal guide for the evening, Jessi, was the perfect compliment to the overall attention to detail and extraordinary service.  From the salad of simple greens and radishes, to the risotto which was cooked perfectly, to the lasagna my husband devoured.  The food was fresh, tasty and filling.  We ended the meal with the basil cake which was a great surprise of flavors! It was clear from the time we entered the restaurant, the entire Pink Door family really work together, love and respect their establishment and are clearly in the industry of service for ALL THE RIGHT REASONS!  The art of good food, making their guests feel at home, and most important, feel safe!
Again, Bravo!
So good, I would come back here anytime I’m in Seattle!

Overall excellent experience. We found the food to be good but not overly memorable. The service and atmosphere were top notch, which is why the 5 start rating despite mostly average food. 
The standout dishes were certainly the arancini appetizer and the mushroom gnocchi.

Not in a hurry to return but glad we went.
Great place.  A bit overpriced for what you get.
The food was great and the service staff really made the evening enjoyable. The location in the deck is perfect fir summer evenings.

Most of the outdoor seating is direct sunlight. It made our lunch very toasty and had to wear sunglasses. Which would’ve been fine if our server would’ve been a bit more attentive and quick to get our orders in. An hour long alfresco lunch turned into a two hour sweaty experience. All that to be said the food was delicious as always.! Still highly recommend the place.
On a hot sunny day their patio was perfect as was the view! Cocktails were delicious as was our meal and service. We had a lovely time!
Excellent menu, delicious food, professional & friendly waitstaff, great ambience. SO happy they have strict Covid protocols.  Thank you Pink Door!

Here's a dilemma: Do I tell you that, "The Pink Door is my favorite restaurant and it's perfect in every way?" Or should I say, "Don't go! I'm having a hard enough time making a reservation as it is!?"
The Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle, and I make a point of going there often. This most recent visit was another memorable and delicious experience.

Romantic and eclectic, this is a lovely dining experience what her seated on the patio with water view or indoors next to the live Jazz musicians. Great for special occasions or just fine dining at its best

We were so fortunate to have an excellent server by the name of Breezy.  She was professional and fun at the same time.  It made for great interaction and friendly service.  The table was perfect as we were seated in the back area with a lovely view.  I would request being seated there again as the noise level was low, good for us to hear each other during our dinner conversation. Would return for another enjoyable meal when we are in Seattle again.

The Pink Door is superb. 
Absolutely top notch quality ingredients translate to amazing dishes.
A bit hard to find but you’ll be glad you made the effort.
We celebrated our 40 year anniversary at the Pink Door and everything was wonderful! From the food, to the service, and the wonderful jazz music! AMAZING!

We were able to eat at patio in summer evening. Warm and romantic, we loved it! 
Special thanks to: 
1. vaccine cert checking, feel so safe! 
2.  stylish waiters and waitresses, so much fun! 
3. great food and service ( split dishes etc)
4. beautiful drinks with cool names ( we ordered a pair of Honey on my mind) 

See you next soon!

I tend to steer clear of the market in the summer unless I have guests in town. Just when I begin to forget, the Pink Door reminds me it is absolutely reliable for an all around EXCELLENT dining experience with a relaxed vibe. This place is quintessential "location, location, location!" and/BUT unlike other tourist traps, service is impeccable, food is absolutely fresh and delicious and you get it all with zero pretension. If it were next to a dump it'd still be a smash hit.
I seriously appreciate the Covid protocols too. 
I'll be back pronto. THANK YOU!

Fabulous food, had bruschetta with the most delicious local tomatoes for a starter. For lunch we had pasta with Bolognese sauce as main course , so delicious! Going back again tonight for more of their yummy food 😊
The food is always superb! The service is always amazing! I applaud you for requiring all diners to be vaccinated!
Lovely lunch - only suggestion was to lower the music
Made us feel special. Thank you!
Had a great experience! Food was delicious! Service was a little slow but otherwise, everything was wonderful! Would definitely come back!
We will be back!   It was wonderful!  Thanks for the extra help with the flowers and wine!
I just wish I could give 6 stars to this restaurant. :)
The overall experience was great! The restaurant was beautiful, the service was excellent and very friendly, and all of the food was incredible. I will definitely be returning.

We loved The Pink Door! We tried to make reservations a few weeks before our vacation but nothing was available. We signed up for the waiting list with Open Table and were notified that a table was available at 5:30 on the Saturday night we requested. We were seated in the back room which overlooks the bay. The service and food was excellent. We truly enjoyed every dish. I would definitely return. I would recommend a reservation for 7:00 or 7:30 to enjoy the live entertainment and the view at sunset.
We had a great time at The Pink Door. The service was excellent, ambiance is inviting, and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend the linguine and bolognese!
Food was great and service..

We hadn't been back to the Pink Door since they added a new dining room. The new space has a great waterfront view. Service was terrific and the food is as delicious and generous as ever. This is really a special place. Wish there hadn't been a group of super-loud brunch-goers at one table but everything else was lovely.

We ordered an appetizer and two mains. The appetizer (bruschetta) was tasty but prepared in a way that made it difficult to eat. One of the mains (cioppino) was very bland, and the other (gnocchi) was literally the worst gnocchi I’ve ever had. 

We had planned on getting dessert, but we did not. We were too afraid that dessert would be as disappointing as the rest of the meal. 

The service was fine, nothing special. She was a little obtuse and didn’t ask whether we enjoyed the mains—she probably knew. Never going back, never recommending. It was the most expensive meal of the birthday weekend I planned and also the very worst.

Pink Door is such a special, wonderful place. Great for a date or to take the family, as we did. Lovely ambiance, great food with farm fresh ingredients and good service. So happy to see them still going strong after the pandemic shutdown. We were celebrating our first real dinner out with the family in a year and a half.
30th wedding anniversary
We had a wonderful long lunch and the staff was very kind to let our party of six stay that long. Our server, Nora, was fabulous and we hope to be in her section the next time!
The food never disappoints.  Everything was delicious both drinks and eats.   Just a little noisy bit quieted down as the afternoon came.
Our first vacation together and this was my choice for a secret date night.
They could’ve fit more than 6, and we had to call to you it wish there was a waitlist for bigger tables so I didn’t have to manually attempt to increase size

Visiting Seattle and this place was recommended- such a great meal and such a cool inside of the restaurant. Everything was so fresh tasting and delicious. I loved the basil and raspberry cake for dessert. A Seattle must!
Anniversary trip
Wonderful food and service. Fresh ingredients and would definitely come here again.
Fantastic ambiance and views on the deck. Great food and service.

We have an annual birth month tradition of lunch in the Pink Door deck. This year was a return to a closer version to normal and they did not disappoint. Staff were lovely, even accommodating special requests. Cocktails and food were delicious. Kudos to Greta for excellent service and the bar manager for satisfying requests deliciously!

It was our first time in Seattle and we've heard this restaurant was a must go when in town. It did not disappoint! The food was incredible and the whole experience of going was definitely worth it. The lasagna is a must try!
Amazing views and the food was so good!
We had so much fun here and the food was excellent.
The food and patio dining was wonderful!   Great jazz band inside.  10 out of 10

Beautiful sunny day in Seattle. Three of us were seated in the restaurant patio with a nice view. Entire patio seating was full. First came the antipasto ahi tuna crudo, which was a great choice. Rigatoni pasta arrived with marinara sauce meatballs and cooked perfectly al-dente. Pappardelle Bolognese prepared with fresh pasta in slow-simmered meat sauce..excellent, hearty and rich. Pasta dishes were their strong forte. Risotto with several vegetables was very good..flavorful, creamy and cheesy. Our choice of side dishes includes: Broccolini was excellent, charred grilled with raisins and pine nuts. Tuscan Fries was crispy and tasty..served with fried herb rosemary and the house aioli, a must to have. Entrees: Skirt steak came with salad and mashed potatoes was well-seasoned and full of flavor. Northwest fish of the day was the Wild King Salmon topped with white creme sauce. It was disappointing..overcooked and extremely dried. Wait staff was efficient and attentive. Service was exceptional. Will be back!

Perhaps it’s the pandemic, we did not have the usual great experience during a recent visit. Our reservation was made well ahead of time for a special occasion and I had requested an outside table. The four of us were shown a tiny outside table by the patio door close to the kitchen bussing area. Our finely-dressed guest sat on a huge puddle of water which was on her chair. We only had one menu to share for the table. Thankfully we were reseated without any issue when we requested  a larger table.  The small table could not possibly have accommodated all our food. We also got a menu each. The antipasti we ordered to start took a very long time as was the ice we requested for  our water. We never got one side dish we ordered. Great service was always one of the highlights of the Pink Door.  Our experience may be a result of  staff turnover because of the pandemic (?)
A must to have dinner while visiting Seattle.. beautiful ambience great food wonderful service

Great al fresco dining with a friendly server.  The fig antipasto was superb.  I had the salmon special which was excellent and my wife had Caesar salad with crab. Only slight critique was that hard boiled eggs in salad looked like Safeway- we have our own chickens and are spoiled with deep yellow yolks from free ranging/dandelion feed…but this is a very small criticism.  Overall an excellent quality to price ratio.
Servers were attentive. Food was excellent and tasted phenomenal all the time.
Great place to eat and bring visitors! The food and drinks were fantastic. Fun little spot.

We were up for an anniversary trip and wanted to do something special for our  actual anniversary day. This absolutely was the right choice! We were lucky enough to get a table and proceeded to have a magnificent and delicious meal! The Ahi appetizer blew our minds and the basil cake was so unexpected and lovely.
Food is always constantly great as well as the staff. Definitely would recommend this restaurant

Don't believe the hype..........its even better!!  I get to Seattle a couple of times a year and this was the first time I was able to get reservations...........man was it worth it.  Solid, solid, solid.  Already planning my next trip back.  THANK YOU!

This was amazing! I wish we knew the music was going to end at 10pm. The only reservation available was for 10pm so we miss the entertainment but the food was amazing! I would definitely go back if we are ever back in Seattle!
Emily was an incredible waitress! Food was amazing. Must-dine spot in Seattle!
The place is beautiful, delicious food and amazing view.
We were celebrating our daughters birthday..the food was great per usual and our waiter, Dominic was absolutely lovely! …we also enjoyed the live music ❣️ we always look forward to our visits
Excellent food in a fun, whimsical and romantic atmosphere. Can’t wait to come back!
Great lunch and service

It was our anniversary and we were seated next to a table of large people. We are not on the small size either but did not fit comfortably next to them. When asked to move we were given the equivalent of being to demanding. We weren’t, we politely asked but they made us feel like we were putting them out when there was plenty of space to move. Won’t be back due to lack of consideration. Food was okay but was not worth sitting in a cramped area.
We ate here after our engagement. It was the best!!!
Lovely ambiance (live music), friendly service, delicious food
The Bolognese was phenomenal.  We literally wanted to drink it!!!😂
Another great meal with the Pink Door. Beautiful weather for dining on the patio. And as always, great food and service.
The Pink Door has always been a favorite and they did not let me down! Loved the total experience - the food was especially amazing! Can’t wait to go back!
The food was delicious and it was an overall great experience with a wonderful atmosphere.

The Pink Door customer service was phenomenal! They were very accommodating with our group’s difficulty in finding the location. The food was absolutely delicious. Our waitress was attentive, efficient, and thoughtful. I spent my 23rd birthday there for the first time and would certainly return.
Fabulous food creative drinks and interesting diversity of ambiance from room to room
Food was average.  Did not live up to the reputation.

For what we got the food was pricey. Service was average. I've been a customer there since they opened in 1983 but yesterday I was kind of disappointed. I think everything was overpriced. The salad didn't have enough to offer and so did the cioppino.
Food was wonderful
Good food, great service. Would be nice to have a pinker door & small sign to indicate the location.
Food and service were both very good. Food was very well prepared and tasted amazing.  Our server was excellent!! Knew her stuff when it came to the menu.
Great restaurant and ambiance. Perfect spot for lunch

Great to be back. We'd done takeout during our last visit and made a lunch reservation two weeks in advance for this one. Pink Door is hard to beat in the summer: sitting outside, looking at Elliott Bay, and enjoying great food and drink. We went in different directions on the menu: one of us had an Insalata Misticanza and the "Three Sisters" summer risotto, the other went with small plates: Arancini, Ahi Crudo, and three Mama's Meatballs: did I mention that it's hard to beat? No problem finding veggie and gluten-free offerings, service is always outstanding, and it's just a fun place. Can't wait for heirloom tomatoes to arrive, because the heirloom Insalata Caprese is a must-order.
The Pink Door is my absolute favorite restaurant in Seattle. Always delicious and I can always count on kind, knowledgable & enthusiastic service. :)
Excellent food with fantastic views and beautiful decor. Food came out pretty quick and water glasses were constantly filled.
Went for lunch—delicious food, unique and fun atmosphere.

Such a pleasant experience. Food was great, nothing too fancy but every dish was perfectly made with care. Atmosphere was nice, not too noisy or crowded. Service was great, they were attentive but not overly and didn’t rush us. Highly recommend.

You can't go wrong with Pink Door. It ticks every box. I love it and come as often as I can. I even made sure we had our first meal as a married couple there in 2019, so I'm guaranteed at least one meal there every anniversary 😅.
Here for birthday , first time in Seattle , came here because of reviews but very underwhelmed with food and service

Sat on the patio for lunch and all the food was amazing. We loved the mussels and clams, the rigatoni and meatballs, and the Mediterranean fries with fried herbs. The seasonal dessert with strawberries was also delicious.
The food was fabulous and the service outstanding. The Pink Door is always a delight!

Heard all about the Pink Door from friends and travel bloggers had to give it a try. 1.5 weeks out no reservations. Then we lucked out and scored a next day lunch reservation. Lived up to the hype!!  So good.
Service was great. Wishes we had been able to get an earlier reservation to see the entertainment.
Arrived early and was seated right away. Beautiful restaurant would go back again

Their food and customer service sets them apart from other Italian restaurants. We loved the ambiance and eclectic vibe. I ordered the flank steak which was cooked to perfection and a savory Cioppino seafood soup. The raspberry basil dessert was a pleasant surprise, although it may not sound appealing. It waa absolutely amazing!!
It was great!!! Seasonal veggies are over the words
Friend visiting from FL
Outstanding meal from top to bottom. The potato gnocchi and the king salmon — the fish of the day — were delectable. Will return for sure.
outdoor patio always a plus, the food was prepared as expected, service felt a little choppy

Love the Pink Door. Our server was very nice but it took a long time to get our food. We were one of the first groups seated and many around us who were seated after us were served and had finished their meal before we even got ours. We asked about it and were then served about 10 minutes later. Not sure what happened and there was no explanation given. 
The food was delicious though.
Service and food was excellent. Really really enjoyed the whole night.
Had an amazing dinner and the staff was awesome. I do wish I could have sat inside to experience the show.
Arancini and their Pink Door lasagna are excellent! The lunch reservations during the summer are great to sit on the patio and enjoy the view and sun. Highly recommend!

The food was mediocre at best. We had rigatoni with meatballs (nothing special) and squid ink spaghetti (too salty, too oily, and 4 shrimps for $ 24 is a bit much). The salad that I had as a side was just insulting: three lettuce leaves and some radish for $ 11 is beyond my comprehension. The service was bordering on being rood. The place is incredibly overpriced. I have no idea where all these 5-star reviews come from. Worth neither the calories nor the money.
Amazing as always

Alway wonderful atmosphere and great service.  The gnocchi was in a broth which made the dish bland.  The Parmesan shavings added flavor which saved the dish.  Will order one of the other wonderful dishes next time.

The cocktails, lasagna, and meatball sandwich were delicious. We especially loved the unique basil cake. Our server was wonderful telling us all about the fun places to visit in Seattle. 10/10 recommended.

First timers at The Pink Door and it did not disappoint. All parts of the experience were exceptional. We were able to get reservations for lunch and sat outside on a patio that was made to enjoy your dining experience.

Our cocktails were perfect, mine was refreshing and light and my husbands was smooth. 

For appetizers we chose the Tuna and it was very yummy.

Mains, my husband had the seafood special of the day which was Salmon and I had the vegetarian risotto which was filled with flavor. 

We tried to order pastas to go as we thought that would be great for dinner and they denied us saying that unless we eat it right away it will not be ideal. Truly respected that and we are already looking for reservations to go back in the evening however that is a challenge. Fingers crossed we get a Friday or Saturday night dinner sometime soon.

Oh and our server Aaron was spectacular, very observant and attentive of our table and we in fact watched him monitor his entire section every time he was outside. He is definitely an added Gem to our experience.

Thank you Pink Door.
We came here expecting phenomenal food, ambiance and service. We were not disappointed. The Pink Door exceeded our expectations and plan on returning.
Our food server was nice and friendly, professional, highly recommended to dine in this restaurant

It was amazing with great food and the best service! I believe the person who served us was named Ryan? But I could be wrong, anyways, he was super awesome and very friendly. We are not from Seattle but we would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to visit!

Great food!  Flavors, texture, variety, you name it, they will meet your expectations no matter how sophisticated your palate is.

All appetizers were incredible (Grilled Figs, Ahi Crudo, and Arancini and the grilled garlic bread).

Wine list is decent but cocktails are amazing, I tried few and my favorite was “What’s Happening “).

For main entrees my family and I tried few plates, the beat for us was the Pappardelle al Ragú, Cioppino, Cesar Salad, Linguine alle vongole, and the risotto).

Desserts were ok.

Service was really good!
Such a cool find. Food was delicious and outdoor dining was perfect.
The food was so good!  Caesar salad was delicious!  Great pasta!
A wonderful and magical place to spend the night. We loved it.

We were lucky and were seated on the patio (although a very good jazz trio in the dining room made it a tough decision). As usual the food was great; one of us had Pappardelle al Ragù Bolognese and the other had Risotto “The Three Sisters” with sweet corn, green beans, summer squash & their blossoms, parmigiano, basil. Both dishes were very well made with fresh ingredients and were delicious.

Pink Door has a decent wine list (if you like wines from the Piemonte region of Italy, I'd recommend the Travaglini Gattinara as one at a good price point that opens quickly with air and is a nice example of Nebbiolo).
Everything was delicious from the salad & bread to the lasagna & gnocchi. We also tried the basil cake & it was a good & interesting mix of flavors. We loved the Pink Door!
We went for a birthday celebration- Pink Door never disappoints.  Food is delicious and all staff is very engaging.  We always leave here felling great 😊
So glad you are open again. I always have my Halloween birthday lunch at The Pink Door but missed last year😢

The Pink Door is a hidden gem in Seattle that is our go-to for special occasions of any kind. The food is outstanding………I do wish they would bring back the olive tapenade as an appetizer but other than that - it’s the best.
Great place to celebrate a birthday.

Waitress was not as friendly and we felt rushed even tho if was end of the night doesn’t need to make it that obvious . Didn’t even remember my drink order so I didn’t bother reminding her as she wanted to just go home. I overheard her telling other tables how thankful she was they came in and she wished things were busier due to the pandemic but she can’t even handle the tables in current day status. Too bad the food was good because with just her I wouldn’t come back and I am not a local

It was a birthday celebration, thank you.  Stephanie was super!
Most of all, thank you for reserving a table on the deck!!!  Seniors who have spent at least 50 years going to favorite restaurants often choose to stay home, because of the noise level in those same restaurants that once held cherished memories. We are now hearing impaired, yet remain youthful of spirit and want to keep coming to the Pink Door. Grazie tanti.  
BTW, my ex-husband painted the cherubs back in the 1980’s.  I am pleased it has been saved, however in a different location.  He will be pleased to know.
The food here is mediocre at best. Nothing special and definitely not worth the hype or the price point.

They’re doing live music inside, which is loud and maybe not to everyone’s liking, but the patio is open and the inside dining area is such that you can get away from the noise but it may affect your wait time. Otherwise, though, as ever, great food and service. We came to town for dinner here.
Great food, setting and service. We will continue to return.
Great day for a summer time birthday lunch at the pink door.  Salmon was delicious, basil cake for desert yummy
One of the best meals I’ve had in a while! The food was delicious and felt very authentic.
My favorite restaurant of all time.  We love this place.

Our waiter was 10/10 and I wish I could remember is name. He gave us excellent recommendations of vegetarian options and was super nice with answering our questions. The restaurant was perfect as well with stunning views and atmosphere. The food came quick and was some of the best food we had. The drinks we loved so much and appreciate the support for the NAACP legal defense fund. We will hopefully be back soon as The Pink Door is our new favorite restaurant!
Our server, Dominic, was fantastic and answered all our questions about the menu and wine list. He even made recommendations for us that were spot on.
Return to dining
Food was really great and our server was so kind
Lovely and delicious dinner!
We have dined there before. We were not disappointed the first time nor were we disappointed the second time. The gnocchi was one of my top meals ever

The Pink Door is our favorite Seattle restaurant. The food is always excellent, tasty, and beautifully presented.  I ordered the Risotto which was incredible. The staff and manager were very professional and friendly. We will return again and again.

We loved this dinner. The service was attentive and thoughtful. The food was outstanding. The basil cake for dessert was fun and unlike anything we have had before. A couple even got engaged during this dinner at their table by the windows and that was beautiful. I would come back here and all three of us agreed it lived up to its great reputation.
Great place for lunch!  For being considered one of the very best in Seattle,  the service and vibe were amazing!
We've been to the Pink Door several times, and we haven't been disappointed yet - great place to eat.

I absolutely LOVE this place. The food was delicious and the service was some of the best I’ve seen. Our waitress was so cheerful and helpful whenever we had questions about the menu. I was quite impressed with this restaurant and will definitely come back the next time I’m in Seattle.
Terrific setting, we sat on the terrace but inside lovely as well, very good service and food. The spring risotto was outstanding.

Great service.
Outstanding food.
Safe environment

Was very excited to try this place and had heard how awesome the food was and what a great view it had. Took the 9:15 reservation as that is all that was available. Food good enough but nothing awesome. View was a big letdown. Service adequate but wouldn’t say friendly. Ok, but definitely not 4.5 stars. Also, braised short ribs that were raved about not even on the menu.

The waiter was very snooty. He was not very accommodating when it came to our questions. The flank steak was over cooked. Asked for Medium-rare and got medium-well. No flavor to the steak. Risotto was bland and mushy. Drinks were nothing special tasted mostly like fruit juice 

This was my husband B-Day dinner and it was not special at all. I had always wanted to go there and now I will never go back
Food was great! Everyone loved it!! Good find while on vacation

Best service and food ever.
We will be back. This is our new favorite place to eat. Thank you so much, especially to our server for making the dining experience special.
Pretty decent place with good ambience and food and highly recommend for a date. Wish it started the live music soon.

One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle! I always take visitors here. Last night my boyfriend and I celebrated our anniversary and the service was outstanding! Everything about the setting, the food, the people, made me feel like I was miles away on a beautiful vacation, totally relaxed. The waiter recommended extra bread to sop up all the pasta sauce and we did so eagerly. Do yourself a favor and split a carafe of the house red!
This place is awesome. There’s seating that looks out over Elliot Bay, the drinks were good, and the food was amazing and wasn’t over priced.
Absolutely delicious can taste the love put into the food
Father’s Day

Food was good but nothing very special or particularly imaginative. Pretty much what you would expect from an established Italian restaurant. Our waiter was nice and gave good suggestions for wine and our meal. There was something odd about the atmosphere, like the restaurant couldn’t decide if it was casual and funky or sophisticated. 

One thing that affected our experience was the presentation of the staff. A majority of the wait staff (our waitress being the exception) were all completely inappropriately attired and unprofessional. Think bra straps exposed beneath a faded racer back tank tops, commando boots and I in brushed hair in a shower bun. I realize that Seattle is world grunge capital but this took it too far. It was off-putting. If I am paying $200 for a meal I expect the staff to dress more professionally.
Absolutely fabulous. Recommended by a friend and did not disappoint. We were in Seattle for one day and this was the perfect way to wrap up the trip.
The Pink Door was so enjoyable and comfortable that neither one of us was ready to leave. We had perfect Seattle weather and exceptional service from Dominic.
Zack was great!!! Hands down best device in town!!! Fantastic food!

Came upon this recommendation through extensive online research…I now feel like a Seattle insider. The location is like an exclusive club…just a pink door! The food was so good it was like a religious experience. A harmony of flavors but each ingredient making its presence known. The service was professional yet welcoming and impeccable from hostess on up! The views are to die for and the restaurant decor makes you think you’re in Italy. Please drink a JUSTICE FOR GEORGE FLOYD cocktail! It’s both refreshingly delicious and philanthropic (good for the soul)!
Food was good service was good atmosphere was great.
What an awesome place! Kind of hidden, tucked behind Starbucks #1 at Pike Place Market in Post Alley. Great food and atmosphere.
Lunch date and the food was amazing
Food was delicious. Drinks were good too. Outdoor patio was lovely. Sad we didn't get to experience the burlesque vibe due to COVID , but overall it was a great dining experience.
Amazing experience - a perfect night out. The food was delicious paired nicely with excellent wine and our server was friendly and attentive
Fantastic food, great atmosphere and a wonderful view. What more could you want?
Loved the experience! Would definitely go back. Great food for a great price!

One of the best meals! We’re visiting Seattle from out of state and had to go back to Pink Door for a second meal on our trip. The oysters are amazing. We had the risotto, pasta bolognse, halibut, and meatballs. All were delicious!!
From start to finish, we had an amazing time! I loved our server's swag. The food and service was on point.
Great food & patio! We really enjoyed the bolognese & the fries!
Zachery was a fabulous waiter!  Thank you, Zachery!  Mary, Anne & Susan
Best food!!! Love every but.. the only tiny thing was a constant smell of fish pretty strong.. but!! The food and view totally worth it

Fantastic experience all around! We had dinner for my husbands birthday and enjoyed our experience so much. The food and cocktails were delicious, service was attentive, and view was amazing! Absolutely would dine again!
Loved the food, the service was great, and the view was even better! Would definitely come back again.

This is a hidden gem. You would never know it was there unless you searched for good restaurants in Seattle.  Make sure to make reservations well ahead  of time.   We had a great waiter and a decent meal. Would do this again.
It was an overall excellent lunch meeting, introduced a new client to Pink Door. Both meals were excellent, service friendly and efficient. So glad to be able to book reservations online.
A perennial favorite. Been going here for over 20 years.
Bad service. Terrible food. Over priced touristy spot.

What a perfect meal! We got to sit outside in the perfect weather. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I especially enjoyed my risotto. The basil cake was perfect! It was very moist, with an excellent frosting to cake ratio. The server even included a little candle for my birthday.
We celebrated a retirement and the staff were gracious and attentive.  Patio seating was a bit more rustic but fun. Really enjoyed our experience.
As always the Pink Door was an excellent dining experience.
Anniversary
We went to celebrate my daughter’s graduation. Service was friendly and food was fantastic. Super fresh, flavorful, and fast. Atmosphere was beautiful and picturesque. Would highly recommend.
I had such an amazing experience to celebrate my graduation from medical school! My waiter was so sweet and helpful with recommendations while providing amazing service!

Every time we’re in Seattle The Pink Door is a MUST!! We were last there in January and our incredible waiter remembered us, and even remembered what we ordered!! It was such a joy to be back again and for him to remember us what quite a shock. We remembered him because of how great a waiter he is. The food is always amazing, the staff are friendly, and the ambiance is EVERYTHING!! As restaurant owners we are very picky. We are huge fans of The Pink Door. Thank you!!
Linguini ala vongola is perfect as always:). Tuscany fries good for starter. Next time I would like to have table with seaview. The best in Seattle!
Delicious as always!
Great experience, awesome food! WIll come again for sure!

Our experience at The Pink Door was absolutely wonderful! Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was outstanding. Cocktails are a must and the basil cake was like nothing I’ve ever tried before in the best way possible. Our server Shawn was so great and made us feel so well taken care of. If you can get a reservation, I definitely recommend you do so!
I absolutely love this place. The ambiance cannot be beat.
Excellent food, excellent service. We got sat right on time. The server was knowledgeable and very kind. Drinks were cold and interesting, the Cesar salad was one of a kind.
Great place.  Food is excellent and our waitress was particularly wonderful.
Exceptional!
Amazing experience. Outstanding server and good. Server made great recommendations. Dessert was to die for !
Perfectly prepared lunch, timely service made for a terrific meal.
Favorite quintessential Seattle dining. Historic venue inside or out; friendly and accommodating wait staff; consistently superb food.  The grilled garlic bread especially is outstanding.

I love The Pink Door, I have been going there for 34 years!  The food is always good and the resturant is beautiful and I'm so thankful they did not have to permanently close due to the pandemic. 

That's being said I have noticed the last  three times I have eaten there the wait staff and hostess have been rude and unpleasant. The first time I noticed this I didnt give it a second thought, but now I can honestly say it's not my imgaination.

I hope the Pink Door reads this and makes an effort to correct some of their staff.
I snag a reservation here whenever I visit my daughter in Seattle !  Never disappoints.
Great lunch on the patio. Always a pleasure to eat at the Pink Door!
Wonderful family dinner. Great outdoor seating. The Pink Door never disappoints

Been waiting forever to get into this restaurant and we finally got in for a Sunday Brunch! Food lived up to the hype and it’s such a cute atmosphere! CANT wait to come back when the entertainment starts again. Only Wish they played any kind of music on the outdoor patio!
Food was excellent! Waitress wasn’t the most warm but get the lasagna!!!

AMAZING! I ordered the linguine and my boyfriend ordered the rigatoni with meatballs. The linguine came with so much clams! Loved it! The pasta sauce seemed simple but was delicious! Doesn’t seem like there were too many ingredients. I think a lot of the flavor came from the clams. My boyfriend loved their rigatoni with meatballs. I got a taste of it and the tomato sauce tasted fresh and was very flavorful. You can really taste the tomatoes but it wasn’t too sour or sweet. Just right. We would definitely come back when I’m back in the area. I want to try all their dishes! We had a reservation and were sat down immediately. Service was nice and fast and the food came out quick. We were l there for less than an hour and a half. Perfect weather and we had a view of the water. Such a great experience!
Fabulous service, great view, delicious cocktails and amazing food!
Absolutely delightful. Amazing service, delicious meal.
Birthday lunch, Luca from El Gaucho restaurant recommended this spot! Halibut and Ciopinno   Was amazing!
Delightful to enjoy the hospitality, care, and cuisine of The Pink Door. Absolutely one of the best meals for the price with drinks done to perfection.
Always a treat, always delicious, always a good atmosphere, we always love Pink Door.
Great food, good service and ambiance. Came back a second time in a week. Will go back whe get a chance to visit Seattle again.

the ambiance of this place is like no other! so cute!! took my girlfriend here for our anniversary and she loved it. food was phenomenal best lasagna i ever had and the basil cake was such a unique and delightful treat. server was attentive and helpful with any questions. great experience overall and will be returning!
One of the best meals I’ve ever had!! Lasagna was amazing! Definitely the best lasagna I’ve ever had! Coffee pie was also delicious! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone going to Seattle!!

Many of us were there celebrating out birthdays, and what a beautiful spot for it.  They gave us a table with a view of the water.  The food was spectacular.  Everything we ordered was delicious:  the asparagus appetizer, the beet salad, linguini with clams, Pink Door lasagna.  Had a delicious George Floyd cocktail.  I can't say enough good things about the Pink Door.
Always a perfect meal at the wonderful Seattle icon.

The food and cocktails are really good! The staff was very pleasant and approachable and the location/view is great. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a girls brunch or date/ special occasion.

For being one of Seattle's hardest to book restaurant, the food was not as top tier as expected. I got the ravioli and lasagna, and it was good, but I would order something else next time. I would return for burlesque/cabaret because the ambiance was great. Cocktails were fabulous.

Was happy I got a table on our last day of our visit to Washington. Made the reservation a week in advance.  Beautiful sunny day.  Sat outside.  Food was delicious.  Had the spinach lasagna , Arancini, and antipasto..  Great cocktails!   Had the Cosmo and The birds and bees drinks.
The food was absolutely amazing!

We always enjoy The Pink Door.  The location is excellent, overlooking the Seattle Public Market.  The food is creative and delicious, and the service is always top notch.  I've never had a complaint about The Pink Door - and I try to eat there whenever I'm in Seattle.
The food was delicious! The staff was amazing will definitely be going back when in Seattle again
Great option for an anniversary special occasion dinner!!

Food is consistently delicious - fresh & thoughtfully prepared. Service is always pleasant & helpful. We always leave pleasantly full, happy & relaxed. This is our go to spot whenever we are in Seattle.
My favorite restaurant in the world.
We had a great meal with a beautiful view and Terrence gave us five-star service!
AMAZING experience and excellent service by Ashley!
Anniversary trip
We had out of town guests here visiting and had a fabulous late lunch! Zach took great care of us!
We had a great celebration with out of town family.  They loved the Pink Door.

We have dined here several times now and it has not failed to be exemplary in all categories! Our server was fantastic and the food was divine. There will be a ‘next time’ and we will raise our glasses once again to a wonderful experience.
Always outstanding. Glad this gem has re-opened -- thanks, Jackie! Lunch is a special treat.

In Seattle for just a few days, we heard we had to try the Pink Door. It did not disappoint. The food was amazing and the drinks were wonderful. It was our favorite meal during our visit. We sat outside and the ambience was lovely- just what we were looking for to celebrate our special occasion. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a special place for a special meal.

The Pink Door is in a great location with a lovely little covered patio that overlooks the water. The food was fantastic and our waitress was very friendly. My sister and I both got pasta dishes (I got the spring risotto and she got the ravioli) which were well portioned and fresh. We also got the basil cake, which was surprisingly delicious. I'd say the Pink Door is perfect for a last night in Seattle or a nicer (but still casually friendly) dinner.
Solid spot. Food and drinks were good. I'll be back! I didn't get a true Italian feel from the decor, but spent most of the time on the patio. Overall is was a quality experience.
Amazing food and service! The ambience is calm and romantic with candle lights at each table. Highly recommend to treat yourself or someone special here
Perfect atmosphere to celebrate our daughters graduation. Fantastic meal.
Food & ambiance was great. Our server was very nice and we’re glad we celebrated our anniversary at The Pink Door

This place is really special.  The food is wonderfully prepared, with great and fresh flavors.  If you are lucky enough to be there on a sunny day and sit on the covered deck, it does not get any better than this.  Truly wonderful.
Great food! Outdoor seating was super cute. Really appreciate them following all CDC guidelines. service was phenomenal!

This place felt like a bit of a tourist trap due to its location. The food was alright, nothing to write home about. The service, however, made this a memorable evening for us. Excellent service sitting at a high top by the bar.
This is one of best restaurants I’ve dined at in America. Every dish is executed to perfection. I’ve been here 3 times and have yet to have something that wasn’t phenomenal. Highly recommend!
Sunshine on the patio is heaven!  Attentive staff.  Delicious food.

So so fun!! Hard to find...which was half the fun, it took us three times to get our slot BUT the meal was outstanding, drinks delightful and the ambiance was A+. So pleasurable, one of the highlights of our visit to Seattle!
Amazing will be back soon!

The ambience is very romantic, but I honestly found the food to be okay. There was nothing special about the entrees they offered. The menu was very typical Italian with not much ‘out of the box’ type of flavors or dishes. The service was wonderful and the cocktails were perfect.  I’m not really sure what the hype is about this place other than the atmosphere. I recommend eating here only if you’re in the mood for basic Italian food.

Excellent service in a time where that seems to be difficult to find. The food is fantastic, full of flavor and sizeable portions. Great cocktails. Sitting outside on a sunny day looking out at the Sound was beyond pleasant. Plenty of shade, lots of pretty flowers, great vibe. Also appreciated there wasnt music blaring which made the ambiance quite nice (although we were outside, so cannot comment on inside experience). The best dining experience I've had in Seattle in a long time.
Wonderful birthday dinner on the outside deck, everything was perfect for our family of 4
The Pink Door has been one of my favorite restaurants for many years. It never disappoints. The ambience, the views, the service and most of all the food - it's all top notch all the time!

Was a busy Mother's Day but we had an incredible meal, very creative (the dish of Peas totally exceeded wish list). Great service, very careful to prevent any COVID issues. Extremely pleasant people working there

I'M IN LOOOOOVE! The Pink Door has my heart and taste buds forever!
PD and I have been seeing each other for a few years now and not even Covid could break us up❤😊 
Dining at The Pink Door has been my traditional go to for my birthday, New Years Eve, special occasions and/or ANY reason I can find to dine there. The casual chic ambiance, creative cocktails, entrees that will tantalize your taste buds, and delish desserts to accompany a beautiful espresso are a few of the reasons I love this place!
Classy meets comfort at the Pink Door, thanks to the owners ability to hire an attentively professional crew. Hostesses, wait crew, bussers, etc. they ALL do their best to give me a fantastic dinning experience. I've never been disappointed and I'm sure you wont be either. Buon Appetito!!

Mother's Day Brunch was really a lunch. Food was great as well as the service even as there were no morning items. Guess they can sell more alcohol with a lunch menu.  That didn't detract from the fact that we ate very well and at a fair price.
Always a great experience coming here! Highly recommend

Always a favorite place to go, but also always a pain to get reservations for. Great food and our server was great. The basil cake was a little funky so I'm not sure I'd order that again but I really enjoyed everything else.
Sad that there was no show. That's what I went for. Update your website so people know there will not be a show.
We had an amazing time! Very socially distanced, clean, and great food!
We had a delicious meal in a beautiful environment with a view.

Dining room had a nice view with evening light. No ambient music however so the vibe was a little awkward. 
Menu items we ordered tasted very average with decent flavors but nothing to get excited about. Ciopino taste was flat, but full of tasty seafood.
The spinach lasagna was perfect! I will definitely be there again!

A gem in the Pike Place Market.  Imaginative interpretations of bistro and trattoria staples, with Pacific Northwest touches.  The tuna crudo is without equal in Seattle, oyesters on the half shell were perfectly shucked and expertly served (brine was intact).  Frozen mignonette a fun and tasty take.

Vegetarian options are inventive, interesting and, like all the first and second courses, very well balanced.

Wine list is well curated, with unique selections at reasonable prices (there are a few unique splurges as well) that expand horizons.

It’s always such fun to dine here... the ambience always makes you smile and the menu is creative and and delicious.
Don’t miss the Cioppino!
Warm reception and service.  Food was delicious especially the lasagna.
Great food and drinks. We loved the wait staff! We sat outside facing the water! Very nice!
Wonderful food, waitress was very nice and knowledgeable. Atmosphere was pleasant. Recommend to everyone.

Delicious food at decent prices for a restaurant which recommends smart casual attire. Cute ambiance, great view if you sit outside; options to sit inside as well. Staff were friendly and informative. We're planning our next dinner date here ASAP!

We have always loved the Pink Door and it will remain a favorite. On this trip, during Covid, we were seated on what is typically a beautiful patio. Strangely, there was a noticeable lack of effort put into sprucing the only seating they have up. There were no lovely flowers on tables, or touches to create the ambiance especially needed at this time of year if your only choice is al’fresco. We were there for a 3:30 late lunch early dinner, glass of wine on the sunny patio. 2 great 2 tops were wide open, with intimate surrounding and next to edge with “the view”. We were seated near the entry to the patio at a 4 top up against the wall. This is to keep waitstaff sections even but not always a great deal for customers. The food was good, not great. I’d give it a solid B grade.  They have been better in the past. Our waiter was great. Just right. Will I go back? For sure. I live here so it will be awhile. Do I hope they up the food game and ambiance they are known for? I do.
We had an exceptional afternoon on the outside patio. We loved every minute - from the fabulous server to the wine list and food choices. It was a special day!

We were  looking for a luncheon to celebrate an important occasion.  The Pink Door is one of our favorite Seattle Restaurants, but due to Covid we thought it might be scaled back a bit.  It wasn't.  We had the full, fabulous Pink Door experience, plus it was quiet!!
Our waiter was a gem who added to the experience beautifully.
Lunch on the patio on a warm Seattle day was wonderful. I liked the service and the food. The benches are a little uncomfortable but everything else was terrific.

Food was disappointing although the service was pretty okay. Bread before meal was served cold. I had some sand in my clam and let the server know, she was just okay...?do you want another dish? Not really much resolving. There wouldn’t be a next time.

The family tried out The Pink Door Sunday afternoon.  Place wasn’t too crowded. Everyone working there was very friendly. Waiter service was great. Food was awesome. We’d definitely plan on returning.
Amazing. Greta was wonderful. Everything was exceptional.

Delicious food, great service, and a lovely atmosphere. My only complaint is that we had to sit on uncomfortable stools next to the bar, despite the fact that we made a reservation. Food was outstanding though, would love to come back for a date night again soon.
Perfect for a special date night 🍷
Great Italian food and an amazing atmosphere for a date
Overhyped. Ambiance is boring. Definition of pretentious.
Consistently great food and service. One of our favorite places to dine! Highly recommended.
Absolutely amazing food and atmosphere!!!! Service was outstanding drinks were great!
Wonderful food and service!

Lunch with three friends, all of us fully vaccinated.   We were delighted to be seated on the patio/deck.   Perhaps because it has been so long, the food, service, ambience were practically perfect and a refreshing change from isolation.
The food was amazing and exceptional service! Will be back again!
Always the best!
Got seated right away in a beautiful spot! It was peaceful and sunny. The waitress was so kind and took her time with us. Every dish was delish! Especially the lasagna!

Location:
Difficult to find because there was no sign anywhere on the building. The only indication is by the color of the door. Seating by the window offers fantastic view of the Pike Market. 

Food:
Excellent! Meatball was not salty at all, and the pasta was not greasy nor too light. Linguine had lots of clams! 

Service:
Tanya was very helpful and served us in a prompt manner.
bad waiter experience.  condescending to us from the get go. girlfriend was not happy.

The Pink Door never disappoints. We are happy that our first visit post pandemic lockdown was all that  we day dreamed it would be. Great service & delicious food. Thank you for being such a fantastic restaurant.
The food was so good and it was worth it to get a reservation in advance!
The Pink Door was fantastic. Great food, service, and atmosphere.
Always a great time every time. The server was very friendly, helpful, professional, and went above and beyond to cater to our needs.
Best food best surroundings.. I love it every time!
A real hidden gem.  Very popular so make a reservation well in advance
It might be on the higher end, but the food is so delicious! Absolutely worth it!

Husband and I went for our one year anniversary visiting from CO! The food was absolutely delicious. We ordered the grilled garlic bread to start and for our meal the lasagna and bolognese. As you can see we dug in before we even got a good photo. Our server was kind and attentive. 10/10 would come back.

👆 Yes I do need help. I visited your establishment on 4/24 at 1:30pm at which a friend and I were promptly greeted by the host staff. They were friendly, accommodating and efficient. We were soon sat a table that unfortunately was located in the center of the restaurant...and on the onset this was wonderful as we took in the magnificent views! Our waitress was also very friendly, knowledgeable, and has the patience of a Saint. Menus were promptly downloaded and a set of drinks were ordered with a appetizer to share. Now granted my friend and I are visiting Seattle for the first time and ecstatic at the new surroundings as some travelers will do, is enjoy an adult beverage. Well the bloody orange cocktail in its relatively tall glass was spilled and the glass broken. One would think... "a simple mistake", right? Well no sooner had the mess been cleaned up and the drink replaced... IT HAPPENS AGAIN! I shrunk in my seat, knowing I was fully to blame and apparently can't hold my liquor. I asked the waitress to bag our food as I needed to save face and get out of there as quickly as possible. She insisted we stay, the manager politely inquires if I was okay and even though I wasn't, I told him I was. Moral of this story... The Pink Door has amazing staff and delightful food, I on the other hand need a 12 step program.
Love the Pink Door. So happy it is back! Food is excellent and the staff very helpful. Would recommend to anyone who loves a nice view and good food.

The Pink Door is the first place I get excited about when traveling to the NW. I have been a patron for decades now and marvel at the consistency of this excellent restaurant. I was visiting my daughter who attends UW and we ate at The Pink Door 2 out of the 3 nights we were in the area. I can't wait until my next visit. Thanks!
Server was very attentive and the seating arrangement was amazing. Right next to the windows with the view of the sound. Would recommend the pink door for casual or any special occasion!
So happy I chose this restaurant.  I was a tiny bit put off by them (don't arrive early, don't stay more than 2 hours, etc.)  That said, the food, service, and ambiance were great.
Very good food and great service. Would definitely go back.
Staff were very friendly and we were seated asap. The covid guidelines are followed strictly and the food with view was splendid as usual

Apparently they usually have live music but we went during COVID, which was fair. But it was all good because the food was possibly the most amazing Italian meal we have ever had in the US. We can’t stop talking about how good everything was. Our waitress did not lead us astray in her recommendations!! There was not a crumb left behind. Will def go back when it’s live again!
Amazing food!! Cute little spot, great service. Try the lasagna or special order fettuccini.

Our server, Stephanie, was amazing! Very attentive, charming, and thoughtful! All of the food was incredible and came out in perfect timing, our wine was delicious and perfectly complimented our meals thanks to Stephanie! The bartender, Terrance, was awesome in accommodating a delicious cold digestivo for a warm day! The ambience is romantic and fun. Such an amazing experience and my new favorite WA restaurant! Thank you Pink Door! We will definitely be back for special occasions.
Always our favorite restaurant. It never disappoints. Food, service and ambiance are wonderful! So glad that we could return.

The Pink Door is highly overrated. The view is pretty good but the staff is rude and very slow. The way they are handling the covid-19 restrictions makes your visit uncomfortable. The food was terrible, especially for the price.  There are so many amazing places to eat in Seattle and this is not one of them. the food is very bland and incredibly basic.

Great lunch experience with out-of-town friends who have not been to Seattle before.  There is nowhere better on a beautiful, sunny Seattle day than The Pink Door patio.  And they more than delivered.  Great service, yummy cocktails, delicious food (highly recommend the grilled asparagus with Parmesan and a poached egg) and such lovely ambiance.  Can’t wait to go back.  🇮🇹🥂
Great food, service, and a perfect view!
A fantastic dinner overall for our family. Great way to come out of the pandemic.
Birthday, sat us away from everyone like we weren’t wanted
Good for birthday date

We were told to fine The Pink Door...so we did! It was actually off the beaten path and hidden out of plain sight. The search was half the fun! Once we found it, we were impressed with the overall experience. They are fully enforcing Covid protocol and we didn’t mind at all. They were OPeN! The food was amazing, our server was attentive, and we could not have been more please with our dining experience. Thank you for making our evening special!

Fabulous, just fabulous!  Everyone at the restaurant was welcoming and the food was delicious.  We enjoyed a very festive sunny afternoon on the rooftop, breaking our COVID hibernation with good friends.
My order was too salty and had to ask to remake it.
The food and service were excellent.  Lots of choices, especially for drinks.

Delicious food, fabulous service, magical ambience. Everything about the Pink Door makes for a perfect dining experience. The servers are comfortably gracious and  attentive without being fussy; the fresh take on Italian fare takes full advantage of the PNW’s bounty, and the preparation and presentation of each dish delivers mouthwatering satisfaction. We’ve been dining here quarterly for 18 years and have tried everything on the menu- I honestly can’t pick a single favorite because it’s all incredible and never a disappointment. Maybe it’s how the light illuminates the environment and makes you glow. Everyone at the table can’t help but smile. A calm joy settles in around you. Your favorite people surround you and you are sooooo well fed. That’s pretty perfect.
Just a lovely lunch.
Host and waitress were helpful and attentive during my dining experience. They always took the time to check in on my boyfriend and I. Had a wonder time!
Wow this place is the best Seattle secret. I have eaten here many many times over the years and has never disappointed
Restaurant didn’t acknowledge the birthday request, a simple acknowledgement would have been enough.
All around great experience. Will definitely be back when in town.

I hate to review this place because then I’ll have more competition for a seat!  Doing a great job as usual.  Wish they’d open the patio up more often (it was upper 60’s this week and they said it was “too chilly” for patio dining).  My death row appetizer would be their antipasti.  I’ve been ruined - no other restaurant in the state has antipasti as good as the Pink Door.

I could not recommend this restaurant enough! The view was completely unexpected and gorgeous, especially at sunset when we ate. The staff was incredible and so attentive. We were greeted by every employee on our way in and thanked by everyone on our way out too. Also, the food was amazing! I'm still drooling thinking about their homemade-style lasagna. Overall, it was a great experience start to finish! It was my boyfriend and I's favorite part about our first trip to Seattle.

Everything was amazing. We had a table right by the water and the view was stunning at sunset. The food was so delicious! We started with oysters and a few other appetizers. Then I had the beet salad and my entree was the linguine with clams, soooo good. Can’t wait to come back! Also our waiter was such a pleasure and his service was outstanding.

We enjoyed the ambiance and the food was Amazing! With covid, they have not been doing their live performances, I guess they used to have live music and/or trapeze act and they said they are unsure when or if those will return (FYI). Otherwise it was a great dinner choice and I would definitely go back again.
Our server was so kind and checked on us just the right amount. The food was INSANE and the ambiance amazing.
The ambiance, view, and service was amazing! Best spot for a romantic dinner in Seattle when you're on a budget. Definitely worth the price.

Food was wonderful! We loved the charcuterie board and the delicious ragu pasta. My son said the cioppino was the best he’s ever had. Topped off with the cheesecake and panna cotta, it was a great end to our Seattle trip!
I can not say enough good things about this place . We went back again ! The Maître d’ was so helpful. He had some great suggestions. Food AMAZING!!!!!

We have always loved doing date night here. Everyone  but our waiter was kind and friendly. We waited 15 min to get drinks and another to order appetizers and then he forgot the appetizers. We watched him serve 3 other tables drinks,food and chatted. Never made eye contact with us even after nicely trying to get his attention. We wore our mask with each encounter with him and were polite after he forgot our first order, but we know that type of service isn't what The Pink Door would tolerate.
staff was wonderful and very kind. food was amazing. we had a great time

My server was great! I want sure which wine to choose so he brought me a small tasting of whites he suggested to help me make the decision. He was super sweet! Also, I’ve had clams + linguine in Italy and the dish at The Pink Door rivaled that!

YOU GUYS ROCK!  Awesome location, Amazing service, Delicious food and priced almost too reasonably. Don't change! 
Linguini and clams are my favorite but you really can't go wrong here. Thank you for opening up and keeping safety as a priority. Kudos to all your servers for accommodating customers during covid. You guys pulled it off perfect.
Everything about the pink door was fabulous, view, service, food, and ambience.
Super food, great location, good view,  great service.  Just super.
We love everything about The Pink Door!
I would highly recommend the Pink Door, it was such a great experience with beautiful decor, and the view is hard to beat. I ordered the bolognese and it was delicious.
Amazing food amazing service lots of extra precautions for covid. What else can I say awesome experience

Our out of town visitor did not tell us it was hard for her to walk up hills or use stairs so if you are bringing someone in the same situation be aware. Our server was almost perfect. He changed music from rock (or whatever) to soothing jazz per my request. He overheard I was disappointed because there were no croutons on my salad so he brought me some in a little bowl... perfect.
The food was outstanding!  Such a nice restaurant with good service and amazing food!

This was our first time to the Pink Door and it did not disappoint! I believe our server's name was Daniel - he was very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and beverage options, and took great care of us. The view was wonderful and the lasagna was the best I've ever had. Couldn't be more pleased with our experience.
Absolutely wonderful!! I highly recommend this restaurant.
Best Linguine and Clams I've had in a very long time. The place is also very cozy.
the pink door never disappoints!! i love this place. My favorite is the pink door lasagna
I love their lasagna. Its vegetarian and so rich in taste!
We are huge fans of the Pink Door. It’s our first stop each time we travel to Seattle. We always have an amazing experience, but this time was somehow even better!! Absolutely incredible. Thank you!!
Love the pink door! Always a great experience
Wonderful staff and customer service! The food was delicious, cant wait until I come back again
Everything was perfect. The food and service was incredible.
Had dinner for my 40th. Great experience!!! Love the ambiance! And great view!

Classic Italian Bolognese was the definition of comfort food gone luxe. Likewise the short ribs with polenta. A Manhattan-ish cocktail was a luscious start, as was a pair of local oysters with a perky mignonette.
The service was thoughtful, swift and friendly. Loved to relax on the deck and enjoy our Northwest natural beauty on a balmy spring day!
Basil cake was amazing. Great view. Windows were open to increase air flow. Lovely service.

Did not make us feel special for my friends Birthday get together. The waiter asked how my drink was & I gave my honest opinion and the waiter did not know how to respond to a bad review. Don’t ask for feedback if you don’t want to hear the truth. The food was mediocre. There’s so many other great places!

Absolute perfection!  The perfect antidote for a year of Covid lockdown.  The magic of the Pink Door never disappoints.  An epicurean delight in the most enchanting world of whimsy.
Still savoring the moments of pure delight!♥️🥂
Romantic ambience, superb service, and delicious food!
Awesome service, they gave us a drink because it was my wife's birthday. THe lasagna was delicious.
The Pink Door is always delicious and elegant. And they are doing a great job of obeying the Covid rules, keeping People safe while doing their great food thing.
Grazie Pink Door: getting to dine again with you is like a delicious breath of Spring hopeful! Everything delicious, service is warm and genuine, life is good!
Food and service is really good.
This is the best meal I've had in a restaurant in more that 5 years!
Never disappoints. Great team serving great food.
It’s a nice restaurant. However, it took some time to find where it is.  The pasta is fantastic!!

The Pink Door is a Seattle Icon of eating establishments - been there forever, amazin experience, with only one issue. Parking.  You'd think by now they would have partnered with a valet company or something to ease the stress - Ubering isn't an excuse. I won't get in an Uber, so I drove around for 20 minutes.  It's 2021, let's figure that out.

It was a great experience. We absolutely loved the environment. It’s a perfect place for a first date. 
It is hidden in an alley so parking is a walks away
The best meal in Seattle, every single thing we ordered was delicious

Wonderful food and wonderful service. 
It was a little wonky getting seated because we showed up 10 minutes early, with covid protocols we had to just stand there and wait with others spaced out appropriately.
Food was OK, service was not great at all. Wouldn't come back again.

My boyfriend and I were way early for our reservation, unsure if they would be able to seat us so soon, but the host was very accommodating. We were seated and given drinks to celebrate our anniversary. Our server was very helpful with selecting GF options for me and the food was amazing!! For dessert we had a delicious affogato and we left the restaurant with big smiles on our faces, though hidden under our masks. I recommend to anyone looking for a fancy night out, plus they have great gf options.
Service was spot on, ambiance perfect, food delicious!
Amazing place to go! Service was great! Food was ammmaazzinng!
There is nothing wrong with the Pink Door. Beautiful location, great locally sourced food, affordable prices.

Awesome as always. Good spacing between tables and ventilation, and the staff made sure capacity didn’t exceed limits at any time. Food and service were excellent, just a bit pricey but worth its value.
Awesome night, great food!
Dinner and drinks were excellent but we were forgotten about near the end of our visit so we skipped dessert. Good value for what we spent.
Love the ambiance ! Out table was great and near the window with a fabulous view!

I can’t applaud the effort of the staff to keep things calm, safe and enjoyable enough. We were hesitant to eat in a restaurant after being home for a year, but the care of the staff alleviated any residual anxiety. We had a lovely time. Thank you.

I have been here a few times and it's nothing special. The food is ok but overpriced for the quality. Your experience will be diminished by how incredibly rude the entire staff is. People need to stop buying into the hype of this place. I cannot stress this enough if you are looking for a nice dining experience in Seattle you will not get it here. They are also not handicapped accessible. I'm not even handicapped and that bothers me.
We had the best time dining at the Pink Door. Dominic was an excellent server and made sure our experience was top notch. Would recommend the mussels and clams dish and the lasagna!
Would definitely eat there again what a great experience with delicious food !

It was a nice evening and a delicious if not especially memorable meal.  I got the risotto, the others in our party got the rockfish and clam linguini.  The dining room is beautiful and the location can't be beat, and our server was incandescent ... but I think my expectations were a little overblown.  The real star here is the setting rather than the food, I think.
It was great! Felt safe durinhas covid time. So I recommend
Fabulous, as usual. Even with a limited menu, they do not disappoint.
Good food and great service. We enjoyed the desserts as usual, superb!
Perfect little spot overlooking the water! We were pleasantly surprised by the views! Very friendly staff!
Every course was perfect, from the wine to dessert. The appetizers, salads and entrees popped with flavors of fresh herbs masterfully incorporated.
The food and atmosphere was amazing! I wil definitely be coming back when I visit Seattle again.
Fabulous all around. We can't wait to go back! I'm dreaming of the roasted eggplant and smoked mozzerella!!
Had the whole rockfish and it was amazing!

The Pink Door is always amazing.  I have certain food allergies that are a pain at other restaurants and The Pink Door always comes through with something inventive to accommodate them.  The server did not blink an eye when I asked for something special.  This time they made a gluten free pasta dish that was one of the best I have ever had.
everytime I wish to treat myself, this will be the place.. beautiful artwork, decor nd incredible food
The Pink Door is always a lock for a great meal and great atmosphere.

Wife’s bolognese was awesome as always 
My Muffalata sandwich was more than disappointing. The sandwich was so thin, the 2 pieces of bread were almost touching. Probably 2 pieces of paper thin ham and cheese. I did not see any other meats. 
Didn’t mention to server but it was the most disappointing sandwich I have ever ordered 
I sure didn’t expect get cheaped out at the Pink Door

I've been a long-time guest of this fine place (about 30 years?), and it never gets old. Now that we live 50 miles away, it takes a bit of extra motivation to drive up there, but we're always happy that we did. All items on the menu are good. Go for it!
First time in Seattle and the pink door was definitely my favorite place out of everything I ate while visiting! The food, service and drinks are amazing.
Waiter was rude. Spoke to manager in regards to this issue and he  didn’t take complaint seriously. Big disappointment.
Had to wait a little bit, even with a reservation. Pretty insipid staff.

We were impressed with the COVID precautions implemented by the restaurant. This was our first time dining indoors in a restaurant in a year! The service was very good and attentive.
