The food was excellent. The cocktails were excellent. The wine list was very good, and our selection of Amarone was perfect.
Great place for our special birthday date night!
As always delicious food and relaxing atmosphere. Love this gem of Seattle !

It was our last night of vacation in Seattle and we were thrilled to be able to get a reservation.   We felt like their social distancing practices were very well done.  The ambience was great, our view was wonderful and food and cocktails were outstanding.
This place was awesome, delicious food and a really cool unique atmosphere

Visiting from out of town and found this place within walking distance from my hotel.  Hard to find the door to enter but is a beautiful and welcoming space inside.  The waiter was the bartender and was very helpful during my dining.  I'm from "bourbon country" so when I ordered a bourbon drink called a "Tom Waites" I'm skeptical being in Seattle.  Wasn't sure it was good so I had to order another one.  Actually was delicious! My meal was the Risotto with a mushroom sauce and was wonderful as well.  Well worth finding and enjoying the cuisine.
Went here for my birthday and I had an amazing time! Ashley was super nice and I’m really looking forward to coming back in the summer for an even better view of the sound!
We love the Pink Door and were so excited to be able to celebrate our Anniversary there.  It's one of our favorite restaurants, with amazing food, service and ambience.  It's a must go to!!
Fantastic food and service! Followed abs encouraged safe practices given Covid.

It was a delight returning to an “old friend” to enjoy our lunch. Plus, it was our first choice after a year for inside dining. Now we look forward to outside dining on the deck.

Regardless of this seasons circumstance, the friendly staff, excellent  service, outstanding dinner menu and general ambiance remains the same and was a pleasure to enjoy once again. 

Graziemillie....looking forward to our return visit.

1st thought’s come to mine-quite underwhelmed!  It was heartening to have waited and made reservations on our last evening in Seattle-to wait for
1.  The bread served pre-meal  was cold, hard and crusty(not in a good way); 
2. Though the service was good and the server was more than adequate-the suggestion of the drink was uninspiring and sure she said it had a flowery taste-but in this case that taste     was too flowery. 
3. When the main courses arrive well-
a . Tortellini was dough balls in soup-what they termed a broth-but it arrived (all 7 little pieces)-disappointed and disheartening-pasta tasted uncooked and cold-no offer of cheese(or packets, in a COVID world);

b. Rigatoni with meatballs was at best-uninspired!  The pasta again  bordered on being cold-almost lifeless.  I was looking forward to a decent marinara sauce and it best feature was that it looked good-but that was it.  Honestly the sauce I get out of a Hunt’s can tasted better.  Oh and then the meatballs -insipid-I expected flavor and to be brought to the old country-but no luck. 

All in all a disappointing outing that was cannot be reclaimed!

The pink door was not what we remember it to be. I think there is a new chief because the food was not up to standard. All of our plates came out luke warm. The food itself was incredibly average to below average. The waiter was awkward and super pushy about us ordering dessert. We will not be coming back to this restaurant. 120 dollar meal for a luke warm meal was not what we signed up for.
Great!! Great View, great food, great everything! everything was great great great great great!
My girlfriend and I had an amazing time! Very fun night out and will become our regular spot!

Our waiter was a gentleman and he was very friendly. I don't recall his name, but he made sure to ask for ours and remembered throughout the entirety of our evening. It was a perfect night to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday for the first time -- definitely won't be the last!

-Brett
Loved going to the Pink Door for a date night! Great drinks and food, and felt very safe with their precautions!
Highly recommended. Had the antipasti, fennel salad with blood oranges, meatballs, and rockfish. Mixed drinks were excellent as was the wine. Skipped dessert.
It is always a treat to eat at the Pink Door. Food, ambiance, and service is top notch.
Food was amazing, WiFi worked great, views breathtaking - we ordered the clam linguini and my business colleague ordered the sandwich. Awesome
We went here as our first date and I couldn’t be more impressed. I would love to come back again.

The Pink Door was a really great dining experience. Our toughest part was actually just finding it. There were no signs outside of the bright lights. Other than that, it was fantastic. Ashley our waitress was very attentive and helpful throughout the entire dining experience.  I did feel however that the appetizers and salads were a bit overpriced for the amount you received. But the main course was worth the value they gave it. My wife finally got the dessert she wanted and was very happy! Thank you for a wonderful time.
Delicious food. Not a long wait. Very romantic place with a beautiful view.
Food was delicious! Got complimentary glasses of champagne for recently getting engaged and dessert for my birthday. Had an awesome view of pike place market and the water. We will be back!

First time back for indoor dining at Pink Door after COVID.  Everything was fabulous, as usual.  Excellent and attentive service, very nice table by the window.  Had the large antipasto plate which was loaded with traditional Italian treats like salami, prosciutto, veggies, mozzarella, etc.  A good size for us three.  Then had the Tortellini in Brodo, with the tortellini swimming in a an absolutely fabulous broth (3 days to make, they said). My wife had the lasagne and my son the linguine alla vongole.  Everyone was very pleased.  Dessert was the almond cake and the "sex bomb" (la bomba sessuale); both made in house and decadently tasty.  We were very happy with everything.
Menu was limited for vegetarians. Food was tasty. Sitting comfort was ok
Wonderful evening at the Pink Door! Excellent food, wine, and service 😊 we will definitely be back next time we are in Seattle!

We got to sit out on the deck overlooks the puget sound and pike place market.  The services was fantastic, our waitress very nice and on top of everything.  The foods was good and it was great to be outside with friend again.
Everything about this place is great....the veggie lasagna (and I love my meat) is AMAZING!!
So happy to be back! We were worried about keeping the time limit at the table (105 minutes for table of 4), they let us stay longer, no pressure. Outstanding experience!

It was good for a first 'dine in' experience in a year.  However, their Covid precautions were not all followed:  temperatures were to be taken of all guests, but were not.  I was told not long after my reservation was made that outside dining was closed, but in fact it was open. That being said, windows were open and diners well spaced out.  A superb waiter, as always at The Pink Door.
Amazing experience. Will be back again.
AMAZING experience! Excellent food, excellent staff, incredible ambience. Love this place!
It was an amazing night. Food was incredible, ambiance   and care for the customer was excellent. We will surely return.
Loved the food. Romantic and beautiful inside! Mikey was great!

Get your reservation in early, it was hard to find a time slot. The food was good but very pricey. The liquor was pricey as well so be careful what you order. The restaurant is very comfortable and pretty and has a great view outside. The servers were terrific.

I ordered the lunch bucatini @ $21.  The pasta itself was perfectly al dente, the sauce was very mediocre and somewhat greasy tasting.  Not worth the price; more like a $12 dish, so VERY overpriced.  Service and ambiance were top notch, but I came to eat, not ogle.
Delicious food with outstanding service! Great for special occasions.

My boyfriend and I were in town and came out for his birthday dinner. Service was excellent! Food was amazing! I’m completely blanking on our waitress’s name but she had a cute pixie cut. Great job all around! (:
Everything is phenomenal. Food is amazing. Staff is extremely nice. Definitely a place to take someone you want to impress. Overall pretty perfect

We had such a beautiful birthday celebration at The Pink Door tonight. They have done everything COVID related so beautifully while keeping with their exacting standards. Our only disappointment was that we couldn’t see our fantastic server’s smile...but we felt it every time he approached our table. 🥰 🍷🎉
Greatly enjoyed our experience, food, service, as always. Service was even better than usual this evening (3/7/2021).

The pink door has the ambiance down to a tee, beautiful. But our food was less than exceptional. Small portions, chewy bread, and over priced for the amount of food you receive. We ordered an appetizer but never got it. Luckily we weren’t charged for it. But, for spending over $100, we left hungry and disappointed.

The Pink Door has gone upscale in quality and price- successfully. It is now one of the most elegant and romantic date places in town. Our meals were wonderful and the service was excellent.  Portions were small by Seattle Italian restaurant standards but wonderfully conceived and presented. Will be back for the next special occasion.

I am definitely coming back here again. Service was on point, I thought that me and my friend were taken care of really well. Staff was friendly and welcoming. The food was AMAZING and the cocktails were pretty good. As of now during the pandemic I'd say the restaurant is managing quite well and the tables are spaced out with enough social distancing.

We were there for our anniversary. From start to finish, our experience was absolutely amazing. Our waitress Ashley K, the food, the drinks, the view made it an incredible time. I recommend The Pink Door to everyone!
Fabulous! Everything was fabulous! Love the Pink Door, it's an icon in Seattle.
The mussels & clams were divine!! Sidecar was the perfect cocktail! Hostess & waitress were the absolute BEST!
Amazing service and friendly staff. I would highly recommend this place for lunch on Sundays. Such beautiful views in the back room.
Good vibe, great drinks, good food. I can't wait to visit.
Great food, amazing service, overall perfect location that is Covid cautious.
Very outdated menu, basic, food quality was mediocre minus, not upscale or sophisticated at all,  atmosphere is nice, great view and great service

Our waitress was attentive, efficient and extremely personable.
A most enjoyable lunch. Thank you

My hubby and I visited Seattle on a short weekend trip and some friends recommended we visit the Pink Door. So glad we took their advise! We booked ahead and asked for a quiet romantic table (it was my bday weekend) and they did not disappoint. They sat us at a sweet little table overlooking the water- the view outside was gorgeous and inside the restaurant was warm and charming at the entrance  and filled with character. We passed a cool bar on the way to the other side of the restaurant that was bright and airy, equipped with a fantastic wall of windows along with some whimsical fresco type murals. Our server was lovely and recommended some real winners from the lunch menu, including the ahi tuna app which was tasty and the Pink Door Lasagna - which you must order if you like pesto, and my personal fav the Pappardelle Al Ragu Bolognese which melts in your mouth and is now probably my favorite pasta dish of all time (definitely my favorite Pappardelle ever) and I have been to and eaten in Italy several times. Overall a great experience- the only downside is that I am already craving that pasta and I live in Cali, so I guess we'll be booking another flight soon:)
Lovely setting and attentive staff. Food     was delightful.

This was our first time out in a long time. We are from out of town and were treating our son and some friends. It was amazing! The atmosphere, the service and the food were all first rate. We had so much fun. We will definitely be returning on our next trip to Seattle!
Exceptional food, service and ambience!
Food was a little Meh this time around. There was a dog in the restaurant.. Idk...just not what it was pre-covid.

We’ve been here before. Before quarantine and couldn’t wait to come back. Finally it happened. Blown away by the service. Our server was amazing. He was like a ninja. In and out and whenever we needed something he was there with it. She loves the lasagna and I love the rigatoni and meatballs. The Pink Door is a great restaurant but part of the ambiance is the entertainment which isn’t going on right now. We can’t wait for the entertainment part to come back. And the full menu.

Amazing, delicious and best people on the planet!

I can’t wait for cabaret to swing again. 

Seriously one of Seattle’s gems!!!

Amazing. Will be back.
The service was great and the food even better. Plus great views
I found it a bit expensive. The food was really great , however the quantity was pretty small per plate, and it was expensive as per the quantity they offer.
Great service, beautiful decor, the food was all wonderful - Super Yummy!!
Excellent food and service. Their desert wines are to die for and would highly recommend their pasta dishes!

It was a great lunch!
Our server was Amaya d great with us 
I will totally recommend and cine back ❤️👍🏽
First time returning to indoor dining and the Pink Door was as great as ever.
This was one of the best restaurants I have ever been too! Our waiter Terrance was very knowledgeable and helped us make great suggestions. The bar tending was great as well.
It was a great dining experience. We got our table on time and the service was great.
Food was delicious and the special was great (the tortellini in brodo)! Felt very safe and the restaurant is clearly working to ensure all COVID indoor dining standards are being met.

This has been a favorite for years and I was delighted and impressed how they handle the new covid challenges and still deliver the same, wonderful experience.

It remains my go to place. tom
Beautiful restaurant with delicious food and fantastic service. Highly recommended.
Nice view and good food.     I would go again.....

Great ambience - a bit of kitsch. Nice view of the sound. Food lived up to the hype. The ahi crudo  had the perfect amount of acidity. My daughter enjoyed the winter risotto. The short rib melted in my mouth. The chocolate bomba dessert was melt in your mouth exceptional. Service was excellent. Nearby construction was a bit distracting. Overall a lovely experience.
Very small portion but the food was so good and delicious. Service was medium as we left with no bread or welcoming drink
Went to The Pink Door for my birthday dinner and absolutely loved it! The service was great and the food was to die for...! Would come back again :)
The food and service was amazing. The placement of the restaurant by the water was perfect. The lasagne was the best I've ever had! We will be back again.
great late lunch in a great atmosphere.  Service was excellent and felt safe to be dining indoors based on how they had it set up.  Great food and value
Food was just amazing. Fast and friendly service from the whole team. Can't wait to eat hear again with my girlfriends.
Good People work here. They seem to appreciate their job and take pride in place. We always have a good meal at Pink Door
This place is a total hidden gem. It is a must if you are close to the market area. Food was beyond perfect, so tasty, balanced, gentle and perfectly seasoned. Great ambiance and background music.

They are doing such a great job during Covid
Food , service amazing
Food was great. All the dishes we ordered were flavorful. Will recommend this place.
Incredible service! Top notch! Food was lovely buy portions are small. Order lots!

Everything about this experience was fantastic. The decor/ambiance was romantic and warm. Our server was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Our drinks were excellent, and I can't find words for how fantastic the food was! We had bread and oils, and the best Caesar salads (not a thing I would normally comment on, but the dressing was perfect) for apps. Both ate the Lasagna (on the menu for 39 years) and it was easily the best Lasagna dish I've ever had. We also had the brussel sprouts on the side and again, to die for. Really enjoyed our experience here, and we will make a point to come back on our next trip!
Never disappoints, the lasagne is outstanding and great service

We had a truly wonderful evening at the Pink Door. From our wait staff, the gorgeous decor, the excellent food, we had the best experience.  Celebrating my daughter’s birthday was extra special and we can’t recommend The Pink Door more.

It’s always a lovely experience at the PD. The surroundings, design, ambience and romance combine for a heady atmosphere. The servers were kind and gracious, outlining the covid precautions thoughtfully and explicitly. Food was delicious: I had the special (get it) and my husband had a delicious pasta (the one with guanciale). You MUST have budino for dessert! Nothing like it. Thank god they ran out  of tiramisu or I wouldn’t have discovered it!!
Really good Italian food, great ambiance and excellent views of Seattle! Can’t wait to come back
Great place with awesome food. Looking forward to going back.
Portion size is really good! Great taste and great value!
Must try this place if you're visiting Seattle. The interior design of the restaurant is delightful. Food tastes good, portion is good, and price is reasonable.
Excellent food, safe environment and our server was very attentive. Thank you for consistent excellence Pink Door.

LOVE! The Pink Door, always an exotic treat. service, food, ambiance, all superb. 
Thank you for a beautiful evening!
We were so happy to spend one of the last nights out at The Pink Door. They are so careful about keeping the tables spread out and the service is so great there.
Everything on the menu was amazing. The server was kind and helpful. I think they did a great job following COVID guidelines.
Fut being in the just of a pandemic, everything was delightful.
Food was great, best french fries in Seattle.  Would go back anytime.
AMAZING, must-visit restaurant!
Its was a posh and eloquent experience. We loved it all. What a beautifully excentric place. Food and service were phenomenal!! Bravo everyone!!❤
The food and drinks were terrific. Great staff and very well maintained (in Covid times). Thank you.

I was hesitant about dining at the Pink Door.  It is in the very heart of Seattle's tourist sector. That usually is reason to avoid a restaurant.  Yet, the Pink Door's food, service and ambiance were wonderful, as good as any of the other highly touted Italian restaurants in Seattle. The bottle of Amarone enhanced every bite. The Pink Door is an iconic Seattle restaurant, serving the needs of locals and tourists alike.
Great service, and delicious food

This place was recommended numerous times by friends that living in and visiting Seattle. It absolutely did not disappoint!! Got the linguine alle vongole and the lasagna. Both were great!! I would desire my be back next time in Seattle.
Always reliable and always delicious. Even in a global pandemic, things were handled beautifully.
Food, service and ambiance were all great. We had both pasta and meat dishes and can recommend both.

One of my Top 5 restaurants nationwide 
Great service Great food
We sat along the window so a nice water view as well
They are very careful in this COVID-19 era. Tables spaced and your temperature taken on the way in
Loved this place And their food! My husband took me here for our Anniversary dinner date. Even if it’s the pandemic, the staff took necessary steps to make sure we feel safe. Highly recommend!

My husband and I absolutely loved our experience at pink door! Everything was perfect from the moment we got there. There was a lovely view, the staff was kind and practicing safe precautions, and the food was amazing. I will forever think about that lasagna now. Also, they were so thoughtful in celebrating our anniversary. Would recommend to everyone and hope to get to go back myself!
Been waiting to come here for 5 years. Was worth every minute of that wait Our server, Ashley, was fantastic and the food lived up to everything we had heard about it.
I LOVE The Pink Door! It's my special occasion destination. Everything is always perfect and delicious. I am gluten free and appreciate the options that are consistent and amazing. Highly recommend!

We couldn’t make our reservation because they didn’t even open until 4pm, but OpenTable let us make a lunch reservation for 1:30pm. We tried calling the restaurant before we got there and then when we were standing outside, but no answer. That’s the only reason for this poor review. Don’t make lunch reservations an option when you’re not even going to be open to honor them.

I was fascinated with the delicious food, excellent top service and overall ambiance.
Our server was incredible, she was very friendly and fully knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. I really appreciated they went above and beyond to sit our table of four by the window. It was a special occasion for my cousin visiting Seattle for the first time and on her Birthday and we were very pleased. I will definitely continue to recommend this restaurant. Thank you!
Very limited menu and the staff was bothered by us being there.  Food was just ok nothing special.

Always a wonderful place to eat, great food and Wonderful staff.
 I highly recommend eating here!

The atmosphere is wonderful, food excellent, and with tables of necessity  being spread apart, it was joyfully quiet. Would always be a top choice when looking for a reliably unique and good dining experience in Seattle.
Food was excellent! Service was great. Highly recommend!!
very accommodating, a wonderful experience for my friend’s birthday lunch
The Pink Door: My must “go to” restaurant. Returning AA Flight Attendant enjoy sharing dining experience with colleagues!! Thanks for delicious lunch!!!

Terrence was our server and made us feel welcome from the moment he arrived at our table. We were celebrating our anniversary and he took amazing care of us throughout our visit. All the staff members were very kind and knowledgeable, the food was delicious, and we have nothing but great things to say about The Pink Door.
Wonderful food, wonderful service. A bit hard to locate for non locals but that’s okay!

Celebrated my 25th birthday at the Pink Door, we were seated exactly at the time of our reservation. We were greeted by wonderful staff. From the complimentary bread, to the appetizers, and the main course everything tasted delicious. Had a couple cocktails and it was tasty. I cannot wait to visit after COVID is over because there is usually live music and dancers! Absolutely amazing restaurant!
We had a great dinner. The cheese and salumi plate was my favorite!
LOVE The Pink Door!  Everything was amazing...food, service, views!  Perfect!
Delicious as always. My experience is always amazing at The Pink Door. 😍
Excellent taste, relaxing circuses, good waitstaff, very covid friendly. Door was hard to find but once open, revealed an Alice in Wonderland experience.
The food was great! The server did an outstanding job and made our anniversary feel special :-)
Loved the lasagne. Linguini with clams also excellent. Service was friendly and attentive.
Always an amazing experience coming here for any occasion. The food and service is always on point!
A safe place where they even try harder. Eric was great

The ambiance was very chic and the server was extremely attentive. I'm from Houston, and I'm used to bold and flavorful meals. I was hoping the pasta dish (clams with linguine)I ordered would have been bursting with flavor, but I was slightly let down. It lacked some seasoning,  but I was able to ask the server for lemon and that helped brighten the flavors up. All that said, the dining area was great and we had a wonderful view of Pike Place Market from our table.  A great experience for lunch at the market.
The food was wonderful but it was a bummer not to have the show.  We will for sure be back.

The Pink Door lasagna is the very best thing on the menu. It’s a vegetarian dish but trust me! It’s the very best and I’m a steak loving carnivore. Would definitely recommend this place for any special occasion or just to eat in general. Service is top notch. Just overall a great experience.
We were visiting Seattle for our wedding anniversary and the Pink Door was recommended. The food and staff was excellent and I recommend it for a wonderful date or special event.

We went to the Pink Door for a birthday dinner. My wife and both enjoyed our meals - beef shank and the whole roasted fist (delicious). The service was good - our server was always there when we needed her and willing to answer questions. We thought it very good value and would return.
It was an amazing end to our trip!
My sever Tanya was excellent. Professional with warmth and very informative.

Sunday brunch with friends.  No outside dining which caused some concern at first BUT after being showed our table, we felt very safe dining here. Large open room, tables well spaced apart, masks required when servers are nearby, QR scan menus, windows wide open, and just had some air purifier system put in.  They are taking the safety of their servers and patrons seriously, and we appreciate it!  Love the food, have always loved the food with ample portions.  Server was attentive without being bothersome.  Only complaint was the cocktails.  Didn't like my bloody mary --couldn't detail what was wrong, too much lemon? not enough spice? maybe just blah.  My friends moscow mule was too sweet for her taste.  But not worth complaining about and quickly moved on to a good bottle of wine.  Will continue to come back.
Delicious food and views!
Great food and service.  Be sure to book in advance as restaurant is very popular.  Dining experience felt safe with COVID measures in place.

My experience was awesome, if only I lived in Seattle! This would be an every weekend thing! I loved everything. The ambiance, the food? The service. Me and my friends first time to Seattle and this was our favorite meal! Definitely can’t wait to go back and eat here!
I LOVED this restaurant and wish I could go back. This will be my first stop when I am back in Seattle. The food was amazing and the ambiance and service were out of this world!
Amazing food and so romantic!!!

Waitress was rude and made snarky comments when we asked if the kitchen had some sea salt or kosher salt. I understand and think it’s good for restaurants to not keep such things on the table but she was clearly put out with that request.  She made a comment again when we asked if we could get some fresh pepper for our salad.  On top of that the mussels were off.  Sometimes they can be hit or miss so I’m not slighting them for that.  The risotto is amazing.  Overall my previous experiences have been great. If this was my first experience I would not go back.  Risotto stood out but the service colored the experience unfortunately.

No longer showing burlesque or a show of any kind. The location is cool and has lots of character, decent prices. Not sure the value is worth it though without that extra something. The food left me a little disappointed.

This restaurant is such a chic spot in downtown Seattle. Although the entrance was hard to find in the middle of an alleyway, it is such a treat seeing such an aesthetically pleasing restaurant lies in the heart of this alley. We got seated right by a window with killer views of the sound. The food was alright but the overall dining experience was lovely!
Everything was perfect. Service was excellent and the good was even better. Will be back guaranteed.
This is my favorite place to go in Seattle. Especially for special occasions. It is so wonderful every part of it.
With how much this place is hyped up, the food just did not live up to expectations. Great ambiance and service, but I will not return.
Don’t pick this place for a special ocassion!!!!!!
Great food and entertaining view of Pikes Place Market. The staff was very helpful and the overall experience felt safe during Covid.
I always love The Pink Door. They were very serious about social distancing and mask requirements. So strict it almost made us feel uncomfortable.
We had a great experience. The service and food were amazing. I appreciate the precautions they are taking during the pandemic to keep guests and staff safe. We will be back!

My husband and I were traveling from out of state and everywhere I read said The Pink Door was a must! The food, ambiance and service was fantastic! I loved how the food was all locally sourced. Highly recommend if traveling to Seattle!

Some of the best Italian food I've had! My friends and I went there for lunch and loved it. I got the Autumn Risotto which is amazing. I recommend if you eat here for lunch definitely request a table outside, it's such an amazing view.

You know you’re going to have a bad experience when you can’t even get greeted without approaching the hostess stand to initiate service. From the second we walked in we felt unwelcome, the service was absolutely horrid, from the bartender, to the hostess, to the server. The funny part about that type of arrogance is your food and beverages were terrible; If you were going to be snooty you should at least have the goods to back it up. Being from New York City I’m used to people being snooty, but again when the food and drinks are trash too, what’s the point in you all acting like you’re half worthy of your reputation? 5 people, over $500 and we all left very disappointed. 

It’s unfortunate that your location depicts your volume, Pikes Market is the only reason you’re special. My colleague tried to order a Cosmopolitan, and incase you didn’t know, they’re red. Hers came out yellow with pineapple. I would expect that to be pretty standard, but of course we had to explain ourselves to 5 different staff members to course correct. The attitude on these people was comical. In case you all didn’t know establishments are being forced to close due to Covid here in Seattle, therefore most restaurants staff are going above and beyond to make patrons feel welcome due to lack of business. I can say with 100% confidence your staff doesn’t deserve to have jobs, tips, or stability. I hope to hear you all close soon, cause there’s other places nearby that deserve your business as they focus on their customers. Shame on you.
Amazing food and service!

Amazing food and we had an appetizer, 3 entries and a desert (OMG... pumpkin bread pudding- amazing!).   Service was top notch and they are very conscious of social distances, wearing masks and no extra touch surfaces (bathroom doors propped open).   Was a wonderful evening and meal!

Our 21st Anniversary.  Excellent server: my hubby has two food allergies and one is onions and it is really a challenge to eat in a restaurant, however our server went way out of her way to insure he has a lovely meal  and she did not act out-out by this complication in anyway.   It really made our evening a lovely experience which was so appreciated  especially during this pandemic.   It was our first indoor dining experience and because we were next to open windows in a very conscientious establishment we will return again.   Wonder food start to finish too!
Excellent service and food was impeccable.

Took some time for us to get water, drinks, and bread. Food was prompt. The payment system through your phone wasn't working and our server just left after the check so getting out of there took too long as well.

The prices are what they are, when you know you're going to a bougie place, in part you're paying for the ambience. It's a nice place and popular, but felt more like you can mark it off your list
Food was wonderful, ambiance lovely - service was great - would totally recommend
Food and drinks were delicious. Dessert was even better! Our server, Greta, was so sweet and attentive. Would definitely like to come back soon!
Easy to make online reservations. Eric was our waiter and was awesome. I like that we were required to put our mask on whenever server is at you table. Keep them safe!
Interior is gorgeous. Implemented very safe procedures throughout. Best meatless lasagna!
Customer service was excellent. Food came out fast and hot. It was very pleasant experience. 100% would recommend.
Food is overrated, but we may have not ordered the best choices. I’d go again, and follow recommendations to get the lasagna. Atmosphere is wonderful and worth it!

So lucky to get a reservation. I dream about this Caesar salad and bread. Today I added meatballs, which were rich and the fresh tomato sauce complimented them well. Updated contactless service was appreciated.
Awesome food and drinks !! my boyfriend loved his surprise birthday treat with drink Doddy

Every person who helped us was wonderful and so accomidating. The mushroom risotto was spectacular, however I was not very impressed with the cheese board. A great place to eat with great ambience and view.
Gorgeous place, great service. Every single meal and dessert was superb (tried them all). Just sad trapeze show cancelled for covid but wonderful experience!!

The food is always spectacular at The Pink Door! Even in these challenging times the staff were warm and friendly, and made sure all our needs were taken care of. The lasagna is our favorite item on the menu. We will most definitely be back in the future!
Service and menu are consistently amazing.
Excellent food and service.  View is amazing, best place in Seattle
The food and service were absolutely amazing. We will be dining here again next time we are in town.
First time back since COVID-19 hit.  Same great everything aside from the noise - very  quite due to social distancing.  It's one of our favorite "go to's" when in Seattle!!
Amazing place. The food was delicious, and the staff was incredible in keeping and showing us the measurements to stay safe and healthy during the covid pandemic. Outstanding
Never fails to please. Excellent menu and execution. Customer service outstanding. Thank you very much, Frank Isernio
Food was delicious. Staff was very friendly. Definitely recommend.
I thought their covid 19 guidelines were great. It felt safe

Please keep the outdoor dining going when ever it is nice.
It was a fabulous meal with wonderful friends, and the patio is the best place.
Phyllis

Our waiter was excellent from his personality to his attention to detail. 
I look forward to returning!
Great experience at Pink Door. The food was amazing, our server Ashley K was awesome, we had a great time! Highly recommend!

I love this place no matter what; food was wonderful, house wine was soso (but what do you expect for house wine?), service was competent.  Sorry that the pike place market addition has impeded the view, but that's not their fault.  Of course eveything feels less vibrant these days with the limited number of tables, but till a great place to go, when you can sit outside or in the original inside part.  Less fond of the addition.
Amazing service and food, social distancing and following COVID guidelines very well.

Excellent experience at the pink door. We split a bottle of Megan Anne Pinot Nior and went for some classic menu items, Pink Door Lasagna and Ragu Bolognese. Both food items were exceptional. The wine was some of the best I have ever had and didn't break the bank. Our server was polite and tentative. It's the perfect date spot. I can see why it has been around for 39 years.
The Lasagna is incredible and consistent. If you're on a special date, ask to sit in the back section with a view.
Loved this place! Can’t wait to visit again.

Table was booked for 7.30pm and arrived a few minutes early. Told our table wasn't ready and to wait outside on the alley. Thought 'fair enough' due to covid, however other guests appeared to be allowed to wait inside. Not sure why this distinction?? Waited outside to be called but no-one came for us so went back inside around 7.40pm and shown to a table that had been empty for a while. Service seemed slow as had to wait about 20 mins for our wine, though not sure what the pace is normally like as it was our first time at the restaurant. Waiter was helpful and courteous. Lasagne was very tasty but portion seemed small compared to other establishments. Overall, glad we tried it but won't be rushing back.
Front of house was friendly, however food and atmosphere were disappointing. The dessert was delicious and the wine menu was nice. The appetizers and main courses were poorly executed.
Great place to have our 3rd anniversary dinner. We always enjoy going to The Pink Door.

It was a very nice experience. The only thing that could be better was the hostess.  Not friendly and also didint give us the table outside or at the window as requested, although 
free. Just said she wouldn't. 
But the restaurant is surely very good.
Our dinner was a Birthday  celebration during COVID-19– the staff and facilities did a great job of making us feel safe and comfortable.
Great experience.  Food was amazing.  Service was exceptional.
Amazing food! Don't skip the bread, it is amazing!
Great outdoor patio with amazing food and service!!!
It was great!
Best lasagna, crostini, desert. Very tasty: all healthy and organic. Very sensitive to COVID-19. Fantastic ambience. Just takes too long to reserve dinner table on Friday or Saturday

This is just a great restaurant. they require under covid that you have on your mask whenever your server is at your table so you are to flag them down when you need something which is ok by me. The seafood is super fresh and the view on the deck is lovely. The drinks are creative and of course the salads and appetizers are good too. Love this restaurant whenever i'm in town.
Eric our server was excellent and the food was delicious. Also the Covid protocol was very good and helped us feel safe.
$12 for the hot cocoa x was a bit pricey
In these COVID times, the patio dining is a lovely respite and The Pink Door has always been a favorite.  Thank you!
awesome food, great wine, good ambiance, excellent service.

Wonderful experience starting at check in. Social distancing and all precautions in place. Food was amazing as always. Don't miss the seasonal dessert Pumpkin Bread pudding. Shout out to our server Tanya B, she was perfect. My wife Cindy is a Hospice Nurse and the diversion The Pink Door provides is a welcome relief from the world.
This is one of the best dining experiences in Seattle - has been for years and will continue to be. The food is always stellar and the staff are friendlier than your average Seattle restaurant.
I have been going there forever and it's one of my fav places in Seattle.  Love the staff- the food and the ambiance. My happy place💕💐
Great meal and service, despite the foggy water view. Will definitely return

All in fine. Best patio/outside dining in Seattle - even with Covid. The weak spot was the waiter. Not good. Amateur service and attempting to be overtly condescending. We laughed it off - but will make me think twice about going back any time soon.

Pink Door was an amazing time! My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary and had the garlic bread, bucatini, lasagna, rosé and a cocktail. The garlic bread was so delicate and flaky and you could taste the high quality olive oil on it. The table focaccia was quite possibly the most delicious bread I have ever had. My boyfriend and I were in heaven. Of course the Lasagna was great, i see why it’s a favorite. Greta was our waitress and she was lovely, friendly and attentive. Plus she gave us a free Prosecco toast for our anniversary!! I will be making any excuse to return to the Pink Door.
The Pink Door is always excellent. Consistently terrific food, and wine list. Excellent location with views of Elliott Bay. Good Covid 19 safety practices, too.

Extremely clean very Covid19 safety protocol. Food as always amazing. Was with friend so outdoor seating only but great atmosphere. Patio closed for rest of year (summers only) but if can dine-in do so but tip big because eating out is a privilege these days. They have fantastic To-Go menu but agin tip big.
As always, a great meal at the Pink Door with a pleasant experience on the patio. The lasagna is a favorite, but then so is everything on the menu.
Felt extremely comfortable and safe indoors. Amazing food. Great atmosphere.
These people are like a family to me! Every detail in this restaurant is cared for, and Ashley is one of those servers who puts her soul into her work, like all of the staff do. I <3 The Pink Door
Birthday. DIDNT do anything to help us celebrate the occasion. Overall good dinner
From cocktails, to service to food everything was terrific.

Got the prized open table reservation for this place with grea luck only to be underwhelmed. The decor was circus antique with old opera playing. The service was standoffish. The food as just good not great. Waited for the local described floor show that did not arrive for the early seating. Anti climatic is an understatement.  The best was to describe it was waiting for Santa to come and fell asleep.
Great food with a view
long-time favorite with great views.  felt rushed to leave when we were told that our time was up after 90 minutes.  guess that's dining in the pandemic era.
Magical experience. Amazing food. Excellent all around!
My fiancé has been talking about this place ever since we’ve been dating. So I wanted to surprise her and she loved it. The food was amazing! It was like I was back in Italy!
One of the best restaurants in Seattle. Worth it for out of town visitors. Get the lasagna!!!
Really enjoyable environment, great food, lovely weight stuff. Will definitely come back again.

Place itself is cute but food was mediocre. I ordered the steak and it was cold when it came out and basically comes with a some arugula and a tomato on the side, so not very filling. Drinks were ok tasted a bit too sweet and we’re kind of small. Overall not worth the price point.

Service was terrible. Our friends called to pay for our tab which was never brought to our attention from the staff. Therefore we paid for it and friends were disappointed. We registered a special occasion that wasn’t even remotely acknowledged. Food was good, as always. Overall, we’re very disappointed and might not come back.

To follow up on my post, we just received a call from Pink Door and they’ve graciously made right on our situation. We’re pleased with how they handled this and we will definitely dine again at Pink Door in the future.
Really great “hole in the wall” place! Awesome food at reasonable prices!

Perhaps our expectations were too high, as a friend had recommended this as one of her favorite restaurants in Seattle. Due to COVID, we sat outside on the balcony, which seemed less charming than the restaurant although the views were pretty. Our server was professional but made us feel strangely unwelcome, perhaps because we had children with us? Our son honestly orders as much or more as any adult. The food was more bland than expected, even the famed lasagna.
A great place to have our first restaurant meal since the pandemic struck.
Fantastic food and great service. Fun cocktail list.
We didn’t actually go
Canceled our reservation and didn’t give us a new one.
My mom was visiting
Classics executed perfectly. I always enjoy their pastas!
Menu good, location near market is good, view outstanding, staff good.
Ambiance got a 3 only because of Covid restrictions.
Beautiful spot and food.

Terrence was great! Bolognese was amazing! And definitely get the meatballs!
Our fav restaurant in Seattle!
Food was awesome, very flavorful. would definitely come back
Everything was wonderful!   Terrence is amazing !
Very good food with lots of options.  All seating is outdoors so can be warm on hot evening.
The Lasagna was incredible. Only downsides were the service not being very attentive.

Once you get past their snooty attitude the food is great..by the way guys.. don't advance some pathetic and completely bogus medical reason for the 90 minute seating rule..we all know and respect that you need to make a living..
Very kind beautiful service. Received a free chocolate cake for the occasion as well :)
Our server was phenomenal! Love this place!
Our first dining out experience since February! Thank you Pink Door for being so safe and careful for your guests and staff. We love you!
Everyone was very sweet and helpful. The service was amazing
The food was delicious!  The server was very helpful with recommendation of the menu! Very clean and safe place to dine during COVID times. We will be back for sure

As always the Pink Door never disappoints and we had a wonderful lunch out on the deck while practicing safe distancing. Thank you for doing such a great job of accommodating us through these challenging times and we hope to return again very soon!

Pink Door is one of our favorite places to celebrate, and we are so happy to have it reopened--with the possibility of eating on their patio.
The food is always excellent--no on beats their ragu boulognese

An incredibly  cute outdoor space with a great menu and fun craft cocktails make this my favorite Seattle restaurant. Inside is beautiful, but outdoors was a great option during covid. Delicious and fun!

The Pink Door has always been one of my favorite restaurants. However this dining experience was disappointing. The crab risotto was very fishy and salty and the vegetarian lasagna was “fine”. The house wine should be better with so many choices on the market for decent Italian table wines. Staff was pleasant and efficient and the outdoor ambiance is kind of cute.
Great dinner, wonderful service, amazing setting.  Felt normal.
Fabulous Penn Cove clams with a side order of fries!  Great food and great service!

Disappointing experience.  This was supposed to be my girlfriend's birthday dinner and despite leaving a note to that effect in Open Table, and calling, nothing was done to mark the event.  I appreciate that it's not the easiest situation right now in terms of running a restaurant, but something as simple as ensuring there was a note beside the reservation indicating a special event that night, doesn't seem like too much to ask.
As always, our experience at The Pink Door was superb! We love visiting.
Lovely evening in the outdoor dining area.  Food and service were excellent.  The papardelle is outstanding.
The food was amazing! Loved how there was outdoor seating and they even took us early from our scheduled reservation time. Everyone was super friendly and nice! Will come back for sure :)

My favorite Seattle restaurant- closed inside but open on the deck—COVID put most of downtown Seattle asleep but got a reservation at the Pink and dove into my Branzini style grilled fish with pesto and gigantic white beans- Ooh La La— tasty!
Such a cute outdoor space.  Food was delicious and the wait staff very friendly!
Great food!

Loved the ambiance of The Pink Door! Even though there was only outdoor seating due to Covid, the atmosphere was great. The service was also amazing! We were early for our reservation and were still seated right when we arrived.

The outdoor patio is lovely and I usually have a good experience; however, this time was different. Our server was very aloof. She completely forgot the Parmesan cheese we asked for and charged my friend's card twice. They also ask you to wear your mask during EVERY interaction with staff which is almost impossible and silly. This is the only restaurant I know doing this right now. Not an enjoyable experience.

Date night here was super cute!! The margs are great and we started off with the garlic bread which I would definitely recommend. For food we got the salmon and pasta with meatballs. Both of these items were good but neither of the dishes WOW’d us. We will be back though to try different things... maybe the lasagna next time! :)

Thank you Pink Door for a simply beautiful experience.  The Pink Door is still a jewel in Seattle and it is great to see that it remains the same!  The service was spectacular! The food was otherworldly!

Very poor service, server kept forgetting the requests (e.g. a simple refill of coffee). My daughter was hungry so I asked if we can get bread quickly to start, even that took 20 min with 3 reminders.
We ate outside and felt safe during Covid. Food was great - Caesar is one of my favorites; clams really yummy as well. Can see the water from the outdoor tables.

My friend and I were really excited to visiting Pink Door.
We wanted to try Truffle Pasta and Ink squid, but the server said that's not the season menu. 
Anyway, we tried the other food, and that was good.
We were pretty satisfied with meal, but the point is service was bad.
Pink door is really popular and so many my friends recommend this restaurant, but our table server was really not good.
We felt like we should hurry to choose the menu, and when we asked some questions to her, she always pushed us to make the answer. 
She seemed to be kind, but we could feel actually what she was thinking.
Always excellent food, service, and experience!  Thank you!

This was the first restaurant I've gone to since the pandemic began. Their safety measures made me feel comfortable and the patio would be my first choice for seating anyway. The food and service were impeccable as always. Try the crab risotto or the meatball sandwich!

This was amazing- a must for the summer menu. Had the crab risotto and bruschetta, the simple salad, and the meatball sub. Also the lemon pound cake. Highly highly recommend everything, one of the best meals I’ve had during quarantine!!
Food, service, atmosphere were amazing. Plenty of space between tables for social distancing.
The food was exquisite - delicious and beautifully plated. So grateful to the server who recommended the king salmon and the chocolate hazelnut cake for dessert. AMAZING.
Great COVID spot, outdoors, view.   Service superb.  Food  mixed.  Linguini great, risotto not so
Sitting on the deck feels safe and super fun! This was a perfect date night!
They ask you to put your mask on when the server comes to the table.  That was definitely a bother, but, I love the food.  The patio was lovely.  The mask thing was annoying.
Anniversary

Four of us went to lunch and were seated outside.  We felt safe since everyone was masked and we were socially distanced.  We each had a different item on the menu and all of us thought the food was excellent.

Food is fantastic as always. It was my third time going to the pink door. It was my husband and I's anniversary. I was a little disappointed that they had a limited menu especially since our favorite arrancini wasn't on the limited  menu. Also it was a hassle to have to put our mask on every time the server approached us, which was challenging if we were in the middle of eating or drinking. Otherwise the outside patio was lovely and the food was amazing.
We had our anniversary dinner at The Pink Door. I always wanted to go but pre-COVID had never managed to score a reservation. It was perfect. The food, service and ambiance were delightful!

The food and staff were wonderful. 
They managed to make everything flow seamlessly and smoothly  during these trying Covid times. 
Never felt rushed and the pace between courses was perfect.
Welcome back Jackie and crew! You have always my first choice for a meal so it was like coming home after a difficult trip. Dinner was superb, as always.

We enjoyed a special lunch on the patio - really nice.  We shared a  half-order of antipasti, which was generous and delicious.  Lots of variety.  We had delicate fresh pasta and a perfect piece of king salmon on a wine and caper sauce.  Great service, as usual.

The food and ambiance are always top-notch at The Pink Door. What I was most impressed with was how unbelievably accommodating the entire staff was from the very moment we arrived. Thanks again for being a gem in the heart of Seattle <3

The pasta was bland and disappointing for the price I paid. Staff was friendly and nice though. I had a great first experience 9 years ago and the food was good from what I remembered which is why I came back. After this experience I probably won't return.

I had very disappointed by Pink door.  Their food is not good as much as before nor service. 

See food is not fresh or prepared well. 
We ordered panini and pasta. Panini was excellent but pasta was horrible. Clam was horrible taste and i had to deal with send in it.   
Server didn't check in for food after it served.
One of our favorite restaurants. So glad they’re open again, amazing food for very reasonable prices.

Beautiful setting on the deck overlook Elliott Bay. Stunning. Tables spaced properly, high level of safety measures in place. Food is amazing in its simplicity and awesome flavors. Could not have been a better experience.

My companion and I had two of the long-term recipes of the Pink Door, Squid ink pescatore and spaghetti bolognese. Both were superb is rational luncheon servings that belay the too frequent tendency to serve extra large portions. We split a large antipasto that was varied and tasty. The deck at the Pink Door overlooks Eliot Bay which is a treat even on an occasionally rainy day as we watched the fine Seattle dry-rain play on the edges of West Seattle.

I received a strong recommendation from a friend to dine at this restaurant and I was not disappointed. It's important to plan your time as with restricted dining during COVID-19 restrictions, reservations are required. The veggie lasagna was highly recommended and did not disappoint. And the bruschetta was excellent. I am very pleased I squeezed in this dining experience during my first visit to Seattle.
Awesome experience! Food was excellent, service was great and the patio seating was just what we were hoping for. I would highly recommend this restaurant!
The Pink Door is a "must visit" place in Pike Place Market. Year after year they never disappoint.
Excellent food, outdoor sitting was nice.
Obviously the best in the city! Consistency is unmatched and seasonal menus keep us coming!
We loved our experience!! Beautiful view, impeccable service and outstanding food.
By far, my favorite restaurant in Seattle! This was our first dinner out since March and we enjoyed every minute.  The environment was safe and as always, a delight!
The Pink Door never disappoints! Delicious, fresh, creative food with friendly service.

We went to the Pink Door to celebrate our 20th anniversary. It was really nice out on the patio. The food was amazing. My husband had the grilled whole fish. I had crab risotto. We shared a green salad and tiramisu. It was all so fresh and perfectly seasoned so the flavors of the food came through. We really enjoyed our meal! Service was very good. Our waiter was careful to assist us with my husband’s onion allergy. Thanks Pink Door!
One of our favorite places in Seattle and we were so happy when they finally opened back up. Best crab caesar salads we’ve ever had!
Great place to eat!
Very good service and food quality!  Love it there
Was so happy to be at the Pink Door! Was a fabulous evening!
Pink is agood place for NIce Italian food. we enjoyed our time over there. would recommend to anyone!

My favorite restaurant!

Highly recommend. 

Beat outdoor seating

During this Pandemic, the Pink Door is offering outdoor seating only.  Nothing is diminished by this necessary action!  The wait staff is incredibly attentive and asks only that masks be worn when they are at the table.  The food was delicious, the drinks were refreshing and the service was outstanding.  Our small group of friends, so grateful to be together in person, thoroughly enjoyed our lunch at the Pink Door and look forward to our next visit.

Fabulous, just fabulous!   There are few things in life that are constant reminders of how special living in Seattle can be, even during a pandemic, but the Pink Door is one of those for me. It’s an experience that includes great views, great food, amazing service and a thoughtful support staff that doesn’t miss a thing.  The Pink Door never disappoints.
Wonderful food and atmosphere. Great spacing between patio tables and service felt friendly and safe! Perfect!
Always good - food quality, service and ambience- what you expect when going to the Pink Door.  Happy that you are open.
Glad we gave it a go given the current COVID situation. We had an excellent time and the food was wonderful, as always!
So happy to have enjoyed such a lovely lunch with friends on the best patio in Seattle on a gorgeous summer day!  The food and service were amazing, as always, THANK YOU!!!
Our server was personable, efficient and very mindful of safety for himself and his guests. Thank him for us😁

During Covid-19, dining here was a treat, even if it isn't quite the same as the normal pink door experience. We were seated at a little table in the front corner past the covered patio area with an umbrella over us. It was good from the sense of social distancing since we were our own island, but it was a small spot so we found creative places to put our coats/purse. There also wasn't light above this table, but when asked we were provided several candles to help and it wasn't an issue. The food itself was mostly great. We started with the clams in herbed butter, then the little gem salad which had a delicious avocado dressing. We then shared the whole branzino fish, which was cooked just right though we weren't big fans of the accompanying beans and Verde sauce. We finished with their dense chocolate cake served cold (similar to an indulgent brownie), and we both agreed it would have been more enjoyable served warm, or a la mode. We did try items from their cocktail and wine menu which were good, but didn't have us commenting just how good like drinks we've had this week at other locations. Our waiter was polite, attentive, and helpful. I think that sitting in the corner table we had was an experience, but I might go for one with a little more room next time. I hope to be back again when things are more normal, and hopefully get that 5 star experience I know the Pink Door can provide.

Great food and atmosphere.
Good selection of wine.
Nice ambiance...
It was great to have wonderful food in safe and lovely surroundings. It felt t safe with everyone masked and distant in the outside air
It was a perfect setting and delicious meal to celebrate a special birthday dinner.
Patio was lovely, great safe guards for Covid.
The outdoor tables and chairs can be of superior quality. It was uncomfortable
Everything was amazing! We enjoyed the meatballs, cheese and salami, and lasagna and all of it was perfect! Service was prompt, personable and very covid-19 safety forward.

Excellent precautions for COVID 19, felt very safe. Caesar salad delicious, fennel seasoned croutons were a taste treat. Summer risotto very tasty and not to rich(a positive for me). My husband had the pasta bolognese, it was delicious.
Wait staff friendly but cautious.

My boyfriend and I had been wanting to visit The Pink Door for years and we just never got around to it. We decided to check out reservations two nights before and came for lunch! I’m so glad we were able to come in so soon! I had the lasagna and it was the BEST lasagna I’ve had in a really long time. Drinks were great, and the view from the patio was lovely! I love that the patio is sort of rustic and the inside is very nice and looks beautiful. I would definitely recommend friends and family and will definitely be coming back for more lasagna!
Delicious meal with adequate safety measures in place during this pandemic.

Glad to see the Pink Door open again. Missed the place.  Food was fantastic and outdoor sitting was greet. They are doing a great job keeping it safe and the rules did not get in the way of really enjoying the night. Thanks for the staff for the great night.
Great night
Amazing food and service. Definitely recommend for anyone in the area if you can get a reservation.
Fabulous as it always has been!  Bring your masks and stay safe.
We had a delicious lunch on the deck with perfectly attentive service.  We felt comfortable and look forward to dining again.

Our server was phenomenal. Top notch! 
The food was delicious as always. 
I’m amazed at how well they are handling social distancing.  
One of my favorite places to dine
Our favorite restaurant!  Service was great and they took all proper social distancing precautions.  Wonderful.
This was our 2 year anniversary. We had sweet waitress and hosts. And their ‘Black Lives Matter’ Drink was amaaaazing!

We love The Pink Door and appreciate all the work your staff is doing under very unusual times! I found the menu a tad limited this time; I'm not sure if it's me or if you've made substantial reductions in the choices. Would love to see you again -- and we're a purchaser of a gift certificate to help carry over during these tough times. Good luck and thank you!
It was a great place for a date! We went for lunch and it was a beautiful view over the water!
Great ambiance. Great food. Great service. Beautiful view.
The Pink Door Patio is the place to be this summer!  Socially distant tables, beautiful view and wonderful cuisine.  Open for Sunday brunch too!  See you again soon, PD!
This place is incredible! The food is incredible, and so are the drinks!

We had a wonderful time celebrating our 50th anniversary. The  Manager made sure all the staff knew it was our 50th and they all congraulated us. The food was excellent, the atmosphere was perfect, and the staff did everything they could to keep us safe.
Superb. The food was seasoned just right. Presentation is as good
Great! Loved it. Always. Great menu. Great food. Service was very good.
Food was very tasty, the lasagna extraordinary tiramisu spectacular
Had lunch there for the first time, and it's simply delectable. Outdoor seating only becausa of the pandemic, but with the sea breeze blowing do you really want to sit inside?
The food and service was great. The lasagna was amazing!
I appreciated the extra notes about diners wearing a mask when the server comes to the table

Life’s always better at the Pink Door. 
The food was amazing as always, staff was on point as expected.
I love the pink door! Food is amazing atmosphere is amazing and I’m so happy they’ve opened up the patio!
The Pink Door is a go-to for me for a treat, and especially eating outside.  It was a lovely night this week and we enjoyed ourselves so much.

This place is absolutely MAGICAL! We reserved a table on the patio for our 7 year wedding anniversary and everything exceeded expectations. We had the meatballs, caprese salad, lasagna and pappardelle. All were superb. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. Wine selection was great (we went with a local bottle, red blend). I recommend Pink Door to anyone local or traveling to the Seattle area. I cannot say enough good things about our experience.
Excellent food and superb service! Thank you, Terrance, for making this an outstanding evening. We felt entirely safe with the distancing of the tables.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle.

I am so grateful that the pink door is once again serving on the outdoor patio. They are extremely responsible to keep guests and staff safe in this pandemic. It was truly precious to be able to share a meal with a friend in my favorite restaurant and know that I was not putting myself at risk.
The bruschetta was delicious as usual with summertime heirloom tomatoes and I love their artesian bread. I had pasta with mamas meatballs and my friend enjoyed the vegetarian lasagna. It was a celebratory meal for us to be able to be back at the pink door!

I absolutely love the deck at the Pink Door.  It reeks of the Market, summer and the best of life in Seattle.  Weather was great - feared sun, but was not an issue.  Spacing of tables and leisurely dinner was great for catching up with friends. No rushing.  Flank steak was our favorite of the entrees, but everything was good, and had a great bottle of Janiuk red which was on the by the glass menu, but were able to get a bottle.  My son loved the cocktails, and we all liked the cheesecake.  And man but its nice to eat out again!!

We dined outside on the deck and it was very pleasant. We had the whole fish and some fries. The portion sizes were very generous. The  food was delicious. The COVID19 safety procedures where good and we felt safe and taken care of. Also they were very accommodating of my celiac disease.

Where to begin?

The Pink Door is unparalleled under normal circumstances. Excellent food, friendly and overly-accommodating staff, and an amazing atmosphere.

In a COVID-19 world, the Pink Door has not only risen to the occasion, it has surpassed all expectations. When it comes to mandated health rules and restrictions, the Pink Door excels. For those of us who are not entirely comfortable with the government level of safety, the Pink Door goes above and beyond.

The host (whose mask was gorgeous) took great care to maintain 6 feet of distance at all times between customers, hosts, and other staff. Our server (Eiric) took the time to explain that, for everyone’s health and safety, customers should wear masks whenever the servers  approached the table. The servers and staff did an excellent job of not approaching without plenty of warning or waiting until signaled.  They provide an easy-to-use touchless pay option as the cherry on top.

If you haven’t already experienced the food, the Pink Door is easily one of the top restaurants in Seattle. COVID-19 has not diminished their excellence on any level.


If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.
The Pink Door is doing and amazing job with their Covid procedures. It felt very safe and conscientious, without cutting corners on amazing food and service.
Súper friendly and the service amazing. Attention to detail. And the food OMG.  I am super happy you’re open.

Pink Door is a Seattle classic -- deck overlooking Puget Sound with delicious old world Italian food. So looking forward to when the 'entertainment' can return, but for now it's a wonderful place to have a quiet, delectable lunch or dinner with family and friends.

The Pink Door was absolutely amazing and although we were disappointed that the shows could not be implemented due to the COVID-19 pandemic my wife and I understood that the health and saftey of the staff and performers comes first.  The terrace was stunning and the staff were all friendly and attentive.  The food was delicious and I was so confident that I would enjoy anything that I asked the waitress to choose my dinner for me.  I ended up with the Lasagna which was a uniquely delightful experience with the pesto sauce and spinich pasta.  I would definitely recommend that anyone in the area visits the Pink Door.  Pro Tip: Don't look for signage as the Pink Door has none that I noticed however it is tucked away in the alley right across from  the Irish Pub, just look for the PINK DOOR! :)
It was a fabulous evening, very safe, very clean and felt comfortable with all the various precautions in place! BRAVO
Rigatoni and Meatballs were absolutely delicious! Service was great making this a very nice evening out.
Awesome food, awesome view, awesome staff.  It is a Seattle icon.
Top notch atmosphere and service. Staff was incredibly friendly and tactfully navigated the challenges and limitations of restaurant service during a pandemic.
Great job Pink Door creating a safe atmosphere under challenging circumstances. Wish you success & the best.

If you haven't been to the Pink Door, you need to go!  I have been there several times and find the food exceptional every time.  As of right now, seating is limited to outside, so be sure to bring some sunglasses.

This time we went for lunch.  We shared a cheese plate, salad and some pasta.  While the cheese plate and pasta were excellent, the Caesar Salad with crab on top was worth fighting over.  I never thought of putting those together, but I'm sure glad they did!

Stop reading and make a reservation!
Exceptional service and delicious food!
So happy to be back. So was lovely. Can't wait to go back.
We had a lovely meal of the summer risotto and linguine al Vongole. We felt safe on the patio yet retained a sense of a special occasion.  So glad the Pink Door is open again.
My go to for special occasions, and they never disappoint!

We were afraid we wouldn’t be able to have our annual birthday tradition at the Pink Door then they opened the patio that same week. Food and service were wonderful as always. They did an excellent job of making it feel safe in this weird COVID world.
Simply the best.

The Pink Door is as much Seattle as the Market.  I've been going for 37 years and it just gets better every time,  always leaving the Pink Door with a smile on my face, and a feeling that something special has just happened.  The food, the ambience, the fun service, amazing deck,  and fabulous  Kamakazi, makes the Door, a special treat to be enjoyed.
As wonderful as always and so glad they are open again. I'll be back very soon.

We had a fantastic time at The Pink Door. Location, food and service were all outstanding. Even though we didn’t really have room for dessert, we all indulged and it was wonderful. Appreciated the service working around COVID-19 restrictions.

Absolutely wonderful! It was our first restaurant dining experience since early March. We were thrilled to be able to be outdoors on the beautiful deck of The Pink Door. The service, cocktails and food were brilliant. Really appreciate the safety protocols in place.  We had a lovely afternoon, and one of many highlights of our meal was the amazing bourbon, cardamaro, cardamom, orange zested iced coffee cocktail… I even had a second one for my dessert. OMG...so Yum!!  Thank you to all at The Pink Door :-))
It's all about the lasagna.  Seriously.  It is the reason we dine here.
The food was amazing, the service was also outstanding. Very impressed and we will be back when you’re open again.

We did not get to experience this supposed hip spot in Seattle as the restaurant was somewhat empty. No Ariel show. The waiter was in a seemingly bad mood. Never asked about the food. When I asked my family if I was getting birthday dessert within his hearing, he informed me it wasn’t free but I could have one!! Free was not my intention! It was rude.

The food was incredible. The venue was amazing! The view from the window seats is stunning! The staff was kind, helpful and quick. If you want to spoil yourself just a little I can not recommend the Pink Door more.
Fun evening with great waiter and delicious food

Whenever I have friends from out of town, I always like to bring them to Pink Door...if you can get in of course! Quality food in a great space. If your schedule allows, be sure to dine there during one of their music/dance shows. One of my favorite spots in the city for sure.
Delicious food, with great ambience accentuated by the live music. Good wine list also (as expected at an Italian joint)

It was absolutely amazing !!!
The Lasagna was to die for

Great Ariel acrobatic show above you while dinning. Waiter had great hospitality and suggestions with food to chose from as well as pairing with wine. The restaurant had a great theme. The wine and food choice by the help of the waiter was excellent.
Food and service needs to be improved to be on a par with the ambiance.
Bigger then we thought it would be great environment. Not too loud but you could be social and not disturb your neighbors. It’s beautiful and perfect for a nice night out.

This restaurant was over hyped, and underwhelming.  Our hostess seemed annoyed by our presence, and our server was non-attentive.  
The Prosecco was good, but the entrees were bland and under-seasoned. Highlight of the meal was the arancini appetizer. 
We didn’t stay for dessert, as nothing on the menu seemed appealing.  We ended with a limoncello, paid our check, then left. 
There are so many great restaurant options in Seattle, and I will not return or recommend based on my disappointing experience.
Great service, amazing view.  Mediocre food.
As always, great service, lovely ambience, and superb food.  I am always feeling as if I had a special experience after my meal at the Pink Door!
It was great!

The lasagna melted in our mouths. The rabbit was spectacular. The Dungeness Crab Caesar has a nice portion and good flavor.  Service was excellent. And the environment from the style to the view was wonderful. It’s no wonder it’s always busy. Thank you for a nice night out.

We dined at The Pink Door in celebration of my daughter's 30th birthday.  Everything about the experience was perfect.  The food was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful. She had a tarot card reading with Eugenia before dinner and really enjoyed it.  As we were leaving the live music started.  Only wish we could have stayed a little longer but by then the place was packed.  I would definitley recommend The Pink Door.
A favorite place!  Love the view from the dining room and eating on the deck in good weather is amazing.  The view and the food and the service. ..... our family favorite😊

There is a reason why the Pink Door has become a mainstay restaurant in Seattle. Since 1981 it has been serving delicious, fresh food in a space that is ambiance rich. It is so comfortable, almost like being in a good friend's home for a special dinner.  Eerick, our server was so professional in giving us outstanding service without being intrusive. You cannot go wrong with any menu choice. I had the Crab stuffed Petrale Sole with Lemon Piccata sauce, it was divine.

Everything was incredible. The staff was so attentive and friendly. The ambience was a perfect setting for a wonderful dinner. Our meals were absolutely off the charts delicious, seriously one of the best meals of my life! I can’t wait to go back!
The staff was very helpful. The food was excellent and the experience was very positive. Particularly enjoyed the aerialist which was a unique touch.
We had awesome seats in the bar yo watch the acrobat act.  Food and dessert was exceptional.

It was a nice experience and a good meal. The"pink door, " was a little hard to find, because it's very discreet, and of the alley not the main road. The view was great. Our reservation was for 10:30pm, but I thought that I had made it for 5:30pm,so we milled around the alley for a while before dinner.  There were several nice little bars in there as well to pass the time . So it wasn't like we were just standing in an alley for 5 hours.  We also visited Kelles Irish Brewery and The Whiskey Bar while waiting.
Started with the Caesar salad; followed by butternut squash risotto and ending with scallops.  Plenty of food to share and loved the view of the sunset and Ferris wheel.  Great service!
Did not disappoint. I have not been there for more than twenty years and now I wonder why.

We sat at the bar. The place itself is beautiful with nice, soft lighting, and the noise level was not too much, even with the band playing. The hostesses were OK. The bartender who was our server, not so great. She made minimal eye contact with us the whole time and gave a perfunctory smile when she handed us the bill. No, "how's your food?" "how's your evening been?" or anything.  Maybe she was just tired, but come on, when you're a bar tender in a sought-after place like this, you gotta just fake it (convincingly!) until your shift is over. That's your job. Paying that expensive bill after being snubbed was not a nice experience. I would try the place again because having a different server would have made a difference. If I were the owner of the restaurant and this bartender were my employee, I'd tell her to snap out of it, or else!

Good food but terrible service. Our server seemed to disappear and we waited for 30+ min before we could ask for our check. We wanted to order dessert and more wine but no one ever stopped by to check in on us. Cute place but not worth it for bad service.
The Pink Door is the best!  Consistently great food, service, and ambiance.
Small, intimate, amazing food. Would recommend for any special occasion.
Awesome! Great food, service, and view. Request a window seat!
Beautiful decor, gold booths, view, food, wine, Sophisticated Lady cocktail, server. I can’t wait to go back.

Beautiful place with great vibes! We are in Seattle for our honeymoon and wanted a nice place to dine! Not disappointed in anything! Most delicious food, and we tried oysters for the first time! Our waiter was SO nice and it was a very special experience overall!
Great service. Delicious food. Not rushed. Knowledge waiter
Excellent restaurant with good atmosphere and good view of market area and the waterfront.

Having friends in from Chicago, we booked the Pink Door for our good-bye and a birthday lunch. This is one of our go-to restaurants for visiting guests. It did not disappoint ! We ordered lots of appetizers: the special crab cake with tarragon sauce, rice balls, small antipasto and, of course, their grilled bread. So Good !!! Good portions too. My wife and I had the fish special, true cod wrapped in prosciutto ( what a combination ), our friends had the crabmeat salad and a huge meatball sandwich. No way that we could do dessert. Service, with Elise, was spot on. All in all a great success ! We will be going back. Soon !!!

Once we found the extremely nondescript entrance off of Post Alley, it was amazing from that point on.  The atmosphere is a funky, nostalgic, chic vibe.  Walking to the back of the restaurant it gets even better once you see the view of Puget Sound.  Our waiter was also wonderful, and even informed us of the next performance so that we could grab our drinks and go watch.  

Then there's the food.  Awesome.  If you want the best salad, split the Caesar Salad.  We had ours topped with crab meat (vs chicken or shrimp).  One of the best Caesar salads that I've ever had.  But it's not small, so either get it as an entree or split it with someone.  Also the lamb ossobuco was heavenly and the oxtail filled ravioli was superb.  Overall it was great and we will definitely be back to enjoy another great evening of delicious food, ambiance, and the view!
Our experience was exceptional.
Amazing view, very calm & relaxing inside, good service and very understanding when we were running late to our reservation ! (:

Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants when visiting Seattle. 
Amazing food and service. ANDREW is the best.
Food was amazing. We had appetizer 2 drinks each and our entree for 150.00. We also got to see the aerialist perform during our visit. We really enjoyed our visit. Definitely going back again.

The Pink Door was recommended to us and it did not disappoint! We made reservations (which was helpful) and were sat in a great spot to enjoy the Ariel show. We loved the cheese food and would highly recommend any one of their pasta dishes. We look forward to going next time we are in Seattle!
This place lived up to the expectations and reviews. I enjoyed the atmosphere, the view, and the food. Would go back again next time I’m in Seattle.
