Everything about the place was wonderful. The food was great, ambiance, entertainment. It’s just that you have to be ready to pay for the experience. Definitely a special occasion kind of thing. — probably not a weekly date night kind of thing.

Always an amazing dining experience at The Pink Door.  I'm not from Seattle but every time I go to Seattle I make sure to eat here.  The food is always on point.  They have a great selection of wines and the atmosphere is amazing.
The food was fantastic and our waiter Thomas was the best, very attentive and made our experience a lot of fun.  We will definitely go back.
We celebrated my friend’s engagement over brunch and everything, from the ambiance, lighting, service, food, was sensational!
Absolutely wonderful!
Our experience was a memorable one. Plenty of delicious vegetarian options.
This is the most classy and beautiful date night destination for dinner it is ridiculous. I would recommend to anyone whom wants a night on the town but especially couples!
Tremendous service, exceptional food and amazing views.
Ambiance and service was amazing! Food wasn’t as fabulous as I wanted it to be but still good. The cheesecake was delicious!
Amazing food and service!!

We had a great meal, a great evening, are looking forward to going back.
My only complaint is with mediocre service:
I was made to feel high maintenance for asking if I had to filet my own fish.  For these prices, someone should have offered.
Also our wine glasses were removed before our main course arrived, without a word, and without asking us if we wanted another glass.  That was particularly surprising.
The staff is all young, and may need a little more training.

5 stars for the food/service/ambiance. I've dined here on several occasions and every experience has been wonderful. My favorite dishes are the cioppino, lasagne, and chicken Marsala. The wine list as beautiful so many options and curated list of great wines abroad and locally. I brought in my own bottle of wine and our server welcomed it and decanted it. Then today, I dined here for lunch, my husband and I ordered a carafe of the house red and it was great too! Service is professional, attentive, and they take pride in their work and the food as if you were dining in their house...Great hospitality!! The restaurant is stunning and the views are amazing. Pink Door is one of my favorites!

Took a business colleague from out of town and he absolutely loved it!  Sent pictures to a friend of his and enjoyed the mussels thoroughly.  The lasagna is always wonderful as well.  This is one of my favorite iconic Seattle restaurants and I love sharing it with friends.
Great food and service! One of my favorites in Seattle. Hard to get reservations so definitely need to plan ahead!
A very good date night. Great food and wine selection and very attentive service. The trapeze show was extremely fun to watch!
Amazing View and delicious, fresh food that delivers every single time!

However nice the ambiance is and the food is, our waitress, Lola, made our evening. She was magical, showing up whenever we needed her and somehow appearing time after time without any of the abruptness of most servers. I've never had a better server and I'm 65 years old. The food was good, but I wouldn't say spectacular. I had the Osso Buco with polenta. It was cooked nicely, but lacked any lamb flavor. The sauce had a sweetness to it, that was okay, I just don't prefer it that way. My son had an excellent spinach lasagna. My husband had the pasta with meatballs and sausage, again good, not great. We all shared the Charcuterie tray, good, but I thought the pate was lacking flavor. Can't beat the view and the service.
Amazing ambience, food and team. We will definitely return.
Always excellent... while rockfish was delicious... ambiance is beautiful.
Loved everything about Pink Door
It was delicious and awesome. Everything about it made us happy.
Loved, loved this restaurant. Entertainment was amazing, meals were outstanding as well as reasonable, service was excellent. Would come back to Seattle just to eat at Pink Door.
Outstanding server who was engaging and delightful. Fantastic food.

The food was lackluster..  I had high expectations considering the amount of effort it takes to get a table here... sadly, it's the worst of the pricey italian restaurants Seattle has to offer. 

We tried their crispy duck leg, which was soggy. The flavor was nothing special. Not bland, but nothing great.. as we tried two other entries, the paparedelle,  and the lamb. The lamb was unseasoned, completely raw . We ordered it medium rare as per recommendation.  It was borderline inedible.  The pasta pappardelle,  was bland.
We also ordered some specialty fries , which sadly were the best item we tried.
The service was good, but painfully slow. We arrived at 7, seated around 7:05, yet didn't recieve any food til nearly 830..

Here’s another must try if you’re in the area. There’s no name outside, just a Pink Door in a small alley. The entrance is on street level but once you walk in, you go down a few steps to the main level of the restaurant. Great service and excellent food. We had the Salume/cheese board for starter. I had the squid ink pasta and my boyfriend went for the Linguine de Vongole. Both were very good.
James G was awesome! Food was spectacular per usual. Always have to come here for dinner when visiting.
They charged us $30 for an uncorking fee and my ribeye had so much fat on it, it was nearly inedible.

I wanted to love this place, however, I walked away feeling very disappointed that I had been so passionate about visiting this restaurant while I was on vacation in Seattle. 

My partner and I went to eat here on Valentine’s Day. It was bustling and loud to the point of being unable to hear one another from across the table, which was expected, but we weren’t expecting to have such an awkward waitress and mediocre food for the price point. The speciality cocktails were also nothing to write home about either. I have very little positives to say about our visit other than the ambiance was as wonderful as I was hoping it would be and one of the hostesses was very pleasant as she checked us in. 

I doubt I’ll go out of my way to secure a reservation here again as it’s all hype with no follow through.

Went on Valentine's Day. First visit. Atmosphere was way too strange for me. Many clowns and jesters in the waiting area. The dining area was already. Nice view of the Sound. Food was... definitely for people with eclectic and adventurous palettes. My steak was very juicy but, not worth $65. The only bright spot was the server who was very attentive and helpful yet didn't hover.
This fun to find restaurant has a great ambiance that captivates you as soon as you walk in. The servers were outstanding and the wine list was worth the visit alone.
Best Valentines lunch ever.  Start to finish it was perfection.
Beautiful view and delicious food, super great service
Seriously everything was perfect. I cannot find a fault!
A really great value for the quality of food and atmosphere, especially for Valentines Day!
Everything was perfect and delicious!

The Pink Door is absolutely a very romantic restaurant in my opinion. It has that old saloon feel with some cabaret jazz live music. Food is absolute delicious along with the service! Can’t go wrong for lunch or dinner for any occasions.
Great view.  Prices and portions are very reasonable

My wife and I went there on a Tuesday afternoon, and we didn’t know what to expect. We were very happy with the entire experience. The staff that greeted us were very friendly, the waitress was very friendly, and the food was excellent. If you like Italian food, you will love The Pink Door. We have had Italian food all over the country, and this was one of the very best.
Anything on the menu is okay. Not particularly outstanding, but nothing to criticize on. The server we had was terrible. All the other staffs were fantastic.
Visiting the area for a short vacation. Got to enjoy the fabulous trapeze show on a bustling Monday night. Good was excellent

Service was great! We had three kids with us five and under. They accommodated us no prob. We even asked for plain pasta and butter for the kids thats not on the menu and they didnt make a big fuss about it. We went there on a Monday night and we had this fantastic aerial show. Definitely a must when going to Seattle!
We caught the aerial show and everyone was delighted! Always a treat to be at the Pink Door!

The. Best. Ever. 
You should go.
This place was so unique. We caught the trapeze act and then we had the most lovely dinner.  My scallops melted in my mouth my husbands steak was prepared perfectly. We can't wait to go back ♡
Highly outstanding except that staff too often asked me finished, it bothered conversation and mood a little.

Once again, we had a wonderful dinner at The Pink Door. We had to wait briefly for our table, but we lucked out and found space at the bar to sit and have a drink. The bartenders were attentive and friendly. When we were escorted to our table, the hostess even carried our drinks on a tray and made sure the bar bill seamlessly transferred to our server, which was a nice touch. Our table was nice and the candles helped set the mood for the room. Our server was quite knowledgeable of the menu, and was patient with our questions, as well as our decision to eat at a bit more leisurely pace this evening. To top it off, he treated us to some Prosecco so we could toast the occasion. That was a lovely touch, too. Our food was good, but it was the service that made our anniversary dinner so enjoyable. Thank you to you and your staff for a great date and yummy food!
Quite simply, the best Italian food I have ever tasted.
We love the Pink Door!!!We come about once a month.The food and service has always been exceptional
we really enjoyed our lunch at the pink door.  The ambience is really good.
The best service and food.  Enjoy, be aware make reservations months in advance.  We love this restaurant.

Best dining experience in Seattle! We knew to make reservations well ahead of time and sat down right before sunset. We ordered the best food of our lives - the lasagna is splendid and the chocolate cheesecake was spectacular.
So happy the venerable Pink Door continues to deliver outstanding food and service!
The food was phenomenal. The decor was fun and charming. I’ll be eating here every time I visit Seattle.
Excellent service and food. Was disappointed that they didn’t offer a free dessert for my friend who was celebrating his birthday.
Such friendly staff, great service and best food

The food and ambiance were fabulous! We had a couple of annoyances though that made for a less than enjoyable experience. The bottle of Prosecco we ordered had different prices on their food versus drink menu. The waiter apologized and said we’d have to pay the higher price and that the lower priced menu hadn’t been updated. Then, we ordered one of the specials, which was described as having 6 ounces of fish. The waiter let us know that they’d run out of the fish but could substitute scallops with the same sides for $4 more. We said okay and ordered it. Upon being served, we were disappointed that the meal only had 3 scallops! No where near the 6 ounces of the original fish offered. While I understand that fish varies by price, if the restaurant runs out and offers a substitute the substitute should be comparable in size and at the same price. That they raised the price and served less food left us with a negative attitude toward the restaurant and the way they handled it. Perhaps because both the beverage and food had issues, we were more affected. Not a great first time experience.
Great experience and food, excelente music and service
Amazing restaurant. Fun decor and ambiance, and wonderful food. One of my favorite restaurants ever. Service can be improved, but overall really yummy!
A must see! Music, great drinks and amazing food! If you find yourself without a reservation go to the bar and make a friend. It’s a relaxed space. You will love it!
Great food and ambiance! Get the rosemary gimlet with tanqueray gin instead of vodka 10/10
Caesar salad with crab was excellent! Lasagna is a must have!  Garlic bread was amazing. No flour chocolate cake is a great to go dessert!

First of all I had no idea there was a whole other side of the restaurant! I have only sat in the front by the stairs, and to be honest I never want to again because that back dining area is just so lovely and the view top notch. Our food was amazing but above all else...Thomas. Oh Thomas, what grand service and exquisite table side manner. Cannot wait to return.

I always visit the Pink Door when I make it to Seattle. The quality of the food, drinks, and service are fantastic. The lasagna and seasonal mocktail are always a pleasure, but don't pass up the spaghetti nero alla pescatora if it's on the menu!

Delicious food and wonderful ambience in a romantic and whimsical setting. We enjoyed a cocktail at the bar while we watched a breathtaking aerial performance. Dinner at a table along the windows gave us a lovely view of the water. Amazing all around experience!
Great experience and outstanding food. Nice view of the sound. Waiter was knowledgeable and on point. Answered all questions.
Had a great time at the Pink Door for my girlfriends birthday. Awesome food and atmosphere.
This was amazing! A must have Seattle experience.

This was a beautiful restaurant with much ambiance and view. The food was very good and cocktails 👌! Our server was ok, I think he was kind of lackluster yet I'd come again when I return to visit Seattle.
What a gem. Wonderful seafood and pasta. Would love to go back!
Love the atmosphere here! Wonderful staff and food is delicious.

Great room, food was delicious, service was not great, but above average, The pasta was cooked perfectly and sauce was tasty we had some oysters as well as some mussels and they were very fresh. Overall a great experience

Visited Seattle and went to The Pink Door for my birthday lunch. The food was excellent! The lasagna, their signature dish, was some of the best I’ve tasted - creamy ricotta cheese, thin spinach lasagna, and not heavy. The raw vegetables with olive oil and anchovy dipping sauce was delicious! And the risotto was tops too! Loved the decor and view. Sad we didn’t get to see the aerial performers, but the restaurant was the best one we went to on our trip!
Great ambiance and food. Good place for a date or get-together with family and friends.
Loved everything about this restaurant. Highly recommended
Great food and ambience. Would love to come again.
Delicious selections of our favorites - a wonderful anniversary dinner.

We had a party of six and had a wonderful evening. We were seated right by the window in that large room overlooking the waterfront and our only criticism was that the sound level in that room from customers was high (and couldn’t be avoided). We didn’t need the additional sound of the singer from the bar area in addition; I would turn the speakers with his audio off.
Just excellent all around....food was special! Get a table next the window overlooking the water.  You won’t be diappointed
This was our first time there. The ambiance was quite nice. A big group was dining next to us so it was kind of noisy. It would have been nice to have more quiet atmosphere.

Such a cute, must stop Seattle restaurant. Food was great. Our waiter was even better! The waiters make the experience. He was calm and not pushy. He recommended exactly what we needed. Just great! Didn't make it to the show, but it was still nice. At least we had a great view, even at night!
Fast service and delicious drinks and food made for a memorable birthday celebration. We will definitely return!
AMAZING, gonna recommend this place to anyone that I know that is traveling to Seattle

Service was great, drinks were great, but the food was a bit limited for vegetarians and the chef of the night was to proud to modify anything. The drinks and and service still made it 4 stars despite a disappointing risotto.

What a place! Such a cool experience and a Seattle landmark.
Loved the vibe. The gorgeous views, swanky live jazz and amazing food made it such a wonderful meal to remember.
Always great food.
Fabulous food. Great ambiance. Great service.
Great place to celebrate a birthday!
Well. A perfect date night.
Anniversary
Little noisy and the food wasn’t outrageously good. Like the ambiance which was the main positive for us.
We had a wonderful experience and our waitress was amazing!
One of our favorites. Great food, great service.

Spectucular restaurant to celebrate my birthday and a girls trip. Will highly recommend it to others. The back room is beautiful especially with the gorgeous views. The ambiance was great. We enjoyed the musical performance during dinner.
Would I recommend Pink Door to a friend? Yes, absolutely, & I have many times! This is an amazing work of art, with an outstanding menu & stellar service. You cannot go wrong!

Best kept secret- yet not !

Just look for it and go ! Book early enough - the locals love it too !

Speak easy feel but even better and amazing food !

Cannot recommend enough !
This place is a classic! Been coming for years every time I come to Seattle !

The Pink Door always pleases and is a great place to meet friends or have a cozy romantic dinner with your spouse.  This time I went for a lunch with the girls and selected something off the fresh sheet.  It was fantastic as always.  We shared a carafe of the house red wine and spent a couple of hours chatting away the afternoon.  I don't think you would be disappointed with any of the menu items but the restaurant is popular and can be a bit noisy when it fills up.  I would suggest making a reservation and shooting for an off time like 11:30am for lunch or a 6:30pm dinner.
Great atmosphere, the acrobat performer really set this place apart

Very nice restaurant! Love the ambiance. Nice place for a first date. They have nightly entertainment. Check their website before you book. Also make sure you make a reservation because this place fills up quick. The food was very good!
It seems over rated. I feel like there is a lot of tourists because it’s so near pike place. The show in the bar area was lovely but other than that the food was good but nothing special.

What a wonderful night  wonderful food and drink plus a show. The aerial ballerina was just wonderful. Coming from “circus town” Sarasota, it was an impressive show.  Did I mention the food was outstanding.  A must do night in Seattle.
Great food and view.   We went for lunch; I plan to visit again but for dinner so we can enjoy the musical performances as well.

We booked a table at the Pink Door hoping to see the entertainment that it is known for.  However, I did not realize that you have to book a table at the bar or lounge area to see the shows during dinner. If you are sitting in the dining room, you can leave your table and return after the show. The food and service were great as was the ambiance. I will definitely return!
Celebrating a grad school graduation and new jobs
The best - as always. We’ve been going for 26 years!
Had lunch with my daughter and cousin on Saturday. What a beautiful afternoon! Oysters were amazing and Pink Door Caesar salad with Dungeness crab was delicious. Thank you for a special day.

We had a wonderful afternoon at the Pink Door.  We were very excited to get a window seat overlooking the Pikes Market Place. The service was excellent and the lasagna was the best I’ve ever had.  It will definitely be one of our stops whenever we are in Seattle.
Iconic and classic place to dine in the Market. Never disappoints!

My girlfriend and I had a great experience here. The entrance is unassuming, and could easily be missed, but is a namesake pink door. The interior ambiance was nice, although it did get quite loud during lunch. We got a table in a section which overlooks the bay, which was nice too. The food was very tasty (we got lasagna, a seafood stew, tiramisu, and prosecco wine) with big portions. Service was slightly hurried due to the busy lunch hour, but was still friendly. The restaurant also has trapeze and burlesque shows, but unfortunately none were scheduled at the time we were there. 

Highly recommend this restaurant when visiting Pike Place, but reservations are a must.
I mentioned in the comments section that it was our anniversary and the staff sat us at a window seat and gave us two complimentary glasses of Champagne. It was great.
Everything about my experience at The Pink Door was amazing. Highly recommend.
The pink door was a great choice for a special diner date. The ambiance was perfect.

The food was excellent. We wanted to come here for the entertainment which was not happening til much later the evening we were there. The service was very slow and sub par. Prices are quite high for what you get.
Service was poor. Food was really good. Great atmosphere.  Due to the service, I wont return. I think they are resting on their laurels.
Great restaurant...got a reservation the day of...probably because of the snow event...but the ambience was great and the food was fabulous.  Was a great night.
Really glad we found this place. It was honestly the highlight of our week in Seattle. Very friendly service, great seafood and pasta, and awesome wine.

Took my sister for get 65th Birthday and it did not disappoint.
Made reservations in the bar area to enjoy the arial act.
Great service and found good value for the money spent.
Will definately return again.

The Oysters pink balsamic shaved ice mignonette was amazing. The Tuna Crudo followed and the smoked olives made it unique and delicious. The entree was the Pappardelle alla Bolognese was wonderful. Service was impeccable. A very special evening.
This place was AMAZING! The only thing was the service was a bit off, but I would highly recommend to anyone!
Love this place! Always make a reservation when we come to Seattle

This was a busy, vibrant place. Live music. Even though we had reservations  we waited about 30 minutes to be seated. Our server was attentive and made good suggestions.  The food was excellent.  Steaks, scallops, oysters, calamari were all delicious.  Wine was very expensive but good.

Some of the finest Italian Seafood in PNW.  Make sure to book a table or your wait can be very long.
Well worth the wait.
Food was great! Wait staff was very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend.
Great experience!
Had an awesome experience! Great wine pairs to seasonal dinner entrees. We will definitely be coming here again.
Food was fantastic and staff were pleasant.  Beautiful restaurant with a great ambience.
The music prevented us from hearing the table next to us but we could hear each other so the noise level was perfect.

They had a delicious fixed four course meal for New Years Eve. I dined alone and the staff was very attentive and awesome.  The owner of the restaurant walked around to each table and spoke with everyone. They made sure it was a special experience!

Pink Door has always been a favorite- and this NYE they literally “crowned” it!!! Dinner was delicious, service was amazing, and Jackie gave me a NYE crown handmade by a man in NYC, truly unforgettable!  Thank you!!! xo

Dominic was
Great.
Best italian in Seattle
Great food and wonderful ambiance
A trip to Seattle is never complete without a meal at the Pink Door.
Good was AMAZING. My drink was ok and expensive for how small it was, but still beautiful
Honestly it's a nice looking place to go to. But the food isn't as good as I thought it would be. I've had better at cheaper locations. Good service though, and beautiful decor.
Absolutely loved our evening here! We will definitely be back.
Whenever we come to Seattle we like to visit The Pink Door!! Great food, service and atmosphere
Great Ambiance! Food was excellent. We had cioppino and winter risotto. 8yrs old had pasta with marinara and loved it.
Our friends want to eat here every time they come to Seattle!  It’s a great excuse to eat there.
First time here and the food was pretty amazing. Full of flavors! Will come again. I hope next time to see a show
Excellent!
This is a long term favorite and is so consistently exceptional! Warm and attentive service and delicious food.
Always a great place to go for great food and great company.

The Bianca pizza and house salad was very good 
The ambiance was very nice 
Friendly staff

Rhett Butler cocktail good. Appetizers ok. Pasta good. 
Service excellent. Ambience very good.
We had a nice, romantic meal.
The Pink Door is ALWAYS  a good idea. Perfect for any day, any time.
Phenomenal meal, great atmosphere and views.
Last day in Seattle for Christmas with family.
I love it but I do think it"s getting a little too expensive.
Amazing! Greta was an incredible server. I will definitely be back.
We had a great time at The Pink Door. The staff were friendly and the food was delicious. Can't wait to go again!
Beautiful restaurant, great ambiance the bar for live music
We’ll always come back here again and again for the wonderful views, service, ambiance, cocktails, and of course...LASAGNA!
Service was really great. Didn’t feel rushed. Great view from our table
Great, as always!
Very fun place, excellent service. Atmosphere is very pleasant.
The Pink Door always pleases and will continue to be a go-to favorite restaurant experience in Seattle! Food is consistently wonderful, ambiance is eclectic and cozy, and the staff are pros!

Birthday lunch that was absolutely fabulous 
Food incredible, service great & such a cozy atmosphere in the bar.
Food is really nice, and the vibe is great too. Will visit again
Excellent food and great service. Ambience was great for having conversations. Overall would recommend!
The services was OUTSTANDING!! We were lucky to have our waiter!!
Awesome food and service.  New dining room overlooking the water
Had our work holiday lunch party here and everyone really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Would highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be back soon!
What a unique experience! The restaurant is beautiful and the food is amazing! Highly recommend!

First time to Pink Door.  Had a fabulous time!  Great window seat. Large bright windows. Neat wide plank wood floors.  Excellent service from our waiter, Andrew.  I was very impressed!  I will be back!
Holiday family outing.

Been going to this restaurants for the past 9 years and I can't say that I had one bad experience. The fish of the day was delicious as well as their lasagna and ragu bolognese (our usual go to's). Great food with even better service!
Excellent, excellent, excellent. What else is there to say! The only issue I might have is it was little on the loud side but then it's a popular place.
Beautiful place, great ambience, excellent food. definitely recommend it.
I would definitely return when in Seattle.  It was a fun place and the service was great.
Excellent Lasagne, fabulous cocktails and service.

It really felt like the holidays in the back room - we were able to watch the sun set over the water and it just added to the experience. The food was incredible, very tasty. Our server was divine and knew her stuff - would definitely recommend!

I was attending a conference with my girlfriend and she had heard about the pink door. We couldnt get a reservation until 930. The ambiance was lovely and there was a cello playing. We shared the northpoint oysters with pink balsaminc ice, which was a new one for me.... very tasty could  have eaten a dozen. My friend has the butternut squash rissoto and brussel sprouts. The rissoto was well prepared, seasoned and creamy. I had the  agnoletti oxtail with a parmesan butter sauce. It was very tasty, but a very heavy entree. Over all a very good meal.
Excellent atmosphere and food.

This was a real treat.  The dishes are well crafted with a real emphasis on the ingredients used in the dishes.  Portion sizes were just right.  I had lamb "osso bucco" that was a beautifully braised shank that easily fell off the bone.  My friend had the lasagna, that was a lovely individual casserole. We started with the Caesar salad, with a dressing that clearly was authentically made, with just a bit of anchovy paste for saltiness.  We both had the flourless chocolate cake in port wine sauce for dessert - yumm!  The view of the Great Wheel and the market just topped off the ambiance of the room.  Everything was priced appropriately (although the wine by the glass was a bit steep).   We will be back!
This was our first pink door visit! Food was excellent-Lola a delight! Nice evening

Went for luncheon and sat in what seems to be the new part of Pink Door.  Food wonderful, can recommend the appetizer plate.  Bread excellent, great crust.  I had risotto, filling and delicious.  Really felt like we were back in Italy (except for the wine prices)

We made a reservation far in advance (2-3 months before) and were able to see two aerial shows during dinner. The pasta dishes were outstanding (we got the lasagna and the fettuccine) and the service was great.
Been coming here since the beginning. Never disappoints. A real Seattle treat!
Haven't been here in years!  Every bit as good as I remembered!  THANK YOU!

Always a great spot for a nice evening with friends.  The atmosphere is great, the aerial performance was amazing, the food is always delicious, and the servers were prompt and great with recommendations.

I have been coming to the pink door for years. And really love the new dining room. But really $30 for corkage? That’s just ridiculous. It just seems to me that dining out in Seattle has become prohibitive. Afterwords, there were four of us, we discussed the price and have decided that it’s just way expensive to go out to dinner anymore. So will be staying home and making her own dinner parties much more frequently.  Pink Door has remained one of our favorite places over the years. We’ve probably been there more than any other restaurant in Seattle. Oh, and in addition we did get me a bottle of wine off your wine list. We usually bring some and buy some.
Simply put, the food was delicious! I would definitely recommend making reservations well in advance, but it is worth it.
Amazing food
Amazing food.  Eclectic decor.  A little hard to find as there is no sign.  Excellent service.  Dessert to die for.
The food and ambiance was amazing. Would visit here again. The Risotto with butternut squash was perfect.
Once again, the pink door was off the hook amazing. Their tomato sauce is the best we’ve ever had.  Drool worthy and then some!

Our waiter was fantastic. He had good recommendations and brought a dessert and candle for our friends birthday. 
We were 4 girls seated on a bench between 2 couples probably trying to have an intimate dinner. 
Disappointed with the stiff brown paper over top of the nice white linen tablecloths. Turns fine dining into a bit more casual

Never had a disappointing meal at this great hidden gem. Turn into the alley and look for the pink door. No other signage, just a pink door. Better if your first visit in during daylight because the lighting makes the door look yellow at night. Enjoy!!
Perfect place for dinner, food was amazing and the service even better. Some of the best Italian food I ever have eaten.
Always feel like Pink Door tries to rush you out of the restaurant too fast.  Waiters need to appreciate a leisure pace for dinner.   Stop with the Red Robin treatment.

I love the Pink Door. Every time I/we are in Seattle we make a point of stopping by for lunch or dinner. The service is always outstanding, the food amazing, and the atmosphere delightful. It is always a pleasure to have dined there. Highly recommend it.
Great dining experience all around!  Very nice waiter!
Lasagna was unreal! Scallops and meatballs were also delish.

Wonderful ambience, delicious food, attentive service. The pasta uses high quality noodles. Good for guests of all ages. Lots of steps to and from the front door. Advance reservations are highly recommended.
Food are not great, tasted good not great, there’s many restaurants much better than that

Overall, the food at Pink Door is good. Yes, it's a little pricey and some of the portions are small. However, it's one of those spots you pay for the ambiance and experience. I was lucky to go on a Monday night which is the night they do the Aerial Acrobatic performance. (No pictures allowed!)  The service is good, the server kept coming back to check on my table to make sure our water was filled and that we enjoyed the food. Their specialty is the vegetarian lasagna which has spinach and pesto in it. It was good and creamy but felt like it didn't have enough sustenance to it. The Vongole pasta was good, again just your typical vongole linguine. Nothing special about it but I still enjoyed it. I also got a side of the meatballs since we felt like we needed some meat and those were decent as well. Not bad but nothing special. Lastly, also got a side of their Tuscan fries and the portion for this was huge! Super tasty as well! Loved the garlic and herbs and the fries were crispy. Definitely worth it to get the fries! 

In terms of drinks, I ordered a sophisticated lady and it was a nice cocktail. It was sweet and fruity but still had a good amount of liquor in it. 

The restaurant is very cute and intimate. A nice place for a date-night for sure. Or perhaps a small girl's night.
Service was slow for what level of busy the restaurant was (slow to moderate).
Amazing good, great venue, will definitely return!
This place was fantastic! By far the best meal I had while in Seattle.
Amazing food and entertainment! Dinner here was worth the hype.
I thought the Pink Door was an excellent place to have dinner. Also came with a show as well. My wife and I enjoyed our dinner very much and plan to go to the Pink Door again.

Celebrated my wife's birthday. We were shown to a window seat overlooking the waterfront. Outstanding service, Outstanding food. We have eaten at this location a few times in the past and it always is a positive experience.
The atmosphere and food was great.  Good customer service.
We choose to share so we started with the oysters the cheese plate

Excellent service. Great value for the food that we received. The wait staff were wonderful. Showed up for 1:30 reservation and was not seated for 15 minutes. Not a big deal but worth mentioning. Definitely recommend.
Usher was not very friendly but food and waiters are both great
We found a bee on the salad which was removed and replaced by a new dish. The music played live in the other corner but could not hear anything. The waiter was too “happy” for my taste.
Great view, warm atmosphere and fantastic food! As we read reviews we noted the cheese board and lasagna as must try dishes - they did not disappoint. A wonderful night
We had a great time and a nice dinner. Server was helpful and attentive. The restaurant has a great decor and is cozy.

I've been to The Pink Door a handful of times, and each time I walk away thinking it's the only restaurant within Pike Place Market worth the fuss. The prices can be a bit on the fancy side, but for that you get consistently fantastic, filling meals. My only gripe is that service can be hit or miss. The staff is friendly and makes helpful recommendations, but is often forgetful about simple things like silverware and drink refills, to the point where I've felt forgotten if I'm with a party of several people. It's perfect, however, for a date. Make a reservation for dinner in the back room or sit at the bar for lunch, and enjoy a carafe of wine or their fantastic cocktails and it feels like you're the only two people in the world, in the best possible sense.
We went there for my wife's birthday lunch with my 2 kids. Food was amazing! Definitely will go back
Early dinner with the family the Tuesday before thanksgiving. Lovely experience as always!

My boyfriend and I had an incredible meal celebrating our four year anniversary! We loved starting with the house antipasto. We ordered the Pappardelle and the Rabbit— delicious! Amazing food and amazing views of Seattle! Thanks!

We took our son (6) to see the aerial show and it was really cool. The food is amazing (though the gf bread was like store bought & I would just skip bread all together instead of ordering the gf option) service was great.
This unique restaurant offers delicious food and excellent servoce. Highly recommended for anyone who travels to Seattle!

Beyond the delicious food, friendly service, and whimsical atmosphere, I was especially grateful to the staff at The Pink Door for accommodating our unique circumstance where we needed to bring our small, new, sleeping pup into the restaurant. She was sleeping in her kennel the entire time and they placed us in a perfect spot (corner table) where we could sneak her under the table, out of sight. I know how making such concessions can result in eyerolls from other customers (we are not making this a habit, by any means), so I am really grateful for their flexibility. Some staff even came by to say hello to her. Thanks again!
Loved the ambiance such a pretty restaurant!
Great place with gourmet food and excellent service.
Best food and the tiramisu is to die for. All around great date night choice.
Amazing food and service. Wish we were able to sit near the live music though!

A sunny lunch in winter at the market. Does that really happen?  Yes.  Celery and mushroom and ?fennel salad was beautiful but. Turns out, bland.  Caponata was perfect with good portions on crostini.  Thank you. Well be back to try more
One of the best restaurants in Seattle, amazing food, amazing service, amazing venue. Thanks a ton!
Every bit of our meal and experience was phenomenal. We will def return. Thanks!
Great food!! Very Kind!

We felt like we were missing something. We were in the room closest to the big window and had no idea that the show was in the other room. As well, the pasta with mini clams that I had was so salty that it burned my mouth and lips. Our waiter never gave us an opportunity to complain, nor did he ask if we wanted anything else after our dessert. I am not impressed.
Outstanding service. Excellent food and a view that was to die for. We will be back!
More than anything, our server made our meal. He was so helpful and knowledgeable. He made sure we were enjoying ourselves without being overbearing. It was an absolute pleasure to dine here.
Fantastic food, fantastic atmosphere. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.
Very good very good very good very good very good very good

The four of us celebrate our multi decade friendship with a quarterly  lunch to honor the birthday of each friend. The Pink Door staff treat us with gracious professionalism and always a touch of delightful wit. The menu never ceases to be fresh and inspired, the Pink bubbles flow, the laughter ensues, and more memories are made. The Pink Door environment is a marvelous cross of Mediterranean elegance and French Bistro.  We always share multiple appetizers. We love the Antipasto platter, the beet salad, fresh oysters with pink peppercorns mignonette, roasted cauliflower, followed with the risotto of the season, their famous meatballs, and a choice of many delightful salads. Sometimes we share an entree - then finish with a perfect cappuccino and the Budino - the most heavenly butterscotch pudding topped with a shot of scotch. Oh yes please!  It’s truly a feast of the senses. The place is always packed, so reservations are a must. This is a truly well run establishment and we often see the manager make her rounds, greeting guests and taking care of every detail. She doesn’t miss a thing! We truly feel cared for and encouraged to relax and take our time. It’s why we keep coming back, four times a year, for the last 17 years.
Great atmosphere and very good food.  Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selections.   All in all, a great evening.
A M A Z I N G. The food, TO DIE FOR, the music, TO DIE FOR, the service, TO DIE FOR!!!!
Celery and roasted pear bisque was amazing, as was the osso bucco.

The Pink Door has been a favorite of mine for thirty years and the signature lasagna has never changed. It’s hard for me to order another entree because I love it so much and it tastes of nostalgia. Views of Elliott Bay from the new dining room are wonderful, but the large parties in that room (birthday/anniversary type celebrators) made it difficult to get our waitress’ attention. Although it doesn’t feel like a hidden gem anymore, the Pink Door is wonderful!
Spectacular ambiance! Makes you feel pink!
Cozy place w/ delicious foods. I recommend today's special menu!

One of the best service experiences I’ve ever had. She was delightful, knowledgeable, helpful and appropriate. Food was delicious and the view and atmosphere were great. Had antipasto, Caesar salad with crab, buccatini.

Our go to restaurant-of-choice in downtown Seattle for celebrations and bringing out-of-town guests. The ambiance is unique and meals are always spot on. Absolutely love the cheese plates and always start our meals enjoying the ever changing selections.

What a completely extraordinary restaurant! No sign out front. Just a pink door! Perhaps this would not be possible in an age before GPS!!!

The restaurant has high ceiling. The decor is semi garish but somehow comfortable. The ceilings are high enough to accommodate a couple of trapeze type devices: one a swing, and the other a ring. On 2 nights a week in the large bar area there are 2 brief aerial shows involving a woman dressed in costumes such as satin shorts with sequins. Music plays and there is a dance aerial show combination that is artful and athletic. Very unique!

But the star of the restaurant is, quite rightly, the food. The freshest ingredients. The most careful preparation. Simple and absolutely fresh oysters. The 3 meat ball offering makes a good appetizer. The lasagna is delicious. But the star of the stars is the marinara. The best I have ever eaten! Incredible!!!

And a great wine list.

I’d lived in Seattle years ago and was never able to find the restaurant. Upon visiting Seattle again, I was thrilled to finally be able to visit. The food was good and the service was great. I hope to visit Seattle again soon and of course, visit The Pink Door again.

Such a wonderful meal, service, ambience, and view. I can not say enough good things about our experience at The Pink Door! On a whim I I tried to book a table for lunch and totally lucked out. I definitely recommend this restaurant!

They didn’t have a table for us at the time of our reservation. Once we were seated it took 15 mins to even have a server come take our drink order. Nice ambiance but they seem to take reservations over the capacity of what they can handle.

I cannot speak highly enough about our experience.  We arrived about 10 minutes early & they were able to seat us right away.  We had great seats in the bar near the aerialist show.  Our service was prompt, friendly & helpful. 2 of our 3 drinks were GREAT, the Old Fashioned made with well whiskey was not enjoyable at all.  All 3 of our meals were served at the perfect temperature, ample portions - not too much or too little. The food was absolutely lovely & crave worthy.  We look forward to going back again soon.
Great service, lovely venue and the food arrived very quickly! We had a very large party and everyone was impressed with The Pink Door!
Lovely place. Service slow. A Seattle gem still.

Flavors were outstanding, the food was great!  We were able to get our table quickly, service was great and very, very Fast!.  Only gripe (and I'm nit picking) is the plates were small, meaning I was expecting more quantity for an Italian place and the price.  However, I did leave full and not food coma full.  I don't usually get appetizers, but I would here if I go back knowing the entree is on the small side.  All in all, great experience!

We went here for our 10 year anniversary, looking forward to a nice dinner without the uppity feeling of a black tie restaurant. We definitely didn’t leave feeling like we would want to come back, based solely on the front of the house staff.

Great 'little' hidden spot at Pike Place Market - I had no idea this was even here - enter through a nondescript pink door and voila - a huge bustling Italian experience complete with views and live entertainment - and some of the best pasta we've ever had!!!   Highly recommend!!
Make a reservation! Had a 9:45pm reservation. Went for dessert, drinks and music. Will plan or dinner next time. Great time!
The food was phenomenal- the service was attentive but not pushy and the live music was wonderful! And the views in the back room were gorgeous! What a gem!
Love the atmosphere. Food and service is great.
For a pre-symphony dinner, my wife and had an excellent dinner.  We had the special ox-tail ravioli and a green salad.  The location was, as ever, great as was the service.
This is my favorite "go to" place.  Only problem is getting a reservation . . .
Best lasagna ever!!!!
Loved everything about our evening at Pink Door. Must do in Seattle!
So glad we found the Pink Door! Will definitely tell the rest back home in Hawaii that it is a must👍5:15 reservations were perfect for sunset views.
Unbelievable place
Great food and beautiful setting inside and patio!  Will return!
Took forever to get a reservation but we sure had a great time!
Fantastic food in a very cozy atmosphere. I can’t wait to go back!
Everyone in our party loved everything that came to the table.  The service was outstanding!
We had a great time. The food was excellent. The service was really quite remarkable. Our server was one of the best I can ever remember. Great job.
Amazing food and ambience! Reserve early and ask for seating by the waterfront. Every single thing we tried was delicious. Particularly, the linguine with clams and garlic bread were divine.
The Pink Door is always excellent. The staff is always kind and knowledgeable. Experience at this restaurant is great.
Wonderful location, great water views. Our server was excellent, very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. And the food was great! A very enjoyable experience.
Everything was great from the food to service and entertainment. I highly recommend the Pink Door.
This was our 3rd visit to the Pink Door and this restaurant remains consistently excellent. The food, the service, the ambience are all top notch. Can’t wait for our next visit to Seattle!
It was okay meal portions could be bigger if your wanting the asking price. But for most part it was just okay.

Had an incredible dinner at The Pink Door -- probably one of the best meals I've had in Seattle! 

My recs for an enjoyable night at The Pink Door:

-Cheese Board Deluxe. If you like cheese, get this board. It's amazing.

-Lasagna Pink Door. Our favorite dish of the night. I didn't think lasagna could taste so good. Pink Door has perfected marinara sauce. All other marinaras are going to pale in comparison to this sauce.

-Make a reservation. Don't expect to walk-in. Sometimes they have availability but when we left at 7PM on a Saturday, they had a sign on the door that said their walk-in list was full.

I'm already planning when we can go back. The Pink Door is my new go-to when we have visitors in town.
Great place
Brought my mom and aunt for the first time and theyre really picky. But they really enjoyed their time here and the food was very satisfactory!
Lovely experience.  Delicious menu, friendly & fun service.  Great local wines.

Love the atmosphere. Food was very good. Wonder why they don’t have an excellent food service rating posted - only ‘good’. I don’t typically go to Seattle restaurants that aren’t rated ‘excellent’ 

Our food service waitress was great. Made the mistake of stopping at the bar for a drink in our way out. Very unpleasant female bartender. Took forever to get her attention to pay our check.

This is our favorite place to go on Halloween. Great food, and the costumes are awesome! We arrived 40 minutes before our reservation, and they were able to seat us within 10 minutes of our arrival even though they were busy. Love this restaurant!

We were in Seattle for a birthday weekend and had the good fortune to go to the Pink Door on Halloween. The servers were dressed up in delightful costumes adding to the festive atmosphere. They were attentive and responsive. Our dishes were delicious. My wife had the Osso bucco and I had their signature lasagna. Both dishes were beautifully presented.

I have always loved the PD - summers on the deck and winters in the newer bright room over the market. It's a wonderful venue.  I am curious, however, why servers have gone to using pronouns such as we, us and our?  "How are we doing today?" "What is our choice for lunch today?"  This makes me crazy and I find myself wanting to say, "We have decided you will pay the bill."  I suspect it is someone's training idea to bring the server into relationship with the diners but it feels contrived and insincere. I really prefer the traditional approach - What would YOU like for lunch; How is YOUR lunch?, etc.

Had a lovely birthday dinner here. We made reservations on opentable about 1 week in advance. We arrived early and promptly seated at bar and were seated at our reservation time. We had a beautiful view near the water. Service was excellent and the food was delicious.
Fantastic food, great server, beautiful venue. Of course it didn’t hurt that I was there with my wonderful family.

Great everything
Food and atmosphere was awesome
Just an outstanding classic restaurant.  Really really cool decor!  My first visit ever, will not be my last

Had a table with a view of the water and got to see the sunset.  I had the cioppino which was warm and delicious (and they customized it for because I can't some kinds of seafood). My husband had the lasagna which was, seriously, the best lasagna I've ever had!  When the trapeze artist was due to start her show, we were invited and encouraged to go and watch it.  Her performance was beautiful.

Overall a great experience.  Would have been a nice touch to offer a real wine glass with the house red carafe of wine,  instead of a regular drinking glass.  Took olive oil away,  but left bread on table, and other minor miss cues, that more experienced,  or better informed wait staff would have known.

The Pink Door is an eclectic, beautiful restaurant in the Pike Place neighborhood.  You must get a reservation weeks in advance, but it is worth it.  The service is good, but was a little slow at times.  The atmosphere is lively and fun.  But the food is amazing.  We had the cheese board, which had 4 amazing cheeses with outstanding compote sides.  My wife had the gnocchi with gluten free pasta and it was fantastic.  My son had the rigatoni with meatballs and loved it.  I had the bucatini and it was the best pasta meal I've had outside of Italy.  It was simply awesome.  They do have many gluten free options and are kid friendly.

This is an above-average Italian restaurant inside the Pike Place Market. As mentioned by a lot of patrons, the place is difficult to find without a sign. We walked past the restaurant a couple times and finally had to call for directions only to realize we were standing right outside. I am puzzled why they didn't just put up a sign when clearly we were not the first one to have the problem. And the restaurant is huge; so I can imagine the number of calls they have to field each day on that alone. To me, it comes across as uncaring, a bit egotistic and tone deaf. Coupled that with the expensive parking ($24), it is not a place I would return.
Anniversary dinner. They were so great and even gave us a welcome congrats drink
The food is amazing and our server was so friendly

Went there on a packed Tuesday evening with our son and daughter-in-law. First time, but we had luckily reserved our spot on Open Table. We each ordered a different entree and shared bites. Halibut, autumn risotto, pappardelle bolognese, lasagna. All four of us loved every bite we tasted of all four dishes! Even the house white wine, Pinot Grigio was good! Dominic was our excellent waiter. All in all a wonderful meal in a unique setting at a reasonable price. What could be better?!!
prosciutto was very good; lasagna was exceptional, even without meat!  penn cove mussels and clams were very fresh and tasty; highly recommend this restaurant!
5 stars for experience. The food is okay.. but also reasonably priced. Would definitely come back but maybe only for drinks!

This restaurant is well worth it! The lasagna was to die for and I will for sure be dreaming of it. My husband I were visiting  Seattle and decided to grab a late Sunday night reservation at this restaurant. The original reservation was for 9:30 pm but we wrapped up our activities and were at the restaurant around 8:30 pm and were seated promptly. It has a very romantic and intimate vibe but still can be casual. People were both dressed up and also in casual attire. Any meal off their menu is delicious. We ended up doing the pumpkin cake for dessert and it was mouthwatering. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!!
This quirky place is a must.  The food is excellent, the service great, the decor is eclectic and if you are really lucky you get to see an impromptu acrobatic show!

The food was absolutely AMAZING!! I would definitely recommend making a reservation though. We dined at 4:30. When we were leaving I heard the host telling someone the wait was at least 2.5 hours. Despite the fact that there was not any entertainment during out dinner the restaurant was still awesome. It was a little hard to find because of the streets but if you ask anyone they’ll direct you.
Everything felt average though it was all expensive. It felt like a tourist spot and I was really disappointed.

Wonderful time spent with my close friends for my birthday. All questions were answered regarding ingredients listed on the menu, and the first server we had, Thomas was so much fun!  We were in a booth that had a great view of the water, so it was quieter than other times I have dined at Pink Door.  The food, wine and experience is always amazing!

Our waiter was awesome! 
Food came to our table really quick
Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the dishes and .
One of my all time favorite restaurants.  I have never had a bad meal in 20 years.
It was a fantastic dinner. The food, the drinks, the server was all high quality and so enjoyed. It was birthday Weekend trip and I would go back in a heartbeat if and when I’m in Seattle again.
Fantastic service,  great wine,  wonderful pasta dishes,  and a charming view.... what more could one want!

Our meal at The Pink Door was spectacular. Everything was delicious and the space was super interesting and cool. We were delighted to find this gem, and will definitely be back when we're in Seattle again!

What a great venue to celebrate our trip to Seattle. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal with a fabulous cheese plate to start, pasta bolognese and the best lasagna I’ve ever had! Our waiter was attentive, and gave us plenty of time to enjoy our wine and dinner. We also enjoyed socializing with the table of 2 adjacent to us, however if you want more privacy I suggest you mention that when making reservations as some tables are quite close. I will suggest the Pink Door to anyone visiting the area and would love to go back again!

Great food, good service but nothing like the website hype. No “acts”, carnival, or however it’s described, atmosphere. There was a live band but not in the room we were in. As a first time visitor you have no clue you could be put in an ordinary restaurant room totally removed from anything that’s going on. Seriously not that special to accept just any table or time slot available. Seattle teems with great dining, so don’t accept second best

I surprised my wife with a trip to Seattle for dinner at The Pink Door. Read the positive reviews, perused the menu online, looked at some photos and said why not? We flew in and headed right over.  Was blown away. Solid spot! Met every expectation. Service, atmosphere, food all spot on. Server was attentive and easy going as well as the hostess. I’d definitely recommend this place to friends and family. Thanks to everyone at The Pink Door!

Everything was exceptional from the entrance to leaving. The food was wonderful and delicious. I recommend the gnocchi and the pizza Bianca. The service was great. We were seated right away near the window to view the coastline and pike market. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that stops by Seattle and the locals that live here if they have not tried or heard of it yet.
Always a favorite. Perfect business lunch with a Kirkland client.
One of my favourite restaurants in all of Seattle; never ceases to be an amazing dining experience and well worth the price.

Came here for dinner with hubby and our toddler--the food and trapeze entertainment was excellent! Highly recommend especially as a date spot, but the trapeze artist really did captivate my daughter's attention, allowing her dad and I to enjoy our meals. The ribeye steak had a smokey taste that was really good, it came with buttery mashed potatoes. I got spaghetti for my daughter which she loved, and I got the bolognese (also really good)! We shared a brownie dessert that was yummy too, but by far I must recommend our favorite thing that we ordered which was a bottle of the Cadence Cabernet-Franc wine. It was very good, paired well with both of our meals. Next time we visit Seattle we surely will be back!
Went for our anniversary, great food and show.  Waitress could have been friendlier.
Wonderful food and a special place for our anniversary celebration!
The food was great! The vibe and energy in the restaurant was on point. It was a 10 out 10 experience at restaurant.

Review: For my first trip to Seattle with my special guy, I wanted to lunch somewhere that was totally “me” and this spot hit the nail on the head. Or should I say, fit the mold (there are gilded casts of cherubs, among other sweet things). Victorian meets postmodern beauty in this hidden pink place (He did the gps location as we walked, but I was the cool one telling him that the pink door meant the right spot). I would soon find out that the decor played second fiddle to the food, my lasagna was tangy and perfect.
The lasagna was unsurpassed, delicious!
Always serve with excellent food and immaculate service. My favorite!

A beautiful dining room with live music that matches the decor. Our food was delicious. We had a pasta with sausage and one single meatball. For half and half it would have been great to have one more meatball. It was tasty. The lasagna was okay. Not my favorite cheese texture. Our dessert was a great ending. A pumpkin cake topped with a caramel ice cream.
The food was so so. The place is hyped up. We ordered the rabbit, the lasagna, the gnocchi and risotto. The lasagna was the best amongst all the items.
Experience was Devine, atmosphere was lively. Great ambiance

I really had a great time at The Pink Door. I had a resser and I highly recommend you to have a reservation too, even in the afternoon around 2-3. 
Service is awesome, and food is great to taste; the view outside in the balcony was a bit covered by the buildings around but still worth to have if the weather is good.
Great place to eat in Piles Place.  Make sure to make reservations a couple weeks in advance.

Brought my friend who was visiting from Kyoto, Japan for lunch. We were seated in the lovely sunny dining room, served by a fantastic (and super hot) waiter, the food was spot on as always. Extra kudos to keeping your lasagne perfection consistent all these years! But the spice cake dessert in caramel sauce w mocha (?) ice cream was absolutely the best. Supremely designed and executed. Thank you Pink Door!
Great fun!
Our experience was nothing short of excellent. We were celebrating a birthday and it was a hit!

I had an incredible experience here at the Pink Door. My boyfriend and I went here for a date and the ambience was incredible. We had a reservation at 5 and it was the perfect time because we got seated next to the window and had an amazing view. I suggest getting the lasagna and bolo and it was just to die for. I high suggest getting the lasagna it was the best I’ve ever had. The servers was also very friendly and checked on our table every 5-10 minutes to make sure we had everything we needed. Of course it is a little pricey but it’s definitely worth it!

Difficult to get reservations - we booked 6 weeks ahead of time.
Expect to pay $50 per person for dinner with 1 drink & desert.
Interesting acrobatic show of 1 woman climbing with ribbons and a hoop - never seen that in any restaurant.
Best Italian In Seattle. Just wish it was easier to get a reservation!!

I made a mistake thinking our reservation was for Saturday when in fact i had made it for the next day.  Staff were very understanding, actually defusing the embarrassing situation. Claiming this happens all the time. Asked us to have a seat and see what they could do for us. Less than 10 minutes later we were escorted to our table as if they were expecting us all along.

Our server was LouLu, pretty sure I have her name wrong but will not forget the incredible service we received from her. She was fun! enganging! knowledgeable!  Pinot Grigio was deliciously chilled! Most of the food was outstanding - garlic was slightly overwhelming in the pasta.

When we are in Seattle again we will definitely return and would highly recommend to anyone

Fantastic! In town doing the tourist bit and found a review for Pink Door. Great place, fantastic food, excellent service. Large portions so beware. We were in a food coma. Would hang out there again and enjoy the ambiance in a heartbeat! 
Intimate feel with lots of quirkiness.

I tried “The Angelica”, a mixed drink with gin, St Germaine, and Prosecco among other ingredients.  Very tasty!  I enjoyed the Alaskan Coho Salmon over grilled veggies and my daughter had the penne with Italian sausage which she loved. We shared tiramisu (Oh, my!) The food was wonderful, the service fun and efficient.  Beautiful view of Puget Sound.  Great for an impress the date or family visit, as the prices are quite high, but it’s worth it.

I had a visitor in town.  The food was excellent but I was expecting more of a view from the website.  It was an eclectic interior with a lot of fun distractions but I had hoped for a more local view of the water or Pike’s.
Wonderful. Great and interesting atmosphere, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Great food!

Excellent food, service and ambience. We  enjoyed a lot. But, I'd add more dairy free choices.
Not very accessible for baby strollers. If there's an elevator/lift, no one told us about it, so we had to carry it downstairs.

The food was fantastic and the portions were twice the size of any other higher end Italian restaurant in the area! we didn't even come close to finishing our lunches... When you make a reservation, keep in mind that Bar seating is the key to getting reservations in a pinch. Bar seating doesn't necessarily mean eating at the bar, because chances are (90%+) you get to sit at a table in the bar area!!!
Always great! Our waiter Andrew was fantastic! The food was superb, although the pizza was a little soggy.

My friend recommended me to go there and I love the food! I tried Naughty Naughty Fig Toddy, it was warm and delicious! I also love the mussels and clams. The restaurant is very nice, service was great. Need to make a reservation, otherwise waiting time for walk-in is very LONG!
Great restaurant near pike place market.  But the quality of food, the service and the ambiance would let you think you are not near such a tourist trap.  Love the place but you need to reserve.
Birthday lunch
It was an okay dining experience.
This place never disappoints. We went there for lunch & had the pizza, clams/mussels, and the caesar.  Always stop here when I'm in the city!
The food was phenomenal especially the gnocchi!! That was one of the best I have ever had

We had a reservation and were seated immediately upon arrival. Our waitress, Lola, was friendly and attentive. Our meal was very good and arrived quickly. We were celebrating our anniversary and our waitress kindly brought us a complimentary Prosecco toast. Overall, we had a lovely evening.

What a delight it is to dine at The Pink Door.  I was thrilled to introduce my lunch guest to the Pink Door's incredible lasagna and my gnocchi with mushrooms was equally superb.  The room was gorgeous as always the service always attentive.  This place never disappoints after all these years!  Good job keeping it great Jackie Roberts!
Food was great! The service was amazing! Would differently recommend to anyone!
Excellent experience at the Pink Door. Loved the atmosphere and views. Osso Bucco was just fabulous. My favorite meal of the night. Clams were also very good. Would go back again and again!
We had a great experience for date night and will definitely be back!
Took a group of 10 and both the service and the food was great.
It was great. That place always has amazing food, ambiance, service, and sometimes entertainment.
My favorite restaurant in Seattle. Lasagne - life changing!!
Great location with a unique vibe. Food and drinks were very good.

My husband and I had not been to the Pink Door for 20 years!  After reading numerous good reviews and knowing they had remodeled since we had been there we decided to try it again. We met our good friends there and had a great evening. The waitress could not have been nicer, we sat st a nice view table by the window and our meal was delicious! We also got an added kick out of watching the aerial artist perform. We will be back!
Wonderful evening. Excellent food, service and ambiance.
We were in town to celebrate with my brother and his fiancé before they left to elope to Vegas.  It was our first time there, and we all loved it. We will be back!
Beautiful venue.  Superb service. A tasty meal.  Unbelievable view of the harbor.
Door wasn’t even oink- couldn’t find the place- no sign. Food was good but not fantastically website talked about all the entertainment. None of that and waiter wasn’t even spirited. Boring really
This place is really a hidden gem, if you are not paying attention you will missed it. Service, food and ambience is amazing.

Great food and a nice place to go with friends.  I have been to the Pink Door several time and I have never had a bad meal or been disappointed.  Eating on the deck in the summer time is a wonderful experience.

We went for lunch, so no entertainment.  The food was good, not great.  The caesar salad was good with crab on top.  The lasagna which gets great reviews was pretty good, but nothing special.  We also had to corn risotto with a tiny bit of crab on top, which left something to be desired.

We had dinner The Pink Door to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary.  The interior of the restaurant is exciting.  The service was impeccable, and the wine selection was outstanding.  We can't say enough about the outstanding service... our waitress, Jacqueline B had a wonderful personality and paid special attention to our every need.  The only reason for a 4-star rating versus a five-star was because the salmon I had for dinner was a little over-cooked, but still very tasty.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and hope to visit it again in the near future.

definitely would recommend this fabulous dining experience to everyone I know.
Service from front desk to waitress and in between made you feel welcomed and comfortable.
Made the whole evening memorable - thanks again for the wonderful night.
Loved everything about this place and would definitely go back the next time I’m in town.

First time to the Pink Door and first time to Seattle. Our server was great! What ruined our experience was the table next to us. A loud drunk man was with his friend. Very obnoxious and although they cut him off from alcohol by then our dinner was done. Very unfortunate for us!
Came for Antipasto and stayed for the Drinks. Food was delicious, service was prompt and knowledgable and the wine list was exhaustive. Thank you Lola for being an excellent server!

Excellent food and service.  The menu has variety and it was difficult for my husband and I to choose.  We asked the server to decide between two entrees and she brought a half a order of each of the dishes to my husband because she loved them both.  This has never ever happened to us and we ask servers to do this alot.  Both dishes were excellent - he had the pasta with sausage and one with ragu.  I had the veggie lasagna which was delicious and rich.  It was an enjoyable dinner with entertainment in the lounge.  I suggest if you want to eat and be entertained make your reservation in the lounge.  Those of us in the dining room were invited to watch the show as well but standing room only.

If you are ever in Seattle The Pink Door is a must.
I had the Cioppini and my husband had the Lasagna. They were both delicious! We also each had a cocktail and the delicious gelato for dessert and the bill before tip was under $100.
great place
IT WAS THE BEST EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD, WITH MY HUSBAND. THE SERVICE AND AMBIANCE WAS SUPERB.  THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS.
UnbelievBle place. Our anniversary dinner was made special by choosing Pink Door. Every dish was fantastic and the ambiance cannot be easily described. Just go!
The food was amazing and the price was reasonable as well. Loved their feature seafood, lamb porterhouse steak and their salumi platter!

The Pink Door is always one of our "must do" restaurants with out of town guests--especially when you can sit out on the terrace.  The food is always tasty, with fresh local ingredients, and the ambience can't be beat.
We where in town for the Saints Seattle game and stumbled upon the restaurant.  So glad we did!  The food was delish, service was excellent and we loved sitting outside and enjoying the weather.
It was just absolutely great! The waiter was very nice and gave us amazing service, we got drinks and apps that made the night so special. Amazing place and will recommend often!
Service and food was excellent, perfect atmosphere. Our warm thanks to everyone for a wonderful evening.

Our waiter was terrific!  Great ambiance, window table overlooking the bay with the window open and a lovely breeze.  Nice bottle of wine and terrific food!  Will definitely rave to all our friends and acquaintances  to experience the Pink Door.
Fabulous atmosphere. Would go just for that and drinks.  Service not so good.  Food not so good. But I wouldn’t say either were bad.

This place is fantastic. Live entertainment and delicious food. I was on my own and easily got a seat at the bar. They do serve full menu at the bar. I had an antipasto platter with perfectly seasoned veggies, olive tamponade (done proper with anchovies), lima bean salad, fresh cut salami and prosciutto. My main was scallops in herb butter served over a green salad. These may be the best scallops I've ever eaten. I really was eyeing the steak but the bartender talked me into the scallops and and I'm glad she did! Had it all with a perfectly crafted dirty martini. I wish I could give this place 6 stars. I will be bringing my wife here on my next visit.
I’ve been to The pink Door north of 50 times. This time I brought with work associates. As usual, the food and service was excellent. The Pink Door never lets you down!

I reserved at table for 10 but only half showed it and they didn’t mind, I felt so horrible but service is always above and beyond! I got to celebrate my girlfriends engagement with her fiancé, it couldn’t have been more perfect!!!

A fairy book story night for us at The Pink Door, celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary. Staff had been tipped off so our most adorable server Andrew treated us like royalty. We began with Prosecco, then moved on to some excellent red wines by the glass. We each had a misticanza salad, lovely oil and balsamic vinegar pairing. One of us had the Cioppino, heavenly seafood in a perfectly spiced broth and one had the Fennel Encrusted Tuna, accompanied by a delightful mix of cucumber, fennel, celery tops. Delicious all around. The pace of the extravaganza was perfect and the ever attentive Andrew mentioned that the trapeze artist was about to perform so he held dessert. That performance was a real treat and amazing. Our dessert included 3 candles-one for the past, one for the present and one for the future-quite touching to us. Andrew finished our evening with an interesting Amaro liqueur. We cannot wait to return to Seattle to see Andrew and dine at The Pink Door.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere, you can ask for much more! Will be going here every visit to Seattle!

very nice restaurant, great food and service.
a perfect place to spend a few hours with friends
Great restaurant for night out. Good food and excellent vibes
Food was excellent. We had a view of the Sound, gorgeous!

Amazing! The food, drinks and entertainment were fabulous. The food was very fresh and delicious. The seat spacing seemed a little tight and we had to wait a bit for a seat for the reservation we made. The decor was great and the staff very friendly! Overall a great experience.

What a wonderful, wonderful experience.  Everything is fantastic.  The food, the service, the views, the decor, the ambiance and the most delicious dishes explained with panache and accuracy by the servers and staff.  It is an experience that is worth going to Seattle for.
Such a lovely place... food was great... service was great
Don't think twice, go here. Excellent food and service, be sure to book near the live music.
Yes go! Yes sit outside!! Tomato salad was delicious. Lasagna excellent!! Meatballs!!

The Pink Door far exceeded my expectations! The food was outstanding (I had the insalata caprese pink door, fusilloni gigante and orange marmalade cake). The ambiance was perfect and my server, Greta, was absolutely lovely - polite, helpful and one of the nicest people I met on my travels in Seattle. I’d absolutely recommend this restaurant and hope to make it back here one day!
Delicious and cool ambiance!
Very good. I liked it. You should go there and eat.
Best restaurant in Seattle!

Just wow! Amazing place all together. I can’t think of anything negative about our experience. The food, service, ambiance and music just incredible! I will never miss this restaurant while in Seattle. 10 out of 10!
The food was great, I had the Alaskan Salmon and my husband ordered the lasagna, both were delicious.

We went there while we were on our honeymoon and it was spectacular. We didn’t realize we needed a reservation for dinner far in advance but we were able to grab a late lunch reservation on the day of and it was amazing. If we are back in Seattle we will definitely be visiting again!

The Pink Door's balcony on a sunny day is always the perfect place for lunch in Downtown Seattle, and this experience was no exception.  The location in Pike Place Market can't be beat, and on this visit I loved their trofie pesto pasta.   Bonus points to a fantastic server who was appropriately friendly and attentive.

This place was so good we booked for lunch the next day on our way out! We don't do that!!!!! We had the half order house antipasto...just fabulous. Would have been sufficient for lunch but we ordered more. The salmon cake turned out to be a salmon burger and was to die for... half fresh salmon and half smoked salmon.....this kitchen knows what it's doing! The cioppino was WOW...lots of fresh seafood and shellfish. Wine was perfect. Quiet and pleasant surroundings; unobtrusive serving staff. A pleasurable dining experience.
Thank you Pink Door; we won't forget you!
Hard to find but worth the effort.

Food was just ok. Drinks nice and strong.  A little on the loud side. Would have liked softer more romantic music as we were celebrating our wedding.  Waiter was great.  Very professional and not pushy at all. We didn't feel rushed.
Excellent food, great service, eclectic atmosphere with no exterior sign advertising the restaurant, only the pink door.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
Fabulous in every way, beginning with excellent service.
Favourite restaurant in Seattle, service and food never disappoint.

I chose this place as a place to celebrate my birthday and wanted to find something that was uniquely Seattle, as I was visiting from California. 

It did not disappoint! 

This place is genuine in it's one of a kind uniqueness: the ambiance is kitschy and fun, the food is FANTASTIC (I recommend the linguini with clams!), the service is great, and I highly recommend reserving a table in the bar area. We had a great table that allowed us to see that evening's aerialist show. It was delightful!! 

I definitely plan on visiting again the next time I am in town! :)
Amazing dinner!!

We were very excited to try the Pink Door as we only had one night in Seattle and I read a lot about this place online in advance.  The ambiance is very cool, the views were awesome-we had a great window seat overlooking the water.  The food and service were wonderful.  My sister will be in Seattle next week and I told her she has to go there!
It was great service and food.   We got a nice window table for our anniversary
I don’t get it, how this place got good reviews. High prices for okay dishes.

Great experience, we had clams & mussels, lasagna and rigatoni, everything was really good.
Watermelon margarita was average, but all food and service was outstanding!
I loved the decor and the view. Our server was very helpful and attentive.
Lasagne was excellent, great flavor!
Son visiting from France.  Always a reliable northern Italian.
Awkward seating situation and the waitress was not attentive to our needs. She thought

Our 12th wedding anniversary 
With friends!
Excellent Food, service!
Always a favorite!

From SF for an overnight stay in Seattle. Booked through OT 4 weeks in advance. Walk-ins at 5pm we’re seated right away as well. 

Seating was on time and accommodations for window seating were met. 

Ambiance was amazing in this area. Quiet. Food was great. We started the meal with the Cheese Platter and Bruschetta . For dinner we had the Special. Squid ink Pasta with clams, calamari and muscles. We also had the Meatballs and Artichoke Sformato.
So delicious!! The food, the outside seating.... perfection!
Very very good food. Amazing ambiance. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle. I wish we would have been able to see a show also

Old fashion food and no its not classic food because its made poorly.
Not tasty,
Tourists trap.
What an incredible vibe and ambience. My wife and I loved it for a romantic night out while in Seattle. Post Alley is the place to be!

A wonderful surprise behind the pink door. The restaurants many rooms were all beautiful and our final destination in the room looking out on the bay was lovely. Only the delicious food surpassed the view.
We were seated outside on the patio and loved being able to sit outside in a covered area. The food was delicious!
It was a delicious experience!  Would recommend it to a friend.
