Food is always excellent, the house made fresh pasta is fantastic. Love sitting on the deck especially now that the viaduct has been taken down, the view is spectacular. Love the "edgy" nature of the restaurant and staff.

Loved this place!   Sat outside on rooftop on beautiful night!  Service was excellent!!   Husband had king salmon and I had crab risotto!  Both fabulous!!!’ We shared a Cesar salad.  Very good.  Had the Hazelnut salted crunch gelato and choc gelato.  So wonderful!!!  Decor is so very cool.  Door is pale peach color so don’t miss it!!  Best meal we had in Seattle!!

As they serve bread , they offer olive oil in way to small dish . No Parmesan cheese . We had to keep asking for more olive oil and shredded Parmesan . We felt uncomfortable asking . I think cheese and oil should be left on the table . Great food , great ambience . Loved music , some bossanova.
Everything was the best! Waitress was awesome, place was full of character, and the food was some of the best I’ve had. We thoroughly enjoyed our time and will be back!
Not as bad as I thought for reservations! Food was great, but definitely a pricier lunch. Check website for event info ahead of time.
Excellent food and service.
I wish we had been informed when the entertainment started so we could have gone inside to watch. We were seated outside on the patio and didn’t know til it was over.
Love the pink door. It’s a one of a kind place. Every time we are in Seattle we have a meal there. Food is great and service in always outstanding.

I was deeply impressed by the service and delicious food. The venue has beautiful views. They took the time to ask if I was celebrating anything, shared with them it’s my birthday, and they were absolutely amazing placing a candle on the plate of my dessert. Loved this place!
Cramped trapeze viewing, waitress took a while

Was my daughter’s 11th birthday and they treated her like royalty. Fresh, amazing food. The tastiest bruschetta I’ve ever had. Wonderful pasta, chicken and seafood dishes. Great room with a nice view. We will be back.
Best marinara ever, better than the best I had in Rome or Naples.
Amazing!! We have not found a restaurant that compares to the Pink Door!

Wow fantastic and very reasonable price.
Highly highly recommend. Must make a reservation!
I am a flight attendant with American Airlines. The pink door always my favorite stop on my overnights. Recommend your restaurant to all of my colleagues. Never disappointed. Thank you !!
Great food and service.
Everything was great the only thing preventing me from giving a perfect score was the fact that our server was a bit cold and snobby.
Wonderful restaurant with a great atmosphere and DELICIOUS food!! PLEASE get the Lasagna Pink Door, you won’t be sorry!
Spectacular!  Our three past meals have been perfection.  This is the place we hold all others up against, no equals.

TERRIBLE. If I could give this place less than a star, I would. 
The only thing nice about our overly awful lunch would be the wonderful waitress - she was a delight to talk to and did genuinely want us to have a good time. 

But the food was AWFUL, I couldn’t even get the main course down my throat. The hostess was arrogant and said she wouldn’t hold our table 1 minute longer than expected. 

The decor - oh my god - the plastic covers were disgusting and the view was definitely not worth the bill. Cleanliness and service consideration level was also very low. 

While booking I was told if it’s a special occasion, which it was, they’d do a happy birthday writing if we ordered a dessert. We did order a dessert for my husband’s birthday and all we got a wax-dripping, oddly-placed candle. Disastrous start to birthday celebrations! 

Definitely not worth the hype and sooooo not worth their ridiculous prices.
Wonderful food. The pizza was amazing! Definitely get the risotto with crab. Fabulous!
Everytime we come to Seattle we make a reservation at the Pink Door.  Excellent food and service!
It was incredible, best lasagna ever and the views were absolutely stunning. Would recommend and come back again.

Every late August for the rest of my days, I hope to have a birthday dinner or lunch at the Pink Door. The season is perfect for their amazing heirloom tomato bruschetta and a glass of rose’. The crab and corn risotto is incredible and after that, you are on your own to sample their amazing food. If possible, try to eat outside. It will be a wonderful time with fantastic food; I promise!
Food was below par
Check in process was a little difficult.
The waiter does not receive things with a welcomed chest.
Its my favorite restuarant in Seattle and has been for over 30 years. Truly an iconic treasure in our beloved Pike Place Market.  I would go veryday if I could!

After. all the hype about this restaurant, I was not impressed by the food or the decor.  There was nothing wrong with either,I just did not find them special.  However, we were there at lunchtime.  Maybe the place is more exciting during the dinner hours.
Exceptional server. Loved everything! The food was excellent. Nice assortment of appetizers and desserts.
Awesome food. Great service. Friendly and helpful staff. Plus the best deck in town. A must for visitors to Seattle!

Yes but be prepared at the cost. Food was fantastic and very tasty plus the service was exceptional. The location is hard to find if you haven't been there before plus no signage to indicate it is the Ponk Door Restaurant.
Delicious summer cocktails! Especially the watermelon margarita!

Pink door has always been good to us. Menu items are very good, especially the pasta. Service is friendly and responsive. Outside seating on a beautiful Seattle day is worth waiting for...prices are in line with other good city restaurants.
This was delicious! The Cesar salad and risotto was out of this world!
We really enjoyed our experience sitting on the patio on a beautiful evening.
My husband and I came here for a fun lunch date while we were downtown for business meetings. It’s expensive, but was very fun and delicious.
Didn’t feel the food warranted the cost, was not poor, but overpriced. We had heard good things but left feeling underwhelmed.
The Pink Door never disappoints. The ambiance and the service our top notch! The food is delicious!

My wife had the meatballs and I ordered the lasagna which we both shared. They were wonderful. My Mom was an excellent Italian cook and this spinach pasta lasagna was amazing. The sauce was incredible with a very tasty tomato base and a little sweet. The dining experience was memorable.
Brought my elderly mom for lunch. She enjoyed it very much.
Phenomenal as always with great food, service, and ambiance!

Very nice Italian restaurant close to markets. Gets booked up so probably best to book ahead. Not really much of a view but pretty patio. Maybe it’s partly the weak pound but it seemed expensive (for Brits) for nice but not exceptional food: $340+ for 4. Waitress was wonderful!
Wonderful experience.  Ambiance is lovely. Food is excellent. We both enjoyed our pasta dishes. The pasta and clams was outstanding. Not too oily and full of fresh clams.

Great ambiance—Interior is very dark but the outer dining room has lovely window views. Our table had an air conditioning unit about it and was dripping water all over us. The staff literally gave us a napkin and said to just put that down so we wouldn’t get dripped on. Lame. Food was just ok. Pasta came out cold. Had to send drinks back because they made them wrong. We split a full fish and they didn’t even offer to debone it for us which is how those are typically served. All in all it’s a tourist trap. Very disappointed.

When we're in Seattle, The Pink Door is our must be restaurant. Food is varied and always delicious. The wait staff is attentive without being intrusive. The restaurant atmosphere is fun, kinky, and a perfect match with the food and staff. I only wish we could get in one day to see the burlesque show. Maybe in the future.

We absolutely loved the Pink Door!  The lasagna was amazing as well as the clams vongolle dish.  We also loved the watermelon margaritas and the yummy tiramisu and panna cotta desserts.  The service was perfect - we loved our server. And the restaurant itself was beautiful.  Such gorgeous water views.  We can't wait to return!

Excellent food!   My husband had the Branzino  and I had the salmon.  Delicious and beautifully presented.  We sat outside at a little table.   Server was pleasant and very attentive.  Would go back on a Sunday to see the aerial show!

WE were celebrating a girls weekend away (four seniors), we sat on the patio and it easy lovely.   Our bruchetta was poor and dry but they took it to the chef and replaced it with nice bread and didn't charge us.  The meal was very good and a fun ambiance.
Would take anyone I want to spoil to The Pink Door.   Awesomeness
love the food quality and the brunch vibe. Great views of the harbour. Nice Service.
Food was excellent. We really enjoyed the restaurant and we didn’t feel rushed. Would recommend highly.
Delicious food with a diverse menu, waitress was so friendly and helpful. Loved doing family style and trying a lot of different dishes
Very cool place!  Amazing food, stellar decore and different and impressive entertainment.

Because it is so hard to get a reservation online we had to go for a late lunch around 3:30. The only seating was outside. The view isn’t great from out there, the sun was shining directly in my face. There was no music playing or anything. I understand their hype is for dinner in the lounge but they could definitely do better for lunch. The food was pretty good but honestly overpriced for a lunch menu without a great ambiance.
Brought my friend here because it’s a staple if you’re coming to Seattle and it was great like usual. Food was great, service was great, and the drinks were great too!
Delicious food and great staff. I highly recommend. They also have a lot of actually good vegetarian options.
Get your reservations early, this Seattle gem never goes out of style.
Thomas was fun! Food was spectacular! Ambiance is a 10.
If you have one night in Seattle, this is the place to go. A great ambiance, fsntastic food in the heart of the market!

Food was excellent. My husband and I shared a green salad. Very fresh mixed greens with a lite vinagrette and a few edible flowers on top.  My husband had the Parpedelle Bolognese.  It was the best version since we had it in Tuscany. I ordered the Scallops and they were the best Scallops I think I have ever had. Absolutely Delicious. If I had one complaint it would be I wish the entertainment would start before 9pm.
My favorite restaurant in Seattle!  Amazing food and cocktails.  Perfect service.  Great atmosphere!
Great service & seafood!

This was our fourth visit and it is still a great way to spend the evening.
The service was exemplary from the moment we walked in. Everyone was friendly, professional and helpful. 
Our party of four all enjoyed the food very much. I had the salmon - delicious. The menu has something to suit everyone. 
A great environment - well worth it... But reserve your table well in advance, it's always busy.
We were on vacation and this restaurant met all our expectations.  The food was amazing, and we actually found the pink door!

We were visiting Seattle for the first time and The Pink Door came highly recommended. It was our last night in Seattle before our Alaskan Cruise and we wanted to end it with a special dinner. We had Caprese tomatoes, ziti with grilled sausage, and chicken with ground pistachios and cheese filling. Our dessert was the lemon mascarpone cheesecake...yummy. Service was excellent.

We stopped in here the night before our Alaskan cruise! Amazing! They took my gluten free need very seriously and service was top notch! The summer risotto, clams and muscles, and panne cotta were to die for!

The waitress was horribly rude when I’ve asked for butter. When she brought out the bread, I ask for butter again? It took her 15 mins to bring it with a smirk, as she rolled her eyes. The butter was not even close to half a  tablespoon. Wow! For a high end restaurant, you can be really cheap and rude on giving your paying customer butter.
Wonderful ambiance, cuisine and staff

Service was great! Dinner reservations are hard to procure so it’s nice that lunch is such an easy option. It was a bit warm in the restaurant and we needed to request ice for our water to try to not sweat during the meal. I ordered the crab risotto and it was just okay. Dessert was blah along with the garlic breads We started with. The fried rice ball appetizer with fontina cheese was great! I usually go once a year to this place and order the lasagna, which is always pretty good, but I decided to switch it up. There are better fine dining places in the city, I think their reputation supersedes the actual food. Out of 10 stars I’d give Pink Door a 6.

Everything was perfect. I was a little sad when I didn’t get gnocchi with my scallops instead got a polenta. I really ordered that dish for the gnocchi. I wish I would had the choice on whether to change my dish or not.

We had a hard time find it as the is no sign. If you don't want to put up a sign, you might say they is no sign on the website.
We had a great time and the staff and food were fabulous!
The service was great and their signature lasagna was amazing! I will go back the next time I visit Seattle!
The ambiance is very nice, but the food is just ok.  It’s not worth the price.  Our salmon was over cooked and the pizza crust was burnt .
Delightful food, a lovely roof deck on a warm afternoon, and a wonderful place to celebrate our anniversary.
Our first visit to this wonderful hidden gem. It was a pleasurable experience from start to finish. The room is beautifully decorated, the staff attentive, friendly and informative.
Great food and show
The place has a nice vibe to it. The decor is very pretty. The food was decent but the service was pretty good.
Everything was fantastic, the food, the ambiance, the service!  A must do dining experience while in Seattle! Be sure to make a dinner reservation in the bar area to see the fabulous aerialist!
Loved everting about Pink Door.  The trapeze artist was amazing!  We made reservations 30 days in advance.  Definitely recommend!
The service was too rushed for us.
Reunion of old friends, wonderful food , great service and wonderful outdoor seating for lunch

A unique atmosphere (we ate outside), and our server, Shandra, was excellent (considerate in waiting for our group's chatter to die down) and engaging. The food was very good, although my wife's lunch was slightly lukewarm. We'd love to go back, particularly when there's entertainment.

Second time being in Seattle and second time at the Pink Door.  Coincidence, not. First time was pure chance we found it, literally, lol.  Pink doors do not show themselves in the dark.  
Always recommend this place to anyone visiting Seattle.  Great atmosphere, neat vibe.  I do miss the “before renovation” atmosphere but eating outside was quite nice.  
Food is lovely but mostly enjoy the ambiance.
Best deck for summer lunch in Seattle. Great food and ambiance can’t be beat
The atmosphere was friendly and relaxing. We all thoughlt enjoyed the bruschetta. We will dine there again.  Anita
The Pink Door is a Seattle Treasure.  It has maintained its excellence through the years and is a great place for lunch or a celebratory dinner.

Fantastic restaurant. All the fabulous reviews are true.  Food, ambiance, service -everything is as good as it gets.  Sit on the patio and have the lasagna. Absolutely divine!  So think about it.  No sign, no advertising because they dont need it -its fabulous.
We had a wonderful dinner at Pink Door last week. The chicken and caprese were on the average side, but the lasagna was amazing. Great view and service.

Great spot close to the market! We sat outside on their gorgeous patio, much quieter than indoors and filled with all different types of flowers. The food was great, our server was nice, and the ambiance was very enjoyable.
Everything was outstanding!
Beautiful setting, excellent food, a wonderful dining experience.
Wife’s birthday
We were celebrating the birthday of a friend from the mid-west and the Pink Door was perfect! Great view, food, and ambiance!

I love this place- great ambiance, yummy food. Only reason not 5* is the server was weird! We asked for his recommendations and he just said look at the menu. Then when asked between two items he also couldn't answer. Not sure if he was subbing that day or just didn't care. I love Pink Door though.
Dinner and a show! The performance was so tasteful and really added to our experience!
Food was delicious, best lasagna ever! Make a reservation if you are going to be in the area. It is worth it!

We were a group of 6 and we had a fabulous lunch at the Pink Door.  The service could not have been better, the food was excellent and we were impressed with the portion size.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Excellent place!! Better that what I was
Told. Muy recomendado!

Is this a fun place to eat? Absolutely. Are you going to receive a good meal? No doubt. Is this an incredible culinary experience? Eh. It’s good food, not great. The fries are phenomenal. The rest of the food is good. The experience is delightfully pink.

So, the food was good. Well made, what you's expect for better quality non-microwaved dining (yay!) But the thing I cannot get over was the anti-gun violence drink. I can't really remember the name but it was something like that. Here's the thing...it had yellow charatreuse!, vodka, and lemon and it was my favorite drink ever.

Also the server had really great teeth. He gave us champagne because it was our anniversary. We sat at a window and stared at the market and the Sound. It was pretty awesome. 

I did almost unplug a lamp with my purse, so watch out for chords.

Service was great.  Very friendly staff.  Great views!  Food was good but not great; I was anticipating better with the high reviews I've read prior to our visit.  I would go back if a friend wanted to go but would not seek it out.
Everything we had was outstanding!!! The arachini are a must and so is the lasagna!

I've been here multiple times. The service and ambiance is always on point. This time, the food was so so. Wasn't terrible, but wasn't anything special. I ordered the crab risotto and there was an underwhelming amount of crab sprinkled on top. The crab is the only reason why I picked the dish in the first place. It wasn't anything to write home about. The garlic bread was to die for though. I would have been happy with just that as my meal.

Must try mussels and clams here! Their vongole pasta is a killer. The restaurant is located by the Pike Place Market.  We were seated by the window and it had a nice view of the market and beach. Parking can be a little difficult. Would recommend making a reservation ahead of time.

Absolute best restaurant in Seattle. Went for lunch the day we arrived in Seattle before our Alaska cruise and the day our cruise was over. We sat outside and it was so pretty and airy. The food was fabulous and my personal favorite was the tri-color tomato bruschetta. Tomatoes as fresh and ripe as you could hope for. The saffron arronchini was great as well. Meatballs, pasta dishes and a specialty pizza (prosciutto, burrata) were all amazing. They have specials everyday in addition to their regular choices. Also nice summer cocktails and even the house White was nice. But both times we had lunch, the staff could not have been more professional or personable. They were so attentive but we never felt rushed. They were stellar! All in all, a perfect experience and one I will be sharing with everyone I know traveling to Seattle! Don’t miss it!
Food and service were amazing! Best lasagna I have ever had!
The Pink Door was fantastic!  Great food, amazing ambiance and nice views from the main dining room.  I would definitely return the next time I am in Seattle.
Celebrating 25th Anniversary
Wonderful we love the ambience we enjoyed our meals I had a Dungeoness crab risotto my husband had a ragu pepper deli pasta and we loved the trio Gelato dessert

First time visiting Seattle, and Pink Door was at the top of the recommendation list, so we gave it a shot. It was tough to get a reservation at a normal meal time so we went at 3pm on the patio. The food and service were amazing. It was a great way to start off our trip.

The place is hard to find, but the once you do it was great.  The food was great.  The waiter was great also. We ask about what would be good.  He gave us some ideas.  We pi led several different types.  Everything was great. Would come back anytime I'm in Seattle.

Food, service and atmosphere is outstanding. When my family and friends come from out of town,  I bring them here and they love it. I highly recommend this place to anyone.  The talented performers are also amazing and must see. Thank you and keep up the great service.

I celebrated my birthday lunch with my fiancee at The Pink Door. Our coworkers recommended this place for dinner for their entertainment, but unfortunately, the night we wanted to go didn't have any availability for dinner anymore. Our experience was still delightful. I ordered the rigatoni with meatballs and my fiancee ordered the lasagna. Wow, we were blown away with how delicious the lasagna was!! Probably one of the best lasagnas I've ever tasted. Our waiter was kind enough to include a candle with my dessert for my birthday. We had a nice view of the water and the end of Pike Place Market. Would love to come back and experience their dinner and entertainment the next time we are in Seattle.
Great experience. Arrived 30 minutes early and was able to be seated right away. Waiter was great and tentative. Food was really good. Good ambiance with nice water view.
The food tasted amazing and staff was very observant about trying and refilling bread for us. We had a window table and enjoyed the view of the harbor and skyline.

We had a lovely summer evening and sat on the terrace. It was a joy dining with a great view, really great mural, and happy and seemingly content staff and customers. Our waitress was a joy in personality and knowledge about the food and beverages. (I will try to find her name and edit my review.) The food was delicious and generous. A lovely, mainly green salad was beautifully dressed. The lasagne, which has been on the menu for 37 years was lovely, as was the clams and pasta with meaty chunks of bacon. We were so happy we returned to the Pink Door to celebrate our 43 anniversary.

Impeccable food.  Service was attentive enough -- never had to wait too long for any of our food or drinks.  Bit pricey for the portion size but they get to do that after being open for nearly 40 years now!  They're clearly doing a lot of things right.

Love this place!!!!
Great place for a date night or birthday celebration.

It is very important to make reservations.  Very popular due to the food, atmosphere and service.
The only difficulty is standing in line at entry.  Steep stairway, no waiting or sitting area.  Again, reservation is necessary.   The staff is super friendly..
We loved all the selected dishes.  Dominique was the perfect waiter.  He really took care of us.  Highly recommended for Italian cuisine.
The food was absolutely amazing!

Everything we ordered was absolutely perfect! We especially loved the bruschetta and the cioppino. Highly recommend grabbing a carafe of the house wine - it was a wonderful red and well worth the price!
Must go while in Seattle.  It's a lovely setting.  everything delicious

Best dining experience in all of Seattle!
A must go every time I visit Seatley
Our food was amazing as always and our waiter was fantastic. This has been one of our favorite spots for about 35 years.
Fun atmosphere and delicious food! Great service.

Fantastic place.  On my “not to be missed” list whenever I am in Seattle. Have never had anything other than EXCELLENT food here. Very fresh ingredients, simple and clean presentation, healthy portions. They have three seating areas and all are FUN and comfortable. House red wine is very weak - and service is always attentive but rarely fast. You will never be disappointed here.

The Pink Door has always been fabulous, but the recent renovation is amazing.  They now have a view of the waterfront from their new indoor seating area. Our food was delicious and our waiter was outstanding! Well done!

Was super happy with our service, food and beautiful atmosphere. 
The only complaint was how rude the Ariel dancer was. I did not appreciate how flirty she was with my boyfriend. It table was next to the ring so she came over by abruptly plopping herself into him while we were eating to explain that he will be part of the show if he wasn't careful (which I totally understand and makes complete sense). She over extended her stay to say the least. Nor was she making were contact with anyone at the table of 4 but him. Made it uncomfortable to the point of him no longer speaking it engaging with her.

We enjoyed the best spot on the patio on a perfect summer evening! The view of the water, the beautiful flowers, and the lovely pergola provided the perfect setting for the classically delicious Italian cuisine. The corn and crab risotto was sublime and perfect to share as a course before enjoying the lamb chops.
The service was impeccable; warm, personable, professional.

Absolutely fantastic! Best Italian place in Seattle coming from part Italian people, amazing and very reasonably priced. Saw the aerial show as well which was great. Highly recommend but need to book in advance.

AMAZING!!  The food is innovative and well prepared. The service was spot on, except for one plate that stayed on our table for a very long time. Usually not a big deal except for the fact that our table was quite small. Our reservations were made the first day Possible in July, yet we were not given a window table. Did it impact our experience? No!
Wonderful experience! Every dish was perfectly prepared. Our best meal in Seattle!
What's behind the Pink Door is an exceptional experience.  Great view, tremendous food and very good service.
So great - lovely spot. Great location, food, service - terrific family dinner

We made reservations a month in advance for dinner.
We received a friendly welcome and were seated
 right away. Our server was excellent! The food was outstanding!
The show was beautiful! Highly recommend

Our group had a nice afternoon lunch overlooking the market and the waterfront. The appetizers were excellent, including the cheese plate and the bruschetta. The entrees were all delicious, including flank steak, penne with sausage and several seafood dishes.

However, the best part of the experience was the service. We wanted for nothing, but the service was not at all intrusive.  Our server was very knowledgeable and able to answer all questions during the ordering process.

On top of that, the menu was very reasonably priced. Highly recommended!

Lives up to the rep! Food was phenomenal. Seafood was super bright - perfectly complemented with not overpowered seasoning to let the freshness shine. Pasta was amazing. One of the best meals I’ve had in years. (And I dine well!)
Amazing dinner ,  Food , ambiance,  attention to detail of serving staff amazing!
Great wine and food.  Fabulous service!   Lovely evening.

The Pink Door is a Seattle gem.  Nestled within the Pike Place Market, the discreet pink door leads to culinary delights and a joyful quintessential Seattle dining experience.  Casual and a local favorite.

Mybonly complaint is I ate here my second to last night in Seattle and didnt have chance to go back. If I had known how wonderful it was would have gone every night. Food and atmosphere was the best. Outdoor seating area was perfect.
Perfect in every way!
My girlfriend’s birthday meal was a really wonderful experience at the pink door. Excellent local seafood and seasonal ingredients!
We loved our experience at the Pink Door! We recommend getting the cheese platter appetizer. The cheese and pairings were delicious!!
Lovely experience,, great service , cozy atmosphere and great food...
Great food and our server was amazing!
Great meal and romantic environment. We enjoy their meal!!! It is a must to go there.

I ordered the squid ink pasta which I read about on Yelp. It was delicious. 

It was difficult to get reservations at night so we went for lunch. The restaurant is tucked away and cute inside, with a patio and ocean view from the main dining room.
Thank you so much for a amazing anniversary dinner. Mario (our server)  was great on all levels.  We will be back next year. Thanks again!

Reservation at 6:30 on a Sunday.  Popular, already crowded, need to book well in advance.  Window table with view of Public Market and harbor.
Mojito and martini to start, both were excellent.
Wife had the Misticanza salad with nice selection of greens; I had the Pink Door Caesar, no anchovies.
She had the risotto with crab meat and corn which was very nicely done.  I had the lamb porterhouse, a generous portion with beans and an artichoke flan-type side.
Three scoops of ice cream shared took care of the dessert side.
Mario B. was our server and took the time to ask the bartender and kitchen about questions we had regarding preservatives and allergies.
Fantastic fun great food.   Loud.
Absolutely delicious!  Great service!  Would recommend to anyone visiting Seattle.
I had an amazing experience at The Pink Door. The food and service was beyond excellent, the seating was perfect, and I had a very memorable and enjoyable time there.
Great spot; great service and food!  And, the location is perfect for a Market day.  The risotto was stellar!
Great food. We really enjoyed the ambiance and service was very good.
Service was the best... food was good but not a lot of choices...
Lives up to the hype as seen on TripAdvisor and other websites.  Outstanding food and experience.  Will return the next time I am in Seattle.
Everything was good. Not fantastic like everyone told me.
One of the best Seattle restaurants! Food is so yummy!

Terrific in all respects.   Friends and I have come to the Pink Door for decades.  I am delighted with the new room with the broad view of the Sound.  Food the same, servers and everyone who works there as charming as always, only thing new is the room with the view.
The food was amazing but our server Lola was outstanding.   She was on top of everything.   She made great suggestions and would bring what we needed before we could even ask for them.

An oasis in a very busy spot
Wonderful food
Very attentive and knowledgeable waitperson
Lovely
Amazing food and service for my fiance's birthday.
best italian place i’ve been to in a long time, very comfortable with great quality food.
High quality ingredients. Imaginative preparation. Great facility.
The food and waitstaff was wonderful. I would recommend this restaurant anytime to anyone!

Went with my mom for lunch during our road trip and that was a pleasant experience. Everything was well prepared. As for main dish we enjoyed white king salmon the most. It was tender and moist. The sauce was tangy and light along with combination of various local veggie. We had gelato and cheesecake for desert. We have had gelato all over Italy but this one is better. It was super silky and light. A perfect finish for the meal.  My mom said she would fly here just for gelato!

The food and service were great. We were a bit disappointed to learn that the entertainment is not a routine part of the dining experience, as that was one of the features we'd thought would be so unique about The Pink Door.

It’s hard to answer if I would recommend this restaurant or not. Yes AND No. 
It was recommended to us, so we went. We know Italian food well. This food was just ‘ok’. The meatballs were extremely dry. 
The hostess was a little on the unfriendly side. However, the drinks were good and the bruschetta was excellent! Our service was great once we were seated. 
The restaurant was beautiful. 
The main entrees need work. May not be worth it. 
I would say, go for drinks and appetizers and enjoy the ambiance.

Sat outside on the patio on a beautiful day. The crab Caesar was delicious. Service was attentive but not obtrusive. I’ve been coming to the pink door for more than 30 years and they’ve changed with the times appropriately. Still a great restaurant. Still sought after with great food and lots of fun choices. And of course in the middle of the market this is a top notch restaurant.

It’s become  a tradition when my friend visits that I take a day off and we dine here with his mom. We have had the best meals and conversations here. Been lucky enough to get outdoor seating on the deck the past few summers. Food is always excellent and they’re always helpful in avoiding putting garlic in my friend’s mom’s dish when we ask.  She’s a colon cancer survivor and can’t handle digesting garlic. I failed to take photos of our food this time and am writing this review so late I can’t remember what we had. But I know I can never go wrong dinig here
First time at the Pink Door.  Ordered two entrees that are really good if done right but can be really bad if done wrong. The lasagna and grilled sea scallops were both excellent.
We loved the Pink Door! I was so impressed they gave us one of the best views for the acrobat show and also gave us some complimentary Champagne since it was our Honeymoon!
Vacation date night

We had an amazing dinner (as usual); however, this was the first time we caught the Cabaret Show. We notified the hostess that we were interested in the wait list. The staff was amazing! They set us up right in the front row. Great show and great staff!

Great fun, old speakeasy vibe-wonderful food and service, outstanding view! Our only problem was finding it-GPS got us in neighborhood, had to ask 2 local security guards where it was (hint, look for the alley with the tables and lights above the PPMarket)!

I did not think I would be heading out for Italian food on our familys Pacific Northest trip, but the Pink Door came hightly recomended. I am so glad we went.  The place is fun and quirky, the location is in the heart of the wharf area, and the food was amazing. Their signature lasagna was out of this world, I had home made squid ink pasta that was great and my sons bolognese was poerhaps the best I have had. Sorry we dont live closer.
I didn't find the food to be anything special.   Would not return next time visiting Seattle or recommend.   To note, I was not there during a show.   7:15pm on a Saturday night on the patio.
Really, enjoyed our meal.  The waiter was good, he was especially helpful in helping us decide on a wine.
Service was great and food was very fresh and tasty!
Nice birthday celebration.

The outside patio on a nice weather day is a fantastic place for lunch during a visit to Pike’s Place market. Right inside the market blocks, but you’d never know it in this secluded restaurant. Great food, service, and ambiance.
Great food. Fabulous French fries
Trip to Seattle. Lasagna delicious.
Lovely experience sitting on the patio. Raining outside but we stayed cozy and dry. Views were great even with the cloud cover. Food and wine amazing. Would go back.

Dined here during our trip to Seattle. Besides getting a little lost trying to find the door, we had a great time at the restaurant! Food and service was absolutely amazing. Glad we found this spot on google!

I love restaurants that surprise and delight - The Pink Door hit all the buttons.  From an unassuming entrance, visitors are treated to a beautiful view of the restaurant as they enter and look from above.  The lighting and interesting décor creates a beautiful ambiance.  The food and service was A+ the live Jazz music was the icing on the cake.  I hope I get to travel to Seattle again.  This will be on my "must go to " list.
The Pink Door is my favorite place to celebrate. Service, food and ambiance are all amazing.
Excellent food as always. Service this time was somewhat lacking. This would not stop us from coming back.

The reviews on this place are great. Its not terrible, but for the hype and price I was pretty disappointed. On the waiter's recommendation I tried the rigatoni, I can only assume that the noodles came from a box at Safeway. My partner and I each ordered a cocktail, they both tasted like scented soap. 
The food was meh, I would have not been horribly disappointed if this is what I had gotten at Olive Garden, but there is a reason I didnt go to Olive Garden. The drinks were pretty terrible.

Loved the restaurant, food was very good with plenty of choices.
The service was excellent and friendly.
We were not rushed even though they were busy.
We had my sisters birthday here, it was beautiful well lit and not too loud. The meal was amazing, I had a summer pasta dish. We loved it!

Birthday 
I have been coming here for over 30 years. Always a treat
Making a reservation is complicated.

The Pink Door was absolutely incredible! It was a tad difficult to find but was a wonderful experience once we found our way. The interior was absolutely stunning and the food was top tier, high quality authentic Italian delicacies. The price range was average for a restaurant, ranging between the cheapest $5 appetizers and the more expensive almost $30 plates, but a quality far betond any other I have ever been to. Absolutely delicious, filling, and beautiful. Would 100% recommend for business meals, dates, or family outings. Wonderful!
Awesome dining experience and the band awesome!

This place was so amazing!  There were so many things to choose from I had a hard time deciding.  I went with Dungeness crab risotto and was not disappointed!  My dad got the lasagna and my mom got the seared scallops.  Everything was delicious!  I will definitely go back my next time in Seattle.

On time. Excellent service.  Excellent food & menu. A taste for everyone. Highly recommended.
Thank you.
Stopped here for our anniversary dinner while on vacation. Great time! Excellent service and food. Definitely recommend.
Amazing! Highly recommend the Pink Door!

Great place
Hard to find though as I didn’t see any signs.
Excellent service and incredible food. Definitely one of the best in Seattle.
There's a reason the place has been open for 30+ years.  Would definitely go back!
The decor and service was great. But the entertainment was only  a few minutes long and the food we didn't enjoy too much. Everything else was great but the food will keep us from going again

Finally got a table here. Seated by the window with view of the water. Tables spaced very well. Waiter was excellent. Happy, patient and attentive. Funky decor. Drinks perfect. Food delicious and fresh. Bread yummy. Go!
What a treat of a place! Super amazing service, beautiful view, delicious food. The prices were very fair as well. Will definitely be back!
Amazing! Two hours of incredibly flavorful food, great service and perfect ambiance for a birthday dinner! Bolognese pappardelle is sublime, could eat this everyday!!
The food was delicious! The atmosphere is nice as well!
I am visiting for a few days and my friend said this was a MUST when she visited herself. And it was lovely!! The food was amazing! The service and atmosphere also great!

Celebrating 70th birthday and first visit to Seattle. The restaurant lived up to its excellent ratings. From the food, atmosphere, and service made for a very wonderful delightful dining experience. Would highly recommend a visit
Call and find out about aerialist performances and dining locations to see them.
This gem is a straight up winner all day everyday, our waiter was present but not overbearing. Cant get enough of the Pink Door love....
Just loved everything, will go again for sure!  Great evening with a friend from PA!
My daughter’s 13th birthday. The waiter was perfect. He knew every little detail about the menu. It was a pleasant experience
THOMAS was awesome!!! So very helpful with menu and drinks and general information! Loved everything about this restaurant!!

We shared that we were having an anniversary dinner. They seated us along a window with a beautiful view. Our server was so fun and amazing. We constantly had our water refilled. The food was amazing. Can’t wait to come back.

Good food and atmosphere but our service was horrible, made us not want to go back.  Server asked if we wanted an appetizer and we ordered one with him. When it had not showed up for 25 minutes and tables that sat down after us were getting their meals, we asked and he said he forgot. He never asked how we wanted the steak cooked. It showed up extremely rare and even after sending back it to make medium it was still on the rare side. He knew nothing about wine but at least he admitted that and brought out a tablet that gave a full description of each wine. At the end of dinner he put both the check and the then later the credit card receipt for signature in between my wife and my son's date when I was clearly the one paying.  When we booked the reso on open door, it asked if this was a special occasion and I checked it was a birthday.  My son's date also said something to the server when she stepped out for moment and nothing ever came of either request.  I finally asked him at the table and he said, "We don't do that unless you want to buy one then I'll put a candle on it".  Seriously, I drop nearly $200, get lousy service and then you can't pop for a scoop of ice cream or a cupcake?  Management - Please train your staff on your time not my nickel and deliver a little something extra, especially when you botch the entire night.  After we left, our conversation for 10 minutes was how the evening was a disaster from a service standpoint. Not the impression you want to give at Pink Door one would think.

Best thing about this place is the view on a good day from the outdoor seating area. They did not have enough staff and our waiter could not manage. We waited a long time to order, a very long time for our food and when it finally arrived it was cold and bland. We couldn’t flag anyone down to refill our drinks nor bring our check. I don’t recommend for a special occasion but would be Ok for a social gathering and drinks. It was also very loud and crowded.

Absolutely lovely! The space is beautiful, with hanging florals everywhere you turn, and the food was even better. The quality of the food was excellent and the portions were generous considering the quality.
The place had great food. Great recommendations on the menu and their wine list is pretty amazing.
Staff was amazing
Great ambiance, great food! Fun for tourists, but wouldn’t visit on a regular basis.
Food was wonderful but very spendy for such small portions.
Wonderful first visit-we enjoyed Caprese salad, scallops, lasagna, and salmon.  Wait staff excellent .

I was a little disappointed.  After all the hype and recommendations for this restaurant I feel like I have had better food.  It was good, not great.  I had the lasagna, while I loved the pasta and the pesto I feel like it needed a little more seasoning.  Maybe just some salt, or a little garlic.  I made the reservation for 3 pm with an outside table requested.  I should have requested "no sun"  we were sat in the sun and I have skin cancer so I cannot sit in the sun.  When I requested to move to another open table I saw we were denied.  We were moved to a very tiny out of the way table in the corner of the patio.  It felt like we were being punished for requesting to move.  So my suggestion is, dont make any particular request or you may be punished and sent to the corner.  The best thing about this restaurant was our server.  She was perfect in every way, such a gem!  I really wish I could remember her name, however we ate at SO many great restaurants and had good service everywhere in Seattle.
A wonderful dining experience, as always, at the Pink Door.
Food was great. Staff was excellent. Garlic bread is a must.

Excellent service, we booked a table inside but preferred an outside one, which could be arranged. Food was nice, wine ( Verdecchio) was lovely.
Would recommend this place, nice atmosphere.

Really dissatisfied with the food. Ordered an octopus salad and the octopus was so chewy. The clam pasta was requested overcooked. It came really al dente so I had to send it back, and although it came little more cooked it was still al dente. The worst part was the flavor. It tasted worse than the clam pasta I easily make at home.  Flavor was off! The only good abt this experience was their herb infused olive oil to dip the bread in.
Fantastically hot pasta -- the key to good pastas that so many restaurants miss.
The food was delicious (the rigatoni is excellent!), the server was extremely attentive and professional, and the ambience and views from the outdoor patio added to the experience.  Highly recommend!

This is my favorite place to bring friends to eat. Views are gorgeous, the restaurant and food are perfection. This is the first time I actually had bad service here. The waitress was overwhelmed and spaced out. This is not usual... Just a one off, I think.
Loved the ambiance and the food/drink were delicious! We made bolognese and mussels/clams. Yum!

The skirt steak was very rare, and we would've appreciated the option to have it more well done. That being said, all the food was high-quality and quite good. What we were really there for, though, was the aerial shows. We watched two of them and were quite impressed.
Outstanding food... so glad we went!! The cheese board was unreal as was the risotto. Not to be missed!

As people traveling from out of state, the Pink Door is a must-visit in Seattle. We had an ocean view from the inside and it had a great ambiance right as we walked in. Our waitress made the afternoon one to remember. When my girlfriend couldn’t decide on food, the kitchen had a special dish made up for her. Would highly recommend to anyone and everyone looking for a nice date with amazing views.
Amazing menu, amazing service.  Amazing atmosphere.  Food was ridiculously amazing.  Recommend!!!
Great service, food and view. Love the Pink Door.
Pasta entree’s unremarkable. Too large scale restaurant for our taste in more intimate dining experience.

I will go again, and this time take a group of friends to see the Trapeze entertainment.
Food was excellent. Entertainment was the BEST!!!!

Everything was fine except I ordered the Caesar Salad with chicken. The chicken was too dry for me to eat. I told the waitress with the idea of giving the chicken back & just eating the salad. However, she took the plate away & said a new one would be back shortly. Bottom line was, the new salad never showed up. The other 3 people had finished their meal and were ready to order dessert. The waitress came back & discovered I never received my meal. I ended up getting it to go and we all ordered dessert. They gave me my meal at no charge. Everyone else enjoyed their meal and the desserts were great.
Totally enjoyed it ...but I’m not happy my open table points we’re denied please explain that to me.

Pink door indeed has the best lasagna in town. Went thr for the second time and wasn't disappointed at all. They could definitely have more vegetarian options for appetizers.
Desert was as usual exquisite and delicious.
We had a great family dinner celebrating our anniversary.  All five of us enjoyed our meals very much.  We will definitely be back.

There was nothing special about the Pink Door except the decor and ambiance. We did not attend one of the shows, just a late lunch. The pasta was good but not remarkable, the size was generous, but overall quite expensive (understandable given the location). Unless you're constrained to the area, I would recommend pasta elsewhere.
It was neat going through the hidden pink door and the service was amazing! The food was okay and although we had a great table outside there really wasn’t a view of anything.
Great restaurant, beautiful dining room, good food, super service!!
delicious food, lovely relaxed atmosphere, great place!
Our waiter was absolutely phenomenal!!
We're so happy that we went to the Pink Door. The food was wonderful as well as the service. The interior decor was very interesting. A "must do" in Seattle!

It is not often when a restaurant exceeds expectations, but this place did.  Hostess was lovely, welcoming, and quick to get us seated.  You guys ever meet that lovely young hostess at that awesome eatery.  She's hot, she knows it, and she treats most of us as if she is doing us a favor to even grace us with her time much less alone a table at her place of employment where she might be making $17 an hour.  I detest this hostess, occasionally it is a male but usually female.  Anyway I digress, this hostess was lovely and nice.  My only complaint was that i came in with a starbucks nitrobrew that was half finished.  The hostess told me i could not bring outside drinks s to the table.  I proceeded to inform her that most fine dining establishments allow outside drinks if they are transferred to another glass.  Anyway she consulted the manager  and voila my coffee was intact.  The waitress was a saucy little number who exuded confidence and charm.  All the food was perfect, from the bread with olive oil, to the caesar salad with crab, to the handmade lasagna.  We also had a pappardelle with bolognese, rigatoni with marinara sausage, and meatballs.  Then we had a berry shortcake!!  Everything was amazing!!

We ordered the cioppino as an app and rigatoni w/ meatballs and pappardelle for our entrees. The hype is real. The best pasta we have ever tasted. 

Be sure to book your reservation well in advance and try the watermelon margarita. Unfortunately, we were stuffed but if you have the opportunity order dessert, the lemon curd cheesecake to be exact!

We loved this place!  We had a beautiful table on the water. The food was delicious.  I had the stuffed chicken and my husband had the pink door lasagna. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Seattle.
Great atmosphere and delicious food.
Excellent food and service! Favorite restaurant during our stay in Seattle!

We had a beautiful view and delicious food! Bruschetta for an appetizer as well as a cocktail for each my date and I. Lasagna and risotto (seasonal) were fantastic. Dessert kept the amazing flow as well. Service was absolutely stellar. The restaurant itself is gorgeous and so much fun stuff to look at.  Absolutely exceeded all expectations!

The Pink Door is always a favorite regardless of weather - and yesterday it rained so we were pleased to have the option of a lovely inside table looking out at the view. The lunch was delicious, service good and a perfect environment for some long time friends catching up over a lengthy lunch!
Very fun dinning experience in the bar with the aerialist. Food was very good, service fine.

We had a great seat on the patio with a waterfront view. Our server was friendly and provided great service. The outdoor area could be improved. The food was okay, but there are better restaurants in the area. We did enjoy a fun show to end our Pink Door experience.

After a fun though tiring morning at Pike Market, my visiting European friends and I enjoyed drinks and a delicious meal for each of us on the outdoor deck with a view.  And only a few steps away from the market.  Lovely!
Had an amazing time at the PInk Door! The food and service were exceptional. We sat on the patio and it was so cute and quaint, but had big views of the sound!
Had a fantastic last night in Seattle at Pink Door! Definitely make a reservation here, everything from the food to the environment was lovely.

Service was excellent and the food was very good. We went on a Sunday and was able to see the acrobat show. We sat in the main dining room, and when she was about to preform the waitress came over to our table to tell us. We walked into the bar and watched...very cool! Additionally, there was a very tiny mix up with our reservations and seating. When I brought it to their attention, they quickly corrected the problem and they gave us a complimentary appetizer...totally unnecessary, but very nice!  I would definitely go back to the Pink Door.

Amazing! Loved it so much we went back the next night. Clams and Muscles were the best we had in Seattle. The fresh pasta was delicious! Staff was amazing and the aerial dancers on Sunday and Monday were phenomenal!
Anniversary. We live in Alaska. We celebrate our anniversary almost every year at the Pink Door. It never disappoints.

Amazing food and service! Authentic Italian, with a very flexible menu that the waiters are more than happy to work with you on if you have allergies or specific preference. Great atmosphere and look as well.
Amazing! Everything was great!

Still my favorite restaurant in Seattle after over 20 years. Had the NY steak and it was cooked to perfection and the taste was delicious. Wonderfully seared to a crisp on the outside and perfectly medium rare inside.
Favorite restaurant in Seattle. The food never disappoints. Service is always excellent, and the location can't be beat.
My husband and I enjoyed a late lunch on the patio. Our server was wonderful and the food delicious!

We were able to sit on the deck. A great spot. Bruschetta doesn’t start until July 3.😩
We’ll return!
Great ambience, delicious food. Tge quintessential relaxing lunch on a summer.
my mom had a great Birthday at the Pink Door!
We had a wonderful evening at The Pink Door. We will definitely return!  Delicious food, excellent service, and a lovely ambiance.
Was there for anniversary and was fantastic!  Food, service and drinks..all terrific!!!

Like a lot of people. I had heard about Pink Door long before planned my first trip to Seattle. It did not disappoint. Besides the fab food, attentive staff and interesting decor, there’s also a magic there.  I had raw oysters followed by a beautiful “everything green” salad then the rockfish branzino/whole style. All amazing.
The food was good. Disappointing service for what was supposed to be a special celebration dinner. Very disappointing.

The quality of the food is always excellent!  Highly recommend Cioppino, which is way better than what you can get in San Francisco.   You will not be disappointed no matter what you order.
It's better to make your reservation one month ahead.

Wow. Just wow. Had not been to the Pink Door in 15 years - last time I was there was for my sister’s bridal shower. Let’s just say I do not know why I stayed away so long. The outside deck, food, service were fantastic.
I’ve eaten Italian food all over the world. This is second only to Milan. Amazing flavors in a gorgeous atmosphere.

Service was excellent. We sat outside which was really nice.  We had clams and mussels, everything green salad and risotto.  All were excellent.  Have the ricotta cheesecake for dessert    It was delicious

Great food, service & atmosphere. 
I messed up & thought our reservation was for 9pm instead of 9:45.........They still seated us immediately!
What a great dining experience. The food and atmosphere were amazing. The Pink Door Lasagna is awesome.
The ambiance and service was wonderful. The food was classic.

We had an amazing end to our girls weekend here. Our seat request was honored with a smile. Our waiter was patient with our questions. Most importantly, the food was brilliant and wine selection was perfection.
Great meal and excellent service.
My out of town business guests enjoyed the view form the outside dining area and were very pleased with their dish choice.  I look forward to going back with my wife.

We returned after dining at the Pink Door for the first time to celebrate our wedding anniversary two years ago. Linguine Vongole was dry and portion of both pasta dishes were rather small, even for someone who doesn't eat a lot in one sitting.
I highly recommend the Antipasto - the full order is good for 4 people. Their main courses are not recommended for sharing. I also recommend the Linguine Alle Vongole and Lasagna Pink Door.
One of the absolute BEST meals we have had in Seattle!

Evan was our waiter and he was wonderful!  Gave us extra time to order and was very patient as we were so busy talking and not looking at the menu! Great service and food fabulous. Love the “new” dining room...decor, view, big windows.
Consistently superb! Very attentive waitperson, yummy specials and I love being able to have gluten free pasta dishes---such a rare treat when dining out. Cheers!

We were in Seattle on vacation 
A friend told us to go to pink table
We are so glad he did!!
Fantastic!!
This is my favorite restaurant in Seattle... hands down! The service is incredible, the wine list is amazing and the food is delectable. The cheese board and oysters are our favorite!
Had a truly perfect evening. The food was exceptional, the waitstaff friendly and attentive, and the ambiance wonderful. This is a not-to-be-missed restaurant if you find yourself in Seattle.

Fresh and delicious food, attentive but not intrusive staff, great atmosphere, and bringing my European guests through the unmarked pink door was priceless.  The shoes on the restroom doors weren't bad either.

I loved the ambiance and the service at this restaurant. The lasagna was the best I've ever had. Our server suggested the best wines to go with appetizer, entre and dessert. It was a really good pairing with wine. Would love to be back again.

Seriously, one of the best meals and dining experiences I've had in quite a while. Very seldom do you eat at a restaurant and all four meals are wonderful. Tonight was one of those nights. Among the four of us, we had the lasagna, cioppino, linguini and clams, and the special fish, which was salmon. Sevice was wonderfulI, and the evening entertainment was also fun. If I could give 6 stars I would! Highly recommended...make reservations.
Amazing food and atmosphere. The Aerialist performance was breathtaking.

As soon as we entered we saw how greatly decorated the place was. We were greeted very kindly upon arrival and they met our request of having a view of pike’s place. Our waiter was very professional and gave us great recommendations that we absolutely loved! We came to Seattle and heard about this place and it surely did not disappoint! Our view + the service + the exquisite food equaled the perfect meal! We had the lasagna and oh my goodness! The lasagna was to die for! Will definitely come again for great pasta and drinks when in Seattle!
Wonderful meal! The server was especially personable and helpful. The atmosphere was celebratory. The food was just right in every way. We will be back!
Excellent, great to be back after all these years.  Made sure to visit after living in San Diego for past 18 years.  Missed the delicious spinach lasagna.  Could have eaten two portions😍🍴
Truly outstanding.  Delicious little neck clams sweet and succulent with linguini and just the right touch of red pepper flakes.  Chock full of clams enough for one with every bite.
Loved this place so much. Our server thomas made the experience so above and beyond that we came back the next day for lunch. Amazing food and such a special spot. Thank you!!
Food was mediocre at best. The noise level was high. The ambiance was typical Seattle, al most non-existence.

great experience.  Had their roasted garlic, rack of lamb, cioppino and salmon special.  e
Everything was delicious.  The only small issue was the salmon was a little too salty.  We had great service and an overall great time.

The Pink Door has been recommended by so many people when I mentioned I was going to Seattle. The second time to Seattle we made sure to make reservations. The food was carefully crafted and delicious. The specialty cocktail I had was creative and tasted so good. The atmosphere was everything you could hope for when having lunch on a Friday afternoon. We sat in the outdoor area bc the weather was too nice to sit inside but the inside is decorated so beautifully. I hope to come back for the burlesque show on a Saturday night! Loved the Pink Door! Can’t want to go back!
My husband got the sausage & rigatoni’s & the sausage was dry.
Amazing food! Sat outdoors and it was lovely! Service was great! Can’t wait to go back the next time we are in town!

We had high hopes for this restaurant and several people told us this was an excellent place in Seattle. After walking into an unmarked door, we walked into what felt like a dungeon with a strange smell. As we were seated, we noticed our utensils were dirty. Our waitress was not friendly and seemed to merely tolerate us. 

The menu was basic, the food was average and the pasta was very dry. The saving grace was the live music, which we enjoyed but the bread and oil was probably the best part of the meal. Never a good thing. We made the reservation over a month in advance and could only get a table at 9:15 pm so we were very disappointed we wasted one of our precious nights eating here.
Anniversary

Had my parents and grandma in town and we were able to sit on the outside patio! I always love this restaurant- I switched it up & got the seafood special (halibut) for my meal & it was amazing! Their pasta & specials never disappoint!
Quirky, hip interior and beautiful outside eating  deck with a water view. Suggest thin, easy care cushions for outdoor bench seating...otherwise yummy place! Thank you.
Absolutely amazing.  Came based on recommendations from friends.  Loved it so much that we came back the next day. I'll be here EVERY time I get into Seattle.
Wonderful evening. Everything perfect and the food absolutely delicious. We will be back, a real treasure in Seattle.
Food was delicious and atmosphere / view perfect for our  first night in Seattle... our waiter was friendly and attentive... lived up to recommendations

The restaurant is a gem in Seattle! My parents and I found it by accident and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. Thomas, our server, was very knowledgeable, efficient, and on point. The ambience was comfortable and eclectic. The food was very good with some unexpected and welcome twists.

The Pink Door is very eclectic and the vibe is really unique and cool! Staff is accommodating and service is great. Our food was delicious. The fresh catch was exquisite. We were entertained by a sultry aerialist. Her exotic rope and hoop dan e was quite beautiful and sexy. This capped the outstanding experience we had here.  I highly recommended next time you visit Seattle.
We had a very enjoyable evening. Looking forward to my next visit to Seattle so we can visit your lovely restaurant again.
Beautiful, fun atmosphere with a view, wonderful service, and great food. Awesome bar and pretty dining room for quiet conversation.
High school grad celebration with my niece.

Loved the service and sunset view. Would recommend to go around 8:30-9 and take the waterfront seating to enjoy the sunset. I could not get a table while trying to make early booking so booked seat at the bar. On reaching there they adjusted for a table overlooking the sea. I got lucky and I thoroughly enjoyed the night.
We went to Pink Door to celebrate our anniversary. The food and service was both amazing. The Lasagna Pink door dish is definitely worth trying!

Fantastic spot! Went on Sunday for dinner to celebrate graduation/fathers day. There was an aerial artist who performed three times during our meal (have to sit in “bar area”. Food and staff were superb! Worth waking up early and making the reservation a month prior. Will definitely be back! :)

I am so so happy I listened to other Yelpers and made this a "must go" on my trip to Seattle! We were only seeing the city for one day and with how in demand this place is, decided to go with a 3:00 pm early dinner reservation rather than wait for hours at peak time. It was perfect weather so  we dined on the patio and it was literal perfection. Started off with an amazing bubbly glass of prosecco, then had the rigatoni with meatballs. So fresh and delicious. BUT my biggest advice is to GET THE RICOTTA CHEESECAKE. We asked for a side of strawberries with it. But it was the best thing I have ever tasted in my life. Packed with so much flavor, my friend literally drooled when she took the first bite. Didn't want it to end. They also put a little candle on it for my birthday - loved the acknowledgement! Thank you so much for a great time!

Thank god we had a reservation - there was already a line before they opened! Weather was great so we asked to sit on patio - service was fast, food was delicious - one of our favorite meals and experiences.
Its always a wonderful experience at pink door. We love the veg lasagna here.
Outstanding, as always. Great food, service and setting. A favorite!
Excellent food. One of the best King Salmon dishes ever

Very nice wait staff, good service, nice location. My date enjoyed her entrée (clams and linguine) but mine (tajarin) was bland and disappointing -- not nearly as good as my previous meals at the Pink Door.
Beautiful restaurant and such a cool entrance! The salmon and pasta were great. The steak was kind of tough. Worth checking out!

Hands down the food was amazing but our server, Hayley, definitely ruined our experience. My friend and I felt rushed and the service wasn’t personal nor anticipatory. Being in the service industry myself, I did not feel well taken care of.
At least once every summer I try to have what I consider the quintessential Seattle dining experience, aka having lunch on the Pink Door patio.  Every year it is exquisite in every way.
Food was amazing! All tested so fresh and different. The ambiance is pretty eclectic and cool. The views from the patio are great! A little bit noisy but was worth it...

It was a upbeat place. Very crowded with little space. Very loud. We liked the atmosphere though and the pretty flowers. It would probably be good to have a sign for the first timers or a brighter pink door because it was hard to find. The food was tasty and the dessert was yummy!
Pink Door is always fabulous. Best food, best service, best ambience.  Just remember to make a reservation.

The staff was extremely accommodating when we asked to change seating and our server was kind enough to let us know that even though we’d be changing servers, they had a system so we did not have to tip servers separately.  Have always been a fan of this place.
Lovely late lunch.  Thank you!
Birthday lunch
Friend came in from Colorado

Loved this restaurant so very much! We went here because they were on the top 100 for OpenTable. Heard so many good things and Pink Door did not disappoint! Excellent food, service, atmosphere, and view! Yes
A beautiful restaurant both inside and out on the patio. I would highly recommend a visit for lunch or dinner. I'll be back when I return to Seattle.
The Pink Door never disappoints! It's our favourite restaurant and we live in Canada! We try to get to Seattle a few times a year and we always make a meal there a top priority!
I had the Pink Door crab cake and it was divine!  Loved the aioli sauce!!  I would have licked the plate if I was alone!

Our experience here was amazing to say the least! My husband and I came here for our anniversary and they sat us in what I would say was the best seat in the house to see the aerial performances. The performer was fantastic and very friendly. She came up and greeted us when she was finished with her performances. We started with oysters, then had the salmon (fish of the day), and finished with the chocolate mousse. Everything was delicious! We were so impressed with the service, food, and ambiance. We will definitely come here again!
Was meeting a local friend here after arriving in the city and was very impressed! We had a wonderful server and I was a huge fan of the pasta. Great dessert as well.

We loved our experience at The Pink Door.  The salmon was delicious and the service was perfect. Absolutely loved the hanging baskets of flowers on the porch. We actually had petals falling on our table. It was delightful.

We loved the Pink Door, once we found it!   We aren't too familiar with downtown so we had to ask directions several times even with Google maps.  The dining room is well appointed with a lovely view, and the food was delicious. The highlight however was our waiter.  We were late arriving but he was patient, friendly and professional. A lovely experience for our group of 5.  We will definitely return.
Hi, a sunny day on the deck can't be beat. Should have informed our server that it was a work lunch to have sped up the service.  delightful meal, a must do summer event.
Ate on the patio, lovely view, great service, fantastic ambience.
Wonderful view of the water.  Great location.  One of the best antipasti appetizers ever.  The prices are very reasonable considering the location and quality.  Will definitely return.
Excellent setting on the patio. Great food.
This is one of the best Italian restaurants in my book! It’s a must when visiting Seattle, but be prepared with reservations!
The food was amazing. It was a gorgeous day so we sat outside on the patio that over looked the water. The whole meal was great.
Womderful.  Just wish we couldve been.in the room.with the live.jazz which is why we booked at the day and time.

The food at The Pink Door is exquisite -- I've never eaten anything here that I didn't like! The ambience is also ideal for all occasions, making it a versatile and delightful venue for casual outings and formal celebrations alike! 

I do have mixed reviews about customer service, though. Servers tend to be very friendly and attentive, but I've had issues with the hosts/hostesses on more than one occasion. During my most recent visit, my (large) party and I arrived a few minutes before our reservation time. The hostess was very rude and dismissive of us upon our early arrival. Furthermore, she made no effort to try to seat us together, even though I had called the restaurant TWICE ahead of time to verify that they could accomomodate us. We ended up having to sit at two separate tables, although they did seat us near each other.

My husband and I were charmingly taken with The Pink Door restaurant, which honestly, was a complete surprise! We were expecting it to be a little too frilly for our tastes, but we were wrong! The atmosphere was entirely darling, great views, fantastic service, and the food was AMAZING. Will definitely be back!
Best Lasagna I have ever had! Great staff, great food, great ambiance.
The spring risotto was amazing! And the doughnuts...omg!
Wonderful pastas, great ambience in ideal Pike market location. Good wine list as well.
Great views. Reasonable prices and excellent food if you like pasta.

I have wanted to come here for so long but getting a table is tough. I sat at the bar and was not disappointed--had a great meal. I had the bolognse & ceasar salad and both were excellent. Would highly recommend this spot.
Always fantastic!
Great service and great food. Dominic was wonderful server

The food was good but the portions are small and my dish should’ve included pasta or something in addition to mussels. I paid nearly $40 for one entree and left hungry.

I also thought the ambiance would be more lively considering the website boasts burlesque and aerial performances. 

The service was otherwise great.

Solid 3 of 5.

The Pink Door was an awesome experience in Seattle. We had a great view of the water and ferris wheel out the window, our waiter was very knowledgable and funny, the acrobat was very talented and entertaining, and the food was delicious. I'd recommend sharing dishes between people to taste all the different options.

Amazing place! If you don’t eat at The Pink Door while you are in Seattle you are truly missing out. There’s not a bad seat in the house. Whether you’re dining outside on the deck, inside at the bar or at a table. The food was top notch, the service impeccable. Do yourself a favor and GO!!!

From arizona and booked a table. Had flowers delivered to restaurant from across the street and the restaurant put them in a beautiful vase, which i was not expecting. Our server was on top of his game and made the dietary needs to meet my wife's needs...re-proposed to my wife after twenty years of marriage and could not have had a better setting.

The Pink Door is consistently excellent.  The food is locally sourced and seasonal.  The green salad with peas, shaved asparagus, and fava beans was outstanding.  The service is personal but not intrusive.  And dining outdoors is a treat I look forward to during our Seattle summers.  Highly recommended.
Food and service were impeccable. Would highly recommend.

Exceptional service. Great atmosphere, especially the outdoor seating during moderate weather. We were able to go inside to watch the aerial performance, which was outstanding. Definitely a place to put on your "must do" list.
We love this restaurant!  First time we have been back since the remodel.  Definitely has a different feel, but still wonderful.
Great! Awesome food and service! Loved the original decor and fun atmosphere.
Very nice and delicious food. It took a bit long to get our bread other than that no complaints.. definitely would fly out for a weekend just to go for dinner...
Amelia was fabulous
Great service with a lovely patio. A true Seattle experience.
Brought our out of town guests and we all loved it!
Wonderful food, atmosphere and exceptional service.
Wonderful food. Great view. Terrific service . Our waitress was lovely.
We absolutely love this place. We frequented often. Love sitting out side and enjoying the antipasto was some delicious cocktails. Have a marvelous lunch with my two daughters

Great atmosphere 
Fabulous food and service 
Great venue and views
Top restaurant for us in Seattle

I was, in fact, catching up with an old friend over a leisurely, late lunch. The service was excellent - attentive but respectful of the conversation at the table. The food - all green salad with Jackie's prawns was excellent and I will always love the character of the restaurant. An all time favorite!
We love The Pink Door -- especially their fantastic lasagne!
The food was absolutely amazing!!!

Fabulous food, service and ambiance. The aerial Trapezist was so fun and interesting. And our waitress was engaging and prompt.

I will recommend the Pink Door to everyone!
Lives up to the hype. Excellent atmosphere and food.

Our brunch at The Pink Door was wonderful! We sat outside on the patio overlooking Pikes Place and the water. Food was incredible, fresh and seasonal. I would definitely go back, but next time for dinner because they have terrific entertainment on a nightly basis.
Entrees were good, dessert was fantastic however the service and evening show was phenomenal.
Not as good as usual, the Caesar salad did not taste as fresh as it should have  and i was not happy with the service.
Exceptional food & service. Always a treat to stop here during any trip to Seattle. Am hoping to be able to sit out on the patio one day.
Love the place !!! Deco, ambience, food, service !!!!
Love the deco and the food was great

The Pink Door is always an experience.  I bring all of my out of town guests to the Pink Door.  I find it very loud.  I love energy, but on many occasions, one can scarcely hear the conversation at their own table.

The restaurant was fun and the food was good -- unfortunately our server was not.  We saw a server (just not ours) who was in the room and engaging with her customers constantly, ours was largely absent.  I would return – but hope for a different server.
Service is really great. So knowledgeable.
Amazing food and service. The clams with linguini were prepared perfectly as was my husband's chipping. I highly recommend the trio of smoked fish appetizer. I think I'm in love with smoked trout.
Fabulous lunch!  The pappardelle was excellent.
Well done as always. Great food. Outdoor dining on the deck is the best in the city.
The Server was very nice to us and gave us a Window seat. Food was a bit pricey, but worth it. The only thing I didn't like about the place was that it was was very Noisy.
Fantastic food and amazing server.     I would go definitely go here again!!!
Food was great! Wasn't as expensive as I thought it would have been. I was pleasantly surprised! They had an aerial performer who was incredible! Great evening!
We were well taken care of for my husband’s bday!! Amazing view, excellent service, and the food was incredible. Best meal we’ve had since moving to Seattle and will definitely be back. Thank you!!
Great fun and excellent food. Would return again. Cost was less than I expected for the value received.
This restaurant is fabulous and would like to send a special thank you! To the owner for the delicious desert!

From glancing at the website you can already see that the Pink Door is a very unique place and dining experience. To that I would like to add that the food was delicious and the service was top notch! Our waiter anticipated everything that we needed and was extremely welcoming.  If you're a cocktail fan, I really enjoyed the Aviation and the Manhattan that the bartender made. 10/10 would recommend to anyone looking for a unique dining experience or a restaurant to celebrate a special occasion.
The service was amazing, the food was great. If you go there, go for the seafood definitely. The oysters are very fresh. 👌🏻
Awesome staff, awesome performance, awesome food, awesome ambiance - everything was just right :)

There were four spiders at the table we were sat at and I noticed them just as we finished our appetizer. The spiders were nearly crawling on me and I have a bad phobia of spiders. I stood up to find the server for 5 minutes and finally had to go find her. Then she made us stand in the middle of the restaurant and someone else came and told us there wouldn’t be any seats for us anytime soon. We sat ourselves at a table in the bar area. The server had a very bad attitude and didn’t even so much as ask how she could make our experience better. She instead made us feel like we were such an inconvenience to her for asking to move. Service is terrible at this restaurant.

This was an amazing experience and the food was awesome. Sat in the bar area and the bartender was awesome and so was the service. We are an older couple and were enjoying ourselves UNTIL the young manager came by and inquired if things were okay....basically insinuating that she thought we were fighting. We told her yes that we were having fun and she told me that was fine but she also told me to be civil. Being chastised by a presumptuous twenty something year old in a brutal way left a bad taste in my mouth!

The food is fine but I do not see how it has over 4000 good reviews in yelp and I waited for almost one month to get the seat. The interior design is great and vibes was nice. But really,  I do not see their food is above the average with this price range $40/person. So if you are coming for food, not worth of the waiting.
Service was spectacular. Loved the ambiance. Highly recommend the ragu.

This was my first visit to The Pink Door and it was a real treat.  I took my bride there as a surprise and it certainly was that!  She had no idea where we were going, and was totally confused when we walked up Post Alley to an unmarked pinkish door and entered into the restaurant.
