The ambiance is great, very much like a secret rendezvous, with a terrific view over Elliot Bay, great service and delicious food.
Love the ambience and food, is a must if you are visiting Seattle. Highly recommend the lasagna and pappardelle al ragu bolognese. make reservation ahead
Had a bit of trouble finding the entrance, but aside from that it's a very nice restaurant w interesting menu items and great service.
Favorite spot in Seattle. Done.
Phenomenal evening including delicious food, kind service & a beautiful ambience. Thanks for making my birthday special! Special thanks to Mario, our server. You were great!
Our young waiter was absolutely the best...knew the food very well and not one bit pretentious!!

Worth the experience!
The food and service was awesome.
Love this restaurant. Very impressed that they read my "notes" in my reservation & accommodated my request!
Best restaurant in Seattle! Make sure to get seated at the bar.

Our waitress made our experience so FUN! I think her name was Camelia? Very good service, beautiful setting, and GREAT table with a view! I can never order anything but the lasagna, it's my favorite. Never take it off the menu PLEASE! :)

Make reservations to get best table.  Portions are generous, even if you pay for the split plate fee you will be ahead. We split salad, entree and appetizer and were very full. Service is done with precision, very skilled and confident staff.  Five stars for chef and staff.

It was so great! The food was phenomenal. they knew it was our anniversary and put us right next to the window with views of the bay and brought us complimentary champagne to start!! Couldn’t recommend more :)

The Pink Door has been one of my favorite restaurants for over 25 years.  However, at our last visit we noticed that things have changed.  What used to be a smart, funky, relaxing place to have a great meal has turned in to an upscale Applebees.  Overstuffed strollers were sitting next to tables as parents kept getting up and returning to attend to fussy babies.  Children spilled drinks on the floor and parents left it to the wait staff to clean up. The new addition is beautiful, but the extra space also seems to have created a less intimate feel and experience, which we always loved about the Pink Door. Thank goodness the food is still as delicious as ever, but we did leave disappointed, wondering if our experience was a sign of change, or just a bad night.
The lasagna was delicious! Such an adorable place with a great view.
A wonderful joint Mother’s Day and birthday dinner for son.    Our waiter Kate A was outstanding.
I love going to The Pink Door with my friends to catch up. It’s my go to restaurant for pretty much every occasion

Lovely Saturday lunch al fresco. Made a reservation for 2 the day before. Roasted garlic app, oysters, cupula tasty cocktails, small Caesar salad, sturgeon fish of the day, cortado + cheesecake. Boom. All fresh, all delicious, great service. Still feels like old Seattle. Smiles.
Having lunch on the patio here on a sunny day is a vacation in my hometown.  We LOVE the antipasto too!
It was great the service was fast even though there was a rush for people and if they could not get us as quick the server apologized
Superior service, delicious food, and fun atmosphere!

So so so good! My husband and I took his mother for a little mother’s day lunch and lucked out without door seating. The view was beautiful! She has a few dietary restrictions but our waitress had great recommendations for her. My husband and I have had dinner here before and happy to say the food did not disappoint. Love it here.

Not many menu choices - I had spinach lasagne which was good but wished for some sausage or more flavor with spices.  Husband ordered ziti with meatballs - pretty standard fare but pricey at $19.  Appetizer of roasted garlic for $14 only had three very small pieces of dry, tough bread (not toasted or fresh) and small amount of spreadable cheese that tasted like cottage cheese - I don’t recommend it.  Atmosphere is fun, but don’t expect great food.
We had such nice dinner here! Service by Brad was a joy and the food was awesome!

One of the best places to eat in Seattle. Varied selection (not just pastas).  Crafty cocktails in a romantic setting with a lovely   aerialist show in the bar area. If you snag a table in the back you get a view of the Duwamish and a fabulous sunset. NOT TO BE MISSED if you're visiting the market.
Quintessential Seattle- one of my fave decks for summer dining! And they have GF pasta too.
The Pink Door always has impeccable service, great food, and a fun/stylish ambiance. I took family from out of town and they loved it.

I love this restaurant. They sat us by the window overlooking the Ferris wheel and brought my niece her dessert with a candle since it was her birthday. Her chocolate mousse was the best I have ever tasted.  AMAZING!
We can’t wait to back! This restaurant is every bit as amazing as everyone says. Get the lasagna!

El lugar esta agradable , no lo encontrabamos pues no tiene un letrero muy identificable pero por supuesto tiene una puerta Rosa eso fue lo que nos hizo reconocerlo jajaja muy buen servicio muy buena comida , quedamos muy satisfechos con todo
Great service, great food, and cool location. Had live music that fit the scene. Will definitely be back 👍🏻👍🏻

Loved the Branzino and the arancini were perfect.... best I’ve had outside of Italy.  Our waiter didn’t get my wine right although he said it was rose’ it definitely was not.  It was a dry white.  Also it shouldn’t be considered odd to ask for a fresh fork for fish after you’ve used one for tomato based antipasti.  It’s a lovely restaurant not a diner and the wait staff should automatically change the cutlery . The bread is amazing... chewey and perfect .  We had a window table which was nice for our birthday celebration .

Wonderful Italian food. House wine was delicious. Had a bit of a wait for our reservation but they took care of us with a toast of champagne. Beautiful view. Server was very knowledgeable and his recommendations were spot on. Such a lovely time with lovely music.
Excellent! Our server was awesome, food was perfect!
Great food, service and view
My new favorite place for special occasions in Seattle. Lots of character and amazing service. The food is very good and not terribly expensive. Just go.
Great meal. Service was even better. Our server Andrew checked on us as though we were family. And unlike family, he wasn't an annoyance.

Absolutely perfect and charming service. This place earns its wonderful reputation. The food is fantastic and not overpriced. Everything came out in a timely manner. It was in a beautiful location, and was a great mix of fun and classy. I’d absolutely go again, and I recommend it highly.

Nothing compares to the full experience you expect and receive while dining at the Pink Door on a Monday in the bar area. The food is always seasonal, always excellent and always freshly made from scratch farm to table perfect. And add to that the exotic, exhilarating and hypnotic aerial performance and you have a perfect night for dinner and entertainment. Perfect for every day, business, special occasions. The beauty of the place is the eclectic mix of everyone and everything. Fully inclusive intentionally to achieve a perfect mix of people, food, fun and harmony. And the price is surprisingly reasonable and an excellent value for the quality and quantity. The service is also intentionally eclectic and perfect as an entertaining backdrop to the full experience. Well done Pink Door. I never miss the chance to drop in when I’m in Seattle and you never let me down.
So much fun for my birthday celebration. Great server, food was yummy. Trapeze act was so different.
Great food. Great service. Was

Wow!  What a treat.  Worth waiting for the late reservation.  Had no idea for the entertainment in the bar area just after we entered.  Watched an amazing acrobatic show before being seated for dinner.  Seats were amazing and over the water.  Food was exceptional and service the best!  Not easy to get a reservation but make it happen!

The ambience and decor in the restaurant were unique. The service and good selection was wonderful and the food tasted fabulous. Our only challenge was finding the restaurant as there was no sign just a pink door LOL it did not look like a restaurant entrance. We would love to come back and check out the entertainment!
Such an outstanding restaurant!!!! Risotto was too die for as well as Collins but without the Campari and the interior is lovely!!!!!
Had a wonderful night celebrating a birthday and an engagement! Our waiter couldn’t have been more nice and the food was delicious! Best lasagna ever!!!
Great lunch on the outdoor deck!

Just perfect!
The food, the ambiance, the service - everything was perfect.
Fantastic! Have made sure to dine at the Pink Door nearly every time I visit Seattle. 10 years and continues to impress!
Had a really great unique experience, great ambiance
It was just all around lovely!
Excellent food, excellent service, and an excellent show!
best seafood place with the best price. Both me and my boyfriend were amazed by the price and quality of there pasta and seafood.
Excellent food and service.   The ambiance is very cool as well.
Fabulous food and fantastic service from Phil and Brad.  The highlight meal of our trip to Seattle.

I would absolutely recommend The Pink Door !! We arrived a bit earlier than our reservation and the friendly hostess seated us early! The service was excellent and food phenomenal- perfect portions ! A lovely 3 piece band played in the front room and the speakers in the back room overlooking the water allowed us to enjoy the music as well! A wonderful experience!!
We went on our honeymoon and it was great!

Everything was perfect. We were just in town for a few days and saw this was very highly rated. We made our reservations 3 weeks in advance and we’re still only able to get 9:45 pm but called a day before and they moved us to 8:00 pm. The food have wonderful fresh flavors and was exactly what we were less to expect from our yelp friends.

Good view of the shoreline

Service was rather quite slow and our server seemed more interested in getting through our meal quickly with very little pleasantry changed which would be the same for most of the staff - mot really an engaging bunch in our view 

Food was mediocre- you will get much better Italian food at Tulios Italian restaurant than here 

Would not go back or recommend this place to foodies
Birthday celebration.  Great energy and fun atmosphere.

This is a place best for date nights. They have chandeliers and candle lit tables and it looks amazing in the  evening. They also have tables facing the river and those offer the best views. They feature aerial artists on some days that perform and have live music too. The food was really good and their wine menu is pretty decent as well.
Front door was a bit hidden but food was good.
The Pink Door is a must visit restaurant in Seattle. The food was fantastic, along with great service and an excellent view. Highly recommended!
Passport ID required for drinks 😒

For Starters we went with Ceaser Salad and la fettunta which was not outstanding was just okay. For the Main Course we decided to with Lasagna Pink Door and that was just delicious. It would just melt in mouth, totally fantabulous. It was so good we decided to order one more. Finally for the deserts we tried flourless choclate cake and that didn't disappoint us either. The Cake was fresh not to creamy but enough chocolaty.
Birthday and anniversary
Anniversary.

This was a truly a great afternoon. We went for lunch, no res...no problem, and after seeing the menu decided it was going to be one of those blow-out, champagne, food overdose type of afternoons. The kitchen did not disappoint and the service was EXCEPTIONAL! Will be back every trip to Seattle...a great foodie town.

Love the Pink Door.  Food and customer service are both wonderful.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 on my food because I found one shrimp that had not been cleaned.  Ugh.
Otherwise AMAZING.
Thank you.

We went for our 25th Wedding Anniversary after trying to go two years ago only to find out Pink Door was closed for renovations. This trip to Seattle did not disappoint. Pink Door was open, we made reservations 28 days in advance. Wow Wow Wow was Pink Door worth the wait. The food-spectacular, ambiance-off the charts, light/decor-fun elegance with a hint of mid evil. Reminded me of a fav restaurant in Paris. You feel swept away to a true destination all its own in the middle of a bustling city. 
Looking forward to our next trip here.
Great food, good service. Will be back for more of the rice balls and lasagne.

Absolutely amazing. A real experience that will stay with me for a long time. The decor, atmosphere, service and food were all second to none. I would love to go back and would recommend it to anyone who is staying in Seattle.
Best service I’ve had in years!  Every dish was excellent.

I wish I had left this review sooner! I can’t say enough good things about our experience! From the ambience to the amazing view to the eclectic decor and INCREDIBLE tasty food! If we are ever back in Seattle we would definitely visit the Pink Door again!
Waiter clearly had a long night the day before
Amazing service! Excellent and high quality food!
Some food was ok but nothing great.  The waiter was very nice and the performer was beautiful overall just ok.

Very beautiful restaurant! Very romantic too. We started out at the bar for drinks, which was great...good drinks and we got to watch the aerialist perform. Then we were seated in the dining room for dinner. Had a great view of water and the big wheel.  
We highly recommend everything we had:  started with the cheese board, *Amazing*! Their bread with that outstanding olive oil is so addicting!  We both thought the Caesar salad was also very delicious. For dinner, my husband had the Clams & Mussels, which was wonderful, and I had the spaghetti with fresh artichokes (can't remember exact name), which was very tasty.  We also heard the group at the very next table raving about Pink's famous lasagna, and the Paparadelle with Bolognese. 
For dessert, we HIGHLY recommend their doughnuts. SOOOO yummy. They are filled with a rhubarb cream filling, and come with a custardy type dipping sauce.  Absolutely delicious.
Lastly, the service was outstanding, both at bar and in dining room.  We had a wonderful evening and will definitely be back.

Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle, and recent renovations only improved it.
Great place for birthday or other celebrations, but also a great deck for late summer lunch outdoors.

The service was great.  The ambiance was great.  However when we get to food it wasn’t consistently good.  We order the halibut, it was good but a tad overcooked.  The whole fish was excellent.  The cioppino was tasteless and didn’t have enough food.  The pastas were pretty good.  The bread served with dinner (both plain and garlic) were excellent.  We think they have the best French fries.  Not sure if we’ll go back very often.
Be sure to reserve the burlesque show separately (not through OpenTable)

The service was fantastic. We didn’t get her name but she’s from
New Jersey. I let her pick my meal from the drink to dessert and she was spot on with everything. She was very helpful, kind and enjoyed her job! I will be going back!
Perfect place for an intimate birthday dinner.

We loved it! 
Impeccable service, great food, good music and nice ambiance!
We already booked our next dinner there!
Excellent service.
Lovely!  The whole experience from the view, the food, the service!  Our waiter was awesome!  Very attentive and great sense of humor.  Highly recommend!  Need a reservation!

The Pink Door is hands down, my favorite restaurant in Seattle, period. Everything is always amazing. It is where I bring loved ones for special times. It is also a wonderful place to reconnect with old friends, It is cozy but spacious at the same time. You can have meaningful conversations and enjoy the artists that sing and perform. It has warm a feeling, the service is impeccable, and the food is just beautiful. It is the best place to  come in on a cold PNW day and cuddle up with a dish of the the best lasagna, ever. Never fails- always warms my tummy and heart!
Everything was outstanding, from food to service to experience.
Great atmosphere, delicious food, probably the best lasagna I’ve ever eaten. Will return whenever  I am in Seattle
Loved this place! We had a great table with an amazing view of the water. The oysters and veggie lasagna were AMAZING! Def recommend!
Always fabulous!
Great food.. Great views. Great service. The back dining room was packed with some larger tables and extra chairs, so it did get quite noisy

The Pink Door is a unique experience that you sense the minute you open the front door. Genuinely friendly staff, great view of the Sound, wonderful service, and great food. Our waitress was one of the best I have ever had.

Nice ambiance, good service. The food is good, but just misses the mark of being great. The steak was an excellent piece of meat, perfectly cooked, but a bit over seasoned. The chicken caesar salad was good, but the chicken was a bit dry.
Family lunch
A perfect evening on the water with excellent food, service and music
Our server, Andrew, was amazing and mega helpful with food suggestions and restrictions. Will be coming again when I’m next in Seattle.

The smoked fish appetizer (Cinque Terre style) was delicious. The Pappardelle was also nice but not quite as notable as the appetizer. The ambience was a nice surprise and the views were unexpected - especially considering how unobtrusive the entrance is. The service was however a little disappointing - our server had an attitude, was not very engaged in the role and not very helpful. Despite the miss on service this was a good choice and we would recommend it to others.

The food was excellent. Really utterly fantastic. In my experience this restaurant is among the top 3 Italian restaurants i’ve been to (in N. America). My wife and I lived in NYC for 12 years and we have high standards and expectations when dining at Italian restaurants. I had the halibut and wifey had the ragu pasta, and we shared the asparagus appetizer. Their olive oil concoction for the bread was outwardly. Never had I tasted anything like it. So, food-wise I give all the stars available. However the waitress wasn’t that keen on being nice to us. She wasn’t downright heartless, not by any means. Just a bit off-putting, unfriendly and rushing. Maybe she was having a bad day. It just felt like she didn’t want to work that day. Maybe it was us taking our time trying to savour the food. We took a bit more time especially because it was our anniversary. Maybe it was us being Asian and gay. I know for sure Seattle is LGBTQ friendly. Not that we expected any congrats but a bit more friendly manner would’ve been appreciated. However, we did get a cozy table in the corner by the windows that overlooked the market and Puget Sound. Dealing with tourists can be hard and gruelling. I know that because again I lived in NYC. Anyway, food-wise, I would love to visit again and taste other items on their menu. Hopefully we’ll get a different waitperson who won’t leave bitterness in our minds.
Our second dinner at the Pink Door. Food was great. Service was great. All round good experience.

The Pink Door is our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  Our server was exceptional (Dominic) and
we can't wait to go back again...even though we live in Olympia
Love that place!!!
Enjoyed!! Sat right by the dancer! Food and atmosphere was just what I needed!!

Birthday celebration exceeded expectation! Was worried this would be another touristy hyped restaurant but it was not. Food was delicious, menu was excellent, great waiter, fun ambiance and great view. Highly recommend this place!
Best restaurant and wait staff in all of Seattle!!
Not from Seattle so it’s a must every time I do come!
50th Birthday lunch

Loved the setting. We were seated in the lounge near the aerialist ... myself, my wife and our two kids (ages 9  such a fun experience. The food was excellent -- everyone loved the lasagna and the halibut (special) was perfectly cooked. We will definitely return.
Went there on a suggestion of a friend. It was great. Had one of their specials watched the Ariel artist for a bit.

Romantic and great ambiance. The food was incredible and great service. 
It does get fully booked so reservation is a must.
Restaurant is amazing! I was a little disappointed with my food order so next time I’ll stick with the linguine which is delicious.
Superb service. Lovely view. Very good food.
Excellent place, great food and ambiance! One of Seattle’s best

The place is difficult to find if you don't know the area, and there are no signs to indicate where it is. It's literally just... a barely-light-pink door. And when I called and asked how to find it, they just rattled off the address (yeah thanks - I googled that, but where the heck are you??). But, that's literally my only complaint! Ambiance was really nice, view was amazing, decent wine list, and the food was fabulous. The shaved vinegar-ice for the oysters was a revelation. Highly recommend the linguine with clams. Panna cotta was perfect.
Spectacular dining experience
Lovely meal and great table. Good service. One of our favorite restaurants in Seattle.

Wonderful experience! The food is excellent and service is amazing. 

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to other people.

A long-standing Seattle GEM!!! The Pink Door never fails to provide a lovely evening with delicious food and wine, excellent service and lovely ambiance.  If you have not eaten here it’s a “must try” but make a reservation far in advance as locals know it, LOVE it, and frequent it often so it can be hard to get in if you don’t plan accordingly. Enjoy!
food was great! Great service and even better views and restaurant vibe. We’ll be coming back again and again!

Pink Door is our Seattle go to place! We are from Portland and I always make a reservation a month before I travel up. The food is consistently good, the service outstanding and the ambience is lively! Love it!

Food was very good. Service was good. We went there to celebrate both of our wives birthday but barely acknowledged by restaurant and was not memorable. They said if we ordered a dessert they would put a candle on it.  Dessert selection was limited so we declined therefore no birthday acknowledgement.  We expected more from staff and it was disappointing.
Amazing as always! Love the lovely girls at the front you hostesses rock and roll!
Friendly staff, great food and entertainment, all positive factors that enhanced our get together!
The food was very delicious and the service can't be beat. The aerialist was really spectacular.
My boyfriend and I had our anniversary lunch here. The food was great. Only thing is that I wish the menu had a few more options. Otherwise wonderful!
Love it!  The black squid spaghetti is my all time favorite. Fresh and juicy, must try if you have a chance.
The food was excellent, the service was perfect, and the vibe was fun!  Absolutely loved the evening!
Delicious and entertaining as always! I also took my 13 year old and there were other kids in there too for the aerial show. It was interesting and artistic.

My train to see my son on his quick business trip to Seattle was two hours late and all I worried about was missing my anticipated dinner reservation at The Pink Door. When I finally arrived there straight from the all day train ride, the greeter whisked my luggage away, sat me next to my son at a table with a wonderful view of the water, brought me a glass of wine, and coached me to breathe. I then had a memorable dinner experience with excellent service and delicious food. For dinner I had grilled prawns over a Caesar salad and my son had the Rigatoni with meatballs. Dinner at the Pink Door is not just dinner. It's an immersion into a relaxing, cultured and nourishing time warp. So excited....I was able to reserve a table for lunch the next day!
Always fabulous service and amazing food. A bit on the pricey side. Difficult to get a reservation. I wish they had an eastside location. Pink door is my favorite restaurant.
We got to enjoy the patio and have a beautiful late lunch in the sun, our server was excellent and the support staff was also amazing!
Delicious food and great service! One of my favorite meals in Seattle...will definitely be back next time
Always a great place to dine. Don’t tell anybody.

My fiance and I loved the Pink Door!! It was so romantic and the food was delicious!! We got the cheese plate, the roasted garlic, the lasagna, and the creme brulee. Everything was wonderful, but the lasagna was amazing!! We sat in the dining room so we had a view, it wasn't crowded, and it was just so romantic. We had the best time!!

One of the best restaurants I’ve been too

Great food,  drink choice and ambience
Wonderful staff, the food and service was outstanding
Amazing food and the service was impeccable.  Lots of fun and a light atmosphere. Would highly recommend!
Wow!  What a special and unique food, art and entertainment experience!
The food was truly amazing ! Excellent service and atmosphere . I highly recommend eating here!
Great ambiance and the winter risotto is a must try.

What an amazing spot! The staff was great, the food was top notch, the ambience was on point. We went on a Sunday and saw an aerial performance - WOW.  I had a friend advise I make reservations about a month so, so I could ensure we got in. We had a reservation for the bar, but we arrived earlier & they were able to put us at a table in the dining area with a beautiful view of the Water. And they let us know when the performer was about to start so we wouldn’t miss out. We did dress up, but not all the guests inside did. What a friggen fantastic experience!

Personally I found this place did not live up to the hype. For having to book reservations 5 weeks in advance I expected the food to be amazing and it left much to be desired. Could be my lack of traditional Italian restaurant experiences but was looking for more pasta options than three -- one of which was vegetarian. Would be nice to offer the lasagna with a meat sauce for the meat eaters who prefer meat with their meal. Unlikely we'll be back, good to try once but definitely did not live up to expectations.
Everything was perfect!
The lasagna and garlic bread and the linguine a la Congolese are exceptional. Wonderful service and wonderful view.
Such a cool eclectic feel to this delicious restaurant. Would definitely come back again and again.
Service was excellent, water always filled, we were getting checked on an appropriate amount of time. Great view

This is a great restaurant.  Reservations are hard to get so it is always a special treat when we are able to dine here.  Had dinner with four friends.  As always the place was packed but service was good.
It was definitely the best lasagna I have ever eaten.
Wonderful food, great setting, incredible views. Definitely a favorite in Seattle.

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch and ordered the Caesar salad which was incredible. We also got the Ragu and the Winter Risotto, both of which were amazing. We loved the outdoor seating and the atmosphere was great. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Seattle, it’s on our list for next time!
Picky foodie friends from NYC were stunned! Great experience and value!

When we lived in Seattle we celebrated our first wedding anniversary there and fell in love with Pink Door.  Unfortunately, we had to move away and try to visit Seattle as often as possible.  Every trip we make we return to Pink Door and find it just as wonderful as it was when we left.  We adore The Pink Door.
Expensive dinner. Maybe good if you get the water view. The food tastes good and the aerial show is good.

LIVES UP TO THE HYPE!!!
It was our first time visiting The Pink Door and let me assure you we will be coming back (if we can get a reservation). There were great GF options and great seafood and other non pasta dishes. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Love The Pink Door! Great service, beautiful dining room with a Puget Sound view and fabulous food! We will be back!

Food and service where both great. We were sat at a window table and it was an incredible view of the bay. Price was fair and average for nicer Italian dining. It was quite easy to find despite only being a pink door in the alley and I heard great things about it so we had to check it out.
Favorite go to special occasion restaurant. Service to food to atmosphere all at a high level....I’m Italian from NYC

I have dined at the pink door for many years but when I went this weekend I had the worst service. My waiter was really rude and had a very bad attitude towards us but was being friendly to people at the table around us. It felt like she was trying to rush us and at one point she rolled her eyes at us while I was asking her for something. I didn’t have an attitude back or say anything to her but I did talk to the manager after and all he said was sorry.

I hope other people don't read this review, as it's already hard to get a reservation. Service was awesome, the ambiance was perfect and the food was top notch. Do be aware that the portions on the pasta are very small, but the taste makes up for it. 

My only hesitation: there are three distinct spaces in the restaurant, the patio (seasonal), the back, and the front area with the bar. I dont think I'd enjoy sitting in the front area as it is much louder and much hotter than the rest of the restaurant, plus you don't get the views.

We really enjoyed our dinner here! The food was really excellent all around... we had the arincini, la fetunna, agnolotti, lasagna, and the cauliflower potato dish. For dessert we had the crime brûlée and the flourless chocolate cake. My husband ordered the starry starry night cocktail. The arincini was decent but not on the same level as the rest of the meal and I wasn’t a fan of the chocolate cake, but everything else was SPECTACULAR! Super delicious food that didn’t feel overly heavy for Italian food. We had a table right by the window with a view of the water and pike place, which made for such a great atmosphere! This is a place that I would definitely come back to for date night, or somewhere I would bring out of town guests.
water view from restaurant was fantastic, and food was also great.

We had a late lunch with friends on Saturday. We sat for 2 hours and enjoyed drinks, appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Our server made several recommendations that were fantastic and gave us plenty of time to enjoy our experience. Everything was delicious and we had a fabulous time. Could not have been better. We will definitely be back!
I don't understand the hype. The food was ok. We will not go back there again.
Exceeded all my ambiance and food expectations. Amazing!
Always great, love the new addition to the restaurant!
Great service and the food is always delicious.
Our waitress had a great highlighter on her face according to my friends. She was great.

Hard to find the location as the door is more of a salmon pink color faded but the local homeless guy noticed we were lost and pointed us in the right direction.  You will need reservations.  I felt a little under dresssd for dinner in a tee shirt. My bad for not changing in to a coller shirt for dinner.  The quail was the best I ever had.  Our waitress knew her stuff and made the whole experience pleasant.  This place is now on my list of places to eat when in Seattle.
The service was great, food was as expected... but the host was not very friendly.
WONDERFUL food and atmosphere!!!  This is a MUST!!
Food was sublime. Took work colleagues from out of town and it was a hit!

Everything was perfect.  We had a beet arugula Salad that was outstanding. We had Lasaugna  that was perfect.  The wait staff was so friendly and helpful.  We came early and they gave us a corner table with a view.  It was my daughters 60th birthday and special it was and the Pink door staff made our celebration one for the record books..  I took a photo of the Pink door to put on facebook of our celebration.

Loved it! The best lasagne I've ever had. I've had spinach lasagne before, but never spinach lasagne noodles. With 3 sauces - a white sauce, pesto, and seriously the freshest, sweetest, best tomato sauce I've ever had. My date had the antipasto platter which was huge and more than he could eat, and consisted of many sections of deliciousness. All the veggies were flavored and cooked to perfection...nothing overcooked or overflavored. Ambience is whimsical and unique. Really enjoyed the experience and we'll be back for sure on our next trip to Seattle.
Aerialist was amazing! Great food/service!
We were in town for Spring Break staying downtown so decided to try the Pink Door. The food was great, our waitress Lola was fantastic and the restaurant decor and vibe was warm, inviting and unique.
Amazing restaurant, amazing service, amazing food, would recommend over and over! Love the show also!
Wonderful food , great presentation, and very good food ! Always a great experience!

I made reservations a month prior online thinking we would have a great table either with a seat by the window or to watch the entertainment however I guess you have to call for those tables because we did not get a great seat for my husbands birthday. Other than that everything was good.
Out of towners from Cleveland here. Loved every minute of our dining experience. We will recommend to everyone!! :)

Great ambiance, and welcoming people.  I am from out of town, and accidentally made my reservation for the wrong night.  I was seated right away and at a quaint table with a nice view.  I enjoyed the warm wine, seafood spaghetti and flourless chocolate cake.  All was fabulous.  I will definitely recommend this spot.
Bread is a bit too cold on it class! Food is good price is acceptable.

My experience was great, the ambiance was wonderful, I had made a reservation the night before and didn’t realize I reserved for the wrong area, but I had left comments on where I wanted to sit, so they understood the mishap and were very accommodating. The food was fabulous, again the dining ambiance was just as great as the lounge, our waiter seemed very friendly. Towards the end of the night it felt like we were more of a bother and that we were a hindrance. It was my birthday and I had wanted a dessert, I thought it was one thing instead of another... so when they brought it out I had stopped the waiter to let the waiter know and he offered a different desert but it was late I said no, and he didn’t even offer to take it off the check. Since we didn’t even eat it... but when he dropped the check my husband just decided to eat it since we already paid for it. I don’t believe they did any thing wrong. It was just not an above and beyond customer service situation. So that was a bit of a bummer. Otherwise it was a great place and I would definitely recommend it to a friend!

The atmosphere was amazing! Made you feel like you were in a different part of the world. The food was outstanding, especially the Ahi Tuna Crudo appetizer. Overall 10/10, definitely would come back here again when in Seattle.

Wonderful food
Great service
Beautiful atmosphere

Authentic Italian cuisine in an intimate environment. Our drinks were great, service was timely, friendly and efficient. There was good teamwork between the servers too. We were seated upon arrival after arriving about 5 minutes after our reservation time. They acknowledged our anniversary and had a lovely glass of Prosecco brought out. We loved it and plan to come back!

The food and service was excellent however when I ordered a Coca Cola it came in an extremely dirty glass. I didn't notice until I finished drinking my soda. It became apparent I was drinking out of a nasty glass with black residue on the sides. It made me feel disgusted. I would not go back to this restaurant because they use dirty dishes. Gross!
Super good. Tasty cocktail (Strega Nonna), very nice tuna crudi, creamy torchio pasta with king salmon, and yummy olive cake.
Beautiful interiors, wonderful service, and great food. Not too pricey for the value of the food.
My friend and I had a wonderful dinner and accommodations were great

Our experience at the Pink Door was not what was expected at all.  First of all, I called and was told that there would be entertainment that we could enjoy while dining...that it would be an experience to remember (by the way, this is part of their advertising).  It was not!!  We were going there for a birthday celebration and were seated in the back of the restaurant away from the nightly entertainment.  The food was sub-par and the service was not that great either.   The server did not come over to see if we needed anything else and I had to remind them that it was a birthday celebration.  I was told that they would come to the table and sing along....did not!  I was beyond disappointed with the entire experience and would not recommend this restaurant at all.

Pleasantly surprised after opening the door after coming in off of post alley...   and then we had no idea that the restaurant opened up into another room...  great views of the water and the end of pike place market...  great food, service and ambiance...  we both loved the bare brick wall and decor.  We’ll definitely be back for another date night soon.  Highly recommended!
The olive oil was amazing! All the dishes were excellent, especially the oysters. Loved the olive oil cake for dessert
The food and service was great!  Linguini and clams = YUMMY!  Garlic breat too
It was absolutely amazing and delicious!

Amazing as usual!
And the newer seating area with a great view of the market and the great wheel just added to an already wonderful visit!
Love it here!
The food is astonishing! The service is pretty good too.
The risotto was absolutely outstanding. The best I have ever eaten.
Great food and fun place. Whenever I’m in Seattle I’m going back.
Fun place and the food was very goodLoved the view of the water!

The Pink Door was exquisite as always.  The server was very attentive.  The food was everything I had hoped for.  The cioppino was perfect on a cold day.  My friend had the spicy sausage rigatoni.  The sausage (locally sourced) was delightfully cooked on a wood grill so had a nice smoky flavor.  Looking forward to getting to try their dinner menu soon.
Great ambience and live music is awesome. The signature lasagna was decent. Definitely a good date spot!
Lovely ambience
Great food and amazing atmosphere! Loved everything about this restaurant!
Out with friends.
Food was delicious, atmosphere was fantastic and service was extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommend it!

I loved their entrance. The idea that there is no name plate & you have to guess the location from its name ( you have to search for a pink door when you reach the location & that's where you have to enter) is so unique. I am a vegetarian, there are not much vegetarian options there but the ones which are there are just too delicious. The Roasted Garlic & the ARANCINI is something which I had tasted for the first time, the portion is a bit less but its just worth even if you feel you are spending a bit more. In the main course the Lasagna is the best I had till date, it just melts in your mouth. The view of ferris wheel from the restraurent is cherry on the cake. One of the cutest places with a very good food I have ever been.

Nous allions là spécialement pour le spectacle de trapèze du lundi soir mais l'unique possibilité pour une réservation était 21h... alors que le spectacle de trapèze finissait à 20h45.....  j'aurais vraiment apprécié que l'heure des show soir indiqué sur Open Table!!!! 
Ce fut une grande déception !!!!
Les employées avaient vraiment l'air fatigué et pressé de finir leur soirée ! Mais le décor est superbe et la nourriture excellente !

The food was nice. The service aggressive and annoying. There was an awkward show in the restaurant of a female dancer on a rope - WTF??? 
And yes, it is really overpriced
We have been here many times before and keep coming back. The combination of great food, atmosphere, cozy lighting, excellent value for money is quite unique.

I had the best Caesar Salad I have ever had.   Also had a whole fish entrée that was done to perfection.  Wine list a little limited but we enjoyed our selection.  Service was very good.  Order the garlic bread, you will not regret it.
Great food, excellent service! Would definitely come again next Seattle visit!

The new menu is boring. There is nothing that excites the palate. I loved their braised rabbit but that is gone and replaced with a sausage stuffed quail. The pork shank was plated nicely but it is essentially a bone with very little meat paired with a few sample bites of "this and that". No thank you. I'll wait to see what the next menu change brings. Hopefully we will be surprised. Otherwise the ambiance of this place is amazing. Good for a date night or anniversary dinner.
Trapeze artists is awesome
Perfect place for a birthday dinner ! This place was one of the most recommended places to eat in Seattle and it did not disappoint. The entertainment was nice and the food was incredible.
Delicious food and great service. Best Italian seafood in the city.
The trapeze artist was incredibly good and we really enjoyed seeing her perform several times during our evening meal.

OMG me and my husband went to The Pink Door to celebrate his bday and we had the best time! Delicious food from appetizers to deserts. Great music, really nice waitress and beautiful decoration! We simply loved and can not wait to come back in different hour and diff season :)
It was my second time at this place and me and my friends absolutely enjoyed it. Thank you for the pleasant evening=)
Really great experience! Loved the staff! Food was AMAZING! We were visiting Seattle from Sacramento, and I must say the food was delicious! Gorgeous restaurant, will be returning one day!!
Incredibly adorable decor, fantastic staff, and delicious food.
Great ambiance and food was great.  Our server was very attentive to our needs.  Can’t wait to return!
Amazing Food & Fabulous Service
Perfect spot overlooking the water!

Pink Door is a long time go to for us. This time, food was good, not great. Garlic bread was overly charred. Meatballs could have used a bit less garlic and a bit more fennel. Extra points for helpful server who happily accommodated one guest’s allergies. Space is, as always, dreamy, festive and gorgeous.
Such a must do when in Seattle.  So fun!  Important to know there is no sign-just a pink door!  That’s part of the ambiance!  Loved this place. Great wine too!

The Pink Door was a unique and lovely dining experience. It first hits you with its special, unique atmosphere and decor. It excites you just to walk in. We got an excellent seat by the window looking out onto the water. Our server was kind and friendly and helped in giving recommendations. The garlic olive oil bread was incredible, my mocktail was unique and refreshing, and the maple creme Brulee was the best I've ever had. Icing on the cake was the sweet sounds of the band playing over the radio and stopping to watch them on the way out.
We went for our anniversary and our experience was exceptional! Our server was so nice and took wonderful care of us. It was great!
Great spot for lunch. I have come with co-workers for special event lunches. Great food an atmosphere.
It was perfect for ending our trip in Seattle. Delicious food, great hospitality, & good wine.

Pink Door is my favorite restaurant in Seattle. It continues to be innovative in its Italian offerings (with a Pacific Northwest spin), as well as providing near perfect service. On this visit, we had a late lunch (starting at 2 pm, lasting till 4 pm) that included a delicious mushroom risotto for me and squid-ink black pasta with seafood for my husband. We both loved our dishes. Cocktail and wine selections were great, as were the salads following the main dish. Since it was a late Monday afternoon, the restaurant was very quiet, unhurried, letting us enjoy the fabulous view on a rare sunny February day. Lovely time--great food, great service, great view.
Good Seattleite experience of Pacific Northwest food/taste. Courteous service. Very casual, no need to overdressed.  Menu is limited but good choices.
The food was terrible as was the service. the music was loud and then low but whoever was controlling the music either had a hearing problem or didn't know how to keep the volume on a steady level.

The ambiance was very special. The lighting and decor was very intimate. The view of the sound and the lighted Ferris Wheel was amazing. We were celebrating my mom’s birthday, and while the service was good in general, I was surprised that they did not do anything or offer to do something in celebration of the birthday. The food was excellent and everything we tried was amazing. The roasted garlic was very addictive, the beet and arugula salad is a must try. The pink door lasagna was very tasty and the pappardelle al Ragù Bolognese was out of this world. The grilled fish of the day was well seasoned and cooked perfectly, and the presentation was really appealing to the eye. The seasoned fries with the fried rosemary and aioli was the best I had anywhere  
We enjoyed our dinner at the Pink Door and will definitely come back

My go to restaurant for special dates with my partner, friends, and clients. I book a month ahead and am lucky to find a table. Elise is my gal for lunch and dinner is a free for all. Their patio is second to none for a rose wine and a relaxed dining experience.
It was stunning and the food was phenomenal
Celebrated our anniversary at The Pink Door with great food, service and a view. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an excellent meal that won’t break the bank.
Lively place, very good food. The service varies; sometimes very good, other times stuffy and inattentive.
Loved our waiter, Andrew! He was patient, polite, and served us well!!!
I have loved the pink door for more than 30 years now!

The restaurant is beautiful and overlooks the waterfront where we were sitting. Ambiance is great, low noise level even when it was full. Food was amazing. Prices very reasonable for high class atmosphere and taste. Workers were a little underdressed and looked unprofessional for “smart casual” dress code they require of the patrons. Would come again and again.
Anniversary

This is my third time being to The Pink Door and it felt just as special and amazing as the very first time. As soon as you enter the atmosphere is extremely welcoming and laid-back, the waitresses and greeters and even Cooks are extremely nice welcoming and make you feel that they're there to give you the best experience possible. The food is beyond amazing and worth every penny, I would definitely recommend The Pink Door to anyone and everyone that I talked to or meet.

Fantastic!! The food, the service, the ambiance - we loved it all. I haven't had a seafood & pasta dinner that delightful in ages. The lasagna is superb (and has been on the menu for 37 years according to our waiter), and the fish of the day was cooked to perfection and adorned with the perfect amount of seasonal veggies. Oh, and THE BREAD! Just get it.
Kate and Alexandria were great! The food was amazing and the artist was so fun to watch. Best date night in Seattle ever!!

My mom is visiting for the first time and I wanted to take her somewhere special. Loved the ambiance of the restaurant, the view and the staff was very nice. We ordered a lasagna which was really good but the linguini and clams dish we ordered was mediocre at best. For $18-$20 a dish it wasnt breath taking. Not sure I would go again but the location and ambiance were really good.

The hostess greeting us was cold to us. The waiter was nice but it was the hostess' coldness that created the first impression for us. The food was okay ... Not quite sure what all the hype was about. You can get equally good food for the same price elsewhere without having to book a reservation far out in advance.
Everything was amazing!  Food, service, entertainment.  A must do if in Seattle!

The Pink Door exceeded our expectations on every level.  Food was amazing, great price for the quality and portions (pork osso bucco was incredible).  The ambiance is great.  We were visiting from out of town and it's little hard to find if you don't want know what you're looking for, but that added to the atmosphere.  Lighting, noise level, decor were all fantastic.  Highly recommend.
Amazing food and show!
Everything in the restaurant including; the service, the food, and the ambiance was excellent. Would recommend 1000 times!

Great restaurant, a staple establishment for residents of Seattle and a special treat for tourists. Dining room has veiw of the water and pike place, a great spot for dinner if you’ve been visiting the market. But be sure to reserve ahead of time! It can get busy and there’s little “waiting” space.
Wonderful service, amazing food with great views of the city.
Forever my favorite place in Seattle! Incredible flavors and excellent service as always.
Amazing! I highly recommend! Try the spinach lasagna! You will dream about it!

This was our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  We spent 4 days here and had lunch 2x.  Menu was limited but everything we tried was excellent.  I had pasta both days which were both excellent.  My wife had clams and mussels one day and fish the other.  All were fantastic.  We also had grilled garlic bread one day, a very nice addition to wonderful salads 

It’s hard to get reservations but they do save some tables for walk-ins.  If you really want to try but can’t get reservations, be there right at 11:30 when they open; or prepare to wait.
Great service, food absolutely delicious. It's a bit more expensive than I would do for a regular visit, but definitely worth it for a special occasion.
Such a cool indie spot- absolutely loved the food! The service was outstanding! Very attentive, very polite, & accommodating. Will definitely be back!

Wonderful Valentine’s Day dinner! It was our first time in Seattle and we were lucky to find this place. I did my research and made reservations 6 weeks early. I’m glad I did because they were booked. The food was amazing, our waitress was on point and the atmosphere was welcoming. Would recommend this for any special occasion or anytime you just want phenomenal Italian food.
The most revolting food, unattractive wait staff and decor that is indescribably hideous. Way too loud also. Cocktails were well done, the one redeeming feature.
Beautiful experience every time. Food is amazing! I’m gluten-free and they have a wide selection and even gluten-free garlic bread!
Amazing food, def try the lasagna
Cozy restaurant, great food and service.
this is my husband's favourite place to go in seattle when he visits.  the food and atmosphere are perfect every time
Classic Seattle restaurant. A little hard to find but worth it. Make your reservation well in advance! Lovely atmosphere and wonderful food.

Amazing! My boyfriend and I ate at The Pink Door for our anniversary, and they gave us a complementary Prosecco toast.  The food was fresh and flavorful.  I strongly recommend the creme brulee.  We are looking forward to eating here again.
Amazing meal with impeccable service. Great window-side view of Pikes below, couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Definitely will return on my next trip to Seattle!

They food was absolutely wonderful and they had some really good cocktails. There is no sign on the door. The only only indication you're there is literally a pinkish door. Great place with a beautiful view in the back.

While most restaurants were closed during a State Emergency (Feb,2019), the Pink Door was open. The staff was amazing and knowledgeable of the menu. The ahi tuna, as recommended by our waiter, was superb. The Osso Bucco was cooked to perfection and favourable. After dinner we moved to the bar and enjoyed the live entertainment. I highly recommend going to the Pink Door while in Seattle. Oh ya, don't worry about online booking...if it's not available to book online, there are many walk-in tables available.

Due to the unforeseen conditions, such as snow and uber drivers not being redeably available we were 7 minutes late to our reservation. I immediately apologized, and I informed the hostess I was late. A manager, I believe... abruptly interrupted and told me my table was given away and refused service. In dismay, I was only 7 mins late. It’s snowing and the road is closed due to snow. After, 10 minutes we were finally seated. I was so disappointed, I planned my reservation in advance knowing I was coming out of state. Also, celebrating my birthday. The only reason they are getting 3 stars, is because the food was delicious. Service was horrible and I’m really torn on recommending this place to anyone.
I am so impressed with this restaurant I already recommended to others is amazing

We were lucky to grab last minute reservations during our short stay in Seattle. We watched the sun set through the big windows in the back of the restaurant - yes, we had pretty early dinner reservations. The candlelit dining room was simply romantic! Our waiter was pleasant and attentive. We shared the Roasted Garlic and Ricotta-Gorgonzola Cheese Spread which was divine!  My boyfriend had the mushroom risotto and he exclaimed that it was the best he'd ever had! For dessert we shared the Maple Creme Brulee which was melt in your mouth delicious! Very impressed!
Waiter not friendly for foreign people coming alone.
Amazing food and ambiance.  Marcus is a great waiter!
Anniversary
Excellent as always
Great Italian experience at Pike's Place.   High quality food with great friendly service.   Make a reservation early to get a spot!

The Pink Door is the perfect combination of great atmosphere and delicious food. The vintage decor, subtle  entrance and wonderful service are all just complimentary on top of the delicious food. Everything we had, from the drinks to the dessert were fantastic. Looking forward to coming back to try more!
Great service, great views, great food!

I heard The Pink Door was a must when I moved to town I thought it would be a great option for a special occasion. We were looking forward to our dinner with much anticipation. However the luke warm service with zero personality from our server Jay, $20 cocktails, and less than delicious food, we were sorely disappointed. Bummer.

My husband, teenage daughter, her friend and I went for dinner and caught the aerialist act on Monday first seating.  It is such a lovely spot with warm and interesting décor that is lost in the new restaurants that spring up weekly in Seattle. The girls thought the place was "fancy" and hopefully had the same memorable experience as I did when I first visited the pink door back when I was in high school.  The food and beverages where great.  My only regret is that I am now gluten free and have fond memories of the roasted garlic and gorgonzola spread on crusty bread that I had in my 20s.  They do offer GF bread but I didn't try it.  I did have the GF pasta substituted in which was fine though I think the penne shape doesn't lend itself as well to a linguine dish.    The service was great and the PG aerialist show was impressive.  I was also pleasantly surprised to see that there is a HUGE addition since I was there last.  The restaurant now spans from the Post Alley to Pike Pl. with views overlooking the sound.  I only peeked my head into the new dining room but will definitely return for a date night.
Great food and interesting setting. Service was nice but unorganized, main course served 90 seconds after the appetizer, no attention after main course was finished...

Wow! The setting is beautiful, the service fantastic, and the food outstanding! The pasta (even without any meat) was amazing and my fiance loved the agnolotti, a very rich butternut squash pasta dish. The prosciutto and bufala was as good as I've had anywhere including Italy.
Finally got reservations here. The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and the aerial performances were a great little addition to and amazing dinner experience.

Food was decent, nothing special. Personally feel as if I had better food for a cheaper price, however the view was great and the ambiance was amazing. My date and I ordered the mussels, a pasta dish, and the lasagna complete with the flourless chocolate cake. I felt the pasta noodles were a bit undercooked and the mussels lacked flavor. We were able to stay long enough to catch one of the acrobatic shows which really made the experience worth while.
The Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle.  My favorite dish is the Cioppino.  I also always love their risotto dishes.
The Pink Door is a very special restaurant. The food, the service, and the atmosphere all make for a fantastic experience! Can’t wait to go back!
The Pink Door has never disappointed! Love the menu and the atmosphere. I tell everyone it is a must when visiting Seattle. Can't wait to visit again :)

We started with cheese board and garlic bread. Both were delicious and interesting. For main course I had the steak, my partner had pork. Both were excellent. I wasn’t in love with the cauliflower based side for he steak, a little sweet, but that’s probably just a personal preference. The desserts were less great. My partners orange cake was very orangey (yeah it’s an orange cake but the flavor was a little overpowering for me) and was a little dry. The maple creme brûlée “custard” was a little too cold for me though very tasty. My main gripe was the service. Our server was very polite when speaking with us but seemed incredibly rushed, making me feel almost a nuisance. For our main course, she took my partners main dish order, then mine, and rushed off without asking if we wanted sides, which we did, but were unable to order as the server did not return until after our dishes had arrived. When ordering dessert our server took my partner’s order and was rushing away without asking for my order. I called it out to her as she walked away but was unable to squeeze my coffee order into the split second of attention I was afforded. 

In summary, the food was good but considering the price we paid for dinner (+$200) for two people, I’d expect to be treated more like the most important element of the evening rather than an inconvenience.
If you are with kids don’t go there. They are rude with people with small children and will try to get you out ASAP
Now I know why this place gets a near perfect 5 stars - this place does not disappoint. If you ever in Seattle , this place is a must .

Worst experience. 

Our server reminded us every 10 minutes that they were closing soon.  He continued to rush us through every step, rolled his eyes when we didn't know what we wanted, and was in such a hurry that when he popped our bottle of wine the cork hit me in the chest. 

My pasta arrived cold and after it arrived we were informed that the kitchen was closed..... yet as I ate my sad cold pasta,  i watched other guests receiving food,  more bread, and more drinks.   One table even received a dessert with a candle...i assume for a birthday. 

My date told the server twice that it was my birthday and he just said "oh cool". 

My first visit will be my last
This our new celebration restaurant for the family. They never disappoint.
The food was amazing and it wasn’t super expensive.  Loved the view and the atmosphere.

Our party of three shared three dishes: risotto with mushrooms, oysters and mussels, and meatball panini. Delicious, fresh tasting food, although risotto was a bit salty. Highly recommend oysters and mussels. Great service. Beautiful dining room.

Love the updated interior!  Had a fab seat at the window with a stunning sunset view. I was a bit disappointed in the rigatoni, but the celeriac soup was amazing. Always a treat to come to the Pink Door.
The Pink Door is consistently terrific--excellent food, excellent service--and the renovations have improved the view and ambiance as well. One of our favorites in Seattle!
Always perfect! One of our favorite restaurants. Love it.
Perfect evening including food, service and aerial bar entertainment!!

The Pink Door remains a top Seattle spot for a reason. Every time I have been, I've received incredible service and absolutely delicious food that, given the location and quality, is very reasonably priced. This was the best birthday dinner I've ever had, and I am no spring chicken!
thankyou so much
ORDER THE LASAGNA. It's vegetarian and amazing. We also got the Winter Risotto and the Branzino. Both were fabulous.

We were celebrating my friends birthday. The server wasn’t the best. He seemed Inconvenience. Just wanted us to order so he could get to the next table. I got up to go to the bathroom and told him it was our friends birthday. I didn’t remember if I had told the hostess when I made the reservation or not so I wanted him to know. He cut me off and said yes I know it’s your friends birthday. Just a little disappointing. This was my second time at the restaurant and it wasn’t my favorite. We traveled from puyallup just to come the the pink door.
Beautiful experience..must be added to everyone’s Seattle dining list!
They moved our reservation 30 minutes up after we checked in early and asked if there was any availability. As always, amazing service, food and ambiance. Thank you!
Such a fun place!
My new favorite Italian restaurant!

by far the best restaurant at the market. the wait staff was very pleasant, our waitress was very enthusiast as she spoke about the food and specials of the night and was very descriptive and informative! All the food was absolutely amazing from the appetizers to the yummy desserts! I definitely plan to come back to this lovely restaurant!

Great food and ambiance. The Amazonian dude in the next table wouldn't shut up for a minute - but his guests were suffering like we were - so it is not a hit on the restaurant - but the live music was awesome.
This restaurant is beautiful! The food was delicious, service was wonderful, the entertainment was excellent! This was a perfect night out! I’m definitely coming back soon!
Went for my birthday dinner and had a great time with friends.  Oysters were fresh, food wonderful and service was outstanding.

The food was all phenomenal.  We had the Northern Fish Special, which was steelhead trout, and fantastic pear and prosecco cocktails.  We were seated at a table for two on the stage, which felt pretty exposed but generally people ignored us so it was fine.  Noise level was low but we had an early dinner reservation as Monday and Sunday reservations fill up very far in advance.  The service was quick and our server was very polite and attentive.
Fun time at this restaurant!
This restaurant was recommended from friends back home in California. Loved it!! Thomas was an excellent waiter.  We will be returning and will ask for our same waiter.
Simply the best. Must go if you are in Seattle! Must make a reservation though about 2 weeks out or else you have to wait!
Pink Door is awesome.

Have dined at the Pink Door several times and always a delightful treat. The innovative menu is amazing and never disappoints. Flavors are amazing and beyond satisfying. Love their signature soup! Pasta perfection and appetizers unique and beautiful presentation. Highly recommend the Pink Door, but make reservations early. We have been turned away before weeks ahead of desires dates. Five Star meals and service.
Great food! Service was outstanding.  Recommendations from staff were outstanding!

Girls weekend first meal. Great service and great food
Loved it. Highly recommend it

I came to the Pink Door with my girlfriend. We sat near the window by the waterfront, which was amazing. 

We ordered the cheese board deluxe and it was fantastic. Well worth the money spent. 

I order a jack & Coke, while my girlfriend ordered a Tito’s with ginger ale. 

I ordered a rigatoni entree and it was barely enough to feed a small child. My girlfriend ordered the linguine and to no surprise the dish was small. 

After leaving the restaurant I spent about $100. Very disappointed with the portion size for the main entree. 

The restaurant was nice, but I wouldn’t go here more than once.a year. It seemed to be more talk than anything.
Love the Pink Door. Great food, great service, great time.
Andrew took very good care of us and earned his tip
Pink Door is a beautiful restaurant.  The service was great and the food was delicious!  It also has a nice view.  This is a very good place for a nice romantic date night.  I can't wait to go back!
So so good!
We love the Pink Door for many reasons and go there often because it is so close to the Neighborcare Clinic across the alley where we work. I love it’s European ambience

When I made the reservation I said one person was in a wheelchair and we were celebrating a birthday. When we got to the restaurant, the first thing we see is a threshold a wheelchair cannot go over and a flight of stairs going down. . . plus a hostess that was not friendly or not trying to help the situation. I told her what the reservation said and she ignored me. Plus nothing was said or done for the birthday celebration.
BUT our server was friendly and her service was great. Plus the food and drinks were very good.
It was a good experience. Great service and the food was delicious! Could’ve had better seating

What a great evening!
Thomas was a superb waiter. He really made our experience. My favorite restaurant in Seattle. Authentic Italian and fabulous wine list. My sister was visiting from New Jetseg and was so impressed by the food. 
Your Oysters were the BEST I ever had!!
Will be back soon.
Thank you
Birthday.  Great entertainment..  I felt special.  Server was exceptional and went the extra mile!
It was fabulous!  The food, the service and atmosphere were superb! Haley was an excellent server.  Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Great experience and ambiance. Food was delicious, but not cheap. The restaurant wished me a happy anniversary with my SO and brought us small glasses of champagne, through our OpenDoor res. Excellent touch!
Best lasagna I have ever eaten!! The way the sauce oozes out of the pasta was delightful (:
The food was amazing and the atmosphere is very unique. Great special occasion or date.
Particularly great and tasty food in a very nice atmosphere. Different areas to try with bar, lounge area, main dining area. Will definitely be back for live music and show.
Nice place with a great ocean view. Their bolognese with fresh pasta is very good. It is a little bit price but worth it.
Great food. Actually amazing food. The atmosphere is great for a first date, date night, anniversary any reason! A little hard to find for people visiting but well worth it!

Very pleasant evening with friends  Everyone seemed so comfortable and at ease.  
The place exuded freshness in every aspect and tender loving care.  My sister and I were visiting Seattle-this place is a definite, "we have to go back".  Esp. for the aerialist.
Amazing service, good food and super delicious desserts!

The food was delicious and service was excellent!  Great menu.  I highly recommend the cheese board - it had a great selection of cheese.  The view from the restaurant is beautiful.  If you are visiting Seattle, put this restaurant on your list!

Literally can't say enough fabulous things about The Pink Door. The ambiance is incredible. The food is out of this world. And the service was lovely. I highly recommend the roasted garlic as an appetizer - my husband and I both agreed we probably could've just gotten a few of those and stuffed ourselves. I chose the lasagna because it is incredibly rare to find one that is meatless and my husband had rigatoni with meatballs. Both of us were pleased with the freshness and authenticity of our meals. If we have the pleasure of returning, I hope to make a reservation in the part of the restaurant where we can watch the cabaret show which looked like a real treat!
Funky and eclectic place near Pike’s Market.  We sat in the bar area and were treated to an acrobatic show.  Food was great and ambience was awesome!

We were seated by the window facing pike market and the water, which was fantastic! The lighting and candles in the room were nicely adjusted.
Food wise it was kind of mediocre. We actually liked trout which was the fish of the day.  However, there was too few choices on the menu. Maybe the appetizers and desserts were just not cater to our taste.

One of the best restaurants in Seattle!!! Great food, great service and the view is stunning!!!!
Will definitely come back.

This was our second visit and (like the first), it was fab! The menu suited all 4 guests, (and I have dairy/gluten sensitivities). The food is beautifully presented and very tasty - the tuna appetizer is delicious, and the roasted garlic - fantastic. Our main courses, again, were very flavorful... linguine with clams, trout, and Branzino Style white fish... amazing!
Lola, who was our server/adviser for the evening is wonderful, very engaging, funny, amiable and wonderfully professional... attentive but not intrusive...
There was no rushing us out of the door and we enjoyed a great evening.
Well worth the visit - just do it! You won't regret it...
Wonderful experience!
We had a wonderful experience as usual,  but my dairy allergy limited my choices and my entree was uninspired. Despite that, we all really enjoyed ourselves and look forward to returning.

Perfection 

Tough to find but worth the search
Was here exactly a year ago.  Loved it!  And had to return for the food...  if/when I come back again.  I will do dinner where nightfall adds to the ambiance.
Awesome as always!
Our waitperson was a jewel. Our table was nice and close to the window. Food was great. The Pink Door is one of our favorites in the Pike Place area.
Good food with a good friend...beautiful view

Pink Door is one of my favorite date places in Seattle. The Puget sound view from this restaurant is mesmerizing. There are good vegetarian options and the vegetarian Lasagne was my favorite. Their live music is amazing. I have visited this place before and it never disappoints.

Pink door hits the mark as always. We had family in town for the holidays and thought they would enjoy the atmosphere after a busy Christmas Day dinner. We all enjoyed the view, food and service is spectacular.
The lasagna wasn’t the same as it used to be... thicker pasta, too much tomato sauce, not enough beschemal but overall hit the spot!!!
Fantastic! We’ve eaten here numerous times and never been disappointed. Service was impeccable.
Cioppino and the linguine vongole were our choices and they could have not served it any better. Spot-on delicious
Wonder place for a special birthday day dinner.  Great food and fun decor
Always great

This is my favorite restaurant in Seattle, this restaurant is a hidden jem located in the post alley by the Pike Place market the entrance is a pink door.  This is a great place for special occasions.

Great food, great service. I've been coming here for over 10 years and take all my out of town friends here as well. This holiday season has been hard (my dad passed away suddenly) and we almost skipped celebrating all together. Instead we went here, to the restaurant him and I found together and were greeted like family. Our waitress was wonderful, and the food was (as always) perfect.
Wonderful holiday lunch. Great food, great ambiance!
This is our favorite restaurant in Seattle. Great find and you will never be disappointed
Never fails to deliver! I’ve never had a bad meal here and it’s my “go to” spot when I’m craving delicious Italian food with a flair!
Seriously the best lasagna I’ve ever had! So many flavors, I’ve been to Italy and this lasagne competes with the ones I had in Italy
The Pink door never disappoints. The food is amazing. Authentic delicious Italian. The staff is very friendly. We make it a must whenever in downtown Seattle.
Quite possibility the best overall restaurant in Seattle.  The food and service are both excellent and the atmosphere is awesome.

Carter was amazing. We celebrated our anniversary and they made our special dinner perfect. The food and everything else was perfect! Thank you Pink Door! Your entire staff were hands down wonderful! We cannot wait to come back!
Too load. Obnoxious. A poor experience.
I have been coming here for thirty or so years and it's always good. Bread is excellent!

The restaurant is not easy to recognize since they don't have any sign outside and only a pink door. They have great atmosphere because of the live house performance.  However, the food portion is a little bit small.

I made a reservation for my friend's and I to eat here for my birthday. We arrived 15-20 mins late and I had told them that that would be the case. We were placed in the lounge area instead of the dining area (which was fine; it was cozy) and were given a different menu, which barely had any options (this is the part which made me very disappointed). I didn't end up liking any of the food options so I asked the server if I could possibly substitute the pasta sauce from marinara to white sauce instead. She said yes and said she would also bring meatballs on the side. The pasta was brought out with very little cream sauce and was a very small serving.  I thought I would be paying about $21 which was the price of the dish, but turns out when I look at the check it was $38. I checked and the 3 pieces of meatballs were $13. The truth is I didn't like them so much that I couldn't even finish 1 meatball. The pasta itself was fine but it was definitely not worth $20. The customer service was very poor as well for our server didn't bother to mention the case if I did replace the sauce. I was not given much information. lIt definitely would have been fine if I was told but I was definitely not aware.
Not great. Food was not good. Ambience and music was nice though
Our server was outstanding! Informative, friendly, and considerate
This was a repeat visit for us. The pink door is one of our favorite restaurants, and I highly recommend it for a fancy date night or special occasion.

Absolutely delicious lunch, by far the best lasagna I've had out and I am a lasagna fiend. Very romantic ambiance for myself and my fiance, and it was exactly what I wanted for my birthday. Great service and even the house wine was delicious and affordable. Born and raised in Seattle I have been meaning to go here for years and I'm so happy I finally did!
Lovely meal for lunch today, husband had the grilled chicken panini and I had the slow simmered beef Bolognese with papadelle. Great cocktails, fun waiter.

Christmas lunch with a dear friend was made more special by the excellent food and service. I’ve never had a better Caesar salad! We shared that and the pizza of the day. Our waitress was pleasant and efficient. I’ll be going back soon!

One of my favorite Italian restaurants. Consistently a wonderful experience. Service, food, ambiance are all 5 star experiences every time I go.
Favorite foods: 
-Linguine Alle Vongole: Food is fresh, simple, with a clean taste. My bf orders this dish practically at every italian restaurant. The Pink Door does it the best. The simple garlic and white wine sauce with pancetta is delicious and great for dipping bread into (: 
-Cioppino Pink Door: I love the spicy tomato and white wine broth the seafood is simmered in. Also another great sauce to dip bread into and eat.
-Fresh Oyster starter: always fresh and delicious, especially with a little of the pink balsamico ice with each bite.
-Bagna Cauda: We love anchovies and garlic, so this was a winner. The fresh vegetables are great, but dipping bread into this hot bath of goodness was amazing. It is steaming hot and a bit salty.

Service+ Ambiance: We always go here to celebrate birthdays and anniversaries for a little romantic date, but the pink door is great for groups as well. It can get a little loud, but its a fun, energetic vibe. Service is always on point, servers know the menu and can suggest great wine pairings.

There is so much to this gem of a restaurant! Definitely try it for yourself. (:
Wonderful as always..the food the service the decor...perfect.
I came for the food, was curious about dinner with aerialist performance, and witnessed the sweetest marriage proposal two tables over. Very delightful evening!

I came here with my boyfriend for a date night and had a wonderful time. The atmosphere was incredible and the food was amazing. I ordered a dish that was off the menu but was highly recommended by the waitress. She was very nice and my water was never empty. There was nothing I could complain about.
Very nice ambiance. Great food for the price. It's a must eat.

It was REALLY hot when we first got there. Eventually someone decided to turn on the air conditioner and it was alot better after that. If you're gonna have the kitchen that close and open to the dining areas you need to make sure sure your watching the temperature of the customer dining areas. Otherwise we had a wonderful time and the food  & wait staff was excellant!
Baby reveal
We had the best server, Marcus.  He was outstanding as well as the food.

We loved The Pink Door! We will definitely be back. We had views of the market and Ferris wheel, are delicious lasagna and scallops and enjoyed the decor and service. Can’t wait to bring friends and family here!

My fiancée and I came here for our anniversary dinner and couldn’t be happier with the quality of service, food, and wine, and will definitely be returning once our middle class wallets can afford it again. Truly, thank you for the wonderful dinner!
Ordered the scallop special with mushroom sauce. It was one of the best meals I've ever had! Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned. Every bite was a delight!
Amazing service as well! Alexandra was phenomanal!
Our server was wonderful and appropriately attentive. The Market Fish scallops were devine

I'm not normally a huge fan of italian, but this place was absolutely amazing without breaking the bank. As soon as I heard the lasagna was the owner's grandmother's recipe and had been on the menu since the 80's, I had to try it. No regrets on that one. My sister had the clam linguine and was treated to a bowl that looked like it was just full of clams. She had to dig through them to find the pasta. Also amazing.
Fabulous!!!!
Liked its romantic vibe. Food and service was great.
Great lunch at the pink door. Festive and fun. Wonderful Pasta Vongole and Seafood Stew. Beautiful decor, views and good value. Friendly service. A Seattle must, very local and family run!

Fantastic food! Great lasagna, great vegan dish. We will be back. We went once before and the pappardelle was great. 

I doubt will go at night because I've heard complaints that the "entertainment" is political and it becomes unpleasant. 

Always a shame when a restaurant allows comedians to alienate half their diners....
