Wow. It had been a while since I was at the PD. Food was amazing! Same familiar menu but WOW - the food was on point.  Will make it a habit again.
Dinner was amazing! Sad I had a seizure in the middle of it and don’t remember much after that... But food was amazing, our server was awesome, and we can’t wait to come back!

I came for a birthday celebration. We had the lasagna and cioppino. Both were excellent. We sat in the bar on Monday to see the aerialist. We were able to see two performances over the course of an hour. They were definitely a draw, however they were a bit short. Overall a very fun experience with great service and great food and a great show if you were able to catch it. Almost hard to find, there is no sign just a Pink door in post alley.

Always enjoy the opportunity to eat at Pink Door.

Really getting to be a challenge to get reservations.
It was all awesome and the wait staff top notch.

A local favorite. Always have so much fun and come out completely stuffed in the best way possible. Amazing staff and service. Will be back again and again. P.s. gotta have the lasagna if you've never had it.

Visiting Seattle for the first time and we made reservations for the Pink Door. The ambience was amazing! Came here for date night and we had the window seat where we could see the water and the lights! Our waiter was excellent and friendly and the food was awesome. I will definitely come back!
Four of us, annual holiday gala. We had four different entrees, pasta with ragu bolognese, scallops, and two different veg entrees. All of us were happy. Great desserts and appetizers too.
Always our favorite. Great service and the food never fails. Just wish they had a location east side as the parking can be rough!
Always my go to when I'm in the city for the holidays.  Amazing place.

Decided to go out and do something new with a friend, I heard so many good things about this place so we went here. I made sure to make a reservation 2 weeks in advance. You would think that a reservation 2 weeks in advance would give us a nice table and all, it didn’t. We had an awkward table and were seated away from the pretty view. The place is beautiful overall, just didn’t get to really appreciate it all that much. The food was alright and the service was awful. Our waitress was never around and our glasses were always empty. Personally wouldn’t go again.

My husband and I had lunch at the pink door.  The food and drink were wonderful.  The bread was AMAZING and the millionaire cocoa was thick and rich.. a perfect cold day cocktail.  Definitely will return for dinner and cabaret!
Excellent food and service. Would highly recommend
Fantastic meal! kinda loud
Great food and service is outstanding
I loved the ambience.  The room was so festively decorated and the lighting just right.  Mrom the first glass of bubbly to dessert, a fine dining experience.
Thanks really enjoyed it.
We always have such a wonderful meal and ambience at The Pink Door…………great food and service. You are in for a treat if your server is Elyse.
Must for dinning experience when in Seattle! Amazing views, amazing food and amazing service!
Much better than expected

The Pink Door as always been one of my favorite spots in Seattle. 
With their latest remodel it has enhanced the dining experience with more views. 
They have the best outdoor patio in the city.
We had a lovely lunch - food was excellent, service was really good and ambience is always perfect.
Brilliant as always, excellent food, great service, great value. Looking forward to our next dinner there.

Our Server was INCREDIBLE!!  We had amazing , 5 star service.  Also enjoyed our Tarot Card Reading from Eugina!!  Was a perfect Holiday ambience and food!


Thank you and we will return!
Food was great. Service was good. Overall, we enjoyed our cioppino and clam pasta.
Always great. Tasty good, good value for money. Friendly staff. Great atmosphere.
Our second visit to Seattle and second visit to the Pink Door. Just as memorable as our first.  Terrific meal and superb service in a fun atmosphere with wonderful views of the  city.
There are many good restaurants in Seattle serving Italian fare and The Pink Door certainly can hold its own in such good company. Nice atmosphere, good service and a fairly good value to boot.
A good Italian restaurant.
I HAD A WONDERFUL TIME! THE FOOD WAS REALLY AWESOME!

Family came to celebrate a birthday and a college graduation. We were blown away by the atmosphere and aesthetic. We were seated promptly. The service was professional but personable. The food satisfied and exceeded expectations. We left blown away.

Really enjoyed my first dinner @the Pink Door. The entire experience, from checking in through dessert, was outstanding. I was pleasantly surprised by the fun and eclectic dining room. Our server was amazing. He was very knowledgeable about the menu, had great recommendations, and was super friendly.  The menu has both classics and in season options. Food was fantastic. I will be back!
The Pink Door never disappoints!  Great service, innovative menu, and a perfect setting.

We discovered the Pink Door several years ago and had a great experience, so  looked forward to dining there again.  Finally made it back and were pleasantly surprised to see that they had expanded into the adjacent space so there's much more seating available...and now with views of the water beyond the Market.  Very nice environs, good service, good food, will go again!
We had a wonderful meal.  Very competent table service.  Warm, inviting ambience.  Would not hesitate to book again.
Great experience of food as i hoped for! Simple classic tasty Italien recipes will just melt in your mouth :-) I  will come back again !

I walked in and the lighting was low which I liked a lot. It was a really cute fancy environment and I liked the burning candles. I felt like I was in the show Reign. I think the food was super good the waitress was super sweet and I had fun! Thank you! They out candles in for my sisters birthday and she loved it so thank you :)
The ambiance and live performance was outstanding. The food was just okay.

The food was just okay.  The Kushi oysters were samll even for Kushi's and several had a muddy taste.  The imitation Caesar Salad with Kale was a disappointment.  The Chicken Marsala was great and the scallops good.  The service was spotty.  We only had one fork for the oysters with two people eating.  We had to ask for water.  We ordered a split of Pinot Noir but were poured and charged for a full bottle.  The waitress knew that it was my wife's birthday and said "Happy Birthday" but offered no comp cupcake.  For the amount of money charged I expected more.  We have been there many times and this was always a standout.  Now it is just average...
Such a fun spot! We sat on the stage and had a great view of the show!
Nice restaurant, attentive staff, fantasic view of the waterfront.... oh and the food is not too bad also. What's not to like?
Second time visiting the Pink Door with my boyfriend.
A Seattle institution still knocking it out of the park!

This place was amazing! I don’t normally leave reviews but this one is worth it. The lasagna was fantastic! Our waitress, Kate, was top notch. Going to a nicer place like this isn’t something we do on a regular basis. She made it comfortable, easy, and enjoyable. We were celebrating our engagement here and this was the perfect place for it.
Fantastic food, fantastic ambiance, fantastic location. We will return.
The Pink Door was fabulous! I would love to come back to one of your shows!
Wonderful food and service, great Seattle views. Will be visiting again!

Service was terrible... specially Lindsay H. our waitress. 

We finished dinner and sat at the bar... not one bartender spoke to us or asked us if we wanted a drink. We would’ve happily had another drink as we were enjoying the music. 

Should’ve listened to the reviews.
This a favorite location for family outings
Pretty impressive
As always a wonderful experience. Our favorite restaurant in Seattle. We bring all of our out of town guests here and it’s always top notch.

The food was excellent with our only complaint being that the side order of meatballs that we ordered was almost cold. Otherwise, service was great, flavors of the food were on point, and the atmosphere was excellent. Would definitely visit again.
One of our favorite places to dine! Food is always wonderful, friendly, professional service.

We went for a birthday celebration. We had a booth with a view of the water.  The setting was lovely - eclectic vintage. The server was knowledgeable and attentive. Cheese board ap has a nice assortment of cheeses. Kale salad was excellent as was the Cesar salad w/ crab (recommendation from a local). The halibut special was also excellent, served
W/ gnocchi. Others in the group had rigatoni w/ Italian sausage, chicken Marsala, pasta w/ clams. Everything was delicious. Bread pudding topped it all off nicely. Will definitely go again!

We had a wonderful time at The Pink Door. The live music was great! We had a tasty Halibut dish and an amazing rosé. I highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion. The hostess and waiter were extremely friendly.

Hostess was rude. Sat at the bar. Was very busy and received mediocre service. Lasagna was good. One bartender was great - the other didn’t mix any of our cocktails. Concerning that they received a “good” and not an “excellent “ from Seattle health and hygiene.

Service was awful, didn’t get offered bread like all the other tables, garlic bread (that we bought separately) was burnt I couldn’t even eat it. Food was good not a lot of flavor but still really good.
Del momtón y más caro que la media
Really terrific food!
Very pretty decor. The service was excellent.  The food was delish. We were in from out of town and it was a delightful way to begin our trip.

The key to excellent service and low noise level may have been a dinner reservation at 3 PM, but on the spur of the moment it was available,and we were not sorry.  Imaginative, delicately flavored pasta and risotto, and the nutella cheesecake was the smoothest ever. The kind where you take one bite and slip into a silent, eyes- closed reverie...
Lovely as always!
Great food, great environment and awesome service!

Wonderful spot! Very unique.  
Be specific in reserving however so you make sure to get something in view of the main room, they moved us into a back spot well albeit it pleasant was not what I was expecting; and I made the reservation as early as I could in advance! (i.e. checking everyday until I could.. haha)
The best lasgana I have ever had in my life.  The service was superb (David was amazing and helpful).  The wine selections were perfect.  I wish I lived closer.

Let me start by saying that the Pink Door is NOT impossible to find if you follow directions well, either from the website or GPS. We found it first time out. We liked the fact that it doesn't have to advertise its existence with a giant sign or gaudy neon. This restaurant is somewhat like the door out front -- simply stated. It's everything you could want for a cozy, delicious dinner on a chilly November night in Seattle. We had reservations, which are highly recommended. The service was great, only to be outdone by the food and drink. We had the Pink Door Caesar Salad with Shrimp and the Rigatoni & Grilled Italian Sausage with Marinara Sauce. We started with a glass of craft beer and the Chianti Ruffina, followed by an order of the Tuscan Fries. ALL the food was extremely fresh and beyond tasty. Thanks to the Pink Door for a great dining experience! Others enjoy!

As usual, the food and ambience are great at The Pink Door!  We always enjoy ourselves when going here and enjoy bringing out of town guests.  I am disappointed in the professionalism of our server at lunch yesterday.  He had very poor service skills and had a disagreeable personality that ultimately impacted our dining experience.
The quality of the food is always good.   A little pricey for lunch, but worth it.

We came here for our anniversary, the staff was very accommodating I had made reservation for by the window but decided we wanted to move after being seated to the lounge/show area. Our sever was very sweet she brought us a small glass of prosecco to toast and treated us to dessert after our meal. Overall the experience and service was amazing, the food was good not great.
Amazing Service & Amazing Food! I definitely will come back again

A very enjoyable evening! Food was great and the ambiance was very warm and funky. My only complaint was that the aerial show was too short- it was truly stunning and the accompanying music was fantastic. We’re definitely going again!

This is a hidden gem! My wife and I made a reservation weeks in advance celebrating our honeymoon. Not only were we greeted with smiles and a champagne toast at our table, we had the best view in the house with the Bayfront view. The food and service were over the top as we were not rushed and enjoyed every second of our appetizer, meal and drinks. The view was the best in the house and it was the perfect place to have a date as it is not loud and we were able to have a conversation at a normal voice. Wish I lived closer to to Seatlle to visit this wonderful establishment on a weekly basis!
Loved it! Great food and view. Fun, kinda hidden, gem!
Great atmosphere and Lola was fantastic!
Great interior, nice service.  SO over rated.  Food was well plated, fresh and clean but uninteresting and lacking real flavor.

The food was delicious but there was this one guy that asked me to moved my napkin because his 2 hands were occupied and he was sarcastic when he said "I only have 2 hands", i don't mind moving the napkin but I mind the comment, I didn't travel from LA to get that kind of service at a high recommended it restaurant.
Absolutely wonderful!  Lovely table by the window, excellent service and delicious food!!!  A perfect evening!

Food is excellent as always, but server could be friendlier. I asked for special of the day, waiter told me everything is on the menu. I’ve been there many times (10+), they always have something not in the menu or the fish of the day; something to that sort. Also, I had to ask for bread while other tables are served without asking. Disappointing!

Pink Door is one of those special experiences that you have every few years, if you're lucky. One of those hidden gems that you just happen to stumble upon- encountering a buzzing, musical hub down a flight of stairs. I felt like I was walking into a Speakeasy. It was wonderful and the food seemed to be cooked by a fleet of Nonnas. Cannot recommend highly enough- the lasagne, the handcrafted cocktails, the swelling, uptempo music, it was amazing and purely memorable. Less about filling your tummy, and more about a fantastic experience. Highly recommend going at night.
Fantastic view, delicious food.  It's been a special occasion go to spot for years.

Waitstaff was attentive and helpful. The menu was varied and our party of four enjoyed everything we ordered. Two of us had dietary restrictions and the waiter went through the menu, meal by meal, to let us know what we could eat given our intolerances. You know it's a good restaurant when everyone gets their dish and makes yummy sounds. Highly recommend and will definitely be back.

Always a wonderful experience. 
Always a delicious meal.
Wonderful choices and plates to share.
Such a wonderful dinner tonight! The wine and food was fantastic. Great service overall and our waiter was awesome! The restaurant has such a lovely ambiance and I cannot wait to come back!!

The entertainment was awesome! We went on a Sunday night (when the aerialist performs), and were very impressed by her talent. It's not often you get to watch a trapeze act inches from your table in a dimly lit, cozy Italian restaurant. That being said, the food was only fair. It wasn't bad by any means, but I was expecting much better things out of the kitchen based on the price tag of the meals. The meals were also pretty small portion sizes. My husband is 6'9" and consumes a lot of calories a day, and he ate two whole baskets of bread in addition to the meal and left hungry. (This might be a special case, but I did feel cheated on the amount of food for the money.)  All in all, you're paying for the entertainment and the ambiance of the place, which was superb and well worth it.
The ambiance was something else, suuuuuper romantic - candlelit, beautiful views of the Seattle Waterfront. Live music was plus too!

Everyone raves about pink door. It’s cute, hidden and a nice little Italian spot, but nothing so memorable or insane that I’d die to go back. They do shows (burlesque) and so not knowing this and seeing a line down the alley to get it, I was a bit confused. We did get to skip that line, but no one tells you this. Because a show was going on we were seated in the very far back. It was freezing inside the restaurant- we asked for them to look into it because everyone was wearing their parkas. Overall the food was ok and I didn’t see the show or wasn’t even told about it and offered to buy a ticket- wish they had said something.
The lasagna was amazing, the best one I've had so far.
Was a lovely experience! Food and service was fantastic! Can’t wait to come back

Excellent lunch.... hazel nut crusted halibut was fabulous!  Also had the prosciutto plate, grilled bread (the best), Caesar with crabmeat (an all time favorite), pasta bolognese, and mamas meatballs!  Everything was just wonderful.  Took some out of town guests and they were impressed!  We go back whenever we can...

My husband and I celebrated our 3 year anniversary on Halloween here and our waiter was dressed as Ursula and really took care of us. We even got two free glasses of prosecco. The entire staff was in costume, and Ronald McDonald was doing Karaoke. So much fun! And the food was delicious as always, you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, even if you can't pronounce it 😂.
10/10 would recommend. We went for a work lunch but its great for really any occasion.
Stopped in for a business dinner.  Great atmosphere, fantastic food and service!  Highly recommend the Pink Door for any occasion.
One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. Love to go for a nice lunch or dinner. Great that they have added space. My all time favorite is on the deck when weather permits
The food was amazing! The experience was the best. I highly recommend this place! Make sure to book a resveration and you’ll be able to watch the amazing performances.

By far, my favorite go to for special occasions or to bring visitors. I am a Seattle native and the pink door has long been a favorite. Lola is an exceptional server if you are lucky enough to be st one of her tables, she made our experience delightful!
Eclectic clientele; excellent food, superior service. Overall a great experience.
We really enjoyed our dinner at The Pink Door! Our server was attentive but not intrusive, and the meal was absolutely delicious!
The Pink Door was excellent. We enjoyed the ambiance and the food was great. We sat in the dining room and had a nice view of the water front. We highly recommend this restaurant.

Fabulous atmosphere and food. 
We celebrated an anniversary with friends who had not been to The Pink Door before. It was so fun to share their excitement and appreciation.

Pink Door offers an amazing dining experience.  The alleyway entrance leads downstairs to a fun dining room, but there’s a second space with a large window overlooking the Pike Street Market and bay!  The service was perfect, and the food was delicious.  While our cioppino o and lasagna were fresh with flavorful twists, the bread pudding was one of the best desserts ever!

the people were great and very helpful. i wanted steak during lunch time but no steak on the menu, until dinner because apparently its to expensive for lunch is what i was told by my kind waiter. he still braught me the dinner menu and i orderd the steak which was amazing. yes it was a little pricey but im from out of town and wanted to taste what the pink door had to offer at its finest. my wife orderd the pink door seafood platter, which was also incredible. all in all i paid around $120 for two including tip and 1 appetizer. even tho we sat in the middle. the view was great, atmosphere was delightfule and we both had a great time. i would come back again. very happy customer
Hadn't been to the Pink Door in years so thought we'd give it a try.  Food and service were excellent.  I would recommend.

The only thing I was disappointed in was the lack of acknowledgment of us celebrating my girlfriend’s birthday. I made a note in my open table reservation and I also tried speaking with the hostesses while attending a work dinner at the Pink Door earlier in the week. The hostesses were pretty dismissive and let me know it wouldn’t be possible to reserve a special table. Our server didn’t know it was my girl’s birthday and we didn’t even end up ordering dessert.
Great Lasagna!!!

Second time here and they were even better than the first. We arrived almost a half hour early (poor planning on our part) and came in to see if there was a slight chance we could seat earlier. The hostess was very polite and told us they were very booked and we would likely have to wait. Not their fault so we were 100% okay waiting. About 7 minutes later the hostess said that some people didn’t show and we could be seated early. Such a nice gesture. Service is amazing, food is amazing (get the lasagna, you can thank me later) and the atmosphere is totally fun. Go.

We had an amazing evening at The Pink Door! The decor and vibe is so funky and cool and we enjoyed our view of the water and the sky wheel.  The food was very good and the rosemary gimlet was delicious! As we were leaving, a jazz singer had just started singing and she was amazing! We will definitely be back!

I had the paperadel  Bolognese it was WONDERFUL
 tasted the small leftovers the next day it was even BETTER !

Food was good.  Nothing innovative, but then I cane from the Bay Area so it may not be fair.  Restaurant’s location and interior is great.  However, service was terrible.  Order was taken by one staff, meal was served by another.  Came in at 3 pm, not very busy, but the meal server never came back to our table with another knife she said she would since she dropped the first one.  And she never came back to serve us bread as requested nor to check on us.  Have to ask the busboy for a spoon.  Papadelle al ragu was served cold...bleh!  Would not recommend this for food.
Best election for our aniversary, excelent service and the best lasagna ever

A destination place for sure. Unique for that special occasion. We flew up from LA just for our 40th wedding anniversary and the restaurant was the highlite of our trip. The food is excellent as the service.. the fun comes in with a circus ciquele show!!

My husband and I ate at the Pink Door to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The ambiance and atmosphere of the Pink Door was perfect for this occasion! We were seated near the large window at the back of the restaurant overlooking the Seattle pier which was breathtaking! Our waiter, Thomas, was OUTSTANDING! Aside from the delicious, authentic dishes, Thomas was truly the best part of our night and made it extremely special!!

Thomas was extremely helpful in helping with both our wine and food selection. Since we were celebrating a special occasion, we decided to go all out with our meal and Thomas made perfect recommendations and allowed for us to thoroughly enjoy each dish as he brought them out one at a time. We will definitely visit the Pink Door again. Next time we will come for dinner and a show on Saturday night when they perform their burlesque shows.

Aerial performances. Great bottles of wine. Our server coursed out our meal so that we didn't feel rush. In town visiting Seattle for the first time from Denver with some girlfriends. We enjoyed our meal and thanks for the sparkling wine toast to our friend celebrating her engagement. I will be back.
it was extremely delish i have recommended to my entire family
It was worth the month long wait to get a table on a Saturday night!

The Pink Door was so incredibly accommodating to me and my partner when we were visiting Seattle. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, and the food beautifully presented. The gluten free options were superb, too! 

Thanks for such a lovely evening.
I celebrated my birthday and everything was on point. Food and service were excellent!!
I tried the Rock Fish and it was absolutely wonderful.  I highly recommend it, if available.

"No wonder it is so hard to get a reservation. " The first thing one of our party said when they tasted the food. Excellent all around. We were seated by the windows overlooking the waterfront. Spectacular views to match the food.

Not very disability friendly. I have a autoimmune disease and those stairs killed me. The food was great but hurt my stomach some as the noodles were drowning in oil. I asked if it was normal and the waitress said it was supposed to be that greasy. UGH! It was fun over all tho! :) Wish we had found a better access to the place. I know it is supposed to be charming and hidden but it was hard on my legs. Plus there was no place to sit and wait. Had 9pm reservations and we got seated at 9:45pm . Worth the experience at least once. But don't expect it to be fine dining because it just is not.
Food was incredible, I had a fresh caught halibut. Service was great. The music was fun!

The food was great, loved the new décor. Our server was a little overwhelmed on a busy Friday night, she forgot mention the specials, the dessert, and brining coffee refills. But over all it was good.
Fun hidden restaurant! Great food and atmosphere. The patio is wonderful in the summer or the inside is cozy and large in the colder months.

Really enjoyed my meal here and would highly recommend for anyone visiting or any locals who haven’t been. I say at the bar and the staff was lovely, attentive and nice to chat with!  The food was phenomenal.
Fun restaurant. Great portion on the whole fish. Will definitely go again. Be sure to get the bolognese
Great food with a great ambience and vibe and a spectacular view! Highly recommend this place for a memorable dinner in seattle
Loved our experience at the Pink Door! Our food and drinks were amazing and the service was great. You get everything you pay for here.
A wonderful experience. My wife loved her Italian dish. The pork shank was awesome and the little green bottle of wine was a nice touch. Definitely a Seattle gem.
Outstanding everything! Can’t say enough. What a great find.
Always love the patio and it was a lovely day.
Excellent food. Great value. Great staff. Superb location.
Great service very cool decor fun time had by all!
Flavorful dishes. Fresh ingredients.
Very good food, but not excellent. The pasta was a little undercooked.
Dinner for 4 at Pink Door was a delight.  Had a wonderful waiter who was lots of fun, we all loved the ambiance and each one of us absolutely loved our food.  Will definitely return when in town.
Wonderful wait staff. Engaging, kind & funny. Drinks were creative & fun. Dinners were amazing & a shared breast pudding was, as they say, to die for! We will come back!

Great ambiance.  Exceptional service.  Small
Menu but everything was delicious.
Loved it! Great place great view and the food was delicious!
Amazing service and food which made for a perfect anniversary dinner.
It’s was great. Nice view of the water and the wheel. Service was a bit slow but the quality of service was good. Portions of food were nice and the price point was good.
Gorgeous interior, very romantic. Food was amazing.
Delicious food. Wonderful service.

Went for lunch.  Food was very good.  Had the lasagna because someone recommended it.  It did not disappoint and the size was good, it wasn't too big or too small.  The pesto layers really made it different.   Ambiance is interesting.  Prices weren't outrageous.  I would recommend going.  Door is actually more of a peach color and is accessed through Post which is an alley behind the original Starbucks.
Amazing squid ink pasta and ambiance!!! Would definitely recommend.
This was such a great find!  Amazing sunset view.  A very good tarot card reader there to book before, after or during your meal.  We will be back!

Great food!  My girlfriend and I both had cioppino and it was amazing!  

The service wasn’t great.  It’s the kind of vibe where they’re like, “we don’t need your business”.  

The food and views made it really great though and it wasn’t overly expensive, would go back, with hopefully a different waiter/hostess.

The Pink Door itself is really closer to melon color.  Anyway, you find this door without a sign and wonder what is on the other side.  Down a flight of stairs, then through several large seating/lounge/areas.  We were seated in the large back room which overlooks part of the Pike Place Market, bright and cheery.

Despite living in Seattle for over 30 years, this was our first visit.  We chose a mid-day lunch and were treated to excellent service and very good food.  We had the antipasti plate, and an eggplant panini.  Both were so tasty and fresh.

We did arrive a little early (11:45) just enough to be ahead of the very busy lunch crowd.

Great experience 

First time for my adult children and all enjoyed it a lot!

We enjoyed a wonderful dinner (again) with a selection of fresh daily specials. The Pink Door is and has been a favorite for over a decade! Our dinner was in the newer dinning room with its fantastic sunset views over Elliot Bay. The personal attention of our waiter and the delicious, flavorful, fresh and beautiful presented food all made for a wonderful dinning experience! Can't wait for the next
time.

The Pink Door was excellent!  We ended up going twice for dinner during our trip.  The second time, they remembered us and gave us a complimentary dessert!  Food and service was great!  It’s become our favorite restaurant in Seattle!
Lovely lovely night out with amazing food and beautiful views.

Absolutely nothing could have been better. The view, the atmosphere, food and service were 5+ star.
The entire evening was one of the finest I have had in many years!
Celebrated my Dad’s 70th birthday. I cannot say enough great things about the service of our server Thomas and the food at The Pink Door. It could not have been a better experience. 5 HUGE stars!
Such amazing Italian food. You must get the lasagna!!

I've always wanted to go to Pink Door, but never had the chance! Then my 5 year anniversary popped up with my loving boyfriend from San Francisco. BOOM! It was finally our turn to try the magic of Pink Door. The Pink Door Lasanga lived up to its name, and the meatballs in the rigatoni made the dish! Also, don't pass up on those aioli fries, they were the BOMB DIGGITY. 5/5 would highly recommend to a friend!

I simply love The Pink Door. Yes, it's changed its layout. There's a causal dining area, a more formal dining area, the patio, and the bar. Hey, it's all great--and now there are even more choices of what ambiance one might want during the meal. For this time at the Pink Door, we sat in the formal dining area by the window. It was a lunch celebration for my husband (just the two of us). We love slow lunches as one might have in Italy, and Pink Door always accommodates that easy meal with lots of great dishes and drinks. For the main, I had a succulent halibut. Perfectly cooked. We ordered a side of roasted cauliflower. Had a lovely chocolate dessert. Wonderful. The full meal can be pricey but reasonable for Seattle prices for that kind of meal. Can't wait to go back in December for our annual holiday meal with extended family.
Fantastic food and service. Would return here again but with so many other great choices in Seattle I am not sure I would have time.

Server was nice 👍 food was terrible! We had the cheese platter to start followed by roasted bruschetta worst cheese platter, bruschetta was tasty. Then we ordered the halibut special $31 each we had two it was served with warm to cold fingerling cut potatoes cold green beans ( watermelon tequila drink was sold out my first wine glass was dirty
Great Servers, great meal.

Bar service was terrible.  Asked for menus at 4:15 pm, found out they were lunch menus later.  Asked for a napkin when our app arrived and bartender looked annoyed, gave me one for the two of us.

Lola the server was great for dinner.  Informative, cheery and had great timing.

Love the location and atmosphere of the Pink Door. I had the: celery fennel salad, frites, and an oyster. The salad was crisp and clean. A little too tossed with dressing but still delicious. The frites with garlic were delicious. Everything I enjoy about well-cooked frites - crisp but soft. I recommend a view near the water in the afternoon.
Must stop for us every time we are in Seattle.  Food is fantastic and the service was great.
We met friends there and enjoyed our food and conversation, although had to definitely raise our voices to be heard in the dining room. :(
Great staff and good food! I had Pink Door Caesar, Prosciutto, strawberry shortcake. The ambience was also very nice with scenic view.

Wonderful food (lasagna, bruschetta, and mushroom pasta were divine!) and romantic, bustling atmosphere. My fiance and I had a great time celebrating our anniversary. We even caught part of an aerial show as we entered. Love this place for date night or a night out with friends!
I looked forward to this meal after hearing about the restaurant.  It was wonderful with our perfect waitress and absolutely delicious food.

This was a recommendation from my coworker. We were in town from New York and the food and ambiance really blew us away. Our waiter was very helpful and telling us about the menu choices and he was very friendly and attentive. The food was absolutely amazing.
Great restaurante, delicious food and always full of fun attractions!

Only concrete plans for my visit to Seattle, were for the Pink Door, based on all the positive reviews online. I wish I could say my anticipation and excitement matched my actual experience there. Servers and food were GREAT!! Management and bar staff were rude to say the least and for some reason disliked our table and let us know they didn’t like us. Four almost 40 year old women, enjoying a nice dinner and a few cocktails, paid our bill, tipped well..... but were yelled at and cut off by the bartender. The dancing, loud bachelorette party behind us was ok, but us four talking amongst ourselves were an issue for the staff. Wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone, and don’t agree with their self proclaimed ‘unpretentious’ atmosphere!

I’ve always had the best experiences at The Pink Door! That’s why it’s my favorite restaurant! I was ecstatic that we were able to make reservations for my birthday! It was a great experience and our server was incredible and I loved sitting outside!

The service was not great. We had to keep asking for water to be refilled and the same for wine. When our food arrived we had to reminded them to bring silverware. Slow service. They rely on location and the outdoor terrace for return business. The food is good.
Service was outstanding, food fresh and delicious.  Eating great food while watching the sun set over the water in this great setting was perfect!
Seattle family getaway great dinner great service beautiful restaurant especially the bar sat outside was wonderful
Came for our anniversary and they made it extra special. Food and service was outstanding.
We enjoyed our late lunch here. We had a great table facing Pikes Market. The food was excellent and so was the service. Wonderful.
Fabulous views, staff, environment and food. Perfect for brunch with my Mom in from out of town! Thank you!

Once again, a great time. The Caesar with shrimp and the Luiguine alla Vongole. Don’t miss the Caprese. 

Can’t wait to come back again.
I wrote in the reservation that we were going because it was my wife’s birthday, and they put a candle in our dessert, thank you very much for that kind gesture! Awesome experience.
The food was delicious and our waiter was exceptional!
The tuna crudo was outstanding so much so I went back twice just to get it again. Great location and staff was very friendly and attentive.
Excellent food and a fun atmosphere.  Service was top notch.
We loved Pink Door. Would love to go back. Food was fantastic. Great service, not overly intrusive but just the right amount of attention. The pasta dishes were awesome!
The food was okay but we were rushed the entire time by our rude waitress. It seems as though the hype of The Pink Door has gotten to the heads of the wait staff.
Every bite is amazing
Always a great dinner at The Pink Door!!
Food was excellent and the view was lovely. All in all a great experience and would love to go back during one of the shows and experience the atmosphere and entertainment at night.
Beautiful evening, the food was amazing, as usual. The wine selection paired so well with the meal. And the trapeze performance was elegant. A perfect end to the day!
Love the atmosphere of this place, quirky yet comfortable.  Everyone we encountered was unique, professional and kind.  The food was excellent, great wine list and desert was awesome as well.
Tried for a couple years to get a reservation and everything was fantastic
Excellent service and great ambiance! Wonderful place to go for a date night or a birthday dinner.

Great service. Great Food. Quirky waitstaff but again great service. Perfectly cooked Halibut. Excellent pasta dish, bucatini.
Reasonably  price actually.  Might be overhyped but good overall dining experience.
A nice little hideaway in pikes place! Easy to pass by, the food is good comfort Italian and the ambiance is just quirky enough. Very good, very fun.
My daughter has just moved to Seattle and we weee looking for something fun and different! You can highly recommended!

Setting & service were excellent. Appetizers were great. Main course unimpressive. Ciopino was bland, vongole was smothered in bacon so couldn’t taste the clams. Rigatoni & sausage was the only winner.
It was our 5th anniversary and we were seated by the windows. It was beautiful! The food was outstanding. And the drinks were yum! It was perfect!

The Pink Door never disappoints and this was no exception.  Our server was prompt, friendly and informative. The dishes were all spot on delicious and the patio was perfect!  I had the squid ink pasta which I could have eaten for days. My guests raved about the seasoned olive oil and  we can’t wait to go back!

We had lunch at the Pink Door.  Lasagna - melts in your mouth!!    We asked what was in it and were informed no meat and no cheese - what??   It was heavenly.     We also had their specialty lunch pizza which was very flavorful.   Had a view  of Pike Place Market which was fun to watch all the activity while enjoying lunch.   

It’s a little difficult to find the restaurant down Post Alley, no signage just a light pink door.

Stopped here about 10 years ago on a road trip from Santa Barbara to Seattle and back...and did the same on this trip, too. Same great views and entertainment and boisterous atmosphere. Each room offers something unique. The ahi crudo was sensational. My friend loved his bolognese dish but was regretting he didn’t order the cioppino which was also fantastic. Our waitress was attentive, however, took away our {gluten free + dairy free!} garlic bread when I had one of our plates boxed. It was an obvious attempt to hurry us along so she could seat another table. We still had half a bottle of wine, so we we lingered for quite a while anyway, despite her tossing our delicious, special-ordered bread. Overall, loved our authentic dishes. Thank you!

The Pink Door was absolutely delicious in every way! From the service, to the view we had of the water to the food-- we were so happy with our experience and would definitely recommend a visit to anyone in Seattle!

The Pink Door was a great restaurant tor my friends to come to.  I was visiting a friend that lived in the Seattle area and she had not been here before.  We would have loved to have received the bread basket that all of the other tables around us had received, but we did not.  Overall however, it was wonderful food!
Our server Lu made the experience with her introduction to The Pink Door. The food and the ambiance followed.
great food, great service, normal portions
Always a great experience!  The weather cooperated so we were able to enjoy the outdoor seating into September ... a 2 1/2 hour lunch!

The Pink Door is one of my favorite spots in my city of Seattle.  I have eaten there at least four times this season.   One of the draws in the summer, besides the spectacular patio overlooking Puget Sound, are the dishes with extraordinary heirloom tomatoes!  The caprese salad featuring fresh mozzarella and heirloom tomatoes and bruschetta with the tomatoes are fabulous!

On this particular visit for my birthday, our server was wonderful, the weather was terrific, all of our food was exemplary and the view unmatched.  We concluded our meal with fresh brewed coffee and a tantalizing lemon tart!  You must visit The Pink Door!
We had an awesome dinner and got to see the first aerial performance.

My husband and I had the best time. We loved everything we ate. I am in awe of atmosphere and the culinary. Not one bit disappointed.  37 years in business and there is no sign outside to show people how to get in. That tells you how good this restaurant is.  Bravo.

Great everything!! My Daughter and Son in Law had 2 drinks ordered for us upon arrival. This was for my wife's 60th Birthday Dinner. They delivered promptly. The food was excellent and the Lasagna was excellent as usual. Service was great. The only blemish is that when we've dine an many top line restaurants and I make reservation for a very special event like a 60th Bday, we've always been presented a small cake, coffee or something to end the night. It's always a very classy touch. We didn't see our server once the bill was laid down. Missed opportunity.  Still one of our favorites in Seattle!!

Went a little earlier than reservation, very accommodating.  Evidently it is the place to go around Pike's Market....there was a line outside before it opened.  Quite a bit of ambiance...lots of mirrors.  Food was okay.  A little offended that the first drink was No No Trump but it is Seattle!.

Food was ok. Found a rock in my food probably due to the clams but still there was a rock in my food. All the waiter did was take it away and that was it. Waitress only checked on us probably once or twice, Could have been better.
The food was delicious and great service. Will definitely go back. The only thing is wish there was a sign to the door, took us awhile to find the place. The door is not even salmon.

Our anniversary dinner was a perfect night of delicious food and wine, great service, amazing ambiance topped off by the very entertaining cabaret and burlesque show!  This definitely is one of my favorite memories of our visit to Seattle!  I already am looking forward to our next evening at the Pink Door!  Thank you for turning our anniversary dinner into a memorable event!!

We had a reservation and were seated immediately.
We were greeted and provided with specials by our friendly server.  
She brought us complimentary glasses of prosecco for our anniversary. 
The grilled octopus was tasty and well seasoned. Not the most tender octopus I have ever had but still very good. 
We shared the summer risotto next. Perfectly seasoned.  Anise was the predominant flavor. Still delicious and creamy with very fresh crab. 
The cioppino was tasty. The broth was similar to a minestrone. The seafood was just a touch overcooked.
Overall a very lovely meal.  Excellent service.

This restaurant is all about interiors. The ambiance was intimate and good for dates especially if you are seated near the front where they have live music. At the back of the restaurant offers a great view. The food was okay or below average. Ordered Linguine but it was undercooked and too salty for me. Offers only a handful of dessert menu so not a lot of options especially for dessert lovers and with sweet tooth like me. Would i recommend this for a date? Yes. But for food quality and service, my apologies but no.
I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, wine list, and handcrafted cocktails. I went for the atmosphere, stayed for the food.
I liked everything about this place. Loved everything we ordered ( pasta, rabbit, ceasar salad), excellent service, nice ambience. Everyone else’s food looked great too. Very nice experience
Fantastic food, great table and service!  It was a great evening.

The most adorable young guy was our server and the nicest person we met in Seattle :)
Lasagna was to die for

Went for lunch.  Not when the show was on.  Service was fantastic.  The tomatoes, basil and cheese appetizer was excellent.  The heirloom tomatoes were perfectly fresh and very meaty.  Had the halibut specials tasted very fresh.  Was there for My Aunt's 80th birthday.  View from windows was magnficient.
Great place, went with the family when they came out to Seattle to visit. Wide variety on the menu and real fresh ingredients and delicious. Our server was also wonderful and very helpful.
The food and the service at the Pink Door make it our favorite restaurant in Seattle. Always a wonderful night.

Lovely patio setting in Pike Place Market
Delicious Italian cuisine. Gorgeous on a sunny Seattle day or on a dark night inside with a date
I love dining at The Pink Door because of the ambience and delicious food. My favorite dish is their Bolognese.
We travel and love finding new places to dine. The Pink Door is our new favorite. Truly a great experience! The food was excellent and the best service I've seen for a very long time, well done!!!

Our first time in Seattle & any time I researched places to go for dinner, this spot popped up! An awesome (and kind of hidden!) joint on the very cool Post Alley, and the restaurant is really pretty inside & way bigger than I expected. We started with the octopus (yum) and got entrees we both loved (mine was the mixed seafood -- forget the name) and my boyfriend got the rabbit. Both really great dishes -- my only negative comment would be that my portion felt a bit small.  Would definitely recommend & go back to try other things here!

Highly recommend their garlic bread for the extra $6 - it was delicious!!  The ahi tuna app was awesome as well.  The food was very good, but be prepared for an extremely limited protein menu.  When we visited there was only one fish dish (they were not offering the branzino style that night), one beef, one pork and one rabbit dish.  No chicken.  So if you’re looking for pasta you’re in the right place.
Great food and a great time
Good food, cozy environment .  Definitely coming back to try other items on the menu.
Great food and drinks! Awesome views and excellent service! No matter the occasion or reason this is a great spot for Italian food!!

We were only in Seattle four days, but loved The Pink Door so much we visited twice.  The hosts were very gracious, even calling me to say they were able to accommodate my request for a different time.  Both servers were excellent and fun and of course, the food was outstanding!
The entire time there was amazing and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!

We really enjoyed our experience at The Pink Door for food, the unique entertainment on the weekend evenings, and Ambiance. Our service was not especially attentive or friendly, but was reasonable. It would have also been better to book or request a table in the lounge area since we were interested in seeing the performance without having to stand  on the staircase. Our table by the window overlooking the water was amazing.
loved it-  the lasagna was the best I have ever had- loved the wine in the green bottles-  server was charming and professional

Loved this restaurant, and exceeded our expectations for food, service, and ambiance. We had a window table overlooking the sound, our server made great recommendations, and was just the right amount of attentive. Penn Cove mussels and clams were delicious, as well as the Neah Bay salmon. We'll be back again.
What a perfect place to celebrate my birthday year after year! Lola was the perfect server and the food outstanding, again. They always make you feel special!
The entertainment made me want to get a root canal

We had a fabulous time celebrating our daughter at the beautiful Pink Door.
Our server Lou was personable and funny, willing to take the occasional photo too.
The food was delicious and the menu varied enough to attend to all our needs ( daughter vegetarian.)
The view was magical and the ambiance was warm and inviting.
We will be returning soon!
Thankyou
Excellent food, service and views.
This is the best lasagna I have ever eaten! Caprese salad also delicious!
Show is over rated... usually just some guy with a guitar.
Ask for patio dining. Lovey, fun and great food. Everything from the bar service 2 the cioppino to the lemon tart was quite excellent
Very hard to find, but a great place with reasonable prices.
Excellent restaurant in every way. The food, of course, was the highlight. Beyond beautiful and delicious. Our server cheerfully accommodated our special requests.

The Pink Door never disappoints!  Even if you can't sit outside, it's so cute inside.  Great for any occasion, really.  The food, though, is good good.  Didn't try the wine, but list looks extensive.  They change their menu every 3 months, so go often.

Every time I dine at Pink Door I think it can’t get better. Whenever my friend visits from out of town and his mom stays in Seattle to visit with him I take a week day off we do lunch at here. We arrived about 20 minutes early our noon reservation but were still seated immediately outside as requested. If you haven’t dine outside at Pink Door it’s a must. We had a wonderful leisurely lunch with excellent service. We shared the tuna crudo as an appetizer so refreshing the citrus of the orange paired so beautifully with the tuna. My friend had the lasagna which os a very generous serving he ended up taking half of it home. His mom had the clam linguini she us unable to eat garlic due to health reasons and they easily accommodated. I had the Springtime Risotto sometimes it can be prepared to rich this was perfect and didn’t feel heavy at all the Dungeness crab was quite a treat and the fresh corn added texture and brightness to the dish. Can’t wait to dine here again soon

Good food, great service. Was a bit disappointed that the fish of the day was scallops, rather than a whole fish. The Bruschetta was excellent with fresh tomato slices and basil on cibatta. We also had meatballs and fresh baby carrots which were wonderful. The risotto topped with a small amount of crabmeat, was mixed with golden corn, which detracted from the dish. So while tasty, I would not order again as it was more creamed corn, than risotto. The view from the dining room overlooking Pike Market was lovely. The service from the time we arrived to when we left was excellent. I recommend this restaurant, but make sure you understand how the dishes are prepared.
Me and my family went to celebrate my mom's birthday and it was a great experience. Excellent service, delicious food, great music, awesome view. Totally recommended.

First time in Seattle and the perfect place to take my wife for a date night. Had the lasagna and meatballs with pasta. Food, service and entertainment was great. Already recommended highly to friends and family. Will come back again next time in Seattle.

We went to the Pink Door, in September, on our way to Hawaii vacation.  Took a lay-over of 11 hrs, and because of Open Table reviews, we chose it.  They were right!  We LOVED this restaurant! Anna A. was our server and she was wonderful.  Food is amazing and the upper terrace is a great place to eat and see the scenery.  They were very friendly and welcoming, as we told them it was our first time in Seattle, WA.  I told my husband I want to go back just to eat there again.  It is a perfect place that caters to adult and children (please, that does not mean to let them run around).  We went with our son and he loved the place, we had to walk all over to see it.   It is priced reasonably - we planned and saved for this vacation, and had a great time in Seattle.  We went to the restaurant after visiting the Space Needle and running around down town.
Great food and great service.  Wish I could afford to go more often!

Unaware that entertainment was only available later in the evening.  A little disappointed because reservations were difficult to get at all and we settled for mid-afternoon.  Lasagna was excellent but portion was modest with no side vegetable.
We had an enjoyable experience. Pink Door is well known and lived up to our expectations. Delicious drinks and food. Especially loved the appetizers.
Beautiful meal with a lovely view out over the waterfront.
The PD is always a wonderful dining experience, from the staff to the food, to the view!
Great food, both the inside and outside patio are really fun. Definitely a must stop in your plans.
Always wonderful food, professional service. One of our favorite places for a special evening.

Our son and his girlfriend were in town for a surprise visit and we were luck enough to get a reservation the day of. We all very much enjoyed the very delicious and fresh food as well as the service which was perfect, not invasive but prompt and helpful.

Wow, so glad I set up reservations for this restaurant during my stay in Seattle. The food was out of this world and the pasta was super fresh and had just the right amount of sauce. The setting was scenic and we enjoyed dining out on the patio. I would highly recommend this as a stop in Seattle for the freshest Italian food!

Since moving to Seattle in 2017 this has quickly become our favorite restaurant, the food is always excellent and the wine prices are very reasonable. Every staff member that we have dealt with has had a great attitude and you can tell that they actually enjoy working there. We picked up a last minute reservation and were able to share the experience with some friends from the East Coast.

The parpadelle with bolognese was excellent. It tasted like it came out of “Mama’s” kitchen back in ITALY.  The fresh mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes was also great.  I would recommend this place to both visitors and natives alike.
Fun restaurant with an eclectic vibe in the heart of pike place. Priced like a tourist location, but the food was tasty and the service was very good.

The wait staff noticed that we needed a bowl for mussel shells before we even had to ask, it was nice to get such attentive service while not being invasive 
Great atmosphere, excellent band, food was simply amazing

Second dining at the Pink Door. Food and wine superb. Service attentive, not intrusive. Very flavorful Italian based dishes. Wonderful fresh vegetables. Salads with crab very flavorful. Enjoy---can be a little hard to find on the alley. Park within 2 blocks and use Google Maps to walk it in.
Really good service and food

There is no way to not have a good time at this place. THe emotion received when you open the hidden door in Post Alley and find you are indeed at the right place, but that y have stepped into some place special. On this particular night, unexpectedly there was a jazz band playing.so the atmosphere was very festive and lively there. We were lucky enough to get seated outside on the very nice and atmospheric patio with a great view of the sound and the ferries coming and going. Everything we ordered was very very good.

We were in town from upstate New York and multiple people suggested this restaurant to us! Our server was Amelia and she was so fun! She definitely contributed greatly to our amazing experience. The lasagne was amazing and the ahi tuna appetizer was our favorite.

Repeat visit for me. First time for my companion. Will definitely return!!
Appreciated having an opportunity to make a donation to one of my favorite organizations. Thank you!!!
The meals are exceptional. Well crafted with surprising nuances. The staff is, how shall I say, buoyant and insightful. The decor is creative and surprisingly interesting.
Yum yum in my tum tum

My daughters and I had a wonderful lunch at the pink door.  They came from Florida and Texas to help me celebrate my birthday.  We relished the warm day on a fun patio and the wonderful food.  The service was outstanding.  We also enjoyed walking through this vintage restaurant.  Recommend highly.

Me encantó el lugar! Muy lindo por dentro, ambiente entretenido y había música en vivo. Nos tocó una mesa con una vista muy linda. Pedimos dos tragos (Aperol y uno con Vodka y limonada, me gustó más el Aperol), lasaña Pink Door y el plato del día en la sección de pescados que eran ostiones con verduritas (el plato estaba muy rico, pero llegó tibio, por lo que se enfrió rápido). Servicio excelente! Volvería de nuevo

Year after year always special, even on an ordinary day. When a mixed green salad has lettuces so fresh and delicious it stops conversation you know the restaurant cares.  Dungeness crab risotto is now a classic summer expectation and experience.  Without time for another meal here I asked for their amazing lasagna to go, so I could enjoy it back in Los Angeles.  Thank you Pink Door for continuing to shine whether on a sunny summer day or in the deep rains of winter.

Visited this place twice for my birthday celebration . i just Loved this restaurant! Great food and excellent view -all the way around .Awesome food and great service.  High recommend the bruschetta and the lasagna is to die for! . Can't wait to come back. Mmmmm!

I have been to the Pink Door before so I knew what to expect. The food was great as usual. It was really packed for a Tuesday night. We got there about 10 minutes early and they told us they were running true to schedule and they would come get us at 8:45. When 8:45 came along I hadn't seen anyone and was worried they missed us. I walked up to the front and saw the person that I originally talked to. She was walking back and forth and helping others. I was hoping she would see me off to the side, but she didn't say anything to me at all even though she saw me. Luckily another person was there and he said to her "I think this gentleman may have got a text". I did not hear "text" so I had to ask him to repeat himself. Once i heard him I said, I did not and didn't even know i was supposed to. He told me no worries and got some menus and told me to follow him. I let him know the rest of my party was over by the bar and he followed me over. He sat us down gave us our menus. Great service on his part. We came there specifically for one dish. The pappardelle with  bolognese. I order the Dungeness crab risotto and it was fantastic.
A must if visiting Seattle. The service, food, ambience, and overall vibe of this place, are exquisite! Loved everything about this place

A favorite destination for lunch or dinner for many years, once again the Pink Door food preparation, staff and ambience did not disappoint. 

Our special occasion was to treat old friends visiting from Sydney, Australia. We were seated at a favorite table on the Pink Door deck. Our friends were delighted by the setting which lent itself beautifully for a long afternoon pranzo catching up after not seeing each other for ten years. 

Of course a beautiful sunny eighty degree day in Seattle contributed to our enjoying another sensational time at the Pink Door. 
Our most grateful Graziemillie to Jackie and Co................Anna & Lino
Traveled two hours by plane to enjoy great food, SERVICE &  ambiance for a 50th Birthday celebration. Great food but if your looking to feel special on a milestone birthday, look elsewhere.
Excellent. Great food, super service. Wonderful. We had a great time.

When making reservations the host wasn’t clear on the difference in dining room option to see the trapeze perform. We traveled to see that and then had to sit outside. No shows on Monday so we also missed that.

The Pink Door is one of Seattle’s best. Affordable fresh food featuring the best of the Northwest’s bounty of fresh food. Great atmosphere on the deck, in the dining room with fantastic views, or in the living room with live hourly entertainment. Trapeze on Monday nights!
Absolutely outstanding experience! Excited to return
We expected the Pink Door to be wonderful and it was. We sat outside and had great service and the pasta dishes were excellent. We need to go there more often.
Amazing food and great scenery. The price is average for the location in downtown Seattle and is worth the wait. If you are visiting the area you have to visit this restaurant.

Unusually in today’s restaurant experience, our waiter was engaging, helpful, and tremendously knowledgeable about the menu, the wine, and food sources. He gave real opinions. The food at the Pink Door tastes Italian, i.e. like in Italy! Real paste, home style sauces, tomatoes from the garden. The neighborhood is tourist-ville, but The Pink Door is worth the trouble.
Summer lunch on the deck!
Everything is awesome but the cheesecakes. Like the Dungeness crab rosiotto most, pretty yummy.
It was hard to get decent reservations at a good time, but well worth it. Our server Thomas was THE BEST! We loved him and the Pink Door. We had a great time.

Fantastic evening! Our reservation was at 9:30 but we arrived at 7:45, and they worked us in early. Fun atmosphere, delicious bruschetta and caprese salad. They do a cabaret show there too, but you need separate reservations.
It was a great experience.  Brought colleges there, visiting from out of town.  They loved it!
Absolutely spectacular food and ambiance! Can’t wait to come back.
It was wonderful as usual!

I have heard about The Pink Door for years. I was told "when visiting Seattle, don't miss it"My experience with this type of guidance is that its not usually correct. This time it was@!
Food, service and ambiance first rate!
Hidden gem in the pike place area, very fresh seafood

The food was good but the service was crazy (& not in a good way). Food came out  wrong, forgotten items & honestly not amazing. They ended up comping a bunch of stuff, which was nice. The outdoor seating was nice & the decor was cool.
Overall, The Pink Door is amazing!  Great food, great ambiance, excellent service - it hits every mark on your expectation for good dining.  Trust the reviews, you will not be disappointed!

I was underwhelmed by my dining experience. I don't feel like my special cocktail had any alcohol. Paying $12 for a special drink I expect alcohol as advertised. I felt like I got the virgin version. My bolognese  sauce and fresh pasta dish was very bland and disappointing. Service was adequate and the food did come out fast. We were in and out within 45 minutes. My friend liked her entree but the overall experience was a disappointment. We were from out of town and had made reservations a month in advance. I do not feel like I received value for what I spent.

Went for my daughters 23 birthday. Everything was great. Only thing I would change is I would have asked for a window seat (which were available when we were seated next to the bus station). I believed they were being reserved for other parties with reservations, however, I saw at least two window tables filled with walk if patrons.
Fhiood was terrific, service was tremendous, great night out.
Wonderful atmosphere, great local ingredients. Wait staff was outstanding.

Had a great late lunch/early dinner to spend my boyfriend’s birthday. The ambiance is so vintage and romantic. The waitress is very friendly and the food comes fast as well as delicious. Everything is perfect for a date.
Lasagna was perfect
We had a really good time. Excellent wait staff, excellent food, very nice surroundings. We look forward to a return visit.
Anniversary
The food was amazing
The food was delightfully tasty and varied.  Wait staff was attentive and energetic.
I would suggest making dinner reservations, you have a choice between stage/indoor area, bar, outside or dinner w/view indoors.
Had an excellent meal here down in the City.  The waiter was excellent & they got us a table right by the window overlooking the Market.  Our favorite restaurant in Seattle.

Delicious, great ambiance, nice live music, not too loud, server was very nice and friendly, menu is always interesting. They also remembered it was my fiance's birthday and said happy birthday to him, which was a nice touch.
Anniversary

We celebrated mutual anniversaries with friends at the Pink Door and found it to be lively, charming and elegant (depending on where you’re seated.) We were seated in the back dining Room overlooking Elliott Bay which is a little less hectic than the front dining room where you enter. 
I enjoyed the taper candles dripping onto silver holders as well as the chandeliers and overall golden glow that bathed the room. 
We shared the antipasto platter which was more than enough for four to share which was delicious: they have quite a way with vegetables here: caponata, tapenade, zucchini, peppers, etc. were superb. We also shared a roasted cauliflower side dish that was so savory and flavorful it converted a sworn cauliflower hater in our group. We had the lasagna (fresh and light), the halibut special (slightly smoky from the grill) which were delicious. The corn and crab risotto was bland (in my opinion) and the undercooked rigatoni had scorched spicy sausage with it, so there were some hits and misses. The ice cream trio was delightful with the honey flavor being the winner as was the Pavlova dessert.
All in all, it was an extremely enjoyable evening and what one person didn’t like, someone else did, so we didn’t leave unsatisfied. Staff overall were very pleasant and accommodating but could use a little more training in basic culinary terms and ingredients. Still, we would all recommend a stop at the Pink Door.
We went w high expectations and it did jot dissappoint.  Slower service but we were not in a hurry. The loudness was the only downer. We had to yell alot. Server was great.
Food was awesome and the vibe was good. Service was on spot! Can’t go wrong

Great early dinner for our anniversary. Make sure to look for the pink door as there is no sign out front in post alley of pike place. Everything we ordered was great and our waitress was super sweet and personal.
This place very good mood and perfect food in seattle.
Noise level was deafening. Aside from that we had a good time, the service and food were good. We didn't see the show, so we can't comment on that.

The food was excellent, the wait staff were very friendly.  The entertainment was a unique experience and the entertainer was super friendly and very sweet.  We will definitely be going there on our next trip to Seattle!
The server was really friendly and efficient. We always come to the Pink door for our anniversary and it’s always a great time.
Our fav place to dine!

Overall, my friend and I had a pleasant experience at The Pink Door. I've had friends and family who've dined here during their trips to Seattle and have heard great things about their pasta. I had their popular dish, Linguine Alle Vongole, and my friend ordered their Pink Door lasagne. While both dishes were delicious, I would recommend the Linguine Alle Vongole as it is more unique and worth the price. Despite reserving a table a month prior to our trip and requesting to sit indoors by the windows, we ended up having to wait around 15 minutes and were eventually seated outdoors at the Patio. While that was not a major issue (and the staff were quite accommodating), there were only 3 chairs for waiting guests, which left us awkwardly standing there. However despite this, it was a nice meal to wrap up our Seattle trip.
I've gone to the pink door for many years on my birthday but i think this trip will be my last one. The place has just gotten too busy and the food was underwhelming.
Outside seating is a nice quiet port in the storm from the market
Good, enjoyed it but not great! Recommend going but gotta make the Rez about 3 weeks out! Very crowded! Enjoyed drinks apps entries and the partial views. Thx!
Fantastic lunch on the patio! Delicious food and drinks. Great service. Even our 10 month old had a good time! Two thumbs up.
Vacation  - we had a great night

The Pink Door is an experience more in atmosphere than food. It was a unique, hard-to-find place tucked away in an alley near Pike's Market. A friend recommended it, and it was so busy that we could only make reservations for lunch. 
We sat outside at the quaint little table covered in a pretty pink oilcloth table cloth. First we shared a cheese plate, which was good, but nothing more than you could find at the grocery store.
Unfortunately the food went downhill from there. My lunch was cold and tasted like a warmed-up freezer meal. 
My husband liked his food, but I opted to eat the bread instead of my entree.

The Pink Door was the perfect waterfront restaurant destination! From its tucked away location in Seattle’s downtown alleyways to its no name designation on the restaurant front. You feel as though you’re entering a secret destination that only a select few are lucky enough to be in the know of.  The interior was eclectic yet whimsical and the food and spirits were out of this world...beautiful and delicious at the same time. If you’re in the Seattle area the Pink Door is an absolute MUST!! (Ask for a seat on the patio or if the weather is gloomy, a seat by the window) ENJOY!

Attentive & knowledgable server. Started w/ the Tuna Crudo, so good we could have licked the plate. Followed by the Corn & Dungeness Crab Risotto and Linguine Vongole, both A+. (I’m drooling as I write this, recalling the flavors). Our first time in Seattle and we struck gold with The Pink Door.

Got to our lunch about 30 minutes early & we offered to sit at bar til reservation time. We were pleasantly surprised when they seated us right away. 
Wait staff was extremely attentive - our water glasses were never less than half full. 
Unfortunately didn’t get the name of our server, but she was super efficient & very helpful with our questions on the menu. 
Great window table with view of the water & Pike Market.  We stayed a little over 2 hours enjoying the view and food & never felt rushed. 
Would love coming here again on our next trip!

Always enjoy dining on the outdoor deck/patio in summer (even when the skies are a bit smoky due to the wildfires in BC and Washington). Excellent service and the ultimate in ambience -- and a damn fine Caesar Salad, too! Good selection of Italian roses' -- Buon Gusto!

Excellent! We made our reservation 3 weeks before our planned trip to Seattle.  We started with the grilled octopus appetizer which was the best I ever had. My husband and I shared it and it was plenty for the two of us. I had the Pink Door Lasagna, reputed to be what they are known for (by the staff), and it was fabulous! My husband had linguine with  meatballs and sausage that was wonderful-the sauce was excellent, sausage  (was a little spicy) and meatballs were great!  Fun atmosphere, if we are in Seattle again we will definitely have dinner at The Pink Door.
I wish it was easier to get reservations! Great food and atmosphere!
Great, fresh Italian and seafood options. Really enjoyed my time in Seattle for our anniversary.
One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. 5 stars across the board.
Noted to be one of the places to go in the Seattle warterfront.
Consistently the best food and dining experience in Seattle.
We had a fantastic meal at the pink door. Great service the octopus was awesome. Fish was cook to perfection and very well seasoned. We highly recommend it.

Both the decor and menu are eclectic.  We've visited twice and found the food to be imaginative and well-prepared.  There should be something on the diverse menu to suit all tastes, from pasta to seafood to steaks.  The staff was very accommodating to our needs and the service very attentive.  Reservations are not required, but I highly recommend them for this popular spot.
Been coming here for years and couldn’t recommend them enough!  Always great service, the food is delicious.  And outdoor seating is lovely.

I've been coming here for over 20 years and they never disappoint. The lasagna is amazing as well as many other seasonal items. Love the patio dining in the summer, and indoors when it's cooler or raining. This place is a gem.
I always enjoy my experience and great food at the Pink Door!
I remembered this restaurant from 20 years ago. It still retains its absolute charm and wonderful recipes and ingredients. A must do while in Seattle.
Fabulous service! Unbeatable view. The food was outstanding. I would go back once a week for lunch if I lived in the area!
This was a great spot to stop for a dinner date. The food was simple Italian done right.
Always great!  Seasonal goodness.  It's a family favorite, especially in the spring & summer.  Some of the best bread & olive oil I've ever had & the bruschetta will make you cry.
Fantastic lunch-after we stopped walking by restaurant-lol!

I totally understand why the ratings are so good, they’re well deserved. This place is super intimate and cute. The outside dining area has an amazing view and they had a live jazz band inside. Not to mention being from the Bay Area, I thought the food would be expensive because it was so good, but everything was under $40. Just a great place overall!
Loved this three in one restaurant in the perfect settle location.

Came here with a party of 11 for a work lunch celebration.  It's tough to find lunch reservations for a large party.  We had originally requested to be on the patio, but the host called up prior to arrival to let us know that it was really hot and not much shade on the patio and asked if we would like to be seated inside-- which we REALLY appreciated!  
The food and drinks where great and the service was exceptional.  We will celebrate at the Pink Door again in the future, for sure!
Reliably excellent service, seating, ambience and cuisine.  A seasonal favorite for us in summer and for special occasions.
Everything was perfect- especially our server. Fantastic balance of high end and rustic. Delicious.
Absolutely the best lasagna I’ve ever had. My boyfriend loved his bday dinner! Beautiful spot and great overall service!!
Music too loud
Fantastic. We all had a great time. The atmosphere is wonderful, we had a great server, and the food was delicious!

I made this reservation to celebrate my wedding anniversary about a month ago. We were seated outside instead of inside with the show the restaurant offers. I did not know I needed to specifically ask for a table inside, considering I noted it in the reservation that it was for anniversary. Food and service really good, just the ambiance was a bit so-so, our view to a small part of the water was far from impressive.
We had to wait until end of trip to get this reservation.  We are so glad that we did!  The food was wonderful.  The outside porch was lovely.  Loved it!

The atmosphere of this place was great, though brought down a bit by the caliber of some of its guests. Doesn’t need to be too posh to turn away people coming in in shorts, sweatpants, and baseball caps. Food was great, had the rabbit in red wine which came with fries which was kind of weird but good still. The staff were friendly and attentive. Overall great experience, and I’m looking forward to dining there again.

Consistently great Italian food! From the appetizer through the dessert course, the food is top notch.  Service is excellent.  Beautiful views from the outdoor deck or from inside if you get lucky.  Even if you don't, the food is so good you won't care.
We have eaten at the Pink Door many times and the food has always been excellent, but this time I had the Rabbit and it was extremely dry, but the flavor was good.

My husband and I returned to this restaurant during a recent visit. We first visited on a family vacation 5 years prior. The food and service are as top notch as I remembered. Ingredients used to prepare the food are fresh and interesting. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Amazing food. Wonderful use of local ingredients to create delicious dishes. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and gave us great service.  Such a fun  atmosphere!
Great place, great food, i would love to go there again
Great service, great apps, great salad, and the main course was perfect. What a perfect night!

Have eaten here 3 times in 13 years-we’re from California. Always flavorful, good service and romantic ambiance .  Love the fact that it is truely is hidden gem- although I think the word is leaking out as evidenced by the long crowd that was waiting to get in. We had reservations and walked right in:)

We went to The Pink Door with our grandma during a weekend trip to Seattle. Beautiful restaurant and view, as well as wonderful food and service. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a special dinner in the city!
Food was ok, maybe I expected more. View from the deck was pretty.

Perfect day on the deck to celebrate our college grad.  Our server was wonderful, personable and on top of it.  My risotto made me weep with happiness - so fresh and delicious.  And just when you thought it couldn't be any better the Blue Angels flew by.  We will be back.
Iconic seattle restaurant, still great! Hadn’t been here in 30 years and was just as good!

We absolutely loved this restaurant. It was quirky and atmospheric. We sat in the back part of the restaurant overlooking the Seattle wheel. All the food we ordered was delicious and it was definitely the best meal we had during our stay in Seattle.
Truly lovely!
Great food, great service, reasonable prices, fun place

We absolutely LOVED the Pink Door!  It was our anniversary and we were greeted by a lovely hostess who showed us a few different available tables and let us choose.  We then received complimentary glasses of champagne for our anniversary.  Even though there was a line of people waiting to get in (we made reservations, highly recommended!), we were not rushed at all.  Service was awesome, the food was delicious, dessert was decadent, the drinks were spectacular and the ambiance was perfect.  We will definitely be back!

Nice restaurant, great food and service!
We had a great lunch during our anniversary!!

The Pink Door is always great. Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is my number one restaurant in Seattle. Perfect for special occasions or to show off this great city of Seattle to visitors.
The Pink Door is our Go To place in Seattle. We never tire of it.

We went to celebrate my husband birthday, we made the reservation one and a half month earlier, but we couldn’t get it with a show, so I suggest to plan very well and in advance if you want to see the show, because the spots at very few. Either way got it for a Wednesday 8:30 pm and in a good place to appreciate the view. We loved the view and the food was really tasteful we would come back for sure!
