Pink door decor, front desk staff, view everything was amazing but the waiter.  as long as he is not your waiter you will be fine.
I love the Pink Door.   Some of the best Italian food
Make a reservation or you’ll be waiting in a lengthy lineup. Food is outstanding along with the service and atmosphere. Will definitely be returning
Super cute restaurant. Our waiter was amazing and friendly. Food was excellent. Def highly recommend this little gem.

I hadn’t been here in years, before the renovation and expansion. Wow, what a surprise is hiding behind the speakeasy pink door.  Spectacular food and service. Who knew I could want a weekday dinner at 3pm?
Food is spectacular. The lemoncello was superb.
We truly enjoyed our meal at the Pink Door.  We had great service and never felt rushed.
Wonderful ambiance and perfect way to have a lovely date night in Seattle.

The entire restaurant is an incredible experience from start to finish. From the vibrant art and decor, to the hilarious drink names like, Hey! Hey! Ho! Ho! Trump’s Got to Go!, it’s a delightful place to be. The service is amazing, and the food is DEVINE! If you are in Seattle, do not miss this place! 🥰
Came highly recommended and did not disappoint!
Delicious food and great service!

Fois gras to die for. Presentation was fabulous almost hesitated to start eating because it was so beautiful.  Onion soup wonderful. Balance of our entrees appetizers excellent. Best meal by far we had on our visit to Seattle
Cipino is a staple for the very best reasons.  Food was awesome, service was even better.
Always the best!   Fresh veggies...can’t beat the caprese salad.
Another spectacular night at the Pink Door - thank you!
Our waiter was very kind. He let me wait for my party as he came little late before we order. We had Vongole pasta, Lasagna and Ceasar salad and all of them were extra ordinary.

This is a restaurant you’d never find if you didn’t know it was there.  It’s very close to the Pike Street Market but down an ‘alley’ that has other restaurants and shops.  Even though it’s called the Pink Door, the door is really more of a peach color, so you’re not sure if you’ve arrived (there is no sign).  Once inside it’s this gigantic restaurant with different rooms and an eclectic design.  We were lucky enough to be seated all the way in the back, which happens to look out on the water and a little park next to the Market.  The food was delicious, the service was very good, and the view was wonderful.  I would highly recommend you find your way to this place if you are in Seattle and maybe request that you’re seated near the window so you can have the same view.
The finest Italian food in a great location beside an Irish pub and a Mexican cantina. Also steps away from a Russian bakery.  Bellissima!
Always one of the best spots - especially in the summer!
Wedding anniversary. Just in town for the weekend. Recommended by someone who lives in Seattle. Fabulous food. Great service. Definitely recommend to friends and family.

Excellent experience 
Lovely to see the trapeze show
Sensibly priced
Perone was s nice surprise
Jacob was an amazing at service and conversation!! Great vibe and theme And the food was so fresh and delicious 😋
This place very much exceeded my expectations. The outdoor patio is marvelous and the food is delicious. One of the few places worth the hype.

Food was decent but the service was terrible.  We were rarely checked on by our waiter and waited 30-40 min after our dessert to for our check.  Salmon was good.  The summer risotto was soupy and had very little crab.  Def won’t be coming back.  There are a lot better places out there.
The cheese plate appetizer was wonderfully paired with accompaniments.   The Ahi Tina appetizer had a wonderful flavor as well.  Overall a great dining experience

Cool interior decor. Responsive service. A very enjoyable dinner out in a unique environment. The food is very good...not amazing...but very good considering the large size of the restaurant and the number of meals served.

Adored food! 
This is now my favorite dining experience in Seattle. Four of us ordered dishes each authentic and delicious. Ambience was friendly and warm. A rare gem hidden from the mayhem of the surrounding market.
Ambiance and setting is quaint and lovely with a view if Puget Sound.  Service was excellent and food was soooo good!!

This was our first time in Seattle and we got this restaurant recommended by someone we shared a Lyft with. So glad we went!! This restaurant was amazing! The food was superb, the service was superb, we loved the atmosphere and location! We only wish that we had been there for the show. If we go back to Seattle, this will be our first stop!

Our favorite Seattle restaurant.  It is fine for a special occasions but we usually go just because we want to be there.  The ambiance, indoors and outdoors, is perfect and the servers do a great job.  We love the "All Things Green"  salad in the spring and the fish and lasagna all year long.  Desserts are delicious.

the lasagna is tooo die for, but make sure you make reservations a month in advance on opentable, otherwise you will be standing in a long line as we saw the line was at least a 1/2 hour long as we walked by and said we had reservations and they let us right in.
The food was fantastic!  Loved the ambience of the restaurant.
It was enjoyable. Waiter was ver my fair in taking off salad charges as they arrived after entre
The Pink Door was the best meal I’ve had in Seattle!  Amazing food!
What a great place ! We took our two boys 7& 14 and all of us are foodies and we thoroughly enjoyed our meals . The service and ambiance are also quite neat !

Beautiful place, decor was inviting, and food was delicious. 
Unexpectedly inexpensive
I enjoyed the food and the service at the restaurant but I didn't like the voice mail I got when I called. The voice mail is rude and not professional. I was very disappointed with it.
A hidden gem! Wonderful food in a pleasant outdoor setting. Inside looks fabulous, yet we chose to be outdoors.

Visited Seattle for first time, our daughter had googled; we were not disappointed.
Will recommend to others.

Staff was great and informative. They never left my wife and I without water. In regards to the specials our waiter was versed in the preparation and presentation of the dishes. The decor was “ok” outside as In laminate table cloths. Inside was proper and decorated with great fixtures.

Food: I ordered the pappardelle and the wife ordered the risotto. Great flavors and excellent presentation. The first bite made me reminisce of my time in Italy. Fresh, flavorful, and great depth of flavors.

Drink: I ordered he house wine. It tasted like house wine. The carfe was dirty but that mattered not as I’m sure they dishwashers it and no one checked the cleanliness of it. Why complain when everything else was great. 

View: the shades were pulled down so we couldn’t see anything. However, it Protected is from the sun so worth it.

i thought the food (at least the lunch menu) had adequate variety/choice.    the quantity was perfect, ample.   it was sometimes difficult to tell who worked there.  though i liked the eclectic ambiance & wait staff, it was sometimes difficult to know who the servers were--nothing to necessarily 'set them apart' from the patron traffic.    
i would go back again to try more variety on the menu.
i shared a dish with another person in my group & the portions were placed on two separate plates which i thought was extremely thoughtful.   classy but casual environment. thank you!
This place is amazing! Beautiful view and atmosphere. The food is so delicious!  Would come to this place every visit to Seattle!
Vegan-friendly pasta option & great drinks.
Our server was not very good. A bit condescending.

Excellent opportunity to celebrate a landmark birthday with a late lunch, excellent view and an creative menu.
The one vegetarian in our party did have excellent, though not abundant choices.
The mix of diverse flavors, colors and textures on the cheese board was a revelation.
The trofie pasta dish looked excellent and was deemed to be great.
The dungeness crab summer risotto was both light in texture and still satisfying.
I'm still trying ti figure if it was finished with corn milk rather than cream.
Our server was outstanding. She gave us time to catch up without pressuring us to order. Love the outdoor patio!

I can’t say enough good things about this restaurant! My boyfriend and I were visiting from out of town for our anniversary and looking for a nice romantic spot for dinner. We were so busy doing excursions during the day that we weren’t ready to get dinner until after 9pm. I thought for sure it would be hard to find a nice place open late on a Monday night but The Pink Door didn’t disappoint. They were open until 11:30pm so it worked out perfectly. It was a little difficult to find as the entrance is in Post Alley. The door is pink (of course) so that was a dead giveaway. The dimly lit, intimate ambiance is that of Italian old world romance...perfect for a dinner date, or in our case, anniversary. We requested to sit inside and were seated in the back of the restaurant, which had a beautiful scenic views close to the waterfront. We started by ordering a few cocktails, which took a little while to be delivered. Our server was extremely apologetic and offered to take them off our bill without us even saying anything. This was jut the beginning of our impeccable service, David L. was a fantastic and extremely attentive server. One of the best I have had. We ordered the La Fettunta, Insalata Caprese, Piatto di Prosciutto as starters to share. I had the Lasagna Pink Door and my boyfriend had the Pappardelle al Ragu Bolognese. They were both fantastic, and his dish was with freshly made pasta! Finally, for dessert we shared the Perugina flourless chocolate cake with Campari Pomegranite sauce. It was amazing! My boyfriend doesn’t really eat chocolate and even he was blown away. Everything from start to finish completely exceeeded all expectations. I can see why they have a 4.7 on Google. It is a little pricey to eat there often but it was certainly worth every penny. We will definitely dine here again if we visit Seattle, such a special experience. My only complaint was that we missed the trapeze show in the lounge...a must see for our next time!
Lovely restaurant with great food! We were lucky enough to get an outdoor table so we were also treated to an amazing view. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

The food here is delicious!!!  From the grilled octopus that was cooked perfectly to the entree of parpadelle that was melt in your mouth amazing and the dessert!  First time in my life I enjoyed meringue.  Or maybe the first time in my life I had meringue prepared properly.  You will not regret coming here.

In seattle for a weekend getaway and Pink Door came highly recommended...they did not disappoint..we were a table for three & had a family member join us last minute & they accommodated without any difficulties..food was wonderful, caprese salad, antipasto board & grilled octopus..were our starters, grilled halibut, grilled branzino white fish & the tagliatelle with braised beef was all amazing..Wait staff was great & very attentive. Over all one  of our best meals in Seattle!!! This restaurant books up & usually will sellout without walkup diners..give yourself at least a couple of weeks out for flexible times.
Good food, but smaller menu than I expected.
I’ve been dining at the Pink Door since the mid 80’s and it never disappoints! I now live in Austin and a visit to Seattle always has a meal at the Pink Door on the itinerary!

Menu selections are varied and lovely options. Pappardelle bolognese was a perfect lunch portion and delicious. We also had caprese salad which included perfectly ripe heirloom tomatoes and the risotto of the day with dungenness crab—delicious! Bread is included with the meal and the right amount for the three of us. Wine choices were good.
It's a nice restaurant at the Pike Place. Not easy to spot but the pink little door.
The Pink Door never disappoints. Can’t wait to go back.
The food was incredible, our best dinner when in Seattle for the week. Great menu, ingredients, wine options. A true gem! Big thank you to our waiter Thomas!
Great spot!
Great vibe, interesting menu and knowledgeable servers
We came because it was our anniversary, first time in Seattle and rated #1. The restaurant was basically fair on all accounts and we would not go again. Much ado about nothing.
Fabulous !
Delicious food, great service, cool atmosphere. I wish I lived closer so I could dine here more often.
Great time,  beautiful seating cant wait to go back.

They're intolerable hipsters, but the food is SO good, and the place is SO cool, that you won't even mind that much. (They're actually quite nice.)

Don't skip out on the Pink Door just because the line's around the block. It's worth it.

The ceasar with dungeness was great.  Also had a half portion of antipasto which was just right and lots of variety: fresh mozzarella pickled beans salami cheese and olives.  Rigatoni with grilled sausage was good although rigatoni a little under done.  Service was excellent
Always a marvelous experience. Views from the outdoor deck are breathtaking, the food is excellent and the service is top notch. Regardless of the occasion I'd recommend this place to anybody.
Pink Door never disappoints! It is always special, delicious, eclectic and fun!
Always order the lasagne on the side.  It is reliably Awesome

Our server was personable and charming. He did a little rule bending (I won’t elaborate) for us. My tuna (on the small menu, can’t recall its name) was suspended in the most delightful flavors: capers, some citrus and salt. It was tasty and attractive on the plate.

We have an annual birthday tradition at the Pink Door and this year did not disappoint. Delicious food, lovely service, great cocktails, wonderful atmosphere. Love the Pink Door! My only complaint is I miss the summer pasta - fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, basil.
Love the deck.  Must admit , its a little pricey!  Service is always great.

I love this hidden gem off the beaten path of the madness of Pike Place Market.  Inconspicuous building of cinder block with pink door belies the wonders beyond that facade.  Crystal chandeliers, mirrors galore, fabulous service and locally sourced Italian influenced cuisine with a most eclectic, knowledgeable and accommodating staff.  LOVE THIS PLACE!  But don't tell anyone about it...keep it a secret for those of us who appreciate the view, the food, the ambiance.
Awesome dining experience with great live music and cool sultry environment
Pink Door never disappoints :)
The best restaurant only gets better. Amazing food and service.
We were in Seattle for our 21st Wedding Anniversary! We were able to secure a reservation for the Pink Door at the last minute. We really enjoyed our experience.
Excellent food and service.   Loved the waterfront view.

Fantastic entrees including lasagna, rigatoni and grilled italian sausage. Great outdoor atmosphere and very attentive staff. No signage outside the pink door so you feel like you found a secret gem when you eat there. A bit pricey but par for the course in the heart of Seattle. Totally worth it.
super fun environment -- food was great and service was great -- hard to find "pink door" but worth looking for!
they expanded since the last time I was there...beautiful.  Food was excellent (a bit pricy), great view and server Amelia was beyond excellent.

Made reservations for this place two weeks in advance, however, we waited for 20-25 minutes and never ONCE had someone wait on our table so we left. Beautiful restauarant and I’m sure the food is great, however, the service was absolutely horrendous. Very disappointed by our experience.
Wonderful, as always. We were lucky enough to get a table outside, which only added to the experience. Great summer food and drink menu.
Such a cute interior in a great location. We had a fabulous luncheon and it was a wonderful spot to catch up with old friends.
This was one of the best restaurant experiences I’ve ever had between the food and the service! I would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area!
Overall great experience...from the food, to the service. Original menu, great atmosphere, and our server Kate was exceptional. Highly recommend!

Opening the unmarked Pink Door is a bit like stepping into a secret club.  We were seated at a window overlooking Pike's Market and the harbor. Our server was personable and friendly. I ordered the lasagna, which is vegetarian and delicious. My husband ordered the halibut special, also delicious. From start to finish, a great experience.

Great place.  The food was excellent and the service was top notch.  We had a party of 8, including children and one guest with a food allergy.  The staff was very attentive and careful to check on all our questions regarding the food allergy with the kitchen staff to be sure that we had no problems.
Highly recommended!!

Over the years I have always had great experiences at Pink Door and this visit was no different. The staff was exceptional as was the food. Love the outdoor dining. I brought a friend who was visiting from out of town and she was suitably impressed.
Great value.  Food is really good.  Entertainment is unique.

A wonderful experience celebrating my husband birthday. We had the prociutto, risotto balls and the caprese to start with. All of which were amazing. 

My husband hand the summer risotto which was delicious and I had the special which was tasty as well. We enjoyed it all with a carafe of the house red which I highly recommend.
Great dinner to wrap up our vacation! We had the bruschetta, rigatoni, crab risotto, and tiramisu and all were very good!
Food was amazing! I am from AZ and this place was recommended by multiple locals and also some visitors we ran into. Kinda pricey but food was soooo good! We had the meatballs and lasagna.
A favorite!

As out of towners, we were very excited to try this place. We were able to get reservations for lunch same day. Once there, decided to order a drink to celebrate the start of our vacation.  We were appalled by the first drink listed, which took a jab at our current President in its title. What was worse was below it the disclosure stating for every one of those drinks sold, $1 would be donated to Planned Parenthood. NOT COOL to mix politics with a paying hungry customer with so many other great dining options in town.  Will not be going back.
I took my wife for her b day. Food was delicious. We had the tuna crudo, bruschetta, lasagna and cioppino. It all was plated very nice and tasted amazing. Go To The Pink Door

Various options for seating. I recommend near the bar and stage for a more vibrant scene. Back room for alone time and conversation and outside when it's that take your breath away kind of day. Food is hit or miss,but still enjoyable and for the most part the staff is quite nice and attentive
Fantastic all around.
Our server was really great.(I wish I remembered his name) We had a wonderful time.
My lasagna was great. But I think the restaurant is a little over hyped. It was a great experience but not what I expected.

The place is good and needs made reservation one day before. No sign just find the place with Pink? door. Suggest booking seat in side because there is bend on evening time. I ordered Rabbit which is no taste.

For a high volume / high demand location, the food is top notch. And service is attentive and well schooled. Notwithstanding the elbow to elbow feel, this is a good place to eat if you are near the market.

I count on Pink Door for a consistent experience when meeting for business during the week. It was a beautiful day and we were able to sit outside and enjoy the lovely weather and view. Our server was attentive and friendly and the food was very good as always. I will keep coming back as long as they are willing to have me.

It was a wonderful experience, first time going to a restaurant which doesn’t have any sign of their name , only a pink door which signifies its presence 
Heard from one of the girls who work there about the background story It seems that this restaurant has been here from 1980s and the owner spent all her money on this place and had a neon sign for the name of the restaurant, but the city said you cannot have one , so on principle she decided not to have any signs only the door which is pink. 
Our waiter was Andrew and he took care of us very nicely 
Couple of pointers , there is no special veg menu , it’s two pastas in the general menu and if you want a vegan pasta there is one but not on menu 
We had a special occasion and they gave us a nice small champagne 
We had the lasagna, the owners mothers secret recipe and a pasta which was delicious 
Perfect portion sizes , wonderful bread with herb spiced olive oil

We went for lunch (no dinner reservations were available when we wanted to go).  Food was amazing, view was spectacular.  Service was great too!!  Bruschetta was perfect,my meatball sub was great (hollowed out loaf of bread filled with meatballs and sauce), my children enjoyed pasta w butter and mussels.  My husband got an eggplant, pesto and mozzarella sandwich that he’s already requested I try to make.  So glad we went!
Thoroughly enjoyed the food and the ambiance. I would definitely return.  The rissoto was great.
Our 11th Anniversary.  The Pink Door is always special.
A little confused about the squid ink pasta..But it did taste good.
great food and awesome cocktails!  I wish we would have come for the dinner show, but was definitely worth coming for lunch😊
Great food and service
Great food and a fun atmosphere. Our server Lindsay was great too!
This place is a 10
Thomas (our server) was awesome! The food was amazing and we loved it.

The restaurant itself was great (nothing to complain about there) and food was great, however only comment I have is the sub-par table reservation system. OpenTable, if there is a way where someone reserving a table at Pink Door could see the full availability of party size AND time availability by date, that would make searching for a table less of a mystery. I originally tried to find a table for 5 during dinner time (6pm), but I didn't know if I messed with the dinner time and party size, I can potentially get something closer to the day I want. It forces the user to basically play a game of investigation to find a reservation versus being offered Pink Doors full availability at a glance.
Amazing, the Ragu was the best I have ever had and you def don’t want to miss the summer tomatoes on the bruschetta!!
The view was beautiful...the service was horrible!! In my opinion not worth the price...too many other great restaurants in the area.

We had a family dinner here with 2 young children (7 and 11) and got seated in the back room with a fantastic view of the water.  There was a band playing that night and we could hear the music from that room, although faintly, which was still nice.  Ambience was great and the service was impeccable.  Our server’s name was Alexandra and she took great care of us.  Our favorite dishes were the Vongole, Mama’s meatballs, and the bolognese.  The creamy Italian sodas were delicious too.  We will definitely be back the next time we visit from LA!
As always, one of my favorite restaurants in seattle! Great food, great service, great ambience, I really recommend!
Amazing Place !!!! I Love It ... the food suuuper !
Attentive wait staff, properly spaced out courses. Great food. Was expecting tourist trap, but everything from venue and view to food and service was exquisite.
This place was AMAZING! The food was excellent and our server Amanda was absolutely wonderful! We will definitely be back when we visit Seattle in the future!

We were celebrating our anniversary, and it was a perfect afternoon: glorious sunny day overlooking Elliott Bay, wait staff spot on, food delightful!  Enjoyed walking through the Market on the way to the restaurant - lively, interesting people & shops.  I have recommended Pink Door to friends who said  they enjoyed "the BEST pasta Ever"!
The food was excellent, atmosphere was charming, service very attentive.

I did not like this place at all. The food was not good. We found a hair in our food. Our server suggested random items and vouched for it and they were just awful. Even though we did not like it we still had to pay. It was a waste of money and time. The reviews that are posted about this place are way too good for a place like this that offers bland food.

This reservation on July 3 was for my husband’s birthday. My order was incorrect. They made me another dish. Although my husband’s meal was no longer hot after waiting for my dish to be redone! Also, there was cork pieces in his wine.
Great service and food for birthday dinner.  The scampi and desserts were fantastic.

Not easy to find as there is only a very small.sign by the large pink door.  Upper post alley.  Worth the search. Outside patio is great.   Service was average...expected a little bit more conversation as we had some questions.  Waiter said they didn't do GF paninis.  I questioned that, he checked, they do. I shouldn't have to know the menu better than the waitstaff. Slow to refill drinks.  Heavy Italian influence on the food, but very well done. Desserts are awesome. Save room.
This restaurant was absolutely Fabulous. Such a beautiful place, amazing atmosphere, delicious food and the staff were lovely.
We finally had our “Pink Door” experience! The food, ambiance, staff, decor, outside view (need I go on) was excellent. We will be returning for another fabulous night!

Excellent as always. We started with bruschetta made with thick slices of heirloom tomatoes and garlic on toasted rounds. The shrimp scampi is very good value- a tray of large sauteed prawns in s butter, citrus and basil sauce. Add a side veggie dish such ss potatoes and greens or grilled asparagus sprinkled generously with soft cheese. Use bread to soak up the delectable juices. Finish off with strawberry pavlova snd try not to moan in delight. Our cocktail: from out lips to your lips- prosecco, rose water and liquor- absolutely amazing!! Our server was so thoughtful and attentive, never far away when needed. It was my frirnd's birthday and dessert came with a lit candle. Memorable! Kudos to the highly skilled and talented chef and his team. Third time back in three months and worth the flight!

We celebrated our 11th anniversary and The Pink Door made it so special. We got a great table near the window looking out over the Market. They treated us to a champagne toast for our anniversary. They service was impeccable and the food was so good. We love this place so much!
This beautiful place never disappoints. Always quirky and interesting and always delicious. A true Seattle gem.
Amazing place to eat! If we come back to Seattle we will for sure be visiting again!!
We had party of 8. Wonderful food and service, great cocktails. Fun atmosphere. Really enjoyed it.

Great veranda setting.  Fresh flowers all around.  Solid wine list.  Niche cocktails.  The paparadelle bolognese was so good we ordered 2.   Fresh bread.  Hard crust.  Prosciutto sliced perfectly with a surprise buffalo mozzarella.  Old country good.
Great place
Second time here. Decided to celebrate our anniversary here. Great as always.
Excellent food and service!
Very pleasantly pleased with everything.

How did I NOT know about this restaurant? My daughter chose The Pink Door to celebrate her 21st birthday and we were not disappointed. Our waiter, David, was EXCELLENT (knowledgeable, welcoming, and attentive), the food was delicious and the view was textbook Seattle. The moment I sat down, I asked my husband "Why have we not been here before?" His answer didn't matter, because I know we'll visit again.

We had the best time here! I think it was our favorite restaurant in Seattle. The eclectic decor was very cool, we had never seen anything quite like it—really impressive. But the food, WOW, it was exquisite. We had the lasagne and the branzino fish. Both were outstanding. I would highly recommend this place for the food plus the ambiance and the great service.
Excellent food in an eclectic setting.  The pasta is some of the best I’ve had.

This was a fun place to eat enhanced by the talented and VERY fit aerial artist performing overhead in the dining room while we ate.  The anti-pasta appetizer was delicious and plenty to share with 2 - 3 people.  The halibut special was tasty but the portion not overly generous.  While our waitress was nice enough she wasn't very experienced or well-trained.  There are a number of things she didn't know so she said she'd have to go ask but never came back with the answer.  The more concerning point was when we ordered a specific bottle of wine that we're familiar with.  She brought out the bottle and fortunately we saw that the label wasn't what we requested.  She insisted it was the same thing, which it wasn't (we just drank the same wine the night before).  As it turns out, the bottle she first brought was about $100 a bottle, more than half of the one we ordered.  Since she was unfamiliar with other things related to our dinner order this may have been an innocent oversight; we'll give her the benefit of the doubt.
This restaurant was pricey (especially for the wine even when you get the one you expect) but overall the food was good. I'd  recommend this restaurant but make sure to get reservations well in advance.
Love The Pink Door. Service was slower than usual. Always return. Love sitting at the bar.

Quintessential summer in Seattle on the Pink Door deck! Yet truly lovely year round - especially with the new dining room windows overlooking the Market and Elliott Bay. The food is wonderful and the service exceptional.
This was my husband and my favorite dinner spot during our 4 day visit to Seattle.  Great fish, pasta and cocktails. Will definitely be going back on our next visit to Seattle.
Our server was so sweet, knowledgeable and had awesome green hair!  We had the best time bc we felt so comfortable in a Fancy place.  Food was amazing I recommend the pappardelle yum yum yum.
Great cocktails, delicious diver scallops with cauliflower puree. Would. Definitely recommend.

Absolutely adored the Pink Door! The ambiance is amazing, lovely view, great food and fantastic service. Our waiter suggested an amazing Italian varietal I had never tried and it was AMAZING wine. (Dry Grillo) The clam linguine was divine and the Caesar was delicious. 

We stayed and watched the Cabaret which was excellent and had quite a few cocktails...

Don’t miss the exquisite Italian food! (Ask for a window seat when you make your reservation)
First time in Seattle and this place was recommended by locals. It was amazing. I’m still dreaming of the cuisine.
Everything was perfect from the moment we walked in the pink door. Wow,
Excellent food.  Great pasta. Bolenase sauce was superb

Visiting from out of town. Delicious meal with a great mix of flavors. Placed an additional order of the tuna crundo appetizer since it was so good. Both pasta dishes (papardelle and linguine) were top notch. Highly recommend!
Beautiful evening in Seattle. Sat outside on the patio and greatly enjoyed the food, service, and ambiance. Always a treat!
Elyse was the most fantastic server
What a great spot. Excellent food, service, drinks and atmosphere. Beautiful inside. A fun experience.
Great place with good food, fun staff. Would have liked to visit on a weekend to see the different entertainment

My first time at this place. I was visiting from out of the state and made reservations 3 weeks in advance. I was so excited based on the amazing reviews. Ambiance was amazing. BUT make sure you specify if you want to sit outside or inside when you reserve. They placed me in the back corner outside. My server was not friendly she wasn’t very helpful and she just rushed with me. My dinner was terrible. Way over priced. The peas were hard! Not even cooked. I told the server and she questioned/doubted me. Such a waste. Most of the people I interacted with at every business including this place in Seattle are very odd and not friendly.
The Pink Door patio at 3:00 was perfect for a late lunch and quiet birthday celebration.
Fabulous food and service. Sat at outside table with a dear friend who lives in Seattle. The Pink Door was her choice and we had a wonderful time. Definitely recommend!
Always outstanding!  A favourite restaurant for me and many people I know
Leisurely dining, pleasant waitstaff, terrific menu options with many fresh local ingredients.  A delicious meal had by all.
Great!  Thank you for offering a vegan option!

We ate outside on the  patio with a great view of Elliott Bay. Love the gluten free options and their marinara sauce has a bright, fresh flavor. Arancini, meatball sandwich and pasta bolognese were all delicious.

On vacation in Seattle and thought we try this restaurant.  Good choice, but you need a reservation,, we were fortunate because my wife is smarter than me. Everything was above average, and worth the trip....
There is nothing like the Pink Door's patio on a nice day in Seattle.  I always enjoy the Lasagna Pink Door.  Also, you should try the Tiramisu and split it.

This is one of our favorite local places.  We chose it to celebrate our oldest son's graduation from high school.  I booked the reservation 30 days in advance and felt like we had the worst table in the place.  It was out on the patio (90 degree day), right in the sun and we all were sweating through our meal.  When we asked about relocating inside, we were told the A/C had broken that morning and inside was no better.  The service and food were great but the experience was truly hindered by the heat.  I would have rather waited to get a shady table than to be placed in the sun.  Disappointed.

We're at Pink Door a few times each year, with our favorite being late summer - when the heirloom tomatoes are available and the Caprese salad is on the menu (worth lining up for). June is too early for that, but no worries. Spring greens risotto and the classic meatball sub did just fine.  If you've never had meatballs at Pink Door, stop depriving yourselves: you can get them with pasta or on the side, but the sub is how meatball subs should be made: ciabatta roll hollowed out with some marinara to dip in case what was on the sub was insufficient.  Add a half carafe of house red (always good), and take the rest of the day off...

My daughter had been to the Pink Door while in Seattle during a convention a year or two ago and raved about it. Her raves were more than justified. We were there celebrating Father's Day. The food was outstanding. Very fresh tasting and well prepared. The Calamari was outstanding and the lasagna melted in your mouth and was full of flavor. 
I would highly recommend this restaurant.

P.S. An outside sign of some type would be helpful. Difficult to find if you're a first timer.
Amazing ambiance and super friendly staff! Our waitress was really sweet and hilarious! Loved the entire experience!
24Th Anniversary
It was a lovely atmosphere and exceptional food!! One of the best meals I’ve had.
Great atmosphere! Food was awesome! Loved that part of my food was from the Pike Market!

We made reservations well in advance of our trip to Seattle- wish that we were able to get a reservation for the Saturday dinner show!  This was a great spot and glad that we had a reservation.  We ended up sitting in a back room with a water view so we did not hear/ see the evening's entertainment.  In our party of 3 we shared oysters and the calamari (interesting preparation and we really enjoyed it), linguine and clams, Caesar salad and the shrimp (also an interesting preparation and delicious).  The Pink Door should definitely be on your must try list.
Staff was great. Not rushed. Food was amazing
On vacation to Seattle and had lunch here. The service was impeccable and the porch had a nice ambiance. The food was absolutely delicious and the wine list extensive. Very enjoyable experience.

We went there as it was recommended by a local who is in the food industry.  We had a pleasant lunch on their deck with a nice view.  As  I understand, they have a show, perhaps a woman on a trapeze, some evenings.  We didn't see it. The inside dining room was dark and smelled a little like a beer pub. The show might be fun, but eating outside at lunch time was nice.

I love this restaurant.  The staff is amazing and the food is to die for.  Perfect spot near Pike's Place, beautiful outdoor seating. The bar is fun. On weekend evenings they have music. On Sunday's they have an acrobatic show. Make reservations as they are ALWAYS sold out!
Great ambience, quality service, and delicious food!
Good food, good service, nice view. Server gave complimentary champagne for special occasion. Happy with our visit.
Fantastic!  Loved it!  We hope to go back. Great food and a wonderful ambiance.

We loved this place!!  Good food, great atmosphere.  Location is great.  We had the linguine with clams, and the Cioppino.  Both were excellent.  We will definitely visit again when in Seattle.  Make sure you make a reservation because this place is very busy.
Food was delicious and enjoyed the music. Alittle hard to find at night
The service was amazing and the food was just as good. I highly recommend it. But you must make a reservation a few days in advance
We loved the Pink Door. The views were fantastic, the staff was wonderful, and the food was delicious. Definitely a hidden gem in Seattle!!

It was truly one of the best meals I have had
We all enjoyed our meal
Love the new back room with views of Puget Sound!
Super food and service with good music and great views. A real hidden gem

The Pink Door experience is fabulous.  The staff is courteous and friendly and the food is excellent.  We started the evening with a reading by Eugenia which was both entertaining and informative.  From the minute you walk in you are transported to a wonderful world of good food and good fun.  The aerialist was the icing on the cake.  She will leave you breathless. If you are looking for a wonderful night go through the Pink Door.
The service was amazing and the food was out of this world. 10/10 would recommend.
Requested a table with a view and got just that, a table with a beautiful view of the waterfront and great wheel. There was also live music in the main room.

A lovely meal for our silver wedding anniversary celebration. We were given a glass of fizz when we arrived which was a lovely surprise. Staff were very friendly and we then moved to the bar to watch the live music - overall a fab evening.
The food tasted just ok.
Food was sooo good. This restaurant was my nimber one restaurant in the Seattle. I love so much

We were visiting from out of town and had never been to the Seattle area before. Friends and family recommended the Pink Door. Unfortunately there were no spots available for dinner reservations so we made one for lunch and it was amazing. Great service, atomsphere and good.
Outstanding food and excellent service with a view of Puget Sound.
Enjoyed the entertainment, food, and service at The Pink Door.

Lasagna and the beet salad was excellent.  Arancini was great as well. 

Waiter was not so good - forgot both the glass of ice and the Diet Coke I ordered, even when not being too busy.  Busboy was very attentive.  Good food but the waiter let us down.
The food was absolutely amazing. We went during the day for a late lunch and sat out on the patio. Highly recommend the pink door lasagna!
The service was amazing and the food was delicious! We had the spaghetti and rigatoni and it was the best!
Good food, service and ambiance. Sad to see the changes to the main room but we had a good evening, as always.
Wonderful nutritious food. Great service. Worth the wait. Veggie lasagna totally delicious. Came with 2 other couples...all with May anniversary. Perfect !
Lasagna was delicious as was seasonal beet salad. Cabaret "boobie" cake is amazing.

the food was great
a must
Whenever we visit Seattle The Pink Door is on our list of dining.  The place has a lot of energy, and the food is amazingly delicious.
Great service, great food, great view. It was a wonderful Seattle experience.

This wasn’t our first trip to the Pink Door, but this trip was to celebrate my daughters 16th birthday.  It is a favorite stop whenever we visit Seattle, reminds us of time spent in Italy.  The food is perfection!

We arrived early for our 6pm reservation and they went ahead and seated us in the dining room with a view of the bay.  The food was outstanding, the service was perfect and the view beautiful.  One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle!
Great spot! Exceptional value.

Today's lunch overlooking Elliott Bay was great!  Not warm enough to sit on the wonderful patio, but a great view made up for it.  Our food was impeccable with local ingredients as the stars of our meals.  My caesar salad with succulent grilled shrimp was the best caesar I have ever eaten. My companions enjoyed another salad as well as local carrots which were exquisite.  Looking forward to going back this summer to take in the beefsteak and fresh mozzarella salad!!
Great times
Best service every. Staff knew what wine paired well with the food we ordered. Very knowledgeable.
Service was phenomenal. Can’t beat good service in my book. Food was great (mussels and clams)! Drinks were refreshing and unique. Not too crowded, so you could enjoy the conversation at the table.
Great experience. The reataurant has a really unique vibe with amazing food!

This was a great restaurant. Not to easy to find since the name is not on door. Just ‘pink color door’ we ate out side on a beautiful weather afternoon. Had the rice ball seafood stew and bookie cake for desert. All were delicious. The server was very friendly no rush to leave. Highly recommend.
Another outstanding meal in a relaxed but sophisticated setting.  Menu choices always tempting  and great cocktail specialties.
I would 100% recommend The Pink Door, the food was amazing and the service was excellent.

They have a wonderful menu of diverse offerings and we tried many of them and loved each one. The service we received in the bar and at the table was personable and top notch. We had a beautiful table and commented a few times on the comfortable yet elegant ambiance. This was our first visit to the restaurant but we will definitely be going back.

Celebrated our anniversary with dinner at The Pink Door! We were lucky to be seated near the windows and enjoyed the beautiful view. Thomas, our server, was awesome and his recommendations for food and wine were on point. He even gave us his recommendations for places to enjoy cocktails for later that night. We really enjoyed The Pink Door and Seattle!
Food, atmosphere, service - this place is perfect.  We enjoyed it very much!!!
My girlfriend and I had a fantastic evening and wonderful experience the night went to the Pink Door.
Everyone raves about Pink Door as the restaurant when visiting Seattle and for good reason! Thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Reservations highly recommended.
As always our regular go to for a great lunch to celebrate or welcome friends to Seattle l.
Excellent service, food and atmosphere!  Will definitely go back.

Food was great! Not huge portions, just perfect for one person. 
Unfortunately our server got busy and we lost her attention after we got our entree. We had planned to stay for dessert and coffee, but took it as a sign and paid up.
One of the best restaurants in Seattle! Lovely decor, good balance between traditional, kitschy and contemporary. Fabulous food and service. Somewhat tucked away location a huge plus.

Enjoyed the whole fish that was featured that evening and also the lavender cheesecake, it was amazing. The ambiance is superb and our service was perfect. Thanks for making my partners birthday dinner special.

I'd heard so much about their spinach lasagne and was not disappointed.  It was delicious!  My husband opted for a "meat" meal and loved it so much he wanted to chew on the bones (I wouldn't let him).  The garlic bread was charred on the grill and delicious as were our desserts.  Would definitely recommend and will definitely go back!
Food and Service very good as always
The waiter is very nice. Food was so good!

Dinner was wonderful. Sitting outside with a view of the Sound enjoying a Mojito and cheese board on a warm evening with family. Couldn’t have been better. Service was perfect and the food was soooo good. My vegetarian options were great and the meat eaters in the family were happy too. Such a perfect evening.
Great view!

Unique spot. They upgraded and expanded but managed to maintain the funky charm. 
It is the opposite of generic. Eating on the deck is the best.
Service, food, location were all a treat.
Mother’s Day and a mom and son trip. He lives in New York. I live in California and he picked Seattle.

Our experience at The Pink Door was jaw-dropping!  From the surprise of finding a quiet little pink door in Post Alley, then opening it to a busy bee-hive of activity down a lovely flight of stairs, and on to our cute little table on the deck with the very attentive wait staff, and finally to the delightfully delicious and awesomely attractive food prepared just for us - our mouths were agape and happy little gasps came out at each of the aforementioned points!  We HIGHLY recommend the Everything Green Salad (so beautiful in the shape of a pretty green rose, and tasty with fresh just right texture in every bite!), and the top sirloin steak option prepared in the best ever Italian recipe that we want to make at home, but it's probably top secret!  Such a memory for our taste buds.  We simply MUST go back!!
it was a nice experience, food and service great, but feel very overpiriced and show was ok, nothing special
great food, seasonal food, and excellent for bringing out of town guests!
The food, service and ambiance are unparalleled! 💓💓💓

My family and I went to the Pink Door for a  Saturday dinner and it was fantastic!  I got the bolognese and it was very fresh and extremely tasty.  We also ordered the lasagna and it was one of the best we  have ever had!  The spaghetti and meatballs was average compared to the rest but still good!  The meals were priced really well for the value of the food.  The. ambience is neat and not your average restaurant scene.  We will definitely be back in the future.
Great food, great service, great wine, great location.

We had dear friends from England come into
Seattle and got together for a very pleasant reunion. We had met on a Tall Ship Cruise three years ago. Our showing them Seattle,
the great time with super salmon made for an outstanding evening. Thank you for your
part in helping us show the Seattle we all love.
Our server was extraordinary... I can’t remember her name but her hair was a lovely shade of aqua... she was fleet footed and fast minded. Thank you!!!

Recently visited for a work lunch.  Our group of five was seated outside on the deck.  Got to enjoy the beautiful weather.  Menu included something for everyone.  All were happy with selection.  In and out within our lunch hour.

Only downside is they won't separate checks but I understand what a hassle this is.
Great food, great service and nice atmosphere!

There was no signage outside, so it was somewhat difficult to find. We entered and climbed down the stairs to the less than friendly hostess, where we asked if this was indeed “The Pink Door”. Wow...the look she gave us couldn’t have gotten any more demeaning. And this, from the hostess! Basically set up the evening. The food was great, my cocktail was blah, as was the service. All the waiting staff were doing their job, but very robotic-like and basically gave us the impression that they were there for the job and didn’t really enjoy what they do. Sure, come for the food, but for the price and location, their wait staff should at least pretend they care.
Always. Exquisite.
Window table on a sunny day superb!
The paparedelle bolognese was excellent! I could eat it every day. The spaghetti was a little undercooked, and the marinara was nothing special, so stick with the bolognese dish and you’ll be happy.
Food and service was amazing. This place had the best pastas in the area.
Food certainly is nothing special. Service was pleasant, ambiance was neat. But had higher expectations for the execution of the food.
Great food. Expensive for the portion size.

I was visiting Seattle with my partner and received a recommendation from a friend for the Pink Door. It was a wonderful experience! From the alleyway entrance to the scenic dining, delicious food, and great service, I would wholly recommend the Pink Door for any travellers with a bit of time and money to spare on a great experience.

Too many good things to list! Craft cocktails were delicious. Great seafood options as well as classic Italian dishes. Were given a romantic table by the window with an amazing view of the Puget sound and fun people watching below. Our server brought us complimentary glasses of prosecco to celebrate our anniversary and was attentive throughout the meal but not intrusive. For a tourist spot it was really top notch.
Amazing outdoor seating area, friendly staff, and great food!
The whole experience was delightful. Good cocktails, great service and delicious food.

Best Italian in Seattle hands down! I’ve been here many times and am never disappointed. The waiters are always friendly and prompt, the food is superb and the ombience is intimate and inviting. Love this place, highly recommend.

Best oysters ever!  Our server was prompt, friendly, knowledgable and enhanced our whole lunch-dining experience.  The food was outstanding - oysters, champagne, antipasto, halibut, green salad, Washington red blend, and cappuccino. Yummm!
Loved it!   Will travel back to Seattle to go again!
Nothing great about the food.
Very good, though a bit overpriced for the food quality. Great ambiance.

We went here for our anniversary dinner. We were sat by the window over looking Pike’s Place Market and Puget Sound. Everything from the service to the food and wine were perfect. I HIGHLY recommend their lasagna. I am a pasta person and this is the best pasta dish I have ever had!! It was such an amazing night that it literally brought tears to my eyes at the end of the night.
I really enjoyed the entertainment.

What a fun place! Such an eclectic place with decore, service staff and entertainment. I really thought we were at an Italian Mulan Rouge. We had a window seat as I requested in my reservation, and they came and got us for the airial display. It was so fun and added to our evening. The food was great....a memorable evening. We will be back.

We love the Pink Door and keep going back. This time we were taking a friend for a birthday dinner. The special was terrific and our favorite ragu was as good as ever. They also have wonderful hors d'oevres. Definitely recommend the Pink Door.
Love !! Our favorite Seattle restaurant.
This is our second time at The Pink Door, and it did nt disappoint! What a great local spot with lovely atmosphere and food! The food is amazing every time!

Had a great time, I wish we could have seen the show. Next time I will for sure specify in the reservation. 

Amazing food and atmosphere.

Very nice ambiance and stylish (not formal) decor.  Very friendly staff that were cheery and helpful.  We never felt rushed despite it being a very busy night.  Food was excellent!  The we had the linguine vignole and the halibut special.    Make reservations, we squeaked in.  I guarantee the next time we are in Seattle we will stop by.  Maybe next time we will book in the the late night show.
It was a wonderful evening with great food and wonderful service. We enjoyed everything
Good food and nice view.
Everything was Excellent, the food was so flavorful, service was outstanding

I love this restaurant. I used to come to the pink door 35 years ago when I lived in Seattle. I spent many Saturday nights there. I returned for a visit and it is just as wonderful as I remembered it from all those years ago!
Overall had a very good meal, the lamb the only set-back, it was woefully overcooked, I had asked for medium rare and got very well done. We would definitely come back
Everything was amazing!  Our server, Terrence, was OUTSTANDING and really made our experience special and memorable!
Outstanding food.  Great service.   Love the decor.  Quirky.  Highly recommend
As always this a gem!  Have been coming here for 35 years - ambience, food, service never disappoints!  Love the remodel!

Fantastic! We had our anniversary dinner there on a Monday night. Turns out on Mondays there is no show happening in the restaurant, but the food and the views were still great! Attentive staff, delicious upscale dinner. We'll definitely come back on a night with in house entertainment!
Lovely place. Great food! Highly recommend.

The Pink Door has been a favorite of mine since the first time I ate there 5 years ago. I don’t go very often  just due to not getting to Seattle that much, but every time I’ve been I’ve had an outstanding experience! The food, atmosphere, service... everything is excellent. I recommend this to everyone who asks where to eat when downtown, and it’s always my first choice when planning a girls’ night out! I’d tell you my favorite dishes, but that would be literally everything I’ve ever had there.

Had to wait for 20 minutes even after booking the table two weeks before for a 2 PM slot. After we got the table, we were severed one tiny piece of bread (we were wondering if this is to be shared between three people!) they later got two more pieces, then it took a while to get the food we ordered, the food was quiet oily and the waiter just disappeared, other staff avoiding to give eye contact in case anyone asked for anything. Looks like this place is understaffed, the food is greasy and is highly overrated. It was not like this a couple years back but everything has changed now. Would not recommend it to anyone!
Great service and amazing food!  I am going back next week for another meal and I'm truly looking forward to it!
Our 15 year anniversary was made truly special by The Pink Door!!
Amazing food and wonderful staff! Friendly and humorous. Just overall a most wonderful experience!
The Pink Door is amazing!  On every level... food, ambiance, service was all exceptional.  We went twice in our 4 day stay and can't wait to come back again.
Interesting place, decor and staff. Packed for a Monday night. Had a great time. Would go back again if I’m in Seattle.
One of the best restaurants I've ever been to and we've been to a lot of great restaurants.  Make your reservation early and don't miss this when you are in Seattle.

One of the best places in Seattle for amazing Italian food. And sound best lasagna ever consumed. Ambiance is amazing. Staff dress a little bit like Halloween overall but they are friendly and very effective at their jobs.
Best pasta in town !! Will definitely visit again.
was awesome
Wonderful lunch with girl-friends, the food was delicious and loved salad, pink door lasagna, pizza and rock fish in amazing ambiance with waterfront view.

My friend and I shared the bolognese and risotto. Both delicious. 
I also had a rosewater cocktail, different but I loved it.
Amazing food and service.

In April, we were lucky enough to have a sunny day that was warm enough to sit outside at The Pink Door. We go to the restaurant several times a year but mostly in summer and again at Christmas time. Our preference is for a long, leisurely lunch that mimics long leisurely lunches in Italy. The Pink Door always delivers that experience. Our food, from antipasti to dolci was excellent--seasonal, perfectly prepared. There's an excellent wine/liquor list. The view is excellent on a sunny day--ferries, mountains, the bay. And our server was perfect in not hurrying us, totally supporting the leisurely lunch approach (he said he does it as well when he eats at the Pink Door). The only slight downside is when it comes to paying the piper--the bill will be high but not untypical for the Seattle restaurant scene. it's worth it for a special outing. Looking forward to going back again very soon.

The Pink Door was the highlight of our  one-day trip to Seattle.  Staff was uniformly professional, welcoming, and friendly.  Food was outstanding.  We had the luxury of dining outside on a most wondrous sunny Seattle day.  Dungeness  Caesar Salad was fabulous.  Highly recommend!

Hands down one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The ambiance, service, entertainment, and bolognese were absolutely next level. I will never come to this city without a reservation here. Don't miss out!
Great food, apps and beer. However, the parking situation is horrible!!! There's so much construction going on around that area with parking being limited to begin with. I would UBER/LYFT next time.

Exceptional everything! I love the Pink Door lasagna so much I can't seem to move past it. Yet this visit one food item surpassed my entree amazingly - the Strawberry Pavlova! Is it okay to say it was orgasmic?!! Honestly, I could barely talk between my sounds of pleasure. I still can't get it out of my mind, dreaming of my next visit!
I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. It's perfection.
Going to the Pink Door is always fun.  Food is very good, service is great and it is always a little weird which makes it really great.  Never get tired of going there.
We went for our anniversary dinner. Had an excellent time, food was delicious and oue server was great. Thank you

This was the absolute best way to celebrate my birthday, the ambiance was totally worth it and the food was the icing on the cake. I will be returning as often as possible. The staff was fantastic and so informative about our selections.
We had family who had been to the iconic Pink Door - they loved it!  the food was excellent, service great & the decor & view were fabulous!!

A friend took me for my birthday and the food was soooo delicious.  I’m originally from NYC and this is the best restaurant i’ve Been to since moving to Kitsap County over 20 years ago and the people at the next table, total strangers, picked up the whole tab.  WOW

Excellent 
Everything 
Cocktails, food, service, view
Worth the drive from Portland, Oregon
Great food and great service. Was a little hard to find but well worth it.
Excellent food and service. Very chic place. Would definitively go again.
Awesome place, amazing food. Great music. I had the lamb with pesto. Delicious.
A somewhat hidden restaurant with a lively atmosphere.  The food was wonderful.

We flew in to Seattle for a quick 24 hour trip. Decided to try this place out after reading many reviews about their food. Thank goodness we did...absolutely amazing food!! Make sure you make a reservation! The restaurant does not have any outside signage..other than the pink door. Once inside, it's the most adorable, eclectic place we've been to! Next time, we'll have to go for dinner to experience the atmosphere. 
We went during lunch, were seated near the windows, so we had a beautiful view of the waterfront. I ordered the everything green salad, and the lasagna...absolutely one of the most delicious meals I've ever had! The salad was crisp, and so tasty!! For the lasagna, there were 7 delicate spinach pasta layers, that paired perfectly with the most amazing béchamel, pesto and marinara! Don't forget to use your bread to soak up all of the remaining sauce! My husband had the pasta with meatballs, and the sauce was absolutely delicious! You'll need the bread for that sauce too! Service was great, very attentive.
Overall, an amazing dining experience, and we will definitely go again!
Staff was great, food excellent & atmosphere charming

We had a great experience! We took 4 children ages 9 and under and we’re a little worried but the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. The food was excellent and a good value for the reasonable price. Pretty restaurant and the show was a great hit with the kids! I will definitely recommend the Pink Door to my friends who might be visiting Seattle.

The food was all amazing. Something came out cold and before we could even say anything the manager came up and asked us if it was ok, he then brought us a new one and comped that app and another one. The lasagna was unreal, and lived the atmosphere.
Great environment. Would come back just for the space. Food was delicious, but ambiance was bettwr

This is , by far, the best restaurant in Seattle. The food is extraordinary... Flavorful and presented in such an attractive way. The service is attentive without being intrusive. I LOVE this place!!!

Went for lunch, had a very enjoyable meal. I ordered the Caesar salad and then the lasagna and my bf had the Prosciutto and then the vongole, both delicious. Wish I had room for dessert! Will return the next time I’m in Seattle.
I love the updated and expanded dining room with view of Elliot Bay-- and my friends really love it too!

Difficult to find the door on Post Alley. Once you spot it, you will be drawn by its interesting decor. The back part of the restaurant offers great view while the terrace would be fantastic during summer I’d imagine (as it wasn’t open when I visited). Lunch menu is similar to dinner menu with some items listed cheaper. Great service by the bar staff. Enjoyed the lunch and will go back even if it’s on my own again.
Great as always    Prices are reasons noble and the atmosphere is nice.  Leah’s very busy any time of day.
Food wasn't that great. SO SO italian food. Restaurant is nice though, has good ambiance and really nice decor. Would recommend for the venue not the food
Tasty with an eclectic atmosphere.
1 year anniversary. They treated us to a complimentary dessert as well, which was very sweet and very much appreciated.
Live music was great, food was delicious and the dessert was divine. Buttermilk ice cream is WOW!
This place was overall amazing from the food, the service, the ambiance! I had the lasagna that’s a dish they’ve served for over 46 years and was absolutely delicious

We really enjoyed our dinner at the Pink Door. Service was impeccable. The food was better than we experienced in Italy last summer. The meatballs were a perfect blend of ground meats & spices. The Lasagna was amazing. The halibut had a nice sear on it. The desserts were all perfect as well. Loved the creative mix of people in the place too.
Great food!  Awesome experience
Had a Tarot card reading with Madame Eugenia to start the evening and she was amazing! The spaghetti and meatballs were only overshadowed by the amazing view. Love this restaurant ❤️
Unique atmosphere. Good place to go for a fancy night out without completely breaking the bank. Friendly service every time!

We visit Seattle 2-3 times per year and this year several of my wife’s co-workers told her we would love The Pink Door. We had a great dinner,  very good server and enjoyed our whole experience during the evening. We will be back to experience more of the menu .
We had a window table in their "new" section overlooking the market.  Food was excellent and the service was wonderful.

I love the ambiance of the Pink Door and the food is good but on this occasion we ordered the Pasta with rabbit. There were bones in it and I nearly broke my tooth. So I wouldn't recommend ordering that.
The entire experience was EXCELLENT!  Food, Service, Atmosphere.  We loved it.

Less than warm welcome. We were late for our reservation, and our table was given away, completely understandable because of the fact. We were made to wait at the bar for another table and then was seated quickly which wasn't too bad. The person who seated us didn't say a word to us in hello and the person who gave us water was far from engaging, even after attempting to start conversation. However, our waitress Lola with the rainbow hair made the rest of the experience amazing. She was engaging and happy and made very awesome suggestions for sights to see in Seattle. Food was spot on and I even found my new favorite wine. Service was fast. Hopefully when I return, which I plan to do to see some shows, the welcome will be a little better.

The Pink Door lives up to its reputation; we were amazed by the environment inside and were quickly seated by a window with a beautiful view. We had the lasagna and special chef pizza for lunch, which were both delicious. The portion sizes were perfect. We would highly recommend going just for the experience.

We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of this restaurant. What a gem! The food was all amazing! Service attentive but not obtrusive. Food, yummy - lobster ravioli, vegetarian lasagna, apple tart for dessert. We seriously wanted to lick the plates. This is a phenomenal experience you should NOT miss! Don't even think of arriving without a reservation at any time or day of the week as this place is busy even mid week.
Spectacular food, incredible service, unusual food pairings that were unexpected and wonderful.

The new Pink Door bar and dining room with a panoramic Elliot Bay view over the waterfront are great new additions to this long time favorite Italian restaurant.  And the menu is great with a combination of signature favorites (the risotto and the lasagna) and new dishes, especially in the seafood area.  If you haven't been there for a while, you are in for a treat.
Food and service excellent as well as location and view of the waterfront. Would highly recommend this restaurant when in the Seattle area.

I made an easy lunch reservation a day before for Pink Door  after finding out that they were reservations only. Dinner reservations may need a few days notice, but I see (and recommend) why this restaurant is reviewed so highly.

Location is right in Pike Place Market, so either plan your day in the area, uber or have a great time looking for parking. Checking-in was easy enough. My group was seated in the ocean view room on one of their beautiful booths.

There wasn't an absured amount of people and the atmosphere was tranquil. -It wasn't loud even though we came from the noisy alleys and Seattle's largest farmer's market.

Though on the pricier end, the food was great. The table had the lasagna, Bolognese, linguine, risotto, large mix appetizers and a half dozen oysters (but came out as 8 pieces to accommodate 4 people!) Everything was very tasty. 

Our server was very helpful! She checked on us the right amount of times to see if we needed anything. Even our water glasses weren't neglected. In the end of our visit, the server let us split the bill among the four. She even offered to help with the calculation even though she didn't have the best mathematic skills.

Absolutely wonderful night at The Pink Door. All of our meals were amazing. The ambience was phenomenal. The view of the water and city lights were perfect. Five nights of spectacular dining in Seattle and this was truly our favorite.
The food was great and very filling.
The Pink Door had a comfortable, romantic atmosphere. I'd recommend it for romantic dates or special occasion. Service was fantastic.

This experience was one of the most disappointing experiences I've had at a restaurant. I made a reservation for my daughter's birthday several months in advance based upon the wonderful reviews I read. I made a reservation for 4 people, but it changed to 3 at the last moment. Upon arrival to the Pink Door, I let them know it would be 3 of us instead of 4. After a  longer than expected wait, we were seated at a two person table next to a wall. They had added a third chair to the side of the very small table. It was very uncomfortable with our knees banging against each other all night long. What made it  even more aggravating is that there were two  4 top tables unoccupied right near us. Soon after, the restaurant seated two parties of 3 at those tables. Sitting in such cramped quarters for no good reason really killed the ambience. Then the mediocre food added to the terrible experience. We were in Seattle to celebrate a special occasion and all the other restaurants we went to provided great service and much better food. I think this restaurant may have been good somewhere in the past based upon the reviews, but now they act as if you're lucky to get to eat at their establishment. I think they forget that they remain open because of the patronage of customers. I will never return to this restaurant.

We were celebrating our 33rd wedding anniversary. It was in the notes and I overheard the hostess say that our server would be made aware. At no time during the meal did our server, Phil, mention that it was a special occasion or say anything about it at all. At the end of the meal, we declined dessert and was presented with the check.  We asked him if he knew it was our anniversary and he said yes. We were in Seattle for 5 days EVERY restaurant at dinner did something, even if it was something small. They ALL acknowledged it. We were very disappointed that The Pink Door is evidently so popular that they don't feel the need to do courteous gestures for their patrons. In 33 years, The Pink Door is the only restaurant (and we have been to many all over the world) to ignore what is usually considered something to celebrate.

I came here for my birthday with friends and family. I made a reservation prior and we were able to get seated in the new expanded area which was BEAUTIFUL! The view of the Sound was amazing! Service was great and the food even better. The wine paired well with all the food we ate from mushroom crustinis, Bolognese, steak, and scallops. I've been here before with bigger groups in the outdoor area which is also a treat. Overall, I love the Pink Door! Perfect for a special occasion.

It’s just too loud to have a pleasant conversation. Someone is always left out or else they’re saying “What? What?” Maybe if there were only two people. The food and decor are superb, so if that’s your interest, you’ll be very happy
Great atmosphere and delicious Italian food and wine list. I had the Papardelle ai Ragu for dinner and arancini and tour of appetizers as entry.
The food was excellent! We were celebrating our anniversary, so with our desserts they brought out Prosecco for us and it was super cute! Would highly recommend.

I’ve been coming here for at least 32 years and it keeps getting better and it was great before! I had my first date with my husband then 30 years later we celebrated my daughters 21st birthday here! We would come more but it’s so busy and I’ve got a tendency to be spontaneous. I highly recommend it.
My all time favorite restaurant. I can’t get enough of the bolognese!

I loved the food the atmosphere.  I was formal looking inside but so laid back.  There was a jazz band playing while we were there.  They saved us a great table at 9PM.  Thank you for a wonderful evening.
Great food (authentic, simple, delicious). Friendly Knowledgeable staff. Cool vibe. I'm a local, so I appreciate the special attention we got!
So eclectic and creative with atmosphere and food was outstanding!

Had a later reservation on a Sunday night (booked about a week in advance- tables go quickly!) - got an amazing table by the window. Everything we ate was incredible. Oysters, Caesar salad, risotto, osso bucco and a boobie cake to go. Our server was very helpful, friendly, and spaced out our courses perfectly! Will be back the next time we’re in Seattle for an Ariel or cabaret show!

One of my favourite dining experiences in Seattle. There was a acrobat performer, that was both entertaining and classy. This place feels like a real hidden old Europe gem of a place. Highly recommend it.

It was Just Fantastic...!! I got 5 star from My Wife :-)
Thank You.

Wonderful meal. We tried to walk in for an evening dinner, but didn’t want to wait. Place gets busy, we found out why! Came back for lunch reservations and were seated immediately. Menu was good, service was excellent, and food was outstanding. Easily the best meal we had on our trip up to Seattle. Had a good view of the Pike Marketplace while we were eating too. 

Well worth it. If you’re hungry, look for the non descriptive pink door in the alley, you won’t regret it!
Great food! Great service! Consistent experience.

Thank  you Pink Door! Brought our friend and his wife from out of town. They absolutely LOVED the Pink Door! We made reservations and were seated right away when we got there. We ordered beverages and chatted a while before ordering our apps and meals. The only snafu was that the gentlemen had ordered for their drink to be on ice, when they came to the table they were not. They quickly made a comment and the server brought back the correct drink quickly. 
We ordered the antipasto of the house, had a couple servings of the complimentary bread (so good!), starter salads, pappardelle al ragù Bolognese, cioppino, lamb osso bucco, the ice cream tri, and cookies. Everything was exceptional! We were here to celebrate a birthday and the staff put a candle in the ice cream.

Not to mention, the view was beautiful! We were there just during sunset and probably spent a good three hours here. Our friends could not get enough of it!

Thank you to all at Pink Door! Looking forward to going back.

One of the best experiences in a while! Treat yourself to this neighborhood gem, the staff is wonderful and so attentive, they will make you feel part of the family. And the food is so excellent, I returned twice over 3 days. Too bad I live on the other side of the country or I would pay the Pink Door a weekly visit.
OUTSTANDING...HADN'T BEEN IN LONG TIME BUT DEFINITELY GOING BACK SOON.

This restaurant has restored my faith that very good if not excellent food can be had at a reasonable price and in a nice setting with a fabulous view in the back room! So tired of the pretenders out there, charging a lot of money for mediocre food.  Pink Door = exceptional food at mid price range. Bravo for Pink Door.  We will be back soon!
The food was absolutely delicious and the service excellent! Great spot!!!
Beautiful atmosphere.  Striking view.  Excellent food and service!

A great spot for a special occasion, or even if you just want quality food at a reasonable price. My girlfriend and I came here to celebrate my birthday and we were not disappointed. There was the pleasant surprise of live music which we didn't know would be going on that night. The staff was very accommodating. I specifically asked for the "most romantic table available," and was sat in the main dining area. (I'd recommend asking for the main dining room vs the entrance room where the bar, stage, and performance area is unless you are there for the music/performance. The noise level in the back dining area was much more conducive to good conversation, and, the view of the Great Wheel is stunning! Thankfully, a party was just getting up from a window seat (ask for a window seat for parties of 2) and we were able to sit there vs. the corner spot where they were going to sit us. I was glad I asked the host to take a picture of us at the beginning of the meal as we had a late reservation, (9:45 PM) and the wheel was still lit up, where after the dinner and dessert, it was not. The food was amazing, and well-priced. (Risotto and Lamb Shank, with brussel sprouts for an app, and the "Boobie Cake" for dessert) The waiter was able to suggest wines that paired nicely to each of our meals, and was price conscious which is highly noted and appreciated. (Some servers would automatically go for something priced higher to drive up the total tab) The decor was lovely, bathrooms clean, and the vibe was awesome! We were one of the last two parties to leave and the staff was friendly the whole time, we never got a rushed vibe at all. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

To keep it short and simple, You will leave this establishment smiling from to ear trying to figure out the next time you can dine here again. Everything was OUTSTANDING. From the moment you sit down your dining experience will be 5 star quality. I'll be back again. Reservations have already been made. :-)

Amazing food, staff and overall experience
They where very nice

Pink Door was closed down last year for several months to remodel the restaurant.  The wait was well worth it!  This has always been a popular restaurant but since the renovation it has been tough to get reservations.  Knew I wanted to go here to celebrate anniversary with my husband so I booked a month in advance to get a Saturday night reservation (you can only book up to a month in advance).  I had heard they were just going to remodel the kitchen but was happy to find that besides enlarging the kitchen they also expanded the dining room and bar area!  

We got the one of the best tables in the restaurant.  Table for two and the window overlooking the Pike Place Market and Seattle Wheel.  Simply beautiful view.  If you are not from Seattle this is another great reason to book this restaurant.

As expected this restaurant was packed but service was great.  We had several drinks during dinner and our server was great about brining new drinks once we had finished ours.

Besides a mushroom bruschetta I also had fish of the day which was a Branzino.  It was described as serving for one but could have easily fed two or three.  I was just sorry I could not finish it. Husband had pasta.

I am so looking forward to my next dining experience at Pink Door!

Do not delay, make reservations for this restaurant.  You won't regret it.

We were seated in the quieter dining room with the spectacular view.   That I expected.  The unexpected was the creative menu, incredibly fresh and delicious meal, and knowledgeable waiter.  Excellent experience.

Lasagna, risotto, linguini clams and pappardelle bolognese were delicious. Italian soda, ginger beer, non-alcoholic specialty drink and proseco spritzer were quality. This was a last-minute Open Table reservation for four on a sunny Saturday evening that was easily accommodated. Beautiful booth seating with breath-taking view of the bay.
Loved it!  Just opened new area super cute.  I have food allergies and they made its best to satisfy my needs without being mean about it.  Super nice place.
It was incredible!
Beautiful view of the bay , great service , very nice romantic restaurant

What a wonderful experience! The lasagna was amazing! Our waiter was sassy and I loved it. The restaurant itself is beautiful. If I had mention something bad, it would be that the ladies sitting next to us were super loud, but of course, this is nothing the restaurant is responsible for. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience and we will come back if we ever find ourselves back in Seattle!
a nice place in the heart of Seattle.  Live music was really good, and food/service as well
Always great service and quality…never disappointed!  What I love about this place unlike the other is their scallops, you get your sides with are delicious…
Always amazing, but hard to get a table.

It was our first time in! Service, food and our table by the window was the icing! Next time in town it will be our first stop! I had the clams & pasta dish, my wife had the lasagna! Both were exceptional! The waiter was friendly and informative.
