The view from the back room is fantastic! Great waiter and the food was excellent! The chef made a great vegetarian pasta dish. The sole stuffed with crab amazing!

I had a reservation for my boyfriend on his birthday and we were so happy with our decision. Everything was so delicious and our server, Andrew basically sold us on everything we asked about. We can’t wait to come back!
My food was overall very mediocre. Both sausage and meatballs were so overcooked.

Fantastic choice for an anniversary. We were seated with a perfect view of Pike Place and the bay. The food was incredible, the service was constantly on point, and I left ready to plan another day to return. We arrived during the lunch menu and the choices had us in awe. We can't wait to go back for a dinner service.

I have loved this restaurant for many years for it's warmth and fantastic food.  With the recent remodel you can enjoy Seattle magnificent views from both the patio during warm weather  and the dining room.  A true destination.
the place has a great rep but i also heard that it can be hard to get a table during peak times.... so when i saw a chance to get a reservation i jumped at it.... and wasn’t disappointed!

I have been coming to Pink Door for 18 years as I work a block away. I am a frequent lunch customer and I appreciate the new indoor dining room section. It's bright and cheery and perfect for vendor/client lunches anytime of year. Summer is also great because the outdoor patio is like no other place. Rather than umbrellas to block the sun, they've created a meshed roof so you don't have any direct sun beating on you. But, everyone still wears sunglasses which gives it this California vibe, you'll want to order a drink, and you should, they're good.

We have been going to Pink Door for years - especially for birthday and anniversary celebrations. Always comfortable, always great food and outstanding service. LOVE the new space and vibe - a very successful remodel. We will be back!
We had a delicious, relaxed dinner and drinks. Delicious food, delicious (huge) desserts, creative drinks list. A great time was had by all.
Great ambiance, wonderful setting, and fantastic food. If you love Italian food and hidden gems this place is definitely a must visit.
Terrific service, view and food. Such a fun place to go!

Restaurant  was really nice and the food was delicious, seemed odd when I could not get a drink at the bar. Bartender helped my girlfriend get her drink and then walked away without seeing if I wanted anything(which I did). Second time waiter forgot to bring drinks to the table till the very end of the meal. People next to us received great service(same waiter).

I love this restaurant! Great staff, great organization, great service, great food, I appreciate how they really do provide a memorable experience! The food is amazing, one of the most authentic Italian restaurants in Seattle!  ( I Know, as I'm half Italian and have taken several trips to Italy) if you are looking for mozzarella di bufalo, which is not always easy to find locally, they have it! I definitely recommend eating at the Pink Door
Wonderful in every way! A little pricey but for special occasion or date night, well worth it!
My family and I always love having dinner at the pink door for special occasions!  Food, fun, and unique entertainment!
Warm, friendly staff, good food  (though small portions), and great atmosphere.
Good experience enjoyed the food and ambience would love to visit again!
The Pink Door was amazing! The views, the food from appetizers to dessert, the wine and the ambience were just so wonderful!! We will be back for sure to enjoy more from this gem of a restaurant!!
So wonderful. The Crostini were amazing as well as the spinach lasagna.  Lovely birthday lunch date.

We love coming to the pink door but this time we didn't have a great experience. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the gluten free options and we seemed confident in ordering the gluten free pasta but when it came out it was not gluten free noodles my boyfriend ended up getting very sick the next day. He said it tasted amazing though but we were disappointed in the service overall and the non gluten free food

The Pink Door was the perfect spot for dinner on my birthday. We were in town visiting from New Orleans and Houston. We chose The Pink Door because of the delicious looking menu and lightheartedly because my favorite color as a kid was pink.
We started with the lobster ravioli (divine) and brussels sprouts for the table. For entrees we ordered Bolognese, Lamb Oso Bucco, Spaghetti and Meatballs and the Northwest Fish (seared tuna over a bed of flavorful fingerling potatoes and eggplant). Everything was spiced perfectly, had wonderful flavor and was a large portion for the price. For dessert we had ricotta cheesecake and the ice cream trio. Both were delicious. Our reservation was for 9:30pm and the ambiance was perfect at that time. The restaurant wasn't too busy, therefore wasn't too loud. The music was serene, lighting was easy on the eyes and we had a great view of the sound which was an added bonus. Our waiter, David, was kind enough to accommodate dietary restrictions and was very informative about each dish. Thanks David! Next time we are in Seattle we will be back.

The restaurant was super cute and bigger then expected from the outside. 
It feels like your in an underground place, but theres a whole back room area where there are large windows that bring in waterfront views. 
We had a lovely sunset , corner table view. 

The food was great. We shared plates since we were not that hungry, but overall experience was lovely.
Great place! Awesome service! Would recommend for sure! Pasta was good, but next time I would try something else.
We really enjoyed our dinner.  Loved the recommendations our delightful waiter provided ,  all in all loved our evening out

Best dinner I’ve ever had! Paired with excellent speedy service who was generous to give excellent advice on wine which both my boyfriend and I enjoyed. Loved it so much I booked it again for my birthday!
Absolutely wonderful experience. Thomas was amazing. Will definitely plan to come back.
The food and wine are always excellent!  Friendly and professional staff.  One of our favorite restaurants in Seattle.

My wife and I were in Seattle for a long weekend vacation and made reservations at The Pink Door, as it came highly recommended from articles online and friends who'd been there before. The restaurant is very eclectic and has a certain charm, that being said we were seated with a great view of the bay. We started out with the artisanal cheese plate, which was excellent. For our entrees, my wife ordered the Pink Door cioppino, which the waiter told us has been on the menu for 36 years. I preserved the bolognese with fresh pasta --- which was amazing. The cioppino, despite being a staple of the restaurant, left something to be desired. The cioppino had very little flavor. While we were both disappointed with the cioppino, the rest of the meal was excellent as was the service.
Stopped in for lunch since we couldn’t get a dinner reservation. Food was amazing!
Our new favorite place to go in Seattle! Ate in the back room- great views. Food was amazing.

Awesome food, staff and live music. Our waiter was Thomas - who was great, but so were the rest of the staff. Really hospitable and the place looked great and had a really nice atmosphere too. One of my favourite restaurants ive ever been too.
I cannot get over how amazing the service was! Great food, great service, great ambiance. What more do you want? 🍝
Perfect food and service. We sat in the original dining space.  Magnificent
What an amazing meal. This place is incredible! The view, the menu, the ambiance, the people. Everything was perfect.
This was our first time to the Pink Door and it will not be our last.  Our server was funny and laid back.  What a great date night!!!
We had an Amazing evening, lovely food l, gorgeous views and good vibe and ambiance.  Would love to return!
Wonderful food, service and the show was amazing. By far some of the best pasta I've had.
We really enjoyed the pink door. Food was fresh and delicious. I loved the Pink door Lasagna. Great ambience, hip but romantic. Would go again
amazing! been here many times and always love it.

We arrived early for a Saturday night reservation and they managed to seat us right away in a room with a generous view of the sound.  The service was excellent, approaching the table at the right times to replenish water glasses and ask for any needs.   This is one of our favorite restaurants in Seattle.
The Pink Door never fails to delight.   It was my son's first time in going and he thoroughly enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  He can't wait to take his girlfriend.
Everything was awesome! Food, wine, cocktails, oysters. Service was flawless. Server wasn’t too present or too absent and was really keyed in on the menu. Highly recommend.
We had such a wonderful time and the food and service was wonderful!
Such a wonderful  boy of old Seattle! The addition is fabulous and our window seat icing on the cake. Our food was great as always.
Wonderful time And meal
Such a wonderful ambience and an amazing view in the newly added wing. One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle
Buen lugar, excelente servicio, el menú un poco limitado pero los alimentos de sabor agradable.

Celebrating an engagement. Requested with reservation a seat by the window to overlook the bay and was granted that request. Beautiful view and a wonderful meal! Fiancé had special spaghetti with squid, clams, mussels, and shrimp. I had the lasagna and it was amazing! The service was great, and we will definitely return on another visit to Seattle!
Fantastic experience and our waitress Elyse was so friendly!
Love this place! Great food, great atmosphere, great service!! Definitely was the cherry on the cake for my fiancé’s 30th birthday celebration!!
The food here is incredible.
Really great. Kale salad is unreal. Truffle risotto made me cry a little. Fantastic

We were able to get into the Saturday night Cabaret/Burlesque show with dinner and I have to say it is a great show. It is a sold out show for the next month or so, very popular!!  I suggest everyone, 21 and older, Seattle residents, who have not attended this event should go, enjoy a great dinner and be entertained by the performers.

I typically love coming to the Pink Door but this time around wasn’t very good. When we got sat for our reservation, it took about 15-20 mins before anyone acknowledged us and took our drink order. Our server seemed a bit disoriented and was not engaging whatsoever. We’ve come for birthdays before and our last servers were amazing and fun to chat with. They even offered her a dessert to end the evening but this time, our server and didn’t even mention anything about a birthday even though I put it on our reservation. My friend order the tortellini pasta in broth and it literally looked like a 5 year old put it together. The presentation wasn’t very good compared to everyone else’s. She’s seen photos of that same dish and hers didn’t even come close to what it looked like. In the end, we didn’t get dessert and just decided to leave after we paid. Definitely a disappointing experience. The atmosphere is always great there but this time around the service fell short. I always go when it’s a busy weekend day. I’ll be returning again sometime but I just hope I don’t get the same server
We came here for our first anniversary for lunch. The service was excellent and the food was amazing! We are looking forward to our next visit sometime soon!
Great service, quick, looks awesome inside, interesting food options.
Fantastic for a date night out.  Gret service and the food is fabulous.
They gave us a fabulous table. Service and food was terrific. Will happily go back
Great food! Great setting! Great service!

Usually pretty good, but made a mistake in ordering this time.  The pheasant tortellini in bone sauce wasn't great.  The bone sauce was too salty and didn't have much other flavor.   Plus the portion size was quite small compared to other lunch entrees.  Not recommended.  But the other dishes looked better.
Service was so so.  Food was good. The music was too loud resulting in customers to speak lounge.  It was difficult to carry a conversation.
pink Door has been a staple in the Market - have been coming for over 25 years - still great food and ambience!
We enjoyed a lovely meal overlooking the water.  The seafood was very fresh and the ambiance was charming.  We had the scallops and ciappinp and Caesars salad and all of it was well executed.
The food was amazing. The pink door has a cozy and a romantic ambience. My husband and I visited it for our anniversary dinner and we loved that place . We would definitely love to visit it again.
Great vibes, great food, fun show following dinner!

This was my second dinner at the Pink Door and it was just as fantastic as the first time. Our server David was excellent, extremely cheerful and knowledgeable and attentitive. The food was excellent and timed well. Their wine and beer list are diverse and the view is spectacular. All around one of my favorite places to eat in Seattle.

Brought my best friend here for a birthday lunch and we had the BEST time! Greta was our server and she was fantastic. Our courses were spaced perfectly, the food was phenomenal and so was the wine. The whole atmosphere made for an awesome lunch and we are most definitely going to return!!

Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and the service was amazing. The staff, ambiance, and views make it a great place to dine. The food was fantastic as well. Will be going back the next time I’m in Seattle.

This was my first experience at The Pink Door. It was easy to find and the hosts were very accommodating. We had a late reservation but wanted to see if we could get in earlier. We waited less than 30 minutes for a table! Our waitress was friendly and knowledgeable. We didn't feel rushed at all. The food was filling and incredibly delicious. Cocktails were on point and the ambiance is awesome. I definitely recommend this place. I will be back for burlesque night!
Perfection! Terrence was amazing!
Returned after many years and the food and overall experience was wonderful.  I plan to come back.
The Pink Door is one of those restaurants you want to return to because there are so many delightful things to try on the menu.

The Pink Door is a very good restaurant, excellent service, very good food.  A bit on the noisy side but not intolerable.  Seafood and past are always good.  Prices are normal for a restaurant in a major city.  There is no sense of being rushed. Their desserts are very good-excellent including the cheesecake.
Very good experience. Service was fast and easy. The food tasted amazing and the place was so beautiful. Best date place I’ve ever been to

Great spot.  Loved the live music provided by the Eric Miller band. 
My husband ordered the Soaghetti and Meatballs and I ordered the Ling Cod special.  Both were excellent.

The pink door is fabulous in every sense of the word. The ambiance, decor, hidden location, service, and food were beyond my expectations. I visited the pink door on a birthday visit to the city and was highly impressed. The desserts were the highlight! Beautiful presentation and absolutely delicious.

The staff was very nice  they seem to have good work flow. They watched the table well but were not hovering  just observant. Always asked if we were finished before removing items which I really appreciate.  The place is nicely decorated and a fun place for dinner.  We really enjoyed our evening there. It’s a little hard to fine the Pink Door  and really helps to use your gps , doesn’t seem to hurt their business though.  The staff was very helpful with food selection and wine.
Everything about our dinner was fantastic. The food, the service, and the atmosphere was great.

My second time and it was fantastic! The antipasto platter was a meal in itself. The giant scallops were just that and delicious! The Cesar salad with shrimp was incredible! The drinks were excellent a well done rye Manhattan and a house concoction called Winter Wonderland as great. Angel, our server, did a great job in every way and the entire staff was friendly and efficient. One of the best dinners I’ve ever had.

Our dinner party spanned 3 generations from a freshman at USC to his 75 year old grandmother and her two children. Everyone was impressed with the view, ambience and appetizer, dinner and dessert selection. Our server accommodated our requests so that we could arrive on time at the airport. We look forward to returning soon!

We were only in the city for 36 hours and wanted to eat something that would make the trip wonderful. With so many options to choose from, The Pink Door was definitely a winner. When we return to Seattle, we'll be going again!

Chose this spot based on its proximity to the Moore Theater,  and the great reviews. We were NOT disappointed! Food, service, and atmosphere were all terrific! Our only complaint was that it was pouring rain and blowing like crazy! Our reservation was at 4:00 p.m., when they opened for their dinner seating.  We arrived about 10 minutes early, thinking we could wait in the bar or the lobby.  That was not the case.  The door was locked until exactly 4:00, and we had to wait outside in the cold and rain...not even an awning.  Fortunately, our attitudes changed for the better once they opened the door! Great start to a great evening! Definitely a place to return to!

Amazing meal!  Went there for a couples date night. The food was amazing. Although I have dined here before and have my favorites we all tried something a little different and it did not disappoint. The new remodeled space has an amazing view of the water and ferris wheel.  Make reservations well in advance.

The waitress was super nice and made great recommendations. Checked on us just at the right time. Bring us what we need but not super chatty, which I really appreciate.
Food wise, everything was really good. Pasta was creamy but other dishes were on the lighter side. I like that as a Italian restaurant, they have lots of good healthy options other than just pasta (even though the  pasta is super delicious).
Waitress was great offered us a  free glass of proseco to celebrate our anniversary

The Pink Door is a special place.  The space is very interesting, the atmosphere is warm,  the food is great and so is the service.  For all of this, the price is incredibly reasonable.  Our new 'go-to' place in Seattle.
Amazing service!
Amazing as always
Birthday was special

The food was delicious and the waitress was attentive. We got a table close to the window which was very nice since we got a view of the Great Wheel and the water. I had great time celebrating my my mom’s birthday here. I look forward to dining here again.

Outstanding food and service in this lovely dining room overlooking Pike Place Market and Elliott Bay.  Servers are very knowledgeable about the menu. Gluten free pasta and bread are available.  The owner made a point of coming by our table.

Many people thought we were there for the show, but we weren't. It was difficult getting in and past the people waiting in line for show. On top of it, the location was hard to find since there is no sign. Literally just a pink door with a tiny sign of hours of operation. I most likely will never eat there again. Sorry

This was our first time for lunch at The Pink Door - we’d been wanting to go here for quite some time. When we checked in, we were met with a stuffy check-in staff - I’d made a little joke that we almost didn’t find them because the door was more salmon color...wow, not even a fake chuckle, just a glare by 2 of the 3 check in’s..no smiles, no nothing. Then the hostess who seated us made no niceties on the way, but made sure her hair was flipped back numerous times along the way..(gotta look your best, right?)..anyway, something I hate...

We were seated by the window, so thank you for abiding by my window table request. Our server was really nice - she said she was new so that's probably why we were never offered the specials choices, or soup options..that’s OK, it was fun hearing them offered by the server a table over after our meal. I ordered the Cesar salad with crab and the 3 meatballs - all great! A huge Cesar with fresh crab, and the sauce on the meatballs was great! Hubby ordered the kale salad and the chicken sandwich, both of which he dubbed as, “OK”. 

We would return, for sure...nice atmosphere, good seating, not overly noisy, and great view, and the food was good. Don’t expect a warm welcome or anything - more like Vegas when you’re getting seated - hair flipping free of charge!
Amazing! The risotto is a must have. Beautiful ambience

My boyfriend and I came here for our last dinner in Seattle as a romantic date night. We came later in the evening, around 10:30. We were able to be seated immediately. The views in the back room overlooked the waterfront and you could see the Great Wheel. The food was to die for. It was one of the best meals I’ve had in my life. We got the oysters and the toasted garlic bread as appetizers. The oysters were the best I’ve had, the bread was great. I lost my ID during a bar crawl the night before, so I went for the mock-tail which made losing my ID not so bad. I had the Northwest Fish of the Day, which was absolutely delicious. My boyfriend got the bolognese which he said was very good. For dessert, we had the apple turnover (?) which was the perfect way to end our meal. The service was incredible, and we will absolutely be back on our next trip to the city.
Intimate and sexy atmosphere. Food was amazing. Service top noche. I would highly recommend Pink Door, it is worth the hype.
Dinner was delicious! The scallops were to die for and the music was excellent, as well as the service! Never disappointing when we come here.
This restaurant is a Seattle treasure.  Outstanding food and great service.  In the summer it has a deck to die for.
The restaurant has revamped from extraordinary to ordinary. The new section has a decent view, but resembles other restaurants in town. The charm is no longer present and the food portion was minimal

Dinner at The Pink Door is always a fine experience. Our food was delicious and the service by Andrew, our wait person, was perfect -- attentive, informative and caring.
I'd highly recommend the Door to any diner...
Highly recommend. Great experience for a date night.

The pink door is my new favorite restaurant. I had heard nothing but great things and really enjoyed everything about the dining experience. Friendly and responsive waiters, amazing food, entertainment, prices, everything was worth it!!!!!

My husband and I celebrated our one year anniversary at the Pink Door. We love Italian food and I lived in Italy for over 3 years and it was some of the most authentic, delicious Italian food I've had in the US. Our waiter was exceptionally kind and attentive. Thank you to the Pink Door for making our 1st anniversary an extremely romantic and memorable experience.
Great experience for a birthday late dinner

The service frankly was way too slow for my liking, the waitress was exceptionally nice and always pleasant by was like Houdini in that she would just disappear for long stretches of time only reappear and was too damn nice to question her.
The food was absolutely delicious. We had the scallops, which apparently are the very best on the planet. The service was exemplary!

The Pink Door is a local gem. I've been visiting this restaurant for over 20 years. The food, beverages, and service has never seen a decline and each time reminds me why it's one of my very favorite Seattle restaurants.

Best meal I’ve ever had! We had the raw oysters, 2 of their best wines recommended by our server Terrance, the special with squid ink sauce, the famous ciopiono, Gf bread, and sorbet. Excellent seafood, large servings, superb & intelligent server, delicious and unique offerings and we loved the swanky atmosphere of live jazz music. The value was amazing for what you got. Could not ask for more!

My husband and I had dinner here for our one year wedding anniversary. The staff at the front desk weren't particularly friendly, and misplaced my raincoat, but our server was excellent - very attentive, friendly and willing to help us make selections. We were seated at a large table near the window with a view of the waterfront. All of the food was excellent - we had the proscuitto with mozzarella, arancini, seared white fish with vegetables, papardelle with bolognese, boobie cake, and ice cream sampler, and a sparkling rose. Altogether too much food for two, but we were going all out for the occasion. Overall we were very happy with our evening and will be back for date nights in the future.
Great experience. The server was excited for us to enjoy the dining experience. The food was perfect and exceeded expectations.

Thanks for a great meal! We took a business contact to lunch and all went exceptionally well. From the food, special requests and service, everything was top-notch!  I have long been a fan of The Pink Door and you continue to not disappoint.
Had a wonderful time here for my birthday. Tasty food and great service. Plus the restaurant has a wonderful view of Elliott Bay.

Loved the interior and ambiance. Staff were friendly and efficient. Food was very good. 
I really enjoyed the experience.
Had a wonderful time celebrating a friends birthday.  Food and atmosphere were amazing.

I made the reservation via OpenTable and indicated it's for a birthday. We were seated at a half circle booth which is very comfortable.  Overall, they maintain a good distance in space between tables so you don't feel crowded and  the conversations of customers become white noise you won't get bothered at all.
Our waiter, Jasiah, was great! Food was fantastic and the atmosphere is uniquely Seattle. Highly recommend!
He of the most enjoyable and tasty dining experiences that Ine had in Years

The food here was amazing. The lasagna was delicious as well as the scallops. The wine selection was great. They had a live band that was playing calm music. The location is great. Our waitress was perfect. I would go back in a heartbeat

This meal is always the best! I always enjoy eating here the lasagna is the best ever!  The newly renovated ( new to me)  layout allows for much more seating. We enjoyed the bar had pomegranate beverage and  a mix of other alcoholic and nonalcoholic drinks. It was a bit cool with cool air blowing down on our large table in the newer part of restaurant but this place will always be a favorite Starting from when my husband purposed to me at a small table more than 25 years ago.

Having received recommendations from several friends prior to going, The Pink Door did not disappoint. Set in a very pleasant atmosphere we enjoyed several different offerings from the menu. All were absolutely wonderful, and we all agree that this is a place to re-visit when in the area again.

The food was average. Actually a bit disappointed. Overpriced for the quality of the food served . Location and service was terrific . Would not return again if in Seattle . Had much much better quality taste of food

We tried for 3 days to have lunch at the Pink Door!  They were sold out every day!  Finally we lucked out and got four of us in for lunch and we were really happy we did!  What a cool place! Great food great view.  We started with BAGNA CAUDA - which is a “hot bath” of anchovies, garlic & olive oil in which fresh seasonal vegetables are dipped.  Actually - dipping bread in that bubbling oil was even better than the veggies (naughty though!).  My husband had the PHEASANT TORTELLINI IN BRODO, classic housemade pasta in a rich bone broth.  Portion was a little on the small side and he polished it off quickly but it was really good.  My son and I both had RISOTTO with  preserved truffles, wild and domestic mushrooms, farm fresh raw egg yolk, parmigiano-reggiano cheese.  It was excellent. Creamy and rich and so full of flavor.  My other son had PAPPARDELLE AL RAGÙ BOLOGNESE - with slow simmered meat sauce, fresh pasta. He loved it.  We had a great lunch and will definitely go back next trip to Seattle!

This is the first time I’ve been to the Pink Door since they opened the new space that faces west overlooking the market.  The new space is bright with a great view of the market which complements the darker room at the front of the restaurant.  The food was very good as usual.  I had the kale salad which was carefully prepared with finely chopped kale, raisins, and nuts, with a side of chicken.  My friend had a Caesar salad with shrimp that he complimented.  The service was friendly and attentive.  A great location that’s added to its appeal by adding additional space.

As always pink door never disappoint me with delicious food and classy cocktail menu!
Great place to take anyone who visit Seattle!

Sorry to say; Not The Pink Door of old, it's had a face lift and with it went everything that made it so funky and unique. Still good food, but lost its flair, now it falls in line with a lot of other bland "fine dining" restaurants. The bar is now full of cloned millinnials, I wouldn't go back until they put the fun back in funky.
Absolutely loved it!
The Scallops were excellent, but the sauce flavor for the Bollanese less enjoyable. Other than that, everything was great.

We love the Pink Door and I've been a regular for over 18 years after moving to Seattle to attend University of Washington. This was our families first time back since having children & we were excited to share our love of this restaurant with our 4 & 5 year old. We couldn't think of a better restaurant to celebrate the holiday season in downtown Seattle. The new dining room along with the amazing staff & of course food exceeded all of our expectations. What an amazing night that we look forward to making a tradition every holiday.

I have been to the Pink Door several times for teas or just meeting friends at the bar, but this was the first time I went to actually dine for dinner. It was fantastic and the wait person was top notch!

Though I've been to Pink Door at least 70 or 80 times, this was my first visit after the renovation done in early 2017. Yes, it's changed but is still wonderful. Friends and I have an annual long-lunch at Pink Door over the holidays, and this meal matched those of the past. Great drinks, great food, great service. The main change (as I could see from one visit at least) is that there are four different ways to enjoy the Pink Door: fancy-ish (in the large dining room with the gorgeous view), casual (in the old dining room, still cosy & funky), in the bar (larger and with some views of food-prep), and on the deck (too cold in winter but looks the same as in the past). I think the renovation only adds good things to the Pink Door--and I'm quite relieved for it...though I do miss having to get The Code for the, ahem, facilities. That fun in-the-know experience is replaced with clean & large toilets, easily accessible in-house. That's okay too. I'm really looking forward to our next visit there.
Delicious food!  We ordered the oysters, mussels n clams, and meatballs.
Went there to celebrate a promotion. The food was great and so was the service. Nice ambiance for date night! Highly recommend!
Very nice restaurant and perfect to add to a day at Pike Place Market and the Waterfront.  New addition to the restaurant was very well done and adds to the already great ambiance.

From the moment I stepped into the door, I was greeted with wonderful service and alternative, relaxed vibes. The food I ordered was great and I enjoyed it thoroughly. The only complaint I have are the waiting area for minors, there was not much of a choice where to sit except a small waiting area that was uncomfortable and full. Other than that, the visit to the pink door was very pleasurable.

Perfect birthday late lunch with my husband and adult son.  Love the decor.  Funky, elegant, and  sophisticated as only Seattle can do it.  Delightful food with a variety of price points.  Thank you so much for the very special Christmas time birthday memories.

I had only dined outside in the summer until my most recent visit for our xmas celebration, with just four employees.  Amazing ambience in the newly renovated dining area overlooking the water and market!  I highly recommend.
Fabulous as always - one of our favorite "date night" locations in the city. And the new dining room is FAB!
Love the new remodel. Food is fabulous. My go to place when I want lasagna. Killer!!! Portion size is perfect, generous but not gluttonous. Love this restaurant.

What a great place.  The food, service, and ambiance was excellent.   Good meatballs! The view was nice in the dining room and the Ariel artist performed three times with three different shows.  It was very fun!
Thomas was an amazing server. Personable and made the experience for us. Food is great and the new space WOW

Eveything is so good at this restaurant. I cannot ask for anything. My only wish is that they have black ink pasta available during winter.

A hig shout out to Jasiah!  He is an excellent server who knows the menu by heart.

This was our second time at the Pink Door, and this time was even better than the first. Our table in the back room was private and had a great view. The food was exceptional, and we would recommend it to friends.

One of the highest quality dining experiences I've had in Seattle - and I'm a native!  The ambiance is warm, the wait staff very friendly, and the food is very high quality.  To top it all off, the prices are reasonable.  It's the kind of restaurant that just makes me happy.
I recommend Pink Door without reservation - although make sure to make your reservation well in advance.  The place is deservedly extremely popular.

Fun eclectic atmosphere with excellent Italian food.
My husband had the oysters on the half shell, sausage pasta and side salad and I had a Caesar salad and Pumpkin pasta...all delish!
The cocktails were inventive and tasty.
The dessert we ordered [plum cake] was so-so but maybe it just wasn't our thing.
Witnessed a young couple getting engaged and the whole restaurant exploded in applause and cheering!
We attended for a late night meal (9:15 reservation) for a birthday.  We ate, drank and enjoyed a wonderful chocolate cake in a kind of magical setting.
Absolutely amazing food!! Great service and atmosphere! Wonderful experience!
Everything about the whole experience was great, from the interior and the music to the service and food itself!

We had an absolutely delightful time dining at The Pink Door. The atmosphere was beautiful, intimate, and charming - not to mention, the aerial artist performances were captivating! Food was delicious, service excellent. Would be an wonderful spot for a special treat or occasion.

I can't recommend The Pink Door highly enough! Fantastic in every way! The newly remodeled space is such a nice warm cozy atmosphere to dine in. Service is always wonderful, and the signature dish of their lasagne will ruin you for all others. You will need a reservation so make it well in advance of when you want to visit. We live 2 hours away and visit every chance we can. 5 stars!
A fabulous location with great ambiance and wonderful food!
Still my fave Italian in all of Seattle. Never disappoints.
Fabulous food!
Had a wonderful evening. Staff was warm and friendly.
The Pink Door was FABULOUS! By far my favorite place in Seattle so far. I will always try to come back to this restaurant..... service was awesome too!!!!!!

Very knowledgeable server.  Excellent food.
The remodel opened up the space quite well - more seating plus more room between tables.
I've been coming here for almost 15 years, and I am always pleased.
Good good and lovely facilty.

I usually get to the Pink Door once a year when I'm visiting Seattle. Every dish I have ordered has been cooked to perfection. I love the recent remodel/expansion however I do miss the small space they had with the fountain in the middle.

Lovely evening in beautiful atmosphere.  Our meal was delicious & waiter went above & beyond to make our dinner a fun experience.
View cant be beat!!!

The dish we ate was delicious (pasta with pumpkin and leeks) though the serving amount is small. The decor and the lighting are fantastic but it was near impossible to hear each other over all the noise. We were seated in the dining room, which is lovely, but the seats are too close together and we opted out of dessert because we couldn’t handle the noise level. Maybe lunch or going for an early dinner would be better.
fantastic food and really great menu selection.  The service was wonderful without being overbearing, really nice staff.  The views were beautiful, would totally dine here again.
Love The Pink Door! It’s a Seattle classic and one of my favorites.
Great food, great service, lovely table for two next to the window with a view of Pike Place and Puget Sound in the back corner of the restaurant
Great food, lovely ambiance, and Jake made our dinner super fun.

I always have a good time here.  The food is great and the new atmosphere is still good.  I think I prefer how it was before but that might be me just being a old stubborn guy. 

Highly recommend for whatever occasion.  

My friend who I took for lunch said to mention that the door is "peach" and not "pink."  He seemed very serious about this.

The Pink Door gives you lovely Italianate decor inside and the beautiful Seattle waterfront outside. Service is attentive and professional.  We had an excellent and well priced bottle of Italian red with our pasta. Salads and bread were perfect accompaniments. We’ll come again anytime we want to impress our guests or spoil ourselves.
The meal was amazing. The view was amazing. Everything was amazing. I will be coming back every time I am in Seattle!
Our waiter Joseph was outstanding!!!  I just love the atmosphere here!!  Will visit every time I’m in Seattle!!
Pink door is consistently one of the best restaurants in the city!

This restaurant was absolutely beautiful. The decor and the ambiance made for a romantic dinner date. The food was great! The atmosphere of the Pink Door definitely made the experience memorable. The restaurant is a little hard to find for those who are new to the city- a pink door in an alley which leads you into the restaurant. Definitely unique! The drinks were decent, but definitely creative.
Waiter that looks like Freddie Mercury is the AMAZING! Great service :)
Food was different then your normal Italian, but was so delicious. Wait staff was super friendly and very informative. It’s a must see if you are in Seattle

Whenever we come to Seattle we try to eat at the Pink Door.  It is a special place for us.  And this past visit didn't disappoint.  We happened to visit on their anniversary and we were greeted with complimentary sparkling wine.  Nice!  We started with mushroom crostinis and then on to a NW regional salad.  Nice light dressing /w the salad.  The vegetarian lasagna was great!  Rich!  And the pappardelle bolognese was lovely.  Great food.  Wonderful service!

Pink Door has always been a favorite. Now that they have expanded it is even better. I went for lunch with friends and everyone enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Thanks Pink Door for making our fab even better

Ambiance - 10

Service- 10

Food - 8

The ambiance and service was excellent.

Even had a live band trio playing in the background.

I had a local porter on tap.

We ordered the smoked tuna appetizer salad.

For dinner we ordered the lamb shank and the linguine with clams.

The food was good, but nothing screamed I have to run back here and eat next week.

The highlight of my meal was the owners house blended special olive oil served with a fresh local bakery bread.

It had amazing flavors!

The food wasn't bad, it just didn't "wow"  me for all the hype we had heard.

I'll go back and order 2  different things next time.

One of the best Italian food ever! Was perfect and waiter was great! Came from Nashville for Fun trip and this was one of the best meals we had while there! Cheese board was excellent and the rosemary crackers to die for 😊

The Pink Door has been a perennial favorite of ours. We hadn't been for quite a long time and "rediscovered" it in the last few months. We've been back several times since then. The food is outstanding. Try the cheese plate. The prosciutto and mozzarella starter is also scrumptious. Service was excellent. Ask for Elyse. Great with suggestions, watched over us without being obtrusive, checked back on us several times and was efficient too. I recommend making reservations. While it's worth the wait - truly it is - why wait when you don't have to. And, definitely dine here during the summer months. The patio is "the" place to be...warm summer day...beautiful blue skies...the Puget Sound as your view.

It was our first time in Seattle and was not disappointed with the Pink Door.  It is a little hard to find, but The Pink Door actually has a pink door.  We looked for it when we were exploring Pike Place Market.  Nice wine list.  None rushed atmosphere.

This is such an amazing find, and I do mean find. Part of the attraction of this restaurant is how fun it is to locate. No sign, you must look for the pink door. The service was great, the food was creative and top notch. Will definitely make it a “must” when we visit Seattle again.
Awesome venue with terrific food and terrific service
Lovely ambiance, delicious food and outstanding service! Special night out with my daughters, perfect place for pre-theatre meal.

We got engaged at this restaurant and celebrated our one year engagement anniversary. They provided us glasses of champagne on the house to celebrate our occasion. The staff is very friendly and charismatic. The only downside is the portions are very small for the price. Other than that food was excellent tasting and presented well.

We had a wonderful time at Pink Door. The food was amazing, our server was lovely, and the restaurant itself was clean, cute, and boasts a great view. We absolutely want to come back for dinner and a show!
The food was great and the service was stellar. It was a lovely lunch, we enjoyed it very much.
Beautiful meal in a beautiful setting with great service.
Love the decor and live music.  Food is yummy especially the white clam pasta!!!
Finally got to try this place ! If you are in Seattle make reservations for this place ! It is by Pike Place Market and very easy to get to.
Great dining experience. Enjoyed the view from back room.
Beautiful restaurant. Great food. Friendly customer service.

I’m the granddaughter of four Italian immigrants. My Italian grandmothers’ cooking and my mother’s will always be to me - the best of a lifetime. That said, The Pink Door’s lasagna was excellent- paper thin spinach pasta and fresh marinara.

We made a reservation on open table to have lunch at this restaurant while we were visiting pike place market where we fell in love 36 years ago.  This visit was part of our 35th wedding anniversary celebration.  The rude host assured us there was no table near a window, sat us at the bar.  When we got up to find someone else to speak with, they quickly seated us appropriately and went out of their way to make it a lovely meal.  Unfortunately, the arrogant rudeness of the young bleached blonde host sticks with me.

Fantastic cozy ambience looking out the windows to see the ferris wheel and downtown lights.  The food and service at The Pink Door are what keep me coming back year after year, and I loved seeing their remodel with more open space and views.  This is the restaurant I recommend to out of towners again and again!

We really enjoyed our dinner at Pink Door. The menu was creative, but simple at the same time. Everything we had was perfectly cooked and very tasty. Our server was friendly and informative and the atmosphere was comfortable and we had a beautiful seat by the window overlooking the market. Will be back!
Great food and service!

Quite disappointed that we didn't see the burlesque show during our lunch, we booked our reservation for our birthday lunch so we were pretty excited to get a show with it. After the fact we saw (after literally having to search for it) that it's only at dinner time Friday & Saturday nights which is understanding but I don't think a burlesque show should be part of the restaurants primary description if it's not happening all the time. Our server was kind, seemed a little rushed even though it wasn't really that busy - he could have had a bigger section and we weren't aware. That's fine. My friend and I have worked in the industry so we don't get upset by it. I was also thrown off at how fast the spaghetti & meatballs came out...suspiciously fast which of course made me pay too much attention at how hot it was and the sauce seemed almost separated from itself..microwaved? I hope not for that much money. The garlic bread was AMAZING though!!! A good peppery background spice with all those yummy oils. I would suggest somebody go if you're scheduling during the burlesque show so you get your monies worth in entertainment.

My birthday was really special and unforgettable! Our table had a beautiful view from Seattle's ferris wheel, the service was impeccable and the staff had a nice little cake with a candle to celebrate my birthday. The food was delicious and the jazz band playing that night was sensational! Thank you for a perfect celebration!
Birthday celebration. This venue is an old favorite and still lives up to its festive reputation. We love it!

We had an amazing time at The Pink Door. It was our one year anniversary and we had an incredibly special evening.  The food and drinks were both amazing.  If I was to try to come up with one recommendation I would say dim the lights a little at night. That would create a little more of the romantic feel you already have there.  But otherwise could not have been better.

It was fabulous! The perfect get together spot for dining with an out of town friend.
They were flexible with our special needs and really gave us the royal treatment. The view was fabulous. I hadn't been there since the remodel and it was impressive! Still cozy but spacious and lovely decor!
The staff is wonderful and caring and helpful!
Love it!
All around excellent. Spinach lasagne was the best.
Great dining experience! xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Excellent reservation system and service, great menu. Super ambiance and elegant dining-room, is all there for you at affordable prices.
Great food with lots of Gluten Free Options - one of my favorite spots in seattle
Had an excellent evening here, first time and won't be the last. Great atmosphere and food.
Incredible view with the new space; the cheese plate, salad, drinks & oysters were superb!

The bar is great. The food is simple, well-executed Italian favorites. The view out over the Seattle piers is really nice. The wait staff is friendly and accommodating (though maybe a little less attentive than we would have liked). Overall, this place is worth the trip. Get reservations. Make them well in advance. You won't get in otherwise.
Probably my favorite Seattle restaurant. Great food, great ambiance, great service. Terrence is a stellar server.

Spent a Saturday date night here- had gotten reservations well in advance.  The ambiance was lovely, warm and inviting.  Our waiter was pleasant, but not exactly super interactive or forthcoming with recommendations.  The beet salad was so-so, the drinks were quite good, and the risotto was great.  The dessert cheesecake was decent as well.  Overall a "pretty good" meal in a beautiful setting.

Very glad we decided to try this place. We were in town from Dallas and wanted to try some god Italian food with live music. We heard reviews about the burlesque show and wanted to see that. Unfortunately, it’s only on Saturday nights and we dined on a Friday. That didn’t hamper our thoughts on the place. A must stop if visiting like we were!
Amazing food and service.
Our server was fantastic and the food was excellent
Best friends were in town. One was gluten free and they were incredibly accommodating!
Service was amazing. They sat us next to the window so my grandmother could look out at the water. Truly a special experience
It's always special and fun to have dinner at The Pink Door.   Excellent food and hip classy.

Great place to grab lunch in the city. Fresh food with amazing taste profiles. There is a wonderful  water view if you sit in the front dining room.  Service was very good; friendly but not overdone. Not inexpensive , but very worth the money.   I would come here any time I’m in Seattle.
We had a great window table in the new section of the restaurant &  were thrilled with the new look of the Pink Door.  The food & service were excellent; looking forward to our next visit!
We had guests from out of town and we took them here. The suggestions by our sever were excellent. Food was beyond amazing. Definitely one of Seattle's best. We always have a great experience here.
Such a cool atmosphere and amazing food. Loved the actual pink door entrance that is kind of hidden. Totally recommend !
I've been going to the Pink Door for at least 5 years.  I have never been disappointed.  Always great food, service and fun!
Excellent as usual
I have dined here for years. Continues to be a fabulous place. Great food and wonderful ambiance. Service is very good and so friendly. I like the quirky location and decor.

Wanted to try forever and was able to get a reservation for four, then upped it to six the day of. Couldn’t believe they’d accommodate that. Food was fantastic. Service was even better, Thank you Thomas for being so kind and helpful. My fiancé wants you to be our best friend! And the ambiance, decor, vibe was just incredible. What’s truly remarkable is I went in with the HIGHEST of expectations and soon realized I had sold myself short with them. It was so much better than we had hoped and we had expected perfection. Couldn’t be more thrilled and can’t wait to go back.
Our server Amanda was outstanding.  The food was excellent.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
Loved this place and am so glad we went here while on our vacation! The food did not disappoint and the place is so pretty!
Always love this place! Great food, views and service.
The Pink Door perfectly balances elegance with comfort, gourmet food with friendly service, tourist epicenter with a languidly relaxed pace....best dining we have experienced in Seattle!
My ciopinno was  so delicious.   The pastas were perfectly cooked as well.   Excellent service, ambient and good food.   Wha t else you can ask for?

Our server Amando was amazing. She had great knowledge with wine list and made wonderful pairing with our meals. The place is super cute and the food was amazing. Will be back next time we are in town.

The Pink Door is like being inside a treasure box, it is so beautiful and eclectic and romantic.  I didn't want to leave.  The food is delicious, and the staff efficient, conversational and attentive.  I can't wait to be in Seattle again to renew the experience.

We came here to celebrate our first year Anniversary, it had come highly recommended. We live in San Diego That has a vast array of dining, we LOVED everything about Pink Door! The ambience, friendly and informative staff (wish we could remember our waiters name, he was a gem from Orange County originally) the drinks, food, dessert, everything was perfect! Thank you, we will be back! 

Must try the paparadelle bolgonese and charred garlic bread with olive oil!
Wonderful food,superb service and a gorgeous view.What a treat!
Loved it. Stopped in for lunch on a cold rainy day.  Cozy, with a great view. Very friendly and efficient service and excellent food.
What a lovely place on all fronts! Yummy food, great ambiance.
Went to the Pink Door for our 21st anniversary and had the best time. The meal was great, ambiance was festive and the waitstaff was so good. We will be back soon.
Fantastic local gem. Highly recommended!
This is a very interesting restaurant serving quality Italian food in a pleasant atmosphere. The service we received was outstanding. Finding the restaurant is half the fun!!
Great little gem, restaurant is very cozy, I love the ambiance, amazing food, waiters very friendly and accommodating, they also have shows and live preference for extra cost.
Pink Door last coed up to its reputation- loved it! The atmosphere is exciting and food delicious.  And the view!
Amazing food, drinks, and service. I would highly recommend for a special date night or a culinary treat. Be sure to make a reservation at least a week or two in advance, it's that popular.

My husband and I got lunch here around 2pm. We chose the patio as it was a sunny day. All the sun was landing right into my eye as some patio tables face directly to pike place. Food was ok but I was definitely in a hurry to finish as it was very hot. We got the lasagna (recommend) and the linguine with mussels (husband said it had too many mussels and not enough linguine)

Starting with the service and ending with dessert, this is one of the best restaurants I've dined. Our waiter was terrific; great sense of humor and excellent recommendations.  We started with the oysters which were fresh and flavorful. I had the cioppino and was not disappointed. It was ridiculously delicious.  The best I've ever eaten. My daughter had the muscles and clams in white wine sauce. She was in heaven. Although full, we knew we had to taste the dessert.  I ordered the ricotta cheese cake on the waiter's recommendation, and my daughter ordered the trio of ice creams. Again, just perfection. We are adding The Pink Door to our list of absolute favorites.

This is our go-to place for special occasions. The food is really spectacular. We love the cheese board and delicious pastas. And inventive cocktails too. Love the water view from the back room of the restaurant, but then you miss the aerial artist in the front room! Have been on multiple occasions and food has been consistently good. Is romantic and lends itself to quiet conversation if not a live music night. Get reservations early - hard to get sometimes.

I was visiting Seattle and had multiple people recommend The Pink Door as a fantastic eatery, and they were right!  The environment was cool--eclectic but not kitschy and just fun decor.  The service was fantastic--knowledgeable, made great suggestions, prompt but never over eager.  The food was perfect--the cheese platter was sublime!  My wife had the halibut and i enjoyed the double cut porkchop.  Both dishes were prepared expertly.  I was extremely impressed and will try to visit next time I'm in Seattle!
Celebrated my birthday there. My boyfriend and I loved it. From the view. To the drinks. To the food. Everything was awesome
Was treated like a queen for my birthday.  Great food, service and atmosphere!
We were in visiting from Tucson..we had a great dinner and evening at the Pink Door.  There was delicious food for both myself (vegetarian) and my significant other (gluten free).

I'd been there once before and was looking for a good place to gather with old friends. The other 3 had never been before. We were all blown away. The food, the atmosphere, the view and the staff were excellent. My 3 guests from Tacoma promised to return. As do I😏
New room in the back faces the sound and the wheel. Beautiful and spacious!

I Love coming to the Pink Door, their Lasagna is fantastic, they have a very nice selection of wines to choose from as well as specialty drinks.  The atmosphere is great and the noise level still allows for conversation. We will definitely come back for another meal.
Great Italian food,  Is a must if you are visiting Seattle.

This is me and my wife's new go to date night spot.   Wonderful service, fun atmosphere with great people watching options, and the food is just amazing.   This is in my top 5 all time for dining out, if not #1.

We totally enjoyed our first experience at The Pink Door. They were fairly busy, but the service was still amazing. We will definitely be going back, and have already raved about it to many of our friends.

Outstanding as always. The remodel is spectacular affording the same wonderful view of Puget Sound from the indoor tables that was previously only seen from the terrace.  And the food remains superb. It's one of our favorite places in Seattle.

Traveled from Texas all day. Lively atmosphere; great service from the moment we were welcomed. Hard to find at first. It’s literally just a pink door in an alley. Had reservations later in the evening but we ended up going earlier. They were very accommodating to the change in our schedule.  Looks like they have live entertainment each night which I wish we got to see. Food was good, but not a huge menu. Large wine list, though we enjoyed a seasonal brown ale. Over all we enjoyed our first meal in Seattle.
Dependably excellent. Staff is attentive and exceptionally knowledgeable. Italian choices fill most of the menu. Good seafood options.
Staff was fantastic, informative, friendly and helpful. Food was great. Good choice of background music ( we’ll call it funky Italian). Great view

I wasn’t sure about a business lunch at the Pink Door with east coast associates I had not yet met, but our conservative group enjoyed the creative and unique atmosphere. The food was delicious and beautifully presented, our waiter gracious and attentive yet quirky like the interior. Successful and fun lunch.

I loved the ambience of this place. It’s one of the best restaraunt I have been to. Our server was very polite and prompt. The Tuscan fries and lasagna was great. As well as for dessert we ordered a cabaret cake which tasted awesome. Only downside was the garlic bread which didn’t seem fresh and was hard to chew. The place has been designed quite creatively and fact that you have to enter through an almost easy to miss pink door adds to excitement for the place. I just wish the garlic bread was better and I could have given it 5 stars on food as well. Would definitely eat here next time I am in Seattle

We were in Seattle for the day. I very much recomend making a reservation, because it seems to be a neighborhood favorite. I dont know if there is an elevator but here are stairs up and stairs down to get in and out. The Staff was eclectic, friendly, and on point with knowlege of the menu and how the chefs were making our meal. Food was delicious and presented to us beautifully. I highly recommend "The Pink Door" for an interesting and special affordable meal.
I had found this restaurant while looking on yelp and I was not disappointed. The pink door has a great atmosphere and delicious food. It was the perfect date spot!
Very tasty Italian food. Hard to find the entrance though as it's just a peach coloured door in the alley with no signage. Make a reservation.

Fantastic food, great drinks, the ambiance is a great balance between lively and romantic. They seated us at an amazing table by the windows. If we're in Seattle again, this restaurant will be my first choice.

Had dinner with some girl friends. We enjoyed great food and great conversation. We were seated at a really nice window table in the newly remodeled back room. It was really lovely. I’d dined outdoors on the patio a couple of other times and loved that too. Great restaurant.
Birthday lunch with my daughter - Beautiful place! Waiter wasn’t very friendly but Food was delicious.

We have been visiting Seattle for years and have always wanted to try the Pink Door.  We were so excited to finally have that chance!  There were 4 of us and it was a Friday night. The place was hopping but we didn't wait more than 5 minutes for our table.  We had a GREAT table in the back room with the waterfront views. STUNNING.  My hubby and I split the lasagna and it was THE best I have ever had!!! It was different though..not your typical red sauce, ground beef/sausage dish. It was amazing!  Our drinks were great as well. The service was timely and server was friendly. It is not a low dollar menu but worth the money!
Not true italian food
Anniversary dinner. First time to Pink Door. Outstanding dinner, delicious steak and linguini. They even surprised us with a glass of prosecco upon our arrival. Well done Pink Door! We will be back!
Everything was awesome and View is amazing! Our server David was knowledgeable, fun, and attentive. Perfect place, food, and service!!

We were visiting Seattle, a former resident suggested it. We were very pleased, sat at a window table overlooking the Pike St. Marker, Wheel and harbor. Food and wine were reasonable, service was professional, we were sat on time. Flavors and portions were great.
Everything was fantastically delicious and we got a lovely table at the window for our anniversary.

Took my girlfriend for our 1 year anniversary, initially walking in was pretty breathtaking, it is a beautiful venue. The food was nice, I ordered prime rib offered seasonally and the peppers brought a really nice flavor to the meat.
This is the best italian restaurant in Seattle. It is luxurious and quite. Nice food with great view of the Pike Place Market and Puget Sound. I will bring my wife here every anniversary.

I started with the Kale salad which was nutty and fresh. I then had the cioppino and it was full of seafood that was fresh and the broth was light and had just the right spice to tantalize my taste buds. The food was exceptional. From the moment we walked through the door I felt like the most important person in the restaurant from the person that sat us down to the waitress who seemed genuine and knew everything about the menu.  You all made our day. We will return.

Thanks you
Bryon

We hadn't seen the remodel and were concerned that the eclectic decor was gone but it looks better than ever! Our lunch was excellent.
Will return for one of the music nights!

It was my 60th birthday. Wow what an amazing experience. We heard this was a nice place… But it was over-the-top wonderful The food was absolutely amazing !!
 truly we both enjoyed ourselves so much. Our waiter was engaging, funny knowledgeable attentive… You name it. The vintage chic of that place was beautiful, the energy really fun
.
The only bad thing is we were sitting right near an  air conditioner. apparently there was a remodel… They were so attentive and made sure they turned it down and were comfortable. 

wonderful wonderful wonderful
Always a delight to come to the restaurant.  Food, service and so far the view seating has been wonderful!  Keep up the standard :)
Amazing! Stay for the show
Always the best! Amazing pasta and great service, highly recommend
Wonderful meal of braised rabbit and a window seat looking out over the action at Pike Place.  I'd gladly visit this restaurant whenever I'm in Seattle.
Our first visit since they expanded. Food and service continued to be excellent. We will go again when we are in Seattle
Creative menu, fun cocktails and a lovely view. Great dining experience!

After reading the glowing reviews, and having to wait for a reservation, I was looking forward to an amazing experience. The antipasto was excellent, but the pasta was nothing out of ordinary. Our waiter seemed as though he wanted to be doing something else. I won’t be going back any time soon.
Been eating well there since 1982!

Amazing dinner!!!! Wonderful ambiance. Treated my wife excellent for her 30th bday. Live music felt like we were in the 20’s. 😍 Best place in the 5 times visiting Seattle we’ve ever dined at! Highly recommend!!!

Just walking in the door I could tell it was going to be a great dinner. The live jazz like music was perfect. My sister, friend and I were out for my last night of visiting them. Dinner was delicious, especially the bolognese and the caramel budino was the perfect ending! Loved it and would definitely go again.

Problem: My first experience was amazing. My second fell short. There. End of review. 

The first time I came here was January 2016. Since then I've been wanting to come back. Pink Door had perfectly cooked prawns (unlike most restaurants in CA that overlooked theirs). Service and ambiance were amazing. We used to make jokes and say things like "I would sacrifice eating my mom's food. IF I COULD HAVE PINK DOOR." That's how much we liked it.

For my friend's birthday (and first time to Seattle), we took her there. No hesitation. There was no wait. The host said "Happy birthday!" However, we were in and out within 45 minutes, which is unfortunate because the live music was beautiful. Their ambiance is perfect.

The prawns were a bit overlooked this time. Sad. Service was okay. Have you ever experienced good service, but felt like it was lacking because it didn't seem genuine? That is the best way I can describe the experience. The gentlemen refilling our water did their job. I always had water. The gentleman taking care of us was courteous and polite. But he didn't go above and beyond. 

When making the reservation, I requested a complimentary treat - if available. We ended up not getting anything. I wish they would've reached out to say "Hey, we don't provide any complimentary desserts. However, you can purchase a slice of cake for $10." Something like that. But that didn't happen. That night I saw a couple tables with deserts and a candle, and felt bad that my friend didn't get one. A big bummer.

I had an incredible time at the Pink Door. It was a unique menu, space and environment and perfect for our anniversary. The service was complimentary and attentive and I will definitely be returning. The lasagna was rich but not so rich that I couldn't finish the whole thing!

We had really looked forward to returning to the Pink Door as we had not been there in a while and had always had a positive experience.  We explained to our waiter that we wanted an unhurried evening.  We even asked that we would delay ordering our entre to be sure of a leisurely pace.  He assured us that it would not be a problem so we ordered all at once.  We had not finished our salad and appetizers when he began whisking away our plates.  When we objected he took back the entrees and said he would have the kitchen make new dishes when we were ready. To say the least we were disturbed and disappointed.  The food was delicious but our enjoyment had been marred by the poor timing.

I have severe allergies to peanuts, tree nuts and a few other foods. The server and restaurant could not have been more accommodating and understanding. The ambiance was amazing. We sat on the porch and had a bottle of Rose along with the most incredible lunch. We will definitely go back.

It was really awesome place for me. 
Even the exterior is so cute and lovely, the inside is so classic. 
Food was also so delicious.
My wife and I really enjoyed an amazing lunch at Pink Door. All the recommendations from our server were outstanding. I highly recommend Pink Door, it's a must visit if you're in Seattle.

The Pink Door never disappoints.  On top of the best lasagna in the world their daily fish specials,  scrumptious salads and pasta dishes are always wonderful, beautifully served and incredibly tasty.  It doesn't get any better than sitting on their deck on a beautiful day in Seattle.  The beautiful new addition with a light filled room and not having to get a code and walk down the hall to the bathroom just make the Pink Door even better.  One of my absolute favorite places in Seattle.  I love taking out of town friends there.  Good job Jackie Roberts!
Barbara Ross

Newly-remodeled and even better. Bar area more open and inclusive. The added dining area is spacious and comfortable, however late afternoon sun was brutal until they closed the blinds. Not a big deal. 

Service was its usual good quality. Food, as always, great and interesting. Had the pasta with clams and mussels. Awesome. 

Was worried the remodel would cause the restaurant to lose its personality, but not the case. In fact, enhanced it. The Pink Door remains one of my favorite Seattle landmarks. Well done.
Fabulous! love the additional room, Service Excellent!
Was vacationing in Seattle and found this place by chance. The food was excellent, view was better and the craft cocktail was delicious.
Love this Seattle favorite; great food, knowledgeable & friendly servers, pleasant atmosphere- always an enjoyable meal here.
I really enjoyed the food! And the waiter was fantastic! It really made my anniversary lunch with my wife special and wonderful

Always have exceptional experience when we visit Seattle yearly at the Pink Door
This last visit was just so special.
We got our favorite server, Terrance, and we were on the patio in the evening
The organic tomatoes were like nothing we had ever experienced. Very ripe, juicy and so flavorful. Cheese, basil and olive oil also outstanding.
The Parpadelle Bolonese just outstanding
Just an awesome dinner
Hopefully, on our next visit, the long rib entree will be available
Pink door never disappoints!  Great food, great service and great atmosphere. Love, love, the patio and view!
love the 'tucked-away in the Market' location....feels like a 'secret';   -terrace has  a wonderful Sound view on a sunny day, inside is cozy atmosphere @night

First time visit and I love the Pink Door!
The lasagna was perfect, the service was excellent, and the table on the deck had a special Elliott Bay view.
I was the first of many visits to come!!!
Fantastic food and wonderful surroundings.  The servers are very attentive and knowledgeable.

Anniversary Dinner.  Newly remodeled, with more dining area and a view at the back of the restaurant.  Food was excellent and the service friendly and prompt.  There was live music in the lounge/bar area.  One of my favorite spots in Seattle.
Pink Door is a Seattle favorite - and on a beautiful September night - the patio was lovely and the food, cocktails and and service was outstanding.

We went for my 26th birthday and it was beautiful! I ordered the squid ink pasta dish which was seriously one of the best meals I've ever had! We sat outside and got to see the sunset  and the sound in the background while eating our dinner. The inside of the restaurant is charming and fun! Loved the huge Angels on the way to the bathroom! I will definitely be going back again!
It’s amazing food and service
We were there for my wife’s birthday and they were very accommodating, and made sure my wife had an awesome dinner experience.
Met friends for lunch. Service was excellent, food was delicious and beautifully prepared and the remodeled dining room is open and light-filled. I'll be back soon.

Coming from out of town this was one of the first places that was recommended for dining in. It was the perfect place for us to have dinner before going to a show. We LOVED the food and the wine was absolutely divine! The lasagna is one of their signature dishes and it seriously doesn't dissapoint! If you like sweet white wine definitely try the moscato d'asti as it is one of best we've ever had.
Very pleasant outdoor seating area.

Pretty good food, nothing that wowed me though and I don't understand the rave reviews. Our first server was very rude and I almost left. The second server was much better. Not sure if I'd return. It wasn't very memorable
Great value considering the location and quality of the food.
Awesome lunch. Great view, and the service was the best.
Server gave us excellent service & recommendation!!

We only have a few restaurants in the Seattle area 
that are our favorites .... this is one of them
Ambiance galore ... excellent service .... great food
A fun venue with great service and a variety of delicious food & drink options!

El lugar resultó ser muy divertido, fuimos en nuestras vacaciones en Seattle, está en el sector del Pike Market, y tiene el mismo estilo, todo muy fresco, el lugar es muy bonito, y los meseros muy amables, con múaica en vivo y una linda ambientación. Tienen además un muy buen Negroni.

When we were in Seattle previously, we went to The Pink Door and loved it. A very different atmosphere and wonderful Italian  food. So when we returned to Seattle, we went back to this restaurant--twice! The Lasagne is one of the best we've ever eaten, and the spaghetti (my favorite pasta), which we had as a half portion appetizer, was cooked a perfect al dente with an amazing sauce. We went back a second time so my husband could get the Halibut, which he had to pass up for the Lasagne on our first visit. He was not disappointed and loved it!  And I had the spaghetti (and meatballs) again since it was so good. I recommend this wonderful restaurant highly! The staff is top quality, the ambiance is amazing, and the food is so good!  The recent renovations to the restaurant have opened up the back room and made it cozy with beautiful huge windows overlooking part of Pike's Market and the waterfront. Be sure to make a reservation!
The food, service, and setting are always amazing at Pink Door. Never disappoints. This is probably my favorite restaurant in Seattle.
The heirloom tomato salad is fabulous! Try it before it goes off the menu for fall!  Our server was tremendous!  Just a wonderful restaurant and new dining room.
First time visit to Seattle on road trip with parents so special treat and occasion. Excellent service and ambience!

With all the diverse dining and cuisine options Seattle offers, Pink Door has always been a favorite. Though I have not been back since before the renovation, it was the same wonderful menu and atmosphere. It was great to see it more opened up and more seating options. However, once a semi-dark, romantic, even maybe tastefully macabre, has turned into a casual, quick bite meal, surrounded by kids. While our food was excellent as always, service was rushed and felt like a really quick turn around. We were only there for a little over an hour from being sat to signing the check. Normally, no big deal, but we were here for a special occasion that ended up just feeling extremely rushed. Not to beat a dead horse, but upon making the reservation, OpenTable asked us if there was a special occasion, which I noted was a 1 year wedding anniversary, went unacknowledged. Overall, not a huge deal, just a bit disappointed that I talked it up so much.
Anyways excellent

Went on the recommendation of my son who'd dined there with his girlfriend a month before. Lived up to the review he gave and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves with Thomas as our waiter. Kudos to all the staff!!

Excellent lasagna.  Cool, funky place.  Great waiter who made food suggestion
that made the experience outstanding.  Friendly, vibrant scene.
Pink Door is such an authentic delight - great food, ambience, and true Seattle place😋

Terrific restaurant. The atmosphere is very eclectic. Told by our waitress that the property used to house an art gallery. Whether you chose to dine indoors, or outside on the deck (the views of Elliott Bay are great), it is a highly recommended dining experience.
Food is excellent! Just a little expensive
Fantastic from start to finish! We were blown away by every dish and are still talking about it 3 days later! Outstanding in every way.
Great little neighbourhood gem.  Finding the Pink Door isn't easy but once inside it makes your evening.  Great food, music and atmosphere.

Halibut was completely overlooked.  We sent it back, which we rarely do, second halibut was just as bad.  Crab risotto was good, but under seasoned.  Band and ambiance was nice.  Recommend drinks and appetizers and then move on.

The Pink Door is a must-visit! The food is delicious, reasonably priced and the atmosphere is great! I would gladly visit time and time again. Service is also top-notch! Highly recommend on all levels. Recommend booking in advance though as this place is very popular!
This was the best Italian food I believe I have ever  had, and the service was exceptional too. I love the ambiance. I would highly recommend to anyone.

Thomas (Tomas - sp) was the best server EVER!! Not just at this restaurant but of ANY place I have been.  He was passionate about the food and provided attentive personal service.  The food and drinks and atmosphere were outstanding but our experience would have not been as memorable without Thomas! Give him a raise or make him an owner... he's the best possible ambassador for your brand!

We usually avoid touristy areas like Pike Place Market but we make an exception for The Pink Door. Stopped first at the bar for two very refreshing, sour cocktails. A French 75 and Lemoncello. Both were cold and refreshing after our long day of touring the piers. 

Started with an amazing bruchetta appetizer that featured fresh tomatoes and basil on a crunchy french bread. The ingredients were all super fresh, locally grown and perfectly matched. Be sure to get this if you go there in the next few weeks (September). Tomatoes just can't stay this perfect for very long.

I had the special, White Salmon. It was absolutely amazing. The light, salmon can be bland but it was married with a subtle cauliflower sauce that brought out the flavors in a creative dish that was perfectly accented with spring peas. We have eaten here many times but this was the best dish yet (of course I say that every time).

My wife enjoyed the black ink pasta. It was full of fresh calamari, musles and shrimp all perfectly brought together with handmade black linguine in a fresh tomato sauce. She loved every bite but I still think mine was better. 

The service their is always good but our waitress was especially friendly and helpful with a beautiful smile. My suggestion is not to hold the touristy neighborhood against this restaurant, everything else about it is great.
Sit on the terrace if weather permits. Peaceful views overlooking the bay. Food was delicious.
Excellent place to dine, friendly waiter and food to die for, I highly recommend.

Having heard rave reviews from friends in Portland,I tried to get reservations for dinner the weekend of 9/8-9/10.Unable to do so I seized on the opportunity to have lunch when we got in to Seattle on Friday.The service and selection were excellent and only exceeded by their taste.My only disappointment was that it was lunch so we were unable to eat and imbibe to the extent I would have at dinner.I would highly  recommend the Pink Door to anyone who appreciates delicious food-but make reservations WELL in advance or you'll be having a great lunch instead of a wonderful dinner!
An enduring Seattle summer tradition for a friend and myself ... lunch on the patio at the Pink Door.  I love this place.
Birthday lunch
never fails to be delicious and exactly what you want
Was recommended by a friend. Food was excellent and nice atmosphere. Would definitely return if ever back in Seattle. A must try!

Food was very good but I was disappointed I couldn't figure out the start time of the entertainment online which was the draw for us while on vacation. We were too early and they were booked later so missed it. That would have made it stand out from other restaurants on our trip.
Fabulous place and we can't wait to return to Seattle!  Our server Gwen was the best!!! Fantastic food
Best Italian food I've ever had!!! Can't wait to be back!! ❤️
