First visit to the newly remodeled space. It was a wonderful evening--and I can't get the Salsa Verde sauce out of my mind!
Ambiance great, new dining room perfect, Tom our waiter,loved. All food yummy, great all around.
We went because the patio is pet-friendly!  The staff were very welcoming. We had a happy, memorable  time!

Lots of atmosphere. We sat out on the waterfront. Service was excellent, friendly and quick. Most of all, the food was delicious. As a tourist in Seattle, this was my favourite restaurant so far! Highly recommended.
Food was excellent, waiter was very knowledgeable and courteous. The decor and atmosphere was great.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. From the wonderful food, the service and the ambiance, to the outdoor dining area and the scenic view, this restaurant is a one-of-a-kind.

 I can't recommend it enough!

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful experience at The Pink Door. We have wanted to try it for months, but we live pretty far and didn't want to risk not getting a table. I finally reserved a table and we are so happy we got to try it. We will definitely recommend this restaurant to friends (even though most people we know already know about it and love it) and come back! Delicious.
The Pink Door is a wonderful gem on the Seattle Waterfront!  Great food, ambiance and service!
Seated at 7pm for our 7 o clock reservation. Nice restaurant and good food. No sign on the establishment.  Look for salmon, not pink, door.

Great location, excellent food and service. One caveat: we went to The Pink Door on the strength of reviews that turned out to have overstated the restaurant's gluten-free friendliness. Their only gluten-free pasta is penne, so no lasagna, unfortunately. That said, the gluten-free penne was outstanding. Al dente, perfect texture, and very tasty. We had one alla bolognese, and another with amazing mushrooms & truffle oil. Also the Udi's garlic bread was wonderful, as was the house salad. I would gladly eat here again and bring friends.

The pink door had a wonderful ambiance inside with live music and candle light, and a fantastic veiw outdoors. The food was lovely especially the dessert. It was a little pricy for the portion size but worth it!
Absolutely loved the place. Great service. Great food. Awesome view!!! Very welcoming restaurant.

I'm struggling with this review because I believe on a different night The Pink Door could be so much better then our rating.  

We were seated on their patio which wasn't the most scenic section of the restaurant.  Our table was on a busy corner traffic area and the people and waiters passing by kept hitting my chair.  Very annoying.  The patio was also extremely noisy.  

Service was very good.  Food was solid.  We chose the Lasagna and Salmon paired with a Nebbiolo wine.  

Now for the struggle with the review...we're thinking if we were inside and dined on a night with entertainment everything would have been much better.  Probably will never know, but we would suggest patrons choose the inside of the restaurant and go on a night/time where they have music or their trapeze act.

The ambiance of this hidden gem is wonderful.  You have several options - lovely outside deck, intimate bar area, bright dining room, and the room with the entertainment above your head.  I say "hidden" because it's hard to find the entrance, if you haven't been here before.  It is not clearly marked.  Literally, look for "The Pink Door".  I had pasta with meatballs and it was delicious.  I'm Italian, so I'm picky about my pasta dishes and this was excellent. The meatballs were rich with Italian spices, but not mushy.  The signature drink was perfect - refreshing, fruity, and tall.  Service was great.

The food was excellent. The staff was very efficient and helpful. 
The outdoor seating was great on a warm day. The desert was really good and we enjoyed passing it around. This restaurant makes you want to come back over and over.
Fabulous!  The remodel is absolutely gorgeous, the service is out of this world amazing.  LOVE, LOVE this very elegant.

My favorite restaurant in Seattle. Great al fresco dining.  Gorgeous view, gorgeous food. and friendly prompt service.  The food is never over done. Each fresh ingredient speaks for itself combined to one harmonious dish.  I order something different every time and have never been disappointed.
Hidden gem wth a great atmosphere and food. We were in town for a friends wedding and heard about the Pink Door by the bride.  The lasagna was deliscious!

Ambiance was terrific, food OK, tableside cocktail not so terrific.  Glass was broken and it appeared they just took my cocktail and pored it into a cheap champagne glass rather than making a fresh drink.   That was disappointing. 

Rice balls were fabulous, highly recommend getting those as an appetizer.

A bit pretentious. Had our 2 teenage kids with us so felt like we were being rushed and no as valued. Truth is our kids ordered dinners worth more the most others so not sure why we get treated less. Very good food but fun if I spend $300 on dinner don't treat me like I don't matter at your restaurant. Tasty but would not return.

Went to this restaurant and so glad we did. We had the Lasagna Pink Door and it was excellent and to die for as the reviews stated. The Squid Ink Spaghetti Al Pescatore was another great decision and not easy to find in restaurants. Service, decor and atmosphere was superb and will be back one day.
Great place...very hard to find. No real sign..just a peach door (not pink) on a side alley
Love it everytime! Out server was amazing!
This was an excellent restaurant from the hospitality to the food! The atmosphere was amazing and I’d recommend this place to anyone visiting Seattle!

The food was salty and the waiter was unhelpful when he was around which was seldom. 
There are better choices in the area than the Pink Door. I would not recommend this establishment.

This is the second time we've been to The Pink Door. The local flavours are especially fantastic. We're from out of town and when we planned this trip decided we needed to go back to The Pink Door.  The staff are great and the location is fantastic. A view from the patio of the harbour is especially wonderful for people from the prairies.

Cool Hidden Spot, large wine list...pretty fancy menu and difficult to read unless you know Italian food. Staff were great, food was relatively quick. Great atmosphere. Probably won't go again, but glad we checked it out.
Great spot for sharing lunch with an out-of-town friend on a sunny summer afternoon in Seattle
Food was too salty, we could not finish our dishes.
Fantastic food for our special night. Sitting out on the deck was perfect as we had a great view of the Seattle Wheel and the water. I would definitely come back for another special occasion
1 year anniversary

I've been here several times & have always had great experiences- this last time was extremely disappointing. So much so, that I will not be back. The waiter was terrible, when I complained (while I was walking out) it seemed to fall on deaf ears. Not to mention that the $200 price tag for a mediocre lunch was excessive.

Love the food as always, but the bartendress with short red hair actually smacked me on the arm to discourage me from taking a no flash photo of the ropes performer. I hadn't seen any signs posted advising patrons to not take photos and there were others doing it so I figured it was ok. Apparently it was not, and in addition to yelling at me across the bar, she reached over and physically hit my arm. This seems excessive and I've never be physically smacked by anyone in the service industry, so this was alarming.
Excellent dinner at the pink door, amazing food and exceptional service! Would go back again

I have reserved a table at this restaurant a month ahead and it was absolutely worth it. Our table was on the patio, which I think is a better choice in the summer at least. The service was excellent, prompt, knowledgeable and courteous. But the best of all was the food. It was just outstanding. And it was reasonable priced. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Difficult to get reservations to this place. I thought the initial service was slow (drink orders), but once we ordered food it was extremely fast. I prefer a more casual pace however. I got the impression they were trying to hustle us out. To me, it seemed a bit touristy and overpriced. My meal was good.
Friendly attentive staff, well crafted drinks and some of the best Italian food in the city. The Pink Door exceeded every expectation.

We were excited to eat here based on reviews we had read & were very disappointed. The atmosphere and location are great and the staff was nice, but the food was mediocre.  Defiantly not worthy of being on of the best rated restaurant in the City if you're even a moderate foodie.
Great food and ambiance enjoyed and highly recommend

So happy to have found the Pink Door! Food was so good & the atmosphere was great! We went on a Wednesday night and had a 9PM reservation. We sat on the patio and it was super romantic. It was really busy even on a Wednesday at 9. There was a jazz band playing which made it even more romantic. We can't wait to go back!

After seeing all the high ratings we were excited to try this spot. It had a great vibe when we walked in and a nice view from patio dining. However the appetizer, bruschetta, was underwhelming. It was charred to the point of tasting burned and while the tomatoes were fresh and delicious there wasn't much flavor otherwise. When the main courses of lasagna and risotto came out, the lasagna was very good.  However the risotto was about half corn half risotto which made for an odd risotto  texture and we ended up splitting the lasagna and leaving most of the risotto. Our waiter didn't seem to notice or ask so we just settled on the tab and went looking elsewhere for a more satisfying dessert. Overall disappointing.
Awesome hideaway gem at the Pike Street Market area. Jus look for the "pink door" in upper Post Alley and you're there..great vibe and food!!
The food doesn't live up to the reputation but the place to be at Pikes. My entree was too salty and the service ok .

I'm so glad that I found this place on Open Table!  We went for lunch after touring Pike's Place Market and found it down a little side alley.  The food was wonderful and we could sit outside on the patio and enjoy a sunny, cool day.  Our friend who joined us, lives in Seattle and couldn't believe that we'd found this gem.  She said that she loves the place and was thrilled that we'd made reservations there.  I'd go back to The Pink Door right now if I could!!

We had friends from out of town and wanted a special experience.
The food selection was excellent and everything we ordered was amazing.
This is a restaurant my husband and I have had on our list of "favorite restaurants", for many years.  It is hard to get last minute reservations which is a little frustrating, it seems like you have to book at least two weeks in advance which makes it hard for busy people like ourselves.
We enjoyed our selves, We had hoped to see  a show but did not Wrong night. It was a good night
Delightful atmosphere, food was excellent and the service was fantastic!
Great outdoor dinning in the heart of pike place market!

Great spot for lunch, especially for lunch on the patio!  Service and food are great!  The Caprese Salad with exquisite heirloom tomatos is mouthwatering delicious!  The new remodel makes a huge difference in  design and space. 

Consistently great restaurant!

Fabulous!!!! The Best food we had all week.  Celebrated my Birthday with a great meal. We started off with an antipasto that was bursting with flavorful delights  The Lasagna was melt in your  mouth fresh & delicious.  The squid ink pasta and seafood was so fantastic.  The Ambience was one of a kind and the live music was perfect.  I definitely will return to this hidden Gem behind the Pink Door!
Still wonderful food and the deck in the summer is a Seattle classic.
Good lunch while visiting Pike Market. Everything was great down to there unique cocktails.
Hard To go anywhere else when in the area! The ambience, service, and food, especially the food, are always excellent!

We spent a week in Seattle & this was our top pick - great food, excellent service, a lively atmosphere but still quiet enough to have a conversation, reasonably priced wine list but some splurges on there if you wanted to. We will be back!
Great food and terrific service in a spectacular setting

Our server, Andrew, was excellent...very attentive and helpful with our selections...food choices, including vegan and gluten free options, were varied...the outdoor rooftop dining was lovely...and everything tasted delicious!

Our waitress was very sweet with a great personality. Food is always delicious. The remodel looks amazing. Love the view from the inside seating! This place has always been my favorite Italian. Sooo good! Well definitely be coming back more often.

We planned our dinner at The Pink Door weeks in advance to celebrate a special day. The hostess was completely out of her element and should not be in the service industry. When we requested a table inside, as there was a dog next to the table they were seating us at on the patio, the guy who was seating us said he would have to go see if the have an inside table for us. He never came back but in his place was the unprofessional, discourteous, rude hostess. She started off the conversation stating that all open table reservations are for the patio only and she stated it says that on open table and on the confirmation email. After taking the time to enlighten her on the facts, nowhere on open table not on the email does it state the reservation is a patio only reservation, she finally sat us inside. By this time we had lost our appetites and decided to dine somewhere else. 

Word of advice: it is not we, the customer, who should be grateful that you allow us to pay for the food and "service" provided, but rather the restaurant and staff should be grateful for their customers and treat them with respect and as the customer. 

Lost a significant customer who's family has been dinning at The Pink Door for over 25 years. 

Hire professional customer service focused staff and the restaurant would be in a much better place.

Every August I take each of my grandchildren to Seattle for a very special trip.  We stay at a nice hotel and do lots of fun Seattle things.  We always have lunch or dinner at the Pink Door, and love the location and view.  The wait staff at the Pink Door has always been friendly and courteous to my young grandchildren, and that's why we keep coming back!
Great spot! We enjoyed the food and drinks and it was a great meal to end our trip with!
I was expecting much more. Is it weird to say that food came out way to fast? Taste was ok.

I don't come to Seattle often, but when I do The Pink Door is my first choice. In fact, on this most recent trip I dined there twice. Having dinner on the deck was a special treat - the mussels/clams were outstanding. And the Elevated Pimm' s Cup cocktail was the perfect drink  for a summer night.
Had lunch on an historically hot day and sat on the outside deck.   Excellent food,  atmosphere,  and service with a view of the sound.   Highly recommend.
Best food in Seattle. Make a reservation ahead as it is very popular!!
Anniversary! Was a great experience . Food and service spectacular! Got a small prosecco taster for anniversary!! Lovely setting

From the moment you open the Pink door you are transformed into a place that is unique. It was my wifes Birthday so I reserved a Elliot bay view from the outside deck. There was also inside tables with views also. The service was great, attentive and complete. Food was excellent as well. Great place to enjoy the market and then slip away to a roof top escape!

Took my husband to The Pink Door for his birthday. I had heard about the restaurant, but we had never been there before. We were happy to see the Italian focus to the menu. He comes from a big, east coast Italian family, so we love that food.  The restaurant was so clean and pretty. The vibe was cool and friendly, and it seemed like every staff member was happy to be there. Our waitress (Catrina) just made the dinner better. She had the right mix of helpful but not bossy, happy but not cloying. Great service. We started with the antipasto platter;  I had lasagna, and my husband had risotto.  All food was great, though my husband says he is getting the lasagna next time. He loved sampling mine so much! Split the peach crostata for dessert, and again, great taste during the summer. We are going back!
My cousin was in town and I wanted to give her a good send off. This more than fit the bill, the food was excellent as well as the service.
Food was amazing. Service was top notch. I would definitely visit here again.

Tuna Crudo was fresh and bright with perfect acidity....Squid Ink Spaghetti Al Pescatore was excellent with a touch of heat but not overwhelming...would have preferred eating in the dining room as opposed to outside

The atmosphere and service were both good but the food was disappointing. Our bruschetta was burnt, and taken off the bill and my date got sick later that night from the salmon being under cooked. He was not in good shape. It was hard to tell if the food was fully cooked in the dim light. We both ordered salmon, but they ran out and I ended up with halibut that was overcooked. Guess I was the lucky one. Still a lovely place.
Great food, service and what can you say about the outdoor deck. Fabulous
Amazing in every way! Our favorites were the Caesar salad with crab, egg plant mozzarella pasta dish! Yummmmm!
Pink Door never fails, always delivers!!!  Patio seating is really nice, entertainment is fun.

my husband has wheelchair needs.  Although he can walk, it was very difficult for him to maneuver the long narrow staircase, the only entrance down to the eatery.  This should have been explained in the advertisement that it is not equipped to accommodate disabilities.

Highly recommend the Pink Door - from the moment you walk through the (pink) door it's an amazing experience.  Eclectic décor, charming ambience, local flavors, and peak-a-boo views of Puget Sound from the outdoor patio.  Refreshing summer cocktails - Limoncello Collins & Pink Door Mocktail and King Salmon and Crab Risotto were fantastic entrees, followed by peach galette and ice cream was the perfect ending to the evening.  Just what a special event calls for.
Even though this place is right in the middle of tourism central, the Pink Door's stellar reputation is definitely deserved. It made me so happy to eat here.
This was fabulous restaurant and Italian dinner.  Very unique combinations and flavors made this a wonderful experience.

Annabelle says:  cozy cottage atmosphere enhanced by friendly attentive service.  All good but squid ink pasta with clams, squid, mussels was terrific. Tangy perfectly spiced broth is memorable. Bread was good but better I'd warned.

We really enjoyed this restaurant .  the atmosphere was lovely , the staff was first rate
the food as delicious
Excellent service, delicious food and a beautiful outdoor deck. Lunch at The Pink Door has become a wonderful birthday tradition for my daughter (and me). Thank you for always making it memorable.
Loved it!!!
We loved this restaurant. Get reservations early.  The lasagna was out of this world.

Had a good table, great service and decent food.  The bruschetta, the prosciutto appetizer and the lasagna were pretty good.  The risotto was not.  I probably would not go back because there are lots of other choices that are better..

Was visiting Seattle and was happy we tried the Pink Door!  Warm service, tasty Italian food and a floral table-clothed patio made for a lovely meal. It's a large restaurant and there are so many great seats.
Awesome atmosphere.  Great food, very good cocktails!!!!!!!    The location is charming and fun for a night  out with friends.  White Horse is just across the way!!
My favorite restaurant in Seattle - got to share it with the rest of my family. We had to have an late lunch/early dinner because we couldn't get a reservation for dinner. But it was worth it!
Great food and great service. Ingredients were fresh and pasta was al dente. Great drink menu, too.

Love this place. Relocating to
Los Angeles. Will keep this place close to my heart.

I loved the food and the service. The ambiance would have been 5 stars except for their music selection.   Instead of having nice Italian music, they played "groove is in the ....... by delight. I love that song but not right for elegant Italian dining.

I have been coming to the Pink Door for over 15 years. It is one of my all time favorite restaurants. Its food never disappoints, always fabulous. The atmosphere, patio view and great staff make it a Seattle jewel.
The food was amazing and the wine delicious. The service...not so much. We were definitely forgotten a few times and we were there for a long time. But the food was so delicious we didn't care!
A friend recommended we try this, and it was the perfect lunch spot. The food was excellent, very fun ambiance.
I've always adored the Pink Door.  The food is, without exception, delicious and beautifully prepared.  Most of all the outdoor seating is fantastic, romantic and beautiful.

Summer on the Pink Door patio is mandatory!  However, the newly remodeled dining room is gorgeous and very compelling even on a nice day.  The views are fantastic and the furnishings/decor lovely.   The food is consistently great.  What a Seattle gem!

We loved The Pink Door. It's not all that easy to find if you're not a local because they apparently don't believe in exterior signs! But when we walked into a full bar of patrons enjoying a Cirque de Soleil style performance, we knew this place was going to be different. There are so many lovely seating options (lively bar, open-air deck, sunny high-ceilinged dining room with Puget Sound views), we actually had a hard time choosing. Everything was fresh and tasty, with the only slight miss being the crab risotto. But we'd definitely go back if we return to Seattle.
this is our favorite spot for special occasions
The service was amazing. The ambiance felt like going back in time, vintage era italian post card. Loved it. Great date night or girl time setting.
Great experience' love this place! Come every time

Meal was outstanding.  Divine!  Had the lasagna for appetizer, ahi tuna, Caesar salad, spaghetti and meatballs and mushroom pasta.  Sides of carrots and creamed corn.  Every bite was delicious.  Great waitstaff. Beautiful setting on deck.  A must.
Always an excellent meal and dining experience.  Very good service

lunch on the patio on a sunny summer day is a must.  secluded with a great view of the waterfront.  awesome food and full bar with indoor dining and bar seating as well.  this is a Seattle "Treasure"!
I wish balsamic vinegar weren't 50c extra. I don't mind the price, but having to ask for something that is expected with olive oil and bread seems just a little unhappy.

It would not be summer without visiting the Pink Door and sitting on the patio overlooking the water.    The Italian menu is packed with seafood, fish as well as traditional pastas.  The new re-model is fantastic.

I had been waiting a decade to go here so was very excited.  My meal, however, was just so-so.  Nothing special for the money, so that was disappointing.   Loved being in the space, however!  It is like being a member of a secret club.

I'm a Seattle native that has come to the Pink Door for years, but not since the new remodel.  It's beautiful!  Nice job! Always one of my favorite places to bring out of town guests, especially  when sun is out, and we can enjoy outdoor dining. It was lovely as usual. Thank you!
Everything was really good. They burn the bruschetta, but my wife and i stull enjoyed it.
Great weather to sit outside. fabulous food.
This was by far one of the best restaurants we went to while visiting Seattle!! It is a must for any one going there!

We were in the new main dining room at a table on the far wall on the left.  Perfect place for 2 seniors, noise was diminished.  Americans talk TOO LOUD! 

I love the food, service is great, the inside is cozy in winter, the deck is fantastic in the summer.  I am looking forward to a safe, responsible, re-opening.


When we go to other countries, like France and England, we embarrass ourselves by how loud Americans talk.  And, I don’t need loud music to enjoy an evening in a restaurant.  Loud music impedes communication and diminishes enjoyment.  The only thing loud music achieves is getting people to leave earlier than they might want - and this results in tables turning more quickly. Please reduce decibels.  

And once we have hot summer nights, the open windows in the expanded area offer a beautiful view, and a welcome breeze.

Best restaurant in Seattle! I might be a little biased but this has to be on of the top restaurants in Seattle. Our waiter was top notch! He knew just about every item on the menu and was familiar with the wine menu. I asked him a few questions about different wines they have and what would be the best local wine. I tried the Wilderness, recommended by the waiter, it tuned out to be very good. I had the Salmon which was delicious and very fresh. Also their Lasagna is spectacular! I would go back in a heartbeat.

This was my first visit to The Pink Door since they closed for remodel earlier this year.  They have taken on more space, enlarged its kitchen making it more productive.  No longer are patrons waiting long periods for their lunch.   Our lunch was as tasty as ever and I highly recommend to anyone looking for a yummy pasta lunch.
Food, atmosphere and service were amazing! I   think this is one of the best Italian places on town. My only complaint would be that desert is not amazing. (still pretty good)
Very very cool spot, will return next time I'm in Seattle! Awesome vibe and awesome food, 10/10

Lovely patio for a late night dinner with a view of the bay.  Service was on point and all the staff friendly and welcoming.  Food is okay--honestly restaurant is a spot to visit, but there are numerous restaurants with more interesting menus.
Always fabulous!  Are coming back this week - thank you for another great experience.
Overall, an excellent experience as our server was wonderful, ambiance perfect and food delicious and fast. A definite must experience when in Seattle.

Great restaurant, I am already looking forward to returning! The lasagna was delicious. We sat on the patio which was nice, but I was under the impression it was going to have a view (not really) but overall still very nice. I would like to sit inside next time as it is a very beautiful place! I had to do a lot of research because I was confused about if a show would be going on, but the show was late at night and all the info is on their website. Great place!
Wonderful authentic Italian food. So good! Great ambiance, great service.
Unique atmosphere. We were there during lunch so missed the acrobatics that take place two evenings per week. The food was very good and of high quality and the service was very attentive.

First off, be aware that this is a very popular destination. I made my reservation on line more than a week in advance, and had limited openings available. We were seated outside, which *technically* has a view of the Bay, but you are looking across the roofs of several intervening buildings. The location is hard to reach: the landscape is extremely steep, parking is limited, the entrance is basically unmarked (and at the time of our visit, more of a peach color than "pink") and along a narrow, crowded alley. Once inside, even room to wait is hard to come by, but the feel is energetic, the decor eclectic, and we saw a group of musicians setting up for a live performance.

Most of that was, unfortunately, wasted on us as we were on the covered patio, and at a tiny table in a narrow alcove, at the very fringes of the seating area.  Nonetheless, the menu was intriguing, and our server went above and beyond the call in explaining the selections to us. He even managed to be good-natured when we pointed out a few minor grammatical errors and other quirks (my daughter is an English professor and I am, well, an anal-retentive nerd). One entree was prepared with "the finest of olive oils", for instance, while another was described as having "really, really good olive oil". We asked what the difference was, and our server rose to the challenge and had an answer at the ready.

The food was very good, the server attentive and agile enough to repeatedly squeeze past the table near ours and take good care of us. All in all, it was a fine dinner and a good introduction to Seattle (my daughter had recently moved there and I was visiting - we are both from the East Coast - to help her get settled and explore her new home).

The Pink Door was recommended to me as a must-stop in Seattle. It is indeed an iconic place to eat (though make sure reservations are far in advance.) The atmosphere is unique, the service wonderful, and the food was amazing! One of the best meals I have had in a restaurant. We started with the cheese board and a bottle of Prosecco. For my main I had the eggplant rigatoni (recommended by the waiter) and it was one of the best pasta meals I have had, with smoky mozzarella and  seasoned eggplant cooked perfectly. We finished with a couple of desserts and after dinner drinks - a must experience while in Seattle!

Excellent food,  drinks and ambiance!!! 
Visiting from Chicago, made a reservation and we were seated immediately upon arrival in their beautiful patio. 
We had the rigatoni with italian sausage and the crab risotto, which was delicious.
Gorgeous place, fabulous staff and delicious food and wine.  We sat in the bustling patio for lunch, and we loved everything about it!
The Pink Door's outdoor patio never fails to disappoint -- my favorite outdoor dining experience in Seattle.
An amazing food experience!  Traditional Italian food with a fresh take.  Loved the garlic bread and Tagliarini.  Wonderful service from Greta.  Don't miss this restaurant!

I've been to Pink Door twice now, and the service is iffy - the service we had the first time was absolutely fantastic, whereas the server we had this time was a bit cold and seemed annoyed the entire time. He asked if we wanted bread after our meal had already come out, and when I asked for more honey for my cheese plate, he looked as if I was asking for his arm. Food was okay - it wasn't phenomenal, but also not bad. I'd come back if only for the drinks and ambiance.

The Pink Door was great!  We had a late night reservation at 9:45pm but they didn't rush us.  We sat outside as we were there during the summertime and it was really nice out; the view is spectacular.       

I had the parpadelle and it was phenomenal.  The pasta was definitely freshly made and the simple red sauce that accompanied it was delish.  My husband had the cioppino and he said it was good.  I am convinced he would've liked more in terms of portions, but he won't admit it.  He said the flavors were there but the broth was a little on the thinner side than he is used to; no docking of points for this as the sauce consistency is just a matter of preference.  For dessert we shared the chocolate ooey gooey and it was fantastic.  

Definitely recommended if it's your first time in Seattle.   The drinks and food are good, the ambiance is definitely upbeat and the service awesome.
Great experience and awesome food. Took my parents here who were visiting Seattle and they loved it - highly recommend to anyone!

This is an excellent spot. It isn't exactly waterfront but it is outside dining with somewhat of a view.
The Linguine alfalfa alla vongole was excellent and our waitress was fabulous. We needed to be out in an hour and she made sure that happened.
I made at 7:30 reservation at 7:19 and asked for outside seating and it was granted. The whole experience was fantastic and I can't wait to see the show next time.

A delectable surprise.delicious Dungeness crab rissotto scallops with morel mushroom sauce and frissee salad yummy bread and desserts.

Definitely will go back.
Wonderful service  by Terrance!
Wonderful restaurant with excellent value. Service was delightful.
Food was very good.  Funky ambience is good once in a while,  but not on a steady diet.  I'd go back, but not in a great hurry.
Perfect in every way. Truly exceptional food and ambience. Great patio.
We had a great meal. The staff were wonderful and really kind to us. The food is simple, tasty and would bring us back again and again.  The trapeze artist adds the cherry on the top.

I love The Pink Door. They have amazing servers, amazing food and a great ambiance that is casual hip n friendly. 
The salads are perfection. I loved the Bibb lettuce salad. The long rib entree was cooked perfectly as well. I liked that the mashed potatoes were not overly creamy or salty.
My husband and I came here for an early dinner. It did not disappoint. Very delicious!
We really enjoyed the Pink Door. Staff was very friendly and the food was excellent.
Our waitress Lola was a delight!...food was very good and enjoyed the experience tremendously!
Excellent dinner. Enjoyed the evening. Food preparation and presentation was very nice. Good value for quality of the food. Nice atmosphere. We were seated on the patio which was lovely.
Wonderful remodel after four months. Great views inside as well as on the deck. Very good and reliable cuisine.

This place lived up the many positive reviews we've read.  It's easy to see why this place was buzzing on a Thursday night.  The staff is outstanding.  Everybody from the hostess, to the bartender and the waiter were all friendly, accommodating and professional.  My wife noted it was my birthday dinner and asked for a "window seat" when she made the reservation - we got a nice table along the window.   We were early and they seated us as soon as the table was available.  The other couple with us was 40 minutes late -  the staff seemed unfazed and kept us well oiled with drinks while we waited.  The Halibut special was nicely prepared, with an excellent sauce that set it off well.  All the other food was well-prepared and tasty.  

In short,  it was a very positive experience and we will be returning.
So fun to see the newly renovated Pink Door ... looks wonderful! But of course during warm weather, the outdoor patio/deck is my preferred dining spot. So fun!
The Pink Door is our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  The lovely view from the patio, the great food, and wonderful service remains the same year after year.

I was introduced to this restaurant by a friend the first time I ever visited Seattle and have been back every time we have made the trip down. The seafood is excellent and I could not ask for a better atmosphere or night out. We celebrated a birthday this night and they were very accommodating of us.
Food, service, and live music were great!

Though it was a bit hard to find for this tourist (look for a pink door, not a sign), Pink Door was worth the search. Traditional Italian done extraordinarily well, with a marinara to die. Plan in advance; dinner reservations are difficult .
Thomas was a amazing waiter he made the experience.
Amazing service with fantastic food! ❤️👏🏼

Pink Door has a great ambience and is a good date place. I also enjoyed the food and service there. The spinach lasagna was delicious. I also got to see the burlesque show. It wasn't too great but still a very different experience.
Great view and perfect service. The lasagna never disappoints and the clam linguine was great. Loved the green salad with English peas, pistachios and avocado dressing.
This is the second time I visited Pink tour this year and both times the food has been really fresh and super delicious.

This is a great place -- amazing Italian food and romantic ambiance right in Pike's Place Market. The only thing I would note is that since they expanded, there are some tables that are better than others. When I took my friends from out of town, we got seated in a hallway type section of the restaurant that took away from the overall experience.

Hostess initially ignored us because she was on phone. One server spilled water on table and my wife. 
Otherwise, food was outstanding.
I heard the Pink door (it's really peach) was good but I was skeptical considering the location. We loved it. And the room with the view. Amazing. The service was perfect as well as the food.

Recently remodeled, the Pink Door now offers a wonderful view of the waterfront from inside the restaurant, in addition to the lovely view from the patio.  Same great Italian cuisine and excellent service.  Highly recommended.  Reservations strongly suggested.
Wonderful service! Outstanding food. The dumgemess crab Caesar salad was tasty! The atmosphere was fun and the view fantastic. I will return soon.
Went here with my mother and boyfriend for dinner. The food and drinks were excellent and the service was also fantastic!
Really good food, this is our third time there.  The service was great!  Cant wait to go back.  Thank you.

Great vibe, try to sit in the newly remodeled room which overlooks the Market. I had the caesar salad, oysters and the mocktail. All were fantastic salad was perfectly dressed, oysters fresh and I love the balsamic ice they serve with it. The bread is excellent and my "mocktail" was a kind of thyme lemon/lime soda. So good and it comes with a polka dot paper straw!! I LOVED it. HIGHLY recommend!

Excelente opción, la ubicación inmejorable comida deliciosa y un ambiente tranquilo y lindo. Todos súper atentos con excelente atención a los detalles, precios justos y excelente calidad. Es un Must si visitas Seattle.
Close to my office. Great place to take my customers after a business meeting. Awesome food from appetizers (perfect local oysters),entrees and desert.
The Pink Door was the perfect place for my family dinner!
Dinner with a long time friend and it was perfect as always!!!
Shared a meal with a couple friends, sat on the deck and enjoyed the view and had wonderful food:  scallops, beef, carrots, amazingly great ice cream!

I normally don't write reviews because I am too busy, but I met up with a friend who is in from out of town and I wanted some place very "Seattle" for her and she wanted somewhere with a patio.   I had been there previously a few years ago and had thought it was just "OK" but this time the food was really stellar and I understood why it's a bit of an institution. I work in fine dining and even from that point of view, I was really impressed with everything.  Our server was great, I don't remember his name but he seemed like he was Italian (he had an accent),  his suggestions both for wine and food were spot on and we had a fabulous time.

It's been awhile since we were at The Pink Door and, boy, were we glad to rediscover it! I originally made the reservation for the view, to introduce east coast friends to Seattle. My husband grumbled because he remembered the food as "meh" and the wine selections as mediocre. NOT ANYMORE! 

This was a fabulous lunch. Every bite was mouth-watering and the wine list was superb and reasonably priced. We had a mixed antipasti platter, the fresh salmon special, seared scallops and the Dungeness Crab Risotto, plus rich chocolate-covered cream puffs for dessert. Absolutely delightful. Staff was very friendly, maybe not super efficient, but my forgotten coffee was comped when they remembered to bring it. 

Our only head-scratcher was the clunky water glasses they used to serve the wine. Cool wines that they have on the list deserve better than the awkward Flintstone glasses they're using. Overall, though, we can't wait to go back!
Wonderful food and great service.  Eating out on the deck is great.
Had a birthday lunch and it was great!!! Good food, wine, ambiance, service... name it! It was our first time and we absolutely enjoyed it :)
Top spot for Seattle.
Every time we go to the Pink Door it's even better than the last!  Hands down my favorite place to dine in Seattle!

Hidden off pink door with no sign makes it still hard to find. Great service wonderful appetizers,  ok meals served. Average prices for a nice meal out. Dining room was very full so noise level was high.  25 corkage fee is ridiculous!

I love this restaurant.  We go there three to four times a year and always have a wonderful dining experience.  My favorite dish is the Cioppino, but have also enjoyed all their seafood, lasagna, and risotto dishes.  I don't eat meat, but always have multiple choices.

Was a great experience...Nice views.Good food, especially good options for vegetarians.
Go for Pink Doo Lasagna.
Friendly Staff and good service
We were treated to a wonderful table looking out over the water. Service was excellent, food was just ok.
Really loved this cool spot.  Fabulous service and really cool as well.  Food perfect.
Wonderful food, lovely service and the best ice cream in the city -- Sweet Lo's Homemade Ice Cream!
Our meal was fabulous.  Best I've had in a long time!

The incredibly delicious fresh and local menu, the welcoming, cozy, romantic space, and the friendly and attentive staff have kept us coming back to the Pink Door for almost 20 years. The clams linguine and the mouth watering lasagne are dining favorites, but every item we've tried from drink to appetizer to main course to dessert has been amazing.
Food is great, outdoor patio is beautiful on a nice weather day!  Great spot close to the market.
The Pink Door is a great place for a meal or just drinks! Sitting outside on the patio with all the great people watching and positive energy is never a disappointment!

Our appetizer was never out in and out food CE out before the app. Once we got the prosciutto appetizer there was a long piece of land here in it. I need both keys and out not to room temperature. I was on a Date which did not make for a great experience
Outstanding meal and great atmosphere. Enjoyed this highly recommend restaurant.

We have been waiting for the remodeling work to finish for the re-opening. We certainly were not disappointed. Delicious food - the whole fish Branzino was amazing and the seafood cioppino was the perfect savory and filling dish. Desserts are really the cherry on top. But it is the atmosphere - from the "secret" pink door on Post Alley to the Moulin Rouge-esque setting. We have to come back for the shows!
Beware Not food allergy friendly or accommodating. Will be VERY limited on menu and for the price not worth it.
Beautiful spot. Great service and lovely food.
The food was delicious and the decor beautiful, however the staff was not very pleasant to interact with.
Awesome experience!! Beautiful fun atmospheres, Terrence our waiter attentive, & patient so fun & food delicious!!

All of the staff here was on top of it! Never had to wait to have water filled, three different servers asked if we had been helped at the bar after already being helped, ambiance was better than expected. Our server even noticed I had a cough and brought out hot water with lemon and honey. Thank you Pink Door!

Behind the PINK Door, wonderful ambiance, service and food. Why can’t all meals
be here?!! Brava!
Very good service and atmosphere! The aerial artist was very entertaining during dinner.  Noise was a little loud but able to talk
It was a good place to have a wonderful lunch out side. Service was great!

Fantastic view, and the remodel looks great. The service was excellent and we got great cocktail and wine recommendations. Our oysters were unbelievably good with the balsamic ice, and our entrees were great as well. Loved the scallops as well as the long rib. We still talked about the meal for days afterward.
I feel like a thesaurus of "good" adjectives as I type this, but everything really was so wonderful!

Amazing dining experience! The place itself is so cute, and the inside is beautiful! Perfect for special occasions or dates but also nice for any dining experience to be honest. The service is casual but very attentive. The food was AMAZING! Menu is extensive with a lot of options. I went with the lamb...unique and flavorful and just the right portion. Reservations recommended.
I love what you've done! The restaurant and bar look incredible. Food was perfectly prepared and delicious, service was spot on. Thank you!

Outstanding, my son loved the Bolognese and my scallops were perfectly cooked. There were local asparagus as an appetizer,  non alcoholic mocktails for my husband. The newly remodeled gorgeous  dining room was a cool, pleasant refrain from a day in the sun.
The new remodel is fantastic and the food and service were excellent as always. A family favorite.
We came early and was accommodated promptly. The food was very good, not outstanding. The waitress was extremely friendly and made the experience extra special.
We followed TripAdvisor recommendations for a tasty meal served accurately and quickly. The lemon fettuccine and lobster risotto were excellent!

I always try to stop at the Pink Door when visiting Seattle, but it was closed for renovations on my last few trips. Well, the wait was definitely worth it. I was able to take a friend there for lunch - she'd never been before, and we were seated in the beautiful new space overlooking the Market and water. The new room was airy but still fit in well with the decor of the original space. 
Of course, it's also important to talk about the food. My friend and I shared the pizza of the day and the vegetables of the day - both with vegetables supplied by local farmers. Their food has always been amazing, and this lunch was no exception - I'm not sure I can recommend them enough!
Incredible. Loved the food options. Tried the crab risotto. Waiter attentive. Scene gorgeous. A gem in Seattle.

Food was delish! Great service! Atmosphere was excellent! Portions and price are more than fair. Been to other restos and forget their names but this "secret" restaurant is definitely a memorable one. I highly recommend it and would  come back again!
First time in the newly renovated space. They have done a fantastic job - while enhancing it they managed to preserve some of its old character. The food is  just as great as before!

Cannot fault The Pink Door, we had one night in Seattle and this gem of a restaurant gave us everything we wanted in terms of location, ambience, friendly staff and brilliant food. Would definitely revisit.
The remodeled space makes the Pink Door even better! It's more spacious and has a spectacular water view.  I've been several times and I never tire of it! It's always been great!!!

We always look forward to visiting the Pink Door when we make our yearly trip to Seattle.  It's especially exciting when the weather is warm and the patio is open.  This year, we were interested to see the remodel.  Had a lovely window table in the new room, good food, and attentive service. Unfortunately, the noise level is incredible! (This seems to be a trend in Seattle, btw.)  It was impossible to carry on a normal conversation; all we wanted to do was finish our meal and leave.  Hope they can deaden the noise level, we'd love to come back and enjoy ourselves at one of our favorite places.

Carried my wife there for Mother's Day. She ordered the bolognese and loved it, I ordered the lamb porterhouse and was very unimpressed. The atmosphere was ok, I'm sure it would be better to catch a trapeze show but they've not started back up yet. Service was great, and overall the place was ok. My plate was overpriced for a tasteless meal.
It was a great place, great ambiance, staff very accommodating and love the entertainment.
The remodel is done, beautiful dining room.   Everything and everyone was great.
Enjoy lunch there with a few friends. Food is good and service was good.

This restaurant was so much fun - Very eclectic decor - loved every unique picture/statue/lamp.
Great restaurant - Great food - Great prices. Can't beat it.

We arrived on time  for lunch and at first they couldn't find our reservation, then the hostess abruptly left and eventually came back and said our table wasn't ready so we sat down to wait. After 15 minutes, and seeing several empty tables for four, we all went back to the front and hung around until they finally seated us (20 minutes past our reservation time). No apologies, no, "Thanks for your patience."
Our waiter was friendly and the food was okay; not bad just nothing special. While we were sitting at our table they moved the tables behind us around and shoved a corner of the table into my son's back but didn't aknowledge it. When we left my son asked to see the manager and talked to her about the issues and she offered to comp our meal or give us a gift certificate but he had already paid and we don't live in the area so he let it go. She did apologize.
My son just got his credit card bill today and he was overcharged by about $125, so the saga continues.
Even if the staff had been friendlier or more accommodating, I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. The decor is cute and the food was good enough but not great, so definitely not worth the time and effort it took to get reservations.

The Pink Door was a great experience. Although I must admit my husband was left hungry after ordering a lamb dish.  I ordered the Lasagna and was disappointed that it was a vegetarian only option.   In saying that, both dishes were still delicious, just unfortunately not what we expected.  I do recommend people go for the experience though.
Love the Pink Door. The food is awesome, the staff is very attentive and friendly, and with the new remodel the place looks even more spectacular.
Wonderful. All the prior recommendations do it justice.
The waiter screwed up our bill and ended up double charging everyone. Horrible experience on my 21st birthday.
Lovely and flexible staff made for an enjoyable experience, and the food was all phenomenal!
The Pink Door never disappoints.  Food is always interesting and tasty.  Wait staff are responsive and friendly.  The charm is reliable.  Highly recommend.
Loved the portobello mushroom panini and cheese board appetizer! Great food and very generous portions!
Very impressed. Heard it was just for tourists. Not so!  Awesome for all!

The Pink Door picked up right where they left off   They successfully preserved the ambience of the original place in the front room, while providing an open and air experience in the new dining room. The views in the dining room are great. So, depending on whether you want the original feel or the new, it's all good. The staff and food is excellent as usual. 
Highly recommend.

I have always loved the Pink Door and still do but I was really disappointed in the quality and quantity of food. We shared an appetizer and each had an entree. We both left hungry.  Not sure that I'll be back for dinner but will probably still pop in for a drink and appetizer on occasion. 
The remodel is awesome and the service was good.
GORGEOUS renovation, fantastic food, drinks, and service. Highly recommend.

Love the new remodel but miss the old space a little. The bigger space offers a great view of the Puget Sound which is nice.  Same great food, same great service and can't wait to get back on the deck.

Top 5 restaurants when dining in Seattle, view is fantastic, food is consistently great.
Service can sometimes be inconsistent.
I didn't think it possible but I love The Pink Door even more after their renovation. Inspiring food and ambiance.  A real treat.

We went for the soft opening and the food and renovations were amazing! The only criticism I have is that both desserts we ordered were slightly dry and chalky but the lamb porterhouse was delicious, as well as the risotto. The renovations are gorgeous! So happy you did them!

I love this place, the risotto they have here is one of the best i've had in my life. We had christmas lunch there because we couldn't get a dinner reservation and it was amazing, the food, the ambiance, the place, the service. I highly recommend it.

Birthday - service was great. The check in and check out area is too small.  We arrive about 10m before I reservation and we had to wait on our table.  There is no place to wait except outside in the cold. Once we were done the hostess had no idea which coats were ours. They have no checking system, they just take your coats. When the performer started the entry between the two rooms became wall to wall people so we weren't able to see the show.  Everything else was wonderful, the service and food is exceptional.
Pink door is an amazing gem. True old world city vibe by the water with everything you could ever want in a killer date spot.

The Pink Door is one of our favorite places to dine at the Market.  The food, service and ambiance always delight.  It's a great special occasion spot.  It will be closed for 3 months beginning January 2017 for a major redesign.  Glad we visited December 30 for a special birthday lunch!
Food is amazing!! Best Italian restaurant with fresh ingredients . Definitely will be back! The live music was also the perfect touch.

A friend of ours recommended this restaurant. My positive experience with the Pink Door is that I was seated at the proper time, the staff was very courteous. My negative experience started with my waiter with a nose ring.  It seems out of place with the appearance of the establishment. The food we ordered consisted of the rib plate, which was mostly fat.  The salad which was covered in oil that I couldn't eat it.  The only thing on the plate that was eatable was the potatoes and you charged $38.00 for this.  The lasagna portions were too small for the price, and the flavor was nothing special. In my opinion, you can have a better meal at Olive Garden.
My new favorite restaurant! Loved the entire experience!
Excellent food and good service. Request not to be seated under the trapeze act unless you like a spotlight shining in your face while you eat.

Simply put, we just loved our dining experience. The food was great, the service amazing and the place in itself outstanding. If I lived in Seattle I would dine at The Pink door at least once a week just for the pleasure of the experience!
They have the best lasagna. Had fish of the day and lasagna but wanted to try everything on the menu. The food was so tasty.
Beautiful Christmas decor for the perfect Christmas week dinner. We loved every bite and every moment!

One of the best meals that I've had in years.  We were celebrating paying off our mortgage and chose the Pink Door because we have never been unhappy with eating here.  The Cioppino was delicious.  The service was impeccable.
My favorite restaurant in Seattle!
The Pink Door never disappoints!  My favorite Seattle restaurant!
Food was incredible, very reasonably priced.  Much needed night out with my husband!
Always amazing food. Wonderful view! Can’t beat it!
As always the food and service were amazing! One on my favorite places in Seattle.
Excellent Italian and sea food. Great show as well.
Good experience. Highly recommend. I suggest you reserve in advance during an entertaining show.
Pink Door was a perfect week day anniversary date spot. I would imagine it is wonderful for a romantic evening as well. I highly recommend the cheese plate!
Awesome dining experience, as always. Friendly, helpful staff. Delicious menu. Outstanding service.  Great people watching. The Pink Door is a home run.
Wonderful service and terrific good. Fabulous experience. Had a special request for seating and the people at the front desk we're so accommodating. Over the top!!
Its a perfect restaurant. The food is stunningly delicious. The staff is attentive and on it. It's amazing at Christmas time.
Crowded on a Saturday at 3pm! Great food and too bad they can't inclose the outdoor section in the winter for additional seating.
Highly rated place...    a bit disappointed with lunch reservation 2:30,  VERY long to order and then to receive meals.

Excellent Service and great food.
I have been coming here with my daughter every Christmas season for at least a dozen years, and look forward to next year.
Service was very nice.    Food was wholesome.   Nice cozy environment.   A little loud.

For many years the Pink Door has been one of my favorite places to visit when I am in Seattle.  The ambiance can't be beat, and the food is superb.  This is the first time that I ever visited when I wouldn't give it the full number of stars on everything.  My friend and I had just had amazing Brussels sprouts at a different restaurant the night before, and they weren't quite matched at the Pink Door.  Overall, the evening was still bril, nonetheless.
The food was outstanding and the service matched the food.  We had a great lunch.  You couldn't find a better place to share a meal with friends.

Came here for an anniversary and they treated us like kings! Complimentary prosecco when we sat down which I did not expect! We were there on a Monday and wanted to make sure we had enough time to enjoy the trapeze show, we were seated right next to it, it was perfect! Our food was delicious. The complimentary bread was to die for too. Would definitely love to come here again, I had heard such great things and am happy I got to experience it!
Fantastic !!! That sums it all up in one word. Great floor show. That was a surprise.

We felt there was too much hype...we made reservations and got a confirmation, then another email follow-up, THEN another phone follow-up an hour before our reservation.  But it was never full at 4:00 p.m., nor when we left at 6:00 p.m..  Yes, the place is unique for the "swing" entertainment, but those windows of entertainment are very limited.  My husband's chair faced an unadorned cement wall, so I think some thought about re-arranging seating would be nice.  About one-third of the seats had the same problem.  Maybe a large mirrored wall ?!  That would certainly create a better view for everyone, not just those facing into the center of the restaurant.  Having said this, it is a nice restaurant.  Not truly worthy of the hype, but pleasant enough and with an occasional quirk.  Don't think we will return.
Outstanding.
A beautiful place to take friends. The food is amazing. A hidden gem off the market.

My absolute favorite restaurant in Seattle.  I have been going to The Pink Door for twenty-five years and it never disappoints.  I just took my daughter for a special night out before PNB's Nutcracker.  The service was extraordinary and the food?  Perfect.  I love that they served vegetables from Butler Green Farms too!   The Pink Door will continue to be my pick for nights out with family, friends or a special date with my husband.  Wonderful!

Attentive service by the entire staff, and excellent food.  The celery root and roasted pear bisque was beyond incredible...I've been thinking about it constantly since our visit!  My mother-in-law also enjoyed her fresh, organic salad and lovely hot tea selection.  The Pink Door has been a favorite of ours for years and this visit only reminded me of the many reasons why!
From Portland Oregon.  We always eat here, have for 40 years.  We will return

Wow, so impressed with this place. I'm so bummed we didn't go on a Sunday or Monday to see the silk performers, "Oh darn, we'll have to go back!" :) Thank you Open table for getting us a great reservation! What a fabulous experience!
We had the ahi tuna crudo & the beef long rib - Excellent!  You can't get food like that anywhere else - let alone in the bodacious environment that is the Pink Door!
Fantastic service above fantastic Kelvin wait person was great helpful. Know the menu made recommendations. Friendly. Hang onto him. Recommend to others an will be back after remodeling. Thank You

We went a chilly, but sunny weekday for lunch. Even though I've lived in Seattle for over 5 years, this was my first time visiting Pink Door. Overall I was impressed: the service was outstanding, the food delicious and the ambiance was charming. The house red was also an excellent Italian selection and a good value. This place makes for a great business lunch or a date for lunch or evening! I'll be back.
Great food, awesome service and great ambience!! Good vegetarian options too.
What a pleasant surprise, great ambiance and delicious food!

I was proposing to my girlfriend.  I called the restaurant and asked if we could include the burlesque trapeze artist in the proposal.  They immediately said they'd be glad to help.  In the end we had an amazing meal, my girl said Yes and we have the Pink Door to thank!  Really outstanding job everyone!  Thank you so much for making our engagement truly memorable!  Yours truly Sherrie Plaster & Debra Skoog
Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Highly recommended
We had a great time here. We ordered more food than necessary and ate it all. Would very much recommend.

Really loved the pink door - such a great spot and a beautiful, cozy atmosphere. We enjoyed spending my birthday there. I have food allergies, and they were so accommodating. The trapeze artist was a fun addition - the performances were fun but brief so you didn't spend too long staring instead of conversing. All and all, this was such a highlight of our very brief trip to Seattle.  Also, best cheese plate ever - random but true

Went for a birthday celebration before a show at 5th Ave. really amazing food and genuinely good service. Had the Bolognese and my husband had lasagne, both excellent. Don't get a ton of food, but the place is right in Pikes market and is a gem, so prices are understandable. Can't wait to be back for dinner and the show.
Excellent service, super romantic spot with great food. Highly recommend!!

Lovely, fairly quiet place for lunch. Pasta with meatballs was delicious. House white wine, which comes in a cute, small, green bottle, is minerally and complements the cuisine. Attentive, friendly service. The lounge area (full menu available) has a nice view of the waterfront, which makes it a great place for visitors to Seattle.

Amazing ambience. The music, lighting, and decor create the perfect setting for a very pleasurable evening. The staff is great and very helpful, and the food is awesome. Great place for a special occasion.
Excellent food.
Really good food! It was hard to get a reservation at the time and day that I wanted and the menu was a little pricey but it was sooooooo worth it!
The lasagne lives up to the hype!
Great food, service, location.
We were lucky enough to have a great dinner and view three performances by their trapeze artist. A fun evening!

What a great meal and atmosphere.  We started with a half of the market board and it was a perfect portion appetizer for two people.  We then went on to have the ravioli, amazing, and the lasagne.  The food alone is worth the visit to the Pink Door but the addition of the aerial artist takes the experience to another level.  I have already recommended the Pink Door to other people and when we are back in Seattle, we will definitely return.  Service also was wonderful.

What a wonderful meal! Our party of 4 all had different entrees and tasted each other's. From the fish special to lasagna everyone was more than pleased. 
We did not experience the entertainment but were very happy with the decor and overall ambiance.
This restaurant is a MUST when visiting Seattle.
Such a great experience!
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and we loved it! Will definitely be back. Definitely a must go. My girlfriend had steak that was cooked perfectly!
We went there with whole family and kids. Waiter was nice and the service was good. I didn't feel food was anything extraordinary but depends on what you order.
Great lasagna, alright seafood. A bit on the expensive side but I'd come at least once, especially if you are visiting Seattle.

The best part of the Pink Door was its hidden pink door in an alley and the salads.  The wait staff was excellent, but the entrees were very small and the ravioli tasted like you were sucking on a lemon.  It was very loud, conversation was difficult to have.  The restrooms are difficult to get to, they require you leave the back of the restaurant and walk a gauntlet of Seattle's finest homeless and heroin addicts.  It advertises live entertainment, but fails to mention that the entertainment does not start until later in the evening.  I will not return.

My husband and I were in town to celebrate our honeymoon. I chose this place due to its good reviews and I figured it would make a great place for a romantic dinner. It was romantic but the food was average. You can definitely get better at a cheaper Italian restaurant. The ravioli butter sauce was incredibly watery and salty. His lasagna however, was good. The garlic bread was a little on the crunchy side but it was fine. Nothing spectacular to write about. Our server was very sweet and nice. Polite but friendly enough.

Our server, Gretta was outstanding  and she provided a memorable dining experience . The Food was awesome in both taste and presentation.Hostess was very accommodating both over the phone and in person with us , as we had to revise our scheduled reservation to an earlier time.
All in all, we all loved this place.
Great food, fun to find. Great location and service too. If you're into Italian food, look no further

This was a great evening,  food was great.   The location was a little difficult for my friend to access, she has a disability and struggles with stairs and walking.  Beyond that, it was a pleasant  evening
The Pink Door Lasagne was incredible! Seasonal drinks were great as well; definitely going back!
comfortable, wonderful food, thoughtful and friendly staff
The absolute best lasagna I've ever had!! If you're in the Seattle area definitely stop by there!! Rad atmosphere! We will definitely be back!

Wonderful place. Great entertainement. Service and for both excellent. Visiting from Canada and was our first night in Seattle. I would highly recommend the pink door to anyone looking for dinner and show.
Had another wonderful evening at the Pink Door.  The service was great and the food was fantastic.  Looking forward to my next visit

We had the seared scallops and they were the best!!! 
Go on a Sunday or Monday for the show!!!

While the food was lovely and the atmosphere  was unique, we were highly unimpressed with the service. Our waitress seemed much more interested in watching the live show and visiting at the hostess station that in paying attention to her tables. I took my daughter there to celebrate her birthday but after a but she just wanted to leave. High disappointment, we won't be back anytime soon.
Cozy atmosphere, great service, great food. Expensive
The food was absolutely fabulous. I can't wait to go back again. What a great find!
We had a great time and service wonderful.  We all agreed we would come back to the pink door.
Amazing Food and the service is outstanding! An awesome experience not to be missed in Seattle. My first stop every visit. Sometimes 2-3 meals per visit to Seattle! Hidden Gem!! ❤️

It's a dining experience. Food was great. Staff and ambiance was great. Disappointed they served warm water with no ice to drink. Only wines and other alcoholic beverages offered. Never asked if we wanted a soda or anything else to drink.   I don't do alcohol, so drank the warm water.
Fantastic restaurant in every way! One of my favs!!

The food is absolutely fantastic, though a bit pricey given the small portions. The authentic Italian cuisine is matched by the extensive wine list. I had the linguine and clams and it was LOADED with clams, which was a nice surprise from most places I've ordered that dish. The vibe of the restaurant is great. I really enjoyed this place.
Loved finally being able to dine at The Pink Door.  Atmosphere, service, food and company was amazing!

Loved eating at the Pink Door.  I have been trying to swing the time to go and I was so happy I did!  The Ahi Tuna appetizer was devastatingly scrumptious and I wanted another one.  My cocktail was the Hilary (election night) and it was just what the doc ordered.  YUM!  Going back.

What a wonderful place. I wish that I was in Seattle longer so that I could have dined during one of the performances. All of the staff was fantastic and the food was amazing. If I come back to the city I will absolutely be back.
Great evening out! Loved the trapeze on Sunday evening!! Come between 6 and 8pm to see her shows, very fun and ask for a table close to the show!

My second visit was  a date with my boyfriend to celebrate our second anniversary. The environment is very romantic and comfortable. Very well service and food. There's also performance on that night which was amazing. I'll definitely come back.
Fantastic food, service and ambiance. I highly recommend it.

The restaurant  was outstanding.  The food was delicious. The atmosphere was great for a nice  dinner as a couple or a small group of friends.  No trapeze as some stated,  so quaint and love historical atmosphere  as well.
Be careful they have a lunch and dinner menus on the weekend and the won't make you something off either one!
came for the acrobats, but they weren't going on. We still stayed to eat lunch, and so glad we did because the food is amazing! great service! will be back!
We live in Vancouver (Canada) and visit Seattle once or twice a year. I always go to the Pink door for at least a drink. I love it there!
The pink door has character, charm and vibe. Appreciate autumn menu.
The ambiance was fabulous and our server, Terrence, took great care of us. The lasagna is a must try and the handcrafted cocktails really hit the spot!

The Pink Door located in a cool area of Pike Place met all our expectations. The door really is pink.The service was superb and the food was amazing. Great ambience cool building as well. Great wine list. Can't wait to return.
Awesome place to eat delicious Italian food!  We always have great service, especially from Terrence!
Place is very cramped and loud. Service was poor with waiter forgetting about us for long periods. Food was generally good, not spectacular. Not consistent with the hype. Would not return.
Amazing!!! Must go. Such good food and awesome wine selection

Entrance to the restaurant is located in a back alley. Good set up. We were well received and seated immediately. I had an appointment but I am sure you can get by without one on weekdays. We had the wild boar stew and fennel crusted roasted duck thighs. Wine selection was good as well. We went on the Halloween night and we got to see some performances in between. Food is fairly priced in my opinion and we thoroughly enjoyed dining here.
Outstanding , a 10/10 in every way - would go back in a heartbeat !

It was definitely good but they have very few options in vegetarian food. Appetisers were really good and different than usual. We tried two veg. Pastas, one with lime flavor was okay where as other one with mushrooms and other vegetables was good one. Dessert was okay.
My wife and I had a great experience at The Pink Door. Good wine list. Great service. Excellent food. Heavenly desserts. Look forward to returning on our next trip to Seattle.
The food is amazing, and the service is great! :) :)

We went to the Pink Door to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday.  We had a wonderful meal, the waiter and all the staff were very helpful and prompt with the service.  Had a great meal and an outstanding bottle of wine.  Great evening.  This was our second time eating here and we were not disappointed at all.
Yummy risotto with truffle. Great date place and great service.

A pleasant and comfortable restaurant in Pike Place Market, with a fabulous view patio in summer.  The food is Italian, and includes standard dishes (such as the delicious lasagne) as well as inventive, seasonal specials.  Nice wine list.  The house red wine was good and affordable.  The service was excellent.
As usual, dining at the Pink Door is fabulous.  Fresh Oysters, great wine and the most wonderful servers imaginable.

Really lovely, romantic ambience. Good drinks and wine choices. We had great service. Although, The food was good, the seasonal dishes were particularly good. It seemed the regular menu choices were fairly commonplace. We are from out of town, for in towners I would say a little more flare for foodies would be an improvement.

Fabulous restaurant!  We are from the east coast and knew nothing about the Pink Door except what we read on open table. We were a group of 6 celebrating winning a national Sumner Learning award, and this was the perfect place. Good food, drink and environment. Definitely recommend it!

Wonderful food & drink, fun to finally experience this historic restaurant. We dined early, I would love to go when there is entertainment. The ONLY complaint would be I feel we were a little rushed and over attended by the wait staff, but perhaps this is because of my recent dining experiences in France, where there is absolutely no pressure to finish up and clear the table.
We flew in from Los Angeles to celebrate our anniversary. One word: AMAZING.

Found this while planning a visit in the Seattle area. Once there, several people recommended the Pink Door to us. The food was excellent and the trapeze show (Mondays and Sundays only I beleive) was good and helped make this a memorable dining experience. Part of the experience is just finding the place as there is no signage to point it out, only a nondescript industrial looking door with no markings.

Loved the pappardelle. Took both kids with me and they were able to order 1/2 portions of the pasta on the menu which was nice. The only con was that we had a corner table in back of the huge center piece so we didn't have a good view of the trapeze show.

Excellent food, very fresh tasting with a lot of flavor. I liked the atmosphere but was expecting more of a green garden look but everything inside was dark and brown.   I would go back for the food next time I vacation in the area.
The food was amazing and the service was really good.  Strongly recommend the Moscovy Duck, it was the most tender duck I have ever had.
Love the atmosphere, but the 70's play list took away from the experience.  Great layout, love the decor, food was great, but the music took away from the opportunity to really create an experience.
The overall experience gets top marks, even if I only gave the food 4 of 5.  The location, the staff, the concept are all amazing.
The food was good. The waitress wasn't so friendly.
Very charming place. Food was very tasty! Service was great!
Delicious food and good service.  Expensive. Was a little disappointed in the décor.
Fabulous, consistent food - love the ambience - very special, unlike any other restaurants in Seattle - wonderful, intimate, French cafe feeling.  Service outstanding!

Amazing! My favorite place in the world now!!! you must try the famous lasagna...people were awesome and so welcoming.  Food was fabulous.  we had dinner here the first night we were visiting Seattle and it was so good we wen't back to the pink door our last day in seattle. an incredible place with an awesome vibe and fabulous food!

I always go for Seattle Restaurant week and ALWAYS order the veggie lasagna, which is to die for.   Great ambiance.  For lunch best to get there early--I go at opening.  By a little after noon, it is jam packed.  I go early for best and quickest service.
Excelente lugar y excelente comida 100% recomendable
A little tough to find if you are not from Seattle but go here!  This place does not disappoint.  Food is excellent, service is outstanding.  Make a reservation.

Once you find the [Pink] door, its one of the nicest atmospheres we've ever encountered - it has a feel more like Charleston or Savannah. Fantastic service, excellent food, reasonable prices - best meal we've ever had in the Seattle area.
I have been going to the Pink Door for 30 years and it never fails to delight.  Some menu staples persist but there are also wonderful seasonal options.
Great food. Delicious dessert. Portions were not too big. Ambience was appealing.
First time in Seattle and by far the best Italian restaurant I went during my visit. The food was great! The service was great! Pricey but it's worth it! I would definitely recommend and come again.

I met a friend for a restaurant week lunch at the Pink Door.  I was early and my friend was late but the staff were most accommodating. I decided on the restaurant week 3 course with wine pairing.  Since I had some time to kill while waiting for my friend I asked if I could have the first of the wine pairings to sip on while I waited.  No problem.  The waiter was attentive but not overbearing.
I got  a first course of crostini with tapenade. Very good.  Second was cioppino. Excellent.  Then for dessert an apple cake. The wine paired with the cake was perfect.
This is a restaurant that knows how to do it right.

This place never disappoints. I always order the lasagna, which is delectable and my husband always orders the pappardelle bolognese. The food is prepared consistently and we have never had a bad meal here. I could go here once a week!
This was our first visit to The Pink Door. The food was wonderful, plentiful, healthy, and well presented.  The staff was attentive and friendly. We loved it!
Sat at a pretty small  table close to door .  Otherwise everything else was awesome, most importantly the food.
This is a cool little gem hidden in the alley.

This is my third trip in the last 6 month - the food is consistently delicious and made with quality ingredients. The servers are friendly and are pretty knowledgeable about the food and its components.
Excellent Food, service and ambiance.  Highly recommended as a place to go with friends and enjoy a delicious, liesurely meal.
Excellent food and service. A little disappointed there was no performance while we ate, but, we just didn't plan well enough. Would go again!

The dining area felt very enclosed. Moved to the back area hoping for a view. Our table overlooked a back stairwell. The live music was a bit edgy. Tables were close together and my date was bumping elbows with the table the was tangent to ours. 

The service was great, but if you're looking for a nice view with your dining experience, this is not the place to go. 
I'm actually disappointed a few friends recommended this to me.
Love Pink door, great food!  Great service!

Very neat decor with lots fun paintings and wall art.  Great location in Pike Place Market.  Food was above average, but not outstanding.  Menu had a nice variety to choose from.  Live music was very pleasant.

the risoto was the best i ever had. great service. dessert not the best. very pleasant environment in the terrace.
inside too noise and hot.

Incredible craft cocktails- simplistic, smooth, and innovative. gorgeous fish entrees cooked to perfection with sizable portions, robust flavored pasta dishes.  Pricey.  Incredible ambience and overall vibe. Friendly staff. Would highly recommend.
Really Good food, they usually have better specials (sometimes super creative). Wait staff is average. The ambiance is great. They do refill water fast.
