We were 45 minutes early for our reservation and we're quickly seated without a problem.. entrees came surprisingly quickly even though they were very busy.  Make reservations.. we are from out of town and this is our second time back.. we will be back again

My first time here was in the late 80s. Eventually, I moved to the area and went there on many occasions, including my daughters (twins) 18 & 21 year birthday celebrations. Over the years this became a destination for our family. Nine years ago I moved to the Bay Area and when I  get the chance to go to Seattle, the Pink Door is on the top of the list. No matter what! 
It is whimsical, fun and truly a must NOT 'pass' kind of place.
For me, it's the food, the service and the atmosphere. I feel like I am transported to another place in time... In a good way. I could just move in and be content.
I had the halibut, my son had his favorite lasagna... And we shared a very nice chocolate cake with incredible ice cream. Timing is everything... We did not get to see the trapeze act or the Cabaret... Perhaps next time...

We brought a guest from North Carolina so she could sit on the patio and savor the Sound as well as the last tastes of summer. The heirloom tomato bruschetta is so wonderful that I almost dream of it. The crab risotto was fantastic as usual and we continue to love this place. We also love them fro their continued support of the Pike Market Clinic through the upcoming Feast of the Market fundraiser. It's Tuesday, October 4 and not to be missed!
Amazing scallops, best I've ever had! It was so fresh and prepared well. My husband had the crab risotto and that was delicious as well. Fantastic service as well. We will be back.

The service was outstanding and the drinks are slamming! The bruschetta was to die for, but I must say that the crab risotto was a little underwhelming...too much corn. But overall, it was a great dining experience and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Seattle.

It was very entertaining and we had a great time. 
We will be back for sure.
Sat on the patio on a beautiful afternoon, great cocktails and food. It was perfect!

Went to Pink Door to celebrate our birthdays.  It was an amazing meal in a beautiful setting. Loved the grilled octopus salad and the seafood pasta dish (with pasta made with squid ink).  The Dump Trump cocktail was also a highlight.

We came for an early dinner date and had a beautiful seat on the patio with a fantastic view of the water. Our server was knowledgeable and a delight. Food was full of flavor and normal portions (not giant portions). It was such a wonderful way to end our trip to Seattle!
Great place to go out to. Loved the food and the atmosphere is awesome.
Seattle landmark close to Pike place but focussed on serving locals as much as tourists.  Take your time to enjoy the unusual atmosphere and decor along with great food and creative drinks.

EVERY TIME WE COME TO SEATTLE,WE LIVE IN B.C. AND THE U.K.WE DINE AT THE PINK DOOR AND HAVE NEVER BEEN DISAPPOINTED-THE FOOD IS EXCELLENT AND OUR WAITER ON THIS OCCASION WAS VERY PROFESSIONAL,ATTENTIVE BUT NOT INTRUSIVE.DELIGHTED WITH THE EXPERIENCE

Our cocktails and wine were delicious, our meal was great, and our server was wonderful!  The only flaw was a loud, consistent humming noise in the main dining room that sounded as if a large truck was idling next to us.

This was our first time to The Pink Door and it was absolutely fabulous!  We went for lunch and sat outside.  Great view, and the food and service was amazing.  My only regret is that we had not gone before.  We will be back and highly recommend to friends.  The inside is adorable too and I would like to see the burlesque show some day.

We went here for our anniversary and it was a great experience overall. We were able to get seated earlier than our reservation without any issues. The staff and service were all very friendly and pleasant to dine with. We had the lasagna and the dish with all of the various seafood, I don't recall the name of it. The lasagna was superb and the seafood dish was good, just a bit too tomato-y on the broth for our liking. We wouldn't order the seafood dish again, however we will certainly return to the restaurant and try other options. Overall, the experience from the food, wine and service was really great and we had an excellent experience there.

This was our 2nd time going to the 'Pink Door' for lunch. The first time everything was great but this time it was very disappointing.  Our party was a group of five & we all felt that are entrees were marginal.  Two of us had 'Mama's Meatballs' with pasta.  Too salty and lacked flavor.  Chicken panini sandwich was much too  spicy.  A mushroom pasta was good & the heirloom tomato bruschetta was delicious.

Food  is fair. Meatball was good. Our server and most of the staff were rude. The exception was the bus boy who was kind and did a great job. We went at lunch and the shows are at night. We did have a nice view of pikes market and the water beyond. Touristy and could be fun at night.

Was told by hostess that there was a 45 minute wait although open tables were visible. Hostess said that they were needed for reservations. Stepped outside and made a reservation through Open Table for 15 minutes later.immediately seated. Hostess did not appear to recognize is when we returned 10 minutes later. Waitress and food were good - food was not as good as I would have expected from reviews.
Great food and good service
Great food and fall lunch on the outside terrace superb.  Great service worth the wait, wonderful food. Go!

One of my favorites and the favorite spot for my brother and sister-in-law from Colorado.  Love the outdoor seating for summer and the staff doesn't spend time trying to get you out the door as soon as you are finished.  It's nice to have a restaurant where you can relax and enjoy the people you are with.  I've been enjoying the Pink Door for about 30 years.  A great place and length of time they have been around tells you something about it.  Food is always great.

My wife & I selected a warm sunny day to have lunch outside on their patio area.  The service started out slow, but once it started it was friendly and more attentive.  I had the Bolognese and my wife had a salami panini.  Each was delicious along with a good bottle of chardonnay, which was recommended by the waiter.  The view of Elliot Bay was great along with the weather and the ambiance.  One of our favorite place for special occasions.
It was OK.  Definitely would like to return for a show. They sat us in the direct sun on a hot Seattle day so that was a little uncomfortable but it was nice
Great experience as always

Friendly service, excellent food which was very cooked and fresh tasting ingredients. Numerous Seafood choices and fresh pasta. Out group ordered the pasta with seafood (red and white sauces and Bolognese. Dessert of Plum Cake was rich with flavor but not heavy. The bar had some interesting choices of drinks. Overall we all had a wonderful time (also because we were able to get a table on the patio and it was sunny Seattle evening).
The food was ok not good. The service left a lot to be desired.

Eclectic , hidden, vibrant location - service was good - great appetizers -  octopus and tomato bruschetta  - my entrée - crab risoto was averaged not much crab.  The rest of our party had better luck with  the halibut and lasagna .

Loved dinner at the Pink Door.  There was a cabaret & burlesque show going on too as we finished our dinner.  I'm sure we weren't allowed to (as we hadn't purchased tickets), but the employees were not fussy about us stopping to watch for a minute before we headed out.  It was also my boyfriend's birthday, and our server gave him a lovely dessert treat with a candle.
I was recommended by friends to try the Pink Door.   I can't say enough about the ambiance, the view, the food and the service.  Would highly recommend the restaurant to those visiting the area.

I had not been to the restaurant for a very very long time. . I was entertaining a friend foodie from California. 
The waitress  was fantastic. The food exceeded expectations.  The olive oil is some of the best in the city.  I should of bought a gallon of it.  the views are good.and the out side deck is very cozy and comfortable.  would do it again.

My husband and I ate at The Pink Door when visiting Seattle recently on the recommendation of a friend. We had a great experience! The food was absolutely fantastic - so fresh and delicious! Our waitress was very helpful, friendly and attentive. It was a beautiful day, so we sat out on the patio overlooking the water. We would recommend!
We appreciated the atmosphère the service the food and above all thethe late dining
Great food and great service! Excellent pasta dishes.

We were traveling through WA and found The Pink Door on Trip Advisor.  The high ranking is well deserved, as the food and ambiance are top notch.  One of the best in Seattle, and yet a pretty good value.

Great service delicious food fun atmosphere decor funky
Definitely will come again
First time visit the Pink Door. Food, service, and atmosphere  were all superb. Looking forward to returning for dinner and to catch a show. What a wonderful find.
We were celebrating our 30 th wedding anniversary and this place was recommended to us.  It was terrific.  Good drinks, good food, good service.

Dinner and Service were great and enjoyed the scenery with the view of the Seattle's peninsula. It was a great view! The service was great from the host, bus-person, wait staff, and overall the whole restaurant. Made our evening eventful.
My husband and I eloped from Texas to Seattle and ended up eating The Pink Door for lunch shortly after we said 'I Do'. We enjoyed out time very much. I'd recommend the cheese plate; exceptional!!

The Pink Door is one of our favorites when we're down at the Market, and we take special friends and family there, knowing it will be a good experience. I wanted to give them 5 stars again this time, but our experience wasn't up to its usual excellence. We normally dine indoors and love the ambience, but this time we were on the patio and found it much less satisfying--noisy, uncomfortable, and crowded. We also had a miserable greeting from the young female hostess (I don't know her name) who was bordering on rude and unwelcoming. I had tried to change our reservation online to 5 people from 4 when my daughter unexpectedly was able to join us. I wasn't able to make the change and explained it to the hostess, who had us standing around waiting unnecessarily for someone to add two chairs (I told her we only needed one extra) and treated us as if we were imposing on her. The restaurant had just opened for lunch and we were the first to arrive, so it should have been easy to just scoot one chair over to the table and get us seated so we wouldn't be blocking the doorway. It was a disagreeable start to what was supposed to be a special luncheon for our family. That said, our server was great and the food was as good as we've come to expect. We'll be back.
Always love the Pink Door and go once a year when we visit Seattle 😊
Excellent experience at The Pink Door, food was excellent, atmosphere was great and service was impeccable. Recommended.

I love going to the Pink Door because of it's romantic feel and ambiance. I was slightly disappointed in the service and the food on this visit. Our waitress was very nice but the service did seem a bit slow. Our food took longer than normal so our waitress brought us salads, which was very nice. The lasagne was absolutely amazing but I was disappointed in the chicken entree. There was not a lot of flavor and it was not as moist it should have been. I do recommend this restaurant though as most dishes are wonderful.

Awesome food with great ambiance! There was live jazz music as we were finishing, and just a great overall atmosphere. The food was delicious, but my wife had some clam shell pieces in her clam pasta. That was the only downside to the meal. This place was great, and we recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle.
Went there under the impression we were seeing a show with our dinner. Instead told the performances are only shown on Sunday and Monday's :(

Hadn't been to The Pink Door in years.  We decided to bring an out of town guest of ours for dinner.  We all had an extraordinary and wonderful time.  Our server and other staff, food quality, even the relatively difficult cocktail orders we requested were all done perfectly.  We will definitely not wait years to come back!
Always fabulous whether on the outdoor patio with marvelous view of Seattle or cozily inside with witty, eye-pleasing eclectic decor.
It was our anniversary and The Pink Door went out of their way to make the night special.  The food was outstanding and the view is one of the best in Seattle.

While the specials all sounded tempting, only one of our party was enticed away from our choices and got the bucatini Al'amatriciana. The other two of us went with house favourites, linguine ala vongole, and pappardelle bolognese. Yummmo to all three.
We booked The Pink Door for a family staying at our hotel. They came back RAVING. So delighted, so impressed.
The food was good but there is better pasta in Seattle. For the price I can't say that the food was enough to bring me back right away.

Glad we made a reservation, even for 2 people!  The place was PACKED on  Monday lunch hour.  Of course, the weather was beautiful for Seattle, and the deck was overflowing into the inside dining space.
Food & view were very good.  Service was not very attentive.

The Pink Door is one of my most favorite restaurants in the Seattle area and in all my 
travels.  Its is just excellent food, friendly people working, and friendly people enjoying 
the atmosphere.  There is entertainment almost every night and it is very quirky and 
fun as well.   I am there by myself often and feel very comfortable doing it.  I love it!!

This place was so wonderful! Great food, Gretta was our waitress and she was fantastic. Made us feel relaxed and very knowledgable about all of the dishes. We will definitely go back and recommend to friends who visit Seattle!

My Husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary and opted to sit outside. It was a nice evening and dinner was delicious. People were really loud close to us. I noticed there wasnt any music outside.  Maybe that would have made the ambiance nicer.

My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner date at Pink Door. We sat on the patio, which was nice - but would have been even nicer if the weather had cooperated in being a bit warmer. Our server was very professional and attentive to our needs. He helped us to pick out cocktails and then a bottle of wine. We almost ordered the full antipasto platter, but he warned us not to if we were considering entrees as well. Thank goodness for that advice! The half-size antipasto plate was still a lot of food and so delicious!! I would recommend that appetizer to anyone going to Pink Door - it was my favorite thing of the night.  I was already almost full from the appetizer, so I ended up ordering an entree sized Caesar salad with grilled prawns. It was a good caesar but not my favorite - I'm kind of a fan right now of caesar salad where they actually grill the romaine itself - regardless , there was nothing wrong with it. My husband ordered the pasta special of the night with some sort of a tomato sauce made with pancetta and pork belly - the flavor was out of this world and the pasta was fresh and a perfect al dente. Finished off with a Spanish coffee, which was delicuious and strong

We were there for our anniversary and had a fantastic dinner.  The pink door was recommended by a friend and it didn't disappoint. We had outside balcony seating that over looked the water and yes, the food was great.
In Seattle for a weekend getaway and had a great meal outside on the deck!  Make reservations ahead, it fills up.  Don't miss the Dungeness Crab Risotto...best I 'be ever had!
The most delicious Italian food I've had in quite a while - up there with the very best in fact. Don't change a thing, you're doing it right.
I eat here everytme I visit Seattle.  It is my FAVORITE restaurant, anywhere.

Dominic is a a fantastic server - attentive, knowledgeable, fun.   You couldn't ask for more in a server.  Combine his service with great food and a fantastic view and you have a recipe for a quintessential Seattle evening!  Be sure to have the grilled bread!

The outdoor patio seating area was lovely with a view of Elliott Bay, the perfect place for a business lunch or date.  The beat and arugula salad was delicious and our server was friendly and attentive. They serve beautiful and interesting cocktails, one that passed by was sparkling pink with flower petals on top and looked refreshing.  We both had the salad but the dishes on other tables all looked appetizing as well.  They bring fresh sourdough bread and olive oil for dipping to the table automatically, so if you don't care for the extra carbs, let your sever know.  The interior ambiance was unique and inviting; I'll be back for dinner some night with my spouse.

Fabulous restaurant! A very enjoyable and unique evening experience. Loved the entertainment! Classy !
My husband and I shared the Heirloom Caprese salad and delicious Scallops which were cooked to perfection. Our waitress selected a nice red wine "Lagone" for our meal.  When we revisit Seattle we will most definitely dine there again.
This visit was fabulous- as always. The dining staff are warm and helpful but don't rush you at all. The deck on a nice day is superb.
Brought friends from California.  Lunch on the deck was absolutely perfection!
We had an excellent lunch at the Pink Door and look forward to stopping in for dinner the next time we are in Seattle.
very good service, the waiter was very kmowledgeable. excellennt food and wine and ambience
Our server Amanda was a sweetheart and very professional. The food was exquisite. In particular the caprese salad knocked my socks off with the locally-grown heirloom tomato - HEAVEN!!

It only took me 30 years to write this review as that is how many years I have been going to this great spot. Yes, there are many new spots to try in our great city, but there are simply none that compare to the Pink Door. To me, it is the epitome of Seattle- it has everything that people want when they travel the world to visit Seattle- a hidden gem, a view of Puget Sound. It is different. Excellent food and service. Love it in the winter as I feel I am in Europe when eating inside and love it as much in the summer on their great outdoor patio. I will keep going as long as they will have us- enjoy this special place!
Excellent food, excellent service with a great attitude

I was excited to be here again after many years.  Did not disappoint!
A most special thanks to our superb waiter

Love this restaurant -- delicious food and the Patio is a fun outdoor dining experience!  Service is good and specials are always interesting and fresh.    It is our "go to" choice for taking out of town guests!
Delightful in every way.
Overly hyped but still delish. Can't go wrong with the lasagna and grilled garlic bread.
Yummy food great wine, and the ambiance was fun!  We had a great time....could have sat there all afternoon enjoying the day!
My favorite restaurant for summer outdoor dining! I love the view, the food, the service, the wall mural....It's like a world of it's own.

"Antipasto of the house " was good. But "Grilled Octoopus" was terrible. The dish was full of beans. There are few octopus, moreover, these were burned.  
Unfortunately, pasta and risotto was not to our taste...

This place is one  of my "go to" place when work peeps come in to town and want to get a sense of Seattle.  It's right in the heart of Pike Place Market so out of towners get a great meal and see the workings of the Market a short distance away.  Good ambiance and the food is really good.  You won't be disappointed & your out of town co worker will be impressed with the local fare menu options and the view.

Heart of the Market outdoor dining can be dicey but Pink Door provides a protected, intimate setting with great food and great service. The staff is friendly and professional, menus filled with good lunch choices and reasonable prices. What more could one want in a lunch spot?
if you visit Seattle, this is a place you should go to have dinner. great location, fantastic views, and the service is friendly. I would not recommend to go with kids, although nothing wrong...

This is simply one of the most lovely dining experiences in Seattle. We save the Pink Door for the most special guests and the most memorable anniversaries, and it never disappoints. The staff is always gracious and frequently funny. The daily pizza and the crab & corn risotto are incredible. We love the array of the antipasto platter and the view from the deck is perfect. As we sadly bid our guest from Germany good bye, a consolation is that we will be going back to the Pink Door for our 40th wedding anniversary in another week and a half, hoping to repeat the same delights.

A lovely evening was had at Pink Door in celebration of my Husbands birthday. I had mentioned this in passing to the receptionist when booking and she ensured that the waiting staff knew it was his birthday and they delivered his dessert with a candle. We were given a table outdoors right by the beautiful view. The food was great, the ambience was great, it was overall a lovely evening.
Great service, great food, great spot dining on the patio. It was a very warm day, so the patio seating was perfect. Great place!

Treated my lovely wife to dinner here on our two-day vacation here from Victoria, BC, in order to go see the Guns n' Roses concert. Second time eating here. Overall, generally good service. The front desk gentlemen who was reviewing reservations had a very slight attitude, but other than that everyone else was great. Server was prompt, food came in a timely manner, and food and drink was delicious. Will definitely return, and I do recommend.
Had a very pleasant lunch on the terrace on a warm summer day. Delicious food and a very nice glass of wine.  What could be better?

This was an excellent lunch - the weather helped with an amazing outdoor patio experience, the food was excellent and cocktails refreshing.  We even had a server who observed some proper rules of etiquette - a rare treat these days (though those who don't observe them might find otherwise).
The Pink Door is a Seattle favourite - consistent excellent over the years. There are few restaurants that can claim that kind of record, especially those in the heart of a buoyant city center.
Wonderful fresh local food and great service as always!

Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants to go to for special occasions like reconnecting with friends or celebrating a birthday/anniversary. Delicious Italian food and can't beat the view from the deck on a gorgeous sunny day in Seattle.

Everything about this place was excellent.  The food was superb.  The outdoor patio was a perect setting (the weather cooperated).  The service was flawless, and the server very attentive.   I can't say enough good things about my experience.
This restaurant is lovely. We sat out on the patio looking at the ocean. The food was fabulous, the wait staff was attentive, it was a perfect day we couldn't have asked for anything better.
Food was good as always. I had the Cioppino as usual, and the portion was considerably less than what I have gotten in the past. Otherwise, everything else was terrific.

This place is a gem. A unique dining experience while maintaining a very approachable menu. Ambiance is excellent, it is a great place for a just a drink at the bar or a full meal in one of the three dining areas, one of which is a gorgeous outdoor terrace. Food and service were likewise fantastic.
Great food, great ambiance, friendly and helpful wait staff and impressive shows throughout the meal. It was a great way to spend our anniversary.
Despite being a well known tourist haunt, this was one of the best restaurants we visited in Seattle. The food was exceptional, the drinks were great, and the view was amazing.
Friends from out of town. Always a memorable experience both food and service
Best food, atmosphere and friendly knowledgeable servers. We are from Vancouver and will go to Seattle just for a dinner there.
I enjoys the Pinks Doors every time I go for eating.  I've been happy with thems for nearly twenty years!

We ate on the outside deck  on a beautiful night with a view of the waterfront. Casual but classy. Excellent waitstaff. Food prep & presentation excellent. Inside room sophisticated & appealing. Would return & recommend.
Andrew was EXCELLENT!!

Andrew was our waiter and he was very helpful, unpretentious, and friendly.    We mentioned in our reservation it was for our anniversary and requested outdoor seating.  We were seated in a lovely spot in the front open patio area.  Lovely .  Always enjoy this Euro feeling spot.   Great place for special occasions!
Great spot with unique entertainment.  Food is great and the energy is amazing.
AMAZING!! Wonderful ambience inside and out! Live entertainment nightly I believe.  Definitely sit outside if weather permits....

We go to the Pink Door a lot and always love it. This visit was especially memorable in that it was absolute perfection. Bruschetta with the most amazing tomatoes, salads, entrees - including our always favorite whole fish -  and desserts were delicious. Cocktails were perfectly poured and I always love the carafe of red wine and the tiny little glasses we fill again and again. One must go to the Pink Door at least once a summer for dinner on the patio and every winter for a cozy dinner in the unique dining room. Never to be missed, the Pink Door is really on top of their always excellent game in 2016.
Recommended by a friend. We had a wonderful time.  The food was yummy and the view spectacular!  A must!
Food was amazing!!!  Waiter - not so much!

My husband took me for my birthday and we had a beautiful evening!!  Sat outside, excellent service, incredible food!! He had the risotto with crab and corn and I had a yummy pasta dish with fresh basil. Wonderful experience!!!

My boyfriend and I were staying near Pike Place and the Pink Door was recommended by some friends of ours. What a great experience! Beautiful views of the water, a GORGEOUS interior decor, delicious food and drinks and very attentive (without being annoying) wait service. All around 5-star experience :) We will come back to this restaurant if we are in Seattle again in the future.

Everything was great except outside seating chairs. Outside seating is not that comfortable. Old chairs with colors off. Atleast expect new color to those chairs as the restaurant is expensive. Seating should be comfortable.  Otherwise food and service was excellent.
Experience was perfect! Staff was super professional and experience was wonderful.
Really great find, especially IF you can find it.  Patio was pretty scorching hot when we went.  Sweating while you eat was not so fun.

Pink Door just fell short of expectations based on reviews.   Promptly seated on the patio upon arrival at 8pm.  Interior dining rooms and patio were all pretty full.  Could see the jazz band from where we sat, but the soundproof windows are just that as you couldn't hear a thing. 

Service was pretty attentive up until dessert was dropped.  Then - our server was MIA for at LEAST half an hour -- took FOREVER to get our check - probably spent close to an hour waiting for the check and handling payment.

Food was good to mediocre.  We did the 1/2 order of House Antipasti, Lasagna Pink Door, Spinach Contorni & Upside Down berry cake.   The Antipasti was plentiful even for a 1/2 order and tasty - nothing special.  Lasagna Pink Door was OK - a little overcooked (too soft & slimy).  Spinach Contorni was tasteless  & bland - would never order this again - my cat could cook better spinach.  Upside Down berry cake was good -- on the lighter side which we wanted vs. Chocolate Gooey cake.  

Definitely can see how this would be an appealing place to take out-of-towners - patrons ran the gamut of cocktail dress to tourist garb.  The view was not that spectacular -but, enjoyable enough during sunset.  

Overall - kitschy and acceptable.  Would not go out of my way to come back again though based solely on the food.  Also - the "pink" door  on the Post side seems a bit dingy - with too much yellow making it more of a faded "creamy mauve"  door.
Consistently great food, servers & atmosphere.  A "must do" for anyone visiting Seattle!
Food, service and location are great.   Ambiance is good - but VERY noisey - even for early dining.    A little pricey.   Cudos for not adding in gratuity- we left a big tip, and plan to return.
Always love visiting and the service is outstanding!
Great place for lunch on a summer day.  Has a European ambience and the food is above average. Great espresso.
Great food. If the weather is nice, great setting for an outdoor dinner. Caprese salad, pappardelle, lasagna...all fantastic.

What a great find! Unique restaurant with wonderful waitstaff, eclectic fresh menu and wonderful wine list. Everything was delicious but the Fresh pasta with foraged mushrooms was Amazing. 
Homey nectarine blueberry cobbler with gelato and espresso the perfect finale.Will go back again!

My wife and I ate here recently while on vacation in Seattle. Very good food and service in a unique atmosphere.  Wish we could of stayed for the show Saturday but we had an early flight on Sunday. Cheers
The food was amazing and the service was excellent!!
We always enjoy eating at the Pink Door. Everything is great. Food is sourced locally. Service is freindly and attentive. One of our favorites.

My boyfriend and I are visiting Seattle and wanted a romantic dinner type of night and found The Pink Door. 

The decor and the ambiance of the restaurant was just perfect. To top it off, our server Amanda was excellent! I went with their special spicy seafood "squid ink" pasta and my boyfriend had the Pappardelle al Ragu Bolognese, both were popular dishes and sure enough.. they did not disappoint!! Both dishes tasted amazing and I specially loved the special "squid ink" pasta. Of course, we had to end our dinner with dessert and we tried their Chocolate ooey-gooey which also tasted great!

Overall, we had a great experience with this restaurant!!
The view was nice but the building is set further from the street so it feels like it's further system.
Tasty but over priced for the lunch we ordered. A caprese salad with 5 small pieces of mozzarella and tomatoes was $12.
You have to know where to sit for the entertainment.  They don't tell you.  We were sitting in a room not knowing there was live music in the area next to us.  Drinks were small.
I've been dining at The Pink Door for many years and it never disappoints.  The food is wonderful, the service is fantastic and the variety of entertainment is first class.
My husband and I really enjoyed our meal. The food and the service  were both very good.  It was a beautiful night and sitting on the patio would have made our experience even better!

A wonderful lunch and so willing to make it a special for us.  Really excellent wait staff and the darling girl at the reservation stand was amazing,She was beautiful with long dark hair and so 
nice... 

great food as always..love that place
Really fun. Excellent pasta. We also had the cheese plate. Lots of tables available in the bar area. No need to be in the dining room.

We sat on the patio and it was perfect. The drinks were great, the food was amazing, and the view outside was everything you could ask for. They were able to make room for us to watch the show as well which was great.

The food was delicious! We shared a starter, pasta and main in order to experience it all and it was more than enough food. Our waiter was awesome! So friendly and fun. The ambiance is great. We didn't see any of the shows but next time would make sure to go back for something while dining.

Great as always!! I was with my teenage son - all the families with kids were on the upper part of the deck - kind of corralled!  It was still very enjoyable.  Our server, Andrew, was the perfect blend of attentive and unobtrusive.  Food: superb although the mussels weren't well cleaned.  Everything else- very delicious.
Beti was a phenomenal waitress and we had phenomenal service. Wonderful food and wine selection and the view is scenic. Would go back in a heartbeat and will recommend to any friend visiting.

The food was amazing. The pappardelle with bolognese was ridiculously good. The house wine was lovely. The service was prompt and attentive. The outdoor seating area is picturesque. Everything about this dining experience was enjoyable. Can't wait to come back to Seattle and visit the Pink Door again.

Went on recommendations from friends.   Food was not up to the hype. Noodles and risotto over cooked,  mussels and clams full of sand, garlic bread lacked garlic,  sauce for fish of the day bland.    Go with caution as our review on trip advisor was bumped way down in just a day by a bunch of reviews that subtly contradicted our review.  Coincidence maybe but suspicious to have so many reviews in just one day and all positive on the very concerns I had.

Great view for lunch.  We sat outside on their upper deck and the view was terrific.
The food is excellent...we all had seafood dishes and they were fresh, tasty and
wonderfully presented.  Only disappointment was in the service.  Our server was
very slow to get our order and to follow-up to make sure all our needs were met.
Very good food and service... Charming and quirky restaurant.

I took my sister, who was visiting from Germany, to the pink door for lunch. We sat on the patio. Both of us enjoyed the overall experience, and I would recommend it for having lunch on a summer-day to enjoy  the view over the roof tops of the houses in that vicinity and puget sound.  The food was good, but not great. I had pasta with mushrooms which were too salty for my taste. And I had the feeling that everything was prepared ahead of time; the mains arrived at our table in less than 10 minutes time.

We visited Seattle recently.  Two friends recommended The Pink Door as a must.  We are so glad we did.  Food was excellent (Cioppino, lasagna, risotto, meatballs, caprese salad).   
Lovely view from the deck.  Look forward to a 2d visit when we return to Seattle area.
Never disappoints!  Love the food, sitting on the deck and the ambiance.

Because my friend visiting from SFO had treated me to many great dining experiences there, I wanted to do the same for her. I looked at dozens of restaurants online, my criteria being an intimate setting, good food, not too expensive, and some kind of view. I stumbled upon the Pink Door and it happened to be everything I'd hoped for. Casually chic, small, unique, with a laid-back but efficient server, good food, and a wonderful view and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.
The Pink Door is definitely a go to spot for out of town visitors or just amazing italian food. Great views and amazing location.
The Pink Door was the best meal we had the entire trip. Such a unique place with character!

I come here for my birthday lunch with girlfriends every year for many many years and have never been disappointed! Everything is impeccable, from the time I make the reservation until the time we walk out the door. The service, the food, the view! The Pink Door is quintessential Seattle.. Please never leave us!!
Pink Door is amazing!! Excellent Italian cuisine. Wonderful service. Eclectic atmosphere including trapeze artists?!  Love love love this place!!
Was traveling. Had great dinner paired perfectly with wine. Show in the back was a blast as well. So accommodating. Much appreesh. Will make it a destination next time we're in Seattle.

A Seattle destination- quirky and fun place for dinner- more about the setting and ambience than anything else.  Be sure to ask when the shows are and make your reservation accordingly- otherwise you will miss the whole point of The Pink Door!  Good good, service, decent wine list.
Got in earlier than reservation time.  Help were very accommodating, since we arrived early.  Food was delicious from a limited menu.  Would certainly dine there again if in Seattle.  Very quaint.
Whenever I have out of town guests, I always take them to the Pink Door.  The food and service is always top notch.  Also being in the Pike Place Market is an added bonus.
Just great... Really enjoyed it.

Our first visit to Seattle, we decided to try this restaurant with outside seating . The first item we ordered was carpaccio.  While it was tasty, as we began to eat it, we noticed that the garnishment had a hair in it.  We quietly showed the waitress and she agreed and took it away without charging us for it.  She then asked how we had found out about the restaurant, we told her Open Table.  The next thing we knew, our reservation had been cancelled by the restaurant.  Open Table reinstated the reservation.

It seemed to be a nice restaurant, but we will not return there.

THE PINK DOOR IS REALLY A FANTASITC PLACE FOR THE AMBIENCE.  THREE OF US ATE THERE WHILE ON VACATION AND ALL OF US WOULD RATE THE FOOD A 6 OUT OF 10.   I HAD THE STEAK SALAD AND ORDERED MEDIUM RARE STEAK BUT WHEN IT ARRIVED IT WAS CHEWY.   TOO BAD.   THE HOSTESS WAS NOT SUPER WELCOMING AND MADE A POINT THAT WE WERE 15 MIN EARLY FOR OUR 9PM RESERVATION WHEN THERE WERE PLENTING OF TABELS.   STRANGE.
I love this restaurant, had an amazing homemade pasta lunch with my Mother!

Had a wonderful meal at The Pink Door! Service was fantastic and very attentive. I had the famous Pink Door Lasagna which I devoured very quickly! I only wish there was more.. My wife had the mussels which she also liked. This restaurant is a bit hard to find in the alley, but obviously you will know when you come across a pink door. Would definitely recommend my friends to come here..
The Penn Cove clams and mussels are incredible!  Always my favorite.
Excellent food and great entertainment.

Really nice restaurant.  Easy to find.  Waited at the bar while table was being set (we were early).  Some nice drink specials.  Apps and dinner came out perfectly.  Waitstaff was responsive and very knowledgeable.

Visited with family from out of town.  Food was fantastic, and wine was pretty good too. Our server was not very knowledgeable about wine, but brought out a wine book that had all the descriptions we could ever need!
Only minor complaint was when they called to confirm and asked if we wanted inside/outside we went with inside to watch the trapezist.  We ended up outside-  which was gorgeous so no complaints-  but just mildly frustrating.
We had a very pleasant dining request. The server was respectful and our eating modifications were addressed perfectly. I would definitely recommend the restaurant.

We went to the Pink door on a recommendation from a coworker during our vacation to Seattle.  It did not disappoint!  The food was excellent and the entertainment was impressive!! I would highly recommend the Pink Door for dinner.
Great claims, bruschetta, pasta dishes. Amazing brownie dessert. Great service. Sit outside for a view. We'll be back!

The location was very convenient to our Downtown Hotel and is part of Pikes Market Place. As usual, I find that seating is prompt when making a reservation through open table. The other nice thing is that you receive a confirmation when scheduling through Open Table and then there is a follow up the day before.  Food and service were excellent at the restaurant.

This place should be touristy and cheesy and heck maybe it is a little but is also serves damn good food and has a great ambience.  Those 800 people who said the pesto lasagne is great on Yelp weren't wrong and the octopus is pretty darn tasty too. 
Delicious and great value. Keep up the good work.
We had a great time. The food was delicious and very flavorful.  We  were fortunate to sit outside. Cudos to the chef and staff.
Their summer menu is terrific, and the cocktails were perfect for an evening dining on the patio!

My steak was very over cooked
Everything else was ok, but the steak was bad

Their food is so great & consistent - and quick to arrive which is super appreciated for lunch! Drinks are great, too! The service is wonderful in the evening, but I have to say when I was there for lunch recently it seemed like they have their B-squad out. Of course, their B-squad is still pretty solid, just not their usual A-team that they have during the evening during the most popular times (when have the trapeze, etc).

We really enjoyed every aspect of our meal.  Service was excellent and the food and drinks were high quality.  We even decided to go back during our trip.  Both visits were impressive--one as walk in and one with a reservation.
Had excellent lunch.  Tough to get in, but used the Open Table app while waiting in line for hostess to book reservation that became available.
Always love going to the Pink Door. Staff has been friendly and the food is always amazing!
From my first meal there 24 years ago I've never had less than a fabulous experience.
Delicious home made pasta and best salmon I've ever had - terrific restaurant.

I came to the pink door for my birthday and was blown away by the quality of the service, the amazing drink selections and how knowledgeable and sweet the staff were. The gentleman who helped with my table (I wish I could remember his name but he had brown hair) was very vibrant and helped us to navigate both the food and drink menu expertly. I had the chicken and my mother had the mussels and clams and both dishes were incredible. Our wine was so good we had to get another glass. I can't rave enough about this place and I can't wait to visit again soon.   

Also the wine display with the cork in the seal was beautiful.

Best meal we had in Seattle!
Will visit again when we return.
It was fantastic. Food was delicious. Funky place and fun atmosphere.
An old standard, worth a return visit. It has been years since I have eaten there. I was delighted with the ambiance, service and food quality. And will put it on my list of regular places to dine.

Loved the unique entertainment.  Trapeze artist.  If you can  get past the hostess who wanted to make us sit outside despite the fact of making the reservation for inside 2 weeks in advance. Nice waiter
The pink door is a very unique restaurant! It did not disappoint! Next time we're in Seattle we will pay another visit to the Pink Door!
Great experience: drinks, dinner, dessert, service.  Top notch!

A great experience for locals and visitors. I love to bring people here on Sunday and Monday nights when they have ariel entertainment in the main dinning room. I just wish it were easier to book a reasonable time through opentable! Doesn't matter if I book 3 or 4 weeks out, It's always 9pm or 9:30pm table times available. Guess that's not the worst problem to have as a restaurant. So make sure you plan ahead if you want to score a seat in the main room!
Overall was a great experience but didn't really like the announcer guy. Wanted more acts and people hanging from ceiling etc.

The biggest draw for my wife and I to The Pink Door is the ambience. The decor is unique and nice. Although the food was good, our food was slightly cold when it was brought out to us. Also, the service was somewhat mixed. We were congratulated for our anniversary so I appreciated that. However, when we showed up for our reservation, we were told to come back in 10 minutes. When we came back, the table was not ready and we had to wait an additional 20 minutes. All in all, I think The Pink Door is a unique and decent dining establishment. However, I  do not intend on coming back since there are better options in terms of food and service.
Highly recommend! Found on Yelp and will definitely return. Very good food from the bread and olive oil to the sausage pasta that I ate and the whole branzino fish my husband devoured!!
Limited menu selections (personal preference), uncomfortable seating, WAAAAAY too loud.
Have been going to the Pink Door for over forty years, and I live in Portland.  Thank you for not changing.  You have great staff and food!
We really enjoyed the food, ambiance, service, and entertainment at The Pink Door. Tanya's trapeze act was such a treat to watch! Don't miss it if you're visiting Seattle!
food was fabulous. It was my birthday and anniversary and they were aware but did nothing for it  booo
Went here on a recommendation from a friend.  The food was nothing short of AMAZING!  Unique decor, excellent service.  If you are visiting Seattle, do not miss eating here!!
Food was good, service was good, the hostess was a little cold.

Although it is a hot spot and I was told to go there by many. It was just okay. The few things on the menu I wanted were out. The price was high for what you got. It was tasty, but not worth it. You can go to the garden at Pike's Market for the same price and go eat elsewhere as well. It was my least favorite meal on my trip.
great food, great service and a great atmosphere  for dinner

The pink door is a great place to eat at Pike Place market. They have an excellent seafood selection together with several pasta and key Italian offerings. Their patio overlooks the market and offers a sheltered, but open-air experience.
Excellent as always! A great go to restaurant where you can count on great food.
Can't say much more that. Food has never been a miss, drinks are unique (in a good way!)
Yet another lovely meal at the Pink Door! The patio is charming, service is discreet, and food is always good.

My close friends and I have been so busy at work lately and we wanted to go somewhere with good food, wine, and nice location.  That day I went to open door and made a reservation for the Pink Door.  It was quick and easy. And the food was delicious! Someone told me to try the veggie lasagna and it was amazing!

Pink Door is always incredible. Great atmosphere. Service that includes warm attention to detail. Food that always hits the spot. I also really enjoy that their menu changes seasonally so there is something new to try every time I visit. This is the type of restaurant that the very best they have to offer is on the specials menu. I usually choose at least one of my courses from there

Knowledgeable wait staff.  They were able to accomodate special requests - knew exactly what to tell my friend NOT to order, and what they were not able to change for her needs.  Amazing service and great view - the noise level was a little quieter outside, but it is noisy inside.  It's worth it as the food is great and the ambiance is perfect for all types of get togethers.
Not your momma's Italian restaurant. Lot's of fun, unusual choices. Especially appetizers. Gluten-free options. Good service. Good wine choices. Located on an alley in pike place market. Nice patio.
Great outdoor seating
One of the great Seattle patio dining experiences
Sat outdoors, moderate noise level from outdoors but plenty quiet for easy conversation. Food was excellent, nice view from outdoors upstairs balcony dining.

We ate outside on a beautiful May evening.  The food was delicious and service attentive. Our server, Greta, knew the menu and offered specific recommendations for each inquiry.  Our party of 6 was  in agreement that we would return the next time we are in Seattle!

We were next to a group of women who literally screamed at each other the entire time. We had a reservation but weren't seated until 20 minutes after ( standing outside in the rain).  No bread was served while all other tables got bread.

Server was fine and food was as good as expected but the experience was honestly awful. It is a much better place for a weekday work lunch than Saturday night because the staff chooses to not deal with problem customers.
My spouse and I had a very enjoyable lunch at this restaurant. If your in the Pikes Market area and in the mood for a very good Italian meal, try this restaurant.

The Pink Door is a gem in Pike Place Market.  I've gone to the Pink Door many times over the course of 20 years and it always lives up to its reputation and always delights. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is always fun and the service is super attentive.

I've enjoyed Pink Door over the years, but the food on this past visit was so bad I am doubtful I will return. To the restaurant's credit, the floor manager comped two of our dishes, but the experience was so disappointing I would not take the chance on returning.
Excellent meatball panini and pasta bolognese.  Meatballs were excellent as well as the linguini with th clams.  Our server was ver sweet and helpful with the menu.

Had no idea there was entertainment in addition to the great food!  An acrobat artist hosted three different short performances, very tasteful.  The food was delicious Italian style, we enjoyed signature vegetarian lasagne, risotto of the day, desert was amazing.  The grilled tuscan bread and EVOO was yummy as a starter.  The service was spot on and timely and everyone was very friendly.  Fun atmosphere for my mom's 82nd birthday!

The restaurant is creatively decorated and sets a great mood.  Everyone seemed to be having a wonderful time...including my husband and I.  The service was great.   We ordered the house antipasti, Osso Bucco and polenta.  I would say that the food is good, but not outstanding.

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Pink Door.  Our waitress was terrific,  very efficient and pleasant. Everyone in our party enjoyed their entrees and we all left knowing we would be back. Kay Briggs

The lasagna is a must. Best in the universe. 
You can't visit Seattle and not eat at the Pink Door- its a must .

Always enjoy dining here especially if we can grab an outdoor table on one of those rare sunny spring days in Seattle!  What made this extra special was the hostess and our server.  We got there early but were promptly seated and the rest of our party was late. Didn't phase anyone as we were all made to feel welcomed the entire time.

Halibut special was amazing and very tasty.  Antipasto plate is always good. Mussels and pasta with peas also delivered. Service was great .... There at the right time,  efficient and friendly. Not to be missed - a ice break from the bustling market.
Great food and service.  Highly recommend it

Great spot for a date night! Was charming and intimate was perfect. However the only disappointing part was no acrobats. I was excited to surprise my husband, but soon found out it's only for Sundays and Mondays which I thought was odd days to have acrobats when everyone is going out on Friday and Saturday. Other then that food was delicious and service was great! Would recommend acrobats on Friday and Saturday nights! Would be a great addition to a night out!

The Pink Door is a delicious restaurant.  It is located on Post Alley near Pike Market.  The restaurant does not have a sign, but has a pink door.  We had a delicious lunch on the patio.  I would encourage a reservation, even for lunch.  My husband has the scallops, which he devoured.  I had the halibut tacos, which were good.  We are glad we had lunch here.

fantastic service and superb food.  The outdoor dining was a pleasant surprise as well.
Just sad that it's not in my home town.  I will definitely go again when I am in Seattle.
Good for few options
Trapeze was different and quite enjoyable. Food and service was excellent.

Interesting place with a good variety of gluten free options.  Even offered GF bread, which is always unexpected and a bonus.   Food was very good, service was excellent, venue was unique and interesting. The trapeze artist was amazing and certainly added to the unique experience.
A must visit Italian restaurant when coming to Seattle. The food and service is impeccable, complete with beautifully choreographed acrobatics show.
Great Service from start to finishfor our party of 8  - our server Thomas was informative and wonderful
Beautiful location, exceptional food, simply amazing experience!

It's amazing how good the Pink Door is after all this time.  The staff was professional and efficient. The wine list well chosen and reasonably priced.   I highly recommend the antipasto,  cioppino,  the steak,  and any of the fresh pasta they produce.  Save room for dessert.
My friends took me there for my bday and had a blast! Thank you pink door
I LOVE your grilled cheese and tomato soup combo and have been a little bummed the last few times I've been there to see that it wasn't on the menu.

I read reviews and this restaurant surpassed them! The ambience, unusual and dramatic interior, location in Post Alley at Pikes Place in Seattle were all superb! 
I had emailed from England weeks before our trip to ask for a table with a view over the waterfront and mentioned it was my birthday . As soon as we were seated at the exact table I'd requested the lovely lady who served us wished me 'Happy Birthday' and when it came to dessert there were candles to blow out! 
It was a Friday night and the restaurant was buzzing with locals and tourists and a Band of Musicians was playing which added to the great feel of the place.
Loved it. Wish it was down the road from us here! Thank you to you all at the Pink Door!

Great vibe with great food. Ordered a vongole and my friend ordered a risotto, and we both loved our dishes! The bread came with an orange vinegar, and it matched perfectly with our dishes. Perfectly completed our Seattle trip!

We appreciated high quality food, attentive but not invasive wait staff and a beautiful, unexpected warm spring evening.    We sometime avoid the Pike Market area due to the high volume of tourists, but took advantage of an early dining time.   We'll be back.
The deck at the pink door makes every experience special

We arrived at the wrong time. No problem: a table was provided.
The food was delicious. The service was perfect. 
Plus there was live music.
The price was right.

Such a great location! Stroll through the market and make your way to the "Pink Door"!  Fun cocktails before dinner, and the most incredible olive oil with bread!  We ordered the trout and lasagna and both were really good! We had an awesome experience!

Going out for my girlfriends birthday, I wanted something special.  and we got it!  I was called earlier in the day to confirm and asked whether we wanted to seat outside, and we got the BEST seats outside in the corner with the best view.
the cocktails were smooth and punchy (vodka for her, gin for me), the dozen oysters were perfect.  for main course, I got the largest fish I had ever eaten an Alaskan Rockfish that was both succulent and easy to get off the bone.
for dessert the butterscotch she got smooth and sweet, and my chocolate dessert was decadent, both washed down by complementary prosecio.  service was friendly and attentive when we needed it with regular water refills on a warm .  there was enough noise that you knew the place was buzzing, yet quiet enough to easily converse.  made for a beautiful special occasion experience
my only complaint would be the lack of sign outside, ... I needed to remove my sunglasses to confirm the door was pink :)
Outdoor patio, check! Sunshine, check! Great food and service, check!

We love THE PINK DOOR. Such a treat to enjoy the market, smell the flowers, maybe do a  Washington wine sampling next door prior to dinner...then eat like Kings and Queens! And don't forget desert! So fun, simply delicious, with such great caring by all!

The Pink Door has been around a long time, but it never disappoints. Tried new menu items for me this time and each one was terrific. House wine is amazing. Definitely recommend it--a favorite among many of my friends.

We red wonderful reviews so booked a reservation.  We then heard while in Seattle from some locals that it was just ok.  We thought about cancelling but so glad we did not!  The menu was fantastic, our server was wonderful, we got an outside seat with a great view, we brought our own wine that we bought from a wine store just down the block, $20 corkage or maybe 25, but the wine list was good and we got another glass at the bar and listened to some live music.  Great experience all around and so happy we decided to go!

Thank You Pink Door for making our honeymoon a special occasion. We had so much fun sitting inside watching the trapeze artist, it was enchanting and like nothing I've ever experienced before. The food was amazing. Thank you Andrew for the appetizer recommendation, the bagna cauda was unique, fresh and so delicious. Everything from start to finish was absolutely perfect. Will return when in Seattle again.
The service was great, the food was excellent

It was our 40th anniversary and everyone took exceptional care of us.  From the  minute we walked down the stairs our exceptional customer service began.  And the  wine and food were 5 five stars. If you want a wonderful evening,  I highly recommend The Pink Door.
Asparagus appetizer was fantastic. So was my pasta dish with the ham and peas. Yum! Atmosphere is top notch. Service was too.

We visited the Pink Door on a Saturday evening, it was one of those warm Spring days when you really enjoyed the weather. We sat outside on the porch with a wonderful view of the harbor. The  food was really hit-and-miss. We love authentic Italian food so we ordered the antipasto place (amazing) and caesar salad (outstanding), and the pea-crusted bruscetta (zero flavor). My wife ordered the salmon tagliatelli because she loves salmon: the salmon was cut into very small pieces that were completely absorbed by the cream sauce (I love the taste of salmon but I want big enough pieces that I can actually taste it), I would give it a B- at best. I ordered the lamb osso buco and was very disappointed--extremely salty, the broth tasted like pure soy sauce and I had no interest in sopping up the juices. I would not order it again. Maybe if I ordered  the fresh pasta I would have had a better experience.  Positives: ambiance and service. Negatives: be careful what you order, read reviews beforehand.
Great ambiance ! Good food .
I LOVE this restaurant.  I will never tire of dining at Pink Door. Every visit is delicious and memorable. Thank you, thank you, thank you! ;)
The best meal I've had while here in Seattle. Try the Tagliarini dish. #Amazing!
Our favorite restaurant in Seattle. Food and service always superb with excellent bar as well.

My husband and I had a wonderful lunch at Pink Door on the patio overlooking the bay. It was a beautiful day and the food was delicious. Service here is excellent! Be sure to look up the hidden gem when you are in Seattle!

A coworker recommended a stop at The Pink Door during out stay in Seattle. We happened to make reservations for the last night of restaurant week, so we ordered off the special menu. The food was delicious, but for the price, portions were so small we ended up going somewhere afterwards since we were still hungry. The butterscotch boudin was delicious, but 4 stalks of asparagus for 1st course and a small piece of swordfish and 3 chunks of potato for 2nd course was not what I expected for $30/per plate.

Went here for Restaurant Week lunch with the boyfriend.  Had spring-themed crositinis and risotto, and my guy had the cioppino.  The food was delicious.  We sat on the outdoor patio with great sunny weather.  Service was a bit slow at lunch time.  I feel ambivalent about this place, it was good, but it didn't blow me away.  The decor is also a little kitschy.
Food and service at this spot are superb. Staff are knowledgeable and able to recommend wine to go with your meal. The lasagna is rich and creamy, the fish fresh and the ambience is romantic.

The Pink Door is known for its lasagna and that is what my boyfriend and I decided to try for Restaurant Week. The lasagna was great, however the rest of the dinner was just a little disappointing. I realize that portions are small during restaurant week, however the appetizer was just a little laughable. The Caesar salad came out as three uncut romaine lettuce leaves. It was a fine salad, there was enough dressing on it and some croutons on the side, but the presentation odd. The blistered asparagus was three asparagus with a little egg and bacon bits on top. It tasted fine, but again, we were a little surprised at how little we received. Another thing I will note is that our waiter lacked luster and seemed to not like that we were there for restaurant week. I understand that overall it brings in less money per table, however I did not appreciate being looked down upon for choosing to partake in the restaurant week menu. Overall, The Pink Door is good for special occasions if you want to choose finer dining, but I wouldn't go back any time soon and definitely not for Restaurant Week again.
Appetizers and entrees were outstanding. Very good selections for Seattle restaurant week.

The food tasted wonderful,  with nuances from herbs and great olive oils. Our vegetarian choices were so delicious and presented beautifully.  It was a warm April day, so we got to sit outside, which was an unexpected plus.  Service was great!

Want a bite whilst perusing the paradise that is the Public Market?  Want a nice outdoor table with a great view  and really nice, friendly, staff and good food? How about a nice place to take that special someone? One place comes to mind: The Pink Door. I took my hunny-bunny there for luncheon, it was absolutely delightful! I cannot reccomend it more highly. Try for an outside table, nearthe rail, but the tsbkes are all great for luncheon al fresco. We will definitly go back.
Best Italian in the city!

Food was really great.  We did Seattle Restaurant Week; but it only had two options on the menu.  I ended up buying a dessert, only to have the waitress bring a "taste-size" dessert out to us with our check.   I thought that was lame, because I would have just had that instead of ordering a $9 dessert.  Bread was excellent.  Water glasses filled and plates brought and given in very good time.  All of the service was good, except for that.

I'd been meaning to go to the Pink Door for a long time. I finally went for Restaurant Week. It was a great deal, and the food did not disappoint. Even better, the service was exceptional. I have had other Restaurant Week experiences where I have been treated like a lower-tier customer, but the servers at the Pink Door encouraged me to try the special menu, thanked me repeatedly for my business, and even gave me a special unlisted mini dessert with the special. I will definitely recommend the Pink Door to others.
Everything we had was excellent.  Wonderful dining experience.

We were visiting the area from Philadelphia and this was easily the best food we ate during the entire trip. The ambiance was great and the waitress was pleasant and knew what she was doing. We will definitely be back when we're in Seattle.

Generally I like their environment and performance. Lasagna and Olive Oil Cake are really delightful and tasty. Scotch pudding was also outstanding. But unfortunately, other appetizer and entree didn't stood out at all: risotto was not creamy; cioppino was bland; swordfish was not tender enough due to the fish itself; a little bit over for the grilled asparagus and the lemon sauce.
Awesome outdoor seating. Went for restaurant week and loved the courses and wine pairings.

Went w/a group of 4"5 & everyone's meal was excellent.
Best olive oil I've ever had...

Atmosphere is amazing and very romantic. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Food was delicious, however my only complaint is portion sizes are very small. Both my girlfriend and I were still hungry upon leaving. For how expensive it is, a decent portion size should be a reasonable request.
The meals was great!

this is the first place i seen that was rated highly in Seattle, i wanted to surprise my girlfriend with dinner reservations because she usually picks the place and time. We flew in from california and prepared for this, we checked out the menu and kept changing what we really wanted. Once we sat down it was lovely, nice weather, the food was great and the service was awesome!
Come here every time I visit Seattle.  Don't think I will be back as the menu was unchanged and lacked interest.
Loved the pesto lasagna.
This is such a great place!  Love the atmosphere, great service and super delicious food. Highly recommend taking guests from out of town.

Went to a 6:45pm dinner here with reservations. Excellent menu and amazing service. Such a cool place. Unique decor and a great ambiance. I will go here again and again until I have tasted the menu in its entirety. Delicious!
The weather was soooooo nice
We had ahi tuna cappacio, rabbit pasta dish and seafood soup. They are all great. We love the food and service here. Will definitely come back again.
The "Pilnk Door Lasagne" is delicious!  It is vegetarian , but hearty enough for meat lovers.
Amazing place!!

Our server was horrible. She didn't tell us her name. Recommend a dish or anything out of the ordinary. When I asked her a question she was annoyed and seemed uninterested in anything I had to say.... It must have been a real bad night if she only had to tend to about 4 tables. I'm never going back!

Every time I come to the Pink Door, I'm impressed with the service. The waiters are friendly and prompt, but never pushy or intrusive, and there's always someone walking around filling water glasses before I even have to think about asking. The food is divine, and I've never had to wait long for my order. Not that I'd mind, as it would still be worth it! The mafalda con sugo has become my usual order and its delectable, with a perfect blend of flavors and fantastic housemade pasta. This time my friends and I also ordered the cheese board, which had a great combination of cheeses and other items. Definitely worth every penny. The ambience is also lovely, and perfect for a girls night out or a romantic evening. I recommend this place to everyone!

A great place for a special occassion and a must do while visiting Seattle. Not for young kids however. Food is fabulous and the trapeze artist was a great addition to the ambiance of the Pink Door. Entertainment is different each night. Make reservations in advance.

Beatrice was excellent. !! providing great service...and veryfun...Thank You Beti.
That said the food absolutely excellent.

Great Evening....

My date and I thoroughly enjoyed eating at the Pink Door.  My date loves Italian food and we are at a couple of so so places around Seattle but the Pink Door did not disappoint.  The Tuna Carpaccio was incredible.  The house lasagna lived up to its standard and the seafood risotto was decadent.
Great spot. Lasagna, cheese board, and kale salad were fantastic. Highly, highly recommend stopping here if you're in the market area.
Great ambiance and Italian food, especially the lasagna.  Other two pasta dishes we got were a bit off on balance- too sweet, too rich/lacked flavor.  Overall great experience.

I wish we could have liked this place more.  My husband got a grilled fish that was too charred, my lasagna was just so-so.  Another family member loved the pasta with meat ragu.  It was just ok as far as Italian restaurants go.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. The food is delicious and the ambiance is very unique. It's truly one of a kind.
Great environment, great food. Perfect date spot.
Honeymoon dinner! Can’t wait to come back for our 3 year anniversary. I tell everyone to go here. ♥️ the spinach lasagna was so good I’m drooling over it 2.5 years later...

We were seated promptly for our 8 o'clock reservations. Our Waiter was informative and efficent. Shared the Smoked Fish Appetizer, Delicous. We enjoyed two entrees: "Signature" Pink Door Lasagna, as well as the Grilled Duroc Pork-Chop. Must do the Doughnuts for Dessert!

Based on the many rave reviews online, we made a last minute plan for dinner at The Pink Door.  We had walked by a few nights before and had wondered what it was.  We were delighted with our wine, meals, desserts all delivered with wonderful, friendly service.  Our waiter was a delight - engaging but not intrusive.  A fantastic night out - we were so glad they were able to take us on short notice!
Fabulous! Best lasagne in town.

First time and was everything I had hoped it would be. It was a surprise birthday for my partner and a small group of our best friends were waiting as we walked in. It was perfect! Our server was sweet, funny and very knowledgeable. The room was filled with a great ambiance and even though my group was loud (we laugh A LOT) it still had a romantic feel.  Thank you for making a very special occasion even more special for me and more importantly for my girl. She was overjoyed!

We had a wonderful night at The Pink Door.  The food was delicious, the service was on point our server went above and beyond after the meal to get us a table where we could enjoy the live music. The drinks were amazing the bartender made me a delicious gin drink that I wish was on their menu. We had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back.
Outstanding food, Bolognese pasta and lasagna were awesome.

I have always enjoyed coming to the Pink Door and suggesting it to people out of town. The food and drink are always great. Our service during this last visit started out great, but went south when we asked for a split check. I appreciate that splitting a check during a busy shift can be a pain for a server, but this afternoon was pretty slow. After we asked for the split check, it took a little over 15 minutes to check out. The server continued to serve all tables around us as we waited to be checked out (cards sitting in the small buckets ready to swiped). Instead of helping us, she continued to refill waters and ask other tables if they needed anything.  It was noticeable to everyone as the table and made for an uncomfortable experience.  I had a meeting after lunch and I was almost late due to the long process.
Service was wonderful!  Saw one acrobatic show,  it was amazing! Perfect location before heading to a show at the Showbox!
This is a beautiful restaurant on all counts.  The food is delicious the ambience is romantic and the entertainment mesmerizing.
Very attentive and friendly staff!!

It's been years since I've been to The Pink Door which is such a shame.  Everything they serve is absolutely delicious.  I literally cleaned my plate and wasn't overall stuffed.  I started with Insalata Misticanza which was so nice and simple yet so flavorful especially with the fresh herbs in it.  For my entree I had the Pappardelle al Ragu Bolognese which was stunning!  Their homemade pasta was to die for and the sauce was perfect in every way.  I think I could have eaten two servings.

The atmosphere is so charming and fun.  I need to go back sooner rather than later!  Their deck is so lovely in the summer too.
Dined with two good friends. Everything was superb!

Just went last weekend with some friends.  We were quickly seated.  Everything about this place was great.  I ordered the lasagna and it was perfect.  I was scraping the cheese off the edge of the dish.  We never felt rushed.  I really want to go in Summer when we could sit outside.  All in all our entire group said they had a great meal.  The cocktails were tasty too.

I went with a friend from out of town. We had no idea what to expect, but every part of our experience was wonderful. Our server was so friendly and attentive. I ordered the pork chop and she ordered steak, and we shared a bit. Every morsel was delicious. The side dishes were presented as thoughtfully as the main dishes. I have already recommended Pink Door to friends. Btw, we were there early on a Thursday evening so there was no scheduled show, but we enjoyed it immensely nonetheless.

We took our out of town friends for dinner and a trapeze show. They had a wonderful time, as did we. Always such great, friendly service. Outstanding food and wine.  And the trapeze woman was spellbinding!
Incredibly attentive service. Amazing pairings on the cheese plate. Incredible porkchop!

I thought the food was very good.  I had the lasagna.  I don't typically like lasagna, because I don't care for the ricotta cheese, but fortunately, their lasagna didn't have any of that.   Probably the best lasagna I've ever had.  Service was a little slow, but the restaurant was completely full.   The server did do a good job overall, was very pleasant and helpful.  It is a small place, or at least it felt that way.  I did feel a bit crowded.  But the food is worth it.

I dine here everytime I am in Seattle. 
I really love this place
The food is fantastic!

We had an amazing lunch here , starting with a beautiful daiquiri topped with a sprig of rosemary. We began with some lovely fresh oysters and moved on to a beet salad with arugula, which was divine. Our entrees included the cioppino and the risotto with seafood. The fish was fresh and cooked to perfection. Our waiter was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere transports you away to another time. I would highly recommend this restaurant on any visit to Seattle.

I'm a huge fan of Pink doors food and servers, and have been for years.
  That said, I just had dinner there for the 3rd time in the last year. All three times with parties of 3 to 4, for special occasions. All 3 times I have personally requested we be seated on the banquet in the dining room, and made all 3 requests 2 to 3 weeks in advance. 
  My requests have never been honored, so I booked this time with Open Table. We were seated at the last table in the dining room, at the entry to the bar, kitchen next to the service staffs computer stand!!!  A table that should be given to last minute diners. All our seater could say was sorry.
  Again, loved the food and our server... HATED the seating.
The food is amazing! On a rainy night the inside it a little crowded so it can be more difficult to carry out a conversation at your table. Still overall a great place for a very Seattle experience.

I was astounded by the beauty of the venue and the life of the room. While I felt the crowd was perhaps a little too casual for such a place, it wasn't too bothersome. The music was great, the service was fast, efficient and pleasant. The food was amazing, though the menu was kind of small. Overall, a wonderful visit.

As the Pink Door is one of the signature restaurants in Seattle, we had high expectations.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed.  We might have enjoyed the experience more if we were with a group who enjoy drinking. The food was fine, but nothing special and over priced.  The best thing about this restaurant was the ambiance.

Each time is special. An excellent wine list, great food - and they even spoiled us with an in-menu'd Avoagatto with Frangelica to finish - topped a great night with two good friends. Oh, and the trapeze performer was flawless too! One of the better restaurants on my  'must do' list from my much travelled, many country list.
I have a great anniversary dinner! Can't wait next visit! My only down fall was to small of portion for $27 meal. I have 3meals. Otherwise, it awsome from time you walk in to time you walk out.
AMAZING!!! The food was delicious, the decor of the restaurant was unique and colorful, & the service was great!!
Tremendous cuisine and great ambiance. A favorite stop while in Seattle!

Made a reservation and was immediately seated. The waitress (I forget her name, but she had a short bob haircut) was very friendly and took our orders as soon as we were ready. The food was prepared within 10 minutes and tasted absolutely amazing. The price for the food was a little high, but well worth it. Not to mention the atmosphere, which was very quiet and romantic. Not ideal for large groups, but perfect for date night or an evening out with a couple friends. I wouldn't recommend taking small children (especially with strollers) as it's a bit compact (although not cluttered or anything), and no one likes hearing crying children a few feet away on a date. The Pink Door was everything I had hoped for!

Loved the squid ink pasta--one of the best dishes at this restaurant! Osso Bucco was only so-so in flavor. Pesto lasagna was also excellent--probably the best lasagna I've ever had. Wonderful wait staff who was attentive and went out of his way to ask whether the red wine I chose would fit well with our food choices.

Everything was had was really great! Prosciutto and buffalo Mozzarella, garlic bread, kale salad, pasta with Salmon and  paperedelle ragu. Our server, elyse, was very attentive,  friendly, and spot-on with her recommendations.  Will definitely eat here again on our next trip to Seattle.
The server was nice and gave us just the right attention. the food was fantastic! so good. we been there before and will return for the shows, as we missed the trapeze show this time.
Food is great! I was really sad to see the pan seared scallops go but food is still great and service as well

Took my girlfriend for our 1st anniversary dinner.  Staff was attentive but unobtrusive and knowledgeable about the menu.  I had the PACCHERI CON SUGO DI NOCI & SALSICCE, which was excellent.  My girlfriend had the GRILLED KUROBUTA SNAKE RIVER FARM PORK CHOP, which was flavorful, but the chop itself was a little overcooked and dry (although not enough to be sent back).  The desserts were decadent and delicious.  The trapeze artist performed partway through our meal, and was  a delightfully risque and talented addition to our meal.  Overall, a great experience.

My husband purchased a gift certificate for me months ago for a special occasion.  We are local and live down the street.  We tried several times to get a 7-8 pm reservation for a Fri or Sat evening and it took a couple months to actually secure one of those time spots.  We arrived on a Sat evening.  At first the hostess did not have our reservation, then found it.  We were seated at a table in the middle of the room.  The first few moments our service was good- then a large party came in and our server was done with us.  Other than our water being refilled frequently by a buss er, we were more or less forgotten.  A manager stood in between the lounge area and dining area and it would seem he would have been aware that our waitress was not attentive- not only to us but the other 3 tables around us. He was not- However eventually someone else took over one of her tables.  While the food was good, our table was bumped a lot and basically on top of the table next to us. We had to ask for bread, more olive oil while our waitress was dutiful with the large party-  Due to the way reservations are made it seems management would have been aware of the large party and not given so many tables to our waitress.  Her attention was very devoted to this party.  We had looked forward to this evening for awhile and needless to say we were disappointed.
Great flavor and everything is tasty and wonderful. Great service and friendly atmosphere in a beautiful environment. love it!
Great food and prices reasonable for quality and portion size.  If you can get in during entertainment hours do so as its a once in a lifetime experience.
