Took my sisters here for lunch. Food was amazing and the waiter was helpful and friendly without being intrusive. Love the atmosphere and never felt rushed.  Made for a memorial afternoon.

The food here is just average. We went on a Thursday night at 7 it was packed, very noisy I wouldn't consider it romantic unless a slow night . Tons of hustle , workers running around. You are paying high prices for the novelty . The restaurant has a lot of character , nice ambience. If you are used to or looking for authentic Italian this isn't the spot for you. It's a tourist spot but fun.
I thought that the Serving size was a little too small for my likings. But the food was really really good.
The service was awesome between the bartender and the waitress, couldn't have asked for anything better. Nice little show was put on as well. Recommend for a romantic night out.
Took our family here for the first time to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday.  Great service, great food, prices not too bad. The antipasto platter was AMAZING!

I went here on Valentine's Day and had a lovely evening. Service was a little rushed because of how busy they were, but our water was topped of every time it got low and our food came out quickly. Great date, great food, great restaurant.

Went to The Pink Door for Valentines Day-I couldn't have asked for a better restaurant!! We were given a beautiful table looking over the restaurant and had a perfect view of the aerial performer. The food was outstanding, the wine was perfect-I really recommend this restaurant-perfect!!
Impressive ambience and food, the service is excellent as well. Very comfortable dining in the restaurant, order whatever you want, with lasagna included please.

We went here for Valentines Day in 2015 and were absolutely amazed by the entire package.  I had my first cheese board here.  We came back this year for Valentines Day and were equally as amazed!  Definitely recommend!

There was live entertainment in the form of an acrobat doing flips and spins from a hoop tied to the ceiling. I tried to take a photo during the performance, but I was told not to by one of the hosts. Apparently, the other 15 people around me were okay taking photos, but they had to draw the line with me. So, I had the host eyeballing me the entire time whilst the rest of the group took pics, yes, even selfies.
Took my GF for Valentines Day dinner. Everything about this place was perfect. I will tell everyone to visit when they are in town.
I can't believe that I have never tried the Pink Door!  The food and atmosphere are unparalleled!  I can't wait to return!
Had the sea scallops ... cook perfectly ! great flavor ! We drove all the way up from Vancouver, WA that morning to meet our family for lunch. It was well worth the drive.
I went to the Pink Door for a business lunch and the food and service were great!!
In from Philly.  Excellent dinner
I recommend any first time visitors to the city to check this place out.

Everything is great.. The only reason why i gave 4 star for service is not for our server but for the male host/supervisor where he was there to bus our tables without any smile. Our server - Aimee was great, very attentive and knowledgeable. 

Food was incredible..we had the Spinach Apple Salad, Chef Special - Link Cod, Lemony Garlic Risotto and Cioppino...Overall, food are well balanced, flavorful and make you want to eat more!

Every time I come to Seattle I try to eat here. The ambiance - cozy, romantic, and just overall makes you feel like you are in another world. You will stay for hours just chatting with your table. Food - trust me, get the cheese plate, the meatballs, and the lasagna. Just do it. Get anything else you want, but don't dare go there without ordering at least one of those, though I recommend all three.

Great food, lots of fun. We were there Monday night, for the trapeze artist. The lasagne was wonderful, all flavor, not all cheese. My husband's pork chop was perfect. We made another reservation as we left.
One of our favorites. Love their menu and the preparation.

Pasta was not what i expected. 
This is why i gave 3 stars not 4stars on food.

We have gone to The Pink Door on many special occasions and decided to take our out of town guests this time. The Pink Door did not disappoint! They are still raving about their Cioppino and the ambiance of the restaurant that can only be found by the pink door.

The food was nothing short of fantastic. While my meal was delicious, one of my son's ordered Lasagne that was perfect and light, and melted in my mouth.  My other son needs gluten free options, so his pasta was a GF penne pasta, with a light smooth white sauce made just for him. They were willing to provide food that was not on the menu to accommodate the different diets, and I was very pleased my boys could enjoy the meal as well. Will definitely be back!!
The unassuming pink door in the alley leads to an enchanting atmosphere, friendly staff and wonderful food.

Went to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, and the place definitely made the occasion special. To begin with, the ambience was so romantic and then the food...from appetizers to entree , delicious. Eggplant Lazagna is a must must try. They have a great wine selection, and the midnight show was the perfect icing on the cake. 
pink door lives up to all the great reviews and recommendations it has!!
The Pink Door was a fun place to eat for my birthday. We enjoyed the food and the service was excellent.

We've been to Seattle many times but something always came up with our plans when we'd have reservations at The Pink Door. Not this time and we are so glad that we finally made it. The atmosphere, the service provided by Terrence, and the food were all fantastic! It was a very fun and special experience.

The Pink Door is not the easiest to find, but well worth it!  Make reservations in advance as you will need them.  Our waitress was very helpful in making our selections.  I had the spinach lasagna and it was absolutely delicious.  My husband had the swordfish and while it was good, he was not overly impressed.  Did I mention the lasagna was worth the trip alone?  The ambiance is very fun and there is a great atmosphere in the restaurant.
I adored this place prices where fair food was amazing the drinks were very good great little neighbor hood find
Wow.. Love this place! Had to go back the next day for lunch. Bolognese and clams with linguini are amazing!! Save room for their amazing desserts!!
Pink door is a Seattle classic---a well deserved reputation. Great food and service
We had a great time at Pink Door! The food was delicious, the wait staff was extremely attentive, and there was a trapeze artist performing!

Go here. Eat. Drink and pray that you get to see one of their trapeze artists perform. Best bread I've ever eaten, and best pasta hands down. We ordered off the seasonal menu - "Pasta Rags" and a mushroom pasta in a light cream sauce. Order extra bread. Have some Oregon Pinot Noir. Trust me. Take pictures and enjoy the show!
I think I was expecting a "more fun" environment. You only get that at the show I guess.
Beautiful and intimate dining experience. Great for a date and the shows are spectacular!

OMG! How have I lived in Seattle for over six years and not known about this place? I have now been to lunch here twice, and both times it was superb, and dinner here once. 

Lunch March & April 2015): The food: the house antipasto platter offers a lot of variety and is delicious...even the olive tapenade, which I am not normally a huge fan of, was delicious. The grilled garlic and olive oil bread is a must have, and the house Caesar is well done. I can't resist the pappardelle ala bolognese - some of the best I have had outside if Italy. My BF ordered the fresh fish of the day (Canadian, wild caught, red rockfish) branzino style. This fish was 2 pounds of melt in your mouth deliciousness. It was perfectly prepared, moist, juicy and very flavorful. For dessert we shared the rhubarb crumble, served warm in a mini-cast iron skillet with a dollop of ice cream. Delish! The service: Thomas, who said he was new, was fabulous. Very attentive and knowledgable, and just a nice person all the way around. Ask to sit in his section! 4 thumbs up!

Dinner on January 12: The food: dinner for four and it was ridiculous - so fabulous from the food (especially!), the service and atmosphere. Shared the Antipasto of the House - always a winner. We also had the pappardelle ala bolognese, the osso bucco, the catch of the day, shaved brussels sprouts (2 orders they were so irrisitable!), a side of mama's meatballs and the doughnuts. WOW! All in all, it was 8 thumbs up! The service: Amy was knowledgable, friendly, accommodating and patient! Thank you!

Don't miss this amazing neighborhood gem in Post Alley...you will love it! And, be sure to make a reservation!
Amazing, even on a damp Monday night

Came here for my birthday. My original reservation for 5 people was moved up 45 minutes, and the hostess was very helpful over the phone. The food was excellent, the ambiance was great, and Bridget Gunning's aerial show was amazing. The only problem I had was with the lack of dress code enforcement. My party was very well dressed, however I did see people with sweatpants and t-shirts. It brought down the vibe a bit, but after a few glasses of wine, I couldn't careless.

The Pink Door never fails to impress.  Great food.  The Kurobuta pork was wonderful.  The pink balsalmico ice with the oysters was delicious. And they know how to do a cheese board!  Service was attentive as well.  Thank you again Pink Door.

I went here with my Italian boyfriend who pretty much turns up his nose at the proliferation of "Italian" joints here in the states. But as soon as the appetizer hit the table, his eyebrows went up and kept creeping northward. He loved the genuine taste of home! We came for lunch and split the sampler appetizer (only complaint was that there were 3 olives & we totally fought over the last one) and the risotto. I'd love to come back for dinner sometime for their cabaret to see what that's all about. Cozy spot, a bit on the pricey side but you get what you pay for which isn't something you can always say.

Went to the Pink Door for lunch during the week with some friends and it was wonderful. I recommend making a reservation, because it really filled up quickly and during the winter, seating is limited without access to their large veranda. 

From the moment we arrived, we were 100% taken care of - the service is impeccable. Our coats were taken and we were whisked to our seats. Our waitress came by right away and was happy to accommodate individual checks. Two of us had sandwiches and two of us split a caesar salad (amazing) and the seafood risotto. Everyone raved about their food. Highly recommend Pink Door, they are consistently execellent.

My husband and I couldn't have chosen a better restaurant to celebrate our anniversary.  It is in walking distance from our condo, which made it very convenient.  We arrived at 8:45 on Sunday so we were able to see the last act by the trapeze artist.  My heritage is Italian and the food did not disappoint!  Our waiter was personable and professional.  It was a perfect anniversary dinner.
The food, the service, the menu selection and the entertainment make this restaurant a fun place to go.  Just different enough to be a try it , you'll like it restaurant.
Have dined at the Pink Door for 32 years-still fantastic food, service & wine selection.
Great food, amazing service, a must see and do in the Emerald City! The performers don't perform during lunch, so we'll be back for dinner.
Amazing!!!

It was fabulous on all levels 
Can't beat this place

We've been going here for years, and it's always the same!!! Same=greatness!!! The food is top quality, and the service makes you feel like someone special. We're so glad this place exists... thank you PINK DOOR!!!!
We went to the Pink Door to celebrate a birthday. It was a fabulous experience. The service was outstanding, the food delicious, and the atmosphere perfect. Thank you for a really memorable evening!

The food is luscious, the ambiance is urbane, and the service is always excellent.  In the winter one is enveloped in a warm cocoon. In the summer, if you are lucky enough to snag a terrace table, you get to feel like you are in the center of Pike Place Market with a view of Puget Sound. In either case, very reliable Italian food will be on your plate.
The Italian food was outstanding, but the noise  level ruined it for us?
But it never fails to produce an amazing meal and drinks! One of our top 2 in Seattle.

I came to the Pink Door for my boyfriend and I's 3 year anniversary. Everything was amazing! We started with the calamari (my boyfriend wasn't a fan because he doesn't like seafood) but I found it delicious. I had the beet salad and he had the lasagna pink door (both fantastic). Then we finished off with the donuts. I have 0 complaints. Great food, great atmosphere, amazing and professional  service. I'm definitely coming back here when I visit Seattle next!

A gem in Seattle. Very happy I got to visit and eat there. Loved the food and the ambiance. It was busy but servers were on top of their game. I've heard some nights have shows (saw a trapeze hanging from the ceiling). Make sure you have room for a hearty meal. Recommended!

I have eaten at this restaurant for at least 20 years now and this was truly the first bad meal I had here. The fish I ordered was completely overcooked and yes the server took it back and put in a new order but by the time it came back I was done with the sides. And besides the fish was also under seasoned so it eating it like that without the sides had no flavor. This is the more surprising because I just had lunch there a few days earlier with a perfectly prepared fish.
Great authentic Italian cuisine. Great ambiance, too. Must-have experience!
Chose this place as a surprise birthday dinner, did the trick. The good was great, decent portions. The service was on point and immediate and I would recommend this to a friend any day.
If you love Italian and want the best produce and foods Seattle has to offer, the Pink Door is the perfect spot.

Celebrated anniversary with my wife here last week and enjoyed the ambiance, food and service. We've had drinks here before, and was impressed by the wine/beverage list and the stellar Italian cuisine at a great value.
Food was a huge disappointment, the food runner spilled on my dates suit and there was no offer of compensation. Over-rated.

What can you say when you discover a great bottle of hard to find wine and you are sitting under the Monday night trapeze act. Exciting and exhilarating, as well as delicious and sabor. Split the whole fish dinner which was seasoned perfectly and flaked off the bone succulently.  Wonderful neighborhood restaurant and fun Monday nights.

We always enjoy our visits to The Pink Door.  This time we introduced a couple of friends to this great restaurant at lunch.  I can hardly wait until we are in Seattle on a lovely evening and can eat in the outside deck.

Great time at The Pink Door - loved the decor. While it wasn't something to Ooh and Ahh over, the food was great. A fun atmosphere. Our server was pleasant and relatively attentive. Only quibble is that we took their first and really early (for us) seating because Open Table said it was the only time available besides 10 p.m. However, we were there until 6 p.m. and there were plenty of open tables to have accommodated us at our preferred time. All in all a good experience, though, and we would recommend to others.

Beautiful and seductive, speakeasy-style hideaway with a fun and atypical,
yet carefully-planned and printed menu, The Pink Door makes the best bolognese we've ever had. This was the perfect reservation to book on a weekday night, just after landing in Seattle from afar for our elopement. Try the scandalous cheese plate and order a local wine.  And the service? Fuggetaboutit!
Our meals were good and the ambience was very warm and friendly.

We had a group of four and had tremendous amount of the fun. The staff was fabulous, the performer was outstanding, the atmosphere was very hip, the drinks were spectacular, but the food was only OK. It would be a stretch to recommend The Pink Door for its food. However, combining the entertainment, staff, and vibe with the food makes for a sure-fire win! I would recommend to book groups larger than four as early as possible as space is limited for large groups.
We came for a late night supper and weren't disappointed. The food was great, as usual, and the service was as good as any our group had been a part of. Always the high point of our trips to Seattle!

Cheese plate was amazing but asked for bread as the one cracker was not enough for the cheese. Main course was really good but not amazing. Had the lamb skewers and the pasta bolognese. The ariel act was a great bonus.

We had a knowledgable server who helped select our wine and food choices. Each dish was excellent and the pace of service was very good. Our only disappointment was the loud recorded music that seemed an odd choice for this type of restaurant.

I took my wife here for a romantic dinner, and was not disappointed. The menu selection is not large but everything sounds good. Our meals were very appetizing.  Service was a little disoganized but overall it was good,  especially for the amount of work they were handling. The only downside was the house red wine I had was warmer than room temperature and borderlined vinegar tasting. Still overall the resturant was not overly expensive and had a excellent food and surroundings. I will definitely go again.

The food is mediocre.  We ordered the famous lasagna, clam fettuccine, and garlic bread.   The garlic bread was really good but a bit oily.  The lasagna although quite tasty, definitely does not come close to the best I ever had category.  The fettuccine is pretty average, very pedestrian.   However it was enjoyable to watch a show in the middle of dinner.  The show is about 10 minutes long, definitely an interesting bonus.   The service on site is great.   Very attentive.  However, over the phone not so much.  I got hanged up/disconnected when i call back to confirm the reservation.  When I call back again, the girl over the phone is very impatient and hang up on me again before I can finish my thought. If it wasn't because this is a place earmarked by the wife, I would not have have gone after the phone experience.  Overall so so food, but definitely interesting experience to watch a show.  So if you are into the food and show experience, good to try once.  But if you just want good food, you can skip this place.  Il corvo has way better food than this place.  Not even on the same scale.

Great food and service. Our only problem is that we made reservations way ahead of time and still had to wait long. We stopped checking our watches after 45 minutes. They did comp us an appetizer but what is the point of reservations then. We came for the show and only got to watch one act because of the wait.

I have lived in the Seattle area for quite some time yet had never been to the Pink Door. It was our anniversary and we wanted something different than the usual so we tried it. Overall the food was good, both of our different wines were wonderful and we liked the atmosphere. 
We went on a Saturday evening so were able to watch the trapeze act. I'm told that they have 3 different trapeze acts a night but we only saw the first one. We had been looking forward to that aspect of going there but were a little disappointed in it. It was very short for one, and for two no trapeze was used in the show that we saw. It was just ok. We have been to many such shows and this was the shortest and most disappointing. Sorry.
On Sundays they have a Vaudeville type of show that we haven't seen and may go back for that sometime.
One note to others who have not been....there is no sign to indicate where the restaurant is outside. You enter from Post Alley and you must look for a kinda pink door to enter the Pink Door. We figured it out the hard way!
Great food & fun entertainment. Just enough entertainment to be enjoyable, but not too much to disrupt our dining & table conversation.

For our 18th anniversary, I decided to bring my wife to the Pink Door. Because where else can you have great food, romantic ambiance AND trapeze acts right next to your table? As always, the Pink Door didn't disappoint. One of the truly unique and eclectic dining experiences in Seattle.
This is a great place if you're looking for good Italian food  and something a little different.  Parking is a challenge.  Allow extra time.  Price is about average for Seattle.

Our group of 8 (2 gluten free) all had delicious pastas, great Washington state wine.  Everything was so good we had to try each other's dishes.  Thanks to Wally in the kitchen and Terrence our waiter for a lovely evening.

Great Food. Great Jazz.  Great service. :-)

Highly recommend. Halibut and Snow Creek oysters with the frozen (ice chip) sauce were excellent!!!

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at The Pink Door.  We arrived a half hour before our reservation and were seated immediately.  We enjoyed delicious seasonal cocktails, appetizers and entrees.  Our server was attentive, and we never felt rushed in the slightest.  Food was delivered promptly; everything was timed perfectly.  We had hoped to catch some of the gypsy jazz on the docket for the evening, but since we arrived so early I thought we were going to miss it.  But after dessert, our server filled our coffees and let us know we were welcome to sit and relax--no rush! So we got to sit through the entire first set! It was a perfect evening.

The food was amazing. All of their seafood is fresh and taste delicious. I love how everything in local. I would suggest this place to anyone visiting and wants a cool awesome place. The ambiance is awesome, it feels like a secret restaurant in the middle of post alley.
Long time favorite that keeps on giving.  Good value too.

The dinner experience to be enjoyed at the Pink Door is excellent. From the making the reservation online, the restaurant confirming by phone the day of, and arriving at the unmarked door it was an easy start to our birthday meal. I had made a request on Open Table for the corner table under the stairs, as a review of the restaurant said it was great for a romantic dinner. The Pink Door staff not only gave us the table but placed a special candle for my boyfriends birthday and wished him a Happy Birthday as we sat down. 

We brought wine to drink with our meal and both had the specials of the day, Sea Scallops with polenta and the Seafood squid ink pasta dish. Starting with a half dozen fresh oysters is definitely recommended, they were the perfect size and tasted wonderful with a balsamic pink salt on top. The entire meal felt like we were welcome to stay and linger. The server did an amazing job checking on us without being pushy to turn the table.  

After our delicious meal we finished with a complimentary butterscotch dessert topped with a birthday candle, a perfect finish. Although we weren't able to view the live music that started at 8pm we did still hear it from our seats. Not overwhelmingly loud so we were still able to have a conversation and enjoy the music. 

I would highly recommend the Pink Door to anyone that is looking for a unique Seattle dining experience.
Excellent food options even vegetarian. Very cool ambiance.  Decor is electic and fun.
This was our third time visiting th Pink Door and this time to celebrate our third anniversary and see a performance.

Our rainy Saturday lunch was an adventure in the best sense of the word.  Once we found the Pink Door, we descended the stairs into a cozy, quirky, warm dining room.  It was Halloween, so we don't know how the wait staff is normally dressed, but they should keep Popeye as a regular feature! We enjoyed a nice glass of wine, the Kale salad was a hit, and the entrees were great.  Service was effortless.  It was such a bright spot on a dreary day that we hated to leave and go back out into the elements.  We'll be back.

I took my fiance here for her birthday. She and I had a wonderful experience. Fantastic service, amazing food, and a romantic atmosphere. As the meal progressed we decided that  The Pink Door will be home to all of our future anniversary dinners.
I wish there was a Pink Door in FL. It's a must every time I'm in Seattle.   Incredible food, ambience, & service. Always Superb!!
I prefer the Pink Door on regular dates - it was busy and so the staff was not very welcoming and the waiter rushed.
Because we live practically next door we tend to overlook this. It remains excellent and as memorable a dining experience as the first time I went there in the 70s. Perfect food and service!
My husband and I loved the place. It was a suggestion from a friend in New York. We wanted to try and the food was so delicious .

The Pink Door is INCREDIBLE!!! We had the antipasti 1/2 order which was a perfect size for 2 people. We ordered the grilled garlic bread which was INCREDIBLE. My husband had cioppino which he used the garlic bread to soak up the sauce and I had squash ravioli with butter sage sauce. We had the bombolino for dessert and it was fabulous.  I cannot stress how AMAZING this meal was....The only negative would be how close the tables are to one another. There is entertainment which begins around 9 pm. We were done before that but we heard it's great. We will DEFINITELY go back.
Haven't been here in years.  Sorry we haven't.  Our lunch during restaurant week was very, very good.  Service was excellent.  We will return soon.
Really fine food...lasagna and kale salad were awesome!  Funky, fun vibe downstairs and inside.  Friendly servers.  Reservations were perfectly met!  Definitely a great experience!
Came here for restaurant week. The good was exceptional, and the wine pairings were spot on. Great experience, no complaints.
As always, loved the ambiance and service.  Since it was restaurant week, tried some of the offerings instead of the favorite standards.  They were good, just not up to the usual standard of great.
In Seattle for 4 days. This was one of better lunches. Sat outside overlooking water. Great food and service. A friend had recommended it and it didn't disappoint.

Seriously, it was so yummy with just a hint of lemon zest. Everything else was wonderful as well. The portions were just the right size too. It was a nice touch to have PINK lemonade at The PINK Door. 
A good place to go for restaurant week or any other time.

My intention was to order from the $30 Restaurant Week menu (which my two friends did).  
I wisely chose the Risotto which was incredible.  The server paired it with a lovely wine.
As always, the food was delicious.   And the Monday night entertainment was wonderful.
After I post the food log on facebook, my other friends are asking to go there another day ;)
I always enjoy going to the Pink Door. They have an awesome outdoor deck overlooking the water. If you've never tried the lasagna I strongly suggest it! It keeps me coming back.
We went for SRW and it was fantastic! The lasagne is delicious. Our server (Nicolas, I think was his name) was great!
Loved the food, lasagna was amazing! Our server made our experience that much better!

Great atmosphere and ambiance. Love the food, the entertainment and the Peroni. Wines are great too. It is a must for us on our trips down from Vancouver and we haven't been disappointed over seven years now.

We had the best dinner at the Pink Door in Seattle's Pike Street Market.  The food was fantastic and we all agreed our waiter was one of the best we had ever! had.  We ate outside on the patio and it was perfect.
The carpaccio was wonderful!
Lasagna was incredible. Food a little pricey for what you actually get but to be expected
Couldn't have picked a better restaurant for our first time in Seattle.
Food was amazing!!! Will definitely be going back. Fun atmosphere.
My Daughter and I have to dine at the Pink Door every time I visit her. The food, the staff & the ambiance is great and worth every cent. I would recommend the Pink Door to everyone.

I love this place! When we go back to Seattle we are for sure stopping by here! It's a little hidden jem. The food was amazing!! We started with a split Caesar salad and added crab to it (half order by the way which was more than plenty for two people). It was so good! I had the bolognese and I literally ate every bite which for me is rare but I couldn't help but continue to stuff my face (which you know is a good sign).  The ambience was fantastic. And to make it even better they have a trapez artist perform on Sunday and Monday nights (make sure you call ahead to get good seats!). We went here on Monday night and the trapez artist was awesome!! We will be back for sure!!
Thank you for taking great care of my friends and I when we dined recently.  Pink Door is a staple and one of my personal favorite destinations in Seattle.
Great birthday dinner option very fun
Friends from Vermont were visiting so we decided to revisit Pink Door. Excellent. We all enjoyed it immensely.

A great restaurant in the middle of Pike Market and all its touristy stuff. You get the feeling that you are sitting in Italy. Great food menu with specialty drinks and great wine menu. One of the few places in US I would recommend trying the house wine. We were not disappointed with anything from drinks to salad to e tree to dessert. Great place!!
The food was fabulous with gluten free options

Every year my wife and I like to find a unique place to dine for our anniversary. The Pink Door was definitely a unique find! The atmosphere was cozy and eclectic.

The restaurant features both indoor and outdoor seating. But we decided to dine inside because of the time of year. Although,  the outside dining has some amazing views of the Puget Sound and Pikes Place Market, the indoor dining had some amazing acrobatic entertainment,  plus a warm and interesting ambiance!

The food was delicious and ample, unlike many upper class restaurants that leave you feeling hungry and over charged.

We are thankful for the experience! 

Lynn Warford

We had a lovely late lunch that hit the spot.  The pizza creation varies by day, and we ended up with a slightly spicy sausage and arugula thin crust pizza that was made to order and very tasty.  It was, however, enough to feed two people rather than the advertized "individual" pizza, so we ended up taking leftovers (which made an excellent evening snack).  The panini we tried (grilled chicken) was also delicious, though we would really like to go back to sample some of the pasta.  The patio offers a view to the water over the adjacent buildings, and is a nice place to sit on a sunny day, slightly offset from Post Alley.  Some interesting Italian wines were on offer.  The seating on the patio was a little crowded, even despite our mid afternoon meal time on a Monday.  Our servers did an excellent job navigating between the chairs to make sure we were well attended.
Great patio atmosphere. Gluten free menu was excellent!

The setting was interesting, the food was excellent and the trapeze (more artistic than high-flying and death-defying) was definitely something I've never seen in a restaurant before.  We had a great meal and a wonderful experience.
The pink door is my favorite restaurant. The food is DELICIOUS and the ambiance is romantic and intimate. Pair that with amazing service and you've got yourself a perfect place to spend a night at!

First I would like to say out server Andrew was outstanding.   We were all very disappointed with the quality of the food.   Our party of five ordered four pasta dishes.  The pasta of all four were all under cooked.   We were hoping the pasta was freshly made.  Very disappointed for a $250 ticket.

We spent last weekend in Seattle celebrating our anniversary and this dining experience was the highlight of our trip! Great ambiance, energy, food, cocktails and service. I am both Gluten and Dairy intolerant and they were more than accommodating, creating a custom gluten free pasta dish that was amazing! I wish we lived closer so we could go there more often! Looking forward to our next trip up to Seattle already, and The Pink Door will definitely  be on our list for another visit!
A delight as always!

Our son told us we had to go to the Pink Door. Although we were not there on a night for entertainment. We had a wonderful meal and time with good friend. We were visting from California for a wedding.

Went to the Pink Door for lunch Oct.1. It was   the 1st day of the new fall menu. The salmon special was fabulous and the  cheese board was delicious. Our mustachioed  waiter was especually helpful.  Next time we come to Seattle we'll be sure to dine there again.
I would have given a review if you gave me points for my reservation.

We had a table on the outside deck at sunset beautiful.  Fun relaxed and magical place, the food superb and we got to see the trapeze artist by popping inside briefly during her show.  I'm from Australia and would urge fellow Aussies to visit The Pink Door.

We went to this restaurant for dinner with some friends. We were super excited about it too! The restaurant itself is beautiful and fun! The view of the Sound is stunning. I really wanted to write a better review about the food but I just can’t. My pasta came out cold, bland and not what I expected. I also thought it was overpriced. My dish was $21 for a pasta bowl so I would expect amazing flavor for that price point. The other dishes we had at the table were about the same. Very bland flavor and Luke-warm when the dishes came out to us. The service was good, our waitress was very attentive

Went here for my birthday celebration with my husband and two other friends. The BEST restaurant we've tried in Seattle so far. The Bruschetta Evita is a must try! I loved the fresh and complex taste of the heirloom tomato. The combination of ingridient is quite simple but leaves a  unique and surprising taste to your palate . We had the Whole White fish of the day as the main dish and hands down, it was the best fish I've ever had in a restaurant! Price range is very reasonable. Service is a little slow but I'm definitely going back!
Best lasagna EVER, Pink door is never disappointing.  Defnitely a most if you want good ambiance, service, and delish food.   Great place overall!

...from the moment you walk through the [signature pink] door. Service and ambiance (we sat inside, downstairs) were impeccable. Immediately took me back to Italy.  The food was just as enjoyable. I would highly recommend The Pink Door--- if you can get in ;)
Love the king salmon with fingerling potatoes and fresh seasonal vegetables
I have been several times to The Pink Door and each time I am impressed with the food, service and ambiance! This is one of my favorite places to go with either a girlfriend or my husband!

As I was looking for this on my GPS, their door is their sign. Its painted really like a pink door. My party and I went on a Sunday and were were lucky where that night, they had a show "Trapeze." The trapeze show was really close.  The food was good but it could have a bit more for the price we paid. Still, was fresh and delicious. I would go back.

My wife and I celebrated our 3 year wedding anniversary at the Pink Door.  It was a great experience.  Good food, reasonable prices and pleasant vibe.  The service was good and efficient, but, very basic.  I would have tipped 30% but, he only did the basic's.  Please don't get me wrong it wasn't bad, just not over the top great.

The cocktails we enjoyed were delicious and fun.  The wine we ordered was reasonably priced and paired well with our dinner.

Also it felt like the kind of place that people from Seattle actually go too for dinner, it's not just a tourist attraction.
Great food and atmosphere with a great view of you sit outside. Perfect for a romantic dinner.

It was my first time visiting Seattle. I had two or three friends recommend this place so we booked a lunch seat on the patio for the day we had to leave for the airport.

Food was amazing. We had the bruschetta with heirloom tomatoes which was only seasonal for the summer. The lasagna pink door was made with spinach pasta so that was awesome (because I'm a spinach lover). Panino wasn't my favorite, but my parents thoroughly enjoyed it. And the linguine with clams was also fantastic, but you've got to eat it while it's warm!

Ambiance was nice. You can see the water. There's a lot of buildings still in the view, but you feel tucked away from the hectic Pike Place Market.

Our waiter was great. He put in all of our orders fast and he was personable and friendly.

I would definitely recommend and definitely return to the Pink Door, hopefully on an evening with the acrobats next time!
Tasty food, good service, great place to have lunch

Great food, great service, outdoor seating perfect for a sunset over the sound, and reasonably priced for the quality.

Don't expect trapeese or burlesque except late Friday or Saturday.

Seriously, my daughter and I were having a lunch'/ dinner meal and the wait staff questions us several times on how much we had ordered... I appreciate sharing they have large portions but then enough especially since we shared most all we ordered... Where did the previous staff go.. This has always been a favorite restaurant for us...

The Pink Door always lives up to its premise. 
Fantastic food and atmosphere. King Salmon was over the top. Lasagna was the mainstay as always. Burlesque show was a great treat.
Antipasto dish was delicious, entertainment was unique, service was fab.

This place does romance right! There's a reason why you have to make your 8pm Saturday night dinner reservations 6 weeks in advance! It really is the best date night spot in town! Great food, romantic setting, wonderful service, and the prices are an absolute steal! Oh and did I mention the covered deck with the view of the water? Sit on the deck- it's amazing! The view is gorgeous and they have blankets if you get too chilly. :-) What a nice touch! The Pink Door is one of my favorite restaurants ever and I plan on returning again and again!

We were unable to visit the pink door last year during our vacation to Seattle so this year we planned ahead. We were hoping to sit on the patio with a gorgeous view, but heavy rain ruined our plans. However, the inside decor was gorgeous and the whole restaurant felt warm and inviting. We had a small seasonal vegetable dish as our appetizer that was DELICIOUS. Somebody in that kitchen knows some amazing secrets to making cauliflower and peppers taste out of this world. We both had pasta dishes that were very flavourful and the portions were definitely good enough for us. The only reason we gave a 4 for overall dining experience was because our server took quite a bit of time to take our order. He came by initially to ask if we were ready to order, but with it being our first time we wanted to take a second to decide. When we were ready I kept trying to make eye contact and we put our menus down to show some body language that we were ready to order. It took him a while to get back to us, but it was also a busy night. It is completely understandable.
We've lived here for a few short months and I have to say that the Pink Door is our new favorite. Each dish was amazing and very fresh and local. We're already planning on coming back with friends.
The location alone makes this an easy choice for dining in the city.  The view, the food and the service we're all excellent as well. I will definitely be back.
Sorry -- am not writing a review.   You won't let me submt what I have written without writing something, so this is what you get.  Sorry --

This restaurant is special. It's a funky space with a very light pink door. It's bigger inside than it appears from the outside. They have a sweet lattice covered patio that has a view of the water. BUT, at the Pink Door, I would say it's about the food. It's authentic, well prepared Italian food. I personally LOVE the Ciopinno. The bread is good. Caprese salad is fabulous. Very fresh tomatoes. ALL good!

Wanted somewhere with outdoor seating, a great view and delicous food to take my friends for the start of our "Girls Weekend". The patio at The Pink Door was perfect. Great service, food and ambiance!

Season after season, year after year, the Pink Door is consistently wonderful.  The food is superb.  To start we had bruschetta with thick slices of super fresh heirloom tomatoes sprinkled with salt.  We felt like little kids taking big bites into a juicy candy then crunch, crunch, crunch.  Along with the bruschetta, we had thin sliced tuna with pickled radishes.  Next, Neah Bay Salmon for my husband, and pasta tossed with burrata and sauteed tomatoes with basil for me.  All excellent--bright, fresh, pure Northwest joy.  Mix it all with a bottle of prosecco and perfect service.  Well, it's a perfect summer lunch.  Hope you have the same.
My wife had always wanted to eat here, so we went there to celebrate her big day.  It was a great evening that will be a one to remember!

Ate here about 10 years ago on a recommendation from a friend.  Had a wonderful time.  Was in Astoria, OR for a long weekend.  We extended our stay until Monday and drove from Astorai to Seattle just to eat at the Pink Door since we do not know when, if ever, we'll be in the northeast again.  It was every bit worth the horrible traffic and 5 hour drive that should have only been around 3 hrs.  Sat outside and watched the moon rise over the river.  Their bolognese pasta is the best we ever had.  We wanted to order different dishes since we may never have the chance to visit again, but we decided we just had to have it again.  Plus they are known for their fresh seafood dishes so it was a difficult decision,  however, in the end we were glad we oreded it again.  Great food, setting, atmosphere, and service.  Katrina was awesome.  Despite being super busy we never were left waiting for anything.  One of, if not our all time favorite restaurant.

- Drew from Baton Rouge

I have been going to the Pink Door for many years and many various occasions. The Pink Door never disappoints. The staff in very friendly, the outdoor patio is divine. We had our reservation at 8p so we enjoyed the beautiful sunset sky then well into dinner the Moon popped over the neon Market sign, fabulous!
The ambiance is great and the added trapez show makes for a unique dining experience. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable and made great recommendations. We would definitely go back!

Came here for dinner on our anniversary and sat outside on the patio. The weather was perfect, the food was very good, and the service was outstanding. Our server made it personal by wishing us a happy anniversary without prompting (she did her homework on our reservation!). The view from the patio is amazing and being here at sunset made it all the better.  Be warned - the bruschetta is massive - almost a meal in itself!

Very good service, good food, and a marvelous water view make the Pink Door a place to return to again and again.  How nice to see that they have added a few gluten-free options to the menu.  This is a place I love to bring my guests from out of town for lunch or dinner. I always know we will have a wonderful time. The Pink Door never lets me down.

This is a great spot in the market. It doesn't look nearly as charming from the outside as it does once you're inside. We had the chiopiono which was fantastic. Service was notable better here than anywhere else in Seattle.

While I like the Market, the crowds can get crazy. The Pink Door was a great escape to a comfortable roof top patio and some great food. 

Great cocktails, cioppino, and Caesar with prawns. Service was attentive and good. 

I'd love to go back for dinner!
Delicious bread with olive oil to start.  Had risotto with crab and liguinni with clams.  Ginger beer to drink.  Excellent.

I take lots of clients to The Pink Door for lunch. Not only are they treated to excellent food, they are also treated to a lovely view of Puget Sound.  I always order the catch of the day of the day which is prepared with utmost care and is served with locally grown fresh vegetables - yum!
Whether you're a local or a visitor to Seattle, put the  Pink Door on your list of restaurants to  try.

Some friends who visited Seattle recently recommended the Pink Door to us for our visit and we were not disappointed. The service was great and the food even better. After dinner we moved inside to listen to  the live music which was perform by excellent local talent.

Loved our most recent Pink Door lunch. Just back from Italy and the food/ambiance were just what we needed. Friendly, professional & excellent service. Great food. Outstanding view/location. Perfect. and appreciated in what seems to be a new world of menus that need translating and service that can be prickly and unprofessional. Thanks to Jackie and team!

I wanted everything to be perfect for her birthday. We arrived a little early, but instead of seating us at a less desirable table, they invited us to wait at the bar. That worked out wonderfully, because we ended up watching the trapeze show prior to dinner. 
The table was perfect to enjoy the sunset while eating our great dinner. The lasagna was superb, and her linguine with clams was the best she's ever had, even while visiting Italy.

pink door gets it right for menu, location, vibe and fun and like a few other market restaurants it gets better as it grows older...and smarter?  it's young but we were there to celebrate a 70th birthday so appeal is pretty universal.
This is the best dining experience I have had in my entire life. Do not miss out.
One of the most consistently great restaurants I have ever enjoyed.  When I know I am going to Seattle, that is one of my most "I cannot wait" things to do...and I ALWAYS do!

The outdoor deck was beautiful. The food was very good. The service was not all that great though. The hostesses were rude, the servers inattentive.  We had a group of 9 and they acted like we were a complete waste of a table. But I guess when it's busy enough on a Thursday night that they were turning people away a guaranteed tip is less important than one that's not.
Great food, ambiance and service. What a gem! We will return.
Had a great outdoor view of the water. The food was amazing and reasonably priced. The ambience was incredible.
Simply perfect for our anniversary dinner. We sat outside and the service was great. We never felt rushed and the food was amazing!

We recently dined at The Pink Door and enjoyed a lovely meal.  Our group of four ate outside on the rooftop deck. This space is usually uncovered but the weather was questionable so they had the retractable roof covered.  We still could enjoy the lovely view of the water and it was very pleasant outside.  Our waiter was excellent and had a great sense of humor. I had the vegetarian lasagna which was delicious. Our group of four also shared the Brushetta Tomatos and the Anti pasta plate.   The Pink Door has been in business for decades and after dinner Saturday night I was reminded why. A real Seattle gem. Tip: This restaurant is very popular so make your reservations in advance!!!

This restaurant came highly recommended. We could not get in for dinner on Thursday night, so opted for lunch on Saturday. It was a gorgeous day and we had a table on the deck. The food and drinks were excellent and the waitstaff was very friendly. I can't wait to go back to the Pink Door on my next trip to Seattle!
Great Patio atmosphere and view!  I have never seen so many clams on Linguine Alle  Vongole.  It was delicious.  The other yummy dish was the Meatball Panini! We will definitely eat here again.

Tons of gluten-free options.  They offer a gluten-free pasta that's great, along with good gluten-free bread.

Everyone in our party had pasta or seafood.  Everything was superb. My third visit; I've made it my Seattle tradition!

Part of the fun with this place was finding it.  And we could see why it was considered as a great "first date" place.  If you can sit on the outdoor patio, do ... it makes the experience.  And, solid cocktails.  Very popular place, so have reservations.
One of the most delightful restaurants for many years in Pike Place Market. Excellent Italian cuisine (except for the canned crab on the risotto) and first-rate service.

Service was very slow, especially when having lunch during the middle of the work day.  Pizza was extremely greasy and heavy.  My company's Panini ripped the roof of her mouth it was too tough.  Also the hostess had an attitude when I asked to be at a table with the view (there were 3 open) instead of sticking someone who had a reservation for weeks against the wall with no view. I do not expect to return unless I am craving the ambiance of the patio.

Overall, the food was great! We really enjoyed the drinks, lasagna and spaghetti/meatballs. We were disappointed with the bruschetta though. The bread was a little burnt and the tomato chunks on top were really big to where we had to take the tomato apart from the bread and eat them separately - much of a disappointment for a $14 appetizer. But otherwise, everything else was great.

This was our first time visiting the Pink Door and it didn't disappoint. We went for lunch on a beautiful sunny day, but we will be back to check out the trapeze/burlesque shows!! 

The patio view as great! The drinks (the Brooklyn) were excellent and the food had me wanting to lick my plate! The tuna carpaccio was perfect, you HAVE to try it!! Overall excellent lunch....we will be back for dinner!

We loved that there was no sign, just a "Pink Door". Decor and setting is enchanting. Would love to see the entertainment. Thought it was every night but it is late night and certain nights. Antipasto plate is perfect start  and has nice variety. Cioppini is light and has nice amount of seafood.  Risotto with crab and corn a lovely combo. Had a great local Hefe wizen on tap.

Delightful restaurant in Pike's Market in Seattle. Suggest the attractive deck for outdoor eating. Tuna sandwich was excellent. Hard to find which makes it special. Up stairs, then turn left. You will see pink door with no sign. Worth the effort.
All of the above. Great service, food and ambiance! Will definitely return.
We sat outside with a view of the water. All our meals (there were three of us) we excellent. I would definitely dine with them again.

We have always loved this placed, so met friends for dinner. Asked the waitress what the  moat popular dish was on the menu, and were told risotto with crab.  Three of us ordered it. It had too much corn, and tomato, and only a tablespoon of crab on the top. Big disappointment!

I really enjoyed my dinner experience at the Pink Door, first the ease  of the reservations through open table, great experience began with us arriving early and waiting at the bar, and listening to the nights band which is situated right by the bar, drank a couple of drinks ( by the way the bartender is a jack of all trades  her name is Angel) I saw her give change, give directions, serve tables, sing with the band and of course bar-tend, pretty amazing woman plus she was great to talk to. The night was going great until we received the check, then it turned amazing because our dinner was comped by the manager, I almost fell of my chair, I did not ask why, I only asked to speak to the manger to give him my gratitude and then we left .  great night and yes the food was very good.

Truly enjoyed my late dining experience at the Pink Door. Although slightly harder to find at night (in the Post Alley, no direct access from the Market).

Service was friendly, food prepared excatly as requested with great attention to details. Really nice views from the patio. Varied menu. Relatively efficient from start to finish.

Not easy to locate but it's well known in the neighborhood so just ask! Food is great! Fresh and local ingredients prepared in an unpretentious way!  The only exception is their signature risotto which tastes really sweet and fruity - not my cup of tea so I asked them to change it. The waitress did that without any further comments but then she said it in a loud enough voice when she recommended dishes to new customers next to our table: ' personally I just love love the risotto ' ..... Haha

The whole dining experience was the complete package. Our waiter was both personable and attentive.  The atmosphere was eclectic and romantic. The food selections were very good. The tuna tartar was the freshest I've ever had and the crab risotto was cooked to perfection, which is hard to do. My husband and I enjoyed it so much, we ate there a second time before returning to PA.

The food was delicious, and the service was pretty good; although it would have been better if our waiter hadn't forgotten to put the order in for one of the dishes that we had ordered.  At least when we inquired about it after it seemed as though it was forgotten, our waiter was honorable enough to admit that it was he who had forgotten to write that part of the order down and therefore neglected to put the order in for that dish, that it was not a mistake made by the kitchen staff.  It would have been better if he had recommended or offered a remedy, but that did not happen; and we said no more about it.  Kind of strangely, too, the end of our service was provided by other waitstaff.  So perhaps our waiter was toward the end of his shift (we finished our meal between 4:00 and 4:15), and perhaps that's why no remedy was offered which the three of us found a bit odd.  All in all, though, our lunch was very good and well-prepared and fairly-well served.

The Pink Door off of Post Alley in the Pike Place Market as been one of my Seattle favorites for many years. During the summer the deck is open and in my  opinion, they have the best outdoor dining deck in the city.  Lunch on the deck is quintessential Seattle. The menu is seasonal but the favorites are always available. Summer crab and corn risotto is one of my seasonal favorites. Creamy and full of fresh dungeoness crab piled on top. Can't go wrong with that one. The other favorite always on the menu is the cioppino. Lots of fresh seafood in a spicy tomato broth.
Yum! 
In the winter the inside dinning is cozy and friendly. On the weekends, stay late and listen to the music and watch the burlesque show.. Place to be!

We went for friday lunch.  It was wonderful.  Very good service and great food.  Mamas meatballs are yummy and they use some really flavorful olive oil to accent the dishes.  I would recommend this cool and fun resturaunt to anyone.  There is no sign to tell you where it is but there is a pink door.  They fill up quickly.

This has become a favorite spot to visit with my daughters. The food, service and setting are all lovely. We don't come often, but when we do, it's wonderful. Don't let Seattle's weather scare you from sitting outside if you have the opportunity. We recently visited on a rainy July day, but were offered blankets to keep the chill at bay.

A perfect spot to enjoy a great meal, the fun of Pike Place Market, and beautiful water views of Seattle.  The food was delicious and service was great.  Recommend the ahi tuna carpaccio, prosciutto, and antipasto for starters.  Yummy entrees were pappardelle Bolognese, lasagna, clams & mussels.  Profiteroles for dessert were outstanding.  Highly recommend!

Honestly we were looking forward to a romantic dinner. Food was good, ambiance was a bit noisy, which is great if thats what your looking for. Nice place to go, however I wouldn't consider it a romantic setting.

The most memorable part of the meal was the female trapeze artist who performed over a small clearing among the tables at 35-40 minute intervals.  She was very "Vegas," kind of glitzy and cheesy, and thoroughly entertaining. The chef knows what he's doing too. The isotope was very good and the fennel dusted croutons added a nice something extra to the Caesar salad, which was suffering from a tiny excess of lemon juice. Definitely a fun experience.  Would be great for kids but the food is not cheap and I don't know if there's a children's menu available. Service was pleasant and efficient.
This is a true gem in the Pike Place Market area. The food was exceptional. The place is full of character and it flows to the people dining. Highly recommend.
I thought this place was really nice. The food was very tasty. Everybody liked their meal. They had several good wines. The house table wine was also very tasty.
We stayed at Inn at the Market and needed to leave early the next morning for a train to Vancouver.  Wanted very good food, close to our hotel with fun atmosphere.  Got it in spades.  Lovely evening.

Look for the pink door, no name, just a pink door. You feel like you are entering a speakeasy! We love eating here.  Great food, lots of local fresh ingredients,  it never disappoints. If you like lasagna it has one of the best. A good wine list and knowledgeable servers that can make legitimate recommendations. A wonderful outdoor deck with a view of Elliot bay perfect in the summer. The indoor dining is romantic, you feel like you have been transported to France. Can hardly wait to go back.

I made sure I made it here for my birthday trip to Seattle.  It's hard to describe how delicious every bite of every course tasted.  From the caprese salad to the summer risotto to the meringue with berries I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch and the perfect table with the perfect view that came with it.   I love this place.
The food and service was a treat in the midst of chaos in this busy part of the city. They we nice enough to seat us early. I would go back and try the chicken cattatorie.
My only complaint is that the portions could have been a little bit bigger, but overall the prices were reasonable and the quality and service were very good. Would recommend to a friend.
The special green beans of the day for outstanding! We had the caprese salad which was so good! Salmon and penne special were really good! The pasta with meat sauce was fantastic

Love going to the Pink Door - first off the simplicity of it's entrance notable only By The Door is iconic.  Upon descending the stairs you glimpse the ambiance of this cool restaurant.  And once you try their dishes your sold!  Truly a gem down in The Market and one worth going to time and time again!!

Loved the Pink Door.  Actually there on a Sunday night for dinner and caught the trapeze act, which I beleive is Sunday and Mondays.  Intimate dining room making it very romantic.  The food was great and fresh, bruchetta, mussels and clams and loved the gelati trio.  They are very accommodating if you are cutting back on your gluten.  All of it was so good we had to go back and this time for lunch on the patio, though the view is limited it's very charming.  Reservations in advance is a must!

Our first dining experience in Seattle, hidden down Post Alley and through the Pink Door. Got us seated right away with a great outdoor table with views of the water. Our server was on it, but not over the top. Food was delicious and options were plentiful. Will definitely be back and recommend it to all Seattle new comers and Natives!
The outside patio is a great place to sit. We also loved the band that was playing that night.
Food (especially house made pasta) was great, show was stunning, server was fabulous!

Will continue to go back . Our server was very informative in the beginning introduction, but seemed as tho he was preoccupied with other things.. Not engaging or smiling. Just simply doing his job.. My prior visit was the total opposite the server was just as great as the food.. We felt as tho maybe we weren't spending a high amount on wine or alcohol that our table wasn't worth talking to.. We watched him laughing and joking with other tables and spending time with them, that's when we knew our feelings were true.

The restaurant is a little hard to find because there's no sign on the door. It's in Post Alley way but even some of the locals don't know what or where it is. That's unfortunate because this place has amazing food and a great outside searing looking towards the pier. The bruschetta with farm grown tomatoes was so delicious and the veggie lasagna was excellent! I was so full but I had to try their tiramisu that didn't have rum in it & oh my god I practically licked the plate. It was so soft and flavorful! Our waiter was nice and attentive & made really good recommendations. I can't wait to go back, this time I'll know exactly where it's at. It's a pink door but at night it looks lighter :)
From the olive oil served with the bread to the fresh seafood, everything about our experience here was delicious and the view is very hard to beat.

We really didn't know what to expect.  Our waitress was excellent and very patient with our special dining needs.  I had the lasagna.  I usually don't like lasagna from a restaurant (my wife makes the best) but this was delicious and unique.  The cheese was very smooth and creamy and there were some delicious spices making every mouthful a delight.  I ate it very slowly because I didn't want it to end.  The bruschetta was delicious with VERY fresh tomatoes and a flavored (well chosen, not overly bold) olive oil on a softish (not crunchy hard) bread.  

Usually there is entertainment including live music and and aerial act but this was July 4th so it was a little quieter.  Also, there is a burlesque show after 9 on Saturday, but again this was cancelled (not my thing anyway).

Three different people recommended this place so we tried it for my Adult son's birthday.  We were seated right away on the patio, but right in the sun. We asked to be moved and they did so. The view was just a slice of water but I guess for some people that is spectacular.  I asked for a local wine and it was disappointing that by the glass I only was able to select a Sauvignon Blanc. It was fine but at $12 /glass a bit steep.  I ordered the clams/mussel dish in a cream sauce, which was tasty, my son had the salmon dish ,which he said was okay.  For dessert I asked for a gluten free suggestion. The only thing available was a sorbet in Prosecco. It was okay but again choices were limited.  Maybe my expectations were too high due to the number of people recommending this place, but for $100 with tip for the meal, I believe there are better places to eat with great food and prices.  Sorry Pink Door, but my comments won't affect you, but you seem to be doing fine with the lines I saw waiting to get in, but then again that is Seattle and very common no matter where one eats.

Sitting on the patio is just so pleasant, with the view of the sound.  The ingredients in the most simple of dishes, from the caprese to bruschetta to clams and mussels, are just so fresh and vibrant. I highly recommend ordering several small plates and sharing, they always have a decent wine by the carafe, as well as good house cocktails and wine list.
We had great outside table, great service and food!!

MY friend and I arrived with a reservation for lunch on the deck.  We were pleasantly offered a choice of two tables.  We made a special request for a vegan antipasto plate (the regular one has meat and cheese) which was cheerfully provided and delicious.  The service was attentive and very courteous.  The Pink Door is a wonderful experience of Seattle dining all year around, but especially on summer days  on the deck.  I recommend it highly for out-of-town guests when you want to show off the best of Seattle.
The food is always amazing. The only negative was that they kept serving us warm water when it was 95+ degrees. We had to ask multiple times for ice.

We made reservations at the Pink Door for our first Seattle visit.  The reviews were dead on - this was our favorite dining experience during our two week visit.  We ate on the deck.  The atmosphere was great and the scenery even better.  My husband has a gluten allergy.  Our server had a good understanding of the allergy and the Pink Door had wonderful gluten free options.  His meal was excellent.  I had the lasagna which was the best I have ever had.  This is a fun restaurant with excellent meals.  I found the pricing to be moderate as compared with other restaurants in the Seattle area.  Go - you won't regret it.  There is a reason the Pink Door is well known and recommended in the Seattle area.

Have an open mind about what you want to eat! You will not be disappointed, especially if you become daring and let the wait staff choose something for you.   Such a wonderful little gem hidden away from the everyday boring tourist type of restaurants!  Looking forward to coming back in the near future!

A tourist trap.
Noisy, disorganized, food so-so.
Entertainment adds to the chaos.
I'm sure the tourists love it.

We arrived for our 9 pm reservation on time and were seated promptly. The wait staff was very professional. All of our food from appetizer to entree was well made. There were a few traditional entrees (lasagna and pappardelle) as well as some unique offerings (crab, steak, salmon). The dishes were flavorful, cooked nicely, and filling. Sadly, we had no room for dessert but the people sitting next to us seemed to enjoy every one of their dishes as well (including dessert).

We booked a reservation ahead and the minute we walked in we were seated even though it was a busy night.  Service was amazing and we had a informative and fun waitress who was clearly devoted to the quality of the food by her descriptions.  She made great recommendations on what was fresh for the day.  We had a linguine and clam dish that had the most amazing light flavors.  Also had a seafood risotto that was notable.  Something as simple as garlic bread was done with a subtle flair that made it way more memorable then it should have been.  Topped the meal off with a rhubarb crumble dessert that was delicious and crowned with a wonderful rich vanilla ice cream.  Sitting outside with a view on a beautiful summer night - this was a wonderful experience.  I would recommend it to anyone who would listen - oh wait - I already have.
The Pink Door has been our go to place to bring visitors from out of town for many years and has never failed us. Food is excellent and the outdoor seating during nice weather can't be beat.

It's a great place for lunch or dinner! Kinda small, but the food is amazing. The tapenade is my favorite thing there, I could eat buckets of it! The staff is always great, and it has a quaint atmosphere. I've also been to the burlesque show and its great! I always bring out of town friends here because it's great.

Pink Door hidden in Post Alley is a great eatery with interesting lay out not far from Pike Market..little pink door mark the entrance..its vibrant, with great view from the patio (sea breeze and the water), yummy Italian food..and friendly servers.. but its also low key and easy going.. nothing yuppy or pretentious here..heavenly desserts ( we shared two..it was a marvel..and budino is a must)..patio seating is a good choice on hot summer afternoon/evening.
We really liked this restaurant!  We loved the food, and the outdoor patio.  The restaurant is very romantic, if you eat inside, it's really beautiful!  We will go back again!

I don't mind paying for good food. This is a tourist trap with average food at absurdly high prices. Completely not worth it. Head over to Queen Anne st and get a far better meal at one third the price

One of My ALL time favorites and I go back again and again....when someone asks me where they should go for a special lunch or dinner I always say the Pink Door 1st thing. It is just so unique. The service is wonderful, the food is fabulous and the experience like no other. It is just an all around great experience. Summer time on the patio is so fun! The bar has so much to look at you can just feel the history. The dining room is a cozy feeling that makes you just want to stay. I recently sent some folks from out of town on business and they said it was absolutely wonderful. They had the best time and the Salmon was out of the world. Enjoy!

The food is simple, yet elegant and wine choices are good.
There are three dining options; the lounge (or bar), the rooftop/deck with views of Puget Sound and the intimate dining room. The entertainment is in the dining room; aerial dancing with rings, swings and scarves...quite a show. You cannot make a reservation using Open Table for the dinning room so beware of this. We were treated so amazingly and they worked to fit us in, especially since I had made the reservations weeks ahead.  

Service is great and this is a real treat for a night out in Seattle.

This was our first visit to the Pink Door and it won't be our last.  Wow.  What a spectacular location, excellent service by Terrance our waiter from appetizer to dessert.  The summer menu offered us a wonderful variety and we left with thoughts of WHEN we will return and WHO we might bring!  Great recommendation by my niece and a friend.  Bravo!
This was my second visit and the service and meal are consistent... very good.
It was an amazing experience. The view is spectacular. The food was good as expected. This is a must try when in Seattle.

The view is great, the food is good, the wait staff fun.  Winter inside with the trapeze, summer outside on the deck.  Great place to take out of town guests and just to hang out.  Make reservations in the summer!
...nice view, close to the Market, wonderful food.  Perfect summer lunch spot.
They were very busy but did not make us feel rushed in any way. Service and food were great and the staff was very friendly.

We went here based on a recommendation from a friend. If we hadn't known about it we would have never found it. It doesn't have a sign just a pink door in an alley. The outdoor patio has an amazing view of the water. The food was more than wonderful! So tasty and one of the best meals I've had out in a long time. The service was on par! Our waiter had great recommendations and wasn't overbearing or neglectful! The perfect amount of attention was given. The atmosphere was very relaxed. Would be great for a romantic dinner or a casual lunch. You won't be disappointed!
We always have a great time here. The entertainment was great as was the food and service.
Great menu and fair pricing.
Great place to take friends visiting  Seattle for a great food and a spectacular view.

We arrived early for our reservation, were told everything was on time and we would be seated prompetly at 9pm (our reservation time). They escorted us to the bar to wait, where the bartender told us they were clearing the section (for the cabaret they were setting up), we then explained the hostess brought us there to wait. We had a drink and felt anxious with all of the activity going on. At about 5 to 9 I asked the bartender if we should go wait up front, as to get out of their way. She said no, and she would check with the hostess about our table. We were once again reassured we would be seated on time. Well we were seated ten minutes late, of course. Food was good, and my wife really enjoyed her's which is was good since we went there for her birthday.

The patio at the Pink Door is my gateway to summer...the season has officially begun once I've enjoyed a sunny afternoon relaxing with (many) rounds of cocktails or wine.  The food is consistantly adequate - nothing really amazing, yet tasty with a lot to choose from.  Service can range from charming to disinterested.  This visit was completely charming.  Thanks Kjersti!

The setting is what makes the experience.  My favorite patio in the city.

While in Seattle, we were on a "Cioppino" hunt...to compare with my husband's favorite, Scoma's in San Francisco...  We ended up at the Pink Door, which has a nice outdoor patio with casual tables and a fun atmosphere.  The Cioppino was a hit - but the spinach lasagna was far too rich - made with a béchamel that made it impossible to get through more than ½ the dish.  Had a really nice salad (sorry - can't remember which one exactly) but overall, we enjoyed the visit.

We were seated outside on the patio during a beautiful evening. The view was quite nice.  The menu is interesting and eclectic.  We had the salmon and the lasagna respectively. Both were very tasty and expertly prepared.  Nice dinner.
I will forever be in love with this place! My favorite in Seattle :)
The service was amazing and very accommodating. My partner and I had a great time. The food was spectacular. Fresh and local.
The Pink Door was good! Super cute restaurant.

A really great spot! My wife and I ate right at the dinner time rush. We set up a reservation and they got us right in on time. The service was excellent, and the atmosphere was perfect. I'll eat here again on for sure.
Always a wonderful time on the patio at The Pink Door. Great service, wonderful view, and delicious food.

We had a friend recommend  this restaurant when we visited Seattle 2 years ago and we loved it.  We visited Vancouver recently and made it a point to spend a night in Seattle so that we could go to The Pink Door again!  A true Seattle gem!
On a sunny day or just a not too cold one, the deck is fun and people seem to have a wonderful time when they dine there; we did!
We had a very enjoyable meal, with great service. Would definately go again

Imagine fresh mozzarella that disintegrates on your tongue. Crispy bread soaked in olive oil. A lasagna that has somehow the delicate blend of  flavors and textures to make a cohesive and delicious meal. Now imagine enjoying that with refreshing Sangria, or an herby cocktail served in an original 1967 World's Fair glass. NOW imagine all of that while enjoying the views of the Puget Sound, Alki, and the Olympic Mountains. Seriously, this place is amazing.

Wrong table.

I made the reservations several weeks in advance by OpenTable. Under special requests I asked for the table nearest the water on the terrace. When I arrived I was seated in another table and no explanation was given. While my dining experience was superb, as it always is at The Pink Door, I felt as though my wishes  as to seating were ignored and neglected.

Enjoyed our time at the Pink Door.  It truly is as other reviewers say, just a pink door along Post Alley with no signage or restaurant name on or near the door.  Surprised we found it as quickly as we did.  We were in the main dining area as there was no room on the outdoor patio.  We were actually thankful for this later when the weather cooled down significantly.  The restaurant interiors are pleasant and it was full when we were there, a lively spot for dinner.  We had the salmon (supposed to be medium rare and was actually medium, but still good) and the mussels/claims/prawns (very good!) with the morel mushrooms and roasted beet salad to start.  Everything was quite good, albeit not super remarkable.  The trapeze artist performed for 6 minutes every hour -- it was unusual and a little hokey, but created a fun atmosphere nonetheless.  Our server was attentive and had good knowledge with respect to the menu options.  Prices were average.
We greatly enjoyed the patio, the view and the food. Highly recommend!

Great service.  We celebrated a 50th birthday and they couldn't have been more awesome. 

Their fish is unparalleled.

I reserved a table for The Pink Door but it wasn't explained when they did the performance and entertainment in the restaurant.  I guess our 5:30 reservation was too early to see that, though they were booked from 6-9 even a few weeks ago when I did the reservation. 

Food was great, drinks were fairly priced, and service was good, I just wish it was more clear on when the unique performance aspect was available to see for us newbies.
Overall experience was just OK...nothing really stood out. Do not sit on patio...crowded and not a nice view.
Excellence service, great dinner and with a great show!

My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner at The Pink Door. I had an amazing thyme lemon gin cocktail and the cioppino and both were great. My husband had salmon which he really enjoyed. The trapeze show was very entertaining and a fun addition to our experience. We had a wonderful time.

We loved the ambiance and decor here, the staff was friendly and knowledgable. Our server was Katrina and she was the best! The cocktails were delicious and exciting. I had the special and it was honestly one of the best meals I've EVER had (an Ivory Salmon with a delicious pesto sauce on potatoes and broccolini). We also enjoyed the entertainment on the evening. (: everything was exceptional and The Pink Door went above and beyond our expectations!
Amazing service
This is the only restaurant that is consistently amazing that my wife and I go to!!

I had a friend visiting from out of town and the Pink Door is always the perfect destination.  This time was no exception.  We were looking for something light and have similar tastes.  We split the half antipasto, split the mussels and clams and split a salad.  Coupled with wine, it was perfect.  Yes, it was Saturday on Memorial Day Weekend and the Market was very crazy busy, so was the restaurant.  We had made reservations and were seated immediately (Don't even think about just dropping in...).  Our server was attentive, as were the rest of the staff.

Had an early dinner- very knowledgable and friendly wait staff. Loved the "everything green salad" with butter lettuce, green peas, pistachios, lava beans, asparagus- The ravioli with green peas, bean shoots, and cheese was delicious. The ivory copper salmon entree with cauliflower, fingerling potatoes and mushrooms was tasty but not special.
Love this restaurant.   Wonderful atmosphere and outdoor seating.   Food was great and service excellent.

While vacationing in Seattle, we visited the Pink Door. It had a lovely ambience with sort of a Paris-shabby-chic vibe. We arrived early in the evening (before prime dinner hours), and most of our meal was quiet and calm. The noise level did pick up a little as more people started to arrive around 6:30. We enjoyed our food, and the service was cheerful and attentive. The trapeze artist performed that night, and it did add some festive spectacle to the night.

Visited The Pink Door while on vacation in Seattle. We were fortunate to experience many great meals while visiting this fabulous city, but this was by far the best. The food was delicious; daughter had the risotto with mushrooms and I had the lasagna (vegetarian). For dessert we shared the butterscotch pudding which was SO yummy...I wanted a second! Dinner was less than $100, for two entrees, a salad, a glass of wine, one shared dessert and a glass of Chianti. As we visited on a Sunday evening, the entertainment was a trapeze artist, during the 1.5 hours of our dining, came out twice to perform. Know this ahead of time...she is performing IN the main dining room which is quite intimate. You can view her from wherever you're sitting, and if you're close by, don't worry that she's going to bump into you...her moves are very controlled. Made for a fun evening. I will definitely return on my next visit, perhaps to enjoy dinner and the show on Friday/Saturday night.
