Celebrated our 25th anniversary at Pink Door. Great service and fantastic food. Linguini and clams were the best I ever had. Hubby had the pasta special and loved it.  Stayed for the cabaret show and overall enjoyed a wonderful evening.

we were celebrating my wifes birthday. upon entry we had to wait for a bit which was not a big deal.. I would not dress up for this night out!! our waiter Dominque was fantastic if you get his section it would be worth it! I had the lamb ribs which were great and a good portion. my wife had vegetarin pasta but it did not have any flavour which was disappointing!!! all in all we hqd fun and we would go back!!!

The food and service were good, but we were very disappointed that there was no entertainment.  We had been told to expect trapeze and silk artists, but there was nothing.  It was just another restaurant, not an experience.

Excellent- had such a good dinner that we went back the next day for lunch. Tuna carpaccio was best ever, whole grilled fish excellent, as was the white salmon and all the salads. Antipasto and salad was perfect for lunch.

The building itself feels as if you just landed after falling down the rabbit hole.  The ornate mirrors,  the high ceilings for aerial acts,  and the music of the night (live jazz band on Wed) give the perfect ambiance for the small group next to us or just me and my partner celebrating 10 years.  The food was exquisite.  I ended up with an amazing black pasta seafood dish that had just the right kick to the lamb my partner was in love with. ..my mouth is still watering.  The staff greeted us immediately and our server was fabulous. I cannot wait to go back though next time I'll check out their Cabaret show.
Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious!  The decor is welcoming and vibrant.  The service however was cold and not what I would call friendly.
The service was absolutely amazing. The food was perfect, ambiance was fabulous. Will be back %100

We have been going to the Pink Door for many years.  It is our favorite place to have lunch whenever we  go to Pike's Place Market.  When the weather is cooperating, it is great to have lunch on the deck.  The food is consistently good.
We had a wonderful visit at the Pink Door. Our waiter was super friendly, the ambience was fantastic, and the food was outstanding!
The outdoor patio has a great view of the harbor. The service was excellent. All is the food was great especially the halibut special. This was my first visit and is definitely go back.

Full of tourists this time of year but you can't beat the food, service and outdoor seating. Everything was tip top, as usual.

Thank you!
The Pink Door is amazing, every time we go! It is a never fail!

great atmosphere. endure it's a small dining area very intimate and cozy. large bar area very eclectic. very large outdoor deck which is considered part of the bar which overlooks the water. food was on par with some more pricey restaurants. The pink door offers reasonable prices and great food.

Always heard about how great it was and we were not disappointed on a sunny Seattle noon.
They made her birthday lunch feel very special and it was, 80 years young!  
The food was incredible and we had the sweetest waiter.  Two hours went by in a flash.  Can't
wait to take my husband for an evening to see their show.
Had lunch here.  Sat on the deck on a sunny day.  We each had the bolognese and it was delicious.  Service was slightly lacking....  No big deal, but was notable.
Took three clients to lunch and sat outside with great views of Puget Sound. Service was outstanding.
We split an order of the lamb ribs with lamb sausage, accompanied by polenta and thinly sliced lightly sautéed veggies. It was all delicious, but the grilled lamb ribs were OUTSTANDING!

I have been to The Pink Door multiple times and it never gets old! The food was delicious and moderately priced considering you get to see an aerial show. Just make sure to make a reservation ahead of time. I can't wait to come back!
Beautiful spot.  Service great and shocking good food

We came here to celebrate our anniversary and were able to sit outside on the deck at a cozy table lit by candles. I had heard a lot about this place before we arrived and I was not disappointed. We ordered a few appetizers and a carafe of wine to start. Both delicious. Our entree's arrived promptly and were amazing. I ordered the lasagna as I was instructed by friends that at least one of us had to get it. I was not disappointed. It is the best lasagna I have had to date, and I think about it often. We ordered desert and drinks to accompany. We weren't rushed at all and our server was very friendly and helpful when we couldn't make our own decisions. The couple next to us got engaged during dinner which added to the already romantic atmosphere. This is one of my favorite places in the city.

Loved this little hole-in-the-wall restaurant, that's tucked down Post Alley, only identifiable by it's pink door. Food was delicious (particularly the bolognaise ragu!) and well priced given the quality of the restaurant. Wine recommendation was disappointing (we ended up paying over $30 for a bottle of wine that was not at the server described), but the staff were very accommodating and offered a free desert for our troubles.

Both times I've visited the food was over the top amazing. Maybe some more exotic choices can be intimidating to more conservative tastes. Ambience is amazing. The whole experience feels very exclusive given its low key entrance and secluded nature. Really a one of a kind dining experience.

This was my first trip to seattle and googled a burlesque show and the pink door came up. This was the best place we went to the whole trip! Great food, service, ambience and even though we didn't get to see a burlesque show because I misunderstood the timing, they had great live, acoustic music that night.

I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. We were there on a Monday and caught the trapeze show while we were eating, haven't seen anything like it before. Just fabulous. We started with the antipasta to start and then had the halibut of the day and fruitti de mare. No complaints.

I loved the romantic atmosphere. The cheese plate was very good and I loved my lasagne, but my husband did not like his spaghetti at all (I tried a bite and agree). The server was attentive and friendly. The short trapeze show every hour was a fun little addition to the whole dining experience. I would love to eat here again!
Funky but enjoyable atmosphere.  Great food and service.  Even treated to a trapeze show.  Would definitely go back!
This is a must-do for Seattle dining! Amazing experience & we went for restaurant week!
We went for restaurant week.  Despite being very  busy, we were seated on time , the wait staff was attentive and the food was fab.  The Pink Door is always such a treat.
The live music really adds to the experience. The place was a little tricky to find but I think that's what makes it special.

Dined there for lunch during the 2015 Spring Restaurant Week promotion.  First, the service was top-notch.  For my appetizer, I had the Blistered Asparagus- Room Temp w/ Sieved Hard-Cooked Eggs & Olive Oil.  The asparagus was sweet and roasted to perfection, lightly dressed, with generous parmesan shavings.  My entrée, Lasagna Pink Door- Fresh Spinach Pasta Layered w/ Besciamella, Pesto and Topped w/ Marinara Sauce, was sublime!  Go try it now!
Perfect spot for every season.  The ambience for special night indoors or outdoor dining on a sunny Seattle day.  The food is always fresh with the perfect Italian menu.

The food was excellent and had a wonderful view!  Great place for adults.  I did read other reviews that said "kid-friendly".  I would disagree.  They do not have a kids menu.  However, they did accommodate the kids with simple pasta choices (pasta with butter or marinara) and pizza.  The kids pizza was too "fancy" for a kid.  Other than that, lunch was excellent and will return without kids.  :)

A wonderful experience in the heart of our Seattle trip. A live Polish band was playing the night we ate there, and we got a great seat to listen and watch the performance. The restaurant interior is beautiful and interesting. The food was outstanding. We will definitely return when we are back in the Seattle area.

I love that this restaurant has no sign, just a pink door. I came here recently for lunch and the outdoor patio is beautiful.  The food was great, and service was impeccable. I will definitely be back again!

we love the pink door and appreciated that it was one of the original " good " restaurants in the market... and continues to add clientele and improve with what is now a prolonged long experience.  we've introduced new generations to it's quirky personality and great menu and they too are committed.  great fun.

Great service,  good food, and perfect location.   If you are physically impaired be prepared for stairs.  No elevators are present so if you are in a wheelchair it would make it almost impossible to eat here.

We went here for lunch during restaurant so they were quite busy. The food was great and so was the service. They definitely know how to keep it together when busy. 

It's in a unique and fun location and they kept with that theme with the interior decor. We had a great time and will definitely go back!

We went during Restaurant Week and had a memorable Sunday family dinner.  Terrence was our server and he made our evening more enjoyable by his attention to details.  We enjoyed the trapeze show, the food was delicious.  Some of our choices were the kale salad was thinly sliced kale with nuts and raisins, the Pink Door Lasagna which has pesto and bechamel sauce, wild mushroom risotto and the butterscotch budino was the dessert we all loved.  It was like no butterscotch we ever tasted - was made with real scotch!

We will be back for that next special occasion.

This restaurant was fantastic, down to every detail. The owner, Jacqueline, even gave us a round of drinks on the house, just to thank us for coming in. That spirit is in her servers, hosts, even the coat checker. Must haves: the house lasagna, the oysters on the half shell, ANY of the cocktails, the garlic bread, the spring spaghetti with artichoke. This will be our new go-to in Seattle on the rest of our trips to town.

The Pink Door takes the unusual approach of not hanging outdoor signs. My hotel could not give me the correct directions to find it.   I found it on line to begin with so I relied on the directions I found there.  It's literally just a plain pink metal door on a nondescript building up an alley way.  Easy to find once you know.
It's worth finding.  It is very well run.  The menu is Italian but not the tired old traditional dishes. The chef makes use of lots of fresh local ingredients. The mushroom risotto was creamy, hearty and really delicious. They used fresh garden peas on the bruschetta, which is something I hadn't thought of before.  For cocktails we had a very refreshing drink made with vodka, limoncello, and a bit of sambuco.  Expensive but very good.
The atmosphere is circus/eclectic. I understand they have cabaret performers in the evening but we were a bit early for that .  You need to reserve ahead for best dinner times.  The Pink Door is a great experience.

We had an excellent lunch at The Pink Door!  We shared the kale salad, the rock fish special and mushroom risotto.  Finished it with orange cake. It wasn't cheap, but we thought it was well worth it. Everything was delicious. The side of corona beans, with the fish, we so good I'm going to figure out how to  make them myself. Our server was great, too!  On our way out, she told us to enjoy Seattle, we told her we were both born here!  Must be a rarity!

We live in SF,  which is a great  restaurant city. But we don't get out often enough. So spring break in Seattle with my wife and teen sons is a chance for eating out ...without being stuffy. Pink Door fits the bill.W had the antipasto for the table and cocktails for the moms and mocktails for the delighted teens. I had the yummy Papardelle.  Wife had delicious lasagna (ok we shared.) I had the muscles and ciappino. Desserts are a must. Great opton forfamilies or a romantic dinner. Especially as theroom darkensand is mostly candle lit.

Perla was superb and the food was outstanding!  I had the "Branzino" style daily fish (Alaskan Rockfish that day) and the chimichuri sauce that accompanied it was perfect.  The beans were al dente and flavorful!  Also had the sauteed calamari strips and the smoked ahi carpaccio....both were out of this world!  

Check out the swing and trapeze artist, as well as live music every evening starting at 8pm!

Great afternoon sipping wine on the outdoor deck. Food was excellent for all 5 guests.
Can't wait to return!
Advertised artists in the air-nothing.  Crowded and the food was not all that great.  Wait staff nice.

I had always dismissed the Pink Door as being one of those restaurants for tourists. But my boss was in town and she wanted to try it, so I made reservations. Every dish was perfect, from start to finish, but especially the morels with semolina cake, the lamb breast, the whole fish. I can't wait to go back.

My husband and I were visiting from the  Eastern Washington where there are few good restaurants.  We were looking for a delicious meal near the Pike Place Market.  The Pink Door was wonderful.  I had the salad with tarragon dressing and it was delightful.  My husband had the mushroom rissotto and I had the spinch, pesto lasagna.  We enjoyed every bite.  The service was  attentive and we would definitely go back the next time we're in town.

The server was amazing, the food was delicious, and the entertainment was out of this world!  How does she do the things she does?  Incredible.  Perfect spot to celebrate my birthday with my best girlfriends.

With the description of an aerial trapeze act and the menu, was excited to try this place and wasn't disappointed. As has been mentioned in other reviews if you don't know what you are looking for you might miss this little gem, there are no signs just a pink door that leads down into the restaurant space.

We were seated on a raised area at a table by ourselves with a good view of the performance area. This is a blessing and a curse as it gave a very good view, but when the young lady starts performing everyone that can't see comes to stand around our table area. Now onto the important stuff, the food.

For an appetizer we shared half an antipasto platter. Some, highs and some oks, the mozzarella was ok, but nothing special on the creamy scale, same with the salami, the roasted peppers were perfect, a very nice tapenade, white beans and olive.

For main course wife had the lasagna with beshemel/pesto sauce which was very good. I got the special lamb dish with a polenta cake and a slaw. The polenta was very good, and the slaw was a standout, the lamb was interestingly spiced, but a little on the fatty side.
The stand out of the night was the dessert, an olive oil orange cake. One of the best of the trip.

Our waiter was very good, when I asked about the slaw he went and found out from the chef exactly how it was prepared.

We tried to make same-day reservations for dinner but couldn't get in (we should have known), so grabbed a lunch reservation time instead.  It was still packed and I noticed a handful of people being turned away - just a sign that this place lives up to its reputation.  Our server was delightful; calm, warm, not overbearing.  My panini was fantastic (great spices/flavor), as was the house wine.  My husband had the lamb and was in heaven with every bite!  We would definitely go back.  Now we know to get a reservation way in advance; we'd love to experience the dinner atmosphere.
Recommend reservations as it was booked most of the weekend.  Decided to go for an early dinner 3:00 as this was the latest open slot.  Great local atmosphere in Post Alley and the food was fabulous.

I brought my family in from out of town and they loved it!  The classic dishes like the cioppino and the lasagna were still delicious, and the large scallops special was divine.  Classic places stay that way because they don't skimp on quality - and Pink Door has never fallen short.

This was my 5th or 6th visit and I have always enjoyed the food. Being my first time for lunch, I was glad that we got there early as the noise level really went up by noon and made it a little harder to talk. Still, I would come back whenever I am in the neighborhood. (live in Portland)

This was my first time to the Pink Door. I read the reviews and the place intrigued me from it being down a little alley and just a small pink door that leads into a huge restaurant below.

Loved the bread and house infused oil and the cheese plate. Our entrees were delicious!

The food was very good, the seating was a little cramped with tables close, but it didn't bother us.  The service was great, and we all had dessert and it was really delicious.  A lovely little place, we all enjoyed it.
My husband and I had a great time. The fish of the day was amazing. I wish I had looked up the entertainment schedule; I was hoping to see some acrobats.

Great food at a one of a kind place!  We had perfect weather the day that we dined and chose to sit outside.  The view was awesome which adds the the phenomenal food.  The kale salad that I started with was so yummy!  Not to forget how wonderful "mamas meatballs" were!  Dessert was great as well!  Make sure to make reservations as this place stays busy!
Pink Door is always great, and this visit was no exception.

I love the Pink Door! Excellent food prepared with fresh ingredients from Pike Place Market! you always count on the fresh seasonal fish and vegetables. The atmosphere is romantic and fun  coupled with attentive servce! I always bring my out of town guests to the Pink Door.

I didn't even know there would be entertainment while dining at the Pink Door. I like how tucked away it is, in one of the alleyways, across from Kells.
No sign, just literally a pink door.
I reserved my table for my friend and myself so we sat in a nice portion of the place. It seems there are two areas of seating if you don't count outside.
Where I sat, I had a splendid view of the entertainment of a dancer dancing among silk cords up in the air. I can't think of the name for the act.
The cocktails were delicious.y favorite
Is Seattle Thyme.
I had the oysters which I recommend, they were so good in a balsamic sea salt seasoning.
Overall, I loved it. A great place to treat yourself or take a serious date. It's fancy, there are candles and lively chatter.  I was aware of the pricing so that didn't bother me.
It was $60 for myself but that's because I had a few cocktails, oysters and the Caesar crab salad.
I couldn't even finish it all. It was too much for us to eat all that.

If you want good seating then I recommend you reserve or else you may wait a while or not get a chance to see any of the dancing they provide at certain times in the evening.

We weren't sure whether or not to believe the promise of trapeze artists and such, but there she was, doing a routine on a ring above the floor of the restaurant. We had to leave before round two, which involved long scarves and heights! A perfect complement to the Euro jazz that was playing and the overall decor. All of which was a great complement to the extraordinary food and wine. We had pasta with meatballs and pasta with sausage, and the marinara sauce was to die for. Makes me want to go back and try the bolognese. Next time!

Hidden is not just a joke...
No sign, just a pink door. 
Thankfully, a co-worker recommended The Pink Door for a nice birthday dinner for my wife's birthday. 
THANK YOU !!
WOW !! What an awesome find !!
The staff was amazing, the food scrumptious, the entertainment was incredible, and all in all, it was a very affordable evening !!
We WILL return !!!!

Great trapeze show. Young girl was amazing. Quite the site to watch. 
Food was amazing. Waiter was perfect.
This is our favorite restaurant and it didn't fail us on our anniversary.  Loved it all over again.

Great, simple Italian food, flavors were amazing, very fresh...we were celebrating my wife's birthday and everything was outstanding. The service was impeccable, great spot right in Pike Market.

My only complaint was it was so hot, we would have loved to sit and enjoy the night longer, but we were both quite uncomfortable with the heat, and the seating. Maybe it was just us, my wife is pregnant which could have added to the uneasiness 

Will definitely come back.
The food was amazing. The service somewhat slow because they were crushed with diners all coming in at the same time. It was crowded because it was St. Patty's  Day. We would come again for the food.

The food was tasty, that is for sure. However, the portions were very very small. The entertainment was enjoyable, but the performer only came out for maybe 2-3 minutes. I assumed it would be a 10 minute 'show'.

While it was a fun experience, I left 50 dollars poorer and still hungry. 
The restaurant was also very drafty and cold. It was a cold day outside, but this made the expensive dining experience a bit less enjoyable.

I'm not a professional food critic and Italian food is not my favorite, that being said if you can get me to eat Italian food it must be good!
  I had the long rib and it fell apart on the bone like a good pot roast, the flavor was excellent and what ever concoction the mashed potatoes were made out of I would walk a mile to eat again.
My wife had the Lasagna and she expressed several times that she would order that again, I have never heard my wife say that in 27 years of  going out to eat together.
My daughter ( 22)  had a gluten free pasta salad thing with sausage and I guess it was good but she absolutely flipped  over their gluten free garlic bread. So much so as a mater of fact that we ordered her a side of it to go!
 Another daughter ( 23)  had the mussels and clams and it was excellently flavored.  My Nephew whom came along ( 30 )  had the cioppino pink door  and other then it not containing scallops which he incited it should have ( He is the food critic..lol)  he enjoyed it and the atmosphere very much... This was my birthday and he said " Good Choice"  so it must have met with his Scientific research criteria.
  Bottom line, everyone would go back in a heart beat.  I rarely...did I say rarely... spend 227.00 for 5 people to eat so this was definitely a  big splurge and a treat for us.. but hey it was my  Birthday  right!....But regardless of that... if  leaving a 50.00   tip on top of that 227.00  is any indication of how pleased we were with the service and the food I will just leave it at that for you to make up your own mind. :)

  OH PS:  They have a wonderful dark beer as well .....much like a porter but they said it was something else.    I had 3....... and  then another good one  at Kell's next door...... then my wife drove us home..:)  Perfect Birthday indeed.
Like stepping back to Italy.  The best lasagna I have ever had.  No wonder it been on the menu for 34 years!
Friends told me to go here for a date, it was a great suggestion!
The Pink Door is where my son requests we go for all special occasions. The lasagne is the best in town. The service is great and the ambiance warm and friendly. The deck is lovely when it's sunny.

i was in town for the weekend and wanted to have one classy dinner before we left inside of food stands at the market (not that there's anything wrong with that--delicious!). As you could imagine, my significant other and myself spent a lot of time reading over menus of various restaurants across town. Torn between the pink door and another restaurant nearby, we chose pink door because of the beautiful ambiance. It's decor and candle lit tables really stole the show and the prices are reasonable considering the environment and quality of the food. Will definitely recommend to a friend looking for a romantic getaway dinner while in the area.
The found and atmosphere in this place was amazing!!  nothing bad to say at all
Service very good.  Food selections left nothing for the healthy.  Kale salad not at all healthy, lots of sugar in the dressing.

We were visiting the Seattle area, for a combination of business and pleasure. The Pink Door was recommended by someone who has been a patron, on multiple occasions, and we went with the anticipation that the food would be acceptable. 
We had a cheese plate, appetizer that was beautifully presented, including a fig compote, and honeyed walnuts. 
The classic was the lasagna, which has been on the restaurant's menu for the thirty-three years of its existence. It was one of the best I've had. It was both tender, and tasty. The portion was perfect, and calls for a return visit. 
Service was right there, and not intrusive, which can be a fine line, when going through the dinner.

We enjoyed everything about our experience. The service was very friendly, and all of our food came out quickly. We ordered the cheese plate (very creative), pappardelle (rich and delicious), and NW fish of the day (really tasty salmon). Love this place!

This place was recommended to us Bostonians by some Seattleites, and it was well worth it! The ambience is very unique: you walk up to--a pink door!--and go down some steps because the restaurant is essentially like a cellar, complete with medieval sconces and grills on the windows. We were there on a Sunday night, which is apparently trapeze artist night, because we were treated to a performance by one! Very unique. 

The food was also good--I got the butternut squash ravioli (excellent) and my husband got the scallops (also excellent). We wanted to try dessert too, but we were too full from our meal. 

Overall, a great experience and we will definitely recommend it to others.

A unique experience. Half the fun was finding the entrance. The atmosphere and decor was better than described, but we were very disappointed that the acrobats were not there. The food was delicious. We would definitely go back during our next visit to Seattle.

Came here with my husband on our first night in Seattle. The Pink Door was recommended by a coworker of mine and I was already intrigued by the fact that there were no restaurant name outside of the establishment. The pink door can only be found by.. well... a pink door! How cool is that. Once we entered the restaurant we are filled with this warm ambience. I could see it was well decorated, candles, chandeliers, flowers, statues, etc... (it was definitely in the small details also). This place was all very romantic and mysterious at the same time. Our server took our orders, and me being a Libra was indecisive on what to get. I first said I'll have the scallops and then changed it to the linguine and clams. The hubby got the slow roasted beef (long-bone). Another server came to give my husband his entree and then gave me mine, except it wasn't the linguine it was the scallops. I told him it was totally ok that I keep the scallops, no need to get the linguine anymore, and boy was I glad I did. The scallops were heavenly! Our original server came back and apologized for the wrong entree, but I told her it was totally fine and I was happy with the scallops. My husband's dish however, was amazing! For some reason, his dishes always seem to be just a little bit better than mine, lol. But it didn't matter, who never minds sharing with me... so I kept picking off of his plate :) I loved the Pink Door and if we are ever in town again, we will definitely be back!

I have eaten here a few times since 2007 or so and each time it has not been a disappointment. Most cities have plenty of stuff around the touristy areas but few as good as the Pink Door. The alleyway entrance and the unlabeled pink door lets you know that you're in the right place. The service was vibrant, smart, and didn't constantly interrupt the conversation. Our server tried to let me order off menu, but the kitchen didn't have what I was looking for - a roasted garlic clove appetizer that I get each time I'm in town. Not to worry, the seared scallops and polenta were absolutely incredible. I keep coming back because of the high standards, quick service, and saucy vibe.

the pink door was great. Super service and great food! The atmosphere was super fun and I would definitely recommend it! Gluten free pasta and bread was available. I had a delicious gluten free chicken panini.

If everyone knew how great this place is then it would be a mob scene.  We had a wonderful Valentine's Day dinner.  

Our waiter was perfect, the food was out of this world and the couple behind us got engaged!  I can't blame them.  This place will make you fall in love.
Absolutely amazing! The lasagna was so delicious! I can't wait to come back for a burlesque show and a lunch on the patio when it's nice out.
This is my wife's favorite restaurant in Washington. The environment is great, try to see the cabaret. The food is excellent, I recommend the bolognese pasta.

We came for a quiet, pleasant valentine lunch. The service was great, the drinks were yummy, and the food was good also. The pan fried brussels sprouts and the antipasto were both excellent. My main dish, muffalda with sugo of rabbit was ok, unremarkable but not bad. Overall I would recommend this spot for lunch or dinner. Service brought it home, too, the people there are excellent.

So blessed to be able to have a wonderful lunch here on Valentine's day. Reservations only on special days so plan ahead. Pink doors signature pesto lasagna. ..worth the trip to the busy Pikes Place business area.

I had heard of this place for years but never got the opportunity to try it. We ate there for our Valentines celebration and it was amazing. Excellent food and service. Try the sauteed calamari and the scallops when they are in season. Just simply perfect.

It was indeed not really easy to find the pink door, our attention was drawn to the other side of the alley with other restaurants and bars. 
We thought the restaurant was very cosy, the staff very friendly, the food delicious. It was a great experience. We hope to go again soon !

We were spending the day in Seattle and needed to drop by the market, so my friend suggested the Pink Door for a late lunch. I had always wanted to eat there, but had never been able to get reservations, so I used OpenTable to secure us a spot. We had the best food I've had in a long time! We split the roasted beet salad (to die for) and the full size antipasto salad (makes my mouth water just remembering it) with bread and wine. OMG, it was wonderful. Our server was very nice and was attendant, the décor was pretty funky, but clean, all and all, a great late lunch!
Kooky fun place. Good food

Many people have recommended that we dine at The Pink Door ... after 10 years, we finally went. And we were not disappointed! Knowing where to enter was a bit of a challenge since the door is unmarked and it was too dark to tell if the door is actually pink. But once we figured it out, the staff immediately impressed us with their positive, welcoming, and friendly attitudes. Terrance, our waiter, provided excellent recommendations for appetizers, pasta, and side dishes. We found it difficult to call out one dish as better than another. However, we recommend highly saving room for the lemon polenta cake ... amazing! Our total bill for multiple cocktails, and 7 courses was VERY reasonable! We'll definitely return to try different dishes, enjoy live entertainment during the week, and the Saturday night burlesque show!

Went there for lunch before going to a matinee at Moore Theatre.  Parked near the and walked for a block and a half.  Great find!  Had a whole fish, prepared to perfection (that's hard to find, believe it or not).  Would definitely go back again.

We had an outstanding waiter and the food was amazing.   Out waiter's knowledge  of the wines  served came into play when trying to pick out a bottle for dinner.    He  was equally knowledgeable about the menu and our dinner was great.     While the line at the door grew long, he did not try to hurry us out and instead let us linger over coffee and conversation with our friends.
i love that  place. service n food was good. but awfully small portion of food.

The food was 5 star....the only thing that outshone the food was the service of our wait staff that have all been here for more than 7 years.    Highly recommend starting with hot pot of white anchovies, garlic and olive oil with platter of raw vegetable for starter.   Pink door lasagna was good but shared plate for four of linguini with clams was better.......special of the evening was Sole in Piccata Sauce with fingerling potato's......and for celebrating their birthday being in business....they brought back the 3 custard filled cream puffs covered with dark chocolate sauce.....which can be shared with 3 people but better that you just keep them for yourself.
Delicious Italian food that's straight to the point! The clams and mussels were fresh. Also the service was great and the prices were perfect for what we got.

There are so many places to go out in Seattle but the Pink Door is special. I took my husband for his 40th birthday dinner and it was amazing. He said he's never had a better dinner out anywhere...ever! You cannot go wrong with this place!!!!

Returned to the venerable Pink Door after a 10 year absence. The location and set up of facilities continues to charm and people watching was excellent; highly entertaining in fact. The restaurant was in full swing with almost 100% seating on this Friday night. Combined with normal restaurant noise, the cacophony made it almost impossible to converse around. The service, food and recommended wine were merely adequate; not up to my expectation or past experiences here. The functioning of the restaurant felt a little off/out of sync; perhaps because of the Friday evening crush of customers. I would like to try the Pink Door again to see if they were merely having an off night.

We went to the Pink Door for my fiance's birthday. The service was great and I had arranged in advance for a glass of Prosecca (sp) to be delivered to the table once we were seated. The Pink Door delivered as promised and that kicked off a wonderful evening. The Ahi Tuna carpaccio appetizer was amazing (prepared by Chef Zach) as were the seafood entrees (scallops and swordfish). It wasn't our first time to the Pink Door and it won;t be our last.
Wonderful cozy ambiance. A bit on the loud side. The food was delectable, particularly the grilled squid appetizer. We thought the portions a bit too small. House wine was perfect and reasonable.
It was our first visit to The Pink Door, and we had a little trouble finding the place, but once that was accomplished, everything was great.
Loved the food and definitely order the Tuna appetizer. Waiter was extremely helpful and a great place to go for a special occasion

The atmosphere in the restaurant is pretty cool and very relaxed. I had a Caesar Salad for an appetizer, which was delicious and I had the special for dinner "Pepper Corn Swordfish". It seemed like a good idea but the Peppercorn was overwhelming to the fish and I wouldn't recommend getting it again. I would like to check this place out again though while getting a different meal.

Horrible service. Came in for lunch with no reservations  for 4 people and was told there were no tables available. However, the host did offer open seating at the back bar. This was ridiculous since the place was apparently empty.  While waiting for service by the bar, I made reservations online. Once reservations were placed, I was immediately  seated to a table. This is quite strange that the place was empty and I had to go through the the hassle of making online reservations to get better seating. In addition, the waitress splashed wine all over my outfit while opening the bottle for us.  Besides the cute ambience, this was a ruined experience by the host and waitress.  Very poor customer service.

The Pink Door can be relied on for consistently excellent service, a great ambience and fresh, delicious food! It has always been busy/full when I've eaten there, but I always felt like we were the only ones in the restaurant with the prompt, friendly service. We had a lovely evening celebrating my daughter's 21st Birthday. I would highly recommend this restaurant for people who appreciate great food and exceptional service.

The Pink Door is made especially if you want to enjoy a show. With dinner involved, you get to get best of both worlds. We made a reservation about 8:15pm while we were in seattle trying out dinner in the neighborhood of Pike Market district and low and behold, there was a show that came with our dinner on a Tuesday night at 8:45pm and it was amazing. A lady came and danced and did some aerials moves while we were enjoying our dinner. The dinner on the other hand was quite delicious. The server recommended the special which was a cod with brocolini and ricotta. It was really good and smooth especially since seafood is right near the water next to seattle. They don't even have to import to get fish. I really enjoyed the food while getting to watch the show. 

Parking was free after 8pm if you could find a spot.
We had a great evening here with excellent food. I would highly recommend the antipasto plate to share to start. Atmosphere was great and I look forward to returning!

Beautiful l ambiance and all  dishes looked super good.
The band that played that night was very entertaining.

Our overall experience here was great. The food was outstanding, even the olive oil that came with the bread basket was memorable. I was visiting a girlfriend in Seattle with anther friend of ours, and the Pink Door was the perfect spot to celebrate our reunion. Beautiful decor and ambiance. Great date spot for sure

My wife's favorite dish is the lasagna and she looks forward to it every time.  We have had nothing but great experiences at the Pink Door.  The menu subtly changes every few weeks, it seems, so there is always something new to try.  Even the recipes change slightly in their presentation which keeps it from getting mundane.  We've had Andrew three times as our server and the guy is a complete professional.  Well done.  Looking forward to our next trip to the Door!

Nicest server I've ever had. The waiter really cared about us and talked like he cared about the food too. The way he described the food and new every minute detail about our meals was amazing and truly enhanced the meal.
Service was excellent and food was great. The only miss was that didn't have a rose wine. No pink wine at pink door?  We had a great night.
We had a great time at the pink door...the food, service and ambience was fantastic!
It is very quaint, classy and vibrant. The mini special events are definitely a plus

The live trapeze artist was excellent.  The scallops were tender and pretty tasty, but the Dungeness crab cakes were inedible!  They had been flattened like a cheap burger with some sort of terrible filler.  My wife ate two bites.  I tried one bite and I'll eat anything-horrible.  So, go for the show, enjoy some wine but avoid the crab cakes in my opinion!
Seemed pricey for what you get. Waiter kept coming by to take away a dish or collect payment when we weren't finished. Made us feel rushed even with empty tables around.

When you find a place you love, it's an easy decision on where to go for a relaxing afternoon glass of wine and appetizers, or for a spontaneous lunch, or for that special evening in a sumptuous setting.  

The food at the Pink Door is always spot on, as is the service.  I've had most items on the menu and have a few that I revisit regularly (the antipasti - with the freshest tasty morsels and the calamari - done to perfection!).  

On this occasion, I treated myself to the lasagna.  I haven't had it in years because it's pretty decadent!  It was as wonderfully creamy and rich as I remembered it. 

The bar, the lounge, the dining room, or the deck in the summer, each provide their unique Pink Door experience.

 I'm sure I'll be back next week, at least once!

We had the sautéed calamari. It was amazing. Then for dinner I had seared scallops. So good! However, my wife had the mushroom fettuccine. She said they could take it off the special menu. Said it wasn't that good and had better elsewhere.

We have eaten lunch on the outside deck several times in the past and was always pleased with the food and service.  December 20, 2014 was the first time we ate in the dining room.  It was our 49 wedding anniversary.  We were pleasantly surprised.  From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with smiles, served complimentary champagne, promptly served after ordering, entertained by the trapeze artist, thoroughly enjoyed our main entrée', and delighted with the "past, present, and future" candles served with dessert.

Needless to say, our anniversary dinner at The Pink Door enjoyable and memorable.  Five stars all the way!

My husband and I had a late lunch at the Pink Door a few days before Christmas. The restaurant really is a hidden gem near Pike Market and close to Central Seattle shopping. The ambiance is European cafe; the menu is mostly Italian. The Caesar salad was made even better with homemade croutons. I had the butternut squash ravioli which was wonderful while my husband had an Italian sausage pasta dish with marinara that he described as average. The service was attentive. Our lunch was accompanied by an aerial acrobatic performance that was good and fun to watch but seemed a little out of place at lunchtime. Overall, a good and different place for lunch in Seattle.
We live in Portkand we have been coming to The Pink Door for over Thirty years.  My favorite restaurant in Seattle.  Do not change a thing.

Love this consistent restaurant.  Food couldn't be more delicious and service is always as close to perfect as it can be.  Rated 4 stars only because it was so loud on last visit that visiting was tiresome.

House smoked ahi tuna was outstanding. Loved the antipasto, great variety in an antipasti  not seen anywhere else. The lasagna is the best I have ever had, rich in flavor but magically not heavy. Beautiful cioppino broth, seafood perfectly cooked. Caramel boogie cake was sinful. Good service, perfect amount of attention. Love the warm atmosphere. Highly recommended!!!

Its ridiculously unassuming entry gives no clue of what waits inside! The main dining room is intimate and elegant. So why not throw in a live trapeze show during dinner, with a gorgeous aerial artist swinging over your perfectly-crafted meal? Funky and fun-- somehow it works! The outdoor deck is spectacular in the summer, and the large lounge and bar area is a great place for more casual dining, with the benefit of first -class food. The staff is hip, handsome, and professional. Definitely a Seattle must!

The scene is vibrant, the staff is friendly, the food is amazing. We had the lasagna and rigatoni with meatballs both were outstanding. The night we we chose there was a trapeze artist that swung above our table, very fun to watch. We will be back.
We had a great time ... Wonderful staff and wait staff and food was fabulous . Especially loved the trapeze show!!

The food and drink was unique and delicious. Wait staff welcoming and helpful.  What was with the trapeze act?!  Now I want one for every meal.  Three words:  Amazing, romantic, unique, perfect.  Thank goodness this is a renewable resource in Seattle.  We will be back.

The food is consistently good at the Pink Door.  I am gluten free and dairy free so I think my food was not as good as my companions' food, but still I appreciated that they were so accomodating to me and that I was able to enjoy a nice meal at an Italian restaurant.  We really enjoyed the Candy Cane dressed trapeze artist which was an unexpected, but fun surprise. Service was good and overall it was just a really fun, nice lunch.
Great neighborhood spot for dinner and entertainment, with friends.  Food is excellent.  Highly recommend this dinner experience.
Secluded city location. Excellent entertainment, food was amazing andat staff perfect

We've been to Seattle many, many times over the last 30-40 years and always enjoy eating at one of our favorite restaurants (Wild Ginger, Green Lake Grill, the old Union Square Grill, Purple Wine cafe and bar, Elliott's for their crab chowder...) and also trying out new ones for variety sake.

I used to write travel reviews and "where to eat and stay" tips for various magazines so consider myself to be fairly well traveled and considerably experienced in dining around the world be it in a local food market in Asia, a fish stand on the Isle of Kho Panang, Thailand;  a small out of the way spot in Ankara, Turkey or Rio; to the finest restaurants of the world's major cities...   

The Pink Door is now in our list of top 5 restaurants EVER in Seattle. Great location (near Pike St. Market), excellent ambiance and truly fantastic, diverse cuisine and matching wine list.  The service was equal to the finest restaurants we've dined at (Lutece in New York; Maxim's in Paris, Busaracum in Bangkok; Les Trois Pheasant in Dijon, France; Chez Panisse in Berkeley, Ca.  Whether it's the Pink Door's marvelous beet salad, the wonderful lasagna, or an entree like their Cioppino or Grilled Lamb long shank the food is exceptional both in terms of presentation and quality.

Oh, and the PD's burlesque show is a terrific experience and one that should not be missed!  It's in high demand, so book ahead of time if you want to add that to your overall experience at the Pink Door.

I live/work in Berkeley, CA and I LOVE this restaurant.  The first time I went was with a large convention group.  Loved the meal & was too full for dessert.  But, I saw something on the menu that caught my eye;  a Budino made with butterscotch -  I believe.  I ordered it thinking that I would share it, but no!  I wanted it all to myself!  It is my favorite dessert ANYWHERE - hands down.  I recently flew to Seattle to visit family and I made reservations here for dinner.  I called several days before to confirm the reservation and begged that they have the Budino on the menu Friday.  Sadly, no such luck.  But my family loved the dinner - and so did I.  I wonder if I will ever have the Budino again?  Oh, the service is wonderful and the atmosphere festive and comfy.  A bit noisy but you can still have a conversation at a table for 6.
One of my favorite Italian restaurants anywhere. Authentic Italian food complimented by a well thought out winelist.

Really enjoyed our experience. Waitress was prompt and checked back, but didn't hover, which was good. Food was delivered quickly and was great as usual for authentic italian cuisine. Ceasar salad with crab was a big hit! Well priced for the good quality.
We were running very late for our reservation and called to say we would be a little late.  When we arrived, they were able to accommodate us no problem and did not rush us.  It was great!
Wow! Super cool location! I felt like I was in a movie! And the food was great too! Definitely recommend!

I had the cioppino and my wife had the bolognese.  The cioppino was very good and the bolognese was the best we've ever had, and we've eaten many bolognese dishes!

I highly recommend the ahi appetizer - absolutely outstanding!  You will feel like you're in Italy or France dining in this wonderful restaurant.  Unique and welcoming ambience that would be ideal for a romantic meal.  

Don't recommend bringing young children here as some servers wear a rather risque apron displying a faux image of the male anatomy.  They have burlesque on Saturday nights so apparently this is an adult-oriented restaurant.
Butternut squash ravioli was very good.  Scallops slightly under-cooked.  Great specialty cocktails. Somewhat tight quarters so I was nearly shoulder to shoulder with guest at next table.
Kale salad was exceptional.  Added chicken, which was incredible.

My brother and I had a great dinner here in October, and then my friend is visiting this week from the Bay Area, and we had another delicious dinner and fun acrobat entertainment in the midst of dinner.  A great place to take visitors to or for local friends as well to enjoy!  So glad I found this gem!

Came back here for a 3rd time. Got the best table in the corner and our server was great. Made good recommendations and took the time to give us attention yet still be discreet. 

Food was terrific with the prosciutto and the roasted garlic. Gnocchi with pumpkin was delicious but personally we felt could have done without the hazelnuts. The rabbit ragu 
was sensational. Best dish of the knight.  

Server bottled our wine to take home and enjoy. Overall a great experience. We'll be back for sure.

After some confusion about our table that I had reserved months in advance, we were finally given the table that I requested and the night went perfectly. The food was excellent, service was wonderful and all in all a great night.

We arrived early for our reservation so went to the bar to have a cocktail and appetizer.  We really enjoyed the calamari as it was tender and lightly breaded.  Our server for dinner was very attentive and engaging and made spot on recommendations for our meals and wine.  We will go back to experience more selections from their menu.  The only negative was the large group we were seated next too as they were very noisy, but I assume that was an anomaly.
My friend and I went in, not knowing what to expect and we were both blown away! Great food, great atmosphere, great everything! I would recommend this to anyone, but make a reservation fist!

We were directed to the Pink Door by many friends and the concierge at our hotel "The Inn at the Market."  After making an online reservation, we walked down the alley to a pink door.  No sign here…thank goodness we were told about the restaurants location or we might have missed it.  we arrived to find a completely charming restaurant.  The atmosphere was warm, inviting and the host/hostess were quite friendly. After siting down at a table in the lounge, and talking with the very friendly waitress, we ordered the pumpkin gnocchi and the cioppino.  Fantastic is not a strong enough adjective to describe how wonderful our meal was.  From the bread, to the very strong drinks, to the delicious main courses, to the amazing entertainment we were extremely impressed.  Needless to say, we will definitely be returning upon our next visit to Seattle!

Our server was very knowledgeable with the wines and entrees'. I thought I knew what I was going to order until she explained the penne pasta special with eggplant- yummy! The house red wine was excellent and my sister and I experienced a great first impression.

When I go on vacation I plan where I go. then where I'll eat. I drive seven hours to stay in Seattle, and I must eat at the pink door. It is the reason we keep coming back. The entire menu is awesome. the people are the best. Please keep doing what your doing

We arrived at 6:45, we were gone by 7:45.  We ordered a very nice bottle of wine, appetizer and mains.  We indicated to the waiter to spread it out and that we were not in a rush.  We received our mains before our appetizer and I'm not kidding you we had our meals on our table no more than 10 minutes after we ordered.  We were finished our meals before the wine.  We had intended on staying quite a while but decided to go somewhere else for a night cap.  Very disappointed.
This was an awesome place to find. We had a delicious dinner and the service was wonderful. Great job to the team at the Pink Door!
An always reliable business lunch location with an attentive staff.
We celebrated our birthdays and the staff, food,and service was excellent. Stayed for the late night fun and enjoyed the complete experience.

I love the decoration of the restaurant. Took a lot of pictures. Service was fast and outstanding. The waiter who filled our water cups was working so hard. He wanted to make sure that we have full cup of water at all time. He is the best. 
Lasagna was so delicious. Calamari was tender and super tasty.
The Pink Door did it again.  Great food and excellent service.  It's one of our favorite restaurants in town.

We had a great meal at the Pink Door. 

Our meal, though, was wonderful.  We shared a salad and calamari appetizer followed by Cioppino for me and lasagna for my husband.  Both were excellently spiced. The service as outstanding.  Our water glasses never got past half full, we were offered extra bread so that I could enjoy the last drop of my Cioppino.

We went to the Pink Door for a romantic dinner for a special occasion.  It was difficult to find as there was no signage, and a garbage truck in the alley, making us nearly miss it.  Once inside, it was an eclectic whimsical environment and very lively. I had heard there was going to be a trapeze artist performing at 8:45.  Our reservation was at 9:00 and was disappointed to learn that her performance was at 8:45 for 4 minutes and it was the last performance of the night.  In any event, the dinner was pricey but was excellent.  I would definitely return for a special occasion.
We did not know what to expect. No signage is quirky but clearly not necessary as the food and service speak for themselves.

It's a shame that restaurants can't lessen the amount of salt they use in their dishes.  My husband and I both had the linguine with clams which had prosciutto.  There was too much of it hence the saltiness.  A. little goes a long way and a dish that is salty becomes overwhelming and loses any subtlety.  Our server was cheery and aimed to please.

Went for lunch with a friend. I had the kale salad and cioppino, my friend had the sauteed calamari and rock fish. Everything tasted amazing and the service and atmosphere was great. They gave us this cookie sandwich for free for dessert and that tasted great as well!
Absolutely the best lasagna I've ever had. And my wife's cioppino was outstanding as well.  Very good wine pairings with the Seattle Restaurant Week $30 for 3 courses meals. A terrific value.
Awesome food.  Live entertainment is an added bonus!

It was an amazing experience, the food was great, the waiters were friendly and knowledgeable. The ambience was soothing and beautiful. We ate off the $30 special Seattle dining menu, and the portions were generous.

We were lucky to reserve for a Monday night while my brother was visiting Seattle, since the trapeze artist only does shows on Sunday and Monday.  Service was great and both of us really liked our fish dishes; mine had a delicious sauce.  The trapeze shows were an added bonus, with a lovely and graceful woman performing for just the right amount of time.  The clientele was also enjoyable.  A perfect evening!

We go whenever there is restaurant week menu.  Comfy, cozy and did I say the food was delicious?  This time, restaurant week lunches did NOT include dessert (a change from previous years when dessert WAS included), but the server kindly brought us two complimentary cookies in lieu of.  Very nice touch.

My boyfriend and I were visiting Seattle for the weekend.  And among all the food recommendations, if we are ever back in the Seattle area, this would be the one place we would DEFINITELY come back to (for the lasagna!!!).  The lasagna may be the absolute best we've ever had - delicious homemade noodles and the pesto inside was so good.  The pappardelle bolognese was good, too; however, it was served room temperature...  The service was only okay.  Not the friendliest.  BUT, the food was so good, how could you not return!?

The food was really good, the ambiance is perfect. Need to improve in service. We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and when I did the reservation write a note telling them that and we didn't receive nothing special for the ocation. Loudly.

Looked up on google the most romantic restaurant in Seattle. Found the Pink Door. I surprised my wife of 17 years on our anniversary. Had a great time and an excellent meal. We cannot wait for the next time. We already know what we are ordering. Thanks for a wonderful night. The Ragghianti's
This is great spot for any date, day or night. Not too romantic if it's a first but can be just enough if it is a special occasion.
Un lugar peculiar para tener una pasta deliciosa y un momento muy agradable. Muy recomendable.

Unusual atmosphere, tables were very squished together and the waiters hardly had space to walk and serve.  Another reason it seemed too noisy,  you could hear everyone talking loud around you.  The Caesar Salad and the wild mushrooms on polenta appetizer were very delicious, but the risotto with crab was just o.k. and the Linquine with clams was soooo salty I returned it twice and ended up not eating anything else for dinner.  Good for a first experience, but one time was enough.
We enjoyed a wonderful lunch on the Pink Door patio. Wonderful food, great service and nice view. They were also very accommodating is dietary need. Highly recommend!
Excellent food! The risotto is particularly good. We enjoyed the music, but it was a bit loud for us to enjoy conversation.

I was visiting Seattle for the first time and stopped by this restaurant. The best whole fish I have ever had!!!!! I will be returning to this restaurant again when I go back to Seattle for a business trip.

Who would've thought that little Pink Door in an alley would hold such delicious food?  I had quite possibly the best lasanga I've ever tasted in my life, and I'm Italian, so that's saying a lot.  I don't think I left a spot of sauce on the plate.

Such a great lite neighborhood find!  It was sortof hidden down this cute little alley that we ended up spending a lot of time on.  Great service, lots of menu options and the outdoor seating was so nice for lunch.  Can't wait to go back on a future trip to Seattle!

We felt like we had been let in on a little secret.  Finding the restaurant in itself is fun.  Simply a pink door in the alley, no sign, no address.  Once you go in you are immersed in a unique dining experience.  We were lucky to be there the night of the trapeze artist as well - performing inches over our heads.  All this, and my pumpkin gnocchi was fantastic as was the signature dessert.
We really enjoyed the restaurant's unique ambience and the food was spot-on and delicious. Would highly recommend.
It has high performance-price ratio, more than what I expected. The atmosphere there is great, good choice for couples.

After reading so many good reviews of this place I went to try it. I have no idea why people rave about this place. The most important thing, the food, was nothing special. The coppio broth tasted like spicy water. The risotto tasted like four cheese rice a roni with ragu in it, and barely had any crab mixed in. The ambiance is cool if you get the right table. They tried to squeeze us in a table practically in the center of the room where you are constantly getting hit by all the people coming through. Then you go outside to sit on some dinky metal chairs that hurt after about 20 mins. I'm a foodie, I love great food, but there are far better dining places in Seattle including ones focused on Italian cuisine.

I come here almost every time I'm in Seattle and I have never been disappointed. The caprese (summer only) salad is divine, the antipasto plate is humongous and delicious, the beet salad is perfectly balanced. They do great with meats and their pasta is homemade and delicious. The potato gnocchi are amazing (semolina gnocchi are nothing to write hime about). And the desserts are also wonderful. They even have gluten free pasta for my wheat-sensitive daughter! And they only serve good wine, and the specialty cocktails are pretty much always winners.

My husband & I went for my birthday lunch.  It was wonderful! - great ambience, romantic, great wine and food (including gluten free bread!), good service.  The dessert was delicious, too and came with a birthday candle.  Loved the whole experience!!
Love the pinlk door, been coming here for years! Still one of seattle's finest!
We visited this restaurant on the recommendation of a friend and it lived up to the hype. Very good food and the entertainment was impressive.
I went here to celebrate an engagement and it was the perfect spot for it.  Very romantic and delicious food.  The staff was also amazing.

Great food, wine and atmosphere.  Service was outstanding, not in your face but there when you need and this was on a night when they were turning people away who didn't have a reservation!  Place was packed, vibrant and we enjoyed every minute of it.  To be safe best to make a reservation in advance.

From the time we entered the restaurant and until we left we were treated like old friends. Our server, Amy, was remarkable!  She took time to explain any questions we had and made us feel like we were her only customers. The food was exceptional but the dessert was over the top. Incredible! Don't leave Seattle without eating here.

I expected this place to be cozy, romantic and vibrant. I did see a glimpse of that. I felt that the place was too cluttered, too noisy to be romantic. Food was good. Staff was amazing and polite.Overall I was happy
This restaurant is always great and always has been! I've never been disappointed:)
The artisan cheese plate was the best I've ever had.  The dark chocolate pieces really made it special.  Could have used a few more apple slices.  A really iconic Seattle gem of a restaurant.
The Pink Door is always a fun place to visit with loved ones or friends.  The service was very good as was the food!  The mini-show during dinner made the experience fun and unique!

Enjoyed the great sunset on the deck for the 5 of us.  We were seated immediately as they had our table waiting. Great service.  While the scallops when excellent, the salmon special was good - outstandingly cooked med rare however the salmon tasted bland....it needed more spices like smoked paprika, parsley, crushed pistachios all in melted garlic butter and glazed over the salmon as it cooks.  Umm sounds better already - give it a taste test Mr/Ms Chef!  The desserts where excellent - summer crisp and burlesque pie!

This place was highly recommended by users of Yelp. Because of that, I could not get booked on a Saturday night dinner, so I opted for lunch. The place had a nice view of the lake/sea, had a gypsie-ish vibe to it,  food was very generously proportioned and great to top it all off, the service was fantastic! The only drawback I can think of is the location can be very tricky to find and traffic is horrible around the area. But that is kind of expected as it was right next to Pike Place Market. It was all worth it though!

LOVED THIS PLACE!!!

We almost didn't find it as it is located in the Post Alley of Pike Place Market and if you miss the door, you may miss the spot. It's more of a coral/peachy color and definitely not pink.  BUT WHO CARES?!  Food was delicious.  If you can - get a table on the deck/patio as it over looks the water. 

We started off w/the cheese board and it was a nice starter as they give you 4 different cheese, 4 different spreads/nuts/etc to try.  Make sure you order extra bread!! 

I had the crab risotto.  It was delicious and they are not cheap w/the crab.  Risotto was very creamy and cooked perfectly.

This was a very special anniversary dinner and the restaurant did not disappoint. From the service to the beautiful patio to the outstanding food we could not have been any happier. We especially loved the crab risotto!!!
When you come to Seattle do not miss this place at all.

Food was great, the view was amazing. We wanted to catch the burlesque show and were under the impression that dinner came with the show, however it is a 1st come 1st serve show and we were disappointed that we could not see the show. Aside from that, the food was great and the ambiance and view was wonderful. They even have blankets for diners who get a chilly.
Loved the whole restaurant experience...only wished I had known about the events prior to my reservation-the acrobatics above the dining room would have been amazing to see!

This little gem is hard to find but well worth it once you get there. My wife and I went there in the early fall when the weather in Seattle is still sunny and mild. The outdoor seating with the view over the bay was perfect! This restaurant utilized their spices and herbs to enhance the flavor of their food and it was delicious. Get there before 1800 because it gets quite busy and crowded but the customer service is still good.

The Pink Door never disappoints. The food is very good and well presented. The service perfect. And the view from the terrace/patio overlooking Elliott Bay is great especially on warm days. I highly recommend the Pink Door. Even the inside dining area is great, sort of funky and definately not a cookie cutter chain place.
Every time that I have made a reservation with Open Table I have always been happy to express that my requests have always been fulfilled.
Charming place with a phenomenal view, outstanding food and exceptional waitstaff.  Highly recommend for a special occasion or for a night out with the ones that matter most!
Great Cheese and Meat boards, love the patio and the atmosphere.  Always good service and great food

Had a thoroughly enjoyable and memorable dining experience with outstanding food and great service. We reside in Santa Cruz, CA, and traveled to Seattle for short vacation and old time's sake. We resided in Seattle area seven years (1995-2001) and used to dine at The Pink door every few months. It was great "coming home" and getting a table on outdoor patio area with a fantastic view.

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed ourselves. He ordered the scallops. They had a nice crust on them, they were buttery, well cooked, and just plain delectable. I ordered the peppercorn steak and I couldn't have been happier. The mashers with mascarpone were rich and delicious! For dessert we ordered the tiramisu. I thought it was good, but my boyfriend outright said it was the best he's ever had. We definitely plan on going back and would recommend to a friend...maybe even take visiting family there.

... and the acrobat inside was a pretty freakin' neat/ different experience. We sat on the deck outdoors, but moved inside to watch a couple of the performances. Not what I'd expect from a killer Italian restaurant, but very cool. Would absolutely go back even w/out the show. Service and food were both outstanding.

In a city of the freshest farm to table ingredients it is difficult to stand out.
The Pink Door has surpassed the competitors in Seattle for service, food and ambiance.
The corn ragout side dish was amazing, the crab risotto was butter based and delicious.

I asked the hospitality desk attendant at a conference where she would eat if she only had one meal in the city and she said without hesitation, "The Pink Door."  Since I had already booked a table on OpenTable, I had high expectations for that dinner.  The Pink Door exceeded all my expectations and even my coworkers  (who are impossible to please) loved it!  They both said it was the best Italian meal they had had in a long while.  The handmade pasta was delicious as well as the clams.  We eat out a lot (3+ times per week) and usually something is a little off: the food, the drinks, the service, the wait.  At The Pink Door, everything was perfect.  I wish they were in my town!

They happily took a party of 8 for lunch. I ordered the paglia e fieno (summer mushrooms, nipitella & light cream) and thought I had died and gone to heaven. Not cheap, but oh so worth it. It was one of the most delicious lunches I have ever had. They got us in and fed quickly without feeling rushed.
Me and my husband were visiting seattle and came to the pink door on our last night.  Beautiful view from patio and the food was amazing.

On a recommendation, we had our first meal upon moving to Seattle one Monday night. Needless to say, we may have set the bar too high to begin learning this fantastic town. The ambiance is the right kind of busy with indirect lighting and mirrors among antiques in a dimmed, intimate setting. The menu is solid for Italian. Do the lasagna, don't think twice. Add a pair of hefty meatballs if you must carne. Caprese and risotto were also incredible decisions. We will be back. Don't be between me and the menu if you value your life.

As our first time here,  we were impressed with the unique and intimate atmosphere.   The bruschetta was not what we expected, just heirloom tomatoes on toast.  But rest of our meal was outstanding!  We had the Pescatore and linguine Alle Vongole.

Family from FL came for a visit & we wanted to go to a new place for everyone. This seemed ideal & glad we went. Great food, staff, service  & atmosphere. Highly recommend if you're looking for a new place to check out. Will definitely go again.

I had never been to the Pink Door before and was pleasantly surprised. It is located near Pike Place Market on Post Alley, and actually has a pink door (a light pink). My friend and I had lunch on the outdoor patio with a great view of Eliot Bay. We both had pasta dishes that were excellent. I would highly recommend the paparadelle Bolognese. I will definitely be back!
Always great, a must when I am in Seattle. The lasagna is amazing, the ambiance of sitting outside is unmatched as I feel like I am in Italy.

On a recent visit to Seattle, we returned to The Pink Door after many years.  A beautiful night, we were seated on the deck overlooking the water.  Very busy, with lots of happy diners.  Good menu, food was delicious (excellent Caesar salad), and well presented.  Our only complaint was that the service was a bit slow, but a wonderful dessert made us forget about the delays.  Good night at The Pink Door.

We had a wonderful lunch at the Pink Door the other day.  My only complaint is the door isn't really Pink and it is a tad hard to find. We were on Post Alley with other lookers who had walked right by.  Once in, we went back to the outdoor porch and it was just lovely.  The water view was perfect for our guest to Seattle.  Our lunches were delicious.  No complaints at all.  They even took care of my food allergies and helped me order appropriately and redid the sauce for me.  I am looking forward to our return visit to The Pink Door.
Delicious, romantic, eclectic, great music, FOOD and ambiance.
We Loved the food and the atmosphere of the restaurant.
Very eclectic place, with a great food, great service and an all around wonderful experience.  Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

My husband, daughter and I had a fabulous dinner.  I had the vegetarian lasagna that was light and flavorable.  The lamb ribs and sausages were excellent and my daughter loved her seafood over ink pasta.  When in town again, we would definitely stop by The Pink door.
It never disappoints . The food was amazing, and the waitstaff exceptional .

I took my boyfriend here for his 21st birthday. We got there a bit early and they said that they would prepare a table for us, so a hostess lead us to the bar. There were no seats and she said to just sit on the stage, but it was very awkward and people were laughing at us, so we went to a different host and he seated us outside. It was a bit chilly but they offer blankets, which I thought was very nice! We had the meatballs as well as the bruschetta and the steak, plus chocolate cake for dessert. Everything was delicious and perfectly seasoned! The service was a bit slow, but very good considering how packed the place was. Definitely recommend making reservations if you want to get into this place. Overall a lovely experience!
So fun and the food was excellent. Really felt like I was experiencing something unique in Seattle.
spagetti and calamari were good. Fresh seafood ingredient, for sure.

We arrived in Seattle around 6:30PM.  By the time we got to our condo, it was almost 8, and we were famished.  The concierge recommended Pink Door, and it was fantastic.  Over the next 5 days, we ate there 3 times.  Fresh, innovative, delicious.  Can't wait to go back.  No sign out front, just a pink door.....
We keep returning for the food and service. One of our Seattle favorites. A must do!

We thoroughly enjoyed out outdoor lunch and, although the seating was a bit close for comfort (we could hear the other tables conversations), the ambiance was fun and energetic.  A great way to take a break from touring downtown Seattle.   Our food and service were amazing!

It's been a couple of years since I last remembered to dine at The Pink Door, and gosh, have I been missing out! I'd forgotten how well-prepared, fresh and tasty everything on the menu is, and what a treat it is to dine overlooking the Market at Elliott Bay.  

The online reservations are for their tables outdoors (seasonal), so if you reserve via OpenTable, voila-- you have a table outdoors! I was a little worried about sitting outdoors as the sky was a bit gray... worry not! The first tiny drops of rain brought out a nearly-invisible sliding awning-- hidden behind the latticework overhead-- to keep us warm and dry even while it sprinkled around us.

The Pink Door is a treat: and try the cioppino-- it's Northwest-fresh, tasty & perfect!
great desert, salmon overcooked, great service, nothing really food noteworthy among our four diners.  price was reasonable for the location.  nice roof top dining area.
I loved this place. I loved the entrance, the ambience, the service and the food. If I lived in Seattle, I'd be a regular. Definitely a little pricey, bit worth every penny!!

The Pink Door has long been a favorite for Seattle funky style, great food, anda rareplace with a nice view right in the middle of Pike Place (where you might think there would be more places that fit this bill). Pink Door service is always attentive and friendly, the food great, and you just can't beat the feelinh of being outside looking at the water. It continues to remind me why it'sa favorite.

The Pink Door is one of my favorite Seattle restaurants. Although its menu is not particularly large, the dishes that they do have are executed wonderfully and always keep me coming back for more! The ambiance of the restaurant is quite charming and elegant. The outdoor seating area is perfect for warm summer nights. I'll be back again for sure!

The Pink Door has been around for many years and it is one of the best Pike Place Market gems.  The view from the outside dining deck is fantastic and the vibe of the market is all around.  The food and service is excellent and I would recommend a visit to anyone visiting or anyone that lives in the Seattle area.  It is tried and true experience in the market.

The Pink Door is such a gem for the Pikes Market area.  The food is excellent, the staff are very friendly and professional, the energy is always positive.  The outside seating is always the best, with the view it creates an "outdoor Parisian cafe" experience.  Can't go wrong with The Pink Door!
Love love love this patio! The food is wonderful too and we come often.
We went here on a recommendation from a friend.What a find! From the outside you don't expect much but wow!Great patio views,wonderful food and a terrific server.Highly recommended.

Not our first time at Pink Door, but few times better than August: great weather for outdoor seating and heirloom tomato season are tough to beat.  Whether it's in bruschetta or caprese salad (our choice), heirloom tomatoes are to be savored.  Likewise, some of Seattle's best meatballs are great in a sub or on the side (the latter this time, but both are winners).  Crab/sweet-corn risotto was "heaven in a bowl," according to my wife, and GF, too (one of several GF offerings).  The wine list offers many options, but for lunch we usually go with a half-carafe if house wine and have ever been disappointed.  Reservations strongly recommended, even if you're arriving at opening.
Recommended by friends who formerly lived in Seattle - were not disappointed.  Good food, great service and healthy pour.  Enjoyed the entertainment also.

My wife made us reservations while we were in Seattle.  After looking at the website I was a little hesitant and even suggested we try something else.  However, I was pleasantly surprised with the overall theme of the restaurant and the cuisine was surprisingly appetizing and well presented. This is a great find in Seattle and will complement anyone's dinning itinerary while in town.

The Pink Door did not disappoint, once again.  And we always have high expectations when we go there.  It is the best summer deck dining experience in the city, in my opinion.  Thank you and keep up the great work!
Love the decoration, and the service makes the experience even better. A must In seattle !
Excellent- went there for my Birthday with my family. We all thought it was great!

I am a gluten-free vegetarian. Therefore, I appreciate that Pink Door offers gluten-free pasta. Even so, there was only one vegetarian pasta dish offered with mushrooms which I dislike so I ordered something else when I looked forward to having pasta. It would be nice to have had a second choice. Nevertheless, I enjoyed the beautiful view, good service and quality food. I just wanted pasta instead of the panini that had a tasty filling but made with Udi's bread.

Sure enough, just as the website says you will not find a sign saying you've arrived at the right place, just a pink door in an alley. Cutting to the quick, excellent service, a noisy, boisterous atmosphere full of energy - exactly what one would expect at a good Italian restaurant.  The food was superb, my wife having oven baked lasagna and crab risotto fort myself. Our appetizer was bruschetta but not an ordinary one at that. Thick sliced heirloom tomatoes, sweet and full of flavor on garlicky sliced ciabatta (I think) drizzled with olive oil and fresh chopped basil. The lasagna was delicious, the risotto cooked perfectly. The only complaint was the corn and grape tomatoes in the risotto were so sweet as to detract from the crab. Poor me!
I had read several very positive reviews of Pink Door. I would just call it average. Not a good restaurant by Seattle standards.
My favorite dish is the Lasagna. Can't beat the deck on a sunny day. Love this place!
Excellent food, skillful service even for a large group.  Too many tempting choices -- it was hard to make a decision.

The day started gloomy but by evening it was perfect – the sun came out and our experience could not have been any finer than it was on the deck at the Pink Door. Our waitress Elyse was amazing – great sense of humor but never intrusive; always on top of our needs. And we indulged in super food – the tuna carpaccio was a standout; our entrees of scallops, lamb and the pasta of the day were excellent; and everything was rounded out by delightful wines and desserts. Thank you, Pink Door, for giving three long-time friends who explored Italy together 12 years ago an evening that transported us back to that fantastic trip.

This Pink Door was recommended by a friend whom has dined here before. We were on our way back home to Vancouver, BC from a Portland, OR road trip and made a pitstop in Seattle for lunch.
