The restaurant is located on Post Alley in the Pike Place Market area, similar to Granville Island in Vancouver. It also has outdoor patio seating. I had the Vegetable Lasagna while my girlfriend had the Seafood Spaghetti.

The food is decent with moderate portions, not the typical Amercan, obesity-inducing, super-sized portions like one usually sees in the States. This place seems like it would be more popular with the tourists than with the locals. It's a casual atmosphere serving Italian appies, pasta, one pizza, meat and seafood entrees. It was okay.

Very disappointed with the meals. Smallest portion of vegetables I have ever received, and they were cold and pickled. Served flat beer but was given the last dregs of the barrel free. Lamb was very salty although well cooked. My wife's chicken meal was OK. Would not recommend this place. My poorest meal of the holiday. Only gave two stars because my wife's meal was ok.
I'll keep it simple, I'll go there every time I go to Seattle
hard to find, no sign just a pink door but worth the effort.  Eat outside if you can, great view of harbor.  Great meal and service at moderate prices.

Having a reservation for Saturday's lunch saved us from a long wait as this place is very popular. The service was efficient and friendly. The food was awesome. Best New York steak I have ever had. It was tender and cooked to perfection. We have friends coming to visit, and the Pink Door will be on our places to visit list.

While the Pink Door is right in the middle of the crowded tourist area, once you go through that pink door, the rest of the world melts away.  We had a delightful dinner on the back porch, with a partial view of the bay.  We enjoyed a great Barolo and some wonderful food in a terrific atmosphere.  What's not to love about that.  The service was stellar, and the weather was wonderful.  It was a great night in Seattle.

This place has the cheekiest cocktails and most fabulous dungeness crab risotto to say the least.

Will I have to dine here again, YES!

I made a reservation over 3 weeks in advance for a Wednesday night and requested to be seated outside on the patio. The day of, I confirmed that I wanted to be seated outside and when we showed up at 7:48 for our 7:45 reservation, the hostess said she had already marked us as "no show" and given away our table. We were placed in the back of the dining room so we could not see the patio or even the band. This was extremely disappointing since it was my birthday and I had made reservations so far in advance. Besides the hostess, overall the food was great, the server was attentive, and we appreciated the real candles.
The Pink Door continues to be one of my favorite Seattle restaurants.  The patio setting is unmatched and the classic Italian menu consistently tasty.

Be aware that there is no actual sign on the door -- just a pink door in Post Alley, so find it by the address. Our waitress was wonderful. She made good suggestions and we tried several different items, all of which were delicious. The bruschetta and caprese appetizers were excellent and included large slices of the best tomatoes we have ever eaten (the bruschetta did not have diced tomatoes, but sliced) flavored gently with herbs to bring out the natural taste. As mains, three of us had the lasagne, the cioppino, and the Pappardelle Al Ragù Bolognese and each was delicious and delicate with robust but not over-powering flavors. I would come back tomorrow if I weren't trying to experience more of the city.

Found this restaurant a few years ago and have always wanted to return.  This latest dining experience was every bit as good as the first time.  We were well taken care of and the food was outstanding.  Can't think of a single bad thing to say.
Enjoyable time for a special occasion.  A bit loud and small/cramped inside so know what you're getting into...  Otherwise the live entertainment was unique and enjoyable.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at The Pink Door.  The food was absolutely awesome and the service was outstanding.  Our waitress was extremely cordial and very accommodating. I would highly recommend this restaurant and consider it a must when visiting Seattle.  My son'e pasta was excellent as was my dinner.  The Hotel 1000 highly recommended this restaurant and we totally agree.

This is very good but not great food, but given the quantities (huge appetizers) and prices it is well worth a trip.  The food is fresh, and somewhat creative - the olive oil with the bread, for example, is noteworthy.  We shared a grilled calamari appetizer and it was the highlight of the meal.  The pasta fruiti de mari, by contrast was relatively bland despite the description.  The wine list is broad and reasonable, and has several half bottles, always a pleasant surprise.

I always think that it is a great sign when it is difficult to get a reserv.  This palace was great all of the food was fresh (like it had been purchased from pikes market). It was beautifully prepared.  I had the NY strip steak and my husband had the crab risotto, both outstanding.   We started with the heirloom tomato salad it was the best.   Can't say enough good about it!  We will definitely return.

We have been going to Pink Door for years and year in and year out the food is always terrific and so is the service. In warm weather the outdoor terrace is perfect for lunch or dinner. This is consistently one of the best restaurants in Seattle!

What a great restaurant, the food, wine and atmosphere was all that we wanted and more. Our first trip to Seattle tells us that we will be back.

The staff too cannot go unmentioned, honestly friendly and enjoying their jobs!

My son and I had a great lunch on a warm, sunny Friday. Our server (wish I'd remembered his name) was very attentive, helpful with menu items and the wine selection. Just the right amount of checking back, seeing that we were doing well, really pleasant. The food is so nice and fresh and served hot and quickly. We did not have to wait for a thing, or remind for more water, etc. Appreciated the ice bucket with the wine, so many places don't do that anymore. Spot-on service, gorgeous view, yummy menu, best place in town to take friends and out-of-towners for a memorable Seattle dining experience. I will keep coming back !

we brought a friend from Nepal to enjoy the market area and of course had to eat on pink door's deck - the most perfect restaurant seating in downtown. superb service, excellent food, fabulous views. it did indeed impress our friend.
Wonderful food in a fun atmosphere.  Everything we tried was fabulous and service impeccable.  We sat inside and were perfectly satisfied but would like to go back and try the outside seating.

Just went to visit Seattle and my girlfriend took me here for lunch. Our table was not ready but it worked out perfect had a great time sitting at the bar with the very fun and friendly bartender. Had a great spot for lunch with an amazing view. Service was out standing food was delicious. Then went back to sit at bar and got to chat and meet some locals.

Overall, the dining experience fell far from expectations due to all the hype surrounding The Pink Door. The paglia e fieno was simple and tasty but the smoked ahi tuna carpaccio was bland and underseasoned with a terrible presentation. I also had, quite frankly, one of the worst cocktails I have ever had. The indoor decor and ambience was great but the outdoor scene was a tacky and low end mish-mash. There are better options available, especially for $50.
We were in town for only one night the Pink Door was recommended. It was a great choice.
I love bringing people to the Pink Door. The server was perfect and the food was great. Its been one of my favorite restaurants for 25 years. Just a wonderful experience.

The location is so special.  Not only is it in a vibrant part of Seattle, but the "secret" entrance adds to the draw.  The food is fantastic and the staff were very attentive and great at giving personally based food and drink suggestions.  The late night entertainemnt really adds to the special feel of the Pink Door.  Friday nights are better for music and cool 1960's tunes.  Saturday night has the burlisque show that is unique.  I preferred the Friday music, but both shows were well worth it.

My wife and I celebrated our 16th wedding anniversary here, and we were absolutely delighted. Our server Andrew was great, very professional and knowledgeable. Overall our experience at the Pink Door was an 11 on a scale of 1 to 10.

Been here only once before several years ago and had a great experience. Was down for the weekend and decided to see if we could relive the experience. Guess what? It was just as good as the first time. We'll be back the next time we are in Seattle for the weekend.

It was such a pleasure to see the abundance of fresh vegetables on their menu and in the 'featured items" for dinner that night.
The server informed us that 90% of the produce in their restaurant is currently from Butler farms on Bainbridge. .. all organic.We were also impressed with the wine list.. many of the wines are organic and or bio-dynamic, of which we are fans.
Service was warm, efficient not intrusive. Prices were a great  value when you experience the "free" entertainment along with the creative, not trendy, decor.

Asked for inside to listen to singer, verified two times including 6 hrs before times of reservation. Our request was ignored and we were told we could not sit inside because a larger party was being accomidated at the last minute. We had a nice view, but did not stay for dessert. Food and server were lovely.

My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for over 4 years. We absolutely love this place! The food is amazing and the ambience is one of a kind. I highly recommend the Pescotora (pasta, seafood and spicy marinara) Soo Good!!! But everything is amazing on the menu though. They even have live entertainment most nights of the week. From trapeze to burlesque to live music. You will not be disappointed with this restaurant.

Despite our reservation, we were seated 30 min late since the host allowed a party without reservations to use our table 50 min before our time. Otherwise, our lunch was fantastic and the view was spectacular.

Had a 12:15 reservation with a colleague from out of town - we needed to be back to office by 1pm.  We told the waiter about our time constraint.  Had delicious caprese salads and enjoyed the view.  Very impressive treat for both the out-of-towner and the Seattle-ite.

We have had this place on our "have to go" list based on friends recommendations for a couple of years.  Our meal last Saturday evening ranks as one of the top dining experiences we have had in Seattle.  It hit on all notes - delicious food, excellent professional wait-staff and service as well as a beautiful patio dining experience.  The bruschetta with heirloom tomatoes on garlic infused crusty bread was wonderful.  The scallops were amazing and the spinach lasagne with bechamel, pesto and marinara sauces was the best dish I've had in any restaurant in the past year.  The waiter was great; good flow without interrupting our conversations and really knew the menu and the wine list.  All in all, a memorable meal!
Food was good but the waiter was horrible.  He lacked personality and seemed like he really didn't want to be there.
Spectacular service, attentive but not pushy. Fantastic food, very fresh ingredients.
Food has been much better, but the location and view are worth something. The berry dessert was to die for! We had a reservation. That was great but very hard to get.

When we walked in I wasn't sure what to expect as the hostess was slow and not very friendly.  However, once we were seated on the patio,  the servers were friendly and attentive and made great recommendations.  The food and desserts were as wonderful to look at as eat! I'll definitely come back and would recommend The Pink Door.  Thank you for a great meal!
The food was great, quick service - tables very close together
Fun, vibrant atmosphere. We especially enjoyed the acrobatic entertainment! The service was wonderful. Food was fantastic.  An enjoyable experience!
We had the best server, Elyse, and she really made the evening!  The food was good, the view was good, but the service is what really made this place shine.
Was a great experience, in every way.  The food, the drinks, and the entertainment were all exceptional.  A treat for the senses.

Food was amazing! I had the salmon she had the scallops, both were so perfectly done.  A little cold and noisy out on the patio but nice views of the sound and an overall fantastic experience!  Wish the front desk would have mentioned the aerial artist indoors and we may have adjusted our seating preference to see it.  Totally worth going to this place!

My wife & I dined at the Pink door in mid July and had an exceptional dinner.  We were seated out on the deck which we had requested thru our open table reservation.  From the unmarked industrial looking dusty pink door in the alleyway to the final dessert this was just one great dining experience.  We ordered a crimini mushroom, barata and squash blossum flatbread, a new york strip steak, linguini and clams and closed with a nectarine crostini with vanilla gelato.  This is not a steak house and yet this was the tenderest and best seasoned strip steak we may have ever tasted.  The view was brilliant looking out onto Puget Sound at sunset.  Nice experience all the way around.
Great patio seating with a nice view. Service was spot on and the food and wine were above expectations. A nice spot above the hustle and bustle og Pikes Market below.

There was five to my party.  Our table was not ready when we arrived and had to wait around 15 minutes.  No drinks were offered to us for the wait.  I had the meatballs and they were dry.  The other dishes were ok.  Desert was good.  However, the ambiance was very good with different artists every night.

Food didn't disappoint - was as good as some Italian I had in Italy! Wait staff was fantastic all around. Restaurant was really flexible to work with as we had a big group and wanted to handle the bill discreetly. Will definitely come back and recommend TPD in the future!

Even though my dining partner was 45 min late, the staff was friendly and attentive. I had a wickedly dirty martini and some antipasto, and they brought me the gluten free bread and extra fresh mozz I asked for. I tried the chilled rose they had on special and I am wishing I had several bottles at home. All in all a lovely time.

We had a lunch date at the Pink Door to celebrate our 10-year anniversary. We enjoyed a lovely spot in a quiet part of the outdoor dining area, despite there being a fairly large crowd the day we visited. The food was top notch, as usual. Excellent service, terrific food, and reasonable prices.  Try a fresh peach crostata to finish your meal--DELICIOUS! You can't beat the view or the ambience. We'll be back!

Our reservation was made for the wrong time on open table and when I received a confirmation email I called the restaurant and te manager politely informed me that the deck was booked but they would find some space for myself and my date. They did! And it was a lovely corner table w an unobstructed view if the sound. 
Our server was friendly, unobtrusive, made lovely suggestions (the heirloom tomatoe bruschetta was amazing) and kept the drinks coming. All in all a 4.8 out of 5 star experience.
One of the great Seattle lunch venues on a sunny day. Just be sure to make a reservation!

We went to the Pink Door for dinner and got a great spot on the patio.  The service was good and the food was outstanding, as were the cocktails.  For food, we got a nice assortment of the prosciutto, mussels, risotto, and lamb.  Super delicious and we can't wait to go back!

Our waitress was absolutely wonderful and really enhanced our dining experience.  She was super knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations for appetizers and desserts.  The cheese plate was spectacular - highly recommend.  And the Nectarine dessert was simply out of this world!  The entree's though... well, disappointing.  There were 5 of us, and none of us loved what we ordered.  I got the scallops and they were not good... too much sauce on the plate, hard green beans with cold, gross white sauce on top, and a very bland potato type thing.  Also, and this may sound petty, our table cloth was ugly...  We ate on the patio, and if I were to go back, I'd sit inside and hopefully get the same great waitress.

Came in for early dinner prior to a show. Servers were attentive and knowledgeable. Food was good, but it wasn't great. It's just not one of the restaurants that I would personally rush back to visit.
You walk out on to the deck and the view right away is amazing!  Then comes the great wine list, appetizers, dinner, and dessert!  Overall amazing time, all aspects.

This place just isn't worth the price and we are used to spending significant money on dinner.  It's just ok.  the Risotto was good but advertised as having crab.  there was one bite of crab in the dish.  The salmon was overcooked and we didn't sent it back because on the advice of the waiter we ordered it medium rather than medium rare...he basically said it would be bloody if we ordered it medium rare.  The almond chicken was also overcooked and a bit dry and even a litte burned.  The wine just wasn't good...an $89 bottle of Amarone that wasn't even close to worth the price.  It was wine, but just not a good choice for the menu and seemed really overpriced for the taste.  The waiter seemed nervous and not really knowledgeable.

The highly recommended lasagna was fantastic. Did not disappoint at all. However, the bologenese was just okay. Standard at any other Italian restaurant. Not bad, but nowhere near the level of the lasagna. The waiter at times disappeared or seemed annoyed.

My mom was recently visiting and I took her to the Pink Door for lunch.  We had a lovely table outside with a view and a delicious meal.  Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  I had not been to the Pink Door in years and was reminded what a great Seattle establishment this is and will definitely be coming back this summer.

What is that about? At least three varieties of Chardonnay are offered by the bottle but not by the glass. Also was certain my reservation was for outdoor dining and did not get seated outside until dessert. Kinda disappointed in the experience.

The evening got off to a rocky start when one of the water glasses arrived at the table with food crusted on the side.  I ordered the Calamari app., but I am not sure what I got.  It was long pieces of some seafood (the size of slender hand cut fries) with spinach in a Marinara.  It was OK, but definitely not like any Calamari I have ever had.  Entrees ranged from pretty good (my Pappardelle al Ragu Bolonese (well cooked and with a nice flavor) to Rigatoni and Mama's Meatballs (chewy -definitely not al Dente - pasta with weird tasting meatballs).  It was like the episode of Everybody Loves Raymond where Marie gives Debra the wrong spices to make her signature meatballs.  These were what Debra must have produced.  We skipped dessert.

To start at the beginning, the reservations were very easy and I was given a chance to pick where I wanted to sit. This is the perfect place to go for a nice date. The food was delicious, the waitstaff was helpful and attentive, the atmosphere was very romantic, and the menu was slightly erotic. The novelty of a trapeze performance (only on Sundays) easily set the date apart. The pricing is very good compared to other resteraunts of similar nature, not to mention the location in pikes place allows for plenty of fun after dinner activities.
Delicious!! Visiting from NY, great waitress, great food, cool ambiance .

Unique dining experience . Great food, even better service. Great place for a date or small group of people. Friendly hardworking staff. Great location. I would recommend calling ahead for a reservation. If your a local and you haven't been here yet then give it a try its very nice despite being located in tourist central just above the first Starbucks and Pike Place Market. I won't say anything about the entertainment, except its great and you should experience it for yourself.  Enjoy!
Dining on the patio overlooking Puget Sound on a Summer evening is wonderful and the food is equally amazing. Love this restaurant and we will be back!
The Pappradelle Bolognese is our favorite. Cooked to perfection, slightly al dente once combined with the sauce. Filling, but lunch entree boxed for the following day is included.

I chanced upon this restaurant years ago (mostly because it has no sign so got me curious) but only got to eat here last year and again this past weekend.  It was my guy's birthday so I thought he would enjoy eating here at The Pink Door.  The service was impeccable and they got us a corner table on the patio overlooking the Sound.  Even though the atmosphere was convivial, it was quite romantic for the two of us and the food was delicious, as usual!  Get the antipasto plate!

I love everything about this restaurant. The environment was wonderful, the waitress was friendly and helpful and the food was outstanding...and you have to have dessert there...so yummy for my tummy. We went back for lunch a few days later and it was still outstanding. will come back again and again and again. Highly recommended .
Restaurant food was amazing. Service impeccable and ambience and views were awesome.

we had friends in town from LA that had heard about the Pink door and so we made a reservation for dinner. We hadn't been in along time and so glad we went the food was phenomenal and the ambience so much fun. They loved it and we will be back soon!!

This is the most popular place for a reason. Reserve in advance.  We loved it so much the first night that we returned on our second night in Seattle.
The Italian food is excellent. Staff is lovely. Everything was perfect. I highly recommend it.

excellent dinner near the Seattle market.  Thought it might be a tourist trap, but in no way is it.
Best meal we had in Seattle, wonderful service, waitress recommended great selections.  Wish
we could back!
When you find a restaurant filled with people, no name on the door, distinguished only by the color of its door, you would do well to give it a try.

I took some east coast friends for an early dinner.  The food was excellent and the menu had lots of attractive offerings.  
A great place to show off Seattle's neighborhood restaurant scene.

This restaurant is my new favorite place in Seattle.  The food was amazing and the dining room was super romantic and beautifully lite by candlelight.  I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.  Great Italian food.

The Pink Door used to be a classy and cool place to go to dinner. It was good for a romantic occasion. Not anymore. It's way too loud, and there's no expectation for how people should dress. There were people there with their baseball hats on (backwards) and wearing flip-flops!  This is certainly not what I was looking for when I made a reservation to take my girlfriend out for her birthday dinner. We will not be back....  It's too bad because the food and the service were both really great.
Excellent we have been several times. Nice wait staff and great food.

My wife and I had a very enjoyable time here. the service was fantastic and the food really good at a reasonable price.  We were surprised that our server offered a lap blanket when the air got chilly.  It was a first, and my wife was 'warmed' by the experience.

My husband and I joined a local couple for dinner at the Pink Door.  We were able to sit outside.  The view of the water was wonderful.  The food was out of this world.  And the service was some of the best I've ever experienced.  Run as fast as you can to eat there!

I have lived in the neighborhood for two years, and each time that I visit The Pink Door I'm reminded of how good it is—the presentation, the tastes, the ambiance, the prompt service. I need to come here more.
Delicious food, great atmosphere, the portions are ridiculously small though considering how much they cost! Definitely recommend getting an appetizer or a side if you're hungry.

My mother and I ate here on the evening of Saturday June 21st while visiting Seattle. I had heard great things about The Pink Door and was not disappointed. We were seated on the deck and were able to enjoy our meal al fresco since the weather was pleasant. My mother raved about her lasagna while I very much enjoyed my spring lemon risotto. Kudos to Terrance for the great service too!

super pretty but just not a place id go again or really recommend. love the inside though, and it's awesome if you're looking for interesting, different, and expensive cuisine. I ordered spaghetti and honestly it was average.

We were very lucky to get last minute reservations at OpenTable when someone else canceled. We tried out their pastas this time and much like the other food I've had there, it was phenomenally good. They've also brought back their butterscotch pudding dessert that is incredibly good.

We had the usual very good meal at lunch. Nice ½ carafe for two, Mama's Meatball Panini and seafood pasta were good as ever. We're waiting until the bruschetta with heirloom tomatoes makes it reappearance this summer.

I brought my wife with me on a business trip.   This place nailed it on ambiances and view.  It's first class.  We only had two items and they were great.  Scallops and rigatoni and meatballs.  Oh, the seared calamari was very good.
Food was simple but good and very well cooked. The outside sitting on a sunny day made for a wonderful experience in the core of downtown.

The reviews for this restaurant got me truly exceited to eat there.  However, both my wife and I were disappointed in the meal.  The outside deck was really cool and a nice view and it had a good vibe.  However, the muscles were gross, the food was too spicy and the portions were small.

Everything about this restaurant was great.  We sat on the outdoor patio, where we had a wonderful view of the water and West Seattle.  Our waitress was attentive, social and very helpful.  The meal was delicious - will definitely recommend this to others.  We will return next time we visit Seattle!
Another perfect evening with fine food, great service and a killer view of the sound.

We were there for the first time to celebrate my birthday.  The wait staff, Elyse, acknowledged me with genuine warmness.  We were seated outside for an early dinner. The ambience outside was festive, casual and scenic   As the evening was cool, we asked to be seated indoors, Elyse was quick to offer us blankets if we needed it.  The food was delicious and good value for the money.  The breaded razor clam appetizer, the squid ink pasta with mixed seafood and the braised lamb shank was scrumptious.  The olive oil dip was especially flavorful with citrus hints.  The indoor ambience looked romantic.  Would love to return to experience the indoor dining and live music.

We were so thrilled to find this restaurant can substitute ALL sandwiches and pastas with a gluten-free option.  As a sensitive person with celiac disease, it was heartwarming to be able to see my mother order an actual sandwich and enjoy it!  It completely normalized our dining experience and not to mention that all 3 of our dishes were fantastic.

Took my girlfriend here on a surprise date night. She was stunned my the exotic nature of the location and loved the atmosphere. We both loved our food and the waiter was more than helpful. I mentioned over the phone that the date was a surprise and the staff gave us a corner table with a romantic candle. Such a surprise! Would absolutely recommend to a friend. I'm already raving about it.

This is one of my favorite little gems in Seattle.  The food is outstanding, and the service is always wonderful.  One of my particular favorites is the lasagna.  I have no idea how they make that cheese so creamy.  Don't miss out on this one.

I have been coming here for years and each time, the service is amazing! This is the best Italian restaurant I have been to thus far, and they always have specials that can't be found anywhere else such as squid ink infused pasta. This is also the only Italian restaurant that I have been to that I am full, but don't have that bloated feeling afterwards. It's great going on a Sunday to have dinner and a show at no additional cost!

Food: delicious.  House wine: red/horrible!  Cold from door open.  Procedure for getting into
cabaret: horrible/confusing/ridiculous.  Too cold in lounge to stay for show.

Great spot.  Took my wife here for our anniversary and the Pink Door proved to be fantastic.  Great food, excellent and caring service, and wonderfully romantic ambiance.

My only caveat is the noise level it pretty high so expect it to be busy.
Spectacular dining experience.  The venue is hip, the food outstanding, and service is simply terrific.

Fantastic meal and fantastic service at a fantastic place.  We will be back!  Expecting to catch the late show one of these weekends.
Started with a nice bottle of Penner-Ash Pinot Noir recommended by our waitress.  Really awesome Beet salad, excellent.  We shared main course plates so we were able to sample both, white salmon and pappardelle al ragù bolognese.  Dessert was a decadent butterscotch pudding, yummy!

The food was delicious, some of the best we have had in Seattle.  The atmosphere was unique and wish we were there when the trapeze artist was working.  Great service + great food + unique atmosphere = great evening.

I booked a reservation on OpenTable and was given options of 3 pm or 10 pm, and nothing in between.  Assuming the other times were fully booked I took a less than ideal dinner time of 3 pm.  Much to our surprise, the entire restaurant was empty when we got there, patio only half filled, and stayed that way until we left a couple of hours later.  The Panini was dry, but the risotto and cheese board were excellent.  However, I would not return given the inability to book a reasonable dinner time reservation.
In a city full of seafood this place is a nice change of pace.  Smaller portions but very well done italian.

Absolutely Awesome! 
Everything was awesome, service, waiter, water boy, and the food- O My G ness!!!! The food was Awesome! Hats off to the chief on the foods taste, portions, and presentation! Absolutely Awesome! 
I'm from South Louisiana where good food is an important part of our culture and heritage. The Pink Door gets a  High Five from people who know good food!
Recommended by hotel concierge.  Food was just ok and waitress had an attitude.  Restaurant had a good vibe though and hostess was friendly.

This place was great for an intimate dining experience. I was meeting my sister in Seattle for a sister weekend. However, her flight didn't get in until 8:15 pm. She arrived at our hotel at 9:45 pm and we were able to make it to our reservation at 10 pm. It was a nice late night dining experience for a Thursday night. The place very intimate. Would be great for couples but it was also good for the two of us to catch up. We didn't feel rushed as there were other couples and friends still dining. I felt there weren't very many places open in Pike Place but this one. The food was delicious and the dessert was a nice treat.
Fantastic service, fair prices, and amazing, fresh food. What a treat! Great wine list as well. Highly recommended but please leave the kiddoes at home.

This was my second time, my husband's first time and it is always a wonderful experience! From the attentive waitstaff to the contemporary spins on Italian cuisine, this place is a hit. The burlesque trapeze artist adds a very sensual element to the romantic, out-of-time feel of this place.
The food was not good and expensive. I would not recommend you waste your time on this place. Service was snooty as well.

What an outstanding restaurant. I'm in town visiting and this was on the Trip Advisor list of places not to miss. I'm so glad I jumped on Open Table and made a reservation. You must sit outside as the view is spectacular and don't miss the Bucket o Peas. Best lasagna I have ever tasted!  I immediately made another reservation so I could go back again before I leave Seattle.
Loved the Lasagna as one of the best I've ever had. The Ceasar salad was also excellent.

All around THE Best!  Very authentic Italian food - very flavorful and fresh.  Comes very close to Italian food we had in Sorrento, Italy.  We pretty much cleaned up our plates.  Service was outstanding - our server even offered us an extra basket of bread to finish up the leftover marinara sauce from my son's side order of meatballs.    We enjoyed the nice view of the water from their outside patio as we ate our scrumptious dinner - don & joe’s italian sausage, pappardelle al ragù bolognese, linguine alle vongole (the best I've had so far), lasagna (with the pasta layered with besciamella and pesto); the blistered asparagus was grilled to perfection and butler greens farm vegetables with roasted corn was so fresh and flavorful!
Friendly staff, prompt and attentive service. Yummy food. Best dinner in Seattle!
A Seattle Classic, shouldn't be missed by locals and tourists.

Even though the Pink Door is too close to the center of tourism, they offer outstanding meals at a fair price. 

We had King Salmon, a beet salad and wild mushroom pasta. All three were spectacular. The salmon was perfectly crusted and also raw in the middle.  Simply prepared with just a touch of salt. Perfect for a great piece of fish. 
The beet salad was sweet with both pink and red beets, almonds and Feta. The flavors came together perfectly and it was light and refreshing.
The pasta was really spectacular.  Mushrooms and cream sauce came together with a special added ingredient that puts a POW at the end of each bite. Try to figure it out without peaking.
We were there on a beautiful day, Andrew served us on the patio.

Our waiter Andrew was very informative about menu details also attentive and polite without being  to obtrusive he is excellent at his job! Ambience and food is always exquisite Just wish there was more room and not so crowded on out door deck.
best lasagna i've ever had. super great service and atmosphere

Visited to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary and The Pink Door didn't disappoint --  great atmosphere dining on their outside deck -- the dining room looked perfect but as it was a beautiful evening and we were glad we were seated on the outside deck--attentive staff and delicious food helped to make it an enjoyable evening ---  the antipasto appetizer was truly outstanding --  the grilled garlic bread was a pleasant surprise -- the entrees we ordered were excellent --it was a nice leisurely paced meal, even though the restaurant was packed and people were looking to dine outside on the deck, we never felt rushed --

The Pink Door has always been a favorite of mine.   It offers so many options; deck, bar, dining room.  There is something for any occasion any time of day.  The lunch I had recently was really enjoyable.   When the sun is out there is few other places I'd rather be than the patio at the Pink Door.   The food is a nice complement to the great atmosphere.   Panini was perfectly cooked and suprisingly spicy.  Our service was very pleasant and attentive for how crowded the patio was.  This restaurant never disappoints.
The tables are close together you are bound to get a few butts crossing your table. The linguini and clams had way too much red flakes, all you could taste. Leave it for the tourists.

A month ago we first ate at the Pink Door and loved their famed lasagna.  My wife had it a second time and it did not disappoint.  I had their tasty, fresh caught salmon and it was prepared perfectly.  Next time I visit again from SF, I will be back.
We love taking out of towners to have a quintessential Seattle experience on the outside terrace. Food is reliably good.
Wonderful food and staff! The lasagna is incredible- along with the seasonal dishes.

We can always be sure that our lunch at Pink Door will be memorable. The ambiance makes us feel that our lunch will be more special than the other restaurants. The menu makes it hard to make a decision what to order because I want everything. I never seem to be at Pink Door on a sunny day to enjoy the outside dining but dining in is okay too. The wait staff knows just what to do to make us feel  that they care that  all our needs are met. This is one restaurant that I always leave feeling that cannot wait to be at Pink Door again soon.
While the food was very good, at those prices they should serve water in glasses, not plastic. Really?

We found this place on a list of top restaurants and we agree it is amazing. Try the bruschetta appetizer, the pink Madonna cocktail, the mussel/shrimp/calamari dish and add linguine, and the scallop entree. It was amazing. The server was very sweet and attentive. If we lived here, we would come back.
A Great local treasure hidden away down an alley! Its hard to get reservations, but worth it if you do! I will definitely visit again! Their Rib-eye was fantastic

The Pink Door is a great dining experience. I have been there many times and the food and service is always top notch. The restuarant itself is beautiful and perfect for a romantic dinner or for a few freinds who want some great food. It's a mix of great Italian and seafood and the puddings are delicious. Wine can be inexpensive or you can treat yourself with something decadent. The burlesque/cabaret show is very entertaining - a little risque but never smutty. Try it once and you will definately go more times.
Been here for over 30 years but never been to the pink door.  Only heard great things about it.  All true.  We loved it, our guests loved it.  We'll be back.

When reading about the resturant we got the impression that entertainment happened nightly. Made reservations for a very special birthday celebration and when we arrived were disappointed to find that there is only entertainment in the weekends. The food however was great and the service was the best we had our entire Seattle trip.

The food was great, the service was excellent, and the view was awesome!
Great spot and nice sunset.

We have eaten a number of times before at the Pink Door. Always enjoyed going there. We usually sit in the lounge. This time we had reservations for dinner in the main dining room. While the food was good, albeit the portions smallish, I felt that they were rushing us in an effort to turn the table. I did not appreciate the lack of attention or the rushed service. I will re-think going back, and if we do, I will probably not sit in the dining room.
We went to the Pink Door after the opera. Although the kitchen closes at midnight and we were close to that hour they happily served us. Great food and ambience.

Picked a perfect 75 degree evening for anniversary dinner - had sparkling wine on table when we got there and great view across sound. Service and ambience were excellent and all round just a great night. Just moved to Seattle and Pink Door made great first impression!
The outdoor dining experience was fabulous as usual. The cioppino was so very fresh and the sweet pea bruschetta was exactly that...fresh and yummy. We truely enjoy the pink door experience.
This restaurant is amazing. Every time is come to seattle I have to go! Great food. Awesome views of the water and just a great vibe all together! Highly recommend!

We were able to get a table on the porch, and I highly recommend it.  Seattle is a city of amazing sight lines, and The Pink Door is well situated to take advantage of that.  Menu is small but everything we had was done very well. They even had a number of Gluten Free  options, which is amazing considering how much of the menu is pasta.  And the carnivore at the table will be very happy with the lamb shank, I promise.   Nice variety on the cheese board.

Pink Door is my favorite summer patio restaurant and when the rain hits I go inside for my favorite  cozy dining experience lunch or dinner.

I rate the Pink Door a 10 anytime of year but it has to be the the best summer patio in Seattle.
The food, service and view made for a special dinner out to celebrate Mother's Day and my daughters 21st birthday.  Will be back soon!

I am a foodie and it was nice to get a good portion of food that was properly spiced, melt in your mouth yummy goodness! The service was not in your face and our waiter Terrance knew everything about the food and the wines. The evening was one of the most romantic eclectic fulfilling evenings ever (and I have been around for a long while!).

We went to dinner at the Pink Door for mother's dinner on saturday. It was very nice. We enjoyed the food and time together as a family. My children are 19 and 17. I wouldn't recommend for younger children.
I found the Pink Door on my "Find Me Gluten Free" app.  So pleased it turned out to be a great place, thank you!!!

The server was excellent he was very attentive but also subtle about it - not over powering, didn't hover. The menu had so many delicious-sounding entrees i had a hard time choosing. I ended up selecting the risotto and it was superb. The dessert was good and the coffee was excellent - fresh, hot & robust. The entertainmnet was the topping on the cake, so to speak what a graceful and lovely young artist/athlete. LOVED every part of my dining experience. The pace was leisurely and relaxed - we left raving about the experience amongst ourselves and will continue to spreadthe word about this hidden gem in Post Alley.

What a wonderful experience! Absolutely love the atmosphere and service. Everything from the moment you enter and being greeted tells you, you are welcomed and treasured here.They will hang your jackets, have a basket for umbrellas, and everyone in the restaurant smile sincerely. I guess they love and appreciate their job.  And let me tell you about the food...it is the best that you can find in Seattle (on the same level as El Gaucho, but more affordable prices and casual atmosphere).  Every dish has a unique presentation and done just right! Dessert menu has a great selection, and please order the cabaret cake with slated caramel. It is to die for!

You start by wandering down the alley filled with flowers and outdoor patios.  You note the pink door, open it, and make your way down the stairs into a dimly lit Italian seafood restaurant.  It was everything we were hoping for!  Our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable  and appropriate in her suggestions.  The fresh Penn Cove oysters were the best ever!  The salmon and scallops tasted delicious!  To top off the evening our waitress suggested the Espresso Semifreddo, explaining how it was made and she hit a home-run there!  Wonderful time!
I surprised my boyfriend by taking him out to dinner, and he loved it and said it was a great place, super quiet and romantic. It was our first time, 10/10 would recommend.

This place was a real shot in the dark.  Found it on Yelp.  They were able to accommodate 5 of us outside on a beautiful night.  There's no sign.  Just look for the pink door and you are there.  Everyone was very happy with their meals and the service was excellent.

The weather was an all-time high for this time of year, and we were able to get a reservation for outside deck.  
Everything was great!
The location and atmosphere is great but the service was a little slow this night.  I've been here before and didnt have any problems so it must have been an off night.

Brought my sister and my father, both widely traveled and experienced foodies, and everyone's  experience was beyond perfection.  My sister is also an experienced restaurant cook and caterer so very difficult to exceed her expectations. From the moment we were welcomed on arrival and bid farewell three hours later, everything about our meal, our table location, exceptional wait staff, was perfect. Thank you for helping us create a memorable night!

They have a nice patio with a latticed roof so not has much direct sun, but still plenty of it.  Make a reservation ahead of time, or call directly to find out their seating strategy.  It used to be first-come-first-served for outdoor seating, but on the day we went, anyone with a reservation automatically got priority outside seating.  It's amazing how few restaurants downtown have outdoor patios.
Enjoyed the back patio and especially the orange chocolate gelato

We had a lovely table in the front portion of the deck overlooking the scenic waterfront. The weather was perfect. The wait staff was kind and patient as we asked about menu items and placed our order. In reading reviews for the Pink Door a comment that kept coming up was the small portion sizes. It's true; they are. The pricey pasta dish my husband ordered would qualify as a "half order", if one was offered. It was certainly not a full sized portion. We ordered dessert as a result, which turned out to be a memorable thing indeed. A cherry almond tart with vanilla gelato. Delicious!
Literally - The food and service were delightful, but ask for the dining room.  The Pink Door has a trapeze artist who performs short areal ballet routines, quite lovely.

So glad to have found this hidden secret! The Pink Door was everything I'd read about and so much more! The wait staff, artist, food and ambiance cannot be matched!  Wonderful restaurant with fantastic food!

My husband and I are looking to try at least two new restaurants a month. The Pink Door is a restaurant I've been dying to try for years. I'm so glad I finally made it in. It was a lovely, romantic meal. The server was knowledgeable about the meals and drinks on the menu.

You could not be disappointed!  The cheese plate is fabulous.  The scallops are to die for.  The Cioppino was the best my husband stated.
Ambiance - terrific.    Friendliness - absolutely.   Do again:  YES YES YES!

We went to this restaurant after reading the reviews. While we were walking through Pike Market we noticed the sign for the Pink Door, I had no idea it was in the middle of the tourist traffic. I would normally stay away from restaurants in the middle of tourist area. I am so glad we decided to go. There was a jazz singer and 4 piece band playing in the lounge, really great music at the perfect noise level to enjoy and still talk normally to each other. The food was delicious. I took everyone's advice on the lasagna and my husband had the peppercorn crusted rib-eye, very tasty. The lasagna is definitely not traditional but worth trying at least once.

Whether it's your 24th or 100th birthday, The Pink Door literally opens up into a whole new world. Imagine "Casablanca" hidden in an alley way of Seattle- that's how I felt and it was magical. I was there with my sister and our boyfriends- toasting with champagne, sharing mouth watering food, listening to my all time favorite jazz songs- and felt so at home because our server, Dominic, was practically perfect in ever single way! Overall, highly recommend The Pink Door and I definitely plan on going more often!

I say hidden, because if you are in the back alley trying to find the door, it's almost impossible!  I love this place, we've been three times, and we live in Calgary - it's kind of a Must Do when you're in Seattle.  The entertainment is what makes it really special, but we missed it this night, we were too late.  The food as always, great.  What can I say?  I'm always impressed by The Pink Door.

Hadn't been to the Pink Door in about 18 years. Not sure why, because the food, the service, the ambience were all absolutely fantastic. The aerialist provided a wonderful, understated elegance, and put a big smile on my face!
We visit the Pink Door on every trip to Seattle. Very centrally located and always  good food and atmosphere.
Had a wonderful dinner and experience at the Pink Door on Saturday April 18th.  It is a unique place and perfect for parties of 2 to 4.  We are already planning our next trip with friends.

Best lasagna I've ever had but some of the worst service I've ever had at a nice restuarant. Waitress brought it was sparkling water when we asked for San Pellgrino. She tried saying it was the same and that there wasn't actually San Pellgrino and it was basically the same thing when we didn't budge because we wanted something flavored she said she could bring out orange flavored sparkling juice. When she brought it out it was San Pellgrino. When it came for the check the waitress brought it out then never came back and the air conditioning got turned on so it got really cold. We eventually got up because we thought maybe we had to pay up front. After that our check got taken care of real fast but we still missed our bus from slow service.

We enjoyed the food and some. Our server was pleasant and efficient. The cocktails very well mixed.
We were expecting a trapeze show it being Friday but here was not one. A little disappointed but overall very good. Would go again. Would recommend to friends.
Great food and great place overall! Would definitely recommend checking it out. We weren't there for any of the entertainment but still had a great time.
This place is one of my favorite spots in Seattle.  The food is always great and the large carafe of wine for $30 is a great buy!

We went to The Pink Door for dinner, a celebratory date night after my husband finished his exams. I had read many reviews that talked about really good food and atmosphere. So I made a reservation about 3 weeks in advance. We arrived precisely on time and then we were seated, at the worst table possible. We asked to be moved and they had to think about it, said it may not be possible even though there were empty tables. 
Then we ordered wine and they served it in tumblers. Not really want you want when celebrating a special night. So we asked for real wine glasses, like half the other tables were using. Our server was nice but that is about all I can say. She did nothing wrong but certainly did not go overboard with hospitality. Good food.

Dined with hubby and another couple for Seattle Restaurant Week, and had a wonderful time. Food, service and atmosphere were impeccable. The Pink Door is very romantically lit and laid out, the live music complementary to table conversation, and the food artfully prepared and presented, without the snobbery of other like-fine restaurants. Our server and I miscommunicated over my wine order and she attended to it very graciously. We are eager to return on a weekend to see the trapeze entertainment!

I went with a friend to Seattle restaurant week and the meal was absolutely incredible. The noodles tasted so fresh and the sauces were full of flavor without being too heavy. The dessert was great too. Fantastic place to go!

This was our first time eating at The Pink Door. We were 2 couples celebrating my husband's birthday before attending a concert. We scheduled dinner for 2.5 hours before the show & that allowed us just the right amount of time to have a meal without rushing. My husband and I had the cheese plate, salumi plate, pasta with bolognese sauce and meatballs, and the flourless cake with caramel sauce and espresso cheesecake for dessert.  All items were excellent, especially the desserts!  This was a prix fixe meal for $28 per person, a real bargain!  My husband also included the wine paring option for $10 (4 glasses of wine).  The acrobatic show only happens Sun/Mon, so plan accordingly. We will just have to come back!
Made a reservation for a window seat because it was a semi nice day and the inside seating was dark

We have lived in the Eastside for almost 8 years and never eaten at Pink Door. Though we have heard of Pink Door, we never ventured to try it. What a mistake! We had such a nice experience and delicious dinner during Seattle Restaurant Week in April. It really is an iconic must experience for Seattlites. The restaurant fully captures all elements of what makes Seattle special--diversity, holistic and tasty food, and art. The trapeze artisit was to cherry on the top of the sundae. She was gifted and fluid in her graceful movements and a joy to watch.
This is a hidden gem in a town full of spectacular places to go an eat. The food is divine, the wait staff attentive, the atmosphere is Parisian and eclectic, and you MUST go here.

Found the Pink Door on the list of Seattle's Restaurant Week and selected it because of the menu and location. Loved all of our dishes-lasagne, risotto and the ahi tuna. As well, the cheese plates and salumi were VERY tasty! The bits of dessert - flourless chocolate cake, espresso cheesecake and pavlova were perfect in their preparation and while I initially thought the servings were small, they were just right due to their rich flavor.

We saw some "regular" patrons next to us order a antipasto plate that looked amazing! We WILL be back to enjoy that and other menu items-I am so glad that the Pink Door participated in Restaurant Week as now we know a nice restaurant with a great view (this time of year) and delightful menu.
Loved this place so much! The location is lovely and everyone and everything set such a nice mood. The entertainment was amazing as well!

My boyfriend and I went here for dinner, and it was great. Very romantic, attentive service, amazing atmosphere. My only complaint is when we ordered our dinner our waitress asked us if we wanted anything with our entres. She mentioned a salad and a couple other things I can't recall. So we asked for two side salads to later find out we got charged $9 for each salad. We were under the impression it came with the entree with the way she worded it. We were a little put off by that. That's the only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars. I'd still go back.

This restaurant has it figured out. Great food, great atmosphere, character and great service. If you're reading this review trying to figure out if you should go here, quite messing around and just do it ;)

I make it a point to go to The Pink Door every time I am in Seattle. I crave the Lasagna. The servers are fun and the view is beautiful. It's like a treasure hunt finding The Pink Door...what a treasure.

I booked through the Seattle restaurant week website, only to find when we arrived that the special menu was not available on Friday night. So we were a bit disappointed about that but otherwise had an excellent night.

I cannot rave enough about how much my family loved this restaurant. We were there during Restaurant Week, so we got a great deal and got to try different food options. The wait staff was remarkable...fast and very helpful. The food was out of this world. This was by far our favorite meal of the entire weekend we were there. Kudos to you Pink Door. Keep up the good work.

Went to the Pink Door for lunch to enjoy the dine around Seattle 3 course meal. The food was great, but the service was poor. My husband and I waited 30 minutes before we got bread, water, or our wine. This was after we ordered our food. One server spilled water all over my husband and our table. When we asked the server various questions about our food, he had no idea what the ingredients were.
The food exceeded my expectations from my last visit a couple of years ago.
Once again, some of the best lasagna (I wasn't going to have two this time but I couldn't resist having a second helping as the first was so good).
My favorite place to eat in all of Seattle. great FOOD AND GREAT ENTERTAINMENT!

My husband thought it was some of the best pasta he has ever had. The lasagna is also very good. We especially enjoyed the fixed prix menu for Seattle Restaurant Week. Excellent cheese on the appetizer cheese board (sheep, goat, cow).
Be sure to make a reservation.

I thought from other reviews that there was a cabaret and that on a Saturday evening we'd see a performer with our dinner. Unfortunately not, which was disappointing. I recommend checking their website or schedule carefully or come not expecting a performance. It also took more than an hour for our entree and our server didn't check in or seem aware of the wait.
Great experience...amazing food...will definitely go back...large wine list and late night show option...

We had won a gift package and included was a certificate, from one year ago, well we were blown away.!!! Try the ceased salad, the chiopino , the bruschetta, the owner came over and introduced herself. Don't miss this great place, se sweet and cozy!!! We are going back!!

Everything about this visit to the Pink Door was spot on... The staff and server were friendly and attentive. Food was absolutely delicious! As promised, they got us out the door in time for curtain call... without ever feeling rushed. Our special evening couldn't have gone better.

The place a little hard to find as there are 3 different entrances that were not from any main street. But once you're there, the place has such a great personality and the food tasted authentic and different. You start with celery with olive oil, and their calamari was sauteed. I had seared scallops for my main course and it was divine. I would probably only go once for the experience since there was other food there that I would prefer to go to.
The Pink Door is an old favorite that never fails to please. It had been a while since I'd been there and I'd forgotten what a gem the city has in this place....

What a treat. Don't miss the lasagna, it is one of the best I have ever had, and certainly not typical for this dish. The service was outstanding and the menu is attractively priced. The entertainment a real bonus. Enjoy this unique place.
Dinner at the Pink Door is always a delightful evening. Wonderful atmosphere (though can get noisy), delicious food and great location. The service was perfect.
Absolutely a wonderful experience and the food is amazing! A romantic atmosphere where you can sit back and enjoy each other without being rushed. We will definitely be back!

As two graduate students we can't get out much with our student loan budget but we like to get out when we can. This was a fantastic atmosphere, great food and just a overall wonderful dining experience. Somehow they have an intimate dining set up that doesn't make you feel like you're sitting on your neighbors lap even though the tables are really close together. also, we were so pleasantly surprised because we decided at the last minute to go to dinner on a Friday night. We got on their website at 6:30 PM, got a reservation at 8 and when we arrived at the restaurant we were seated immediately. I don't know if we just got lucky but it was amazing!

I took my long time friend, who was new to Seattle to this wonderful restaurant. We were both impressed with the food and the service. The waiter was very knowledgable and engaging. We had a great time!

If you didn't know where and what it was, you'd never find it, but I don't think it's a problem for them.
This is a really unique restaurant, in a cellar, but so eclectically elegant.
Tables were close to each other, yet you could have a conversation.
A great find!
The Pink Door came recommended to us by friends and did not disappoint. The food and service was great. Truly a gem and we will be back for sure.

How odd to have a restaurant without signage....beware! Hard to find, but worth the effort and then not something you'll soon forget. Be sure to make a reservation to avoid disappointment. Most every night they have entertainment, but it doesn't start until later - you may want to choose your dining time accordingly.
Service was exquisite and caring.....cheez plate appy to die for! What a great experience.....wished we lived nearby....we'd be there again and again!

My friends visiting from California and Connecticut felt special and enjoyed their time at the Pink Door. The food was delicious and the wine was excellent. Our waiter was attentive and had a great sense of humor. We will definitely come back again!

Romantic setting with light music in the background. We were lucky enough to see an incredibly talented trapeze artist. Great place to hangout with your loved ones. Awesome food and fast service. Will definitely go back.

What a fun last evening for a vacation. Wonderful food,impeccable service and very unique entertainment. We will definitely come back. My thirteen year old daughter reaaly enjoyed the experience but it was also very directed towards us "adults"

This place was great and delish! I would recommend the lasagna with a glass or red wine. Inside setting was beautiful and very calm. Was dinner down with a pink lady drink~ YUM! Can't go wrong here!!!

the food excellent. however, we really wanted to go for the entertainment aspect,but when we arrived we were told that the trapese artists are only on sundays and mondays, and burlesque seating is a first come first serve with a line out the door starting at 10:00pm. the website was not clear about this.

Took my daughter here for a graduation-from-college lunch, and she loved it. Great atmosphere and perfect service. We had a variety of dishes and all were delicious, though my lasagna was nothing special (mostly cheese and pesto, with no vegies). My sister said the cioppino was perfect - not rubbery like most places. The beet salad was fantastic, as were the meatball subs. Excellent bread served with lunch, and we immediately went out and tried to find some just like it in the Market. No luck, but you can ask - I think it's sold in Pioneer Square. Overall, a really wonderful lunch in a funky atmosphere, and we will be back!

Lovely interrior with a hint of hideaway location, lovely tasty food that comes out in timely manner, and servers always attentive without being pushy or interfering. Slightly on the higher side of $$, but well worth it especially for brunch!
The food was outstanding, amazing, exquisite!! The oysters on the half shell were the best we have ever eaten and to die for! Can't wait to get back to The Pink Door!!

Dined there recently at the recommendation of many locals. The food was ok, not anything really wow, but where else can you dine while having a trapeze show overhead. I would do it once but I don't anticipate it being one I would return to should i be in the area again.

I love the pink door! We brought our kids (4&1) and still love this place. Everyone was super nice to our kids but the setting would be more ideal for a date night. The food was amazing and we will definitely return soon.

We are from Vancouver,BC. The Pink Door was on a food segment during a KOMO tv newsbroadcast.We had been planning a daytrip to Pike Place Market anyways,so had been wondering where to have lunch.It was definetly worth going to this restaurant.The food was delightful.Service attentative and friendly.Would highly recommend this restaurant to any and all.We'll be back. Five out out of five stars.
Every time I go, I have a wonderful experience!

This place has tremendous character and charm, the food was exquisite, quality service without any feeling of snobbery, and any place that can achieve all that while you are graced by the skills of a talented aerialist is worlds away from any place I've ever eaten before. The entrance teases you. I promise it's worth the price of admission.
We came into this not really knowing what to expect but we definitely had a great time.

We went to the Pink door for dinner only. Terence was our server and he was the BEST server we have had at a restaurant. He was attentive, knowledgable, friendly, and gave us a wonderful experience. The entire staff made sure our water was never less than half empty. We tried the recommended specials and we're not disappointed. We had to refrain from literally licking our plates.

Great lunch we had. Salmon cooked to perfect! All salmon lovers will know that it is hard to find a place that cooks your fish but doesn't over cook it. Service was very attentive and friendly. We will return. Thank you so much.

A cool place for dinner, and the food is "good", but foodies will not be impressed. The seafood was just OK, maybe we should have had their specials, but we weren't at all impressed especially not for the price. My husband's cioppino had 2 hairs in it! He was too shy to say anything, especially since the waitress was so incredibly nice and he figures the hair was hers, but it was gross.

A friend and I recently enjoyed lunch at The Pink Door. This is not our first time at this restaurant. We have always found it to be a very reliable place. Service was warm and friendly -- as usual. The waiter guided us through the specials and encouraged us to try one of the appetizers -- a bagna cauda -- which was fabulous. When we ran out of veggies to dip into the sauce he had no problem with me pouring the leftover bagna cauda on my nicely done swordfish. All in all, a lovely meal.
Great food, great ambiance, great location. Highly recommend

We had a wonderful lunch. Everthing was delightful - the ambience (tall taper candle with dripping wax on gold candlestick was a beautiful change from the typical votive in a glass), the pleasant service, the cocktails (a negroni and house cockail - the celery made me do it), prosciutto and buffalo mozzarella, arugula and beet salad, mama's meatballs in ciabatta, and a lovely capuccino. We throughly enjoyed this little restaurant (there is no sign, just a pink door!) in the Pike Market area. Stop by the WA wine tasting shop just across Post Alley before or after your meal. We will try to go back to check out the evening bar scene - looks like a great place for an after-dinner cocktail.
The restaurant offers a cozy atmosphere for fine dining and a unique entertainment experience that is fascinating but not invasive.
This little Italian gem tucked into an alley with virtually no identification is worth the search. Excellent service, very good food, and surprising entertainment
Great food great service great location! Been here several times and it's always perfect !

Take the Italian countryside and go to a farm, then bring a gourmet chef and say make something with the ingredients on the farm. What you get is the fare at The Pink Door. Earthy, intelligent, well portioned, and at times brilliant. Both my wife and I had many bites that were perfect. The kind where you sit and reflect on what you just tasted, the kind where the sum of the parts exceeds the whole. Everything we had worked together on that Italian farm, we were transported. What more can you ask for from a plate of food?
The live trio really swings on Wed so that was a nice after dinner treat with our heavenly desert.

Disclaimer: I don't like fennel, so the menu, which contained many items with fennel, didn't appeal to me. But what was worse was the waiter, who was arrogant, not helpful, and inattentive. He also tried to add a gratuity to our bill even though we had only four in our party. I ate several other places in Seattle, all of them outstanding. By comparison, this place was mediocre.

The Good for Groups depends on the size - I'd say up to 12 would be comfortable. There was a table set for 10 while present.
Never tried Brunch nor Happy Hour or Late-Night.
It was a Great Lunch, all except our service was very slow at the end. We had to wait for our dessert and check an exceptionally long time. Making us late to get back to work.
Great place for a business lunch.

We had a really, really good anniversary dinner at The Pink Door this past weekend. Great cocktail in the lounge before dinner, romantic atmosphere, incredible appetizer and entrees. Our server was prompt, polite, and attentive without being overbearing. The front desk staff was super cool. You have to look closely in Post Alley to find the place, but it IS the only pink door there....so....

I'd recommend a vist to The Pink Door for anyone going to Seattle for a couples retreat, anniversary, etc.
You can always count on the Pink Door for great food. We shared the Lasagna, bread, salad and wine. Wonderful flavors, just enough food, no rushing us out of the door.
I brought my girlfriend here for our one year anniversary, and I cannot recomend it more!
One of my very favorite restaurants!!!
Amazing, thoughtful service, food beyond compare, a romantic atmosphere, and incredible performance on Monday evenings. Highly recommend.

I surprised my girlfriend by taking her here for the first time for our Valentines Day, which happened to be a few days later than the 14th. We were extremely impressed with the ambiance and the service. The staff were friendly and waited on us hand and foot. The food was also great, I think the only complaint we had was that we wished the serving sizes were a little larger haha!

This is a great romantic restaurant for any couples looking for a special night out. The food is as good as the service, and the acrobatic shows are impressive. I definitely recommend going at least once.

Food was pretty good variety of choices although a little on the costly side I think. Service was very good and Ambience was Great! Hard to locate at first in the alley. Plenty of paid street parking, unless its busy hours of a weekend.
I took my wife here for valentines day. I have not herd of the resturant I went based on reviews. It was fantastic. I highly recommend the Pink Door. I will be back! Thanks
Had an awesome experience here. Great food and service. Highly recommended.

We have eaten at the Pink Door every time we head to Seattle since we discovered it 4 years ago. I'm not a big calamari fan but can't get enough of theirs. Tender, juicy in a tasty, tasty sauce. The pastas are obviously house-made from scratch; sauces are complex and absolutely delicious. Our servers on every occasion have been wonderful--attentive but not overbearing and knowledgeable about menu details. This truly is one of our favorite restaurants. We haven't tried it for lunch or brunch and have not as yet been there at a time it was seasonable to sit on the deck but given our dinner experiences, cannot imagine that anything at Pink Door would be less than wonderful.
From the service to the food and everything in between ... Fantastic!

The staff was super friendly and so accommodating. We showed up a bit early for our 10 person reservations and they quickly escorted us to a much better waiting location than standing by the front door. Once our table was ready, the wait staff was so helpful and always there to meet our needs, but we never felt pressure to hurry our meals. The ambience was great (despite being very tight quarters with the other guests) and the food was delicious. This was only my 2nd time at the Pink Door but it will definitely not be my last.

We have been to the Pink Door once before and loved the food and ambience. We decided to make a reservation for our 26th anniversary, and it was just as good or better than last time. The lasagna was delicious and "felt" healthy, not overly salty and I felt pleasantly full, not bloated or stuffed. My husband had pasta with a sausage that he also thought was delicious and of good quality. It wasn't very busy, so we enjoyed the quiet atmosphere, and the service was excellent.
Great service and fun ambience. The food was fresh tasting and delicious. Don't miss the antipasti dishes; a great presentation of wonderful flavors!
Very nice dining. Food excellent with the exception of one slightly under cooked pasta. The flavored olive oil is wonderful as are the desserts.
